Cut up red potatoes into small dice. Boil until tender. Strain out the water. Add stock. Add a small amount of pesto. Mash the potatoes with a large fork. Add a bit more stock if needed. Salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with pine nuts and fresh basil leaves.

Separate egg yolks from whites, add yolks to mixer bowl. Mix in egg yolks, milk, self rising flour and vanilla essence. Whisk egg whites into stiff peaks. Gently fold into yolk mixture. Pour 1/3 cup mixture onto hot pan, cook 2-3 minutes per side or until done. Serve with syrup and butter or margarine.

Mix all together, cover with lid and cook on low for 4 hours. You can add veggies if you like but the roast will be plenty tender without them. Eat with rice or potatoes and it makes a meal for a family of 4-5 people. You can make this anytime as it doesn't take a lot of time to prepare or clean up.
Dissolve gelatin in hot water. Add the ice cream and pineapple. Fold in the nuts and bananas. Chill.

Mix together first 6 ingredients until well blended. Set aside 3 tbsp soy sauce mixture for dipping. Pour remaining soy mixture into crock pot. Add chicken and cook on low for 8-10 hours or high for 4-5 hours. Remove chicken from crock pot and place on a platter. Pour 1/4 cup wine into crock pot and bring to a simmer. Add 1/4 cup soy mixture to wine mixture and bring to a boil. Boil until reduced by half. Strain and serve as a dipping sauce for the chicken.

Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add the onions and cook over medium heat until they are soft and transparent. Add the curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Add the flour and cook for about 1 minute. Add the corn and the milk. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the heavy whipping cream and salt and pepper to taste. Add the crab meat. Serve with crackers.

Place 1 pound of asparagus on a cutting board. Trim woody ends, and cut into 2-inch pieces. Rinse and drain asparagus. Place in the center of a 16 inch square of heavy-duty aluminum foil. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon lemon juice and a pinch of seasoning salt and pepper. Lay salmon on top of asparagus. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon lemon juice and a pinch of seasoning salt and pepper. Fold the 4 corners of foil over the fish and vegetables and press tightly to seal. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until fish flakes when tested with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.
Mix all ingredients well. Refrigerate. Serve with tortilla chips.

Soak strawberries in cold water overnight, or at least three hours. Drain them welladd more cold water if needed. Combine strawberries, remaining cold water, and sugar in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Gradually whisk in potato starch until smooth and well blended. Add cranberries and rhubarb and cook over medium heat until mixture thickens to a pudding-like consistency. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Serve warm or cold. Serves eight.

Cook the spiral pasta in boiling water until tender but firm. Rinse under cold water and drain well. Chop the broccoli into small pieces. Cut the onion into small pieces. In a large bowl, combine the spiral pasta, broccoli and onion. Mix together the mayonnaise and apple cider vinegar. Pour over the spiral pasta mixture. Add the cheddar cheese. Toss until well-coated and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Mix together spinach, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, salt, ground pepper, garlic powder, thyme leaves and tarragon. Spread mixture onto chicken breast and roll up. Place butter into skillet or frying pan on medium heat. Cook chicken until lightly brown on both sides. Remove chicken from skillet, add wine to skillet, cover and reduce until wine is almost completely evaporated. Add cream to sauce and cook until sauce thickens. Place chicken on plate and serve sauce over it.

In a large skillet, saute fish&shrimp in butter. Add 1/2 cup water. Cover & simmer til done. Drain. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flour. Cook 1 minute. Stir in cream& bring to a boil. Reduce heat& cook until thickened. Add all remaining ingredients. Stir in fish&shrimp. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake 350 for 30 minutes or til bubbly. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl combine sour cream, parmesan and garlic. Slice bacon and cook until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Melt the butter. Put the bacon pieces over the butter and top with the fish. Sprinkle the sour cream mixture over the top of the fish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until fish is done. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F . Cream together the butter and granulated sugar until fluffy. Beat in the brown sugar until blended. Beat in the eggs one at a time then stir in the vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda and saltstir into the creamed mixture. Fold in the walnuts. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Store in tightly covered containers.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Combine butter and sugar in saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Pour into mixing bowl. Cool slightly. Blend in syrup, eggs and vanilla. Stir in nuts. Pour into unbaked pie shells. Bake 15 minutes or until almost set. Cool slightly. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Cook spinach and mushrooms until tender. Mix together soup, mayo, egg whites, and seasonings. Combine spinach mixture and soup mixture together. Bake at 400F for 30 minutes. May sprinkle with cheese for more flavor. Serves 6.
Cream together the margarine and onion. Add dill weed. Place a spoonful on each refrigerated biscuit. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Serve warm.

Spread 2 slices of toast with mayonnaise. Top with american cheese slices. Top each with one-third of the cooked bacon. Top each with 3 slices of tomato. Top with lettuce and remaining 2 slices of toast. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Place dried hibiscus flowers in a large bowl. Add 3 cups of boiling water, cover, and let stand for 20 minutes or so. Strain to remove the flowers. Stir in sugar. Taste and add more sugar if necessary. Place the strawberries in a large bowl or pitcher. Stir in the hibiscus mixture. Cover and chill at least 1 hour or overnight. Serve over ice cubes in tall glasses. Garnish with more strawberries if desired.

In a small bowl dissolve the yeast in the hot water. Stir in 2 tablespoons of the sugar and 1/4 cup of the shortening. Stir in 1/4 cup of the flour and let stand 5 minutes in a warm place. In a large mixing bowl combine the remaining flour, the remaining sugar, the salt and the remaining shortening. Stir in the yeast mixture, the egg and the 1/4 cup of the milk. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Place the dough in a lightly oiled large mixing bowl and turn to coat with the oil. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a damp cloth and let stand in a warm place until doubled in volume, 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Divide the dough in half. Shape each half into a ball. Place the balls on greased baking sheets. Cover with plastic wrap or a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume again, 30 to 45 minutes. Preheat oven to

Heat the olive oil and add the bay leaf, peppercorns and parsley. Cook for a few minutes until the parsley is wilted and the peppercorns have popped. Add the mushrooms and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Tip the mushrooms into a bowl and cover with the cider vinegar. Add the parsley and refrigerate for 24 hours before serving.

Cook pasta according to package. In a skillet saute onion and garlic. Cook bacon and add to skillet. Add cream cheese and milk. Heat until cheese is melted. Add pasta and peas. Mix well. Add red pepper flakes to taste. Serves 4.

Combine onions, olives, garlic and 1/4 cup of the vinegar in a large bowl. Let stand 1 hour. Stir in remaining vinegar and the olive oil. Add oranges, parsley, pine nuts, lemon juice and pepper. Toss to combine. Serve at room temperature.

Soak the portabella mushroom caps in the vegetable stock for 20 minutes. Drain well and pat dry. Heat the oven to 425. Brush the caps with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Grill for 10 minutes over medium heat and then put in the oven for 10 minutes. While the caps are cooking, make a sauce by combining the oil, vinegar and the garlic in a small saucepan and cooking over low heat for about 5 minutes. Remove the caps from the oven and top with the sauce and the fresh thyme. Sprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano and serve immediately.

Wash and trim the fennel and slice thinly. Boil the water with the bay leaf in a pot. Add the onion and oranges. Let the fruit cook for 5 to 6 minutes and add the fennel. Boil for another 4 to 5 minutes and add the orange zest. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In saucepan over medium heat, combine apple juice, dried apple and butter. Simmer until apple is tender. Remove from heat, stir in ground cinnamon until well blended. Let cool slightly before serving.

Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain. In a large skillet melt the butter. Stir in the pesto sauce. Cook over low heat until the sauce is thickened. Stir in the cream and heat through. Add the pasta and toss to coat. Season to taste with the black pepper and the parmesan cheese. Add the cooked shrimp and toss. Serve immediately.
Combine the sour cream and sugar in a small bowl. Add the herring and apple and toss gently to combine. Serve with the onion and pickle slices and the dill sprigs.

Brown meat in frying pan. Add pepper and mushrooms. Add cabbage. Add carrot and cook until tender. Add onion soup mix and water. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in cornstarch and soy sauce. Cook over medium heat 2 minutes longer.

In a large skillet heat oil and add pork, onion, garlic clove, lemon pepper and green chilies. Cook until pork is thoroughly cooked through- about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Place the pork mixture in the middle of each tortilla. Roll up tightly- securing with toothpicks if desired. Place taquitos in the baking sheet seam side down. Spray the tops of the taquitos with cooking spray- bake for 10 minutes or until crisp. Serve with hot sauce or guacamole.

Combine the pineapple juice with the ginger in a pitcherstir well to dissolve the sugar in the ginger. Fill glasses with ice cubes, then pour the mixture into the glasses and top with club soda. Garnish each glass with a slice of pineapple and sprinkle with additional crystallized ginger if desired.

Combine the milk, scallions, garlic, and ginger in a saucepan and simmer over moderate heat until the milk thickens. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Place the salmon fillets on a rack in a broiling pan and broil the fish until just cooked through, about 4 minutes, depending on thickness of the fish. Remove from the oven and keep warm while the asparagus is cooked. Toss the asparagus and carrot together and place on top of the salmon fillets to serve. Spoon the sauce over the fish and vegetables before serving. Serves 4.

Mix together salt, vinegar, pepper. Rub over both sides of steak. Dip in flour. Heat oil in skillet. Brown steak. Add tomatoes, green chili, garlic and basil. Cover. Simmer over low heat 30 minutes or until meat is tender. Serve over cooked rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat chicken breasts in the flour and shake off excess. In a medium bowl combine the curry powder and coconut milk and set aside. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Place the onion and bell pepper in the skillet and saute until tender. In a 2 quart casserole, combine the onions and bell pepper with the coconut milk mixture, curry powder mixture and the chicken breasts. Cover and bake in the preheated oven for 2 1/2 hours. Add the carrots and continue baking for another 30 minutes or until the chicken is done through and the vegetables are tender. Serve over white or brown rice.
Grease a mug. Blend all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Heat in microwave for 1 minute 30 seconds.

In a medium bowl, combine all of the ingredients except the eggs and tortillas. Heat butter or oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. When butter is melted, add the egg mixture. Cook until egg mixture begins to set. Add the chicken and cook until the mixture is firm and browned. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Preheat broiler. Meanwhile, place the tortilla shells on a baking sheet. Broil for about a minute or until they turn golden brown. Top the tortilla shells with the chicken mixture and serve.

Prepare the pot. Place a 14-inch cast-iron skillet in a 350-degree oven. Sprinkle the bottom with breadcrumbs. In a large pot over medium-high heat, combine the broth and tomato paste. Season with pepper and oregano. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Reduce the heat and add the garlic and chicken breasts. Cover and cook for about 15 minutes or until the chicken is tender. Add the mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Remove the skillet from the oven and add the chicken mixture. Bake for 15 minutes or until the chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or pasta.

Sprinkle both sides of the chicken halves with seasoning salt. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat, cooking the chicken halves on both sides for 8-10 minutes or until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear. Remove chicken from skilletkeep warm. Add the onion to the skilletcook over medium heat for 5-7 minutes or until tender. Add the mushroomscook 3-4 minutes or until tender. Add the garliccook 1 minute more. Stir in the winecook 2 minutes or until almost evaporated. Add the reserved chickentoss to combine. Sprinkle with the pepper jack cheese and parmesan cheese.

Place apricots and nectar in saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until apricots are tender. Mash or puree in food processor or blender. Pour into bowl and let cool. Chop pistachios with food processor or knife. Stir into apricot mixture with butter and seasonings. Spread on crackers or slices of bread.

In a large resealable plastic bag combine oil, lemon juice, garlic, thyme, salt and pepper. Add chicken and shake a few pieces at a time. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Thread chicken and peppers onto skewers. Grill, uncovered, over medium heat for 6-8 minutes on each side or until chicken is no longer pink and vegetables are crisp tender. Serve with rice.
In a large saucepan, saute squash in lemon juice. Add apples and water. Cook over low heat until tender. Add brown sugar and cinnamon. Add apple juice. Stir well. Simmer 5-10 minutes. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a 12 cup muffin pan or line with paper liners. In a large bowl beat butter and sugar until creamy. Add honey and beat until blended. Beat in eggs one at a time. In a separate bowl combine the flours, cornmeal and baking powder. Stir into the batter just until blended. Stir in milk. Fold in the blueberries. Spoon batter into prepared cups and bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F 190 degrees C. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Combine Bisquick baking mix, milk, sugar, oil and egg in a large bowl, stirring just until moistened. Spread in prepared baking pan. In a medium bowl, stir together Bisquick baking mix, melted butter and cinnamon. Sprinkle streusel topping evenly over batter in pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.

Brown pork chops and place them in a casserole dish. In a small bowl add the flour and the seasonings and mix well. Add the margarine to the bowl and cut it into the flour and seasonings until it resembles cornmeal. Sprinkle this over the top of the pork chops. Add the cream of potato soup and stir gently. Bake uncovered at 350f for about 45 minutes. Serves 4.

Sift together flour and salt. Cut in shortening with pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle with vinegar. Add about 1/4 cup of ice water. Mix to form a soft dough. Roll out on lightly floured board. Cut dough into pieces. Roll out each piece of dough into a 9 or 10 inch circle. Fold in half. Place in baking dish. Roll out remaining dough. Fold in half. Place on top of dough in baking dish. Flute edges of dough together. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until done. Cool on rack. Spread with favorite filling.

Slice breakfast sausages lengthwise in half. Remove the casings, if necessary. Slice the green peppers and onions in thin strips. Mix sausage with green peppers, onions, cheese, garlic powder, and worcestershire sauce. Spoon about a tablespoonful of mixture onto each party rye round. Serve immediately or keep warm in very low oven until ready to serve. Serves six to eight.

Boil water in a large pot. Add salt, then pasta. Cook according to package directions. In the meantime, heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the sausage cut into slices. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add mushrooms, cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the garlic cloves cut into slices. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the green olives cut into slices. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Add the lemon rind and lemon juice. Add the parsley. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in the cream. Add the cooked pasta. Mix well. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine pasta, roasted red peppers, onions, parsley, red wine vinegar, garlic cloves, olive oil, cannellini beans, red kidney beans, salt and pepper. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving. Serve chilled.
Pour ingredients into a shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into a glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Mix apple juice and cinnamon syrup. Top with whipped cream. Add caramel syrup and sprinkle with nutmeg and cinnamon.

Place mince in a bowl with shallot and parsley and mix well. Add paprika, cumin, salt and pepper and mix well. Shape into patties. Heat a frying pan to medium-high. Add a little of the olive oil and place a couple of koftas into the pan. Cook for 3-4 minutes each side for medium or 3 minutes each side for medium-rare. Cook in batches. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil and a little lemon juice and sprinkled with pine nuts.
In a 6 quart crockpot, combine all of the above except the tortellini. Cook on high for 3 hours or low for 5 hours. In the last half hour of cooking time add the tortellini.

Cut french bread into 1/2-inch slices. Spread cream cheese mixture evenly on each slice. Sprinkle with all purpose seasoning. Top each with a slice of feta cheese. Garnish with olives. Serve with pepperoncini peppers. Makes 24 appetizers.
Mix together all ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Strain and bottle. Keeps in refrigerator for 2 weeks.

Heat oven to 350F. Grease a 9-inch round baking pan or an 8-inch square pan. Mix together brown sugar, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda in a large mixing bowl. Cut in butter with a pastry blender or fork until mixture is coarse. Add milk and mix well. Beat egg in a measuring cup. Add to dry mixture all at once. Stir well. Fold in walnuts. Spread batter into greased pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely. Makes 10 to 12 servings.

Combine yogurt, cucumbers, salt and pepper. Place in refrigerator for at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours. Just prior to serving stir in garlic, lemon juice and olive oil. Garnish with chopped parsley and chopped mint.

Combine honey and cinnamon in small saucepan. Stir until blended well. Add almonds and toss until well coated. Arrange on wax paper in single layer and let dry 1 hour or until crisp. Store in air tight container.

Melt butter in skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes until tender and lightly browned. Add ground beef and cook until no longer pink and browned throughout. Drain fat. Stir in italian stewed tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Spread mixture in bottom of baking dish. Place slices of garlic bread on top in overlapping circles. Sprinkle with shredded mozzarella cheese and bake at 350 f for 20 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned on top. Cut into 4 wedges and serve warm. Makes 4 servings.
Melt butter in a pan over medium high heat. Stir in flour to make a roux. Slowly add milk and stir until thickened. Add new potatoes and peas. Season with salt and pepper and serve hot.

Place star anise, cinnamon sticks and orange peel in a large saucepan and add the milk. Bring just to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the mixture is reduced by about one-third. Add the brown sugar, stirring until it dissolves. Add the chocolate and rum and stir until the mixture is smooth. Serve in a mug with a sprinkling of ground cinnamon.

Place all ingredients in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Season with more sugar or salt if desired. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Shake before using.

Cook tapioca pudding until thickened. Pour in jell-o and let it set up. Take it out of the fridge when it is cool and whip up the cool whip in a separate bowl. Mix the cool whip into the jell-o and add the mandarin oranges. Stir well. Put it back into the fridge until ready to serve.

Combine apricots, red onion and garlic in large saucepan. Add water to cover fruit by 1 inch. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes or until apricots are softened slightly and skins are slightly wrinkled. Strain through a fine mesh strainer over a large bowl. Discard skins and seeds. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Transfer to 2-quart glass jar with lid and refrigerate overnight before serving. Yields 1 1/2 cups.

Combine the chicken stock with the rice and simmer for 12 minutes. Stir in the egg yolks and lemon juice and cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the seasonings and stir well. Pour into individual bowls and garnish with mint. Serve with a slice of lemon and a drizzle of olive oil if desired.

Boil the eggs and cut into halves. Heat the oil in a pan and add the cumin seeds and bay leaves. Once it splutters add the ginger garlic paste and saute for 30 seconds. Then add the green chillies and saute until it changes colour. Now add the fennel seeds and saute for 30 seconds. Then add the tomatoes and salt and saute for 2 minutes. Now add the boiled eggs and saute until the gravy thickens. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve with bread or rice or roti

Heat olive oil and garlic in large skillet over medium heat. Add salmon and cook about 2 minutes or until fish is just opaque. Add broth and bring to a boil. Stir in pasta and cook till al dente. Sprinkle with parsley, cayenne and salt to taste. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl beat the peanut butter with the butter until smooth. Beat in the sugars. Beat in the vanilla. Add the pretzels. Form into balls and place on wax paper. Freeze for about 20 minutes. Place chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl. Cook for 1 minute on high power. Stir. If not completely melted cook for another minute or so. Dip each frozen ball into the melted chocolate and place back on wax paper. Refrigerate for about 30 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease a 13x9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle cracker crumbs on bottom of pan. Place chicken in pan. Spoon ranch dressing over chicken. Top with teriyaki. Bake 30 minutes. Sprinkle with additional crumbs. Bake 15 minutes more.

Place chicken bouillon granules in the crock-pot. Add water until dissolved. Brown the pork chops on both sides. Place the apple pie filling in the bottom of the crock pot. Add the chicken broth. Place the pork chops on top of the filling. Season with lemon juice, cinnamon, and the pecans. Cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 7 hours. Serve with a side of brown or wild rice.

Heat oil and saute onion until transparent. Add curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Add carrots and parsnips and cook until tender. Add vegetable broth and cook until the vegetable are tender. Puree the vegetable mixture. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot garnished with parsley and a dollop of yogurt.

In a large mixing bowl, beat the ricotta cheese and sugar until fluffy. Fold in vanilla extract and orange rind. Fill mini cannoli cups or ice cream cones with the ricotta mixture. Garnish with mini chocolate chips and sprinkles. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Add shallots and cook until tender. Stir in cornstarch until smooth. Stir in wine and bring to a boil. Cook until thickened and reduced to about 2 cups. Stir in broth and mustard. Cook until heated through, stirring constantly. Stir in chives and pepper to taste.
Mix the pineapple juice with the sugar and water. Pour into a tall glass. Add the slices of watermelon on top of the mixture. Top with a scoop of coconut ice cream and a cherry.

Combine all except the frozen fish sticks. Stir in fish sticks. Spread in a 13x9 pan. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes or until browned and bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese. Broil until melted. Serve with garlic bread.

Slice 1/4 inch off the rounded sides of the chicken breasts to even the surface. In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray saute asparagus, peppers, mushrooms and tomatoes 3-4 minutes or until vegetables are tender-crisp. Remove vegetables from pan and set aside. Spray the pan lightly with cooking spray. Arrange the chicken on the pansprinkle with the garlic powder, salt and pepper. Cook the chicken on the stovetop over medium heat 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Place the vegetables on the cooked chicken. Top the vegetables with the cheesecover and cook until the cheese is melted. Garnish with the parsley if desired.

In a large skillet brown sausage meat. Drain grease. Add cream cheese and mix well. Add the parmesan cheese and continue mixing. Add the jalapeo and garlic. Stuff peppers with filling. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serve with chili sauce.

Cook sausage in skillet until browned. Add onion and green bell pepper. Saute until soft. Add mushrooms and bell peppers and continue to saute until tender. Add egg noodles or pasta and pasta sauce. Cook until heated through. Serve with parmesan cheese on top.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease two 9-inch round cake pans. Melt the 12 ounces bittersweet chocolate with 1 3/4 cups coffee in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water. Stir occasionally until the mixture is smooth. Cool to room temperature. Add the butter and beat with a wooden spoon until well blended. Add 2 cups sugar and the 4 extra large eggsbeat until smooth. Beat in the vanilla. Pour into the prepared pans. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool completely on a wire rack. Frost as desired.

Preheat grill to medium high. Combine rub ingredientsrub mixture over both sides of steaks. Place steaks on grill and cook 3 minutes per side for medium rare. Grill steaks to desired doneness. Remove from grilllet stand 5 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 350f. Drain and chop artichokes. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Spoon into an 8x8 baking dish. Bake 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with crackers.

Melt sugar and white corn syrup in a medium-size sauce pan. Stir constantly until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Add crunchy peanut butter and stir until well blended. Add cornflakes and stir to coat. Pour into a greased 13 x 9-inch pan. Chill. Drizzle with melted chocolate.

Mix first five ingredients with mixer on low speed until blended. Spoon into greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine all vegetables and oyster sauce in a large bowl and toss to coat. Set aside. In a small bowl combine chili paste and olive oil. Cook ginger and garlic cloves in a hot pan until fragrant (about 20 seconds) and then add carrot and green onions and cook for an additional minute. Pour chili and olive oil mixture over vegetables and toss to coat evenly. Serve over rice or with noodles or by themselves.

Heat oil in large skillet over med-high heat. Cook chicken in pan 5 to 6 minutes turning once. Remove from pan. Add spices to pan, cook 1 minute. Add orange juice, vinegar and raisins. Bring to a boil. Add chicken. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until chicken is warmed through. Serve with couscous.

Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, saute the red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, and zucchini in the half-and-half until the vegetables are tender-crisp, about 3 minutes. Add the pesto sauce and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes. Drain the pasta and place in a large bowl. Add the vegetables and toss gently. Garnish with the ham. Serve immediately.

Combine sugar, paprika, salt, pepper, thyme, oregano and onion powder in a small bowl. Rub ribs with this mixture and let stand for 1 hour. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Place ribs on a baking sheet and bake 2 1/2 hours. Turn ribs and bake an additional 30 minutes or until cooked through. Makes 4 servings.

Mix together the scallions, fresh parsley leaves, and basil. Add the butter. Place the scallion mixture into an ovenproof dish. Crack the eggs into the scallion mixture and mix well. Pour the heavy cream over the top. Sprinkle with the cream cheese. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until the egg whites are set. Garnish with the chopped parsley. Serve hot.

Peel and slice onions into 1/8 inch slices. Toss with sugar, black pepper and butter. Let marinate 15 minutes. Add sherry and stir. Add more sherry if you like. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve as a side dish with roast beef or chicken.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Toss carrots, garlic and almonds on a baking sheet. Drizzle with the oil and sprinkle with salt and freshly ground pepper. Roast for 30 minutes or until the carrots are tender. Combine the vinegar and honey. Toss the carrots and almonds in the dressing. Add the cheese and toss to combine. Just before serving toss in the arugula.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place chicken in a shallow roasting pan and add buttermilk. Toss to coat. Combine Cajun seasoning and salt in a small bowl. Drain buttermilk from the chicken and dip it in the seasoned flour. Place in pan and bake for 1 hour or until the internal temperature of the thickest part of the breast reaches 180f. Cut into serving pieces and serve. Serves 4.

Cook noodles as directed. Drain noodles and put in 9x13 inch baking dish. Mix together ground beef, barbecue sauce, water and tomato sauce. Pour over noodles. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Top with shredded lettuce, tomato and onion. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In small bowl stir together first 4 ingredients. Rub mixture over meat. Bake uncovered 15 minutes. Sprinkle with green onion and sesame seeds. Bake 10 minutes longer or until done.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Line a large cookie sheet with heavy duty aluminum foil. In a small bowl combine the barbecue sauce and the lemon juice and set aside. In a second bowl toss the vegetables with the lemon juice and set aside. Place a half breast on each piece of foil and divide vegetable mixture on top. Spread the barbecue sauce on top and sprinkle with the seasoning salt and pepper. Fold up the sides and top edges to form a packet then fold the bottom edges up to meet the top edge and secure with toothpicks if needed. Place on the cookie sheet and bake for 40 minutes or until the juice runs clear when pierced with a knife. Serve the packets with the remaining barbecue sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl, mix pancetta with 2 tablespoons olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper. Rub both sides of each shrimp with the mixture and lay in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Roast for 5 minutes, then flip the shrimp and roast for 3 to 5 minutes longer or until cooked through. Place 2 to 3 shrimp on each of 4 plates and sprinkle each with a pinch of sage leaf and a pinch of salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Mix 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper with 1 teaspoon salt. Rinse and drain raw shrimp. Stir cayenne and salt mixture and place in plastic bag. Add shrimp and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes. Heat 1 tablespoon canola oil in wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and stir-fry until crisp. Add shrimp and stir-fry 2 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Add green onions and snow peas and stir-fry 1 minute or until vegetables are crisp. Add broth and lemon zest and stir-fry until heated through. Sprinkle with cilantro. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 450f. Line baking sheet with aluminum foil. Cut baking potatoes into wedges and place onto baking sheet. Combine olive oil, parmesan cheese, parsley, garlic powder, red pepper flakes and salt. Toss together. Pour over potatoes and toss to coat. Bake for 45 minutes. Turn potatoes over and bake for another 45 minutes.

Combine flour & buttermilk in sauce pan. Stir & cook over low heat about 5 minutes until thickened. Stir in apple cider. Cook for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat & stir in Swiss Cheese & caraway seed. Serve warm with crackers or crusty bread.
Cut baguette in half lengthwisespread inside of each half with butter, sprinkle with blue cheeseseason with peppertop with celery tops. Broil until cheese is bubblingserve immediately.

Remove peel from 2 oranges and discard. Slice pulp and place in a large glass jar or bowl. Pour vodka over pulp, then fill jar/bowl with cold water so that pulp is covered by an inch of liquid. Cover with lid or plastic wrap. Place in refrigerator for several weeks until liquid is clear and orange pulp has softened. Strain through cheesecloth or fine strainer into another jar. Discard pulp. Sweeten liquid to taste with sugar syrup (equal parts of sugar& hot water). Serve in wine glasses or goblets.

In a large bowl combine flour and salt. Make a well. Mix together the wet ingredients and pour into well. Mix well. Turn out onto a floured board and knead until firm, shiny and elastic. At this point cover and chill for 1 hour, up to 24 hours. When ready to use follow instructions for manual pasta machine or cut into manageable pieces and roll out to desired thickness, cut into desired shape.

Remove outer leaves from romaine lettuce. Chop remaining romaine lettuce into 1 inch pieces. Toss lettuce with dressing until evenly coated. Sprinkle with bacon and cheese. Chill until serving time. Slice boiled egg in half. Arrange egg halves over top of lettuce salad. Garnish with onions. Serve with favorite salad dressing if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream the margarine and molasses together. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well. Spread in a greased 9x13 pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into bars.

In a bowl, combine the shrimp with the parsley and green onion. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Add the eggs and asparagus. Mix lightly. Add the vinaigrette and mix well. Refrigerate the mixture. To serve, place lettuce leaves on individual plates and fill with the shrimp mixture. Garnish with tomato wedges.
Cream butter until light. Add sugar, egg yolk and extracts. Beat well. Add dry ingredients and chips. Drop from teaspoon onto wax paper. Let cool before eating.

Combine onions and garlic in a small saucepan. Add the wine and cook until the alcohol has evaporated. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook over medium heat until the sauce thickens, stirring occasionally. Cool. Serve at room temperature.

Mix together all of the ingredients except the lipton onion soup mix and form into a loaf. Spread the lipton onion soup mix evenly over the loaf then cover with aluminum foil. Bake for 1 hour at 325 degrees.

Melt the butter in a sauce pan. Add the milk and simmer over medium heat until reduced by half. Add the banana and mango chutney. Remove from heat and puree with an immersion blender. Garnish with croutons. Drizzle with rum.

Prepare cake mix according to directions on box. Pour 2/3 of the batter into a greased 9 x 9 square pan. Arrange the peaches in an even layer over the batter. Sprinkle the remaining batter over the top of the peaches. Bake at 350 degrees F for 50-60 minutes. The top should be golden brown. Serve warm with Sprite.

In a large bowl combine warm water (110-115 degrees) with olive oil and honey. Sprinkle yeast on top and stir. Let sit 5 minutes to allow yeast to activate. Add unbleached flour, oats and flax seeds. Stir to combine. Knead in Vital Wheat Gluten until dough is smooth and elastic. (If you dont have Vital Wheat Gluten you can add an additional 1/4 to 1/2 cup of unbleached flour.) Dump the dough into a lightly greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise until doubled in size about 1 1/2 hours. Punch down the dough and form into two loaves. Place into lightly greased 9 x 5 loaf pans and let rise again until doubled 45-50 minutes. Bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brush both sides of 2 slices of bread with 1/2 teaspoon of the olive oil. Lay 1 slice of bread on skillet. Sprinkle with half of the basil leaves and half of the tomato slices. Top with half of the mozzarella slices. Top with second slice of bread. Turn sandwich over and brush with 1/2 teaspoon of the olive oil. Cook until the bread is golden brown and cheese is melted and gooey. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Cut sandwiches into 4 triangles and serve.

Combine all ingredients except beef in a small bowl. Add beef to the marinade and turn to coat evenly. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Remove beef from marinade. Discard marinade. Heat vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef and saute until browned. Add remaining 1 1/4 cup water and the teriyaki sauce to the pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until liquid evaporates. Stir in the scallions and serve hot over rice with additional teriyaki sauce.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heatadd corn syrup, salt and vanilla extractcook, stirring constantly, until mixture boilsremove from heatcool slightlystir in eggs one at a timepour into unbaked pie shellsprinkle with nutsbake at 375 degrees for 50-60 minutes or until filling is setcool completely before serving.

Sift flour, baking powder & salt together. Beat eggs & add sugar gradually, beating well after each addition. Stir in sifted ingredients & anise extract. Chill dough for one hour. Roll dough into one-inch balls & place on greased baking sheet. Bake in a moderate oven at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 15-18 minutes or till done. Remove from oven & let stand for one minute before removing from pan. Roll in confectioner s sugar when cool.

In skillet, cook turkey and onion. Remove from pan and add to crockpot. Add chili powder and salsa. Add corn and red pepper. Cook on high for 2 hours. Heat tortillas in microwave. Fill with taco mixture. Top with cheese. Add olives and sour cream as desired.

Brown the thighs in the skillet. Add the remaining ingredients to skillet. Cover the skillet. Bring to a boil. Cover and bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for 15 more minutes. Serve with hot rice.

In a shallow bowl, mix together the mayonnaise and the dijon mustard. Spread each fillet on both sides with the mixture. Sprinkle with the pecans. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 5 minutes on each side. Serves 2.

Drain the canned tomatoes, reserving the liquid. In a large saute pan or dutch oven, over medium-high heat, warm the tomatoes in the liquid. Season with a pinch of salt and continue cooking for about 30 minutes. When the pan is dry, add the butter and cook another 20 minutes. Season to taste with more salt. This can be used to make a simple pasta dish or can be used as a base for other more elaborate dishes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 9×13 inch pan. Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in the brown sugar until it dissolves. Remove from the heat and stir in the flour, baking soda and salt until well blended. Add the milk all at once, stirring until smooth. Pour into the greased pan. Top with fresh peaches. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes. Serve warm with whipped cream if desired.

Cook sausage and ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat until browned. Drain well. Return meat to skillet and stir in italian-style sauce. Cook 2 minutes. Spoon sauce evenly into center of each crust. Sprinkle with ricotta and top with italian blend. Bake at 450 for 20 minutes or until browned and heated through. Cut into wedges and serve.

In a small bowl, combine the oils, white wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, garlic clove, salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Let stand 15 minutes to blend flavors. Stir in the fresh herbs. Strain before serving or use as is. Use as a dressing or marinate fish or chicken with it.

In a mixing bowl, combine mayonnaise, onion powder, marjoram, tarragon, thyme and rosemary. Sprinkle in the pimentos. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Spread a thin layer of the mayo mixture on each flounder fillet. Bake at 400 degrees for 5 minutes per inch of thickness of the fillets. Sprinkle with dry vermouth. Bake for a few minutes longer or until done.

Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini, onions & garlic to the skillet & cook until soft but still crisp. Pour mixture into pie shell. Beat the eggs with the milk & cream, add the salt & pour over the zucchini mixture. Sprinkle the top with the mozzarella cheese & bake for 35-40 minutes or until the pie is set. Serve immediately or cool & refrigerate.

Saute onions in butter until tender. Add beef. Cook until no longer pink. Add baked beans. Stir in barbecue sauce and cook for 1 minute. Stir in celery. Cut out tops from green peppers. Fill with beef mixture. Replace tops. Place in a baking dish. Sprinkle with gruyere cheese. Bake 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until peppers are tender.

In a small bowl, combine granules and powders. Sprinkle over each piece of bread. Coat lightly with a spray of olive oil. Broil on a baking sheet in a broiler pan for 3 to 5 minutes or until lightly golden brown and crisp.

Melt butter with sweetened condensed milk until combined well. Add milk until desired consistency is achieved. Pour into a greased 12-inch x 8-inch baking dish. Top with gingernut biscuits. Sprinkle with scotch finger biscuits. Drizzle with melted milk chocolate. Cool, then cut into squares.

Whisk eggs in a bowl until well mixed. Add salt and pepper. Mix well. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add slices of white bread. Pour egg mixture over the bread. Sprinkle with cheese. Flip the slices of egg and cheese and sprinkle more cheese on top of that side of the bread. Fry until golden brown on both sides. Top with ketchup if desired. Serve while warm.

Place broccoli in a large pot of boiling water. Cook until tender. Drain and set aside. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add the broccoli and stir until heated through. In a small bowl combine the oil and vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Add the rosemary and whisk until the mixture is emulsified. Pour the oil mixture over the broccoli and stir to combine well. Garnish with parsley and cheese. Serve at once.

In the bowl of a standing mixer, combine the first seven ingredients. Add flour, baking powder and salt. Mix on low speed to combine. Increase speed to medium, and mix for 1-2 minutes. Wrap dough in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight. Prepare filling, and refrigerate. To assemble, roll dough out on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut out circles with a 3 inch round cutter. Fill with 1/4 teaspoon of filling. Moisten edges with water. Bring edges together to seal. Place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Brush tops with beaten egg. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 20 cookies.

Boil the carrots until tender, drain, set aside. Saute onion until tender, add horseradish and continue sauteing until soft. Combine mayonnaise, onion mixture, salt, pepper, crumbs and mix well. Fold in the carrots. Pour into a casserole sprayed with a vegetable spray. Cover tightly with foil, bake 30 minutes at 400 degrees. Uncover, bake 15 minutes longer until top is browned and crisp. Serves 4 to 6 as a side dish.

Heat oil in large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onioncook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add garliccook until golden. Add broth. Bring to boiling. Add beans. Cook until tender, about 1 hour. Stir in tomatoes. Cook until heated through. Stir in ham. Season with thyme. Serve with crusty bread.
Combine all ingredients together. Store covered at room temperature. Makes about 2 cups.

Heat oil in a wok or large skillet. Add garlic and stir for a few seconds. Add veggie broth and bring to a boil. Add tofu and cook for a few minutes. Add veggies and cook until tender. Add soy sauce and hot sauce. Taste and add more salt and pepper to taste. Add chopped cilantro.
Combine macaroni, mayo, sour cream, celery seed, pepper and onion salt. Add tuna. Mix well. Add peas. Garnish with cheese whiz and pimientos. Makes 8 servings.

Butter small heavy saucepan. In small bowl mix curry powder & pepper. In saucepan over medium heat stir in crackers & pretzel sticks until well coated with butter & curry. Spread on wax paper. Cool completely. Store in airtight container.
Boil water. Add zucchini and cook until tender. Drain and set aside. Melt butter in same pot. Add zucchini. Add sour cream. Salt to taste. Sprinkle with sharp cheddar cheese. Serve with hot bread.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a 9x9 inch baking pan. Combine the apples and the light brown sugar in a bowl. Stir in the flour, rolled oats, cinnamon and allspice. Spread mixture into baking pan. Sprinkle with the butter and bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top is golden. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat broiler. Rub whole eggplants with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast in broiler until brown and tender, approximately 30 minutes. When cool enough to handle, cut in half lengthwise and remove seeds and pulp. Set aside. Heat a small amount of olive oil in a nonstick skillet and saute onion and garlic until onions are translucent. Stir in roasted red pepper and capers. Stir in eggplant pulp and cook for about five minutes. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

In a small bowl stir together apple jelly and apple juice until smooth. Put 1/2 mixture in a small bag. Put chicken into bag and shake to coat. Heat 1 tablespoon margarine in skillet over medium high heat. Add 1/2 coated chickencook 3 minutes on each side or until no longer pink. Repeat with remaining chicken. Add remaining apple mixture to skilletheat through. Sprinkle with cinnamon and salt and pepper. Serve with rice.
Brown chops in fat in large frying pan. Add carrots and celery. Mix soup with water and pour over all. Add sage. Cover and bake at 350 for 1 hour. Serve over rice or noodles.
Combine the coffee, unsweetened cocoa, and spices. Stir until well combined. Place into an air-tight container. Cover completely with olive oil. Store at room temperature. Makes 1 cup.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease a baking dish. Cook pasta according to instructions on box. Pour into dish. Add marinara, mascarpone, thyme, parsley, and 1/2 cup of the cheese. Stir to combine. Bake for 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a shallow baking pan combine the soy sauce, ginger and garlic powder. Arrange the pineapple slices on top of the soy sauce mixture. Place the pork chops on top of the pineapple slices. Sprinkle with the paprika and breadcrumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve with rice and vegetables.

In a bowl cream together the butter, powdered sugar and vanilla until light. Slowly add the flour beating until well blended. Stir in the walnuts. Roll into 1 inch balls and place 2 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10 minutes at 350 degrees F or until lightly browned. Cool 1 minute before removing to wire racks.

Trim the bottoms from the asparagus. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the asparagus and blanch for 30 seconds. Drain. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet. Add the garlic and the onion and saute until the onion is translucent. Add the blanched asparagus and saute for 2 minutes. Stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the asparagus among four plates. Top with the chopped tomatoes and sprinkle with the basil and thyme. Add the mozzarella and the parmesan and serve immediately.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add onion and garlic. Cook and stir over medium heat until onion is tender. Add rice. Cook and stir 2 minutes. Stir in stock, reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in parsley and parmesan cheese. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve with peas.

Grease an 8 x 8 glass baking dish with butter or nonfat cooking spray. Spread a layer of cottage cheese in the bottom of the dish. Top with a layer of cooked frozen chopped spinach and a layer of light sour cream. Break eggs over mixture and sprinkle with thyme. Bake 30 minutes or until eggs are set in the centers. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese and parmesan cheese. Bake another 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

In a large bowl combine potatoes, oil, and seasoning. Form into a long log on a floured surface. Roll in egg yolk and then in flour. Coat with egg white and then coat with dry breadcrumbs. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry logs in oil until golden brown on all sides. Drain on paper towels.
Place the breasts in the bottom of a slow cooker. Sprinkle with the seasoning. Add the soup, rosemary, herbs, and 1/2 cup of water. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Serve over hot cooked rice.
Wash strawberries. Cut in half. Sprinkle with sugar. In a bowl, soak strawberries in plum wine. Add cantaloupe. Serve chilled.

In a small skillet cook the green chili and green onion for a few minutes. Set aside. Take the cream cheese and spread it onto the tortillas. Top with the green chili and green onion. Roll up and cut in half. Serve with salsa.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add macaroni and cook according to directions. Heat a large pot over medium heat. Add butter and eggs and whisk until combined. Add evaporated milk, flour, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Stir until smooth. Add cooked macaroni and mix well. Pour mixture into a 9 inch deep dish pie plate. Top with feta cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees F for 35 to 45 minutes or until golden brown.

Boil potatoes in salted water for about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes. In a separate saucepan, add water to potatoes until the potatoes are covered. Mash potatoes using a potato masher or a hand mixer. Add eggs, curry powder, and salt to mashed potatoes until mixed well. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Form potatoes into a small ball shape on your hand and then flatten into a pancake shape. Fry patties until golden brown on each side. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute shrimp with mango chutney for about 4 minutes or until shrimp are cooked through. To assemble, place 2 patties on a plate with a shrimp on top of each one. Serve with lemon wedges or lime wedges and mango chutney for dipping.

Cut fish into 1/2 inch pieces and place into a baking dish. Drizzle fish with lemon juice and mix together well. Let marinate for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes pour lemon mixture from baking dish into bowl and set aside. Heat olive oil in saucepan on med-high and add onions and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes until peppers are soft and onions are translucent. Pour worcestershire sauce and orange juice into onion mixture and let cook for 2-3 minutes. Pour mixture from saucepan into baking dish with fish and add stewed tomatoes and tomato sauce. Mix well. Sprinkle fish with old bay seasoning and bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees or until fish flakes easily. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 350 f. Beat together eggs, milk, and salt until well blended. Dip bread into mixture one slice at a time until both sides are well soaked. Place bread on baking sheet with sides. Bake until golden brown and cheese is melted. Cut into wedges. Spread on avocado slices, and top with ham. Sprinkle with black pepper. Makes 6 servings.

Wash, then boil small potatoes in enough water to cover by 1 inch until tender. Drain and return to pan. Mix in crumbled feta cheese, olive oil, sliced olives, and freshly chopped mint. Serve immediately.

Slice carrots into sticks about 1/4" thick. Slice zucchini into sticks about 1/4" thick. Slice onion into sticks about 1/4" thick. In a hot pan, heat oil. Sauté vegetables. Add salt and pepper to taste.

In a large bowl, dissolve gelatin in cold water. Add cranberry sauce and salt. Mix well. Add apples. Chill. Beat yogurt and fold into mixture. Refrigerate until firm. Unmold onto serving platter. Garnish with pecans. Serves 6.

Wash cucumber and slice thinly. Lay cucumber slices in layers, alternating with thinly sliced onions. Season with kosher salt. When top layer is completed, pour over low-fat sour cream and sprinkle with white sugar. Chill 2 hours or overnight. Drizzle with white vinegar before serving if desired.
Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla and lemon extract. Add dry ingredients alternately with milk. Bake in a well greased and floured pan.
Unroll dough and cut into triangles. Spread with cream cheese mixture and sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Drizzle with melted chocolate. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.
Prepare fruit. Combine lime juice and cayenne pepper. Add salt to taste. Mix well. Serve at room temperature.
Brown the meat in a frying pan until it is almost cooked through. Add the remaining ingredients. Simmer for 20 minutes or until the meat is done. Serve over rice or potatoes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Salt and pepper the chops on both sides. Heat shallot and whiskey together in a pan until shallot is translucent. Remove shallot and place in a bowl. Mix together the shallot, margarine, lemon juice, and brown sugar substitute and pour over the chops. Place chops and juice mixture in a baking dish and place in oven. Bake until the juice has dried and the chops are browned and cooked through, about 30 minutes.Sprinkle thyme over the top of the chops and serve with the peaches and juice mixture on the side.

Cook pasta and drain. Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter. Toss the pasta with the butter and parsley. Transfer the mixture to a serving bowl. In a separate bowl mix the breadcrumbs with the remaining butter, chilies and the garlic. Sprinkle this mixture over the pasta and toss well. Season to taste with salt.

Cut leeks in half lengthwise, then cut halves in half again lengthwise. Wash each piece and dry well. Slice each leek piece thinly crosswise. In a large skillet saute leeks in oil over low heat until limp, about 10 minutes. Stir in onion and continue to saute until tender about 5 minutes more. Stir in tomatoes and carrots and saute until the vegetables are tender and the juice is absorbed. Stir in potatoes and continue to saute until potatoes are done, about 15 minutes more. Stir in parsley and season with salt and pepper and lemon juice to taste. Serve warm.

Cook noodles in boiling water. Add butter to hot noodles. Stir in soup and milk. Blend thoroughly. Stir in bouillon cube and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Spoon into a 1 1/2 qt casserole. Sprinkle with 2/3 of the cheese. Sprinkle with pizza topping. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until hot.

Toss the turnips and shallots with the oil, and spread out on a baking sheet. Season the vegetables with the garlic, salt and pepper. Roast the vegetables for 30 minutes or until tender. While the vegetables roast, cook the peas according to package directions. Add the peas to the roasted turnips and shallots, stir in the sugar and parsley.

Place pizza dough in a lightly floured surface. Roll dough out to 14-inch square. Lay dough with short side facing you and roll up jelly-roll fashion. Seal seam and pinch ends to seal. Place seam side down and bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes. Brush melted egg over top of baked roll. Let cool for 5 minutes. Slice and serve.

Combine 2 cups of the cherries with the water in a non-aluminum pot. Cook over medium-low heat until softened. Puree mixture in blender until smooth. Strain into large bowl and discard solids. Combine dumpling dough and filling in mixing bowl until dough is smooth and holds together. Roll 1 teaspoon of dough into ball and place on ungreased baking sheet. Fill dumpling with 1/4 teaspoon filling. Seal edges and pinch to form doughnut shape. Continue until all dough and filling is used up. Bake at 400F for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. In small saucepan, melt 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat until bubbles form around edges of pan. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt and cook, swirling pan, until butter is deep golden brown about 3 minutes. Remove pan from heat. With spoon or slotted spoon, remove butter solids from butter liquid. Discard solids. Set butter liquid aside. Season both sides of fillets with salt. Place on baking sheet, drizzle with white wine, and sprinkle with tarragon. Place sheet in oven and cook until fish flakes easily with fork about 10 minutes. In medium bowl, stir together tarragon butter liquid, dijon and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt until well blended. Spoon sauce over fillets. Serve immediately.

Combine all burger ingredients in a bowl. Mix well. Form into four burgers. Bake for 15 minutes or broil for 5 minutes on each side or pan fry for 4 minutes per side or until done. Serve on whole grain buns.

Whisk all ingredients except pork together in a small bowl. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add meatseason with salt and pepper. Brown meat on all sides in oil. Place meat in a crock potpour liquid over meat. Cook meat in a slow cooker until tender, about 4 to 5 hours. Shred meat with two forks. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.

Heat olive oil. Add asafoetida powder and cumin seed. Next, add the brown mustard seed and green pepper. After 2 minutes add the courgettes and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add the natural yoghurt and stir. Add the ground coriander and chat masala. Toss well. Serve hot.

Cook onions in butter until tender. Add flour and cook for 1 minute. Add the beets to the onion mixture, cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in the cider vinegar and bring to a boil. Stir in the sugar, salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat and serve with any meat or vegetable main course.

Preheat oven to 450. Mix together ketchup and hoisin sauce in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper and marinate in the fridge for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, wrap the bacon around the legs of the chicken and secure with toothpicks. Place the chicken in the oven and cook for about 30 minutes. In a large pan, heat some oil and saute the carrots and sugar snap peas until they are cooked. Add the asparagus and cook for a couple more minutes. Add the mint leaf at the end and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with the chicken and enjoy

Whisk together milk and egg in a small bowl. Season with garlic salt and black pepper. Cook in nonstick skillet over medium heat. Once cooked stir in mayonnaise. Spread mixture on both sides of bread. Sprinkle fresh chives on top. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Peel baking potatoes and boil in salted water until tender when pierced with a fork. Cool slightly then mash with a potato masher or ricer. In a small bowl combine onion with 1 tablespoon milk. In a large bowl combine mashed potatoes with the remaining milk, cheese, egg, pepper, salt and onion mixture. Mix well. Spoon mixture into a greased 11 x 7 baking pan. Bake at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately with sour cream or whipping cream.

In a large skillet or wok, saute the vegetables and garlic in the oil over medium heat until crisp-tender. Add rosemary and lemon juice. Toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in basil. Serve hot or warm.

Mix together the Bisquick and margarine and press into a greased pie plate. Bake at 425 degrees for 8 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and stir together. Pour into the crust and bake at 425 degrees for 45 minutes.
Mix the ingredients together and bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Refrigerate overnight.
Place drumsticks in bottom of crock pot. Mix remaining ingredients in a bowl. Pour over drumsticks. Cover and cook on low heat for 6 hours. Serves 4.

Melt the white candy coating according to package directions. Dip toes in coating. Tap off excess. Add green food coloring paste to coating and stir. Dip toes in coating again. Place on wax paper. Let stand until set. Cut sandwich cookies into triangles. Press on each toe. Attach candies to toe tips. Melt more coating. Drizzle over toes. Let stand until set.

Wash and slice the eggplants into small cubes. In a pan with 3 tablespoons olive oil saut the eggplants for about 10 minutes. Add the penne pasta and the remaining oil. Saut until the penne is golden. Add the balsamic vinegar and the mint. Season with salt and white pepper. In a bowl mix the eggplant and the penne together. Add the feta cheese and the cashew nuts and mix again. Serve chilled.

In a small bowl stir together cornmeal and spices. Drizzle beer over brisket and sprinkle the spice mixture over it. Add the garlic and pepper to the brisket and turn to coat well. Cover and cook in the slow cooker for 8 to 9 hours on low or 4 to 5 hours on high, until the brisket is fork tender. Meanwhile, add the sweet potatoes to the slow cooker along with the remaining can of beer. Cook for the last hour of cooking time for the brisket. Serve the brisket sliced over the potatoes and spoon the remaining beer over the brisket.
Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sliced mushrooms. Cook 2 minutes. Add cream cheese. Cook until melted. Stir in rice. Add salt, pepper and walnuts. Stir. Serve immediately.

Cut duck breast in half lengthwise. Place 2 slices of apricot in each half. Wrap each half in 1 slice of pork fat. Prepare bbq for medium heat. Grill 15 minutes per side or until duck is no longer pink in center. Brush with honey and glaze. Garnish with scallions. Serve.

Dip washed, boneless, skinless chicken breast halves into beaten eggs. Roll in cracker crumbs to coat. Brown chicken in butter in large skillet on medium heat. Remove chicken. Add garlic to butter in skillet. Brown for 1 minute. Add the crumb coated chicken back into skillet. Sprinkle with parsley. Cover with parmigiano cheese. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Mix everything together in a bowl and store in a glass jar. This keeps for months. Try with shrimp or chicken salad.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add potatoes and cook for about 3 minutes or until brown. Stir in chicken bouillon and bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Stir in the lemon juice, lemon peel, dill, and garlic. Cook uncovered for 5 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by half. Season with the pepper. Serves 2 as a side dish.

Slice tomatoes into small pieces. In a large bowl combine ketchup and sour cream. Add tomatoes, potato chips, bacon, onion, olives and cheese. Stir until blended. Chill for several hours before serving. Serve with potato chips.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread a thin layer of butter over the surface of one sheet of phyllo dough and sprinkle with a small amount of the chives. Repeat with another sheet of dough. Brush the butter side of one sheet with egg wash and place the other sheet on top. With a rolling pin, gently roll over the top sheet of dough to lightly adhere the layers together. Repeat this process with the remaining 2 sheets of dough. Cut into 2-inch squares and place 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes until golden brown. Remove from oven and top with a sprinkling of white pepper and remaining chives. Serve warm.

Melt margarine in 9 x 13 pan. In a bowl whisk together the milk and flour. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in black pepper. Reduce heat. Add cheeses, stirring until melted. Add drained pasta. Spread into pan. Bake for 45 minutes.

Cut all vegetables into small pieces. Put all vegetables into a large pot. Add 1/2 of the white vinegar and the canning salt to the vegetables and let them stand for 1 hour. Pour off the liquid and rinse the vegetables. Put the vegetables back into the pot and add the remaining white vinegar and sugar. Bring to a boil. Cook at full rolling boil for 10 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the vegetables cool completely before canning. Makes 5 pints of Home Canned Rotel Substitute.
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water, stirring until clearadd cold apple juice and stir until cold. Add cut-up fruit and chill until set. Unmold onto serving plate and serve.

In a large skillet over med/high heat, saute the onion and chicken in the butter until the chicken is no longer pink. Add the milk and the broth. Bring to a boilreduce heat to med/low. Add the mushroom soup. Mix well. Pour into a 2-quart casserole. Add the macaroni. In a small bowl combine the cream of chicken soup and the cream of mushroom soup. Pour over the casserole. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F oven for 20-25 minutes. Serve warm. Serves 6-8.

Combine all liquid ingredients except vanilla extract in a large mixing bowl. Crush the mint leaves in the bottom of a cocktail shaker, add ice cubes and the liquid mixture from the bowl. Shake vigorously for 10 seconds, until well chilled. Strain into two glasses filled with ice cubes. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla extract to each glass. Garnish with sprigs of mint. Serves 2.

In a medium saucepan, bring 3 cups of water to boil. Stir in the butter and the millet. Reduce the heat and simmer uncovered for 40 minutes. Drain the millet and place in a bowl. Add the butter and salt. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a heavy-bottom saucepan over medium high heat, melt butter. Add onion and saute 2 to 3 minutes or until soft. Add rice and stir 1 minute. Add red pepper, chili powder, origanum, and stir 1 more minute. Add tomato juice and puree. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium high and cook about 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Add tomato water or stock and stir. Cover, reduce heat to medium low and simmer 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir occasionally. Serve immediately.

Drain and press firm tofu for 15 minutes. Cut into cubes. Place in a bowl, add mayo and mustard. Season with turmeric, garlic powder, onion powder, scallions, carrots, salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight before serving. Serve with bread or crackers.

Cut the green and yellow wax beans into 1-inch pieces. In a large skillet, bring 1/2 inch of water to a boil. Add beanscover and cook for 5 minutes. Add 3 tablespoons light soy saucecover and cook until crisp-tender, about 1 minute longer. Remove from heatstir in pickled ginger. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Sift together dry ingredients. Combine the butter and milk. Then add the buttermilk and egg. Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 pan and bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 5-10 minutes. Cut into squares while still hot and enjoy while warm.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the flour and cook until lightly browned. Gradually add the milk while stirring to make a smooth sauce. Add the salt and pepper. Cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat and stir in the prepared mustard. Arrange half the potato slices in an ungreased 1 1/2 quart casserole. Layer with half the frankfurters. Repeat with the remaining potatoes and frankfurters. Pour the sauce over the frankfurters. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for about 1 hour or until bubbly. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Peel and core the pears and cut into quarters. Combine the sauternes wine and water in a pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and let simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. Add the pears and cook for 15 to 20 minutes until the pears are soft and the liquid is reduced by half. Remove the pears and let cool slightly. Mix the sauternes and the sugar in a bowl and let sit while you prepare the syrup. For the syrup, combine the sauternes wine and the water in a pot and bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes and add the sugar and stir until it is completely dissolved. Turn off the heat and let the syrup cool and thicken to a glaze-like consistency. Put the pears into a serving dish and pour the sauternes and honey mixture over the top. Drizzle with the sauternes syrup and garnish with the orange zest and lemon slices.

Boil 3 medium potatoes and dice. Saute diced onions in butter until golden. Mix 1 can diced tomatoes and 1 can undrained tomato juice. Add to onions. Add diced potatoes. Heat through. Put in 9 x 12 dish. Top with 1 cup shredded swiss and 1 cup shredded parmesan. Add 1 can evaporated milk and 1/2 cup whipping cream. Top with 1/2 cup grated parmesan. Bake 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve with salad.

In a medium-sized bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. Cut the butter into small pieces and work it into the dry ingredients with a pastry cutter or two forks until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Add the paprika and stir to combine. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk and dried thyme. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and stir to just combine. Fold in the shredded cheddar. Pour the batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each about three-quarters full. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Serve hot or at room temperature.
Boil the potatoes for about 10 minutes until soft and tender. Drain the water off. Add the milk, butter, salt, and sour cream to the potatoes. Mix well to make a nice creamy texture.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Place chicken breasts in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Spray the chicken with cooking spray, then sprinkle with the garlic powder and onion powder. Bake in the preheated oven until the chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes.Meanwhile, melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heatstir in the onion and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in the garlic, chili powder, and cumincook until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute longer. Add the beans with their liquid, the corn, and the salsaheat through. Serve chicken on warmed tortillas with toppings such as lettuce, tomato, onion, cheese, or avocado. Serve with the black bean mixture on the side.

Peel turnips and slice very thin. Melt butter and cook onions until tender. Combine with turnips. Beat eggs and sugar. Add to turnips and onions. Stir in flour. Add baking powder, salt and pepper. Add nutmeg. Put mixture in unbaked pie crust and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake in a preheated 375 oven for 35 minutes.
Combine yogurt and cool whip in a large bowlstir well. Fold in fruit. Spoon into six 4-oz. Dessert glasses. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

Combine the first 5 ingredients in a small bowl. Place chops in a large plastic bag or a glass baking dishpour marinade over chops. Marinate at least 8 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. Remove chops from marinadediscard marinade. Grill or broil chops, turning once and basting with any remaining marinade, 4-6 minutes on each side or to desired doneness. Serve immediately. Serves 4 to 6 people.

Melt the chocolate and butter in a large saucepan over low heat until the mixture is smooth. Stir in the cereal until well-coated. Add the dried cherries and mix well to combine. Press into a foil-lined 13-inch x 9-inch pan. Chill until firm and break into pieces to serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. Mash the bananas with a fork in a large mixing bowl. Stir in the oats, coconut, raisins, walnuts and date sugar. Spread into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve warm or cool. Makes 12 bars.
In a large bowl toss lettuce, onion and cheese. In a small bowl combine vinegar, sugar, pepper and salt. Whisk until sugar is dissolved. Pour over the lettuce mixture. Toss gently. Serve immediately.

Combine milk, water, cocoa powder, corn syrup, and a pinch of salt in a medium sauce pan over medium heat. Cook, stirring frequently, for 5 to 7 minutes or until the mixture is smooth, thickened, and just beginning to bubble around the edges. Remove from heat. Stir in bittersweet chocolate and vanilla. Stir in butter, 1 piece at a time, letting each piece melt into the chocolate mixture before adding the next. Transfer to a serving bowl or pitcher and let cool slightly before serving with ice cream or pancakes or waffles or oatmeal or any other dessert that needs a chocolatey boost.

Heat oil in saucepan or dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add onions, garlic, chili powder, cumin and oregano. Cook 10 minutes stirring occasionally. Add 2 cups stock. Bring to a simmer. Combine masa and remaining stock. Add to saucepan. Add more stock if needed to thin sauce. Stir to combine. Season to taste. Serve over french fries, burritos or tacos.

Combine honey, cinnamon, and butter in an 8-inch square baking dish. Arrange 4 slices of the bread in the dish. In a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, orange juice, and salt. Pour the egg mixture over the bread in the baking dish. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. Heat oven broiler to high. Place dish 4 inches from heat source and broil 2-3 minutes until golden brown on top. Serve warm.

In a skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add the red onion and saute until soft and translucent. Add the bourbon. Add the ancho chiles and saute until the liquid has evaporated. Add the chicken stock and apple juice concentrate and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Remove the ancho chiles. With a food processor or blender, purée the mixture. Strain the ancho chile purée through a fine-mesh strainer into a clean pot. Whisk in the peppercorns and sugar. Heat to a boil and reduce to a simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Store in the fridge or freezer.

In a small saucepan bring the water and 1/2 teaspoon salt to boiling over high heat. Add the pea pods. Cover and cook for 3 minutes or until tender. Drain the peas. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute for 20 seconds. Add the soy sauce and stir to combine. Add the sesame oil and stir to combine. Add the sugar and stir. Add the chili oil and stir. Return the peas to the skillet and stir to combine. Divide the mixture among 4 plates. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve immediately.

In a large pot, soak the beans in enough water to cover them by at least 3 inches for at least 4 hours (or overnight). Drain the beans in a colander. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until translucent, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Stir in the beer until it’s evaporated. Add the reserved beans and their soaking liquid to the pot with the onion, garlic, and beer mixture. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 2 hours, until the liquid has evaporated and the beans are tender. Stir in the jalapeno and cook until tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes, sugar, and salt and pepper to taste. Cook for an additional 10 minutes to incorporate flavors. Let cool. Serve warm or cold. Top with chopped cilantro.
Place 3 pork chops into a 3-quart slow cooker. Layer with 1/2 of the apples. Season with salt and pepper. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Cover and cook for 2 hours on low.
Combine wine and water. Add maple syrup to taste. Add butter. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat and add cinnamon stick. Let stand 1 hour. Serve.

Cook butternut squash in chicken stock until tender. Blend with water and lemon juice to desired consistency. Heat and add onions, garlic and chilies. When the onions are translucent, add butter and cream. Season with pepper and salt to taste.

Mix the yoghurt with the curry powder, salt, cumin and cardamom. Melt the butter and add to the mixture. Mix well and chill until serving time. Before serving sprinkle the nuts on top and serve with coarse salt to dip into.

In a large bowl, combine sweet potatoes, vinegar, pickle relish and mustard. Salt and pepper to taste. In a small bowl, whisk together oil and green onions. Pour over sweet potato mixture. Toss gently to coat. Add black pepper. In a medium bowl, combine bell pepper and remaining 1/4 cup of oil. Spread in a thin layer over the top of the sweet potatoes. Refrigerate 1 hour to blend flavors.

Butter a 13x9-inch pan and set aside. In a heavy 4-quart pan over low heat, combine the evaporated milk, sugar, salt and chocolate chips. Stir constantly until mixture thickens to soft ball stage on a candy thermometer (234 degrees). Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Add marshmallows and nutsstir until blended. Pour into prepared pan and refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Cut into 1x2-inch bars.

In 3-quart saucepan, combine sugar, egg, milk, vanilla and salt over low heat. Heat until mixture comes to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook 1 minute more or until mixture forms a thick paste. Remove from heat. Beat until mixture is thick enough to leave trail when dripped from spoon. Fold in marshmallows and nuts. Pour into greased 13 x 9-inch pan. Spread into even layer. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. Drizzle with melted chocolate. Refrigerate until set. Cut into 1-inch slices.

Place the raspberries, water and sugar in a saucepan. Bring to a boilremove from the heat. Stir in the coffee and half-and-half. Cool to room temperature. Strain the mixture through a fine wire strainer. Serve over ice cubes in tall glasses. Garnish each glass with a sprig of mint and a raspberry. If desired, top each glass with a dollop of cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place salmon in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Brush with olive oil. Sprinkle with sea salt and pepper. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with pasta or rice.

Beat egg yolks together with sugar and cornstarch until lightly foamy. Add milk gradually, stirring constantly over low heat until mixture comes to a full rolling boil for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add the cooked rice, butter, vanilla and raisins. Serve warm or cold with nutmeg sprinkled on top.
