Wash the sweet potatoes and pierce with a fork. Place in a small saucepan with apple cider and water. Bring to a boil and cook for about 1 hour until the potatoes are very soft. While the potatoes are cooking, heat the butter in a small saute pan over medium heat. Add the chopped ginger and cook for about one minute. When the potatoes are done cooking, drain the water. Add the butter mixture and mash. Add a little cinnamon for extra flavor. Serve.

In a blender, combine strawberries and mashed bananas with enough water to make a smooth puree. Add lemon juice and blend briefly. Freeze until slushy. Process in food processor until smooth. Repeat freezing and processing until sorbet is very smooth and firm.

Melt the marshmallows and milk in a double boiler. Pour that mixture over the gelatin, stirring it until the gelatin is dissolved. Stir in the cream cheese until it dissolves. Add the pineapple and cool the mixture. Add mayonnaise and whipping cream and chill until firm.

Follow package directions. Divide batter in half. Add crunchy peanut butter to one half and chocolate chips to the other half. Drop by the spoonful on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 - 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease 9x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray oil. In large mixing bowl combine contents of jiffy cornbread mix. In small bowl combine cream cheese, onion, eggs and butter until smooth. Pour cream cheese mixture over jiffy cornbread mix and stir to combine. Bake about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into squares to serve.

Place a layer of potatoes into the crock pot. Spread with ham and onion mixture then sprinkle with paprika. Repeat layers two more times ending with potatoes and topping with more paprika. Combine soup and water and pour over top. Cook on high 4 to 6 hours or low 7 to 9 hours. Remove ham and serve. Slice ham into 1/4-inch slices and keep warm while finishing soup. In a small bowl, stir together milk and cornstarch until smooth. Stir into remaining soup and simmer until thickened. Spoon over ham and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Roll out each crescent roll and place on a baking sheet. Spread spaghetti sauce on each roll and sprinkle with pepperoni slices and mozzarella cheese. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.

To prepare the pudding combine the milk and cream with the sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar has dissolved. Add the almond extract. Bring the mixture to a simmer and stir in the pudding mix. Remove from the heat. Stir in the vanilla wafers. Line a 10-inch pie plate with the vanilla wafers, making a layer over the bottom and up the sides of the plate. Pour the pudding mixture over the wafers. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until set. Before serving spoon the cream over the pie and garnish with a maraschino cherry.

Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain well. Place in bowl. Combine carrot sticks and onions in a separate bowl with pasta sauce and garlic. Add to pasta mixture along with fresh parsley. Stir to blend well. Serve at room temperature or chill.

Cook rhubarb in boiling water for 5 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes. In a blender combine rhubarb with sugar and strawberry gelatin. Let set for 20 minutes. Mix vanilla pudding with milk and pour over rhubarb mixture. Refrigerate. Top with graham cracker crumbs and fresh strawberries if desired.

Prepare stuffing according to package directions. Spray a 9x13-inch pan with cooking spray. Place a layer of stuffing in the bottom of the pan. Place the chicken breast on top of the stuffing. Top with remaining stuffing. Combine butter, soup and milk. Spread over stuffing and chicken. Bake uncovered for about one hour.
Heat butter in small skillet over medium heat. Add zucchini and cook until tender crisp. Remove from heat. Add arugula. Season to taste. Toss well. Serve immediately.

Mix the dressing with the bread crumbs and the Italian seasoning mix. Dip the chicken in the dressing mixture and coat well. Place the coated chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with spaghetti sauce. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with the low fat mozzarella and the Parmesan cheese. Return to oven for 3 more minutes. Serve over spaghetti with a sprinkling of the Parmesan. Serves 4.

Place stew meat in crock pot. Pour over the can of celery soup. Add the cans of mushroom and french onion soups. Sprinkle the stew meat with the fresh mushrooms. Cook for 6 hours in crock pot on low heat. Remove meat from crock pot and shred with two forks. Place meat back in crock pot and add the onions and egg noodles. Cook for another 30 minutes. Top with a dollop of sour cream.

Heat bacon grease. Add onion. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until slightly transparent. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add spices and cook for 1 minute. Add diced tomatoes and stir. Add the rest of the ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Turn off heat. Let sit for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork and serve.

Place the fillets in a baking dish. Cover with water. Add lemon and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool in the refrigerator. Serve chilled with the dill.
Grease your crock pot with butter or margarine. Add all your ingredients to your crock pot and cover. Cook for 7-8 hours on low or 4-5 hours on high. Serve with rice, noodles or potatoes.

Cook bacon to a crisp in a skillet or microwave oven. Drain fat. Slice bread in half horizontally. Spread one half of bread with cream cheese, and sprinkle with horseradish to taste. Layer with cooked bacon, tomatoes, lettuce and other favorite sandwich ingredients. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, combine cayenne, cumin and oregano. Coat potato pieces with the olive oil. Sprinkle with spice mixture. Arrange in a single layer on a greased baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven for about 45 minutes, turning once during cooking. Serves 4.

Combine first four ingredients in saucepan. Cook until very thick. Add onion and cook until tender. Cool. Combine next four ingredients. Blend well. Add tomato mixture to this dressing. Blend well. Store in refrigerator. Serve as dressing for tomato or chicken salad.

Brown pork chops in skillet in small amount of oil and set aside. In skillet, saute vegetables with onion soup mix. Add spaghetti sauce and simmer for about five minutes. Add cooked pasta to skillet and stir until mixed well. Serve over pasta with pork chops on top.

Mix the light rum and vodka with the fresh lemon juice and simple syrup in a shaker. Shake vigorously for 5-10 seconds. Add the mint leaves and pour into a tall glass. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of lemon.

Combine flour, bread dough, tart apples, brown sugar, white sugar, apple pie spice, nutmeg, butter. Knead on a floured surface until smooth. Roll out to a 1/4 inch thickness on a floured surface to make a 12 inch diameter circle. Bake at 350 f until browned about 20 minutes. Cut into wedges. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake about 1 minute longer. Serve warm.

Cut tomatoes in half horizontally and remove seeds and pulp. Place in blender or food processor and process until smooth. Melt butter in a large pot over low heat. Add onions and saut until tender. Stir in soymilk. Bring to a simmer. Add tomatoes and simmer 10 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with basil or parsley.

Boil eggs as instructed in package directions. Peel and remove yolks. Put yolks in a bowl and add remaining ingredients. Mash with a fork until smooth. Spoon into egg whites and garnish with parsley. Serve with your favorite bread or crackers.

Peel, core and slice apples into 1/4-inch thick rounds. In an ovenproof skillet or small saute pan over high heat, add butter and brown sugar. Cook until foaming. Add apples and cook until they begin to brown on one side, about 5 minutes. Pour in bourbon and cook for 30 seconds. Deglaze pan with 1/4 cup water. Stir in lemon juice. Transfer pan to oven and cook for 15 minutes. To serve, drizzle with creme fraiche.

In a large bowl combine the cranberries, sugar and water. Bring to a boil and boil 2 minutes. Stir in the cranberry juice, apples, grapes and pecans. Spread in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Cool. In another bowl, combine the pineapple and whipping cream and spread over the cranberries. Cool. Sprinkle with the coconut. Serve.

Place a slice or two of tomato on each snapper fillet and top with a sliced onion. Sprinkle lightly with pepper. Squeeze lemon juice over fillets. Drizzle with oil. Bake for about 30 minutes in a preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven.

Wash the figs well to remove any dirt or insects. Cut them into small pieces. Place the figs, water, and the juice of two lemons in a large pot or Dutch oven. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and cook for about 20 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent the fruit from sticking to the bottom of the pot. When the fruit is soft, add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the lemon zest if you are using it and cook for an additional minute or two to blend the flavors. Pour the hot jam into sterile canning jars and seal. Process the jars in boiling water for 10 minutes.

Place the breast side down in a shallow pan with the ketchup, brown sugar, soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, Worcestershire sauce and onion. Cover with a tight-fitting lid or foil and bake at 325 degrees for about 4 hours or until the internal temperature registers 165 degrees F with an instant-read thermometer. Remove from the oven and let stand for 5 minutes before carving and serving with your favorite side dish.

Sprinkle gelatin over evaporated skim milk in a heavy saucepan. Stir until completely dissolved. Beat sugar until light and fluffy, beat in extracts and juice. Fold in gelatin mixture. Chill until firm.

Cook the tenderloins as directed, cutting into bite-sized pieces. Melt margarine in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the rice-a-roni and cook until lightly brownedstir in the chicken, peppers and corn. Add the cayenne and cook until heated through. Makes 4 servings.

Place the onions in an oven-proof dish. Sprinkle them with salt and pepper and cover with foil. Roast for 45 minutes until soft and dark golden brown. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the sage and the garlic. Brush the racks of lamb with the extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle with the herb and garlic mixture. Broil 3-4 minutes on each side. Serve the onions on a bed of baby spinach. Arrange the racks over the spinach.

Mix first six ingredients in a large saucepan. Add apple chunks and stir to coat evenly. Add water and stir to combine. Bring to a boil and cook for one minute. Remove from heat and add lemon juice and mix to combine. Cool completely. Fill 8 pint jars with mixture, leaving 1/2 inch head space. Wipe rims and adjust lids and rings to finger tip tight. Process in boiling water bath for 20 minutes or until sealed.
Combine onions, sliced mushrooms, cooked bacon, Monterey Jack cheese, eggs, milk, nutmeg. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 375 degrees F for about one hour. Sprinkle with paprika before serving.

Saute onions in a large skillet over medium heat for 1-2 minutes. Add garlic, and saute for 1 minute more. Add ginger and stir-fry for 1 minute more. Add serranos and stir-fry for 30 seconds more. Add snow peas and bell pepper and stir-fry 2 minutes more. Add mushrooms and oyster sauce, and stir-fry until heated through and liquid is reduced to a saucy consistency. Serve over steamed jasmine white rice.

In a small saucepan, combine the first 3 ingredients and heat until boiling. Reduce heat to lowcover and cook for 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the next 5 ingredientscook until thoroughly heated. Serve with milk on the side. Makes 2 servings.

For the rub combine cumin and onions. Heat olive oil in skillet. Add onions and sauté for 4-5 minutes. Add lemon juice and cook for another minute. Remove from heat and stir in cumin mixture. Place fish in a single layer in skillet and pour mixture over top. Grill for 10-12 minutes on each side. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cut steak into 1/2 inch cubes. In a heavy skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic. Cook until lightly browned. Add soy sauce, gingerroot, and cubed steak. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir in green onions. Continue to stir over high heat for 1 minute longer. Sprinkle with chives. Serve over hot cooked rice.

In a large slow cooker, place pork roast. Season with dry rub seasonings. Add onion and garlic. Pour in water. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours. After cooking, remove roast from cooker. Shred roast and return to cooker. Mix well and cover. Turn off heat and allow to rest 15 minutes. Serve on buns with barbecue sauce.

Slice sausages into small pieces. Brown in skillet with butter. Add onion and green pepper. Cook till tender. Add green chilies and sauté for 1 minute. Place in bottom of crock pot. Add eggs, milk and sour cream. Mix well. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook on low for 4 hours. Serve with salsa.

Cut a top off the red bell peppers. Cut out the seeds. Cook peppers in boiling water for 30 seconds. Remove from water and put in ice water. Remove peppers from water. Slice off the tops of the peppers. Place the bottoms of the peppers in a baking dish. Cut the tomatoes in half. Place tomato halves in the baking dish. Tear up the mozzarella and place it over the top of the tomatoes. Sprinkle with garlic and basil. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and garnish with basil leaves. Serve warm.

Put vinegar, sugar and soy sauce in a large bowl. Mix well. Add in chicken pieces. Cover and let sit in refrigerator for at least an hour. Remove from refrigerator. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic. Saute until golden. Add in chicken pieces. Turn heat down to medium-low. Cook until golden. Serve over rice.

Melt butter in small saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat. Add lemon rind and juice. Stir in salt and sugar. Add egg. Stir over low heat just until egg is cooked through. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

Cook corn in boiling water until tender. Drain. In a large heavy pot melt butter over medium heat. Add tomatoes, jalapeno peppers, onion and garlic. Cook until tender. Stir in corn. Add milk, salt & pepper to taste. Heat until hot. Garnish with cheese.

Brown ham. Add mushrooms and cook 5 minutes. Add 1 can of mushroom soup and 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil. Add minute rice and simmer 7-8 minutes until done. Do not drain. In a 2 quart baking dish place half of the rice. Spread with half of the soup mixture. Spread with half of the ham. Repeat. Bake 30-35 minutes.

In large saucepan add water and potatoes. Bring to a boil and boil for about 10-15 minutes or until tender. Drain water and add garlic, salt and butter and continue to cook for 3 minutes. Mash together. Add dried chipotle chiles and continue to stir until well blended. Add chevre cheese and continue to stir until cheese is melted. Stir in milk. Add salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped chives and serve.

Preheat grill to med-high heat. Rub steak with garlic pepper seasoning and chili powder. Grill steak 4-5 minutes per side. Slice and put in hoagie rolls. Spread with salsa and top with avocado and cheese.

Combine the first five ingredients in a medium bowl and beat with an electric mixer on low speed until smooth. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes. Stir in the cheese. Spoon half of the batter into two greased 12 cup muffin pans or paper liners. Layer with the pineapple chunks and remaining batter. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pans to cool on wire racks. Yield 24 muffins.

Place all of the ingredients except for the dressing in a large bowl. Toss until well combined. In another bowl mix together the mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, and water. Pour over the broccoli mixture and toss until well coated.

Heat a skillet on medium heat. Add the hazelnuts to the pan. Toast the nuts until they are fragrant and beginning to brown. Add garlic to the pan. Continue cooking until the hazelnuts and garlic are both light brown. Add the cilantro. Season the mixture with salt to taste. Slowly add the olive oil. Toss to coat the hazelnuts and cilantro. Sprinkle with the Parmesan.

In a small saucepan bring the dry white wine and sugar to a boil. Add vanilla bean and boil for 1 minute. Remove vanilla bean. Cut melon into cubes. Toss with blueberries and dressing. Garnish with vanilla bean and mint sprig.

Peel and slice the onions into strips and saute in a little oil over medium heat until they are tender and beginning to brown. Remove from heat and let cool. Add the ground beef and saute until brown. Drain the fat and return meat mixture to skillet over medium heat. Stir in the cooked onions and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cool the meat mixture slightly and stir in the milk and Bisquick mix. Place the meat mixture in the bottom of an unbaked pie plate. Sprinkle with shredded cheese and bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for about 1 hour or until the crust is browned and the center is set. Let stand for a few minutes before serving.
Melt the butter in a microwave safe container or a double boiler over medium low heat. Add the sage and stir. Remove from heat and add the balsamic vinegar. Taste for seasoning. Serve.

Warm oil in a large pot. Add leeks, garlic and cook until tender. Add chopped carrot, potato, and cook until tender. Add chicken broth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Puree soup until smooth. Place a slice of bread into a shallow bowl and spoon over pureed soup. Broil until crisp. Serve with croutons.

Mix together flour, salt and cornmeal. Add water to make a smooth batter. Add beer to batter and mix well. Add eggs to batter and mix well. Allow batter to sit in refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Deep fry until golden brown.

Put the onions and butter into a pan. Saute until the onions are golden brown. Stir in the salt and milk. Bring to a gentle simmer. Cook until the mixture thickens to the consistency of heavy cream. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the egg yolk until the mixture is smooth and thickened.

Preheat oven to 425. Beat milk and egg in a shallow dish. Heat oil in a skillet over med-high heat. Dip each breast in milk-egg mixturethen roll in panko. Cook in oil over med-high heat about 1 min per side or until done. Transfer to a baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray. Top with swiss and ham. Bake at 425 for about 12 minutes or until heated through. Cut in half on the diagonal. Serve with pasta or rice.

Melt butter in saucepan and add onion and celery. Cook 1 minute. Stir in soup, water chestnuts and corn. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in sour cream and cheese. Pour into 9x13-inch baking dish. Place 1 cup cracker crumbs on top and melt butter and drizzle over crumbs. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until crumbs are lightly browned.
In a saute pan over medium heat, melt butter and add onions. Cook about 10 minutes or until tender. Add thyme, lemon peel and vegetable stock. Add fettuccine, cook until tender but firm to bite.

Heat oil in large saucepan. Add onion. Saute onion till transparent. Add garlic. Continue to saute until golden brown. Add quinoa. Mix together well. Add vegetable stock. Stir to combine. Bring to boil. Cover. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes. Add soy sauce. Mix well. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Remove excess fat from beef. Rub in horseradish and garlic. Brown meat on all sides. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook for 8 hours on low. Add 1/4 cup water to pan juices. Thicken with flour and water paste if desired. Garnish with parsley. Serve with rice or noodles.

In a 9×13 baking dish, place the butter in the bottom of the pan and melt. Dip the chicken breasts in the butter and then in the bread crumbs and then back in the butter. Sprinkle with the herbs and then the cheese. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with salad or potatoes.

Pre heat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly oil a 9x9 pan. Whisk together eggs, salt, agave nectar, grapeseed oil and banana. Add cocoa. Bake for 25 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with sea salt.

Beat butter in large mixer bowl until creamy. Beat in mints and 1/2 cup powdered sugar. Beat in 1/2 of ice cream. Spread in 9-inch springform pan. Freeze 15 minutes or until firm. Meanwhile, beat remaining ice cream and powdered sugar until smooth. Spread on top of first layer. Freeze 15 minutes or until firm. Spread remaining ice cream over top. Freeze 1 hour or until firm. Decorate with chocolate syrup. Garnish with Andes Mints.

In a bowl, combine wheat germ, TVP, curry powder, sea salt, cayenne pepper, wheat germ. Add boiling water. Stir well to form a stiff batter. Cover bowl and refrigerate batter for 1 to 2 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. On a large cookie sheet, lightly brush with olive oil. Remove batter from refrigerator and stir in Braggs Liquid Aminos. Drop batter by tablespoons onto cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until crispy. Serve immediately. Store leftovers in an airtight container.

Prepare the pizza. In a saute pan saute the spinach leaves and artichoke hearts in the olive oil. Add the garlic, crumbled feta cheese. Remove from the pan and allow to cool. Add the artichoke hearts, spinach leaves and feta cheese to the pizza. Spread the pesto on the crust. Top with cheese. Bake according to crust directions.

Preheat broiler. Sprinkle ribs all over with rosemary and garlic and rub in the seasoning. Broil 2 inches from heat until browned on both sides. Add water to bottom of broiler pan to keep drippings from burning and to prevent charring meat. Cut ribs into individual portions. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375F. Place acorn squash on baking sheet. Cut in half and remove seeds. In a large skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic. Saut until the onion is soft and fragrant. Add the turkey and saute until cooked through. Season with the sage and salt and pepper. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, almond meal, and spices. Fill each half of the acorn squash with the turkey mixture. Pour the egg mixture over the top of the turkey. Sprinkle with the remaining tablespoon of butter. Bake for 30 minutes or until the eggs are set and the tops are golden.

Drain crushed pineapple reserving liquid and set aside 1/2 cup of juice. In a large mixing bowl combine crushed pineapple with 1 cup of juice from the can, 3/4 cup of milk, and 1/2 cup of pudding mix. Beat with a spoon for about 2 minutes or until well blended. Fold in 1/2 cup of whipping cream and 1/2 cup of pie filling. Pour into unbaked pie shell and freeze for 1 hour or longer if preferred. Decorate with remaining pie filling, coconut, cherries and sprinkle with a little cinnamon.

Wash leeks, cut off any roots that are attached, slice them in half lengthwise, and slice into 1/4 inch thick slices. Melt butter in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add leeks and saute until lightly browned. Remove from heat, and season with celery seed, parsley, salt and pepper. Serve as a side dish or as a stuffing for chicken or fish.

Combine lemon juice and olive oil in a small bowl and set aside. In another small bowl, combine parsley and flour. Dip fish in the flour mixture and then in the lemon mixture. Melt butter in frying pan and saute fish for about 2-3 minutes on each side until fish is lightly browned and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve immediately.
Dredge fish in flour, salt and pepper. Saute in butter until brown on both sides. Add onions and parsley. Pour in wine and boil until liquid is almost gone. Serve over rice.

Cook potatoes and onions in the microwave oven according to package directions. Cool slightly. Cut into cubes. Heat 1-2 tsp of vegetable oil in a large skillet. Add potato-onion mixture. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly. When the mixture is hot, sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes longer. Serve immediately.

Fill large bowl with water. Put sugar in small saucepan, add 1/4 cup water (enough to cover the sugar). Heat over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves. Continue to boil until mixture is a light amber color (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat. Stir in almond extract and violets. Pour into a shallow dish. Let cool. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Cook peppers in boiling water for 5 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain and cool. Remove tops and seeds. In a large saucepan, combine soup, onion soup mix and milk. Stir in chicken and rice. Cook over medium heat for 5 to 7 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Spoon mixture into peppers. Top with cheese. Return to saucepan and heat over medium heat for 3 minutes or until cheese is melted and blended.

Separate the cake into three layers. Cut the bottom layer into a small cubes and place in a 13x9 inch pan. Prepare the pudding according to the directions on the package. Spread on the bottom layer of cubed cake. Add the second layer of cake cubes. Add the last layer of cubed cake and spread the last layer of pudding on top. Cool before adding the fruit. Place the cubes of fruit in an even layer on top of the cake, then cover the top of the cake with the whipped topping. Refrigerate until serving time.

Beat the cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth. Blend in the sour cream. Stir in the brown sugar, cinnamon, and the cheddar until well combined. Chill for 2 hours. Drain the red apple and finely chop. Mix in the green apple. Line an 8 inch square dish with the cracker crumbs. Spread the apple mixture over the crumbs. Top with the remaining cracker crumbs. Store in refrigerator. Serve chilled.

Combine dry ingredients in a medium size bowl. Cream together shortening, butter, sugar and eggs. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture. Stir in pineapple and vanilla. Drop by rounded tsps onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 12 minutes. Yields 4 dozen.

Sift the flour and baking powder in a medium size bowl. Add the shortening and using your fingertips or a pastry blender, cut the shortening into the flour mixture until crumbly. Add the cheese, mix it in well. Add the buttermilk all at once and stir just until the dough begins to form a ball. Turn it out onto a lightly floured surface and gently knead just until the dough comes together. Roll it out to 1/2 inch thickness and cut into biscuits with a floured 2-1/2-inch round cutter. Place the cut outs onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees F for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove them from the oven, transfer them to a wire rack to cool just a bit before serving.

Brew the coffee and cool it to a temperature of about 130 degrees Fahrenheit (54 degrees Celsius). Add the skim milk and the artificial sweetener. Blend the drink until frothy. Add ice and blend again. Serve in a tall glass with whipped cream on top.

In a large skillet, saute ravioli in olive oil for 3 minutes. Add in the butter and saute for another minute. Stir in the heavy cream until heated through. Add in the walnuts and continue cooking for 1 to 2 minutes. Serve hot.

In 1-1/2-quart casserole, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Add corn and next 3 ingredientsheat through. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and top with tortilla chips. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until heated through. Garnish with lettuce.

Cook noodles according to package directionsdrainset aside. Heat oil in wok or large skillet over high heatsaute chicken for 1-2 minutes or until brownedremove from panset aside. Stir green onions into wok until tender crispadd garliccook for 30 secondsadd broccoli and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes or until crisp-tenderadd noodlesstir-fry for 1 minutestir in broth, teriyaki sauce and red pepper flakesbring to a boilcoverreduce heatsimmer for 2-3 minutes or until chicken is cooked throughtoss with cornstarch mixture.

In a large bowl combine first 5 ingredients. Spread evenly over cut sides of toast. Top with 2 slices swiss cheese and sprinkle with paprika. Broil 4-inches from heat 2 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Spray 10 inch nonstick frying pan with cooking sprayplace corn tortilla in pan. Spread mole evenly on top of tortilla. Break one egg in center of mole. Cover with another corn tortilla. Cook 2 minutes or until bottom is crisp and golden brown. Turn overcook 2 minutes or until egg is set. Top with remaining tortillassprinkle with cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Cut tostada in half. Serve with salsa.
Preheat oven to 400 F. Grease 10 inch pie plate. Blend all ingredients in a mixing bowl. Pour into pie plate. Bake for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with extra cheese. Serve hot.

In a sauce pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add rice and stir until hot. Add frozen vegetables and cream of mushroom soup. Stir well. Add milk. Heat through. In a small sauce pan over medium heat, melt cheese. Stir until smooth. Add black pepper, and paprika. Stir. Pour over vegetable/rice mixture. Serve immediately.
Mix all dry ingredients together. Mix all wet ingredients together. Add dry ingrediants to wet ingredients. Mix just until combined. Do not overmix. Bake for 20 minutes in a 350 degree oven.

In a medium bowl, combine the flax seeds and protein powder. In a separate bowl, combine the cinnamon, baking powder and salt. In a third bowl, combine the soymilk, xylitol and vanilla. In a fourth bowl, combine the eggs and oil. Pour the soymilk mixture into the bowl with the flax seeds and protein powder and stir until blended. Then add the cinnamon-baking powder-salt mixture and stir again. Finally add the egg-oil mixture and stir just until blended. Fill paper-lined muffin cups half full and bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm or cold.

Mix all ingredients except tomato juice with your hands. Shape into loaf shape in loaf pan, pour tomato juice over top of loaf to cover. Bake at 350 for 45-60 minutes until done. Remove from pan to serve.

Soak rice overnight to soften. Cook rice, drain and cool. Sauté onion in oil until tender. Stir in rice, parsley and eggs. Shape into 12 patties. Dust with breadcrumbs. Fry 2 minutes on each side or until crisp.
Heat butter in a saute pan over medium heat. Add beer, italian dressing, salt and pepper. Add in shrimp. Cook for about 5 minutes or until pink. Sprinkle with tabasco. Serve over rice or pasta.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, water and blood orange zest until sugar is dissolved. Let mixture cool completely and pour into ice cream freezer canister. Freeze according to manufacturers instructions. Pour mixture into a blender or food processor and add Campari and blood orange juice. Blend until smooth. Return mixture to canister and refreeze until ready to serve.

Drain beans and place in slow cooker. Add water to cover by 2 inches. Add garlic, onion, salt, pepper, parsley, ground cloves. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or until beans are tender. Remove ham from slow cookercut into 1/2-inch cubes. Stir ham into beans. Cook for an additional 30 minutes. Stir in parsley. Serve with crusty bread.

Heat 1 tbsp of the oil in a large saucepan or flameproof casserole, add the onion, garlic and bay leaves and saute over medium heat until the onions are tender. Add the wine and reduce by half. Add the chopped tomatoes, chickpeas, the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil, the remaining 1/2 cup of water and the fish fillets, cover the pan and bake in a 350 degree F oven for about 30 minutes or until the fish is cooked through. Uncover and sprinkle the fillets with the olives and parsley. Serve over boiled or steamed rice.

Heat oil in skillet. Add onions and saute until golden. Add garlic, ham and cook until crisp. Remove ham and onions from skillet. Drain fat. Cut meat into thin strips. Add to skillet with flour and cook until browned. Add wine and broth and bring to boil. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Add ham and onions. Cook until hot. Serve over noodles. Garnish with parsley.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine 2 cups water with the cardamom pods, fresh ginger, orange strips, and 1 tablespoon of the sugar. Cook until mixture is reduced by half. Stir in remaining 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heatadd the tea leaves. Steep for 5 minutes. Strain into a heatproof glass pitcher. Discard the solids. Add milk to taste. Serve hot or cold. Garnish with the remaining orange strip. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sift together the spelt flour, cocoa powder and sea salt. In a large bowl, add the sugar and whisk to combine. Add the oil and whisk until combined. Add the vinegar and whisk until combined. Add the vanilla. Make a hole in the center of the mixture. Add the flour mixture and combine. Add the water and combine. Grease and line a 9 inch square pan. Pour the mixture into the pan and smooth the top. Bake for 25 - 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Serve.

Butter one side of all 4 slices of bread. Top unbuttered sides with cheese and pepperoni. Spread pizza sauce evenly on both slices of cheese and pepperoni and place other 2 slices of bread on top, buttered sides out. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook sandwiches on both sides until golden brown and cheese is melted.

Combine cheese and milk in a saucepan over low heat and heat until melted. Remove from heat and add remaining ingredients. Pour into greased 13-in. X 9-in. baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Serves 10.

In a large skillet heat butter over medium heat. Add green onion and cook until tender. Add the cooked ham and mix well. Add the half-and-half and whisk well. Add the frozen hash browns and stir well to combine. Add salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Spread the mixture into a 9-inch pie pan. Cover the top with the shredded cheese. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until the quiche is puffed and golden. Remove and let stand for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the green onion before serving.
Combine cherries and water in a sauce pan. Bring to a boil. Stir in sugar and cornstarch. Cook and stir until thickened. Cool.

Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add flour, stirring constantly. Add mustard. Add milk. Cook over medium heat. Stir in baby onions. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in scallion. Cook for an additional minute. Season with salt and cayenne. Serve hot.

Rinse the stems and cut away the tough ends. Toss in a large bowl with olive oil and season with sea salt and black pepper. Cook in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until wilted. Toss the garlic in with the broccoli. Serve hot. Serves 2 to 4.

Preheat the oven to 450°F. Scrub the potatoes thoroughly. Cut each one into 6 wedges, removing any green spots or eyes. Place in a large bowl and toss with the rosemary and sea salt. Spray a baking sheet with the cooking spray. Place the potatoes in a single layer on the panbake until golden brown and tender, 45-50 minutes. Makes 3-4 servings.

Combine brown sugar and butter in a sauce pan over medium heat. Stir constantly until mixture thickens and turns a light brown color, about five minutes. Add spices and stir until well combined. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. In a heatproof pitcher combine brandy and water and heat over medium-low heat until steaming. Pour hot brandy into pitcher with buttered brown sugar mixture and stir until well combined. Pour brandy into two warm mugs and garnish with an orange slice. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease 6 muffin cups or line with paper bake cups. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and saltmix well and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the milk, egg and vegetable oilmix well. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredientsstir just until moistened. Fold in the bacon and maple syrup. Spoon into the prepared cups. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack. Makes 6 muffins.

Preheat oven to 375. Combine honey, butter, yellow mustard, salt and curry powder in a small bowl. Place chicken in a 9x13 baking pan. Pour glaze over the top. Bake for 45-60 minutes, turning once. Serve over rice.
Combine all ingredients. Use to make bread.

Sift together flour, sugar and baking powder. Add salt and milk. Add enough milk to make soft dough. Knead gently and roll out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut out circles with a biscuit cutter and place on lightly greased pans. Fill with fruit and dot with butter. Bake at 375 until golden brown and crust is cooked through.

Cook bacon until crisp. Crumble bacon, set aside. Preheat barbecue to hot. Clean corn husks by removing any old husks or silk from corn. Cook over barbecue for 10 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat, cut off husk, sprinkle with crumbled bacon, salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Peel potatoes and cut into wedges. In a large bowl, mix together onion, butter, salt and pepper. Toss potato wedges into butter mixture and coat well. Spread potatoes into a buttered casserole dish or baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until tender.

Cut off the kernels and place in a large bowl. Add the butter and mayo. Season with salt, pepper and red chili powder. Mix well. In a small bowl mix the queso fresco with the key lime juice. Spoon the queso fresco over the top of the corn mixture and mix well. Refrigerate and serve cold.

Place wheat in a medium bowladd 1 quart of water. Soak for 4 hours, or overnight. Strain wheat through a cheesecloth or fine sieve. Add skim milk to wheat, 1 quart at a time, until mixture is smooth. Add honey and stir until dissolved. Add apricots. Stir in cinnamon, cardamom, and vanilla. Chill until ready to serve. To serve, fold in almonds.
Slice onion and brown in butter. Add bread cubes and brown sugar. Add water and tomatoes and cook for 15 minutes till tomatoes are soft. Season to taste.

Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Cook shallots in oil until soft. Add white wine. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until reduced by half. Add chicken stock. Simmer until reduced by half. Stir in heavy cream. Bring to a simmer. Season with white pepper. Pour into a bowl. Cover to keep warm. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Cook until foaming subsides. Stir in remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Whisk until well blended. Pour over reduced sauce. Stir until melted. Serve over fish or meat.
Blend basil with butter. Place orange rind and juice in a bowl and place in the microwave for 15 seconds. Add to the butter. Stir. Microwave for 10 seconds. Pour over the steaming corn.

Boil the macaroni, drain well and rinse under cold water. Combine with the rest of the ingredients and add enough salad dressing to make a thick mixture. Put in a large bowl and add enough paprika to make a pretty color. Cover and refrigerate overnight for best flavor.

Cut the chicken into 1/2-inch cubes. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, bell pepper and the next 5 ingredients. Heat the non-fat cooking spray in an 11x7 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Stir the bell pepper mixture. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Stir in the orange juice. Bake for an additional 5 minutes. Serve over brown rice.

In a large bowl, mix together the sugar, cinnamon and peaches. In another bowl combine the flour, butter and milk. Pour over the fruit. Bake at 350 for 45-50 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serves 8-10.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the asparagus and boil until crisp tender--about 5 minutes. Drain the asparagus and pat dry with paper towels. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add the prosciutto and cook until crisp--about 5 minutes. Add the asparagus and toss until heated through--about 2 minutes. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Beat agave and applesauce with a whisk until well blended. Add in the rest of the wet ingredients and beat to blend. Then add the dry ingredients and beat to blend. Fold in the cinnamon, cloves and bananas. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 10 minutes in a 375 degree oven.

Preheat oven to 375f. Butter a shallow baking pan. Dip each breast in the flour. Heat the butter and oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mustard and flour. Cook for 1 minute. Add the wine and broth. Cook 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and tarragon. Stir until thickened. Remove from heat. Arrange the chicken in the pan. Bake 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Spoon sauce over the chicken. Return to oven and bake 5 minutes more. Serve with rice or noodles.

Mix together all the ingredients except for the egg white. Bring to a boil and simmer until reduced by half. Beat egg white until soft peaks form. Mix egg whites into the reduction. Pour into popsicle molds or an ice-cream freezer container and freeze. Serve immediately or freeze until solid. Can be frozen for up to three months.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, coating both sides of each piece evenly. Place in skillet and brown on both sides. Add mushrooms and saute until almost tender. Add marsala wine and broth. Cook until chicken is done, about 15 minutes. Pour over hot cooked rice or pasta. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley before serving.

Place pork butt in slow-cooker. Combine remaining ingrediants. Pour over pork butt. Cover and cook on low 8-10 hours. Remove and shred with two forks. Return to crockpot and warm through. Serve with biscuits and gravy.

Heat the oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the onion and saut for 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook for another 10 minutes. Add the red bell pepper, green bell pepper, cumin, paprika, oregano, and salt and pepper. Cook for 5 more minutes. Toss in the cotija cheese and serve with tortillas.

In a bowl combine cottage cheese with mixed vegetables, sweet corn relish and tuna. Divide tuna mixture between two lavash. Sprinkle with snow pea sprouts and roll. Wrap each sandwich with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
Combine all ingredients in a non-metal bowl. Add chicken pieces. Marinate for 30 minutes in the fridge. Grill or broil on medium heat for about 20 minutes or until juices run clear.

Wash and rinse the berries. Combine the sugar, water and spices in a heavy nonaluminum saucepan. Heat the mixture slowly to the boiling point, stirring often. When the mixture is boiling, add the berries and heat to the boiling point. Boil gently for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand for 1 minute. Drain the berries and add the orange. Serve hot or cold.

Melt butter in pan over medium heat. Add shallots. Sauté until tender. Add mushrooms and saut until liquid evaporates. Add medallions and saut until browned. Add cognac and flame. Add whipping cream. Simmer until heated through. Season with horseradish and parsley. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Line baking pan with foil. Season fillets with salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add fillets and cook for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Remove fillets from pan and place fillets onto baking pan. Bake for 3 to 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Remove from oven. Serve with salsa and lemon slice.

Prepare ramen according to package directions. Crush and set aside flavor packets. Prepare broccoli and bok choy according to package directions. Cool slightly. Toss with green onion, sunflower kernels, almonds, and dressing. Serve in a large bowl. Serves 4-6.

Melt the butter and add the sugar and milk. Stir until the mixture is smooth. Sift the flour and baking powder. Stir into the mixture and add the egg, cardamom and salt. Place mixture into a greased dish and bake for 30 minutes at 180c or until firm and golden brown. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350. Place all ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Beat at low speed with an electric mixer for 1 minute. Beat at high speed for one minute. Pour into a greased 10 inch pie pan. Bake for one hour. Cool. Top with whipped topping.

Melt the butter in a wok or large frying pan over moderate heat until foamy. Stir in the shallots, chili pepper, garlic and carrot. Stir fry for about 3 minutes. Pour in the vegetable stock and soy sauce. Cover the wok or frying pan and cook over low heat for 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. Season with salt if necessary. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan combine the water and sugar. Stirring constantly, bring mixture to a boil and cook until sugar is completely dissolved. Remove from heat and add the ginger. Let steep for 15 minutes. Strain the mixture through a fine sieve and discard the ginger. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch and water until smooth. Whisk into the citrus syrup and bring back to a boil, whisking constantly until the mixture is clear and thickened. Remove from heat and let cool completely. Transfer to a clean jar and store in the fridge up to 1 week. To serve, shake a bit of syrup into a glass of iced tea. You can also use the ginger citrus syrup to make a refreshing spritzer by combining the syrup with sparkling water and a splash of club soda.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Heat 1 tbsp. butter in a skillet over medium-high heat until foaming. Add steaks and cook for 3 minutes. Turn steaks and brown the other side. Transfer steaks to baking sheet and put in oven. Heat remaining 1 tbsp. butter in skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until browned, about 8 minutes. Stir in soup and season with thyme, marjoram and salt and pepper. Cook until slightly thickened, 2-3 minutes. Remove steaks from oven. Stir in sour cream and green onions. Serve over cooked noodles.

Combine the first three ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Cut the apples into chunks and arrange in an 8x8 glass or ceramic baking dish. Pour the brown sugar mixture over the apples. Mix the remaining dry ingredients and stir in the melted butter until the mixture is coarse and crumbly. Sprinkle over the top of the apple mixture. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until the top is golden. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

In a blender, combine watermelon, sugar and lime juice until smooth. Pour into 4 glasses or a punch bowl, add rum and serve immediately. Mint leaves can also be placed in glasses and removed before serving.

In a small saucepan combine the wine, water, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add the salmon and simmer, covered for 5-6 minutes or until the salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove the salmon from the pan and keep warm. Whisk the yogurt, cucumber, and dill in a small bowl. Season with salt. Serve the salmon with the cucumber sauce. Garnish with a few more dill sprigs, if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash Brussels sprouts and trim stems. Cut in half lengthwise. Arrange on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Roast for 20 minutes or until lightly brown. Remove from heat and add grapes. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and toss to combine. Serve on a bed of baby greens and sprinkle with toasted walnuts.

In skillet, brown pork chops on each side. Remove from heat. In same skillet, heat oil over med. heat. Stir in seasoned stuffing mix. Pour apple pie filling over the top of stuffing. Place pork chops on top. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until chops are cooked through.

Mix together the white and wholemeal flour. Add the salt to taste. Add the cream of tartar to the milk and mix into the flour. Add the syrup, knead and form into a ball. Roll into two equal balls. Place on a greased plate. Bake in a moderate oven for 25 minutes. Serve warm with butter.

Place chicken in slow cooker and add salsa, peanut butter, lime juice and soy sauce. Mix well and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Add ginger and cook 15 minutes longer. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with chopped peanuts and cilantro.

Melt chocolate and brummel and brown in small sauce pan over medium heat until smooth. Add condensed milk and stir. Cook over medium heat until smooth and boiling. Cook for another minute. Add vanilla and stir until combined. Remove from heat. Serve warm.

Beat eggs with an electric mixer until light and lemon-colored. Add sugar and beat until thick and pale yellow, scraping down sides occasionally. Add butter and beat until smooth. Stir in lemon juice and lemon zest. Pour into 6 individual serving dishes and chill for at least 4 hours or overnight. Before serving, whip heavy cream in a chilled bowl until soft peaks form. Spoon over mousses and serve. Garnish with mint, if desired.

1 Bring the consomme and water to a boil in a large pot. Add the rice and stir to combine. 2 Cover and cook for about 20 minutes, or until all the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Fluff with a fork. Serve with the remaining tablespoon of butter and the lemon wedges.

Brown and drain ground chuck and onions. Add green pepper and cook until tender. Stir in rotel and cook 5 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper. Place 3 tortillas in a greased baking dish. Spread 1/2 of the meat mixture over the tortillas. Top with 1 can of ranch style beans. Repeat layers with remaining tortillas, beans, and meat mixture. Combine cream of chicken soup and velveeta and spread over meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serve hot with lettuce and sour cream if desired.

Cook egg noodles. Drain. In saucepan combine mushroom soup, onion, tuna (drain before adding), and cooked noodles. Mix well. In 9x13 pan combine ingredients. Sprinkle with cheese, and bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees.
Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente. Drain. Toss in pan with fennel, oil, capers, lemon juice and parsley. Add fish when cool enough to handle. Serve with parmesan cheese sprinkled over.

Pour water in a pot and boil. Add sugar and stir until it dissolves. Add the orange wedges. Simmer for 5 minutes and add lemon. Add the other two fruits and simmer for another 5 minutes. Add the red candies. Strain. Add the pineapple and cranberry juices. Serve while warm.

Whisk together honey, lime juice, and soy sauce. In a small bowl, combine honey-lime mixture and chopped cilantro. Rub lime-honey mixture over both sides of each chicken breast. Set aside. In another small bowl, combine 1/4 cup chili-garlic sauce and 2 tbsp. red pepper flakes. Thread chicken onto skewers. Place the skewers onto a broiler pan and brush both sides with remaining 1/4 cup chili-garlic sauce. Broil 4 inches from heat for 5 minutes on each side or until chicken is done. Serve with the reserved lime-honey mixture. Serve with rice.

Place cutlets in a baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Add white wine to the dish. Pour soup mix over cutlets. Mix all together. Bake at 350 degrees f for 1 hour. Combine the half-and-half and dry mix. Cook and stir over medium heat until boiling. Stir in the garlic powder, pepper and tabasco. Serve over cutlets.

Prepare chicken as directed on package. In a skillet, saute mushroom stems and pieces in butter until tender. Stir in dressing mix and water until well blended. Add chickencook until no longer pink. Stir in soup, mushroom pieces, oregano leaves and cooked pasta. Heat through. Serve over cooked pasta. Makes 4 main dish servings.

In a medium bowl, combine butter, worcestershire, lemon juice, white sugar and paprika. Divide evenly and spread onto both sides of pork chops. Sprinkle with salt and cayenne pepper. Heat a skillet to medium-high and add butter and chops. Cook until browned. Serve on buns.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook sausage according to package directions. Remove from pan and cut into 1/2" slices. Unroll dough and separate into 8 triangles. Place 1 piece of sausage in each triangle, and sprinkle with cheese. Fold triangles over filling, press edges and seal. Place on greased baking sheet. Beat eggs and milk togetherpour over rolls. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Combine teriyaki sauce and soy sauce in a bowl and place chicken in the bowl, turning to coat. Cover and chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, mix pineapple juice and brown sugar in a small bowl. Place in fridge. Slice chicken breast in half and place in a shallow dish. Drizzle with soy sauce. Place in fridge until ready to grill. In a small bowl combine teriyaki and soy sauce and add to chicken. Place in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Meanwhile slice pineapple rings and toss with brown sugar and pineapple juice. Grill chicken until done. Assemble Hawaiian sandwich and top with pineapple slices. Makes 1 sandwich.

Place 1/2 teaspoon garlic and 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper on a small plate. Mix well and set aside. Place chicken pieces on top of garlic mixture and turn to coat both sides of the chicken pieces with the garlic mixture. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add oil. Add the chicken pieces and brown on each side about 4 minutes per side. Remove from pan. Add the roasted red pepper and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon garlic and saute 1 minute. Stir in the sun dried tomato and saute 1 minute more. Add the rosemary and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered for 20 minutes or until the chicken is tender. Remove the rosemary sprigs and set aside. Blend the cornstarch with a little of the broth and add to the sauce stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Simmer an additional 5 minutes. Add the basil and serve over the pasta of choice.
Combine first 6 ingredients in a bowl. Set aside. Add vinegar to oil in small bowlwhisk. Add pepper. Pour dressing over salad. Add feta cheese to top.

Cut chicken into 3-4cm slices, season with a little salt and pepper and sprinkle with mixed herbs. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a frying pan with the lemon slices. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until softened. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil to the pan along with the lemon slices and the pesto. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the lemon slices are softened and the sauce has thickened a little. Meanwhile, heat a griddle pan until hot. Brush the chicken slices with a little of the pesto sauce, season with a little salt and pepper. Cook for about 4 minutes on each side or until the chicken is cooked through and has a crispy brown coating. Top with a little cheese before serving with the lemon slices and sauce on the side.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine the tomatoes, garlic, vinegar, basil and peaches in a bowl. Mix well. Add the chopped red peppers and season to taste with salt and pepper. Place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 20 minutes until the tomatoes are softened and the peaches have begun to caramelize. Serve on toasted baguette slices.

Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Dip in egg whites. Dip in bread crumbs. Place in butter in skillet. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes. Cut in pieces. Top with sour cream mixture. Add chopped parsley. Serve with mayonnaise.
Combine cocoa, sugar and spices in small saucepan. Stir in milk. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils. Boil 30 seconds. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Spread the spears out on the sheet so they are not touching each other. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until they are crisp tender, about 10 minutes. While the spears are roasting, heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add the butter and let it melt. Stir in the soy sauce and the vinegar. Remove from heat. When the spears are done, sprinkle with the sauce. Garnish with parsley if desired.
Cream cheese, butter and green olives together. Add in walnuts and green onions. Form into a ball and chill in fridge for several hours. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel potatoes and dice into 1/2 inch cubes. Toss in a medium bowl with the cornstarch, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Heat vegetable oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat until just smoking. Add potato mixture to the skillet, coating well. Pour in the butter and cook, stirring occasionally until the mixture is lightly browned and crisp in spots, about 8 minutes. Transfer to oven and roast until browned, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter and sprinkle with parsley and lemon zest. Serves 4

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Cut the peeled onions into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Brush lightly with vinegar and sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Arrange on a baking sheet, sprinkle with rosemary leaves. Roast until tender, about 20 minutes. Toss with additional vinegar, salt, pepper, and rosemary leaves to taste.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute roast until browned. Add onioncook until tender. Remove roast from skillet. In a large bowl, combine soy sauce and waterstir well. Add roastturn to coat. Pour half the soy mixture into the skilletcook over medium heat until mixture is thickened. Remove roast from skilletkeep warm. Add cabbagecook until tender. Return roast to skillet. Stir in flourcook until thickened. Serve roast over cabbage.

In a large saucepan combine all ingredients. Heat to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 35 - 40 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with pepperoni and cheese. Makes 8 servings.

In a 10-inch skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add salt pork. Fry until the pork is crisp and golden. Add the tomato, bell pepper, onion and garlic. Cook until the tomato is soft. Add the flour. Stir until it forms a paste. Slowly add the milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Cook until the mixture thickens.

In a medium saucepan, combine water and sugar over high heat until the sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil. Add tomatoes and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add gingerroot and lemon. Cover and let stand for 2 hours. Drain the liquid and reserve for another use. Pour the tomatoes into hot sterilized pint canning jars. Pack the cherry tomatoes down into the jar. Add 1 tablespoon of the reserved liquid to each jar. Seal the jars immediately. Store in a cool dark place. Makes 4 (1/2-pint) jars.
Mix together all the above ingredients and refrigerate over night. Make sure the cream cheese is at room temp before mixing together. Serve with lettuce and tomatoes. Great side or lunch.

In a medium bowl, combine breadcrumbs, scallion, parsley, and seasonings. In another bowl combine flour, egg, and 1 tablespoon of milkbeat until smooth. Dip fish into batter. Drain excess batter and place on waxed paper-covered baking sheet. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Fry fish in oil until golden browndrain on paper towels. Coat with bread crumb mixture and place in baking dish. Bake at 350F for 35-45 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with tartar sauce.

In a skillet heat butter until melted. Add chicken to skillet and brown on all sides. Add tomatoes, celery, onions, parsley, zucchini, soup, sauce and water. Bring to a boil and cook 20 minutes or until done. Serve over hot rice. Garnish with green onions.

Cook meat in a skillet. Add cream of chicken soup, onion powder, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in cooked noodles. Pour mixture into 1-1/2 quart casserole. Combine butter and bread crumbs. Sprinkle over top of casserole. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter one side of each bun. Spread the mustard on the buttered side of each bun. Place the buns buttered side up in a baking dish. Sprinkle the tops of the buns with the swiss cheese. Combine the worcestershire and the garlic salt, pouring this mixture over the buns. Bake for 5 minutes or unil cheese is melted.

Cover peppers with water in a medium pot. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool until you can handle the peppers. Peel the peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. In a food processor or blender combine the peppers and onions. Process until smooth. Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the red pepper flakes and cook for another minute. Add the tomatoes with their juices and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the pepper puree and water. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce the heat to medium low. Simmer for about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the coconut milk. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Serve warm.

Rinse hen thoroughly inside and out. Combine poultry seasoning with adobo seasoning and dill weed. Sprinkle seasoning mixture inside cavity and inside the hen's body cavity as far as possible. Stuff the neck cavity with the seasoning mixture. Fold wings under hen's back and tuck them behind legs. Place hen on rack in roasting pan. Combine 2 tablespoons butter with 2 tablespoons olive oil. Place hen breast down on rack, spread the mixture on hen's back and sides. Bake at 425 degrees f for 1 hour. Reduce heat to 325 degrees f. Baste hen with pan juices every 15 minutes, turning hen over every 30 minutes. Bake until juices run clear when pricked with a fork. Remove hen from oven. Discard giblets. Carve hen and serve with seasoning mixture mixture.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine 1/2 cup melted butter, 1 cup chopped celery, and 1/2 cup chopped onions. Saute till tender. Beat 6 eggs and 1/2 cup water. Add to celery mixture and stir well. Add 1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley and 1/2 teaspoon ground sage. Stir in 2 cups cooked and cooled cornbread. Mix in 2 cups chicken broth. Pour into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Bake for 1 hour or until top is golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut serrano peppers into 1/2 inch pieces. Wrap in bacon and cook till tender. Cube chorizo sausage. In a sauce pan combine all of the above ingredients with 1/4 cup of water. Cook until well blended. Pour into an 8 by 8 inch baking dish. Combine remaining water with extra sharp cheddar cheese in a bowl. Microwave for 1 minute. Stir well. Spread over the top of the buffalo turds. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes or until brown and bubbly. Serve with toothpicks or small plates.

Split french bread horizontally. Spread mayonnaise on bottom half. Add peppers, tomatoes and onion. Top with colby-monterey jack cheese. Spread top half with mayonnaise and place on top. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Prepare a small bowl of boiling water. Add the margarine. Add the flour. Beat until the margarine is completely dissolved in the flour. Remove from the water. Add the water (and salt). Add the cheese. Beat until smooth. Add the egg. Beat. Place the batter in an ice cream scoop. Put into greased muffin tins. Bake in preheated oven at 375 for 20 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 12.
Combine peaches, crushed pineapple and sugar. Cook until soft, stirring frequently. Add jell-o mixture and bring to a boil. Cook until thickened. Store at room temperature for up to 3 weeks.

In a bowl mix together yoghurt, red chili powder, ginger-garlic paste and salt. Marinate the chicken with this mixture for 1 hour. Mix all tikka powder in a bowl. Heat olive oil in a pan. Add tikka powder. Stir for 1 minute. Place the marinated chicken legs in the pan. Add 1 cup of water. Cover the pan. Cook for 25-30 minutes.

Sift together flour and sugar. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add egg and mix until dough forms. Press into buttered 8-inch square baking pan. Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes. Cool. Spread preserves over hot crust. Sprinkle with pecans. Let stand until chilled. Cut into squares.

Mix together in a large bowl the broccoli florets, grapes and celery. In a smaller bowl mix together the yogurt, light mayo, vinegar, sugar and salt. Add to broccoli mixture and gently mix. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight. Serve chilled.
Soak rice paper in warm water until soft. Lay on clean work surface and place 2 or 3 tablespoons filling in center, top with lettuce leaves and carrot sticks, roll up and serve with peanut sauce.

Cream butter and sugar together. Beat in 1 cup of the milk and the vanilla extract. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup of milk. Beat with electric mixer on medium-low speed for 1 to 2 minutes or until frosting is fluffy and smooth.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Wash the lemons and cut a thin slice from the end of each one. Cut the lemons into quarters and remove the seeds. Cut the quarters into thin strips. In a small bowl, melt the butter in the microwave for 15 to 30 seconds. Add the honey and stir. Remove the skins from the rosemary sprigs. Peel the garlic cloves. Add the rosemary sprigs, garlic cloves, lemon strips, honey mixture, salt, and pepper to the bowl with the melted butter. Whisk until the mixture is smooth. Place the chicken in a baking dish. Pour the mixture over the top of the thighs. Bake for 45 minutes. Check the internal temperature of the chicken with an instant-read thermometer. It should read 165 degrees. Remove from the oven and allow it to rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
Place the water and lime juice in a blender. Add the sugar and blend. Add the mango, pineapple and rum and blend for 30 seconds. Serve in glasses over ice.

In a large skillet, combine 2 tablespoons of the flour and the butter. Stir over medium heat until butter melts. Dip the chicken pieces one at a time into the flour mixture. Shake off excess. Saute in butter until no longer pink, about 6-7 minutes. Remove from pan and keep warm. Add cream to butter mixture and boil until thickened. Remove from heat. Add crabmeat and asparagus. Top the chicken with the mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Butter an 8x8-inch pan. In a large heavy saucepan, combine sugar and evaporated milk. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add butter, salt and vanilla. Stir until smooth. Add marshmallows and stir. Add chocolate chips. Spread evenly into buttered 8x8-inch pan. Chill until firm. Cut with a sharp knife. Makes about 2 pounds.

Scramble the egg. Fry the ham in a small amount of vegetable oil until crisp. Dice the onion and fry with a little vegetable oil until golden brown. Place the ham in the bottom of a small bowl. Layer in the ham, onion, egg, and potatoes. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Serve immediately. Makes 1 serving.

Prepare broccoli as directed on package. Drain. Cook rice as directed on package. Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine soup and mayo. Add lemon juice and curry powder. Add chicken and broccoli. Spoon into a 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese and crumb. Bake uncovered 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

Cut the cabbage into quarters and core out the center portion. Put the cut portions into a pot with cold water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook for 10 minutes or until the leaves are tender but still firm. Drain the potatoes and cut them into small pieces. Heat the bacon drippings in a pot over medium heat and add the potatoes. Cook for 4 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Combine all of the first four ingredients and heat until the sugar dissolves. Add the boneless breasts and simmer 10 minutes. Add the cornstarch and mix well. Add the green peppers and cook 10 more minutes. Add the soy sauce and cook until the chicken is heated through. Serve on a bed of rice.
Puree first 3 ingredients. Add cool whipblend well.

Preheat your grill or broiler to high. Grill your rosemary and garlic cloves in the husk and the skin until you smell the rosemary and it is brown around the edges but not blackened. Grill the mozzarella until the outside is golden brown and the inside is just starting to melt. When the mozzarella is cooked place it in a warm place to keep it soft but not melty. Place the rosemary and garlic in the food processor or a blender and blend until smooth. Brush the insides of your buns with the rosemary and garlic butter and place under the broiler to warm until the butter is bubbling. Stack the mozzarella slices and top with slices of tomato. Season with salt and pepper and serve on the warm buns with a salad.

Soak split peas overnight or at least 4 hours in advance. Rinse well, add turmeric powder, onions and garlic clove. Pour water to cover the split peas by about 3 inches. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer until the split peas are soft and sloppy. Melt oil in another saucepan, add cumin seeds and stir for about 30 seconds. Serve split peas over rice or with peasant bread. Sprinkle with the fried cumin seeds and the pepper sauce.
Boil red potatoes and pepper until tender. Combine butter, garlic powder and salt in a bowl. Pour over the hot vegetables and stir to coat well. Serves 4-6.

Cut eggs in half lengthwise and remove yolks to a small bowl. Mash yolks with a fork and add cream cheese and mayonnaise. Mix in mustard and season with pepper and salt to taste. Fill each egg white with the mixture and top with a bit of parsley and a dash of paprika if desired. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Wash the mushrooms well under running water. Remove the stems and chop them up with the garlic until well blended. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Heat the oven proof skillet over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook until browned. Add the chopped mushrooms and garlic and cook until the liquid is evaporated. Add the milk and let it come to a boil. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Remove from the heat and season with salt and pepper. Stuff the mushrooms with the sausage mixture and sprinkle with the chopped green onions. Bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes until hot.

In a medium bowl, crush the candy bars with a rolling pin. In a medium saucepan, combine the chocolate syrup, butter, milk and candy bars. Heat until melted. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs, sugar, vanilla and flour. Add the melted mixture alternately with the buttermilk. Pour into a greased bundt pan. Bake in a moderate oven. For topping: In a small saucepan, combine the remaining chocolate syrup, butter, milk and candy bars. Heat until melted. Pour over cooled cake.

Fry bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside. Add tomatoes and fry until soft. Add monterey jack cheese and stir until cheese is melted. Spread mayonnaise on top half of each piece of bread. Add bacon, tomato mixture, lettuce and cheese. Close sandwiches and serve. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel and slice the root vegetables into large chunks. Toss with a little olive oil and roast for 45-50 minutes or until the vegetables are soft. Remove from the oven and mash together with a potato masher or fork. Add the cheese and butter. Mash together until combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the chives before serving. Serve with a green salad or steamed green beans and a slice of toasted sourdough bread.
Beat eggs with fork until well blended. Add beer, butter and seasonings. Heat until boiling and pour over toast. Serve immediately.

Sift together dry ingredients. Cream together shortening and sugar. Beat in egg. Beat in milk and vanilla. Fold in dry ingredients. Pour into greased 9 x 9 pan and bake at 375 F for 30 to 35 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar or drizzle with icing.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease and line a 10 inch spring form pan. Cream together granulated sugar and margarine. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Beat in flour, ginger and zest. Stir in lime marmalade. Pour into pan. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour or until skewer inserted in center comes out clean. Cool. Spread with lime curd. Sprinkle with sprinkles. Refrigerate. Cut with hot knife. Serve with lime curd.

Steam the potato and sweet potato until soft then mash them together with the curry powder and cumin. Cut up the pumpkin into small pieces and steam until soft then add to the potato mixture and mash everything together. Cook the onions in a pan with the garlic and a little bit of oil until soft then add the stock and bring to the boil. Puree the vegetable mixture and add to the stock. Cook until heated through then season and serve with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease muffin cups with cooking spray. Mix flour with baking powder and salt. Blend in brown sugar and stir in dried cranberries and pecans. Make well in center of mixture. Beat egg and milk with fork until smooth. Add to flour mixturestir just until blended. Fill muffin cups almost to top. Bake for 20 minutes or until tops are golden brown and muffins pass the toothpick test. Cool on wire rack.

Cook water to boil. Add scotch bonnet peppers and bay leaf. Add whole allspice, fresh thyme and salt. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add garlic and green onions. Cook 5 more minutes. Add shrimp. Cook 2 more minutes. Drain and serve over rice.

Sauté butter with celery, onion and red pepper till onion is transparent. Add chopped tomatoes, white wine and flour. Let this simmer until thickened. Add beef stock cube, salt & pepper and parmesan cheese and stir well until all is combined. Serve with toast or bread cubes.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, saute onion in oil until softened. Add garlic, coriander and cuminsaute 30 seconds more. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium, and add avocados and green peppercornscook 2 minutes more. Let cool slightly, then puree in blender until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with cilantro leaves. Makes 4 servings.

Place a wire rack in a rimmed baking sheet. Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. In a large bowl, mix together the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, five-spice powder, vegetable oil, salt and freshly ground black pepper until well combined. Add the chicken wings and turn them until they're coated in the marinade. Add the garlic cloves and stir until combined. Spread the marinated wings out on the wire rack and roast for 15 minutes. Remove the wings from the oven and spoon the sauce over them evenly, then return the pan to the oven. Roast for another 15 minutes, or until the wings are cooked through, golden brown, and crispy on the edges. Serve the wings warm with the sauce spooned over them.
Mix first four ingredients. Add warm water. Knead well. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into desired size. Fry in hot grease.

Mix together salt and pepper and set aside. Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Remove the chicken and set aside. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the pan and add the orange and ginger. Cook for about 30 seconds. Add the orange juice and vinegar and bring to a boil. Add the chicken and stir until the juice is absorbed. Cook for an additional minute.

Preheat the oven to 190C/375F/Gas 5. Place the peaches in a medium-sized saucepan with the lemon zest, juice, vanilla essence and the sugar. Heat the mixture until the sugar has dissolved. Add the macaroons and stir until the macaroons have all soaked up the juices. Put the macaroons into a shallow ovenproof dish. Cover with the peaches. Dot with the mint leaf. In a large bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff but not dry. Spread over the fruit and bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden.
Pour a shot of Baileys in an 12oz cup of freshly brewed coffee. Top off with some whipped cream and a cherry.
Mix tomatoes, basil and garlic in small bowl. Toss together in large serving bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Top with parmesan cheese.

Combine butter and garlic over medium heat until butter melts. Add the vinegar and cook until liquid evaporates. Remove from heat. Add the pectin and sugar, stirring until completely dissolved. Pour into sterilized canning jars and seal.

Remove seeds from green chilies. Place cream cheese in a small bowl. Mix in salsa verde. Spread mixture in the green chilies. Lay steak in the center of each chile. Roll each chile around the steak. Place in a greased casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes.

Spread a few tablespoons of beans in the bottom of a 9-by-13-inch pan. Top with a few tablespoons of salsa. Spread a few tablespoons of guacamole over the top of the salsa. Spread a few tablespoons of the sour cream over the top of the guacamole. Sprinkle a few tablespoons of the shredded cheese over the top of the sour cream. Sprinkle a few tablespoons of the diced tomatoes over the top of the cheese. Sprinkle a few tablespoons of the black olives over the top of the tomatoes. Sprinkle a few tablespoons of the green onion tops over the top of the olives. Serve with tortilla chips.

Soak peas in water overnight. Drain peas. Combine peas, onion and garlic in a large pot with water to cover. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer until peas are soft and water is evaporated. Add salt and pepper. Purée. Place in a serving dish. Top with oregano. Serve with biscuit.

Combine half-and-half and water in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in cornmeal and salt. Stirring constantly cook until mixture comes to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in butter and parmesan until melted. Serve with freshly ground black pepper.

Mix cream cheese, italian seasoning and mozzarella cheese in small bowl until well blended. Spread evenly in 13x9 inch pan. Top with pizza sauce. Sprinkle with remaining cheeses and vegetables. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Peel and pit nectarines. Cut crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Combine marmalade and margerine in small bowlmicrowave on HIGH for 30 to 60 seconds or until marmalade is softened and mixture can be stirred smoothly with a spoon. Combine marmalade mixture and marmalade-margarine mixture. Arrange nectarines on platter. Spoon marmalade mixture evenly over nectarineslet stand for about 5 minutes or until nectarines are coated with marmalade mixture. Spoon chocolate fudge topping over nectarinesserve immediately. Yield: 6 servings.

Combine first six ingredients. Cut scallops into 1/2-inch slices. Combine scallops with remaining ingredients and toss to coat. Heat 1 Tablespoon oil over medium-high heat. Cook 3 minutes. Turn scallops overcook another 3 minutes. Transfer to plate. Discard any remaining liquid. Reheat 1 Tablespoon oil over medium-high heat. Add parsley, cook until wilted. Serve with scallops.

In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the rice and stir to coat with the oil. Add the vermicelli and continue stirring until the rice is golden in color, about 3 minutes. Add the hot broth and stir to combine. Add the salt and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the rice is tender and the broth is absorbed. Serve.
