Whisk together the soy sauce, vinegar, peanut butter, hot water and sesame oil. Put the broccoli florets into a large skillet with the oil. Sear until the broccoli is crisp-tender. Add the tofu. Add the soy-peanut butter mixture. Heat until hot. Garnish with the chopped cilantro or parsley.
Prepare tea as directed on the package. Sweeten to taste if desired. Add fruit juice and icepour over tea to serve. Garnish, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium high heat, cook onion for 3 minutes. Add garlic and swiss chard. Saute until tender. Add basil, salt & pepper. In a separate bowl beat the eggs with water. Add the chard mixture and stir well. Pour mixture into a greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until firm.

In a large saucepan bring broth to a boil. Add kale and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat heat the olive oil until hot but not smoking. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook until fragrant but not brown, about one minute. Add cannellini beans and cook for another minute or two until heated through. Add cooked kale and stir to combine. Toss with cooked pasta, season with salt and serve with parmesan cheese if desired.
Wash berries and remove stems. Combine berries with the sugar and 1 cup of water. Place over medium heat. Cook until berries are tender. Add more water if needed. Add salt. Serve warm.

Thaw rolls as directed. Spread each roll with 1 tbsp butter. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley. Roll up as directed. Place in greased 8x8x2 pan. Sprinkle with more cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 18-20 minutes until golden brown. Makes 12 rolls.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 13×9 inch pan. In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and butter until well combined. Beat in the eggs and vanilla extract until smooth. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet and mix well. Spread into the prepared pan and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. While the brownies are baking, melt the vanilla chips and macadamia nuts in a double boiler or in the microwave until melted and combined. Remove the brownies from the oven and pour the vanilla chip mixture over the top. Spread evenly and return the pan to the oven for another 10 minutes or until the top is set. Cool in the pan before slicing and serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.In a small bowl combine hoisin sauce, orange juice, light soy sauce, olive oil. Brush beans with hoisin sauce mixture. Roast 20 minutes. In the last 5 minutes of cooking sprinkle with sesame seeds.Serve immediately.

Mix tuna with coleslaw dressing. Add onion, salt and pepper to taste. Fill a small ziplock baggie. Put a piece of tuna mixture at one end of the nori sheet. Roll up the sheet to enclose the filling. Continue until mixture is gone. Seal ends with water. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a large bowl dissolve gelatin in the hot water. Add yogurt and beat at medium speed until blended. Spread over crust. Arrange peaches in rows on top of yogurt layer. Garnish with jam. Chill for several hours. Top with frozen whipped topping.

Cream together the cream cheese and sour cream. Stir in the yogurt until well combined. Add the dill and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the cucumbers. Garnish with the green onion. Chill for up to 2 hours. Serve with your favorite crackers.

In a large pan combine 3 cups of water with 3 tea bags (or use 3 tea bags for each cup of water) and 2 cups of juice. Heat for 5 minutes and remove tea bags (if using). Add 3 cups of sugar, bring to a rolling boil and then add 1 package of liquid fruit pectin. Boil for 1 minute and remove from heat. Quickly pour into sterilized canning jars and place in a water bath canner (or use the stove top method). Let stand until cooled.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add onions and cook until soft and lightly caramelized, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool 10 minutes. Peel eggs, discarding shells. Chop white and yolk separately. Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl. Add cooled onions to bowl and mix until well combined. Chill at least 30 minutes before serving. Serve chilled or at room temperature with crackers or bread slices. Makes 4 cups.

Grate the zucchini and squeeze out the liquid using a clean dish cloth or paper towel. Blend together the zucchini, sugar substitute, oil, and vanilla in a large bowl using a mixer on medium speed until smooth and creamy. Stir in the flours, baking soda and powder, and salt with a wooden spoon or spatula until combined. Stir in the cocoa and nuts by hand. Spread in a greased 10-inch square baking pan. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes or until set. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Cut into 16 bars and serve at room temperature or refrigerate and serve cold.
drain tuna, add all other ingredients in a mixing bowl and mix well.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the sherry, ginger and garlic cloves. Cook until ginger is tender. Add the dry crushed red pepper and the brothcook until mixture is reduced by half. Stir in the cornstarch until smooth. Cook and stir until thickened. Add the soy sauce and chili-garlic sauce. Stir until heated through. Serve over cooked noodles.

In a small saucepan over low heat, melt margarine. Add chili powder, garlic salt, and onion powder. Stir to mix well. In a large bowl, pour margarine mixture over popped popcorn. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and toss to coat well.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Peel and trim beets. Cut into 1/2 inch slices. Toss with water in a casserole dish. Cover and bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until tender. Stir occasionally. Mince garlic. Heat oil in skillet. Add garlic. Stir 1 minute or until garlic is golden. Add spinach. Stir until wilted. Remove from heat. Combine spinach mixture with beets. Serve on bed of spinach. Sprinkle with balsamic vinegar. Top with goat cheese. Garnish with basil.

Cook chicken in skillet with olive oil over medium heat until tender. Remove chicken. Saute onion & garlic in same skillet until tender. Stir in chicken broth & milk. Heat until bubbly. Add chicken back into sauce. Add cheese & sour cream. Heat until cheese is melted. Serve with hashbrowns.

Cook grits according to package directions using water. When cooked add shredded Velveeta and grits spread. Stir until melted. Stir in garlic spread and shrimp. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients and mix well. Transfer to baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees until brown and bubbly.

In heavy bottomed saucepan, combine all ingredients except nuts. Bring to a boil over medium heat and boil hard for 1 minute. Add nuts and boil for 1 minute more, stirring constantly to avoid burning. Remove from heat and quickly pour onto buttered cookie sheet to cool. Cut into squares with knife dipped in hot water or use scissors to cut. Store in tightly covered container.

In a bowl, combine rice vinegar, sugar, salt and chile, then stir in shallotset aside. Cut off both ends of each cucumber, then slice it lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices. Add to bowl with shallot mixturetoss to coat evenly. Serve immediately topped with chopped cilantro leaves.
Melt butter in skillet. Add onion and brown until tender. Add broccoli and brown. Add remaining ingredients and cook until heated through.

In a large saucepan or pot heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened about 3 minutes. Stir in the rice. Cook for a couple minutes. Stir in the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Cover. Simmer until the rice is tender about 35 minutes. Stir in the broccoli. Cover. Simmer until the broccoli is tender about 5 minutes more. Remove from the heat. Stir in the butter and the cheese. Serve.

Rinse and soak the barley in cold water for about 4 hours. Drain well. In a large pot bring the broth to a boil. Add the barley and cook on low for 1 hour. Drain the barley. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a large bowl. Add the cooked barley. Toss well. Serve right away or refrigerate up to 2 days.

Rinse the rice until the water runs clear. Add the rice and the water to a pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce to a simmer and cover the pot. Cook for 30 minutes or until the rice is tender and most of the liquid has been absorbed. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool slightly. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the ginger and stir-fry until softened and aromatic. Add the mince and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until browned. Add the oyster sauce and the chilli-garlic sauce and stir to combine. Turn up the heat and add the shallots and stir-fry for 1 minute or until the shallots have softened and turned golden. Return the cooked rice to the pot and add the mince mixture and the sauce to the rice and stir to combine. Add the cornflour mixture and the oyster sauce to a small bowl and mix well to combine. Pour the sauce mixture over the top of the rice and mix well to combine. Heat over medium heat until the sauce has thickened slightly and

In a small bowl whisk together egg and mustard. Dip each side of each lamb chop in egg mixture, then in bread crumbs and sesame seeds to coat both sides. In a skillet over medium heat melt 1 tbsp of butter and saute chops until well browned (about 2 to 3 minutes per side). Transfer to a plate. Add a tbsp of butter to pan and saute vegetables until tender (about 5 minutes), then pour over chops. Add the remaining butter and 2 tablespoons of water to pan and bring to a boil for 1 minute. Whisk together until butter is well blended and sauce is thickened. Pour over chops and serve.

In large bowl, combine milk, vanilla, brown sugar, eggs. In medium bowl, combine bread cubes and apple. Pour milk mixture over bread mixture. Toss gently. Pour into well-greased shallow baking dish. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until firm. Serve warm.

In 12x9x2 pan, layer pasta sauce. Top with pasta. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. In pan, mix together sausages, water, peppers, onion & garlic powder. Spoon over top of pasta. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake 15 minutes more.

Saute chicken with butter in a skillet until cooked. Sprinkle with the breadcrumbs. Add the Parmegiano-Reggiano. Continue to saute until browned. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with chopped parsley. Serve at once. Serves 4.

Combine the granulated sugar and 2 tablespoons water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Let the caramelized mixture boil until thickened and the liquid has evaporated, about 2 minutes. Whisk together the soy sauce and orange juice in a small bowl and set aside. Remove the ginger, peppercorns, and cilantro from the hot oil and set aside. Season the fish on both sides with 1/4 teaspoon pepper and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Pour the caramelized glaze over the fish and let stand until ready to cook. Heat the oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until very hot, about 4 minutes. Add the fish in a single layer and sear until browned on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes per side for medium rare. Sprinkle with the ginger, peppercorns, and cilantro and drizzle with the soy glaze. Serve immediately.

Combine breadcrumbs, dijon, salt and pepper. Dredge pork chops in mixture. Heat 2 tablespoons butter in skillet. Add pork chops. Brown on one side. Turn. Add 2 tablespoons butter. Add lemon juice. Cook for 1 minute longer. Sprinkle with capers. Serve.
In a jar with a lid combine the mustard and red wine vinegar. Cover and shake well to mix. Add the olive oil and shake to mix. Add the tomatoes, scallions, capers, parsley and dill. Cover and shake.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain and crumble. Cut up the red onions into small pieces. Cut up the green bell peppers into small pieces. Drain the pork n beans. Cook the red onions and the green bell peppers in the bacon grease until tender. Add the bacon. Add the yellow mustard. Add the light brown sugar. Add the chili sauce. Add the barbecue sauce. Add the spicy barbecue sauce. Add the cajun seasoning. Mix together. Bake at 350 for one hour. Serve hot.
In a large skillet, heat the oil. Add the onion and saute until softened. Add the mixed greens. Stir in the salt. Remove from heat. Add the penne. Toss together. Top with the feta.
In a small saucepan combine all ingredients and bring to a boil. Lower heat to simmer for about 10 minutes, or until cranberries pop. Turn off heat and let cool. Cover and refrigerate. Serve chilled.

Place a handful of basil leaves in the bottom of a large serving platter. Place the garlic in a mortar or a food processor. Add the olive oil. Process or crush the mixture into a paste. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Lay the grape tomatoes evenly over the basil. Scatter the chives over the top of the tomatoes. Top with the garlic-oil mixture. Garnish with the remaining basil.
Dissolve cornstarch in cold water in a medium bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients. Heat in a small saucepan on medium heat until mixture thickens and bubbles form. Cool completely. Serve.

Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and red chilies and saute till the onion is soft. Add the chicken and saute until brown. Add the basil and water. Bring to boil. Lower the heat and simmer until the liquid is almost evaporated. Add the sugar and stir to dissolve. Stir in the coconut milk and the cilantro roots. Stir and cook until the sauce thickens. Serve with cilantro sprigs.

Prepare pie shells according to package directions. In a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs. Stir in the half-and-half and salt and pepper. Fold in the ham. Spread the mixture into the prepared pie shells. Sprinkle the mozzarella and cheddar over the top of each. Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 to 20 minutes, or until set. Serve warm.
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Place in a small bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use. Shake before using.

Place pheasants in a large stockpot with the water. Salt to taste. Bring to boil and skim foam. Add the onion, celery, carrots and mushroom. Bring to boil and cook for 30 minutes. Add the low sodium chicken broth and cook for another 10 minutes. Add the egg noodles and cook for another 5 minutes or until noodles are done to your liking. Remove the pheasant and serve with the broth and the vegetable mixture.
Peel and dice potatoes. Add garlic powder, salt, pepper. Add cider vinegar. Let set until warm. Add red onions. Add oil. Add dill weed. Mix well.

Combine dry ingredients. Add liquid ingredients and oil. Knead lightly for about 5 minutes. Let rise for about 1 1/2 hours or until doubled in size. Roll out to desired thickness and length. Bake in a 400 degree preheated oven for about 15 minutes, until golden brown. Makes 8 large rolls or 16 small rolls.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a 1-quart microwavable casserole dish combine sugar snap peas and 2 Tbsp water. Cover dish with plastic wrap. Cook on high until tender crisp. Uncover. Cook 2-3 minutes longer. In a small skillet heat 1 Tbsp butter and 1 minced garlic over medium heat until melted. Stir in sugar snap peas and lemon juice. Cook 1-2 minutes or until heated through. Season to taste with lemon zest and salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Rub a whole chicken inside and out with 1 tablespoon seasoning salt. Place in roasting pan breast side up. Baste with barbecue sauce. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Sprinkle with remaining tablespoon seasoning salt. Sprinkle with pepper to taste. Cook for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes, basting every 15 minutes with barbecue sauce. Serve with leftover barbecue sauce.

In a saucepan, melt butter. Saut onion in butter until soft. Stir in flour and cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Gradually stir in stock. Stir in beef. Cook until meat is tender. Stir in bread. Add cheese and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 160 degrees celsius. Grease baking tray. Cream together butter, sugar and condensed milk until light and creamy. Fold in sifted self raising flour and dark chocolate chips. Place teaspoons on baking tray and bake for 10 - 12 minutes or until golden brown and firm. Remove and allow to cool before storing in an airtight container.
Mix together in a large bowl all of the above ingredients except the hard boiled eggs. Refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, add the eggs and mix well. Toss in the peas just before serving.

Cut the pork into 1/2-inch thick slices. Put the flour in a bowl. In another bowl, combine the butter, broth, ginger, Dijon mustard, grainy mustard, and scallions. Dip each slice of meat into the flour mixture to coat evenly. Then dip into the broth mixture to coat evenly. Heat the butter and oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the slices of meat in batches, turning once, until browned on both sides. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except pecans and morsels. Drop by tablespoons on a ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Melt semisweet chocolate morsels. Stir in pecans. Drop by teaspoons on top of each cookie. Cool.

In large microwave bowl combine chocolate pudding mix, evaporated milk and sugar. Beat at high speed for 2 minutes or until well mixed and thick. Add melted butter and beat at low speed until well blended. Stir in nuts. Spread in greased 9 inch square baking dish. Refrigerate for several hours or until firm. Cut into squares and serve with whipped cream if desired.

Saute onion and garlic until soft and translucent. Stir in white beans. Cook for about 1 minute. Add tomato sauce and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Add pasta. Cook for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Serve with a dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Rub chicken with cooking sherry and balsamic dressing. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Heat grill to medium heat. Grill chicken tenders for 3-4 minutes per side until cooked through. Remove from grill and brush with remaining balsamic dressing. Garnish with italian parsley and sliced red onion. Serve with baguette slices for dipping.
Spread tortillas with cream cheese. Add green onions and garlic and sprinkle with seasoning salt. Roll up and refrigerate. Cut each roll into 1/2 inch pieces and serve with salsa.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook sausage until browned. Add the vegetables and cook until crisp-tender. Add the pasta sauce and stock cube. Bring to a boil. Simmer about 5 minutes. Stir in mozzarella cheese. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with fresh herb. Serve immediately.

Peel baking potato and cube. Saut onion in skillet with a little butter or olive oil, stirring often. Add cubed potato and enough water to cover. Boil 10-15 minutes or until tender. Add cream of potato soup. Add cream of tomato soup. Heat until warm. Stir in curry powder and salt. Serve with grated cheese on top and a small pat of butter or olive oil. Yummy!

In a large bowl, stir together first 5 ingredients. In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, heat butter, corn syrup and brown sugar until butter is melted. Remove from heatstir in vanilla. Pour over cereal mixturestir until well coated. Spread onto waxed paper-lined baking sheet. Cool completely. Break into pieces. Store in an airtight container.
In a medium saucepan, saute green onion and mushrooms in butter till tender. Stir in rice and broccoli. Add hollandaise sauce mixstir in water. Heat till bubbly. Add chicken and heat through.

In a 2-quart saucepan, combine the orange juice and curry powder and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Add the mandarin oranges and carrotcook for 5 minutes or until the carrot is tender-crisp. Serve immediately or cool and refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 1 day. Garnish each serving with 1/4 cup grapes and 1 teaspoon lemon juice just before serving. Yield: 4 servings.

Boil new potatoes until tender. Drain. Toss with fat free ranch dressing, lime juice, jalapeno peppers and lime zest. Add jicama, avocados, tomatoes and cilantro. Toss well. Garnish with green onions.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, green pepper and garlic and cook about 3 minutes. Add eggs and cook 3 minutes. Stir in cheese until melted. Add giardiniera and cook about 2 minutes. Spoon into hoagie rolls and top with tomatoes. Serve immediately.
Beat the margarine, sugar, vanilla and liquid together. Add the dry ingredients to the mixture. Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper. Bake at 375 until lightly browned.

In a 12 inch skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add pepper and mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside. In a large bowl, combine salt and pepper. Add 1/2 cup of water to mixture and stir until smooth. Add steaks and coat with mixture. Return to skillet and heat over medium high heat for 3 minutes on each side or until cooked to desired degree of doneness. Remove and place in a warm place while you prepare teriyaki baste and glaze. In a small bowl, combine all baste and glaze ingredients. Brush glaze over meat and allow to rest for about 3 minutes before serving.

Heat the oven to 400f. Brown the sausages in olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat until just done, about 10 minutes for each kind. Remove from heat, cut open and remove the casing. Cut the bell peppers into strips, then cut the strips in half crosswise. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in another large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, stirring frequently until golden but not brown, about 1 minute. Add the pepper strips and onion slices, stirring constantly until all are browned. Add the cooked sausages, stirring until thoroughly heated. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into a 2 quart casserole dish. Bake until bubbly and browned at the edges, 20 to 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large bowl cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla extract and mashed bananas until well blended. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in cinnamon. In another bowl combine flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Gradually add the dry mixture into the batter until well mixed. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and stir in granola cereal. Let cool on cookie sheets for one minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Heat the oil in a large pan and saute the shallots and garlic. Stir in the stock and bring to a simmer. Add the peanuts and cook for another minute or so. Whisk in the soy sauce and molasses. Bring to a boil and simmer for a few minutes. Stir in the lime juice and ginger. Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

In a large bowl, combine the baby spinach, apples, and onions. Add the dressing and toss well. Let stand 5 minutes. Add the jalapeño pepper and cilantro just before serving. Makes 6 servings. Per serving (excluding unknown items): 57 calories, 5 g fat (1 g saturated fat), 2 mg cholesterol, 12 g carbohydrate, 3 g protein, 1 g dietary fiber, 217 mg sodium. Calories from fat 33%.

Preheat broiler. Sprinkle both sides of steak evenly with salt and pepper. Brown steaks in hot oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Transfer to plate. Pour off fat from skillet. Add crushed tomatoes, potatoes, onion, and green pepper. Cover and cook until potatoes are tender crisp. Remove from heat. Top potatoes with steak. Sprinkle with basil and red pepper. Broil 1 minute on each side until cheese is melted.

Wash, dry, and devein the peppers. Slice peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds and membranes. Place pepper halves in a small saucepan. Add the water. Cover. Bring to a boil and cook for about five minutes or until the peppers are soft. Drain the peppers. Combine the cooked chicken and cream cheese in a medium bowl. Season the mixture with salt & pepper to taste. Divide the mixture evenly among the pepper halves. Place a cherry tomato in the center of each pepper half. Sprinkle the pecans over the top. Bake the poppers at 350 degrees for about ten minutes or until the peppers are crisp-tender. Serve warm or cold.
Cube cream cheese into 36 pieces. Place on serving tray. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour dressing over cheese and toss lightly. Refrigerate at least 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees. Cut each breast half into 3-4 strips about 3/4-inch wide. In a large mixing bowl, combine mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Add breadcrumbs and stir until well coated. Dip each strip into mixture then place in shallow baking dish. Bake 1 hour or until no longer pink in center. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.

Chop the shallot and garlic clove fine and place them in the mixing bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Beat the cottage cheese and cream cheese with the shallot and garlic to a smooth paste. Heat the butter over medium heat and add the camembert and paprika stirring to melt the camembert completely and combine with the butter. Stir the seasoning salt and pepper into the camembert and butter and remove from the heat. Beat the mixture into the cottage cheese and cream cheese and combine thoroughly with an electric hand mixer. Serve as a spread or dip with crackers or crudites.

Place fish in a shallow baking dish. Add bay leaf and butter. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Remove from oven. Add scallions, mushrooms and beef stock. Sprinkle with worcestershire sauce. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a sheet pan with foil spray pan with non-stick cooking spray. In a large bowl toss together the chicken wings, lemon juice, garlic salt and kosher salt until well coated. Sprinkle with dried thyme, cayenne pepper and black pepper. Spread the wings on the pan in a single layer. Roast in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the wings are cooked through and no pink remains when the juices are checked with a fork. Serve warm with extra lemon wedges on the side for dipping.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 13 x 9 inch glass or ceramic baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the asparagus, scallions, cheese, and eggsmix well. Pour into prepared dish. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the eggs are cooked through. Top with sour cream. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Add mashed potatoes. Add nuts. Add vanilla. Sift together dry ingredients. Add to potato mixture. Add milk. Spread batter in greased pan. Bake 50 minutes.

In a small saucepan combine the sugar, cornstarch and water. Stir and cook until thick and bubbly. Add the cherries and cook for 2 more minutes. Spread in unbaked 9 inch pie shell. Cut butter into flour until it looks like a course meal. Mix in brown sugar and oats. Sprinkle over the top. Bake at 350 for 50 minutes or until golden.

Heat the oil in a large pan and add the garlic cloves and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant and then add the brussels sprout and cook for 3 minutes. Season to taste with the salt and lemon zest and serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine the garlic, salt and cayenne. Add the paprika. Set aside. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat. Thread 6-8 large raw shrimp onto each of 4 skewers. Brush with olive oil. Sprinkle with the paprika mixture. Grill the shrimp for 3 minutes. Turn and brush with more olive oil. Grill for another 3 minutes. Brush with lemon juice and sprinkle with more paprika. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Sift the ground almonds and cocoa together. Peel the banana and orange and blend together with the cocoa mixture. Add the orange juice and rind and blend until smooth. Divide into small balls and roll in the blanched almonds. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove wings from package, rinse off skin. Place wings in a shallow baking dish. Combine the remaining ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Pour mixture over the chicken wings. Cover and bake for 1 hour, turning once halfway through cooking time. Makes 4 servings.

Cook potatoes in boiling water for 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drainplace in a bowladd the remaining ingredientstoss to coatspread in a greased 13 inch x 9 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until potatoes are heated through and lightly browned on top. Serve with additional crushed red pepper flakes if desired.

Place 4 graham cracker halves in an ungreased shallow dish. Broil 10 in. From the heating element 5-8 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Place 1/4 cup miniature marshmallow halves over each cracker square. Broil 1-2 minutes or until marshmallows are puffed and lightly browned. Remove from oven. Place 1 square of semi-sweet chocolate on each cracker half. Arrange 3 raspberries on each chocolate covered cracker half. Chill 15 minutes before serving.

In a small saucepan over low heat, melt butter. Add garlic cloves and saute until tender. Add the raw shrimp and cook until just opaque. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 1 minute. Serve hot. Serves 2.
In the jar of a blender, combine the banana, orange juice, nectarine and milk. Blend on high speed or ice crush setting for 40 seconds or until smooth. Pour into a glass. Serve immediately.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook for 5 minutes on each side until browned. Remove the breasts from the pan and set aside. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil and the ginger and garlic to the pan. Saute for 1 minute. Add the onions and saute for 5 minutes. Add the red pepper and saute for 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth and coconut milk and stir to combine. Add the coconut milk and stir to combine. Return the chicken to the pan. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve garnished with the coriander.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 13x9x2 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In large skillet brown beef and onion over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in taco seasoning and watermix well. Add beans and mix well. Remove from heat. In small bowl mix soup and ranch dressing. Spread half of beef mixture in baking dish. Top with ranch mixturespread remaining beef mixture over top. Sprinkle with cheesebake uncovered 20 minutes or until bubbly and heated through. Remove from ovensprinkle with crushed doritos and bake 10 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve with lettuce and tomato slices if desired.

Sift flour, rolled oats, wheat flour, wheat germ, sugar, salt, baking powder in a large bowl. Combine eggs, milk and oil in small bowl. Stir into flour mixture. Stir in pecans. Cook on hot waffle iron. Yields 6 waffles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare brownie mix as directed on box. Bake for 20 minutes. Let cool. Spread with sweetened condensed milk. Top with coconut and sprinkle with butterscotch chips. Add chocolate chips and nuts. Spread over top. Bake for 20 minutes longer. Cool and cut into bars.

Heat 1/2 inch of vegetable oil in a frying pan and fry onions till soft. Add aubergines and fry for 10 minutes. Add chilis, tomatoes and garlic. Simmer until the mixture has become thick. Add cheese and tabasco. Remove from the heat. Place pita bread on the table and allow everyone to fill their own.
Peeled radishes and carrot are julienned or grated. Sugar, vinegar and salt are added to taste. Serve cold.

Place water in bread pan. Add olive oil. Measure flour. Add salt. Measure and add yeast. Measure and add dill. Measure and add garlic. Measure and add milk. Measure and add cornmeal. Select dough cycle. Begin mixing. Remove dough to a greased surface. Knead 3 to 5 minutes. Divide in half and shape into two 10-inch ropes. Place 1 rope on each end of a greased baking sheet. Brush with butter. Sprinkle with dill. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes. Turn breadsticks. Bake 5 to 10 minutes. Sprinkle with dill. Cool on wire racks. Makes 2 loaves.

Cream together butter, brown sugar, and egg. Stir in vanilla, orange zest, and juice. Mix in buttermilk baking mix. Stir in walnuts and chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 9 to 11 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine shrimp with seasonings & toss gently. Spread evenly in one layer onto baking sheet. Roast until cooked through. Remove from oven & allow to cool slightly. Combine egg white with 2 tsp of water and beat with fork until fluffy. Brush bread slices with olive oil and sprinkle with seasonings. Top each slice with a layer of shrimp. Sprinkle with green onions & plum tomatoes. Top with brushed bread and sprinkle with cheese. Place in oven and broil until toasted. Serve warm.

In a large skillet, brown meat, onion and garlic powder until meat is cooked through. Drain fat from meat mixture. In a medium pot, combine broth, milk, salt and pepper and evaporated milk. Cook on low for 1 hour or until thickened. Add cooked meat mixture, onion powder, worcestershire sauce, and cook for 20 more minutes. Serve over toast or biscuit.
Melt butter over medium-low heat. Whisk in cream and lemon juice and bring to a gentle boil. Remove from heat. Whisk in shallot and wasabi paste. Let cool to room temperature. Whisk in tamari.

Combine the first four ingredients in a large bowl and whisk until smooth. Stir in the sour cream and mix well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours or until ready to serve. Stir well before serving. Serves 12-15.

Clean mussels by rinsing them under cold water. Scrub beards off of them. Place them into a large cooking pan. Add lime juice. Add white wine and bring to a boil. Add Thai red curry paste. Add garlic. Add fish sauce. Add white sugar. Add cilantro. Cover and cook until done. Serve with crusty bread.
Wash and hull papaya. Slice papaya in half and remove seeds. Blend papaya with strawberries. Mix in yogurt and milk and honey to taste. Serve immediately. Garnish with mint if desired.

Mix 1 cup of boiling water with 1/2 cup of sugar and 1 packet of instant espresso in a bowl. Let the mixture sit for 2 minutes. Beat 1/4 cup of cold water into the espresso mixture. Stir in 3/4 cup of cold water. Beat in 1/2 cup of heavy cream and 1/2 cup of milk and pour into an ice cream maker. Beat in 1 teaspoon of rum and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Let churn in the maker for 15-20 minutes, or until thick and frozen. Remove the ice cream from the maker and freeze until firm. Sprinkle with walnut halves and serve immediately or transfer to an air-tight container and freeze until needed.

In a small saucepan, combine sour cherries, water& cinnamon stick. Bring to a boil& simmer for 15 minutes or until cherries are tender. Add cornstarch& sugar, stirring until mixture thickens. Add brandy& simmer for 1 minute. Stir in lemon juice & cool to room temperature before serving. Serve warm or cold over icecream or pound cake.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Rinse catfish and pat dry. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice and olive oil. Season with Cajun seasoning and thyme. Arrange fillets in a 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking dish and brush each with the oil mixture. Sprinkle the pecans and Parmesan over the top of the fillets. In a large bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and parsley. Pour the oil mixture over the crumbs. Mix well. Spoon the crumb mixture over the fillets and bake for 25 minutes or until the topping is golden brown. Serve with your favorite vegetables or over a bed of rice.

Peel, core and slice the apples and place them evenly in a square baking dish. Sprinkle the brown sugar, oatmeal and spices on top. Melt the butter and pour it over the top. Bake at 375 degrees F for 45 minutes or until the top is brown and the apples are tender. Serve warm.

Bring a pot of water to a boil and add spaghetti. Cook until al dente (according to package instructions). Drain and set aside. In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil. Add the sesame seeds and stir-fry until they turn golden. Set aside. In another pan, add the remaining oil and heat. Add the garlic and saut for about 1 minute. Add the soy sauce and sugar and let it boil. Add the water and spaghetti. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add the sesame seeds and stir-fry until the spaghetti is coated with the soy sauce. Serve garnished with the green onion.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix stuffing mix with water and butter until well blended and set aside. Cut the top off the bread and hollow it out to form a pocket and then stuff with turkey and gravy, then put the top back on the bread and press together to seal it. Bake for 15 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute onion in oil until tender. Add garlic and saute for 30 seconds more. Stir in Worcestershire Sauce and cook for about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Form into 6 burger patties (about 4 ounces each) and place in skillet over low heat. Cover with lid or foil for about 10 minutes or until cooked through. Cook remaining patties in same manner. To assemble burgers, place cooked patties on toasted buns. Top each burger with 1 tablespoon melted Gouda Cheese.

Cut the cauliflower into florets. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the cauliflower and cook until it begins to brown. Add the tomatoes, garlic clove, and salt. Let it come to a boil. Cover with a lid. Reduce the heat to low. Let it simmer for about 20 minutes. Serve.

Mash the cream cheese with a fork in a medium bowl until smooth. Add the smoked whitefish, roasted garlic cloves and a squeeze of lemon juice. Mix gently with a fork until incorporated. Stir in the smoked paprika, to taste. Serve with your favorite crackers or veggies for a quick, tasty appetizer.

Cook pasta according to directions. Drain and set aside. Meanwhile heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add zucchini slices. Cook for 2 minutes. Add broth, tomatoes and meatballs. Cook until the liquid has evaporated. Sprinkle the pasta mixture over the vegetables. Stir to combine. Sprinkle cheese over the top. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes. Serve.

Cook the noodles according to the package directions. In a wok over high heat, combine the vinegar, sugar and cornstarch. Stir and bring to a boil. Add the scallions and ginger and stir for one minute. Add the bok choy and cook until bright green and tender. Add the honey and stir for one minute more. Remove from heat and add the noodles. Toss until coated with sauce and serve.
Bring sugar and syrup to a full boil. Remove from heat, mix in peanut butter& pour over cereal. Press into buttered pan. Melt chocolate& butterscotch chips& spread for frosting. Chill.

In a bowl, combine kiwi fruits, cottage cheese, peanut butter, vanilla extract and ground cinnamon. Spread about 2 tbsp mixture on each tortilla. Roll up tortillas burrito-style. Cut each wrap into 2 or 3 pieces if serving as an appetizer. Serve with additional reduced-calorie peanut butter for dipping if desired.

Grill chicken and sausage. Cool. Dice. Cook pasta according to package directions. In a large skillet cook onions and green bell pepper in olive oil until tender. Add chicken and sausage. Stir until combined. Add mushrooms. Cook and stir until heated through. Stir in pasta. Season to taste.

Cook the cauliflower in boiling water for 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain, rinse with cold water, drain again and pat dry with paper towels. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heatadd cauliflower and red pepper flakes, stirring occasionally until tender. Remove from heat. Top with cheese and serve.

Toss walnuts with honey and cooking spray. Spread evenly on a baking sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 5 minutes. Stir. Bake 5 minutes more. Stir. Bake until toasted and golden, about 5 minutes more. Spread walnuts on paper towels to cool. Cut off tough bottoms and core ends of endive. Arrange endive on a serving platter. Spread 1 tablespoon goat cheese on each endive. Top with a few orange sections and a few walnuts. Sprinkle with chives and pepper. Serve.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and saute till soft. Add flourstir till blended. Add fat-free half-and-half. Cook, stirring constantly, till thickened and smooth. Add garliccook 1 minute more. Stir in sour cream, cheese and seasoning. Simmer 5 minutes longer or till sauce thickens. Serve over favorite pasta or spaghetti squash.

In a large bowl whisk together milk and eggs. Add the lemon and rosemary and mix thoroughly. Put the cornmeal in a shallow dish and season with the garlic and a little salt. Coat the fish fillets in the cornmeal. Heat the olive oil in a pan and fry the fillets for 2 minutes on each side. Remove the fish from the pan and drain on paper towels. Serve with the lemon slice on the side.

In large bowl or Ziploc bag combine dry red wine, extra virgin olive oil, chopped garlic and bay leaves. Marinate new york strip steaks, 1 to 1 1/2 inches thick, at least 2 hours but no more than 24 hours. Remove from marinade and discard liquid. Preheat broiler. Season with fresh ground pepper and place steaks on rack set on rimmed baking sheet. Broil 4 to 5 inches from heat until desired doneness. Serve immediately.
In a large bowl combine coleslaw mix and onions. Mix mayonnaise, mustard, sugar and vinegar in a bowl. Stir in dressing mixture and mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
Beat together eggs, sugar, and margarine. Add vanilla. Sift dry ingredients together and add to mixer. Stir. Roll into balls. Put on greased cookie sheet. Bake 15 minutes at 375 degrees.
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Simmer over low heat until the fruits are soft and the chutney is thick. Remove from heat and let cool. Spoon into jars and seal.

Cook hominy in a large pot of boiling water until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Drain and set aside. Saute onions in a skillet until tender. Add remaining ingrediants and cook for about 5 minutes. Stir in cooked pork and chicken. Add hominy to soup. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with cilantro. Makes about 8 servings. Serve with warm flour tortillas.

Combine cream of chicken soup, coarse grain mustard, and honey in a saucepan. Heat until blended. Add oil and whisk to blend. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Place the chicken breast fillets in a lightly greased 8 inch square baking dish. Pour the sauce over the top. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree f oven for 30 to 35 minutes. Garnish with chives. Serve with rice.
Combine all ingredients in saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 5 minutes. Allow to cool to room temperature. Store in an air tight container.

In a saucepan over medium-high heat, add the butter. When the butter is melted, add the leeks and saut until tender. Add the cabbage and carrots. Saute for 3 minutes. Add the brown sugar and apple cider vinegar. Cook for another minute. Remove from the heat and stir in the spicy brown mustard, caraway seeds, salt and pepper. Serve warm or cold.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and pepper. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Add garlic powder and cook for 1 minute. Add chili sauce, soy sauce, pineapple and cornstarch. Cook for 1 minute. Add shrimp. Cook until no longer pink. Serve over rice.

Mix water and cabbage in a large bowl until it is well blended. Add the beaten egg, salt and pepper and let sit for 10 minutes. Preheat pan over medium heat and add 1/4 cup of all-purpose flour to the pan. Slowly add water until it reaches pancake batter consistency. Take 1/4 of the batter and pour into pan. Add 1/4 of the cabbage mixture and 1/4 of the ham and egg mixture. Cook for 5 minutes or until crispy and browned. Top with barbecue sauce and mayonnaise. Serve immediately.

Combine the tequila, sugar, cilantro, lime peel, and salt in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce the heat to lowsimmer for 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Stir in the lime juice and jalapeno chile. Remove the cilantro sprigcover the mixture tightly and cool completely. Pour the mixture into a small jar with a tight-fitting lid. Store in the refrigerator. Shake the jar before using.
In a small bowl, combine the creamer and the sweetener. Mix well. Add the cinnamon and cream of tartar and mix well again. Serve with a tall glass of coffee or over ice.

Heat a wok until smoking hot. Add 1 tbsp of the olive oil and the chicken skin side down. When the skin is browned add the rest of the olive oil and the skin side up. Add the salt and black pepper and turn the heat down to medium and let the skin get crispy. Add the chicken to a plate and set aside. Put 1/2 the honey in the wok and add 1/4 of the water. Stir and add the remaining 1/2 of the honey and the other 1/4 of the water. Add the fish sauce and the soy sauce. Stir and cook for 1 min. Then add the lemons and the rice wine and stir and let it boil for 2 mins. Add the sesame oil and the chicken and stir for 2 mins and serve.

In a large frying pan over medium heat, add lite olive oil. Cook for 2-3 minutes until it is hot. Add garlic and stir. Add the spinach and stir constantly until it begins to wilt. Add basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine the first four ingredients and toss. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients and whisk together. Add the vinaigrette to the artichoke mixture and toss well. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least one hour or up to 24 hours.

Preheat oven to 350. Season both sides of each breast with the seasoning. Place on a baking sheet. Bake 10 min or until no longer pink. Heat potatoes in skillet with 2 T. of water. Add butter and heat until melted. Add lemon juice. Serve with the chicken and potatoes.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees f. Remove the membrane from the back of the ribs and discard. Coat both sides with vinaigrette. Place in a shallow baking dish and bake until tender - about 2 hours. In a bowl, combine the barbecue sauce and lemon juice. Stir in the parsley and oregano. Remove the ribs from the oven and brush with the barbecue mixture. Return the ribs to the oven and bake for about 30 minutes, or until the sauce is caramelized.

Cut steaks into 1-inch thick slices. Mix all other ingredients except steaks. Marinate steaks in mixture for a minimum of 1 hour. Thread steaks onto skewers. Grill over high heat (450 degrees F) for about 5 minutes per side or until done. Turn once. Serve with lettuce leaves, kimchi, and steamed white rice. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve hot.

Place 3/4 cup water and 3/4 cup white vinegar in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Add flour and stir until thickened. Add 1/2 cup of the sugar and the juice of 1 lemon. Continue cooking and stirring until the mixture is thick and glossy. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup of the pineapple juice. Refrigerate until cool. Add the crushed pineapple and stir. Fold in the gumdrops, nuts and marshmallows. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into small cubes. Put them in a large saucepan and cover with cold water by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to low and simmer until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain the potatoes thoroughly. While they are still hot, put them back into the saucepan with the chicken broth and turn the heat to medium-high. Cook, stirring constantly, until the broth has evaporated and the potatoes are completely dry and smooth. Turn off the heat. Add the sour cream to the potatoes and beat with a hand mixer until light and fluffy. Add more sour cream if you want it creamier. Stir in the butter and egg yolk until smooth. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with ketchup or gravy if desired.

Cut bread into cubes. Place cubes on baking tray. Butter lightly. Sprinkle with mayonnaise and curry. Bake at 350F for 10 minutes. Turn once and bake for a further 10 minutes. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper before serving. Sprinkle with paprika if desired.

Preheat oven 180 degrees C (350 F). Beat eggs and sugar together until mixture thickens and leaves ribbons when lifted from side of bowl. Add cornflour, baking powder and sifted flour. Turn into greased 20 cm (8 inch) tins and bake for 35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in tin for 5 minutes before turning out onto wire rack. Spread each cake with butter cream icing and sandwich together. Decorate with passion fruit pulp or whipped cream and fresh fruit.

Cut jalapenos, red chiles, green chiles and habaneros in half lengthwise. Remove seeds and pulp. Set aside. Rinse out jars and allow to dry. Place limes in a jar and cover with vodka. Add remaining ingredients and seal tightly. Let stand for 14 days. Strain into bottle and allow to cool. Serve in a shot glass with a sliced lime.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line two large cookie sheets with wax paper. In the top of a double boiler over simmering water, beat egg whites on medium speed until foamy. Gradually add granulated sugar, beating until stiff peaks form and sugar is dissolved. Stir in extract and food coloring until well blended. Add chocolate chips and mix until blended well. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 7 minutes or until set. Remove from cookie sheet and cool completely on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Wash the potatoes under running water. Cut each potato in half lengthwise. Place cut side down in a shallow baking pan. Combine lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, salt, oregano and peppermix well. Pour over the potatoes in the pan. Turn the potatoes to coat both sides with the mixture. Bake 1 hour in the preheated oven. Turn the potatoes over halfway through baking time to evenly coat both sides with the lemon mixture.

Bake biscuits according to package directions. In skillet, over medium heat, cook Canadian bacon and sharp cheddar cheese slices to desired doneness. Top biscuits with ham and cheese. Break egg on each biscuit. Cook until egg is done to your liking. Top with bearnaise sauce and serve immediately.

Cut off both ends of the cucumber and slice lengthwise. Cut into 1/2 inch slices. Add to a large bowl and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour over the cider and sugar. Let stand for 1 hour. Remove the cucumbers from the liquid. Drain the liquid and reserve. Add the red onion and fresh dill to the reserved liquid and mix well. Pour the liquid over the cucumbers and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Remove from refrigerator and stir once or twice. Serve.

Place chicken stock in slow cooker and stir in potatoes, all-purpose flour, leeks and dried dill. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 6 hours or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. Sprinkle with bacon bits, salt and pepper to taste. Add half-and-half to desired consistency. Garnish with shredded cheese, if desired.

Peel and cut 2 pounds of potatoes into chunks. Boil them in 6 cups of water till they are cooked. Drain them and return them to the pan. Melt 1/4 cup of butter in a small saucepan. Add 1/4 cup of whole wheat flour. Add 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper. Stir this mixture into the potatoes. Add 2 cups of milk. Add 1 egg and stir it in. Cook for 2 minutes longer and serve warm.

Combine the cabbage and cucumber in a large bowl. In another bowl whisk together the vinegar, sugar and Worcestershire sauce. Pour over the cabbage mixture and toss well. Add the oniontoss well. Cover the salad and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. Yield: 12 servings (serving size: 1/4 cup).

Mix together all ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surfaceknead gently for about 3-4 minutes or until smooth. Place dough in a greased 9x5 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45-55 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Makes one loaf of bread.

Saute the onion and garlic until tender. Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink. Add the mushrooms. Heat through. Add the carrots. Heat through. Add the quick-cooking long grain and wild rice mix. Stir well. Add the water. Cover tightly. Cook over medium heat for 20 minutes. Uncover. Stir. Sprinkle with the cheese. Serve.

In a heavy saucepan combine brown sugar & evaporated milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat & cook to soft ball stage (238f). Remove from heat & stir in vanilla & butter. Beat until mixture is smooth & shiny & spread into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle with additional nuts if desired. Cool & cut into squares.

Boil the carrots in a little lightly salted water with a pinch of sugar in it until soft. Drain. Boil the sweet potatoes separately in lightly salted water until soft. Mash or puree together. Add the butter. Add a few drops of olive oil. Season with coriander powder, cumin powder and whole cumin seed. Stir in the honey. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve.

Pound the spices and sugar in a mortar and pestle. Mix well. Place the pork belly in a roasting tin. Rub with the spice mixture. Roast for 4 hours. Brush the roast with the soy sauce. Continue to roast for another 15 minutes. Serve with the sweet soy sauce.

In a blender container, combine grape juice concentrate, lemon juice, and sugar. Cover and blend until smooth. Place blender container in freezer for 3 hours or until firmly frozen. Remove container from freezeradd vodka. Blend until smooth. Fill four glasses with crushed icepour in purple slush. Garnish each glass with 1 grape, 1 mint leaf.

In heavy saucepan, combine sugar, milk and butter. Cook and stir over medium-high heat until bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in butterscotch chips. Stir in oats and coconut. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Let stand until firm. Makes 5 dozen.
In a large saucepan brown the meat. Drain. Return to saucepan. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, cover and simmer until noodles are tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.

Preheat grill to medium-high. Wash and cut the red potatoes into wedges. In a large bowl, combine sour cream, ranch dressing mix and pepper and saltstir well. Drizzle the dressing over the potato wedges and toss well to coat. Place the wedges on the grill in a single layer and grill for about five minutes on each side until the potatoes are cooked through and crisp on the outside. Serve hot.
In a large bowl, mix together all ingredients. Spread in a 9×13 inch pan. Cool. Cut into 24 bars. Wrap in plastic wrap and store in an air tight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Place the water and tangerines in a 4-quart nonreactive pot and simmer, uncovered, until the tangerines are softened and beginning to break apart, about 30 minutes. Add the cranberries and apples and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes or until the fruit is very tender. Stir in the sugar and simmer an additional minute or two. Cool to room temperature. When the sauce is room temperature, stir in the slivered almonds. Cool to room temperature before serving.

Heat oil in a large heavy-bottom saucepan. Saute onion and garlic for about 3 minutes or until softened. Add all remaining ingredients and cook over medium-low heat for about 25 minutes or until tender. Serve.

Mix the berries with the cornstarch. Pour into a baking dish. Sprinkle the topping over the berries. Bake 35 to 45 minutes, or until topping is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool for 10 minutes. Serve at room temperature with low-fat vanilla bean ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

Brown beef and onion. Add garlic. When meat is cooked through, drain liquid. Add cream cheese and Rotel and bring to boiling point. Add the whole kernel corn. Stir until heated through. Pour into a 13 by 9 by 2 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with the grated cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with tostada shells and your favorite toppings.

Beat eggs lightly in a bowl. Pour in 1/2 cup of cold water. Stir in 1/4 cup of all-purpose flour. Mix well to make a batter that is not too thick or too thin. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a fryer or deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Dip food to be fried into batter and deep fry until golden brown. Remove to drain on paper towels. Serve immediately with dipping sauce.
In a large bowl combine cilantro, onion, vinegar, lemon juice, oil, hot sauce, and salt. Stir well. Slowly add water and stir until smooth. Dip bread into mixture. Serve warm.

In a saucepan, beat eggs with curry powder, butter and salt until smooth. Heat in a pan over moderate heat until set. Slice bread in half lengthwise and spread with mustard on one half. On the other half layer ham, then egg, lettuce, tomato, and pickle. Top with the other half of the bread. Makes 1 sandwich.

Saut onion and garlic in vegetable oil until golden brown. Add carrot and saut until tender. Add chili and saut until tender. Add vinegar and lime juice. Bring to a boil then simmer 10 minutes. Season to taste with salt.

Melt margarine and semi-sweet chips. Add sweetened condensed milk. Remove from heat. Stir in peanuts and marshmallows. Press into pan lined with wax paper. Sprinkle with candy sprinkles. Chill. Cut into squares.

Brown the hamburger in a large skillet. Add the onion and garlic. Saute until the onion is transparent. Stir in the tomato sauce. Cook for 1 minute. Add the black beans. Season to taste with ground cayenne pepper, chili powder. Cook for another 3 to 4 minutes. Warm the flour tortillas. Add 1/4 cup of the meat mixture to each tortilla. Fold the sides in, roll up. Serve with salsa.

Pour milk, cream, orange zest and brown sugar into a medium saucepan. Add the risotto rice and stir to combine. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan and simmer until the liquid is absorbed, about 40 minutes. Stir the chocolate into the rice pudding and let stand at room temperature until the chocolate is melted and the pudding is thickened, about 30 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

Heat 1 t. Olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and mushrooms, cook for 5 minutes or until mushrooms begin to soften. Add bacon and continue to cook until crisp. Sprinkle with lemon zest and cook for 30 seconds more. In a small bowl combine vinegar and rosemary. Add to skillet along with the salmon and cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with the bacon and mushroom mixture and lemon wedges.

In a food processor or blender combine cookies, butter, and pecan chips. Add in powdered sugar and pulse until mixture is crumbly. Press into a 9 inch spring form pan and bake at 350° for 10 minutes. Let cool. In a bowl combine pudding mix and milk and whisk until smooth. Beat in cream cheese and cooled cookies until well blended. Spread over cooled crust. Chill for at least 4 hours or overnight. Garnish with whipped topping and sprinkles.

In a medium saucepan, bring to a boil the 3 cups of water. Add the quick-cooking oats. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes or until the mixture is the consistency of creamy pudding. Remove from heat. Stir in the raisins and the 1/2 teaspoon of ground cardamom. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400. Line a baking sheet with foil and brush with butter. Wash and dry asparagus. Toss in butter, spread on foil and sprinkle with sugar and red pepper flakes. Bake until crisp tender, about 10 minutes. Melt butter in a small saucepan. Add vinegar, mustard and crushed red pepper flakes and bring to a boil. Pour over cooked asparagus. Serve hot or cold.

Cook the bacon in a large saucepan over medium heat until crisp. Drain fat. Add onions and saute until golden brown. Add the evaporated milk, sugar, tomatoes, pepper and salt. Add the potatoes and simmer for 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Add the creamed corn. Simmer for 20 minutes or until the soup is hot. Add boiling water if needed.
Toss lettuce with dressing in large bowl. Divide among 4 plates. Top with remaining ingredients.

Toast 2 English muffins. Spread each with 1 tbsp bacon. Top with 1 tsp chopped red onion. Layer with 2 slices cooked chicken. Top with tomato. Sprinkle with 1 tsp shredded cheese. Broil until cheese is melted.
Sift together dry ingredients. Beat together egg and milk. Blend together and stir in melted butter. Pour into a greased waffle iron and cook till golden brown and crisp.
Saute onion and butter. Add canned tomatoes. Add egg yolks. Add salt and pepper. Add cheese. Serve on toast.

In a small bowl, combine the yogurt, garlic, ginger, cumin, black peppercorns, and nutmeg. Grill the buffalo. Skewer the buffalo, vegetables, and yogurt mixture. Grill until the vegetables are tender crisp. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl mix the oil, garlic and basil together with the red pepper flakes. Preheat oven to 350 and place the bread on a baking sheet and brush with the oil mixture and bake for 5-8 minutes depending on the thickness of the french bread. Remove the bread and spread the pizza sauce on the bottoms and top with mozzarella and parmesan cheeses and bake again until the cheese melts. Serve with a nice green salad and a glass of wine if you prefer.

Heat olive oil in skillet or wok until hot. Add onion and cook until softened. Add cabbage and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add vinegar, sugar, mustard seeds and salt. Toss to combine. Cook for 2 minutes longer or until mixture is thickened. Season to taste with pepper. Serve warm or cold.

Heat the oil over medium-low heat. Add the garlic, cayenne and salt. Saut& until the garlic is golden, about 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and bell peppers. Cook until the tomatoes begin to break down. Remove the mixture from the heat. Add the avocado to the mixture. Toss well. Add the scallion and cilantro. Garnish with a lime wedge. Serve.

Pulse ancho chile in a blender until coarsely chopped. Add warm water and pulse until mixture forms a paste. Transfer to a small bowl and stir in lime juice and sugar until blended. Place corn on the cob in a shallow bowl and brush with a thin layer of butter. Top with ancho butter. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and salt. Grill 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Brown chicken in hot oil for 4-5 minutes. Turning once. Remove from pan. Add onions to pan. Cook until tender. Add garlic, carrots and tomatoes. Cook 2-3 minutes. Stir in vinegar. Add water. Bring to a boil. Add parsley. Return chicken to pan. Reduce heat. Cover. Cook 1 1/2 hours. Remove chicken. Skim fat from surface. Pour sauce through a strainer over chicken. Garnish with parsley.

Spread mustard on two slices of bread. Layer the smoked ham and brie on top of mustard. Top with other slice of bread and butter outside. Cook in skillet or press in a panini maker until the cheese is melted and browned.

Combine the cream cheese, eggs and feta in a large bowl and mix well. Divide the mixture among 12 squares of phyllo and roll up each one tightly to enclose the filling. Place the phyllo squares on baking sheets and brush with melted butter. Bake in a 375 degree F oven for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut into wedges to serve.

Cook potatoes as usual in salted water until tender. Drain and add all other ingredients except paprika. Beat with a hand held mixer until smooth and fluffy. Spoon into a 2 qt casserole dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Cover and heat at 350 f until heated through.

In a medium saucepan combine butter and cream cheese. Over medium-low heat melt and stir until smooth. Add half-and-half and garlic powder and continue to stir until smooth and thickened, about 10 minutes. Add italian cheese blend and stir until melted and combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with favorite pasta dish.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the goat cheese into 6 slices and lay on one side of the chicken. Add the sliced tomatoes to the other side of the chicken. Wrap the chicken tightly with the bacon. Season the outside of the wrapped chicken with the salt and pepper. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes or until the chicken is done.

To assemble, spread pudding mixture in crust and refrigerate 1 hour until set. Meanwhile in a microwave safe bowl combine banana, milk, and pudding mix for 45-60 seconds stirring frequently until smooth. Spread over set pudding layer. Refrigerate 2 hours until set. Top with cool whip lite, marshmallows, and raspberries. Chill before slicing.

Mix cornstarch with salt and pineapple juice in a small saucepan. Stir in crushed pineapple. Bring to a boil, boil and stir for 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in mustard and lemon juice. Serve with ham.

Cook bacon in frying pan until crisp. Drain, cut into small pieces. Place mashed potatoes in a medium bowlmix well with bacon pieces and cheddar cheese. Spread onto one slice of bread. Top with slices of swiss cheese, turkey breast and lettuce leaves. Top with remaining slice of bread. Makes 1 sandwich.

Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in oatmeal. Allow mixture to cool and then cut into 8 rectangular pieces. Wrap each piece in wax paper.

Prepare asparagus by washing and snapping off tough end. In a small bowl combine the oil, paprika and cumin. Add the garlic granules and mix. Lay the asparagus in a shallow baking dish and drizzle with the spiced oil. Cover the dish and roast for 30-40 minutes. In a small bowl whisk together the mayo and lime. Toss in the cilantro and season with salt and pepper. Remove the roasted asparagus and toss with the sauce.

In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add garliccook 3 minutes. Stir in orzo, rice, chicken broth, water and onion. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and cook for about 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in basil and parsley. Remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Yield: 4 servings.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium high heat. Add cumin seeds and red pepper flakes and stir until seeds are golden brown. Add carrots and stir until evenly coated. Sprinkle with kosher salt. Cover and cook over low heat 10 minutes. Uncover and continue to cook until tender. Stir in cilantro and lemon juice. Sprinkle with more cumin seeds and cinnamon if desired. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine soup and water in a shallow 2-qt. baking dish. Layer half of the stuffing mix over the soup mixture. Arrange chicken breasts over stuffing mixture. Top with remaining stuffing mix. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5-8 minutes longer. Uncoverturn oven to broilcook 3 minutes longer or until cheese is melted and browned. Serve over hot rice.

Prepare rice according to package instructions, omitting fat and salt. Stir in herb seasoning mix. Cover and keep warm. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 teaspoon vegetable oil to pan. Add shallots to pan. Saute 2 minutes. Add button mushrooms and portobello mushrooms. Saute 4 minutes. Add 1/2 teaspoon vegetable oil to pan. Add wild rice mixture and thyme. Stir 1 minute or til mixture is heated through.

In a large pot over medium heat, saute the chicken in 1 tablespoon of the oil until just lightly browned. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside. Add the butter and remaining tablespoon of the oil to the pot. Add the garlic to the pot and saute for 30 seconds. Add the saffron to the pot and stir to combine. Add the chicken stock to the pot. Bring the stock to a boil. Return the chicken to the pot. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover the pot. Cook for 30 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice. Remove the pot from the heat. Stir in the olives. Cover the pot. Let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in the cilantro. Season with the salt and pepper to taste.
Dissolve jello in boiling water. Add cream cheese. Mix until blended. Add remaining ingredients. Chill until set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and lightly flour a 9x13-inch pan. Combine the first four ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture thickens and begins to boil, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the heatcool for 10 minutes. Beat the eggs in a bowl until thick and lemon-coloredstir into the cooled mixture. Beat in the vanilla and pecanspour into the prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center of the pan comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400f. Mix together dry ingredients. Cut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the milk and egg. Stir in the raisins and turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Roll out the dough to a 1/2 inch thickness. Cut with a biscuit cutter. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes or until lightly golden. Serve with preserves or jam.

Heat oven to 425°F. Coat baking sheet with cooking spray. In a large skillet, heat 2 teaspoons oil over medium-high heat. Add 1/4 teaspoon garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until beginning to brown. Add snap peas, water and remaining 2 teaspoons oil and bring to boil. Add tomatoes and season with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to baking sheet and roast, stirring once or twice, until tomatoes are tender and beginning to burst open. Garnish with remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Serve with rice.

Heat oven to 350. Place baked beans in large bowl. Add bacon, onions, green peppers, red peppers, brown sugar, molasses, hot sauce, pineapple and water. Mix well. Place in a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Stir. Return to oven. Bake 1 hour longer. Stir. Return to oven. Bake 1 hour longer. Makes 24 servings.

Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the chicken thighs and cook until lightly browned. Sprinkle the oregano, garlic, pepper and parsley over the top. Add the kalamata olives, the capers and the diced tomatoes. Cover the skillet and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes. Serve hot over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine the biscuit mix, cheese, butter and oregano evenly in a bowl and mix well. Shape into balls and place on a greased baking sheet, flatten slightly with palm of hand. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Heat the sausage according to package directions. Serve the sausage over the biscuit bites with extra cheese if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line baking sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl combine almond meal, baking soda and salt. In a small bowl combine eggs and honey. Stir the egg mixture into the almond meal mixture. Add the melted butter and lemon juice. Stir until the mixture comes together. Divide the dough into 12 equal parts. Shape each part into a ball. Place the balls on the prepared baking sheets. Brush the tops with the melted butter. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Let the biscuits cool for about 5 minutes on a wire rack. Serve warm.

Combine sugar and 1/2 cup of ice cubes in a blendermix until sugar is dissolved. Add remaining ice cubes and the kiwis and blend until slushy. Divide slush among 4 glasses, adding a bit of orange juice to each if desired. Top with sugar and a few mint leaves. Serve with a spoon or a straw.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the honey and water until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature. In the mean time, add orange blossom water to the yogurt. In another bowl, toss the figs in the cooled syrup. Divide the yogurt between two bowls (or one large bowl). Top each bowl with some of the figs and pistachios. Sprinkle with more orange blossom water to serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Place asparagus spears on the baking sheet. Lightly drizzle the spears with the oil. Sprinkle the balsamic vinegar over the spears. Cut the top off the garlic bulb and squeeze the contents of the bulb into a small bowl. Mash the garlic contents until it resembles a paste. Sprinkle the mashed garlic onto each of the spears. Drizzle the spears with the mashed garlic. Sprinkle the spears with the kosher salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle the spears with the balsamic vinegar. Bake the spears for 6 minutes. Remove from the oven. Sprinkle the cheese on top of each of the spears. Drizzle the spears with the mashed garlic. Place the chives on top of the spears. Serve warm.

Place cheerios, granola and cranberries in a bowl. Combine brown sugar, honey and peanut butter in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until melted. Pour over the cereal mixture. Stir until all is well coated. Drop mixture by tablespoonfuls onto wax paper. Let cool for about 1 hour.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Rinse in cold water and drain. In a large bowl, combine the cooked spaghetti, snow peas, cooked chicken breast, red bell pepper, and green onions. In a small bowl combine the teriyaki sauce, dark sesame oil, and salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle the teriyaki mixture over the spaghetti mixture. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

In a large saute pan heat bacon fat over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about five minutes. Add fresh corn and cook, stirring occasionally for five minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add unsalted butter and cook until melted and sauce is smooth and silky. Serve with freshly ground black pepper on the side.

Drain and rinse black beans. Place in a blender and add cream cheese, rotel, cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, onion powder, garlic powder and parsley. Blend until smooth and creamy. Chill for 2 hours before serving with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut squash lengthwise, then cut out seeds. Place cut side down on a baking dish with about an inch of water. Bake for about an hour. When done, remove from the oven. Let cool slightly. Use a fork to pull the meat of the squash out. Add a little water if needed so it is a little saucy. Add butter and salt and pepper to taste.

Brown chicken in oil. Add onion, garlic & mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are tender. Add tomatoes. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add wine. Cook 5 more minutes. Remove from heat. Add balsamic vinegar, thyme & pepper to taste. Serve over rice.
Combine potatoes, egg, flour, salt, and pepper to make dough. Roll thin. Cut into strips. Saute with cabbage in margarine. Serve.

Sauté onion in butter until tender. Add stock. Bring to a boil. Add broccoli, bay leaf, seasonings, and cook for 5 minutes. Add cream and cook until heated. Add blue cheese and stir until melted. Serve with lemon wedges.
Boil together the rhubarb and sugar over medium heat. Simmer for about 15 minutes. Strain and add the juice to cold club soda. Serve over ice.

Carrots and Celery: Peel carrots and cut into sticks. Peel and cut the celery into sticks. Add to a large pot with enough water to cover and cook until crisp tender, drain and set aside. Cabbage: Peel and slice off the core from the head of cabbage. Cut into thin wedges and place into pot with a small amount of water to cover. Cook until tender, drain and set aside with carrots and celery. Lemon Juice: Squeeze the juice from the lemon. Add to the pot with the carrots and cabbage and toss to mix well. Salt and Pepper to taste. Serve warm or cold.

Slice each celery stalk lengthwise into halves, and then cut each half into thirds to form two inches long pieces of celery. Using an electric mixer combine the blue cheese and cream cheese until well blended. Stir in sour cream and mix well. Spread some of the mixture into each piece of celery. Sprinkle each piece of celery with the chopped walnuts and serve chilled.
Preheat oven to 350. Blend together all ingredients in order listed. Place in 9x13 pan. Bake 30 minutes. Serves 8.

Cook bacon in a pan until crisp. Add onions and garlic and sauté until translucent. Remove bacon and onion mixture from pan and set aside. In the same pan add potatoes and pour in balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until potatoes are fork tender and the vinegar has evaporated. In a cast iron pan or baking dish, add the bacon mixture to the bottom. Top with potatoes and sprinkle with gruyere cheese. Bake at 375° until the cheese has melted and become golden brown. Serve with sour cream on top if you like.

Place the butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Turn the mixer on medium speed and add the bread flour, kosher salt, baking soda, sugar, brown sugar, and egg until well combined. Stop the mixer occasionally to scrape down the sides of the bowl. Reduce the mixer speed to low and slowly add the milk and the vanilla extract until just combined. Increase the speed to medium and add the egg yolk until the dough is smooth and cohesive (this takes about 1 minute). Place the dough in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.

In a large bowl combine the mushrooms, oranges and lemon juice. Let stand for 15 minutes. Drain the mushrooms and oranges and reserve juice. Combine the spinach, orange juice and lemon juice. Add the mushrooms and oranges. Toss to coat. In another bowl, combine the oil, honey and poppy seeds. Toss the salad mixture and sprinkle on the almonds. Toss to coat. Chill at least one hour.
Cook pasta in boiling water. Drain and combine in sauce pan. Add remaining ingredients. Heat and mix well. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat the egg in a bowl. Put the shredded cauliflower in another bowl. Dip each piece of cauliflower in the egg mixture, then coat with the cheese. Put the coated pieces on a greased cookie sheet. Sprinkle with oregano and parsley. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until crust is firm.

Cut tomatoes into wedges and onion into slices. Heat butter in large skillet or wok over medium heat until hot. Stir in curry powder and salt and cook about 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add shrimp and tomatoes and cook until shrimp turn pink and onion is tender, about 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and heat through for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream and avocado halves. Serve immediately with crackers or pita bread wedges for dipping.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Prepare the cake according to the box instructions. When the cake is almost done, add the gelatin and the water. Allow the cake to finish baking. Cool the cake completely before serving.

Saute the garlic and onion in the olive oil over medium high heat until tender. Add the roma tomatoes and olives. Lower the heat and cook until the tomatoes are softened. Stir in the beans and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Add the oregano and stir well. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Top with the feta cheese.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the broccoli and cook for about 3 minutes. Drain the broccoli, reserving the water. Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the garlic cloves and cook, stirring constantly until they are golden. Add the mozzarella cheese and cook until it is melted.
