Stir in the reserved cooking water. Add the rosemary. Season with salt. Add the broccoli and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Serve with garlic bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly spray 10x6x2 inch metal loaf pan with pam or grease with shortening and dust with flour. Mix dry ingredients in a bowl. Beat honey and milk together in a measuring cupadd to flour mixture alternately with the beaten eggs, beating after each addition. Stir in melted butter. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutesremove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Cut into thin wedges for serving.

Heat oil in a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook until lightly browned. Add garlic and stir until fragrant. Add escarole and cook until wilted. Stir in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add cannellini beans. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until the liquid is thickened. Stir in the pasta and parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

In food processor or blender, combine cream cheese, garlic, bell peppers, cucumbers, carrots and green onion. Blend until smooth. Blend in mayonnaise. Season with salt. Spread mixture on slices of bread. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Heat apple butter and pumpkin in a sauce pan. Mix brown sugar with cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger. Add to pumpkin mixture. Cook on medium heat until thick. Remove from heat and add eggs. Let mixture cool. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 425f for 30 minutes. Reduce heat to 350f and bake for an additional 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center of the pie comes out clean. Let cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a skillet over medium heat, cook sausage with potatoes until browned and sausage is cooked through. Stir in parsley, cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, eggs and milk. Spread evenly over the pizza crust. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Top with lettuce, tomato, and basil if desired. Cut into 8 triangles. Serve with sour cream for dipping.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve with vegetable crudite.

In a wok or large saut pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat until it is very hot but not smoking. Add the frozen chopped onions and cook for 2-3 minutes until they begin to soften and turn golden brown. Add the rice and cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly until the rice is heated through. Remove from the heat and add the chili, pineapple chunks and the cilantro and toss to combine. Serve immediately topped with the shrimp.

Melt butter in small saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir in peppercorns and cook until fragrant. Add wine and stir until reduced by half. Add heavy cream and bring to a boil. Turn heat to low and add stilton. Continue cooking until sauce is thick and stilton is melted and incorporated. Stir in parsley and serve with fish.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss potatoes with olive oil. Sprinkle with parsley, sea salt, and fresh ground black pepper. Roast for 35-40 minutes or until potatoes are crispy on the outside and tender in the middle. Rub chicken with olive oil. Sprinkle with parsley, sea salt, and fresh ground black pepper. Roast for 35-40 minutes or until cooked through.

Cut the figs into small pieces and put into a large saucepan with the water. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 10 minutes until the figs are softened but not mushy. Drain the water from the pan and put the figs back into the pan. Add the sugar and lemon juice to the pan, along with the lemons cut into quarters. Bring to a boil and cook for about 5 minutes until the fruit has thickened, stirring frequently so that the preserves do not burn on the bottom of the pan. Add the cinnamon sticks to the pan and cook for one more minute. Remove from the heat and cool to room temperature. The preserves will thicken as it cools. Store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
Combine the first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Add extracts. Spoon into a 2 quart bowl. Chill. Just before serving, add topping. Makes 6 servings.

In a medium bowl, cream together the butter, light molasses, egg, flour, salt, baking soda, cinnamon, ground cloves, and nutmeg until dough is formed. Divide dough into two portions. Shape into flat round disks about 1/4 inch thick. Wrap disks in plastic wrap, then refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour. Heat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). On a lightly floured surface, roll dough out to about 1/8 inch thickness. Using a 3 inch round cookie cutter, cut out rounds of dough. Place rounds on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 5 to 7 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool for 1 minute on the baking sheet before moving to wire rack to cool completely.

In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook, breaking up the meat into small pieces until cooked through. Add the basil and cook for 1 minute. Add the cherry tomatoes. Season to taste with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes longer. Transfer to a bowl. Add the pasta to the skillet and cook over medium heat until the pasta is al dente, about 10 minutes. Drain the pasta. Add the sausage mixture. Toss until the pasta is evenly coated. Serve topped with Parmesan cheese.

Grease and lightly flour a jelly roll pan or 17 x 11 x 1 inch pan. Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla until well blended. In a separate bowl combine flour and baking powderstir into creamed mixture. Spread into pan. Sprinkle with chocolate pieces and nuts. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 18-22 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Cut into bars when completely cool.

Melt the chocolate in a heavy-duty saucepan over very low heat. Stir until the mixture is smooth and glossy. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Add the egg yolk and beat well. Beat in the butter and liqueur. Stir in the icing sugar and cocoa. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours. Chill until firm. Shape into 1-inch balls. Roll in cocoa or confectioners sugar. Store in refrigerator.

In a small saucepan combine 2 cups water and the apricots and currants. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the fruit is soft and the liquid is syrupy, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the rice and 3 cups water in a large saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until the rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Remove from the heat and stir in the apricot mixture and the almonds. Fluff the rice with a fork and stir in the cilantro and salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Boil the cauliflower for 10 minutes until tender but still firm. Let cool slightly and drain in colander. Mix together the bisquick and water to form a batter. Dip the florets in batter and deep fry in hot oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt while still warm. Serve hot.

In a crock pot, mix together cream cheese, parmesan, onions, thyme and frozen chopped spinach. In a small bowl, mix together whipping cream, pimientos, worcestershire sauce and garlic salt. Pour cream mixture over top of the other mixture. Cook on low for 2-3 hours or until dip is hot. Serve with crackers or veggies.

Wash blueberries and pick over them to make sure they are free of worms. Combine blueberries with 2 cups of the sugar in a large bowl and stir until they are completely covered with the sugar. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or foil and let the blueberries stand in the refrigerator for 8 hours, or overnight. Place the orange juice and lemon juice in a large pot with the remaining 3 cups of sugar and 1 cup of water. Place the bowl of berries into the pot with the mixture of orange and lemon juice and 1/2 of the berry mixture. Cover the pot and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove the lid and increase the heat to high. Cook the berries for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. The berries should start to thicken up a bit at this point. Add the remaining berry mixture to the pot and stir to combine. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes more, stirring occasionally until the mixture thickens up to your liking. Remove the pot from the heat and let the mixture stand for about 10 minutes

Put your egg yolk into a bowl and add 1 tbsp dijon mustard. Add salt and cayenne pepper and mix well. Slowly add a little vinegar and keep mixing with a whisk till you get a nice emulsion. Add the rest of the vinegar and whisk well again. Add 1 tbsp olive oil and keep mixing with whisk till you get a thick consistency. Add rest of olive oil and keep whisking till you get your desired consistency. Serve with your sandwich or dip into chips.

Preheat oven to 400F. Place grape tomatoes on a baking sheet. Toss lightly to coat with olive oil. Sprinkle with kosher salt and black pepper and a pinch of basil to taste. Roast until starting to brown around edges, about 20 to 30 minutes. Cool and serve at room temperature.

Prepare orange jello according to directions on box. Chill until firm. In a separate bowl mix juices with ginger ale until sugar is dissolved. Add fruit to pear halves before filling jello mold with liquid mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish, if desired.

Prepare crust as directed on box of crust mix and spread on bottom of 13 x 9 pan. Drain canned peaches well and pour over crust. Mix together brown sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle on top of peaches. Bake at 375 for about 1 hour or until crust is light brown and fruit is bubbly.

Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add milk. Combine dry ingredients. Add to creamed mixture and mix well. Stir in vanilla and bananas. Drop by tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 425 for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Makes about 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Lightly grease a baking sheet with olive oil. Rub each salmon fillet with sea salt and wasabi powder. Place on baking sheet and bake for approximately 8-10 minutes until done (about 6 minutes per side) or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Cool slightly before serving. Top with sour cream or wasabi cream sauce if desired.

1. Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Spread mustard over bottom of baking dish. Arrange fish over mustard. Spread with cream. Top with chives and lemon juice. Cover with foil and bake for 15 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 minutes more or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle with sugar and salt. Garnish with remaining chives and dill. Serve with hard rolls and mustard or potato chips.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook potatoes until tender. Drain. Cut potatoes in half. In a large skillet or frying pan, heat oil over medium high heat until hot. Add chicken. Season with rosemary sprigs, salt, and pepper. Cook until chicken is done. Add potatoes to skillet. Heat through. Serve hot.

Combine all dry ingredients in a bowl and mix well. In another bowl, combine all wet ingredients and mix well. Mix dry and wet ingredients together and stir only enough to moisten the dry ingredients. Fold in the egg and the egg white. Heat a waffle iron and spray with cooking spray. Spoon batter into the iron and cook according to manufacturers directions. Makes about 6 servings.

Place the adobo seasoning in a plastic bag with the chicken and shake to coat. Let stand for 15 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. In a large skillet cook the onion and garlic in olive oil for 5 minutes or until onion is transparent. Add the beer and cook over medium-high heat until evaporated. Add the butter and let melt. Add the mushrooms and cook until tender. Remove from heat and add the cornstarch and beer mixture. Stir until smooth and pour over the chicken. Bake in the oven for 30 minutes or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165 degrees. Sprinkle with the cheese and bake for an additional 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar, cocoa, rum and creambring just to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer gently for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in dry instant coffee. Let mixture stand for 30 minutes. Strain mixture through sieve lined with damp cheese cloth or coffee filter over a bowldiscard solids. Stir in vanilla. Serve warm or refrigerated over ice cream or pound cake. Makes 1 1/2 cups

In large skillet saute garlic in butter over medium heat. Add carrots and cook until tender. Add onions and portabella mushrooms, salt, and pepper to taste. Add balsamic vinegar to deglaze pan. Saute until liquid is reduced and the vegetables are tender. Serve with grilled steaks.
Prepare salad by slicing peeled pears in halves. Toss together with mayonnaise. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Add cherries.

Boil eggs, peel and slice in half lengthwise. Remove the yolks and place in a small bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and mash together with a fork. Stuff the mixture back in the egg whites. Chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

In a large skillet over med-high heat. Heat the oil. Add the garlic and ginger. Stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the bok choy, bouillon cube, soy sauce, sugar, and 3-4 tbsp water. Cover and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add the cornstarch mixture. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, combine wheat bran, almond milk, applesauce, egg and brown sugar. Add vanilla extract and mix well. In another bowl combine whole wheat flour, baking soda and powder and salt. Add to wet ingredients and mix well. Spoon into greased muffin tins and bake for about 20 minutes. Allow to cool in pan 5 minutes before removing and cooling completely on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with aluminum foil. Slice spaghetti squash into 1/4" thick slices, then scrape out seeds with a spoon. Place squash slices on baking sheets and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes or until soft. Heat rag pasta sauce and spaghetti squash in a medium saucepan over low heat until sauce is warm and squash is soft. Fill spaghetti squash slices with sauce and top with sausage and spinach. Sprinkle with goat cheese and bread crumbs, and drizzle with olive oil and butter. Bake for an additional 5 minutes until bread crumbs are crisp and goat cheese is melted. Sprinkle with Parmesan before serving.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees f. Grease an 11x15 jelly roll pan. Mix oats, nuts and coconut in a bowl. Combine brown sugar, cinnamon and salt in a small bowl. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add honey and bring to a boil. Add water and stir until well combined. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and salt mixture. Pour over dry ingredients and stir to coat well. Spread evenly in prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack and cut into bars.

Spread refried beans in 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Blend remaining ingredients except scallions. Spread evenly over refried beans. Sprinkle scallions over top. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Serve cold with tortilla chips.

Peel, seed, dice, and remove seeds from habanero peppers. Peel, seed, dice, and remove seeds from serrano chiles. Peel, slice, and remove seeds from green onion. Peel, section, and chop fresh tomato. Combine all ingredients in a medium-size bowl. Toss to combine. Cover bowl with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with tortilla chips.
Combine dry ingredients. Add buttermilk and vanilla. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into batter. Fold in melted butter. Pour into 2 well-greased 9x5 loaf pans. Bake at 350f for 50 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350F. Line an 8x8-inch baking pan with foil. Melt butter and chocolate together in saucepan. Whisk in Splenda until combined. Cool slightly. Beat egg and vanilla in bowl. Add sugar and beat until creamy. Beat in Splenda mixture and flour until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips and dried cherries. Spread batter in baking pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Cool completely in pan. Cut into 16 bars.

In a large skillet saute olive oil, garlic and sun-dried tomatoes for 5 minutes or until tomatoes are soft. Add chicken and saute until cooked. Add bouillon cube and water and cover and cook for 5 more minutes. Add half-and-half and rosemary and let reduce for 10 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper and serve over hot cooked fettuccine. Top with parmesan cheese and enjoy!

Mix together miracle whip, sugar and cocoa. Sift together flour, soda and salt. Add to mixture and stir well. Add hot water and vanilla. Pour into greased pan and bake in 325 degree oven until done. Cool on wire rack.

In a medium saucepan melt butter over low heat. Stir in marshmallow and continue to stir until melted. Remove from heat and add the rice krispies and stir until thoroughly combined. Stir in the maple syrup and white chocolate chips and stir until thoroughly combined. Spread into prepared pan and chill until set. Cut into squares.

Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla, beating well. Stir in flour and baking powder. Mix until well blended and smooth. Roll into 1-inch balls and roll in powdered sugar. Place on wax paper-lined baking sheet. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Melt chocolate as directed on package, stirring until smooth. Dip 1/2 of each cookie into chocolate and place on wax paper-lined baking sheets. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm. Dip remaining cookie halves into chocolate and sprinkle with flaked coconut. Refrigerate until chocolate is firm. Yield: 3 dozen.

Remove the membrane from the back of the ribs and place the ribs in a large roasting pan. Salt and pepper the ribs. In a large bowl mix the barbecue sauce and the garlic powder and pour over the ribs. Place the ribs into the oven for 2 hours. Remove the ribs and add 3 hickory chips to the pan and turn the heat down to 250 degrees for 4 hours or until done. Brush on the sauce and serve.

Brown ground beef with zucchini. Drain. In a large bowl combine hot water, stuffing mix, tomatoes, ketchup, catalina dressing and seasonings. Stir well. Add ground beef mixture. Stir until well mixed. Heat through. Serve hot on rolls. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f (180 degrees c).Place the tomatoes in a large baking dish and sprinkle with the olive oil, garlic and mint. Season with salt and black pepper. Place in the preheated oven and bake for 1 hour. Serve the tomatoes with toasted bread and goat cheese.

Mix together white cake mix, oil, water, egg whites (beat first), and daiquari mix together. Bake according to package directions. Cool completely. Cut into squares and arrange on serving plate. Top with thawed frozen strawberries and cool whip. Chill at least an hour before serving.

Heat the oil in a large wok or heavy pan over medium high heat until it is hot but not smoking. Add the garlic and stir fry for 30 seconds. Add the mushrooms and stir fry for 30 seconds. Add the shrimp and stir fry til pink and cooked through, 3-4 minutes. Serve immediately with cooked rice and a lemon slice.

Combine all ingredients except coconut in blender or food processor and process until smooth. Stir in coconut and refrigerate for 2 hours or more before serving with tortilla chips. Also good as a dipping sauce for roast chicken or pork.

Snap or cut each spear into 2-inch lengths. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar and 2 tablespoons water until smooth. Add the vegetables to a large bowlpour over the vinegar mixture. Toss to coat. Let stand 10 minutes to marinate. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately, or cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 6 hours before serving. Makes about 4 servings.

Combine first 3 ingredients in 1-quart baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Combine next 3 ingredients in bowlstir well with whisk. Sprinkle over top of corn mixture. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake an additional 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Mix the pinto beans and green chilies in a bowl. Brown the chorizo in a skillet and add the beans. Add the mayonnaise. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Spread half of the mixture onto one half of each of four tortillas. Top each half of the tortillas with half of the cheese. Fold the other half of the tortillas over and place them in a preheated oven to melt the cheese. Serve warm.

Remove the tips from the wings and cut off the wing joints. Put the flour in a shallow dish and add the onion salt, chicken salt, lemon pepper, white pepper, cayenne pepper, black pepper, dried herbs and chicken wings to the flour and coat well. Heat a frying pan on medium high heat and spray a little oil on the pan. Cook the wings for 5-7 minutes on each side turning as needed until golden brown. You may use a little extra flour if the wings stick a little.
Soak breadcrumbs in milk. Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. Beat together with egg. Add milk mixture. Stir in corn syrup and butter. Bake on greased hot griddle.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease a 9 x 5 loaf pan. Combine 1 3/4 cup of the all-purpose flour with 3/4 cup of the sugar, the baking soda, and the salt. In a separate medium bowl, combine the lemon rind and the lemon juice. Cream together the butter and the yogurt until light and fluffy. Beat in the lemon mixture. Add the eggs 1 at a time. Beat just until incorporated. Add the flour mixture, 1 cup at a time, alternating with the sour cream. Stir just until combined. Pour batter into pan. Bake for 1 hour. Cool 10 minutes. Unmold. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar. Serve warm or cold.

Cut onion into thick slices. In a shallow baking dish toss the onion slices with the bouillon and set aside. In a skillet heat the butter over medium heat until it is melted. Stir in the flour and cook 1 minute. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add the onion slices to the baking dish and pour the milk mixture over. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and top with the cheese. Return to oven until the cheese is melted.

To make the sauce, whisk together the cream cheese and cucumber. Season with salt and pepper and add Tabasco to taste. Dye with a few drops of green food coloring.To assemble the sandwiches, spread the sauce over the bottom piece of bread. Top with thinly sliced cucumber and onion. Spread the remaining sauce over the top piece of bread. Place over the bottom piece of bread and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with a light spray of olive oil spray. In a medium bowl, mix together the Jiffy cornbread mix, sour cream and dry ranch dressing mix. Stir until blended but do not over-mix. Press the mixture into the prepared baking pan. Bake until browned on top but not completely cooked through, about 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside to cool. Combine beans, corn, tomatoes, bell pepper, bacon bits, onion and shredded cheddar cheese in a large bowl. Stir in dressing. Serve over cornbread or on the side.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Wash and trim ends of asparagus. Cut into 2-inch pieces.Toss in a large bowl with pine nuts, lime juice and lime zest. Add oil and toss to coat.Arrange on a baking sheet and roast for 10 to 15 minutes or until crisp-tender, tossing once during roasting to prevent burning.Let cool in roasting pan for 5 minutes before tossing with goat cheese and honey. Salt to taste and serve immediately.

Cook the asparagus spears with the oil and the garlic clove. Add the onion, the leeks and the chicken stock. Bring to a boil then add the potato. Simmer until the vegetables are cooked. Blend with the immersion blender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm with parmesan cheese.

Brown hamburger with salt and pepper. Stir in spaghetti sauce. Heat through. Top with cheese and corn. Unroll dough into rectangles. Layer one rectangle at a time over bottom of 9 inch pie pan. Repeat. Spoon hamburger mixture over top. Sprinkle with mashed potatoes. Dot with butter. Bake at 375 for 25-30 minutes or until crust is golden. Garnish with parsley if desired.

cook squash and carrots until tender in a large pot of water. Drain. Combine soup, sour cream and butter in a large bowl. Add all vegetables and stuffing mix. Stir until well mixed. Bake in a greased 2-quart casserole at 350 for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Combine oil and pumpkin. Add eggs and mix well. Sift together the Bisquick and sugar. Add to wet ingredients and mix well. Stir in raisins and cinnamon. Pour into the pan. Bake for 50 minutes or until done. Cool for 10 minutes then remove from pan and cool completely. This bread is great with jam or butter.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. In a bowl, mix together mayo, breadcrumbs, garlic, and oregano. Dip each side of pork in the mixture, then place in baking dish. Bake for one hour.

Combine apple juice, vinegar and olive oil. Add rosemary, salt and pepper and whisk well to combine. Pour half the marinade over the chicken and turn to coat. Place the other half of the marinade in a shallow dish. Marinate the chicken for at least 1 hour or overnight. Preheat grill to medium high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade and grill for 4-5 minutes on each side or until done. Serve with grilled apple wedges.

Beat eggs and add sugar, salt, raisins and lemon juice. Add the cooked rice and mix well. Pour into a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Serve with melted butter on the side.

Sprinkle each breast with 1/4 teaspoon cornstarch. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken, and cook until golden. Sprinkle with remaining cornstarch. Add broth, lemon juice, mustard, garlic and parsley. Heat through. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drainstir in pasta. Toss gently. Season to taste. Garnish with more parsley. Serve immediately.

Combine chocolates and shortening. Melt over low heat, stirring occasionally until smooth. Cool slightly. Stir in extract. Add nuts and pour onto a buttered 10 x 15 inch jelly roll pan. Chill until firm. Break into pieces and sprinkle with candy canes. Store in the refrigerator.

Beat 4 eggs until they are well combined. Add 2 teaspoons of finely chopped chives and 1/2 cup of cooked and cooled prawn meat, season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat a little oil in an omelette pan or in a frying pan until it is very hot but not smoking. Pour in the egg mixture and tilt the pan to spread it thinly. As it cooks tilt it to allow the uncooked egg to flow underneath. When cooked on one side turn it over and cook the other side. Cut into wedges and serve warm or cold with dips.

Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and swirl to coat. Add chili peppers, lemon zest, and green tea. Cook 1 minute. Add broccoli. Cook 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add squash and continue to cook until crisp-tender. Add more oil if needed. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil. Add bell pepper and cook until crisp-tender. Add brewed tea and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper.

Melt butter in a medium-sized bowl. Add honey and eggs and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Add the rest of the ingredients and beat until well combined. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking pan and bake for 25 minutes. Allow to cool before cutting.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, heat the olive oil and cook the garlic and parsley until the garlic is golden but not burned. Add the tomatoes and cook 2-3 minutes until the skins burst. Add the lemon rind and cook 1 minute longer, stirring constantly. Remove the skillet from heat and stir in the lemon juice and sugar. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serve at room temperature as an appetizer or side dish. Makes 6 servings.

Remove the fat from the back of each chicken and rub the entire bird with the garlic powder. Place the chickens in a shallow roasting pan. Add the onions and the wine to the pan. Cover and roast for 40 minutes. Check to see if the chickens are done and if not roast until done.

In large pot, bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. Stir in 1/2 of the bacon. Cook 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Meanwhile, in skillet over medium-high heat, cook remaining bacon 7 minutes or until crisp, turning once. Drain bacon on paper towels. Cool and crumble. In skillet with bacon drippings, cook onion 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Stir in white wine, water, soy sauce, tabasco sauce and salt. Cook 1 minute. Stir in cooked greens. Cook 3 minutes. Top with bacon. Serve hot. Serves 8.

Brown the ground beef and sausage in a skillet. Add the onion while browning the other meats. Add the rest of the ingredients after the meats are cooked. Simmer until the cheese is melted. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Combine the first four ingredients in a 4-quart heavy saucepan over medium heat. When the mixture comes to a boil and starts to thicken slightly, wash down the sides of the saucepan with a pastry brush dipped in cold water to prevent crystallization. Cook the mixture to the hard ball stage. Add the nuts and continue to cook, stirring constantly, to the soft crack stage. Remove the pan from the heat and add the vanilla extract and the baking soda. Stir well. Pour the mixture onto a flat, greased marble slab or stoneware platter. As the candy cools, stretch out the mixture by lifting one side of the slab and pulling it toward you with your hand. Work quickly and repeat this procedure on all sides of the slab, pulling the candy thinly. When the candy cools to room temperature, it will be very brittle. Break into pieces with your fingers or a stiff knife. Store in an airtight container for up to one month.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Lightly grease a 9×13-inch baking dish.In a saucepan over medium-high heat, sauté the onion and garlic in the olive oil until the onion is translucent.Add the arborio rice and cook until the rice is lightly toasted. Add the wine and cook until the rice is tender. Stir in the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat and add the chopped tomatoes and zucchini. Stir until the vegetables are incorporated into the rice. Stir in the parmesan cheese and season to taste with salt and pepper. Fold the tuna and basil into the rice. Place in the prepared baking dish. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes. Serve immediately.
Marinate ribs overnight. Brown ribs on all sides over medium heat. Place in slow cooker. Combine all ingredients and pour over ribs. Cook on high for 3 hours.

Spray both sides of each slice of sourdough bread lightly with nonstick cooking spray. Spread apricot jam on one slice of sourdough. Place a slice of swiss cheese on top of jam. Arrange one slice of sourdough on top. Spread remaining apricot jam over other slice of sourdough. Top with one slice of turkey breast. Add remaining slice of sourdough on top. Spread one side of sandwich with jam. Top sandwich with roasted red pepper and a slice of sweet onion. Place sandwich in panini maker. Press for 4-5 minutes or until sourdough is golden brown. Turn sandwich over and press for another 4-5 minutes. Remove sandwich from panini maker and allow to cool for a couple of minutes before serving.

Beat eggs. Stir in cream and seasonings. Butter a flat-surfaced 8-inch skillet. Heat over medium heat. When skillet is hot enough for water to dance on bottom, pour in egg mixture. Swirl pan to distribute. As eggs set, pull mixture to center and tilt to sides to allow uncooked portions to set underneath. When all of mixture is set but center is still moist, remove from heat. Top with fresh chives. Serve with hot buttered toast.

Heat chicken broth in a large pot to boiling. Reduce heat to low. Add tomatoes, sweet onion, celery and sugar. Simmer 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and puree in blender until smooth. Return to pot. Stir in light cream, basil and season to taste with salt and fresh ground pepper. Serve immediately. Garnish with fresh basil if desired.

Peel, core and slice apples. Place in a well greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Mix together the cake mix, sugar, cinnamon, butter and nuts. Sprinkle over the apples. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Salt and pepper both sides of veal scallopini. Dust with flour. Heat oil in large skillet and cook until golden brown on both sides. Add 2 tablespoons of water to skillet, cover and simmer for 3 minutes. Add butter to skillet, add lemon juice and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add capers and parsley. Serve with rice or pasta and a salad.

Preheat broiler. Arrange bacon slices in broiler pan. Set steak fillets over bacon. Sprinkle with black pepper and salt. Broil 8 minutes for medium-rare doneness. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in small saucepan. Combine remaining butter, balsamic vinegar and parsley. Spread over steak fillets.

In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over medium high heat. Add the onion and saute until softened. Add the chicken thighs and brown on all sides. Add the garlic, ginger, honey, fish sauce and soy sauce. Reduce the heat to medium low and simmer until the sauce thickens, about 25 minutes. Sprinkle with the five-spice powder. Serve with lime wedges. Garnish with the cilantro stem.

In a small skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until golden. Slice the mushroom caps thinly or remove stems and slice the caps thinly. Place on the skillet until almost tender. Add the tomato slices, cover and cook until the tomatoes are done. Remove from the heat. To assemble the sandwiches: spread the mayonnaise on both sides of the slices of french bread. On one side of the slice, layer with the mushroom mixture and top with slices of tomato. Place the top slice of bread on top and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease an 8-inch square baking dishset aside. Mix cake mix, egg and butter in small bowl until moist crumbs formset aside. In medium saucepan over low heat, combine butter, marshmallows and peanut butter chipsstir until completely melted and smooth. In small bowl, mix chocolate chips and roasted peanutsset aside. Spoon cake crumbs into prepared baking dishpress down lightly. Pour marshmallow mixture over crumbsspread evenly. Sprinkle with chocolate chip mixturepress down lightly. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from ovenlet stand until cool. Cut into bars.

Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil, onion and garlic. Cook until onion is tender but not brown. Add the shrimp, cook until they are just opaque, add a little more olive oil if needed to keep the shrimp from sticking to pan. Whisk the eggs in a small bowl, add the shrimp, onion and garlic to the bowl, mix well. Pour into the skillet, cover and cook until set in the middle but still moist. Serve immediately.
Cook pasta as directed on package. Meanwhile, combine all sauce ingredients. Heat through on med-low heat. Toss with pasta and ham. Top with parmesan.
Sift flours together and add other dry ingredients. Add molasses, honey, and melted buttermilk. Add raisins and nuts. Pour batter into greased pans and bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes.

Beat shortening until creamy. Beat in sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in egg, add vanilla extract, then add flour, salt and soda, blending thoroughly. Fold in toffee pieces and butterscotch chips. Place teaspoonfuls of dough on ungreased cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Bake at 375f for 12 minutes. Do not overbake. Makes 3 dozen.

Mix the cottage cheese with the spring onion, celery, radish, dill and a little salt and black pepper. Divide between 4 plates. Arrange the lettuce leaves on the plates. Top each plate with a plum tomato half. Top the tomatoes with a little of the cottage cheese mixture. Garnish with some thinly sliced cucumbers.

In large bowl combine the first eight ingredients. Spread in 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Bake at 400F for 1 hour. Let cool and break into pieces. In a large skillet over medium high heat, heat oil and butter. Add potatoes and fry for 10 minutes. Turn and fry for another 10 minutes. Transfer to plate lined with paper towels. Add more oil and butter if needed. Season to taste with seasoning salt and black pepper. Add parsley. Return to skillet and fry for 2 more minutes. Serve with sour cream and fresh parsley.

Pour popped popcorn into bowl. Crush the Bugles and pretzel twists. Melt the butter and add the sugar. Mix well. Add the popcorn. Add the crushed Bugles and pretzel twists. Mix well. Spread on baking sheet. Add the candy corn. Bake at 300 for 10 minutes. Cool. Store in air tight container.
Toss all ingredients together and serve.

Combine peppercorns in a small food processor and pulse until they are ground into a fine powder. Add scallions to processor and pulse until finely chopped. Mix together peppercorns and scallions in a shallow bowl. Place flour in a separate shallow bowl. Season cutlets with salt and pepper. Dip cutlets in flour. Then dip cutlets in the pepper mixture. Place in a greased baking dish. Cover and bake in a preheated 350f oven for about 30 minutes or until no longer pink in center and juice runs clear. For sauce combine all sauce ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Serve with cutlets.

In a small bowl combine brown sugar with butter. Microwave on high for 1 minute 30 seconds. In a greased 9-inch pie dish arrange the canned pineapple slices evenly in a circular pattern on bottom of dish. Sprinkle with cherries. Pour brown sugar butter mixture over fruit. Place a plate on top of pie dish. Microwave for 5 minutes on high. In a bowl combine egg, cinnamon, ginger and milk and stir together well. Add flour, stirring until combined. Spread over fruit mixture. Microwave for 3 minutes on high, then 5 minutes on medium power. Cool 10 minutes before cutting into wedges.

Brown turkey in a skillet. Add 1 can cream of mushroom soup and 1 can water. Simmer until meat is tender. Add spaghetti and broccoli. Mix well. Transfer to a 13x9x2 baking dish. Mix sour cream and soup together. Spread over spaghetti mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serves 8.

Preheat the oven to 180 c. Lightly grease an ovenproof dish. 2. Dice the asparagus and put into the bottom of the ovenproof dish. 3. Break up the camembert and put the pieces over the asparagus. 4. Chop the salmon and sprinkle over. 5. Beat the eggs with the cream. 6. Pour over the salmon and asparagus. 7. Grate over the Parmesan. 8. Season with pepper. 9. Bake in the oven for 25-30 minutes or until the top is crisp and golden. 10. Serve with baby salad leaves. 11. Serve with crusty bread.

Rinse pork chops. Pat dry. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Slice bell peppers into strips. Set aside. In a large dutch oven or crockpot, mix pork & beans with all other ingredients except bell peppers. Place chops on top of bean mixture. Top with bell peppers. Cover and bake at 325 degrees for about 1 hour or until chops are done.

Dip wings in egg or buttermilk mixture. Roll in bread crumbs. Place on nonstick baking sheet. Bake at 450 for 20 minutes or until brown. Turn wings over. Brush wings with butter. Bake for 10 more minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Combine the first three ingredients in medium size bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Place in refrigerator for 4-6 hours or overnight. Serve cold with fruit or fresh berries.

Place the polenta in an oiled shallow dish. Mix the wine into the water until it is dissolved. Pour the water over the polenta. Mix well so that the polenta is completely covered by the liquid. Cover the dish with foil or plastic wrap. Bake in the preheated oven for an hour until the polenta is cooked through. Uncover the dish. Add the butter and the polenta stirring thoroughly until the polenta is coated with the butter. Season the polenta with salt and pepper. Set the polenta aside. Heat the oil in an extra large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and saut them until they are tender. Add the spinach, the cheddar cheese and the parsley. Mix the ingredients together thoroughly. Place the polenta on serving plates. Top the polenta with the vegetable mixture. Garnish with parsley sprigs.
Prepare dressing by combining orange juice, vegetable oil, vinegar and celery seeds. Add greens and toss to coat. Top with oranges, onion and almonds. Serve immediately.

Grind sausage until finely minced. Mix with mustard, rosemary and breadcrumbs, and season well with salt and pepper. Divide meat mixture between the 6 eggs, mounding it in the middle of each egg and pressing down well to enclose. Heat oil in a frying pan and fry eggs for about 4 minutes on each side until golden brown. When cooked, remove eggs from pan and cool slightly. Brush eggs with melted butter, then roll in breadcrumbs, pressing down firmly to adhere to egg. Transfer to an ovenproof dish, brush with mustard and bake in oven until golden brown. Serve warm or cold.

Grease 8 inch square baking dish. Beat eggs with butter, flour, baking powder, cottage cheese, and monterey jack cheese together in a large bowl. Stir in diced chilies and tomatoes. Pour mixture into dish. Bake for about an hour, or until casserole is browned. When done cooking, let rest for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with salsa and sour cream if desired.

Soak the chickpeas overnight in plenty of water. Drain. Reserve the liquid. Blend the drained chickpeas with the garlic, onion, rosemary and parsley in a food processor or blender. Add the breadcrumbs, egg, and reserved liquid and process until smooth. Stir in the nuts. Form the mixture into patties about 2 cm thick, and brown in the oil in a skillet or frying pan over moderate heat 4 to 5 minutes per side. Serve in toasted buns with lettuce leaves, tomatoes, and mustard. Serve with French fries or baked potatoes with butter. Serves 6 to 8.
In a small bowl combine the cream cheese and seasonings. Stuff each jalapeno with a spoonful of the mixture. Wrap each with a strip of bacon. Secure with a toothpick. Bake for 45-55 minutes.

crush graham crackers and combine with melted margarine. Add powdered sugar, milk and milk chocolate chips. Spread into a greased pan. refrigerate until set. Melt eagle brand condensed milk in a double boiler or microwave. Stir until smooth. Spread over top of the crust. Refrigerate until set. Cut into bars and enjoy.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mccormick grill seasoning to the skillet. When the oil begins to bubble, add the vinegar and worcestershire sauce. Stir to combine. Add the brown sugar to the skillet. Stir to combine. Add the tomato sauce to the skillet. Stir to combine. Cook the meat with the seasonings in the skillet until no pink remains. Add the onion to the meat. Cook the mixture in the skillet until the mixture thickens. Turn off the heat. Serve the mixture over buns.

Spray crock pot with cooking spray. Add cabbage with some salt and pepper. In a skillet, saute the sliced onion in butter until they are golden. Add in the broth, mustard, salt and pepper, and the kielbasa. Pour the mixture over the cabbage in the crockpot, and cover. Cook for about 6 hours on high or for about 8 hours on low.

Place fish in shallow baking dish and pour milk over top. Sprinkle with seasonings and top with parmesan. Bake for about 10-12 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Garnish with lemon wedges and serve with lemon wedges and tartar sauce if desired.

Cook the macaroni shells & cheese according to package directions. Drainset aside. Spread 2 tablespoons spicy brown mustard on bottoms of 4 crackers. Top each cracker with 1/3 cup sauerkraut. Top each cracker with 1/3 cup corned beef. Add 1/3 cup macaroni shells & cheese to each cracker. Top each cracker with 1 tablespoon swiss. Place sandwiches in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Combine 2 tablespoons spicy brown mustard, 1/2 cup milk, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Pour over sandwiches. Bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Cut into 8 servings. Serve warm.

Rinse liver with cold water, drain welldab dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepperset aside. Combine flour, parsley, and pepperspread on a baking sheet or shallow dish. Heat enough oil to come 3/4 inch above panset aside. Heat margarine in a large skillet over medium-high heat until meltedadd onion and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutesadd wine and cook for about 1 minuteremove from heat. Dredge liver pieces in flour mixturedip into the egg mixturethen roll in onion mixturetransfer to a wire rack set inside a baking sheetrefrigerate for 1 hour. Meanwhile heat a deep heavy skillet over medium-high heatadd enough oil to fill pan 3/4 inch deepheat to 375 degrees Fadd liver pieces, and cook until golden brown on all sides, 5 to 7 minutesdrain on paper towelskeep warm. Serve livers warm with bread for dipping.

Peel and slice potatoes. Place in large bowl of cold water for 30 minutes or soak in ice water for 1 hour. Remove from water and drain. Add mayonnaise, sour cream, lime zest, juice of 1 lime, lime leaves, thyme, salt and pepper in another large bowl. Add potatoes to the mixture. Mix well and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Just before serving add more lime juice to taste.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Prepare the oven racks for baking by lining them with baking spray.Slice the sausage into 1/4-inch slices.In a small bowl, mix together the cheese, ranch dressing and olives.Take a wonton wrapper and place a slice of the sausage in the center. Dip your finger in the cheese mixture and run the mixture around the sides of the sausage. Fold the wrapper in half so that the wrapper completely encases the sausage and seal it by pressing on the edges.Place each wonton on the prepared racks so that they are slightly touching.Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes, or until the wontons are lightly browned on top. Serve immediately with additional ranch dressing if desired.

Melt white chocolate with hot whole milk in saucepan over low heat until melted, stirring often. Remove from heat. Stir in coffee. Pour into mugs and sprinkle with chocolate sprinkles. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400. Beat egg and add milk. In separate bowl combine dry ingredients and spices and mix well. Fold wet into dry and stir raisins into mixture. Spoon into greased muffin cups and bake 25 minutes or until done.

Heat olive oil and saute onion and garlic until soft. Add ginger and cook for about 10 seconds. Add the chicken breasts. Saute about 3-4 minutes per side or until the juices run clear. Add the peaches and red pepper. Cook until the peaches are slightly soft and the red pepper is a bit wilted.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Arrange the sliced vegetables on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with the olive oil, butter, orange juice and the salt and pepper. Toss to coat evenly. Bake 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender when pierced with a fork. Toss again, sprinkle with dill and serve immediately.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a slow cooker. Add chops and rosemary. Cook on low for 5 hours. Remove from slow cooker and place on a serving platter. Pour cooking liquid over the top. Garnish with parsley.

Prepare the oven to broil. Broil the potatoes until the skins are brown. Cut the sausage into 1/2-inch slices. Heat the oil in a saute pan over high heat. When it is very hot, add the fennel bulb and the sausage slices and saute until brown, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the broilersprinkle them with the raclette cheese and place them under the broiler until the cheese is melted. Serve the potatoes in a shallow bowl with the fennel bulb, sausage slices, cornichons, and french bread.

Mix flour, soda and salt together. Cut in shortening with pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add brown sugar, raisins and nuts. Stir in milk until dough is soft enough to roll out. Roll out on floured surface about 1/4-inch thick. Cut with floured 1 1/2-inch cookie cutters or knife. Place on greased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until light brown on bottom. Serve hot with butter and syrup or powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). In a large skillet, heat butter over medium high heat. Sprinkle beef with flour and brown well. Remove roast from pan and set aside. Add garlic and saute in drippings until lightly browned. Add onions and cook until tender, stirring frequently. Stir in tomato paste and cayenne pepper. Add bay leaves and pour in beer. Return roast to pan and bring to a boil. Cover and transfer to a 6-quart (6 L) slow cooker. Cook 8 hours on low, or until tender. Remove roast from pan and set aside. Stir in parsley and cook on high for 15 minutes to blend flavours. Carve roast and serve with vegetables and gravy.

In a small bowl, mix the spaghetti sauce and butter. Melt over medium heat. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the flour tortillas, one at a time. Sprinkle each half of the tortillas with 1/4 cup sauce and 1/2 cup of the shredded cheese. Add the meat and top each half of the tortillas with 1/4 cup of the remaining sauce. Sprinkle each half of the tortillas with 1/4 cup sauce and 1/2 cup of the shredded cheese. Add the meat and top each half of the tortillas with 1/4 cup of the remaining sauce. Sprinkle each half of the tortillas with 1/4 cup sauce and 1/2 cup of the shredded cheese. Add the meat and top each half of the tortillas with 1/4 cup of the remaining sauce. Sprinkle each half of the tortillas with 1/4 cup sauce and 1/2 cup of the shredded cheese. Top each half of the tortillas with 1/4 cup of the remaining sauce.

Beat egg, buttermilk and spices in a small bowl. Place flour in another small bowl. Heat oil in a deep fryer. Dip chicken in buttermilk mixture then coat with the flour mixture. Lower into hot oil and cook until golden brown and crispy on all sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

In a small bowl, combine the juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, and Tabasco sauceset aside. In a large resealable plastic bag or other large container with a tight-fitting lid, combine the chicken wings with the sauceseal the bag and turn to coat. Chill for 2 hours. When ready to cook, preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the chicken wings on a baking sheet, and bake for 30 to 45 minutes, or until cooked through. Drain the wings, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the cranberry sauce with the reserved cooking liquidcook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Serve with the chicken wings.
Melt butter. Add flour and stir constantly. Add broth and water gradually. Add chipotle peppers. Season to taste. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream. Serve over your favorite taco salad.

In a large stockpot bring the tamarind paste and water to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened to desired consistency. Remove from heat and stir in palm sugar and tomatoes. Season with the fish sauce and red chile. Add the celery and simmer for 1 minute. Add the cod and simmer until the fish flakes easily. Serve with bean sprouts and mint.
In a medium bowl combine Braunschweiger, onion, chili sauce, mayonnaise, cream cheese and green olives. Shape into a ball and refrigerate for 24 hours. Serve with crackers.

Toast the peppercorns in a skillet over medium heat until fragrant and lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a spice grinder or mortar, then add the corn syrup, lime juice and dried mint and grind into a smooth paste. Rub into the cut side of the pineapple wedges, then let sit 10 minutes. Heat grill to medium-high (or preheat broiler). Grill or broil until browned on one side and tender, about 3 minutes per side for grilling or 30 seconds per side for broiling. Sprinkle with lime zest and serve with fresh mint.

Lightly coat each filet with the seasoned flour. In a large nonstick skillet, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the sole and cook about 4 minutes per side or until golden brown and flaky. Set aside. In the same skillet, add the fresh lemon juice and cook until mixture thickens. Add the fresh parsley and stir. Pour over the sole and serve.

Beat eggs in a bowl. Place crescent roll dough on a cookie sheet. Spread with egg mixture. Layer with slices of salami and cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Brown the sausage with onion and garlic until cooked through. Drain fat and add greek seasoning and mayonnaise and cook until heated through. Stir in the parmesan cheese and artichokes and serve with tortilla chips.

Season rib eyes with garlic powder and herbs. Heat a little oil in a non-stick skillet and place steaks in pan. Cook over medium-high heat 3 minutes per side. Remove from pan and drizzle each steak with a little lemon juice and sprinkle with feta. Serve steak with a few olives.
Preheat oven to 450 F degrees. Place olive oil in a bowl. Roll peas around in oil coating them well. Place on a baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes. Serve with chives sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare brownie mix as directed on package. Spread in a greased and floured 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely. In a medium bowl, beat ice cream until soft. Fold in powdered sugar and nuts. Spread over cooled brownie layer. In a double boiler, melt chocolate and butter. Stir in evaporated milk and vanilla until well blended. Pour over ice cream layer. Chill until firm. Store in refrigerator.

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water until tender yet firm to bite. Add broth and cook 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook 2 minutes more. Add carrots, green pepper, broccoli, tomatoes, dried tomatoes. Heat through. Season to taste with salt, basil and parmesan. Serves 4.
In a large bowl combine cream cheese, milk and pie filling. Fold in the marshmallows. Fold in the nuts. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Fold in the cool whip. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Cook ravioli according to package directions. Drain. In a sauce pan, bring 1 cup water to a boil. Add sauce mix, stirring until thickened. Stir in cream. Serve over ravioli and top with parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in medium saute pan over medium heat. Add shallots and saute until translucent. Add mushrooms and wine. Cook until liquid is reduced by half and mushrooms are tender. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add penne and cook until al dente. Drain and return to pan. Add mascarpone and parmesan. Toss to combine. Serve with extra cheese.

Cook spinach according to package directions. Drain well and set aside. In a skillet, saute onion and garlic in butter until tender. Stir in spinach, lemon pepper, salt, and fresh nutmeg. Heat through. Top with parmesan cheese.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine garlic and mayonnaise. Whisk until smooth. Add lemon juice, parsley, salt & pepper to taste and whisk until well combined. Remove from heat. Set aside to cool to room temperature. In a large bowl, add potatoes and toss with enough olive oil to coat them evenly. Pour into a single layer onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and toss to coat evenly with aioli. Return to oven for another 5-10 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Serve warm.

Mix ground beef with the next 7 ingredients. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter. Add ground beef mixture. Cook, stirring often until no longer pink. Drain off excess fat. Add cornstarch and water to thin. Stir in frozen hash browns. Heat through. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with salad.

Slice onion, green pepper, & celery into small dice. Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add onion, green pepper & celerysaute for 3 minutes. Add tomato sauce & stewed tomatoessimmer for 10 minutes. Add chili powder & salt. Heat through. Place swordfish steaks in skilletcook for 5 minutes per side. Serve over rice.

In medium mixing bowl beat cream cheese at medium speed of an electric mixer until softened. Add the beef bouillon cube dissolved in the boiling water and the garlic powder. Stir well. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

In small bowl, whisk together oil, red wine vinegar and balsamic. Add dijon and tarragonwhisk. Season with salt and pepper. Place mushrooms in individual bowls. Drain watercressarrange over mushrooms. Top with chives. Drizzle salad dressing over salads. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 12 muffin cups with nonstick spray. Cut sandwich bread slices into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Place 2 rounds of bread on bottom of each muffin cup. Top with 1 teaspoon cheese and 1 teaspoon ham. Add an egg to each cup. Cover with remaining bread slices. Bake about 20 minutes or until tops are golden brown and yolks are set. Serve warm.

Pour 2 ounces of gin into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Fill the rest of the glass with ginger ale. Garnish with a fresh cherry on top of the glass. Drink the contents of the glass through the cherry, which will act as your straw. Repeat until the drink is gone.

Poke holes in the biscuits with a fork. Place biscuits in a single layer on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 1 minute. Dip each biscuit hole into orange juice. In a small bowl mix together 2 tablespoons granulated sugar and 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon. Roll each biscuit hole into sugar mixture. Makes 24.

Cream together butter and sugars until light and creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in vanilla. Combine dry ingredients and add to butter mixture. Mix well. Spread in a well greased 9×13 pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Cool on pan. Sprinkle with white chocolate and toasted macadamia nuts. Cool to room temperature before cutting into squares.

1. In a wok or deep pan add 3/4 inch of oil. Heat until hot enough to fry. 2. Add 5 to 6 egg roll wrappers at a time. Fry until golden brown on both sides. 3. Place on paper towel to drain. 4. Add cabbage mixture to the pan. 5. Add the rest of the ingredients. 6. Stir until mixture is heated. 7. Fill the wrapper with a spoonful of the cabbage mixture. Roll the wrapper. 8. Place on a serving dish. 9. Serve hot or cold with duck or sweet and sour sauce.

Place bacon in crock pot. Cook on high until fat is rendered. Drain fat from crock pot. Saute onions until tender. Add other ingredients. Cook on low 6 to 8 hours. Remove any fat from top of bean mixture before serving. Serve over hot dog buns or french bread slices topped with sliced dill pickles.
Heat oil in heavy skillet. Add vegetables. Cook and stir until vegetables are crisp tender. Add tomato sauce, sugar, vinegar, salt, pepper. Cook and stir until thickened. Stir in mustard.

Combine flour, eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, applesauce and pecans. Beat until well blended. In separate bowl combine pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, and baking powder. Add to applesauce mixture. Stir in sour cream. Pour into greased and floured 9x5 loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50-60 minutes. Makes 1 loaf.

In a 9 x 13-inch baking dish spread margarine evenly over bottom of dish. Combine Bisquick, sugar, milk and eggspour over the margarine evenly in the dish. Bake for 50 minutes or until center is set. Meanwhile brown sausage, drain fat. Stir into casserole in the last 5 minutes of baking. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into 8 pieces. Serves 8.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9×9 inch baking dish with foil or parchment paper. Combine the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Add the wet ingredients. Stir until a dough forms. Press the dough into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool. Cut into 10 squares. Store in the fridge.

Mix peas and rice together. Add 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. Meanwhile brown the pork in the oil. Add the remaining ingredients and cook for 2 minutes. Stir into rice and simmer until heated through. Garnish with green onions.
Mix first 4 ingredients. Shape into 4 patties. Cook and brown 5 minutes on each side. Place on buns. Top with lettuce, tomato and onion. Makes 4 sandwiches.

To make the dressing, heat the oil and garlic over medium heat. Cook until garlic is golden. Add the mustard and let the mixture bubble for one minute. Stir in the vinegar. Cool completely.To make the salad, mix the dill and radicchio in a serving bowl. Add the artichoke hearts and toss. Drizzle with the vinaigrette. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. In a large bowl, cream together the brown sugar, sugar and shortening until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla. In another bowl combine the flour, baking soda, salt, toffee bits and mini chocolate chip. Stir into the creamed mixture just until combined. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for a few minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Mix the ice cream and cereal together in a large bowl until thoroughly mixed and coated. Add the shortening and mix well until all the cereal has been coated. Add the white chocolate chips and stir until all the chips are melted and the mixture is sticky and pliable. Refrigerate for 1 hour and then roll into balls and place on a wax paper-covered baking sheet. Refrigerate for 10 minutes until firm. Melt the remaining white chocolate in the microwave and use it to dip the balls into. Place on a wax paper-covered baking sheet to set and cool. Makes 20 to 25 balls.

In a large bowl combine soup and milk. Stir in ham and onion. Add potatoes and stir. Spread into a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with swiss and cheddar cheeses. Bake uncovered at 350 for 40 minutes or until bubbly.

In large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in 2 cans of sweetened condensed milk. Add 4 cups lemonade concentrate. Blend well. Fold in whipped topping. Spread into graham cracker crust. Refrigerate. Drizzle on colored whipped topping before serving.

Cut bacon into 2 inch strips. Cut prawns in half lengthwise with shell on. Thread 2 strips of bacon onto each skewer followed by 2 prawn halves. Brush with olive oil. Season with black pepper. Grill over hot coals or on a gas grill for 3 minutes or until pink and crisp bacon is cooked through. Squeeze lemon juice over them just before serving. Serves 4 as an appetizer. Serves 2 as an entree.

Boil the potato and mash until smooth. Add flour, nutmeg, egg and salt. Make into a dough. Roll out on floured board to 1/2 inch thick. Cut into 1 inch squares. Boil in salted water. Add butter and parsley. Serve.
Mix first 6 ingredients in a bowl. Spoon into 4 tall glasses. Garnish with mint sprigs if desired.

To prepare the crust combine 6 cups of crushed graham crackers with 1/4 cup melted butter and 1/4 tsp of cinnamon. Press into a 9 inch pie dish. Combine 1 package of instant vanilla pudding mix with 1 1/4 cups of milk. Beat with a mixer until smooth. Beat in 1 1/2 cups of cool whip. Combine 1/3 cup of fat free cool whip with 2 tsp of vanilla and 2 tsp of Splenda. Beat with a mixer. Fold into the cheesecake. Layer the pie with sliced bananas and the remaining 1/2 cup of cool whip. Refrigerate for 6 hours.

Wash strawberries, remove stems, peel and slice. Remove seeds from kiwi fruits and peach slices. Set aside to drain. Combine 1/4 cup boiling water with 1 1/2 tsp nutrasweet. Cool. Add 1 cup water to make 2 cups. Combine kiwi and strawberry slices with nutrasweet water. Pour into 4 paper cups. Freeze 4 hours or overnight. To serve, insert wooden popsicle sticks. Garnish with peach slices, if desired. Serve immediately or store in freezer.

Heat oil in a pan. Add chicken and cook until golden. Remove from pan. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Return chicken to the pan and simmer for about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Serve with sour cream and sprinkle with smoked paprika.
Combine raisins, nuts and honey. Mix well. Spread on a flat tray. Sprinkle with coconut. Store in an airtight container.

Marinate wings overnight. When ready to cook, heat oil. Add gingerroot, green onion, and garlic. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Add wings and cook 20 to 25 minutes. Add remaining ingredients, cook 15 to 20 more minutes. Turn wings to brown evenly. Serves 4.

Cream the butter and sugar together until light & fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla essence. Sift in the flour, a little at a time, until the mixture is soft enough to roll into balls. Chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Roll into balls and place on a tray lined with baking paper. Flatten slightly with the base of a small drinking glass dipped in a little flour. Bake in a hot oven (200c/400f/gas 6) until golden. Sprinkle with the mixed fruit while still hot.
In food processor, mix ground pork with eggs and breadcrumbs. Add onion flakes and parsley. Dip meat mixture into flour and brown in skillet. Add garlic and cook 2-3 minutes. Serve with potato salad.

Combine the water, Splenda and lime juice in the blender container. Peel the watermelon and cut it into 1 inch cubes. Peel the cucumber and cut it in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds from the middle of the cucumber. Cut into 1 inch cubes. Blend watermelon and cucumber cubes in the blender. Pour into bowl and serve. Makes 4 servings.

Boil potatoes. Drain and return to pan. Add butter and milk and mash until smooth. Stir in Dijon and seasonings to taste. Fill each potato skin with 1/4 cup broccoli and 1/4 cup ham. Top each with cheese and bake at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and potato tops are crispy.

Bring 3 quarts salted water to boil. Cook shells 8-10 minutes or until tender but firm. Drain. Cool slightly. In a large bowl mix crabmeat, shrimp, celery, onion, pimiento, salad dressing, cheese, salt, and pepper. Stuff each shell with the crab mixture. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours or overnight.

Combine the butter and all the other ingredients in a small bowl. Put the butter in a plastic bag and then put the fish in the bag and seal tightly with the fish in the bag. Refrigerate overnight to marinate. Grill the fish 4 to 5 minutes on each side and serve with the almonds on top.

Heat oven to 325 degrees F. Spray a 2-quart round casserole with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine rice and boiling waterstir until water is absorbed. In a small bowl combine butter, oil, and saltmix well. Add to rice mixture and stir until moistened. Spread mixture into casserole. Cover with foil. Bake for 40 minutes. Uncoverbake for another 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Bring broth to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in ricecover and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in carrots and onion. Beat egg and stir into mixture. Stir in 1/2 cup cheese. Spoon mixture into a lightly greased 13x9x2-in. baking pan. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 375° for 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

Slice open red pepper and remove seeds. Place in a bowl. Add garlic and balsamic vinegar and let stand 10 minutes. Drain off liquid into a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and let cool. Strain and chill liquid until cold. Discard peppers. In a blender combine liquid, basil, and parmesan cheese. With blender running, slowly add olive oil and water. Blend until smooth. Season to taste.

Add the milk and broth to a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Gradually add the polenta and whisk to prevent lumps from forming, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring often and adding the salt and pepper to taste, for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the polenta is tender and creamy. Remove from the heat and stir in the herbs and 1 cup of the butter and the cheese, and stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c).In a bowl combine eggs, cream cheese and garlic powder. Add tomato sauce and mix well. Stir in the italian seasoning. Lay out 4 pieces of parchment paper. Place a piece of parchment on a baking sheet. Divide the tomato sauce mixture into 4 equal portions. Spoon the mixture onto the parchment. Sprinkle with the parmesan and romano cheeses. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Cut into 4 equal wedges. Serve warm or cold.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add salt to taste and cook pasta according to the package directions for al dente. Drain pasta and set aside. In a medium frying pan heat 2 tbs of butter over medium heat until bubbly. Add kasseri cheese and mizithra cheese. Stir until melted. Remove from heat. In a large bowl combine the cooked pasta with the melted cheese and 2 tbs of butter. Toss to coat completely. Serve hot with a sprinkling of fresh parsley for garnish.

Clean the mushrooms by wiping them with a damp paper towel. Saut them in a heavy saucepan with a little butter and the onion. When they are browned add the flour, mix well and then add the bouillon cubes. When the soup begins to thicken add the milk a little at a time until the desired consistency is reached. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat the broiler to high. Place the cheese on a sheet pan and broil until it starts to brown. Let cool slightly. In a small bowl, whisk the oil and vinegar until emulsified. Season to taste. Arrange the arugula on a serving plate and drizzle the dressing over the top. Divide the cheese among the plates and top each portion with a spoonful of quince paste.

Grind green gram to fine powder in a blender. Soak it in water for 10-15 minutes. Grind green chilies and ginger-garlic to fine paste in a blender. Take the soaked gram in a bowl and add spinach, green chilly paste, ginger-garlic paste, baking soda, salt to taste. Mix well. Add rava (semolina) slowly to the batter. Mix well. Add 1-2 tsp of oil to the batter. Pour 1 tbsp of batter each in waffle iron and cook for 1-2 minutes until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney or tomato ketchup.

Boil cauliflower, carrots, celery, water until tender. Melt margarine in saucepan. Blend cauliflower mixture. Add evaporated milk, salt. Stir until hot. Add cheddar cheese. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in frozen peas. Heat through.

In a medium bowl, stir together honey and butter until blended. Stir in egg yolk until combined. In a large bowl combine flour, oats, baking soda, and saltstir well. Stir flour mixture into honey mixture just until dry ingredients are moistened. Fold in pecans and chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12-14 minutes or until light golden brown. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rackcool. Store in airtight container. Makes about 5 dozen.
Simmer brussels sprouts in beer with a dash of salt and pepper for 10 minutes. Drain and saute in a pan with a little more butter for a minute or two. Serve with bacon or without bacon.

Prepared pizza crust according to package directions. Spread with oil. Top with onions and cheese. Bake as directed. Remove from oven and add roasted peppers. Sprinkle with oregano and thyme. Add basil. Cut into 8 wedges and serve.

Place a crescent roll into a 10-inch pizza pan. Spread with butter. Arrange sliced mushrooms over crescent roll. Sprinkle with red onion. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with herbes de provence. Sprinkle with garlic powder and cracked black pepper. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 13-15 minutes or until crescent roll is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Cut into 4 wedges. Serve hot with a side salad.

Boil water and cook the pasta according to package directions. Heat the olive oil and add the carrots and green onions and cook until softened. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Stir in the pasta and toss to combine. Add the Alfredo sauce and the Parmesan cheese and toss to combine. Top with fresh basil and season with salt and pepper.

In a small bowl, combine water and vinegar. Bring to a boil and stir in sugar until dissolved. Stir in fish sauce and cayenne. Stir in the carrot. Cook until the carrot is tender. Transfer to a blender and add the mint and chili. Blend until pureed. Pour through a strainer into a bowl. Sprinkle with the chopped peanuts. Serve cold.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and shallot. Cook for 4 minutes. Add the broth, sherry, pepper and salt. Cook until the liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes. Add the broccoli and cook for 1 minute. Serve immediately.
Spread evenly the yellow cake mix in a buttered 2 qt. Pyrex dish. Sprinkle with crushed pineapple and applesauce. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat the oven to 375f degrees. Crush the gingersnaps in a food processor until it resembles fine crumbs. In a medium bowl, mix together the gingersnap crumbs and butter until it comes together as a dough. Spread the dough into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. Slice the pears and arrange in rows on top of the dough in the pie plate. Drizzle the lemon juice over the pears and arrange the walnuts over the top. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes and serve warm.
Whisk together first 4 ingredients until smooth. Add 2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar. Whisk again. Add salt and pepper to taste. Store, covered, in refrigerator up to 1 week. Shake well before using.
Preheat oven to 375. Cream oil and sugar. Add vanilla and bananas. Combine dry ingredients. Add to wet mixture. Add eggs and chips. Fill muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake 18 to 20 minutes.

Tear off 4 squares of parchment paper. In each square place 1/4 of the vegetables in a single layer. Add a sprinkling of the feta cheese. Drizzle each square with 1 teaspoon of the oil. Sprinkle each square with 1/8 teaspoon each of the basil and oregano. Fold the sides of the paper to form a pouch. Bring up the ends of the paper to form a top. Bring the ends together. Secure with kitchen twine. Place the packets on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat the peanut oil in a wok or large saut pan over medium high heat. Add the gingerroot and garlic. Cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant but not browned, about 2 minutes. Add the choy sum leaves and stir fry until they are just wilted but the stems are still crunchy, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the water chestnuts and cook until they begin to soften a bit, about 1 minute. Add the soy sauce, chicken broth and sugarstir well and cook until the broth has thickened a bit, 2 to 3 minutes more. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400. Beat sugar, butter and eggs until smooth and creamy. Add milk and blend. Sift dry ingredients together. Add dry and wet together. Fold in nuts and carrots. Divide into 12 muffin cups. Bake for 25 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

In large bowl combine raspberry puree, sugar and lemon juice. Beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add sugar to egg whites, beating until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into raspberry mixture. Pour into a 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 45 minutes or until center is set. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 4 hours.
Sift flour, sugar, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, milk and onions into a mixing bowl. Mix well. Drop by the spoonful onto a greased baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.

Boil potatoes until they are just tender. Drain them and pour over them some of the bacon fat and caraway seeds. Let this mixture cool while you cook the cauliflower in the remaining bacon fat. When the cauliflower is crisp tender add the chopped onion and cook for a few minutes. Drain the cauliflower mixture, reserving the fat. Mash the potatoes with the cauliflower mixture, adding enough fat to make the mixture smooth. Add the hard cooked eggs, the bacon, chopped green onions and the remaining bacon fat. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper and mayonnaise. Mix well and serve chilled.
Sift together the dry ingredients. Mix the wet ingredients. Stir into the dry ingredients. Spoon into well greased paper lined muffin cups. Bake 350 for 25 minutes.
Cook spaghetti according to directions. Drain. Combine cream cheese, sour cream, spaghetti sauce in a saucepan. Add spaghetti and stir until heated through. Serve with parmesan cheese on top.

Peel and core apples, leaving stems attached. Cut each apple in half lengthwise. Divide figs and nuts among apples. Brush each half of apple with lemon juice. Add brown sugar and cinnamon to apples. Bake for 30 minutes or until the apples are tender when pierced with fork. Serve warm.

Cut the crusts off the bread. Split it in half. Spread some mayonnaise on each half. Cut the crusts off the bread. Split it in half. Spread some mayonnaise on each half. Top one half with a layer of tomatoes, bacon, lettuce, salt, pepper, and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese. Close the sandwich and slice it into 4 wedges. Dip each wedge into the breadcrumb mixture before frying.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add dijon mustard, worcestershire sauce and garlic salt. Brush each breast with butter mixture. Press breadcrumbs onto each breast. Bake at 425 for 20 minutes or until done. Top with remaining 1/2 cup parmesan cheese. Broil on high 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Combine dark sesame oil, light olive oil, minced garlic cloves, hot pepper flakes, firm tofu and cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Add soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, turbinado sugar and cook for 5 minutes more. Add pasta and toss with sauce. Add broccoli florets. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes and cook 3 to 4 minutes. Add chicken, poultry seasoning and cook 2 to 3 minutes until chicken is golden brown. Stir in dried cherries. Cook 2 to 3 minutes longer until cherries are heated through. Serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In 10-inch skillet, cook bacon until crispdrain on paper towels. In 1-1/2-quart casserole or skillet, combine cream, water and parmesan cheeseheat until just boiling. Add egg, stirring to blendreturn to boiling. Reduce heat to medium-lowsimmer, uncovered, 4 minutes or until egg is just set. Remove from heatstir in bacon, green onion, mustard greens, pepper and salt to tastecover tightly with aluminum foil and place in 350 degree F oven for 5 minutes to heat through. Remove from oven and place on serving platter. Drizzle with olive oil flavored cooking spray to serve.
Peel and pit the avocados. Cut the onions into small chunks and add to the avocado. Add the tomatoes and hot sauce. Salt to taste. Gently mix. Garnish with the cilantro.

Preheat grill to medium heat. In a small bowl mix together all the above ingredients. Brush mixture onto both sides of fish. Grill fish 3-4 minutes per side. Remove fish from grill when cooked through. Serve immediately.
