Cream together peanut butter and butter. Add powdered sugar and brown sugar, beating until fluffy. Add chocolate chips. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto a baking sheet lined with wax paper. Let cool, then store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet, heat olive oil. Saut garlic clove for 30 seconds. Add parsley and stir. Add drumsticks and brown for 3 minutes. Add white wine vinegar and stir well. Place in oven and bake 45 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve with pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 425f. In saucepan, melt butter. Add flour and mustard powder. Add milk and cook until smooth. Add cheddar and vegetables and simmer until tender. Spoon mixture into unbaked 9-inch pie crust. Sprinkle with chives and bake at 425f for 25-30 minutes. Serve warm.

Put the first 6 ingredients in a large teapot and cover with 4 cups boiling water. Steep for 10 minutes. Add tea bags and steep an additional 5 minutes. Strain the mixture into 4 mugs and add maple syrup and soymilk to taste. Serve hot.

In a small bowl combine the sour cream and taco sauce. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Coat with cooking spray. Cook the chicken until no longer pink. Add the beans and cook for 2-3 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the sour cream mixture. Cook until heated through. Serve on the tortillas topped with the cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Combine first 5 ingredients in medium bowl. In a large bowl, combine dry milk powder, egg whites, syrup, vanilla, and walnuts. Beat 2 minutes or until well blended. Add to flour mixture. Beat just until dry ingredients are moistened. Spread in prepared pan. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack.

In a large bowl combine all of the ingredients except for the strawberries. Mix to combine. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes to an hour or until the dip is firm enough to scoop out of the bowl. Remove the bowl from the fridge and scrape the dip into a serving bowl or a small casserole dish. Place the strawberries on the bottom of the dish or bowl. Spread the dip over the top of the strawberries. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 48 hours before serving.

Mix the water and the cornmeal in an iron skillet or saucepan. Add the salt and mix well. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cook for 5 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve hot with syrup or butter.

Combine milk, heavy cream, white chocolate chips, pure vanilla, and pumpkin pie spice in a small saucepan over low heat. Heat until mixture is hot but not boiling. Remove from heat and serve with a dollop of whipped cream.

In blender container combine orange drink mix and sugarblend on medium speed until smooth. Add tea and blend. Add lemonade mix and blend well. Add cherry drink mix and blend well. Add cinnamon and nutmegblend well. Serve over crushed ice. Garnish with cherry and orange slices.

Cook pasta according to directions. Melt butter in large skillet. Add flour and stir well. Add milk and stir. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Add salt and pepper and stir. Cook for 1 minute. Add cheeses and stir. Cook over low heat until cheeses melt. Stir in lemon juice. Stir in pasta and serve.

In a medium saucepan, combine the chocolate with the condensed milk and stir over low heat until the mixture is smooth. Remove from the heat. Stir in the salt and vanilla. In a small saucepan over boiling water, heat the water until it begins to boil. Add the boiling water to the chocolate mixture and stir. Remove from the heat and add the ground cinnamon. Serve in a bowl or mugs and top with whipped cream.
Brown meat and drain. Saute garlic. Mix all other ingredients. Simmer 2 hours. Makes 4 pints.

Preheat oven to 375. In a 13x9 baking dish place chicken in pan. Salt and pepper to your taste. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and turn chicken over and pour wine over it. Pour mustard over chicken and sprinkle with brown sugar. Bake uncovered for 30 more minutes.

In a blender, combine milk, cool whip and pudding mix. Blend for a few seconds, then add coffee and blend for a few seconds more. Place in the freezer and let freeze for a few hours or overnight. Scoop into bowl and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Slice french bread lengthwise and remove a thin slice from each side. Place bread slices on baking sheet. In a bowl combine the cream cheese and mozzarella. Spread evenly over bread. Mix green onion with garlic salt. Sprinkle over mozzarella. Bake 15 minutes until melted. Serve immediately.

Mix butter, Worcestershire, garlic, jelly and mustard in a small bowl. Marinate the chicken in the mixture for 1 hour. Grill or bake. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl and use as a glaze for the last 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Rub butter over beef. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with oil. Sprinkle with rosemary and thyme. Roast uncovered for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 325f and continue baking until a thermometer inserted into the center of the beef registers 130f for medium rare or 140f for medium. Transfer to a carving board. Carve into thick slices. Yields 1 slice per serving.

Preheat oven to 425 F 220 C . Make short crust pastry and chill while making filling. In a skillet saute onion in a small amount of olive oil until tender but not brown. Add carrot, stir to combine. Add beef, sausage and black pepper to taste. Add mixed vegetables and enough milk to moisten. Stir until well mixed. Roll out the shortcrust pastry on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thick. Cut into 5 inch circles with a biscuit cutter or drinking glass. Place 1/4 cup filling in center of each circle. Fold dough in half to form a half moon shape and pinch edges together to seal. Crimp edges with a fork or cut out leaf shapes with a pastry wheel. Brush top with a light coat of milk or beaten egg and sprinkle with coarse sea salt if desired. Place on a parchment lined baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough. Bake in a preheated oven for 20 minutes. Makes 8 pasties.

Prepare greens as directed in recipe. Melt butter in skillet. Add bouillon cube. Stir over low heat until dissolved. Add nutmeg, summer savory and pepper. Add greens. Cook 30 minutes. Add vinegar. Stir to mix. Add flour. Cook 5 minutes. Add sugar and cook 5 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet brown meat in oil. Drain. Add onions soup mix. Stir to combine. Add vegetable juice and seasonings. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add vegetables. Simmer until veggies are tender. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a medium bowl stir together flour, cornmeal, sugar and salt. In another medium bowl whisk together buttermilk, eggs and sweet corn. Add wet mixture to dry ingredients and mix gently just until combined. Spoon batter into paper-lined muffin cups. Bake until tops are golden brown and a cake tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 18 to 20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Heat large pot filled 1/2 full of water to boiling. Add linguine. Cook 2 minutes less than package directions. Add frozen shrimp. Cook until shrimp are pink and cooked through. Drain. Add olive oil. Toss to coat. Add garlic and basil. Toss. Drizzle with butter. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Serve immediately.

Melt margarine in 9 inch cast iron skillet. Remove from heat and sprinkle in flour. Add the cornmeal and brown sugar and mix well. Beat together the egg and the buttermilk in a small bowl and mix into the dry ingredients in the skillet until just moistened. Spoon the batter into the prepared skillet and smooth the top with the back of a spoon or spatula. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly before cutting into wedges to serve warm or at room temperature with prunes on top and margarine or honey to spread on the prunes.

Whisk together soy sauce, lemon juice, olive oil, dried oregano, and garlic in a small bowlset aside. Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Toss pork with half of the marinade in a small bowllet stand for 10 minutes. Thread pork, bell peppers, and onions alternately onto 8 skewersbrush with remaining marinade. Grill until pork is no longer pink in center, about 5 minutes per side. Serve warm with pita bread and tzatziki sauce.

Cream together butter and sugar. Blend in well-beaten egg yolks and milk. Sift together flour, salt, and baking powder. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture and beat until smooth. Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold into the mixture just until blended. Bake in a well-oiled waffle iron.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Peel and dice potatoes. Combine with butter, paprika, garlic powder and pepper in a bowl. Spread into a greased baking dish. Bake for about 1 hour or until fork tender.

Spread butter on the inside of bread slices. Combine beef, egg, onion, soup, salt and pepper to taste. Spread mixture evenly on bottom half of each bread slice. Top with a slice of sharp cheddar cheese. Top with the remaining bread slices. Melt in microwave oven on high for 30 seconds or until cheese melts. Serve immediately.
Put a few ice cubes in a glass and add 2 oz. of vodka. Add a stuffed olive and a slice of lemon or lime. Stir well. Repeat. Add more ice cubes to each glass. Serve with a toothpick.

Place pork in 3- to 4-quart slow cooker. Combine remaining ingredients in small bowlpour over pork. Cover and cook on low until meat is tender, about 8 hours. Remove roast from cookershred with 2 forks. Return meat to cooker. Stir until well combined. Serve with hot rice.

Toast a slice of bread. Spread a layer of pepper jelly on the toasted side. Put a thin layer of meatloaf in the center. Spread a layer of mayo on the other side. Spread another layer of pepper jelly over the meatloaf. Top with the other piece of toasted bread.
Combine steel cut oats and water in a slow cooker. Add the cinnamon and salt. Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 3 hours. Stir in dried fruit before serving.
Soak the wafer crumbs in the coffee and mix with the other ingredients. Press into the bottom of a springform pan. Bake at 350 for 5 minutes. Cool.

In a large saucepan combine chicken stock, couscous, oil, sugar, vinegar, thyme and sultanas. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer till almost all liquid is absorbed. Add carmelised onion. Mix well. Sprinkle with toasted pistachios if desired. Makes 6 servings.

In a large bowl combine the milk, egg, sugar, butter and salt. Whisk until smooth. Add pasta and toss to coat. Sprinkle in cheddar cheese, tossing to coat. Spoon into an 11x7-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 35 minutes or until hot in center, uncovered. Cool slightly before serving.

Combine the corn, beans, and chilies in a large bowl and mix well. In a separate bowl, combine the laughing cow light swiss cheese and cream cheese and mix well. Pour the vegetables into a lightly greased 2-quart casserole dish. Pour the cheese mixture over the vegetables and spread evenly over the top. Bake for 30 minutes at 375 degrees. Serve hot.

Cut off tops from jalapenos. Scoop out seeds and membranes. Fill cavity with 1/2 teaspoon of jelly. Add a pinch of cumin. Top with a slice of bacon. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until bacon is crisp and top is golden. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar.

Mix together apple juice and corn syrup in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon. Remove from heat and stir in dried oranges. Cool completely. Spread apple slices with applesauce. Sprinkle vanilla over the top of each slice. Roll up each slice and secure with wooden skewer. Drizzle with orange mixture.
Mix berries with sugar, rind and salt. Cook until thick. Pour into unbaked pie shells. Cover with top crust. Seal and flute edges. Bake in moderate oven until done.

Heat the olive oil in a large sauce pan. Saute the onion until golden. Add the garlic until fragrant. Add the broth. Bring to a boil. Add the tomatoes. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the basil. Add the parmesan cheese. Stir to combine. Serve hot.

Place fennel and garlic in a heavy duty plastic bag. Pound to break apart. Add thyme. Combine with mustard and spices. Toss to coat meat. Place in baking dish. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours. Remove meat from marinade. Place in roasting pan. Bake uncovered 45-50 minutes. Internal temperature 145 degrees. Let rest 10 minutes. Carve and serve.

In a medium bowl beat together 1 egg, 1/2 cup of milk and 1/4 cup of water. Add 1/3 cup of all-purpose flour and 1/8 tsp of salt. Stir until smooth. Cook on a hot griddle. Pour a little batter on the griddle. Cook until brown on the bottom. Turn and brown the other side. Serve hot. Serve with jam or syrup and powdered sugar.

Slice eggplant into 1/4-inch rounds. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt. Place on a baking sheet and bake 20-30 minutes until tender. Remove from the oven and let cool. In a bowl add the eggplant, olives, parsley and oregano. Drizzle with more olive oil and toss. Serve at room temperature.

Mix cake according to box. Pour into bundt pan. Bake as directed on box. In a bowl combine pudding and warm water. Mix until smooth. Cool slightly. Pour over warm cake. Chill several hours. In a microwave safe bowl combine chips and cream. Microwave 1-2 minutes until melted. Add corn syrup. Drizzle over cake. Let stand several hours to set.

In large bowl, mix fruit with 1/2 cup of sugar. Pour in dry red wine and lemon juicemix well. Refrigerate overnight. To serve, place fruit mixture in bottom of tall glassestop with whipped cream. Garnish with mint sprigs or fruit slices. Serve chilled.
Place all ingredients in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings if desired. Serve with tortilla chips or use as a condiment.

Put cashews in bowl of food processor. Add 2 cups of water and process until nuts are very fine. Transfer to large bowl and add dates. Process again until mixture is very smooth. Add cinnamon, nutmeg and butterscotch. Process for 1 minute. Add water and process again. Spoon mixture into individual glasses and chill. To serve, garnish with kiwi.

Cut watermelon into 2-inch chunks and place in blender with 1/3 cup water. Puree until smooth. Add honey and 1/2 teaspoon of the lemon juice and blend until combined. Pour into an ice cube tray or mold and freeze. When cubes are solid, remove from mold and store in an airtight container for up to 2 months. Make 30 ice cubes.
Brown ground beef with chopped onions. Add tomatoes. Add salt. Add noodles. Let cook 10-15 minutes. Add cheese. Serve with crackers.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all ingredients together. Spread into a greased loaf pan. Bake for 60 to 70 minutes or until done. Cool before removing from pan.

Pick through and trim turnip greens and okra. Combine all ingredients except greens and water in small bowl. Stir well and set aside. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat and saute garlic until golden. Add jalapeno peppers and onion and saute 2-3 minutes. Add pine nuts and cook until nuts are golden and mixture is dry. Add greens and cook until tender. Add water and bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 5 minutes more or until greens are tender and liquid is evaporated.
Place a small amount of cream cheese in center of each tortilla. Sprinkle with banana pepper and red bell pepper. Roll up and serve with salsa.

Put water into the mixing bowl. Add yeast and sugar and stir until dissolved. Set aside 5 minutes. Add shortening and salt to water mixture and stir until smooth. Add 2 cups of flour and stir until combined. Add 2 more cups of flour, stirring until well combined. Turn out onto lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes or until smooth. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to coat all sides of dough with oil. Cover with plastic wrap or greased wax paper. Set aside at room temperature for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Punch down the dough with your fist. Divide into 12 equal portions and shape each portion into a ball. Place 1 inch apart on greased baking sheets. Cover with plastic wrap or greased wax paper. Set aside for 30 minutes or until doubled in size again. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and place on wire rack to cool. Makes 1

Combine all ingredients except club soda in large saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Remove from heatcool completely. Add club sodarefrigerate for at least 1 hour. Pour over ice cubes in tall glasses and serve immediately.

Combine sour cream and mayonnaise in small bowl. Blend in mustard and oregano. Blend in blue cheese until smooth. Add lemon juice and garlic oil. Season to taste with black pepper. Add to fresh spinach and toss.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine the chicken breasts and 3/4 cup water. Bring to a boil over high heat and then cover and reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and cool for 5 minutes. Remove chicken from liquid and shred into small pieces. In a large pot add the remaining 3 1/2 cups of water. Add the seasoning mix and stir until dissolved. Add the cannellini and black beans and bring to a boil. Add the mushroom soup and stewed tomatoes and stir to combine. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the shredded chicken and heat for 10 minutes. Stir in 1/4 cup sour cream and heat for 1 minute. Serve hot and garnish with cheese and sour cream. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Pour the melted butter into the bottom of the baking dish, then sprinkle with garlic powder, then parmesan cheese. In a large bowl toss the potato halves in olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place the potatoes cut-side down over the parmesan cheese in the baking dish. Bake for about 40-45 minutes, or until tender.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a medium bowl. Beat until blended. Add pecan halves and toss to coat. Let stand for 1 hour or until mixture is dry. Heat oven to 250 degrees f. Spread mixture onto a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour or until mixture is dry and nuts are fragrant. Let cool completely and store in airtight containers.

Spray 13x9x2 inch baking dish with non stick spray. Cut each roll into 4 piecesarrange in baking dish. In small bowl, combine brown sugar, butter, vanilla pudding mix, 1 cup milk and 2 tablespoons walnuts. Spoon over rolls. In same bowl, combine 1 cup milk with remaining 2 tablespoons walnutssprinkle over top. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake in 350 degree oven for 35-45 minutes or until top is lightly browned.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl mix together mayonnaise, dry mix, milk, and garlic powder. Cool slightly. Add pasta to mixture. Add in remaining ingredients. Refrigerate overnight for best flavor. Serve cold.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the orange juice concentrate and soy sauce until smooth. Add the lemon pepper and garlic, and whisk until the mixture is smooth and fragrant (about 2 minutes). Preheat the grill or a grill pan over medium-high heat. Sprinkle both sides of the chicken breasts with the seasoning blend. Place the chicken on the grill, cover, and cook until the meat is cooked through (about 6 minutes per side). Whisk the honey into the sauce and continue to cook while whisking until the sauce has thickened slightly (about 2 minutes). Serve the sandwiches on the rolls with the arugula and a drizzle of the sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine butter and sugars. Beat well. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat well. Combine flour and baking powder. Add to butter mixture and beat well. Beat in lemon juice and zest. Pour into 9 x 13 pan. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes. Cool and frost with icing. Icing: Combine butter and 2 cups of powdered sugar. Beat until smooth. Add lemon juice and zest. Beat until smooth and spread on cooled cake. Decorate top with fresh cranberries.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly coat a baking sheet with olive oil and spread the carrots out in a single layer. Season with salt and pepper and roast for 15 minutes, or until they begin to get lightly browned around the edges. Remove from oven and drizzle carrots with olive oil and paprika and return them to the oven for 5 minutes more. In a medium bowl, whisk together the orange juice and lemon juice, then add the butter and whisk until it is completely melted and incorporated into the liquid. Whisk in the paprika and season with salt and pepper. Add the hot roasted carrots and toss thoroughly to coat them in the sauce. Serve immediately.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a 8x10 inch glass or ceramic baking dish. Whisk together 3 egg yolks, 2 cups milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon white pepper in a blender or food processor until smooth. Beat 4 egg whites with 2 tablespoons water in another bowl until stiff peaks formset aside. Pour egg yolk mixture into dish over melted buttersprinkle with 1/2 cup grated Jarlsberg cheese (about 1/4 cup) and 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmegspread evenly. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until set (but still moist). Top with 1/2 cup prosciutto slices and remaining Jarlsberg cheesesprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon white pepper. Bake at 350 for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with beaten egg whitessprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon ground

Sift together the whole wheat flour and the unbleached white flour. In a separate bowl combine the baking powder and the salt and set aside. Beat together the eggs, milk and vanilla. Add the dry ingredients to the milk mixture alternately with the melted butter. Fry in a hot well greased griddle or waffle iron.

In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients. In a smaller bowl combine the buttermilk egg and melted butter. Stir into the dry ingredients until just mixed. Drop by teaspoon on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Wash and peel the garnet yam. Cut into 1/4-inch-thick rounds. Place yam rounds on a baking sheet. Place in oven and cook for 1 hour. Remove from oven and set aside. In a 10-inch skillet, melt 4 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat. Add onions and saute 5 minutes. Add pecans and saute 1 minute. Stir in maple syrup and cinnamon. Bring to a boil and cook 2 minutes. Stir in cooked garnet yam rounds. Stir well to coat. Sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon of butter. Serve hot.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add beef and cook until browned. Stir in onion. Drain hash browns and stir into mixture. Add eggs and mix well. Season to taste with salt. Cook until mixture is firm and browned on the edges. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa.

Mix together eggs and garlic salt. Spray skillet with cooking spray, pour egg mixture in the skillet and cook until done. While the egg is cooking, cut the mozzarella in half. Flip the egg over and place half of the mozzarella on the egg. Fold the egg over and place the other half of the mozzarella on top. Let the egg cook for another minute or two until the mozzarella is melted. Cut the egg into four slices and serve.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease an 11-by-7-by-1-inch pan. Separate the dough into three sections. Roll each section into a square. Place two dough squares into the pan and sprinkle with half of the chocolate and half of the corn syrup. Repeat the layering and place the remaining dough square on top. Bake until golden brown, about 1 hour. Cool completely. Cut into squares. Melt the remaining half of the chocolate and the butter and stir until smooth. Drizzle over the bars. Sprinkle with the remaining orange zest. Refrigerate until set.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). In a large bowl, combine the graham crackers and butter until well blended. Spread half of the mixture into an 11 x 7 inch baking dish and bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and spread the cream cheese over the bottom crust. Bake for an additional 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the cinnamon and the remaining crushed graham crackers. Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and spread the blueberry pie filling over the top. Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely before serving with ice cream.

Cook bacon and set aside. Cook onion, potatoes, carrot, and celery until tender. Add cream of potato soup. Simmer until hot. Add milk and american cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Stir in cooked wild rice and bacon. Serve hot.

Place macaroni in a 6-quart rice cooker. Stir in the chicken broth and cream. Season with salt, mustard, paprika and pepper. Add the cheeses and stir. Cover the rice cooker and press the cook button. When the cooker is done cooking, stir and serve.

Heat olive oil in a saute pan over medium-high heat. Add garlic cloves and saute until lightly browned. Cut off tops from rolls. Place a slice of ham in each roll top and a slice of tomato in the bottom. Add a slice of cheese to each sandwich. Drizzle with olive oil to coat. Put the rolls back together and wrap in foil. Serve warm.

Combine berries, sugar, water and lemon zest in a large saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until mixture comes to a boil. Stir in cornstarch. Cook 1 minute or until thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in almond extract and brandy. Chill thoroughly before serving.

Fry onion and mushrooms in margarine until tender. Mix the fish fillets with the onion-mushroom mixture, add the pepper and wine. Put the mixture into a 2-quart baking dish. Combine the milk and flour, stirring until smooth. Stir in paprika. Pour the milk mixture over the fish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Preheat barbecue or broil pan. Cut fillets into strips about 2 inches wide and thread onto skewers alternating with sweet peppers and tomatoes. Brush kebabs with olive oil and sprinkle with cumin, turmeric and red pepper. Broil until meat is medium-rare and vegetables are tender but still firm. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

Combine hazelnuts and balsamic vinegar and let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Add honey and whisk until well blended. In a large bowl combine dressing, crystallized ginger, bartlett pears and lemon juice. Toss to coat. Place lettuce on plates. Spoon dressing over and sprinkle with hazelnuts.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Cut off both ends of each acorn squash. Cut each half in half lengthwise. Scrape out seeds. Rub the inside of each half with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Rub with 1/2 tablespoon of olive oil. Place cut side down on a baking sheet. Roast until tender when pierced with a fork, about 45 minutes. Remove from heat. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon of pepper, 3 garlic cloves, 2 teaspoons of lime juice, 1/4 teaspoon of dried chili pepper flakes, and 1/2 teaspoon of cilantro. Mix well. Drizzle over roasted acorn squash. Serve with cilantro leaves for garnish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. In a large bowl, combine oats, salt, orange zest, and nuts. In a small saucepan, melt butter and combine with maple syrup. Stir into dry ingredients. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Place beans in slow cooker with 8 cups water. Cover. Cook on high for 4 hours. Add remaining ingredients. Stir well. Cook on low for 3 hours or until baked beans are tender. Remove ham hock. Shred meat. Return to slow cooker. Cook for 15 minutes. Serve with the ham.

Cube the winter squash. Saute the winter squash in the butter until it is tender. Add coconut milk and brown sugar. Add vanilla extract and cook for an additional 3 minutes. Salt to taste. Garnish with parsley.

Cream shortening and sugar. Add molasses and egg. Add sifted flour, salt and soda. Then add spices. Dough will be very soft. Roll into walnut sized balls and roll in sugar. Place on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 f for 8 to 10 minutes. Cookies will flatten out while baking.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9 x 13 pan. In large bowl beat 1 pkg cake mix, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 cups water and 1 tsp vanilla. Pour into pan. In another bowl beat 12 oz cool whip until fluffy. Fold in 1 pkg instant vanilla pudding mix with 1 1/2 cups milk and 1/2 cup pineapple juice. Spread over batter. Spread 1 can crushed pineapple over top. Bake 45-50 minutes. Cool. Beat 12 oz cool whip, 1 tsp vanilla with 8 oz cream cheese. Spread over top of cake. Sprinkle with walnuts.

Slice eggplant lengthwise and cut into 1/4 inch slices. Lay slices flat on cutting board. Cut through slices at an angle from each end to form strips. Cut strips into 1/2 inch pieces. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add pepper and eggplant. Cook until pepper is crisp-tender, stirring frequently. Drain. Stir in mint and salt. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve hot or chilled.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9×13 inch baking dish with some of the oil. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heatcook and stir mushrooms in the hot oil until lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in chili powder. Add the chicken breasts to the skilletcook until no longer pink in the center, stirring occasionally, 12 to 15 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes and mushroom mixturecook until thoroughly heated through, 1 to 2 minutes more. Remove from the heat and set aside. In a small bowl, toss together the rice with the garlicspoon half of the mixture onto the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Spread the chicken mixture over the ricetop with the remaining rice mixture. Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, 20 to 25 minutes.

Combine all ingredients except for chicken in a large zip top plastic bag and mix well. Add the chicken and refrigerate overnight. Place the marinated chicken on the grill. Grill for 3-4 minutes per side and then transfer to a large baking pan and place in a 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes.

Slice the blood oranges into wedges and place in a bowl with the fennel bulb slices. Drizzle with the white wine vinegar, then sprinkle with the fresh basil and garlic. Add salt and black pepper to taste. Drizzle with olive oil just before serving.

In a large sauce pan combine white sugar, corn syrup, and chunky peanut butter. Cook over low heat until peanut butter is melted. Stir in chocolate chips and rice crispies until well mixed. Press mixture into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Refrigerate until set, then cut into squares. Makes 20-24 bars.
Cook noodles to taste. Drain. Put noodles in serving bowl. Add remaining ingredients. Toss. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Boil or steam the green beans until tender. Rinse in cold water. Drain well. In a small bowl combine the oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Add the green beans to the dressing mixture and toss to coat well. Chill for at least 3 hours. Stir in the onions. Just before serving, sprinkle with the olives.

Dissolve the dry yeast in the warm water. Add the buttermilk and brown sugar. Let stand 5 minutes. Add the butter, the salt, the caraway seeds and the remaining 1 cup of the flour. Beat 2 minutes at medium speed of electric mixer. Add the remaining 3 cups of the flour and beat 2 minutes more. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured board. Knead in enough of the remaining flour to make a moderately soft dough that is still slightly sticky.

Preheat oven to 200c. Grease an oven tray well with vegetable oil. Wash and cut potatoes into wedges. Combine egg white and spices into a large bowl. Mix well. Add potatoes and coat well. Bake potatoes skin side down for 40 minutes or until tender and golden brown. Serve with a relish or as a side.

In a small bowl, combine everything but the prime rib. Rub the spice mixture all over the roast and refrigerate for 4 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the roast in a roasting pan. Roast for 2 1/2 hours. Add the water to the pan. Roast for another 2 hours. Let sit for 10 minutes before carving.
Toast muffin. Spread with cream cheese. Spread with liquid honey. Top with dried figs. Sprinkle with sunflower seeds.
Mix cake mix according to package directions. Add pudding mix (dry) and eggs. Add water. Pour into greased 9x5x3-inch pan. Sprinkle with poppy seeds. Bake at 350 for 50-55 minutes. Cool.
Place in a wok over high heat. Saute chicken. Add broccoli. Add mango. Add soy sauce. Cook until done. Add snow peas. Add cilantro. Add scallions.

In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients and mix well. Add the pumpkin and the soymilk and mix well. Add the raisins and mix well again. Refrigerate dough for about an hour. Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Drop the dough in teaspoon size rounds onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake for about 12-14 minutes until lightly browned on top. Remove from the oven and cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before removing from the pan.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut chicken into small pieces. Blend milk, cream cheese, seasoned croutons and onion. Add chicken. Divide crescent rolls into 8 portions. Place a portion on each piece of waxed paper. Roll each piece into a ball. Place on baking sheet. Press into round shape. Bake until golden brown. Remove and place on a serving dish. Spoon mixture on top. Sprinkle with pepper.

In a large soup pot, over medium heat, saute onion, carrot and celery in butter until tender. Stir in pearl barley and broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until barley is tender. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. Stir in cream and red pepper flakes and heat until thoroughly heated. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve topped with fresh parsley if desired.
Slice summer squash into 1/2" rounds. Saute in butter until tender. Sprinkle with salt & pepper to taste.
Mix together first 4 ingredients. Whisk in peanut butter until smooth. Add vinegar to taste. Serve over rice or noodles or use as salad dressing.

Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, onions, and bacon. Cook until bacon is crisp. Add broccoli. Cook until tender. Stir in stock. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Puree with potato masher. Add salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve with croutons.

Line a 15x10-inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the corn syrup and butter. Heat until the butter is melted and the mixture is smooth. Stir in the cerealmix well. Pour into the prepared pan and press firmly into the bottom of the pan. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Melt the chocolate in a double boiler over low heat. Pour over the cereal mixture and spread evenly over the top of the cereal layer. Refrigerate until the chocolate is firm, about 2 hours more. Cut the cereal into 1-1/2-inch squares and place the miniature eggs in the center of each piece of cereal. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a heavy medium skillet over medium-high heat, combine the shallots and 1/4 cup orange juice. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the carrots and the remaining 3/4 cup orange juice. Cook until the liquid evaporates and the mixture begins to caramelize. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Stir the honey into the remaining 1/4 cup orange juice. Pour the mixture over the carrots. Toss until the carrots are coated.

Pulse the cream cheese and jack cheese in the food processor until smooth and fluffy. Add the jalapenos and pulse to combine. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and stir in the garlic and green onion. Season the filling with salt and black pepper. To assemble the wontons, place a wonton wrapper in the palm of your hand and place a heaping teaspoon of the filling in the center. Fold the wrapper over the filling to form a triangle. Press the edges together to seal. Repeat with the remaining wonton wrappers and filling. In a large skillet heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the wontons, being careful not to crowd the pan. Brown the wontons for 2-3 minutes per side or until golden. Sprinkle with additional black pepper before serving.

Pour the pineapple, juice and vinegar into a large saucepan. Heat to boilingstir until sugar dissolves. Simmer until reduced to 10 cups. Stir in the rest of the ingredients. Simmer uncovered for 2 minutes. Ladle into 4-6 hot sterilized 1-quart glass jars. Wipe the rims, then seal tightly. Process the jars in a boiling-water canner for 10 minutes. Remove and let stand in the canner until cool.

In a bowl dissolve yeast in warm waterlet stand 5 minutes or until foamy. Stir in buttermilk, oil, sugar, salt, and 1/2 cup of the flour. Stir in enough of the remaining flour to make a soft doughturn onto a lightly floured surfaceknead until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowlcover with plastic wraplet rise in a warm place until doubled in size 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Punch dough downturn onto a lightly floured surfacedivide into 24 pieces. Shape into rollsplace in greased muffin cupscover with plastic wraplet rise in a warm place until doubled in size 30 to 45 minutes. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Wash and dry the apples. Insert the wooden sticks. In a non-metallic pan combine the water and vinegar. Bring to the boil. Remove from the heat and stir in the demerara sugar and butter. Return to the heat until the mixture thickens. Stir in the golden syrup. Stir until the mixture thickens. Remove from the heat and leave until cool enough to handle. Remove the sticks and roll the cooled mixture in a bowl. Place in the fridge until set.

Heat the butter in a large saucepan and saut the leeks until soft. Add the chicken stock and wine and bring to a gentle simmer. Add the bay leaves. Turn off the heat. Add the streaky bacon to the pan. When the bacon has cooked, place half of it on top of the leeks. Stir the cream into the pan. Spoon into a shallow ovenproof dish. Top the dish with the remaining streaky bacon. Place in the oven for 10-15 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

Trim and chop off any tough ends of the bok choy. Cut off the stem end of the beans and snap the beans in half. Spray wok or large skillet with oil. Heat over medium high heat. Add the onion and stir-fry until softened but not browned. Add the bok choy and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. Add the beans and stir-fry until the beans are crisp tender but still retain their bright color. Add the soy sauce and stir-fry until heated through. Taste and adjust seasoning with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Slice banana in slices. Peel and slice oranges. Peel kiwi fruits. Cut grapes in half. Place banana and oranges in a large bowl. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Mix in kiwi and grapes. Add yogurt and mix. Serve immediately.
Slice onions 1/8" thick. Put in buttered baking dish. Mix soup, milk & pepper. Pour over onions. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 350 for 45 minutes or until onions are tender. Serve with french bread.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees f. In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg and water. In another bowl combine the lime zest and juice and the sugar. Stir in the nuts and toss well to coat. Stir in the spices and toss well. Spread nuts in a single layer on baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour. Turn and stir once or twice during baking. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 weeks. Makes about 4 cups.

Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add fennel and onion and cook until softened. Add remaining oil. Increase heat to high, add cayenne pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add wine and cook for 1 minute. Stir in stock, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Heat another pan of water. Once boiling add fish fillets for 4-5 minutes. Remove from pan. Place fennel mixture in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour into soup bowls. Add fish fillets and serve immediately.

Boil the potatoes in the water until soft. Drain and return them to the pot. Add the half-and-half, garlic, kosher salt, and freshly ground black pepper. Mash until smooth. Add the cheese and stir just until it is incorporated.

Melt the butter in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Add the rice, stirring constantly until the butter is absorbed and the rice is lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the cardamom and cinnamon, stirring constantly for about 1 minute more. Whisk in the milk until it is completely incorporated. Increase the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer gently until the rice is tender and the mixture is thick, about 25 minutes. Add the sugar, whisking until dissolved. Stir in the pistachio and honey. Transfer the mixture to individual serving dishes or a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding. Serve chilled or at room temperature. I like my rice pudding a little sweet, so i also added a little bit more sugar than the 2 oz. Called for in the recipe to suit my personal taste.

Cut plantains crosswise into slices 1/2 inches thick. Place in a large saucepan and add water to cover. Bring to the boil and boil for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain and mash to a pulp. Add the butter, allspice, coconut and cloves. Add raw sugar to taste. Bake in a moderate oven for 1 hour. Serve with vanilla ice cream and sauce to taste.

Cut potatoes into 1/4 inch slices and place into crock pot with 2 cups of chicken broth and 2 cubes of chicken bouillon cubes. Cover crock pot and cook on low for 6 hours. In a medium sized saucepan, bring remaining 2 cups of broth to a boil. Add cubes of cream cheese 1 at a time and cook until cream cheese is completely dissolved. Add sour cream and continue stirring until blended. Add 1/2 cup of chicken broth to the cream cheese mixture. Turn crock pot off and add cream cheese mixture. Stir until blended. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. Pierce the squash several times with a knife. Bake until soft to the touch, about 45 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool. In a large bowl combine squash, 1/2 cup of the reserved chai, nutmeg, cinnamon, salt and pepper. Gently mix until evenly combined. Spoon mixture into a 9-inch pie plate. Combine the remaining 1/2 cup of chai with 1/4 cup of milk. Bring to a boil. Pour over squash. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake for 25 minutes or until a golden crust forms.

Heat oil in a large skillet. Add onion and garlic and saute until soft. Add the kielbasa, breaking it up. Add the diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, oregano, parsley and vinegar. Add the penne. Toss and simmer until the sauce thickens. Serve hot.

Make a slit in the bottom of each tomato to allow the filling to be spooned in. Place the tomatoes in a baking pan large enough to hold them snugly. In a small bowl combine the feta cheese, olives, parsley, basil, oil and vinegar. Spoon the mixture into the tomatoes. Pour the juice from the tomato pan over them. Bake 20 minutes or until the tomatoes are tender and the mixture is hot. Serve warm or cold as an appetizer or side dish with bread or pasta.

Cut chicken into cubes or shred. Combine crumbs and ranch mix. Add to chicken and stir well. Form into small patties. Coat patties in egg and then breadcrumbs. Melt butter in skillet and cook over medium heat until brown. Turn once.

Mix eggs with jalapenos. In a large pan heat the butter. Add the egg mixture and stir. When the eggs are cooked, add the cheddar cheese on half of the omelette. Fold the other half over to cover the cheese. Cook for a minute or two more until the cheese is melted. Remove from the pan and serve.

Heat oil over medium-high heat. Sauté pepper and onion until softened (about 2 minutes). Add mushrooms and sauté until softened (about 6 minutes). Transfer vegetables to plate, reserving pan juices. Stir together pan juices and vinegaradd soy sauce and worcestershire sauce, stirring well. Return vegetables to pan with saucebring to boil. Serve over cooked brown rice. Serves 4.

Cook noodles in boiling hot water for 8 minutes or until done. Drain in colander and set aside. In a saucepan mix together butter and flour for roux. Cook and stir over medium heat for 2-3 minutes or until flour is golden brown. Stir in bouillon cubes, paprika and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in broth and bring to boil for 2-3 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in parsley flakes. Stir in noodles and chicken and mix well. Bake in greased casserole dish for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

In a small bowl whisk together the egg, egg white and garlic powder until well blended. In a large mixing bowl combine the flour, beer, pepper, sugar and salt. Stir in the egg mixture until well blended. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 2-3 minutes until smooth. Lightly oil a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray. Divide the dough evenly among the muffin cups. Bake for 30-35 minutes until the loaves are golden brown. Cool for 1 minute in the pan then remove the loaves from the muffin cups. Serve warm.

Remove stems and seeds from birds eye chiles. Heat oil in wok. Add shallots and garlic and stir until fragrant. Add birds eye chiles and stir until they are slightly softened. Add dried shrimp paste and stir to mix well. Add lime juice and sugar to taste. Add soy sauce and stir to mix well. Add salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Garnish with sliced cucumbers.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic. Saute for about 3-4 minutes or until onions are tender. Add the wine and honey and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add the cream. Heat through. Add the pasta. Toss to coat. Add the spinach and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve hot.

Combine stock and tomatoes. Simmer 5 minutes. Add beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until tender. In a skillet, saute oil and herb seasoning over medium heat. Cook until fragrant. Add to beans. Stir. Garnish with parsley. Serve.

In medium bowl, combine velveeta and cream cheese until blended. Spread into 9x5x3 loaf pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with pecans and top with remaining ingredients. Bake 5 minutes longer or until bubbly. Chill several hours before serving.

In a heavy saucepan, saute vermicelli and onion in butter until tender. Add rice and safflower oil and cook over low heat 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir in chicken stock and bring to a boilcover and cook 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from heatstir in parsley and season with salt to taste.

Prepare simple syrup by combining water and sugar in a small saucepan over low heat until sugar has dissolved. Stir frequently until all the sugar has dissolved and the syrup is clear. Remove from heat and let cool. In a shaker, combine gin, simple syrup and juice from both lemons and limes. Muddle the cucumber slices and add them to the shaker. Shake well and strain into ice-filled glasses. Fill each glass with soda water. Garnish each glass with a cucumber slice and a few mint leaves.
Combine all ingredients. Spread into prepared pie shell. Bake 450 for 15 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

Wash beets well. Boil in salted water till tender. Cool. Peel skin off. Cut into chunks. Toss with olive oil. Dice pineapple. Chop avocado. Cut lettuce into bite size pieces. Arrange on a serving platter. Top with the remaining ingredients.

Line baking sheet with wax paper. In a small bowl combine all dry ingredients. Slowly add vegetable oil and stir until a stiff dough forms. Shape into 1 inch balls. Roll in cayenne and place on waxed paper. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Makes 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 375F. Blend crisco with sugar until creamy. Beat in 1/2 of the flour mixture, then the milk and the rest of the flour mixture. Beat in the egg yolks, then the vanilla. Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold into the batter. Fill greased and floured 10 inch tube pan or 13x9 pan with batter. Combine the topping ingredients in a small bowlsprinkle over the batter. Bake 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the middle. Cool completely before removing from pan.

Peel the courgettes. Put the onion and oil into a frying pan over medium heat. Add the courgettes and cook for 10 minutes. In the meantime, beat the eggs with the flour until smooth. Stir into the courgettes. Add the herbs, cheese and salt and pepper to taste. Heat the remaining oil in a separate pan. Cook spoonfuls of the mixture, turning once. Serve hot.
Place pork in crockpot and pour soy sauce over meat. Brown meat on all sides. Add garlic, brown sugar and cashews. Cook on low for 6-7 hours.

Slice roast in half lengthwise. Rub roast with oil. Lay slices in a slow cooker. Add all the other ingredients. Cook for 7 to 8 hours on low or 3 to 4 hours on high. Serve with sweet potato and carrots.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 9x13 inch pan. Prepare cake mix according to package. Bake for 40 minutes or until done. Cool. Mix cream cheese, confectioners sugar and vanilla. Spread on top of cooled cake. Sprinkle with nuts. Refrigerate.

Boil the eggs until the yolks are set hard. Run the eggs under cold water to stop the cooking. When the eggs are cool enough to handle, carefully slice off the tops of the eggs and remove the yolks to a small bowl. Blend the yolks with the mayonnaise, yogurt, lemon juice and spices. Refill the egg whites with the yolk mixture and sprinkle with the chopped fresh herbs before serving.

In a small bowl combine egg whites with the milk and water. Add the flour, cinnamon and salt. Beat well with a wooden spoon until the dough is smooth. Chill for 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Coat a muffin tin with cooking spray. On a floured surface roll out 1/2 inch thick. Cut into 2 1/2 inch rounds. Place 1 teaspoonful of the filling in the middle of each round. Fold dough over the filling. Place the pastries on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Drizzle with jelly. Serve warm.

In large saucepan over medium heat, saute onion and celery in oil until tender. Stir in tomato paste. Add beans. Stir in broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 20 minutes. Add barley. Stir in spinach. Cook 3 minutes. Season with pepper. Serve.

In saucepan, bring fruit and water to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer until fruit is soft and water is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Stir in sugar and macecook and stir until sugar dissolves, about 2 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water until cornstarch dissolvesstir into fruit mixturecook and stir until mixture thickens and boils. Remove from heatstir in butter and vanilla until meltedlet cool to room temperature. Refrigerate until cold and firmly setunmold onto serving platter. Garnish with sliced almonds or candied ginger if desired.

Cream shortening and cheese until well blended. Blend in egg and extract. Stir in flour, soda, and salt. Chill 1 hour. Roll into 36 balls. Roll balls in nuts. Place on wax paper. Chill 2 hours. Dip in chocolate coating.

Scoop a few tablespoons of cooked lentils onto a plate. Make a well in the center with a fork. Break an egg into the well and cover with a lid or a plate. Cook in microwave 1-2 minutes until egg is set. Sprinkle with seasoning and a slice of cheese.

Put the carrot in a bowl. Add the salt and mix well. Cover with cold water and soak for 15 minutes. Drain well and squeeze out the excess water. Heat the oil in a pan. Add the mustard seeds and when they start to pop add the carrot and lemon juice. Stir and serve.

Drain and rinse broccoli. Cut into bite sized florets. Cut chicken into bite sized pieces. In a large bowl combine the broccoli, red grapes, granny smith apple, celery, walnuts and creole seasoning. In a separate bowl whisk together poppy seed dressing, salt, pepper and garlic salt. Pour over the broccoli mixture. Toss to coat. Serve over a bed of lettuce garnished with toasted walnuts.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground turkey with the onion and garlic. Drain off fat. In a small bowl, combine the spaghetti sauce, oregano, garlic powder, basil, sugar, cayenne pepper, and the water. Pour over the meat mixture, stir well and heat through. Serve over cooked pasta.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Combine mayonnaise, artichoke hearts, cheese and garlic powder in a bowl and mix together. Spread mixture evenly in a baking dish and sprinkle paprika on top. Bake for 10 minutes until hot and bubbly. Serve with crackers, celery sticks or carrots.

Wash fruits well. Chop them in a food processor. Drain off liquid from fruits with paper towel. Add chopped fruits into a mixing bowl with guava jelly. Mix well with the remaining ingredients. Spread in 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with coconut on top. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes or until bubbly. Remove from oven and let cool. Serve warm or cold.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beanssaute 3 minutes or just until tender-crisp. Stir in onionsaute 30 seconds or just until tender. Stir in tarragon vinegar and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in bacontoss to coat. Serve immediately.
Toss the Brussel Sprouts with the yogurt. Top with the Parmesan Cheese. Broil the sprouts for 3-5 minutes, until they are lightly browned. Sprinkle with black pepper. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle the lamb with the brown sugar and rub into the meat. Allow to stand for 20 minutes or so, turning occasionally. Mix together the soy sauce and whisky and brush over the lamb. Place the meat in the oven for 1 1/2 hours or until the meat is fork tender. Remove and cover with foil for about 15 minutes before slicing and serving.

Tear kale leaves from stems and wash well. Drain well and pat dry with paper towels. Heat oil in heavy skillet over medium-low heat. Add onion and garlicsaute 4 minutes or until tender. Add kalestir until coated and heated through. Drizzle with broth and stir until thoroughly combined. Stir in cheesetoss until melted and well-combined. Serve warm.

Cook the sirloin in a skillet. Cut the beef into cubes and sprinkle with pepper. In a serving bowl, combine beef with mangoes and pears. Arrange the lettuce leaves on a plate and top with the beef mixture. Serve with a dressing on the side.

In a large bowl combine 1 box of vanilla wafers with 1/2 stick of melted butter. Mix until crumbled. In a medium bowl combine 2 cups of flour, 3 tsp baking powder and 1/2 tsp salt. Set aside. Beat 2 large eggs and add 1/2 cup of granulated white sugar. Beat with mixer until light and fluffy. Add 2 cups of flaked coconut and 1/2 cup of chopped pecans. Slowly add dry mixture into the egg mixture and mix well. Fold in crushed vanilla wafers. Grease a 15 x 10 x 1 inch baking pan and spoon in batter. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until done. Cool in pan for 10 minutes then remove from pan to a wire rack. Serves 25-30.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 2 9x13 inch pans. In a large bowl beat eggs at high speed for 3 minutes. Add sugar, oil and orange juice. Beat for 2 minutes. Beat in flour, baking powder, cocoa and salt. Divide batter into prepared pans. Bake for 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool. Spread half with frosting. Top with other half. Drizzle frosting over top. Garnish with candies.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the green onions and saute until tender. Add the fresh dill and saute until the dill wilts. Add the broth, potatoes, and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low. Simmer until the potatoes are very tender. Add the peas and simmer another 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Puree the mixture until smooth. Add the cream cheese. Stir until the cream cheese is melted. Season the mixture with the black pepper. Add the smoked salmon to each bowl before serving. Serve with toasted bread.

Brown the beef and drain fat. Add the seasonings and cook for 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes and broth. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Add the masa and stir. Simmer for another 10 minutes. Serve with your favorite toppings.

In a large kettle, cover the pumpkin seeds with water and boil for 5 minutes. Add the salt and continue to boil for about 10 minutes or until the seeds are tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Place the seeds in a large bowl and drizzle with oil. Toss to coat thoroughly. Spread the seeds on an ungreased baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until crisp.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a small bowl toss potatoes with 1 teaspoon rosemary and 1 teaspoon olive oil. Place potatoes on a baking sheet and bake in the oven for 30 minutes until tender. After 30 minutes add potatoes to a large bowl. Add 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 tablespoon rosemary, and 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper and toss until mixed together. Press potatoes into the pizza crust evenly. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon of rosemary. Bake in the oven for 10 minutes or until the crust is golden.

Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Line two baking trays with greaseproof paper. Combine the butter and icing sugar in a large bowl until light and creamy. Beat in the egg and then gradually add the flours and cornflour, beating until a dough forms. Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth. Roll the dough out to 1/4 inch thick and cut out with a 7cm round cutter. Place on the trays and bake for 10-12 minutes until slightly golden. Remove from the oven and let cool on the trays for 2 minutes. Remove the biscuits from the trays and allow to cool on a wire rack. To make the filling, place the butter and golden syrup in a small pan and heat gently until melted. Combine with the sweetened condensed milk and stir well. Cool for 5 minutes. Using a teaspoon, fill the biscuits with the filling. Return to the wire rack to set.

Sprinkle fish with tarragon, chives, salt and pepper. Melt butter in 9x13 dish. Arrange fish in dish. Sprinkle with ritz cracker crumbs. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

In small bowl, mix together cream cheese and sour cream until smooth. Season with dried oregano and garlic to taste. Pour mixture into a baking dish and top with pizza sauce and mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Bake until cheeses are melted and bubbly and sauce is hot. Sprinkle with green onions before serving. Serve with crackers or chips.

Melt margarine in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook rice-a-roni according to package directions. Stir in chicken and pinto beans. Add corn and salsa. Season with pepper. Divide mixture evenly onto tortilla. Sprinkle with cheese. Roll up.

Toast almonds in oven or pan to a golden brown. In a food processor combine the almonds, garlic and cumin. Pulse until coarsely ground. Add the lemon juice and water and process until well blended. Add the orange zest and salt and process again. Place the swordfish in a zip lock plastic bag and pour in the almond mixture. Squeeze to coat. Marinate in refrigerator at least 2 hours or overnight. Remove swordfish from bag and pat off excess crumbs. Grill or bake in 400 degree oven. Baste with lemon juice while cooking.

Mix gelatin with 1/2 cup cold water in a small bowllet stand for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine pudding mix and 1/4 cup cold water in a medium bowlbeat with a whisk for 2 minutes. Add milkbeat with a mixer at medium speed until well blended. Stir in gelatin mixturechill 1 hour or until set. Stir in fruit. Garnish with cool whip.

Place tomatoes and onions onto the ciabatta. Top with sliced salmon. Sprinkle with lemon zest and lemon juice. Add the mozzarella. Season with salt and pepper. Close the ciabatta. Spread the mayonnaise on the top of the ciabatta. Top with the capers. Cut into halves.
Cook the turkey in oil in skillet until brown. Drain and add the onion and garlic. Cook until tender. Add the rest of the ingredients. Simmer for 40 minutes. Serve over rice. Serves 4.

Cook ground beef with chopped onions in skillet. Add cabbage and seasonings. Cover and simmer until cabbage is tender. In a bowl stir together 1/2 cup of beer and 2 beaten eggs. Let rest. Take 2 rolls of dough. Cut each in half. Take 2 halves and place in ungreased 12 inch skillet or cast iron pan. Add 1/2 cup of beef mixture. Top with a little more of the mixture. Place second half of roll over mixture. Brush with beaten egg mixture. Bake at 375 for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool slightly before cutting. Serve with additional beer for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease muffin cups. Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder & salt. Stir in egg. In a separate bowl, combine milk, yogurt & oil. Pour into dry ingredientsstir just until moistened. Fold in raspberries & chocolate chips. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan 5 minutes before removing to wire rack. Serve warm or cold. Makes 12.

Mix together milk, vegetable oil, egg and baking mix in bowl. Mix in preserves, and stir in water (1/3 cup) if necessary. Fill muffin cups 2/3 full. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Bake in 400f oven for 15 to 20 minutes or till done. Cool. Makes 20 to 24 muffins.

Combine cream and coffee granules in a heavy-bottom saucepan and heat to simmer. Stir in the amarula and cook until the sauce thickens and begins to boil. Remove from heat and stir in the powdered hot cocoa. Add the chocolate and stir until melted. Remove from heat. Pour into a bowl and set aside to cool slightly. Whisk the cream with the sugar until soft peaks form. Fold the whipped cream into the hot cocoa mixture. Refrigerate for several hours until firm. Scoop into small balls and roll in the graham cracker crumbs. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Makes 3 dozen.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook until al dente. Drain. Melt the butter and mascarpone together in a small saucepan. Add the mustard and cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Add the pasta to the cheese mixture and toss well to coat. Transfer to a 10-inch x 13-inch baking dish. Stir in the sun-dried tomatoes. Sprinkle with chives. Serve.
Blend all together and pour over cooked chicken. Broil for 1-2 minutes and serve.
Cook the macaroni until it is almost donedrain and rinse with cold water and drain again. In a large bowl combine the macaroni and all other ingredients. Blend well and refrigerate for 1 hour.

Heat butter in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add chickencook 3 minutes. Add onions and garliccook 3 minutes longer. Add broth, noodles and frozen vegetables. Bring to a boilcover tightly, reduce heat to low and cook 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in soupbring to a simmer and cook 5 minutes longer. Stir in milkheat through. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Saut shallots until translucent. Add mushrooms and sage. Cook 3 min. Add mascarpone. Cook 1 min. Add gnocchi. Cook 1 min. Add parmesan cheese. Cook 1 min. Season with salt & pepper.

Combine all the marinade ingredients in a 1 quart container with a tight fitting lid. Add the chicken. Toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Prepare grill. Remove chicken from marinade. Discard marinade. Brush the grill rack with oil. Place the chicken on the grill rack. Grill with the lid closed as long as the meat is firm to the touch and the juices run clear. Discard any remaining marinade. Serve immediately.

Roll out French bread dough to about 1/2 inch thickness on a floured surface. Cut out 3 inch rounds. Combine sugar and cinnamon in a bowl. Dip each round in sugar mixture on both sides and place in muffin pans (12 per pan). Brush each round lightly with melted butter. Bake at 375F for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from pan immediately to wire rack to cool. Yields 24 bubble rings.

Peel and thinly slice potatoes. Butter an ovenproof gratin dish or baking tray. Arrange slices of potato over the bottom of the dish overlapping as you go. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Pour over the milk and cream mixture until just covered. Season with salt and pepper. Bake in a moderate oven for about 35 minutes. The potatoes are cooked when they can be pierced with a knife.

Cook the macaroni according to the directions on the package. In a large skillet heat the olive oil. Add the onion and bell pepper and saute over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. In a large saucepan add the milk and soup. Heat over medium heat until the soup is hot. Remove from the heat. Stir in the taco seasoning. Add the macaroni to the skillet. Pour the hot soup mixture over the noodles. Add the ground beef. Mix well. Sprinkle with the shredded cheddar cheese. Serve immediately.
In a medium bowl, toss together zucchini, olive oil, oregano, cheese and pepper. Spread mixture in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until edges are crispy.

Bring the first four ingredients to a boil in a heavy bottomed sauce pan. Lower heat and simmer for about five minutes. Stir in the fruit. Continue simmering for another five minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Pour the oatmeal into bowls and top with the bruléed sugar. (In the photo I used a torch, but you can also melt the sugar on top of your stove in a small pan. Make sure it’s in a well ventilated area and stir occasionally.)

Cook egg pasta according to package directions. Drainkeep warm. Melt butter with garlicstir in tuna until flakedadd broccoli floretsseason with salt and pepper. Combine with egg pastatoss with half of Alfredo sauce. Pour into 1-quart casserole dishsprinkle with breadcrumbsdot with butter. Cover with remaining Alfredo saucesprinkle with remaining breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until browned.

Cook rice according to directions and drain well. Add the consomme and onion soup and cook until all the liquid is absorbed. Add the water chestnuts and cook until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed. If the rice is not soft enough to your taste add more consomme or water and cook until done. The rice should be very soft. Toss the rice with the butter and serve.
Cook bacon until crisp. Drain fat. Chop into small pieces. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour into a slow cooker and bake uncovered for 6 to 8 hours on low or 3 to 4 hours on high.

Cream together the shortening& the sugar. Add the eggs& beat well. Then mix the mashed bananas, baking soda& salt& mix well. Add the flour& mix. Stir in the chocolate chips& spoon into a greased& floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour or until done.
Blend dry ingredients. Add liquid ingredients. Fold in pumpkin. Fold in raisins and carrot. Bake for 20 minutes.

Heat a large nonstick skillet sprayed with cooking spray over medium-high heat until hot. Combine maple syrup, brown sugar, mustard, salt, and pepper in small bowlset aside. Place each pork chop in the center of the skillet. Cook 3 to 4 minutes per side or until internal temperature reaches 145 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer. Remove from heatbrush each side of the pork chops with the glaze. Let stand for 2 minutes. Serve warm.

Toss prawns in flour and saute in butter and brandy until opaque and done, add wine and amaretto and cook until liquid is reduced. Add orange zest and juice and reduce again. Whisk in cream and parsley and serve immediately.

Cook carrots and onion in water. Add hash brown potatoes. Cook until almost done. Add ham. Add cheddar. Add evaporated milk and garlic. Simmer until cheese is melted. Stir in broth. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add a dash of garlic sauce. Top with more shredded cheese and parsley. Serve.

Cream together butter, sugars and vanilla until creamy. Slowly add in flour. Roll into balls about 1 inch in diameter. Flatten balls with bottom of glass. Place kiss on each cookie. Dust with powdered sugar if desired.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the oats and nuts and stir to coat. Remove from the heat and stir in the rest of the ingredients. Spread mixture on waxed paper and let cool. Roll into small balls and roll in coconut. Store in an airtight container.

Combine all dressing ingredients except almonds in a small bowl. Crumble the almonds into a separate bowl. Refrigerate for 10 minutes. Combine cabbage, chinese cabbage, green onions, and ramen noodles. Add dressing and toss well. Garnish with almonds. Serve chilled.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and cook for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes or until almost dry. Dust with flour, shaking off excess. Add brothstirring often to prevent scorching, cook for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add nutmeg and pepper to tastestirring often to prevent scorching, cook for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add milkstirring often to prevent scorching, cook for about 5 minutes or until heated through. Add winestirring often to prevent scorching, cook for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add salt to taste. Makes about 3 cups.

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Peel and core apples. Add apples to boiling watercook 20 minutes or until tender. Drain applesadd lemon juice and 2 cups of water to pancook 20 minutes or until reduced to 1/4 cup. Combine apples, mustard and 1 teaspoon salt in a medium bowltoss to coat. Add mayonnaise. Divide apples evenly between 2 tortillastop each with 1/4 cup cheese. Top each tortilla with 2 slices of ham. Top each tortilla with 1 lettuce leafroll up tortillas burrito-style. Cut in half.

Steam the broccoli for about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat. Blend the flour into the melted butter until smooth. Stir in the skim milk and bring to a boil. Cook for 1 minute or until the sauce thickens. Remove from heat. Add the cheese. Stir until the cheese melts. Add the broccoli. Mix until well blended.

Slice nectarines thinly. Mix together the sugar and ground ginger and sprinkle over nectarines. Set aside to marinate. Wash and dry berries. Mix together lemon juice and cream cheese. Spread the cheese mixture over the nectarines and top with the berries. Serve chilled.

Place the nuts in a food processor and blend for about 30 seconds, add the basil and blend for 30 seconds longer. Add the garlic and blend again for about 30 seconds. Scrape down the sides of the food processor and add the cheese and blend for 30 seconds more. Add the lemon juice and blend again for about 30 seconds longer or until you have a smooth consistency. Add the olive oil and blend for 30 seconds more. Season the pesto to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with your favorite pasta or bruschetta or on a pizza.

In a heavy frying pan brown the ground sausage. Remove excess fat. Add the skim milk. Whisk in the white flour gradually, stirring constantly until the mixture is smooth and thickened. Add garlic salt, ground black pepper and dried sage. Cook over medium heat until the mixture is thickened to the consistency of thin gravy. Serve immediately over hot biscuits or toast.

In a bowl, mix the cream cheese and oregano until smooth. Spread in a pie pan. Add the pizza sauce and pepperoni on top. Add the green onion and the sour cream on top. Put the mozzarella on top of that and bake for 30 minutes or until mozzarella is melted. Cut up the bell pepper and pita chips and add to top. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Sift the flour, baking powder, soda, and salt. Set aside. In a medium bowl beat together the egg, melted butter, milk, and vanilla. Add the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Add the buttermilk and stir until smooth. Heat a griddle to 350 degrees F and grease with shortening or vegetable oil. Use about 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake. Cook until bubbles start to form on the top of the pancake. Turn carefully and cook until golden brown on the bottom. Makes 20-25 pancakes.

In a bowl, mix all together except for meat. Take about a tablespoon of this mixture and roll into a ball. Cover meat with mixture and roll into a ball. Repeat with remaining mixture and meat. Thread meatballs on skewers. Cook on grill or broiler until done. Serve with plain rice.
In dutch oven cook beef and onion until beef is no longer pink. Drain off fat. Add remaining ingredientscover and simmer for 30 minutes or until veggies are tender.

Combine milk and eggs. Sift together cornmeal, flour, baking powder and garlic and onion powders and salt. Make a well in the center of the dry mixture and pour in the liquid mixture and stir until blended. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead 10 times. Divide into 24 equal portions and shape into balls. Roll each ball in flour and drop into deep hot fat. Fry until golden brown. Drain and serve hot.

Cook the orzo according to the package directions. Add the chopped leeks during the last minute of cooking. Drain the pasta. Heat the butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the leeks and cook for about a minute. Add the broth and the juice from half a lemon and the zest from half a lemon. Season the mixture with salt and pepper. Stir in the lemon juice. Add the asparagus and cook just until it is tender. Pour the sauce over the orzo. Sprinkle the top with the parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Slice carrots lengthwise into 1/4 inch thick slices. Toss together olive oil, vinegar, honey and spices. Arrange carrot slices on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes. Flip and bake for another 30 minutes. Serve with ketchup and ranch dressing for dipping.
Put all ingredients into a microwaveable dish and cook 10 minutes in the microwave. Remove from microwave and stir. Cook for 5 more minutes and stir again.

Cook the pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile combine the artichokes, red peppers, olive oil, mustard and garlic in a bowl. Top the cooked pasta with the mixture and sprinkle with the cheese.

Combine gelatin with hot water in a 2-cup glass measuring cupset aside. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 2 minutes or until smooth. Reduce speed to lowadd the sour cream in a slow stream, beating just until combined. Beat in the heavy cream in a slow stream, beating just until combined. Gradually beat in the Splenda until smooth. Stir in the lemon juice and zestpour into the prepared crust. Chill 3 hours or overnight. Just before serving, place the lemon gelatin mixture in a small saucepan over low heatcook and stir constantly until the gelatin is completely melted and smooth. Cool slightlypour over the chilled cheesecake. Refrigerate 2 hours or until serving time.

Put all the ingredients in the food processor or blender except the salt and pepper. Blend on low speed for about 1 minute until it is almost smooth. Turn the processor on high speed for 2 minutes or until the mixture is completely smooth. Add the salt and pepper and pulse a couple more times until combined. Store in an air tight container in the refrigerator.

Boil the potatoes until soft. Mash them and add the lemon grass, coriander leaves, spring onions, chili powder and the eggs to it. Mix well. Dip your hands into some flour and make small patties of the mixture. Heat some vegetable oil in a pan, put the patties into it and fry them till they are golden brown. Put some sweet chili sauce on them and serve them hot.

In a heavy saucepan combine coconut milk, sugar and tapioca. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Cook and stir for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Beat in eggs and extracts until mixture is smooth. Pour into crust. Chill overnight. Before serving garnish with coconut and whipped cream. Keep leftovers refrigerated.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the water, lemons and oranges. Bring to a boil. Add cinnamon and allspice. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove spices. Add apple cider. Mix. Add sugar if desired. Serve.
Combine all the ingredients in a saucepan. Heat slowly until the sugar is dissolved. Cool. Store refrigerated.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl stir together oats, walnuts and spices. In a small bowl whisk together oil and maple syrup. Stir into oat mixture and toss to coat. Spread onto a large baking sheet and bake for about 30 minutes, stirring once or twice, until crunchy and lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).Combine the flour, granulated sugar, and baking powder in a large bowl.Cut the cold butter into the flour mixture with a pastry blender or your hands until the mixture is crumbly.Stir the buttermilk into the mixture with a fork until it is just moist.Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface.Knead the dough lightly until it is smooth.Roll out the dough into a 1/2-inch thick rectangle.Fold the dough in thirds like a letter.Press the dough into a 1-inch thick rectangle with a rolling pin.Cut the dough into 6 even rectangles with a knife, making sure to keep the rectangles as straight as possible.Place the biscuits on the prepared baking sheet.Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the biscuits are golden brown.Serve warm with butter.

Rub the fish with flour. Melt the butter in a pan and fry the fish skin side down over high heat until the fish is crisp and lightly browned. Turn the fish over and fry the other side. Pour the wine into the pan and continue frying for a few minutes. Place the fish on a serving dish and garnish with lemon slices. Serve with lemon wedges.

Peel and slice the peaches. Put the peaches into a blender with the sugar and lemon juice. Blend until the mixture is very smooth and frothy. Add orange juice and chill thoroughly. To serve, fill glasses with ice and top with chilled champagne. Garnish with the frozen peach mixture and serve immediately.
Layer corn chips on bottom of bowl or plate. Top with chili and sour cream. Top with shredded lettuce. Top with salsa and sprinkle with cheddar cheese.

In a Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add rice. Cook and stir until lightly browned. Stir in onions and pepper. Cook and stir until tender. Add celery. Stir in crushed tomatoes. Add cumin and garlic. Cook and stir until fragrant. Add broth and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Fluff with fork.

Combine the flour and cornstarch. In a saucepan over medium heat, mix together the crushed pineapple, egg yolks, lemon juice, flour mixture, sugar and salt. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened and bubbly. Add the egg whites, beating them in one at a time. Pour into a buttered 1-quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until puffy and brown on top. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with the pineapple slices.
In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise & sugar. Stir in cream cheese until smooth. Fold in Cool Whip. Chill at least 3 hours. Top with nuts. Serve with crackers.

Combine 1 qt of mashed potatoes, 1/2 c. sour cream, and 1/2 c. milk. Add garlic powder and 1/2 tsp of salt to taste. Spread evenly in a greased 2-qt casserole dish. Sprinkle with french fried onions and cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 f for 20-30 minutes. Serve hot.
