Preheat oven to 350. In a bowl toss the cubed squash with 3 tablespoons butter, 3 tablespoons honey, and 4 tablespoons water. On a large cookie sheet spread the cubed squash in one layer. Sprinkle the top with 2 tablespoons of the remaining honey, 2 tablespoons of the remaining butter, and the rosemary. Bake 30 minutes or until the cubes are tender when pierced with a knife.

Place 1/2 teaspoon brown sugar in the center of each apple slice. Place apple on a skewer. Place a teaspoonful of honey on each skewer and brush on both sides. Dip the skewers in melted butter or margarine. Place the skewers in a shallow dish. In a small bowl combine corn syrup and vinegar. Pour over the skewers. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Makes 12 servings.

Cook rice in boiling water for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside. Cut sausage into 1-inch pieces. Brown in skillet. Add water. Bring to a boil. Add rice and cream of celery soup. Stir in mushrooms and green beans. Add 1/2 cup of swiss cheese. Top with remaining cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes.
Cut chicken into small bite sized pieces. Cube pears. Combine all the salad ingredients in a large bowl. Toss well. Serve in shallow bowls or on plates.

Melt butter in a 2-quart saucepan over low heat. Cool slightly while you mix the dry ingredients in a bowl. Add the melted butter, stirring until it is evenly distributed. Mix in the eggs and syrup. Beat the mixture in your electric mixer for about 1 minute at medium speed until smooth. Pour into a buttered 9x13-inch baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into squares for serving.

Soften cream cheese. Add powdered sugar and blend well. Add peanut butter and blend. Add milk and blend. Blend in whipped topping and fudge sauce. Fold in chopped nuts. Chill at least 4 hours. Store leftovers in freezer.
Mix all dressing ingredients in a bowl. Add the lime. Shake until well mixed. Toss together the lettuce, onion, corn, beans. Add the dressing and toss again. Just before serving sprinkle with chips.

Beat eggs with white sugar until light and foamy. Add oil. Beat in vanilla. Add flour, salt, baking powder, cocoa. Beat well. Add hot water. Beat well. Pour into greased 9 inch round pan. Bake at 325 for 1 hour. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees f. In a large bowl, combine flour, powdered sugar, vanilla, salt and butter, using electric mixer until crumbly. Stir in pecans with a spoon. Shape into 1-inch balls and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until cookies are set and barely begin to color around edges. Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container. Up to 1 week.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. In large bowl, mix noodles with chicken and celery. Add cilantro and onions. Toss to mix. Add vinaigrette and toss to coat. Add sesame seeds before serving.

Heat 3 inches of canola oil in a deep fryer until it reaches 350°F. In a small bowl combine 3 Tbsp. extra virgin olive oil with the thyme leaves. In a medium bowl mix the almonds with the thyme-oil mixture. Place the nuts in the hot oil and fry, stirring constantly, until crisp. Remove the nuts with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle lightly with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
Chop all the vegetables. Mix all the other ingredients together. Toss with the vegetables.

In a small bowl, mix together hot sauce, worcestershire and lemon juice. In a large bowl, mix together olive oil and garlic. Add salt and pepper to taste. Place oysters in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Cover with garlic and oil mixture. Let stand at room temperature for 20 minutes. Grill over direct heat for 3 minutes. Turn and grill for 2 minutes more. Pour hot sauce mixture over grilled oysters and serve with lemon wedges and parsley.

In skillet, melt margarine over medium heat. Sprinkle chicken with pepper. Add to skillet. Cook 6 min. on each side. Combine shallots and broth. Pour into skillet. Cover. Cook 5 min. Stir in tomatoes. Heat through. Garnish with parsley. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In small bowl mix together the black pepper, salt and lime juice. In small bowl, mix together butter and spices. Rub spices on both sides of fish. Place on baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, turning half way through baking.

Whisk together lime juice, cilantro, salt and pepper. In a bowl, combine the lime dressing with the corn and toss. Add the cherry tomatoes and onion, toss again. Chop the avocados into cubes and add to the bowl. Toss lightly. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl, place the tofu. Add the agave nectar and the raspberry liqueur and whisk until smooth. Add the chocolate chips and the vanilla extract and mix well. Spoon into a prepared chocolate wafer pie crust and refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs, sugar, and salt until smooth. Add butter and beat until smooth. Stir in the karo syrup and baileys. Stir in the chocolate and macadamia nuts. Pour into the pie shell and bake for 35-40 minutes. Let cool and then serve.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. In 8-inch skillet or ovenproof pan (with a cover), melt 2 tablespoons of the butter with the extra-large eggs over medium heat until very thickened and pale golden browndo not let boil. Remove from heatstir in all-purpose flour and milk until smoothstir in cheese, then ham. Pour batter into skillet or panplace in ovenbake until puffy and golden brown, about 20 minutes. Serve hot with lemon wedges or fruit preserves. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl, whisk together vinegar and oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add beans, bread, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and cheese. Toss to combine. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours, and up to 8 hours. Just before serving, stir in basil.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare crust according to directions on package. Unroll onto a 15x10 inch jelly roll panpress into a 15x10 inch rectangle. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Meanwhile, in a food processor, combine the artichoke hearts, pecans, Parmesan cheese, oregano, basil, garlic clove, and 1/4 cup olive oilprocess until smooth. Spread artichoke mixture evenly onto prepared crust. Bake for 15 minutes more or until hot. Cool on a wire rack.
Place all ingredients into bread machine pan in order as listed. Select basic white cycle.
Soak spareribs in water for 4 hours. In the meantime mix all the other ingredients. Roll spareribs in flour and breadcrumbs. Bake in 350-degree oven for 1 hour.

Preheat gas grill over medium heat or preheat charcoal grill 4-6 inches from medium coals. Combine all glaze ingredients in a small bowlstir well and set aside. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepperbrush with glazeplace on the grill, cover and cook 8-12 minutes or until juices run clearturn once and brush occasionally with glaze.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Place chickens in a baking pan. Combine all other ingredients in a blender. Pour sauce over chickens. Bake in oven for 1 hour.

Sautee butter, onions and garlic until translucent. Add the water and let simmer for 15 minutes. Add the carrots, parsnips and curry powder. Cook until tender, about 2 hours. Add the heavy cream and salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crusty bread.
In a big saucepan cook the chicken stock. When it is hot, add the eggs. Stir quickly for 1 minute. Add the parsley and the parmesan. Serve immediately.

Prepare the topping by mixing together the oats, brown sugar, margarine, and vanilla extract. Press into a 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spread with the apricot preserves. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes more. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into 24 bars. Yield: 2 dozen bars.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook until lightly browned and tender. Stir in sugar and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Place steaks in a glass bowl. Pour onion mixture over steaks. Cover bowl. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight. Remove steaks from marinade. Grill or broil 4 inches from heat until desired doneness, turning once. Serve with remaining marinade.
Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat. Stir in salt & butter. Cook over low heat til thick& clear. Cool& frost.

In a large skillet, melt the butter with onion and garlic over low heat. Stir frequently as onion cooks. Add the mushrooms. When the mushrooms are tender, add the broth and wine. Increase heat to medium high. Bring to a boilreduce heat to medium low and add the chicken breast halves. Simmer covered for about 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Stir occasionally while the chicken is cooking. Remove from heatstir the parsley into the mixture. Serve over hot white rice.

Rub the fish with a little olive oil. Place in a large zip lock bag with the remaining marinade and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. In the meantime prepare the topping. In a small bowl combine the garlic and the basil. Saute the fish in a pan sprayed with non-stick cooking spray for about 5 minutes. Top each fillet with about 1/4 of the garlic and basil mixture. Serve immediately with a slice of lime.
Beat eggs and sugar together. Stir in cornmeal, plain flour and canola oil. Beat well. Add milk and stir in the baking powder. Bake in a moderate oven for one hour.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix eggs with sugar until foamy. Add sunflower oil and vanilla essence. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt and stir into egg mixture. Spread into greased and lined 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake 30 - 35 minutes. Cool slightly before spreading with frosting. In a small bowl mix together the softened butter and the confectioners sugar. Beat until smooth. Spread frosting over warm cake and sprinkle with nuts and the whole cherries. Cut into squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel off any discolored leaves from each sprout. Cut off stem end. Rinse in cold water. Slice sprouts in half lengthwise. In a large mixing bowl, toss together sprouts, butter, grape and wine. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread in a single layer onto a jelly roll pan or baking sheet. Sprinkle with almonds. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Stir after 10 minutes. Sprouts will brown a bit. Serve.

Slice dough into bite-size squares. On one half of the dough square, spread a spoonful of pizza sauce and sprinkle with a bit of mozzarella cheese and a few pepperoni slices. On the other half of the dough square, sprinkle with some italian seasoning and grated parmesan cheese. Place the two sides of the dough square together and press down firmly. Place the stuffed dough squares onto a greased baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees F for about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with additional grated parmesan cheese and a drizzle of olive oil.

In a large bowl, whisk together flour, manchego cheese, granulated sugar, and baking powder. In a small bowl, whisk together jalapeño peppers and milkset aside. In a large bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour mixture, salt, and vegetable oil. Stir in the milk mixture, and stir until just combined. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the egg mixture and cook, stirring, until the eggs are just cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Mix soy sauce, vinegar, honey in small bowl. Heat oil in large skillet. Add mushrooms and green onions. Cook 5 minutes. Add chicken and cook 6-8 minutes. Remove from skillet. Thread chicken, mushrooms and green onions onto skewers. Wrap each with 2 strips bacon. Place in shallow dish. Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Cut chicken into pieces. Arrange on platter. Top with pineapple. Drizzle with marinade. Serve.

Mix barbecue sauce and grape jelly in a bowl. In another bowl mix meatballs and pineapple chunks. On a greased cookie sheet, shape meat mixture into a round ball. Pour half the barbecue mixture over the meat mixture. Bake in a 375 oven for 20 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Melt butter in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat. Add potato, corn, and edamame. Saute 2 minutes. Add squash, onion, and chives. Saute until vegetables are just tender, about 4 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Mix olive oil with onion and potato. Heat on the stove with a little water until they are tender. Add the milk and the water to make a smooth paste. Add the cheddar cheese and stir until smooth. Serve warm to baby.

Preheat grill to high. In a small bowl stir together orange juice, zest, ginger, hot sauce and 1/4 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp black pepper. Rub orange mixture over all sides of fish. Grill tilapia for 3-4 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Toss together cauliflower, garlic, rosemary, lavender, 2 teaspoons black pepper, 1 teaspoon coarse salt. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast 20-25 minutes until tender. Toss with lemon juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil.

Grease 13x9-inch baking dish or 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray. Crush bread into medium bowlset aside. In 3-quart saucepan over medium heat, melt butterstir in brown sugar until smooth. Stir in half-and-half until blendedremove from heatset aside. In large bowl, beat eggstir in milk until smoothadd to brown sugar mixture, stirring constantly. Add breadmix until well coatedpour into prepared baking dish or casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30-45 minutes or until center is firm (do not overbake). Serve warm with caramel sauce if desired. Carbs.

Slice the asparagus into 1/2 inch pieces. Saute onion and green pepper. Add asparagus and cook until tender. Add tomatoes. Cook until tomato sauce. Add chilies. Add eggs and break into pieces. Cook until heated through. Serve with cheddar cheese on top. Serve with salsa on the side.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a small bowl combine the herbes de provence, garlic and olive oil. Season the lamb chops to taste with salt and pepper. Wrap each lamb chop in a portion of the herb mixture and place in a baking dish. Bake in a 375f oven for 10-12 minutes for medium rare.

Cook pasta in boiling water until just tender. Drain pasta in a colander and set aside. Place Velveeta and the Cheddar Cheese in a bowl and place in microwave safe bowl and microwave on high for 4 minutes or until Velveeta and Cheddar are completely melted and smooth. Combine pasta and sauce and mix well. Add the heavy cream and the milk and continue mixing until everything is well mixed and the sauce is creamy. Pour the pasta mixture into the casserole dish and add the eggs and mix well with the pasta mixture. Bake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes or until top is lightly browned and golden and the sauce is thick and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Prepare pudding according to package directions. Set aside. Cut bananas into thin slices. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl, beat sour cream until smooth and fluffy. Add sugar and vanilla extract and beat to combine. Slowly add pudding and mix well. Fold in whipping cream and set aside. In a large mixing bowl, mix together graham cracker crumbs and melted butter until moistened. Press mixture onto bottom and up sides of an 8-inch pie plate. Spread half of the banana mixture over the bottom of the crust and spread half of the whipped cream mixture over the top. Top with remaining sliced bananas and remaining whipped cream mixture. Refrigerate for at least two hours.

In a large bowl combine the lentils, onion, garlic, carrots, spices (except black pepper), 1/2 cup of the flour and 1 1/4 cups of the water. Let sit for 15 minutes. Form the mixture into 8 patties. Combine the remaining 1/4 cup of flour with the black pepper. Dip the patties into the flour mixture. Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook the patties for 2 minutes per side until browned.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease an 8-inch square pan or line it with parchment paper. In a large bowl or the bowl of an electric mixer cream together the cane sugar, flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, salt, baking soda, and applesauce. Add the vanilla extract and then the tofu and continue to mix until the batter is smooth. In another bowl combine the chocolate soymilk with the vanilla extract. Stir the liquid into the batter. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread it out evenly with a rubber spatula. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the top is firm to the touch. Let cool completely before cutting. These brownies can be frozen.
Cook potatoes until tender. Drain and add frozen peas. Add cream cheese and let melt. Add sun dried tomato and season with salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate and serve.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a blender container. Cover and process until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to serve. To serve, spoon whipped mixture into dessert dishes. Garnish with fruit of your choice.

In a large dutch oven or heavy stockpot, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onions and garlic. Saute until they begin to soften, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add chicken breasts and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes. Add chicken broth, chili powder, cumin and bay leaves. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 30 minutes. Add corn and simmer 15 minutes longer. Add beans and diced tomatoes. Cook uncovered for 15 minutes. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground pepper. Serve with shredded cheese and sour cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Peel and wash potatoes thoroughly.Cut into wedges and coat with olive oil and herbs to taste.Lay out potatoes on baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with crumbled feta cheese.

Saute the ground sausage and half the onion until the meat is no longer pink. Drain the fat. Add the spinach. Cook until the spinach wilts. Drain fat. In a bowl combine the meat mixture, the remaining onion, the pimiento, the swiss cheese, half the cheddar cheese and the half-and-half. Mix well. Add the seasonings. Add the egg mixture. Mix well. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Sprinkle the remaining cheddar cheese over the top. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 45 to 50 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.

Cut the stem and ends off the zucchini. Scoop out the seeds and pulp with a small spoon and place in a bowl. Mix the corn with the ricotta and cayenne pepper and add salt and pepper to taste. Fill the hollowed out zucchinis with the ricotta mixture and sprinkle the top with cheddar cheese and cilantro and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes until the zucchini is tender and the cheese has browned.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until al dente, according to package directions. Drain pasta in a colander. Beat together eggs and milk in a large bowladd pasta and stir to coat. Pour pasta into a lightly greased 13-inch by 9-inch baking dishsprinkle on the feta and top with the Kefalotiri. Bake until the top is lightly browned, about 30 minutes.

Grease two 1 pint pudding basins. Mix the flour, custard powder and caster sugar together. Add the butter and rub in. Beat the egg lightly and mix to the flour mix. Add the milk and mix thoroughly. Put half in each of the pudding basins and smooth the tops. Beat the egg yolks and add the milk to make a custard. Divide the custard between the two basins. Sprinkle the top of each basin with sugar and place the plums in the centre. Cover each basin with foil and pleated greaseproof paper. Steam for 2 hours. Remove the foil and greaseproof paper. Turn out and serve hot or cold.
Beat together first 4 ingredients. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Chill well before serving. Serve with crackers.

In a skillet over medium heat cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon. Add butter to drippings in skillet. Add onions and cook until translucent. Add cauliflower. Cook until tender. Remove from heat. Stir in bacon. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Coat a 13x9-inch baking pan with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup parsley, 1/4 teaspoon of parmesan cheese and the garlicset aside. In another small bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of parsley, 1/4 teaspoon parmesan cheese and the lemon-pepper seasoningset aside. In a medium bowl, combine the remaining 1/4 cup parsley and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon parmesan cheese. In a small bowl, combine the breadcrumbs, cheeses and mustard. Arrange the fish in the pantop with the cheese mixture. Combine the remaining parsley mixture with the parmesan mixturesprinkle over the cheese on the fish. Bake for 30 minutes. Garnish with the remaining parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 f. Peel the potatoes, cut them into large chunks and place them in a large oven-proof baking dish. Dot the potatoes with the butter. Peel the onions and cut them into 1/4-inch dice. Add the onions to the dish. Peel the garlic cloves and crush them with the flat side of a chef’s knife. Add the garlic to the baking dish. Season with the vegetable stock, chili flakes and 1 tsp of the sea salt. Cover the dish with foil. Bake in the oven for 30 minutes. Remove the foil. Continue baking for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with the fresh parsley. Serve.

Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat. Saut garlic and red pepper flakes for 30 seconds. Add shrimp and cook until they just begin to turn pink. Add the tequila and cook 1 minute. Add lime juice and cook 1 minute longer. Sprinkle with salt and serve over rice. Garnish with cilantro.

In a large bowl, combine the mushrooms and scallops with the lemon pepper seasoning. In a medium bowl, combine the parsley, butter, and garlic powderstir until blended. Drizzle half of the parsley mixture over the scallops and mushroomstoss to coat. Divide the scallop mixture evenly among 4 large squares of foil. Top each serving with remaining parsley mixture. Fold the foil over the scallop mixture, making 4 packets. Grill the packets over medium heat 8-10 minutes or until the scallops are opaque in the center. Garnish with parsley sprigs and serve with lemon wedges.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add penne pasta and cook until al dentedrain and set aside. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add garlic, cook about 1 minute longer. Stir in cream of mushroom soup, tuna and pasta. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheddar cheese and 1/2 cup breadcrumbs. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Spray a 2-quart baking dish with butter-flavored cooking spray. Pour the pasta mixture into the baking dish and sprinkle with remaining cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Dissolve sugar in water in a large pan. Boil for about 5 minutes. Add coffee. Let cool. Dissolve cocoa in coke. Put some in each glass. Top with whipped cream and garnish with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

Slice pineapple and onion into thin 1/2-inch strips. Toss in medium bowl with scallions, salt and pepper to taste. Add lime and cilantro and toss well. Serve immediately or chill. Use within 24 hours.

In a bowl, combine the lemon, cinnamon, and olive oil. Cut the chicken breasts into strips and add to the bowl. Marinate for 30 minutes. In another bowl combine the shallots and chicken broth. Set aside. Heat the olive oil and saute the shallots and broth mixture over medium heat until the mixture is reduced by half. Remove from heat and add the marinated chicken and cornstarch. Toss to coat. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve over rice.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat heavy cream. Stir in onions. Cook until onions are golden brown. Add the frozen peas. Stir in tortellini. Add the prosciutto. Stir. Season with the salt and black pepper. Stir. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan and saute the prawns in it for 2-3 minutes until they just turn pink. Add in the rum and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from the heat and add in the double cream, vanilla pod and coconut milk. Season to taste and serve at once over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease an 8 inch square baking dish. Beat the eggs with the milk in a large bowlstir in the flour and seasoningmix well. Pour mixture into baking dish. Sprinkle evenly with the cheesebake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the center is set. Serve warm, cut in squares.

In a small saucepan combine honey, water and cloves. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in marmalade. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes. Stir in cilantro and set aside to cool. In a large skillet combine carrots, butter and salt. Cook over medium heat until tender, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Pour marmalade mixture over carrots and simmer for 3 to 4 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Brush bread with melted margarine. Grill. Spread with green onion and wine. Place a small amount of cornflour in a saucepan with milk to make a thick creamy sauce. Add parsley and season to taste. Place crab on toast. Pour sauce over crab and top with cheese. Grill until the cheese melts. Serve hot.

Combine all the ingredients in a food processor until smooth. Pack the mixture into a 10 inch loaf pan. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Remove from the refrigerator 1 hour before serving. Slice as desired. Serve with crackers or bread slices.

Beat the eggs lightly. Put the flour into a bowl, and add the paprika and the salt. Beat the eggs lightly again and mix into the flour mixture. Mix the beer into the egg/flour mixture, then stir until smooth. Heat the oil in a deep frying pan until hot but not smoking. Dip each of the shrimp into the batter mixture so that they are completely covered. Put the battered shrimp into the hot oil and fry for 4 minutes or until golden brown, then remove them from the pan with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cut and discard stems from mushrooms. Slice the mushrooms and sprinkle with lemon juice. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat until it is hot but not smoking. Add anchovies and cook until they dissolve into the oil (about 1 minute). Add the mushrooms and cook until they are soft and lightly browned (about 6 minutes). Sprinkle with mint and parsley and serve at once.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare cupcake mix according to directions on box. Fill paper lined cups 2/3 full. Bake 18 to 22 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Beat all remaining ingredients at medium speed until blended. Spoon into a pastry bag fitted with a plain tip. Pipe frosting in a circle around tops of cupcakes.

Combine pineapple tidbits and mandarin orange sections in a large mixing bowl. In a small mixing bowl whisk together the sour cream and mayonnaise. Pour over the pineapple and orange mixture and gently fold in the maraschino cherries and coconut. Chill overnight. Serve chilled. Sprinkle with additional cherries and a few more marshmallows if desired.
Mix all together the night before (except the nuts) and refrigerate overnight (I use an old large mason jar). The next morning you can add the nuts right before serving if you like.
Mix all the ingredients together. Serve with white rice.

In a small bowl, mix butter with the green onion, garlic, and seasonings to taste. Melt the butter mixture in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the chicken broth and potatoes, cover partially, and cook until the potatoes are just tender, about 15 minutes. Add the mushrooms and vegetables. Continue cooking over medium-low heat until the vegetables are just tender, about 5 minutes more. Stir in the paprika and serve immediately.

Place potato halves in a large saucepan with 1 Tablespoon of the butter. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt, black pepper to taste. Pour in the white balsamic vinegar and cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid. Shake the pan gently until the potatoes are cooked through and the liquid is almost evaporated, about 8 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the remaining 1 Tablespoon of the butter. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in the green onions, the fresh thyme and the lemon peel. Cook until the garlic is lightly browned, about 2 minutes longer. Stir in the maple syrup. Remove the saucepan from the heat. Season with additional salt to taste. Remove the lid from the pan containing the potatoes. Stir in the sauce mixture. Toss until the potatoes are coated.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add chicken. Cook until brown. Add bacon. Cook until crisp. Add ranch dressing and red pepper flakes. Cook until heated. Spread on half of each tortilla. Sprinkle with cheese. Fold over. Cook until golden brown. Serve with salsa.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine butter, spices and herb. Brush over the tortillas, then sprinkle with the seeds. Bake until browned and crisp, about 4 minutes per side. Cut into wedges to serve.

Soak gelatin in cold water for 5 minutes. Squeeze out excess water. Blend gelatin with whipping cream. Slowly beat in icing sugar 1 cup at a time. Beat until firm peaks form. Chill until ready to use.

Boil potatoes in salted water until just tender. Drain. Add bacon, vinegar, scallions and celery. Toss to coat. Refrigerate. Remove from refrigerator 15 minutes before serving. Mix sour cream with mayonnaise in a small bowl. Add to salad and toss. Serve.

Cut up chicken and cook in a skillet. Cook rice separately. Mix yogurt and peanut butter together in a small bowl. Add red pepper to taste. Drain and cut up cooked chicken and mix with yogurt mixture. Serve over rice.

In a large skillet over med heat, saute the pierogies in the oil until lightly browned. Remove and keep warm. In the same skillet, saute the onion, mushrooms and tomatoes in the remaining oil until tender. Add parsley and season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in enough water to make a sauce. Serve pierogies topped with the tomato mixture. Makes 2 servings.

Cut each chicken breast in half lengthwise so you have 8 pieces total. Place chicken pieces in crockpot. In medium bowl combine margarine, salad dressing mix, cooking sherry, soup. Heat until margarine is melted. Add chicken and cook 4-6 hours on low. Remove chicken from crockpot and place on platekeep warm. In same crockpot whisk in cream cheese until smooth. Stir in riceheat until hot but do not boil. Serve with chicken.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add oil and cook onions and garlic until translucent. Add ground beef and cook, breaking up with a spoon and stirring to evenly brown. Drain fat and return to skillet. Add breadcrumbs and spices and mix well. Let cool and divide into approx 12 balls. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add oil and cook onions and garlic until translucent. Add ground beef and cook, breaking up with a spoon and stirring to evenly brown. Drain fat and return to skillet. Add breadcrumbs and spices and mix well. Let cool and divide into approx 12 balls. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add oil and cook onions and garlic until translucent. Add ground beef and cook, breaking up with a spoon and stirring to evenly brown. Drain fat and return to skillet. Add breadcrumbs and spices and mix well. Let cool and

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat a 13×9 inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Place half of chicken in baking pan. Cover with remaining half. In a large bowl combine the corn, beans and salsa. Sprinkle with cheese. Pour over chicken. Bake in preheated oven until no longer pink in center of thickest portion, about 1 hour. Meanwhile, heat butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and garlicsaute until tender. Stir in cumin. Combine cornstarch and water until smooth. Add to panstir until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Spread over chicken. Yield: 4 servings.

In a medium saucepan, combine the stock and the lemon. Bring to a boil. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Using a sharp knife or skewer, pierce the skin of each thigh several times. Sprinkle with pepper and place in the boiling liquid. Cover and simmer over low heat until the chicken is no longer pink. Transfer the chickens to a serving platter. Add the onion to the liquid and bring to a boil. Add the rice and simmer over low heat until the liquid is absorbed, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in the parsley. Spoon the rice over the chicken.

Place the broccoli florets into a pot of boiling salted water. Cook for 3 minutes. Remove the broccoli with a slotted spoon and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat saute the garlic in the butter for 1-2 minutes or until the garlic is golden brown. Add the florets and continue cooking for 3-4 minutes. Add the olive oil and continue cooking for 3-4 minutes. Season with lemon juice, black pepper and parmesan cheese. Serve over the pasta and sprinkle with pine nuts.

Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Beat eggs with heavy cream in a small bowl until frothy. Stir in potatoes, pepper, and salt. Add to skilletcook until potatoes are softened but not browned. Stir in meatloafcook until heated through. Serve immediately.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over moderate heat. Add the lemon juice and lemon rind. Place the fillets in the saucepan. Cook for 2 minutes then turn over. Cook for a further 2 minutes. Place in an ovenproof dish. Sprinkle the cornflake crumbs over the fillets. Sprinkle the lemon pepper over the fillets and the salad supreme over the crumbs. Cook in a moderate oven (180c) for 10 minutes.

Cut vegetables into large chunks. Toss with herbs. Put vegetables into bottom of a 5-quart crock pot. Place chicken in crock pot. Mix together soup, wine, soup mix, and water. Pour over chicken. Cover and cook on high for 5 to 6 hours or on low for 8 to 10 hours. Add additional water if necessary. Serve with rice.

Cream butter until light and fluffy. Gradually add sugar until combined. Add eggs one at a time. Stir in flour and baking powder. Stir in blueberries and cranberries. Pour batter into greased and floured 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Drizzle with glaze.
Thinly slice the cucumbers and onion. In a medium bowl, combine the cucumbers and dressing. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Chill and serve as a side dish with any meal. 4 servings.

Heat the bacon until it is crisp. Drain on paper towels. Cut the bacon into small pieces and set aside. In a 3-quart stockpot or Dutch oven, heat the butter until it is hot and melty. Stir in the onion and cook until it is soft and tender and lightly browned. Sprinkle with the sweet paprika and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer. Stir in the potato. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the chicken stock and the cheddar cheese. Cook for 3 minutes more. Stir in the bacon. Season with the pepper. Cook for 2 minutes longer. Garnish the soup with the chives. Serve with a big chunk of crusty bread.

In a medium saucepan, combine tea bags and boiling watersteep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Stir in cranberry juice, apple cider, and brown sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Stir in ginger and spices. Simmer for 5 minutes. Discard spices. Serve immediately.

In blender container combine coffee granules, water and coffee liqueur. Blend well. Add creme de cacao and sugar. Blend until smooth. Pour into serving cups and top with whipped cream and grated chocolate.

In large skillet, saute garlic and oil until garlic is golden. Stir in onion soup mix, water and bread crumbs. Cook over low heat until thickened. Stir in noodles. Cook until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley and Parmesan Cheese. Serve hot.

Combine soy sauce, mirin and honey in shallow dish. Place tuna in dish and turn to coat. Marinate at least 30 minutes at room temperature. Place in a large non stick skillet and cook over high heat for 1 to 2 minutes on each side, until desired doneness. Top with sesame seeds. Serve with wasabi paste and white rice.
Cook meat and onion in saucepan. Add vegetables and gravy. Simmer. Fill bottom of pie crust with meat mixture. Spread over mashed potatoes. Bake in 425 degree oven for about 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut pita into 4 triangles. Place triangles on cookie sheets. Brush with oil. Bake 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Add chili powder, seasoning salt, onion powder and garlic powder to remaining oil. Dip triangles into oil mixture. Sprinkle with cayenne. Cool. Store in freezer bags.

In a large pot of boiling water, blanch the cabbage for 1-2 minutes. Drain it well, cool it to room temperature and then chop into 1/2" pieces. Saute the garlic, onions and seasonings until the onions are clear. Add the cabbage to the pot and cook for 5 minutes. Add the cream, lemon juice, white pepper and sugar. Cook until heated through. Serve hot or cold.

Cut the red onion into thin slices. In a small saucepan, over low heat, melt the butter with the milk. Mix the cornflour with a little water to make a smooth paste. Stir into the milk mixture. Stir in the pepper and salt. Cook until thickened to a sauce consistency. Arrange the slices of red onion in a single layer in a shallow 2 quart baking dish. Cover with the sauce, sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes or until the sauce bubbles around the edges and the cheese is melted. Cut the bread into 1/2 inch thick slices. Place 2 slices of bread on each plate, top with 2 slices of the red onion, sprinkle with a little more cheese. Spoon the sauce over the bread slices. Serve hot.

In skillet, saute onions with oil until soft. Add potato cubes and cook until tender. Add garlic, celery and basil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add broth and cook until vegetables are tender. Add broccoli. Serve with toasted bread.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease bundt pan or deep-dish pie plate. Mix sugar and cinnamon well and set aside. Separate dough into 18 biscuits. Cut each biscuit into 4 pieces. Place one piece in the bottom of each cup of the pan. Sprinkle with 1/4 of the mixture. Add another piece of dough over the top of the mixture. Repeat until pan is full or mixture is gone. Mix remaining mixture with 1/2 cup margarine and spread over the top of the dough. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before turning out of pan.

In a large pot with a tight fitting lid, combine all the boil ingredients and bring to a boil. Cook until reduced by half. Remove from heat. In a small bowl combine light mayonnaise and ketchup. Stir in the dill pickles and onions. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. When ready to serve, bring the boil up to a boil and add the raw shrimp. Boil for 3 minutes or until pink and firm. Drain and serve with the dipping sauce.

In a skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef and drain fat. Stir in the cream of mushroom soup and milk, and bring to a boil. Simmer for 3 minutes until thickened. Place 1/2 cup of meat mixture in the center of each tortilla, fold the sides in and roll up the tortilla like an enchilada. Place 4 of the filled tortillas in a 9x13x2-inch baking dish. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and place them over the first 4 tortillas. Pour the remaining meat mixture over the tortillas. Combine the cheddar and green chilies and sprinkle over the top of the casserole. Bake uncovered at 350f for 35 minutes. Let sit for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with lettuce, tomato and/or sour cream if desired.

Place the watermelon in a food processor or blender. Add the water, sugar, and lime juice. Process until the mixture is pureed and smooth. Chill the mixture until it is ready to serve. Serve over ice in tall glasses garnished with mint leaves or thinly sliced watermelon.

Saute onion and fresh mushrooms in butter until onion is transparent. Add flour and stir until golden. Add hot water and stir until thickened. Season with salt and pepper. Cut chicken into pieces and add to skillet. Cover and simmer until done. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream. Serve over noodles.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Warm bread in microwave 30 seconds. Combine ricotta cheese and spinach in a large bowl. Beat with a fork until blended. Add olives, parsley, 1/4 teaspoon each pepper and sea saltstir to combine. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1/4 teaspoon of each pepper and sea saltstir to combine. Add bread cubestoss to coat with butter mixture. Pour bread mixture onto baking sheetspread evenly with a spatula. Spread ricotta mixture over bread mixture. Sprinkle with olives, parsley and sesame seeds. Bake for 15 minutes or until mixture is firm. Cut into 4 wedgesserve immediately.

Combine ginger, garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil and sugar in a medium bowl. Mix until sugar has dissolved. Thread 4 shrimp onto each skewer and place on a greased grill rack over medium heat. Brush shrimp with marinade and grill until done about 2-3 minutes on each side. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with chili pepper flakes if desired.

Chop the onion into small pieces and put into a large pot with the carrots, celery and the peppercorns. Chop the meat into small pieces, then add to the pot along with the bay leaves. Pour in the water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer. Cook until the meat is cooked through, about two hours. Remove the meat from the stockpot using a slotted spoon. Strain the stock through a sieve lined with a paper towel to remove any pieces of vegetable or meat.
Place apples in roasting pan or ovenproof baking dish. Add sultanas & sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350F for about 25 minutes or until tender. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Drizzle bacon with 2 tablespoons of the Catalina dressingset aside. Combine 1/2 cup dressing, prepared mustard and pepper in a small bowl. Cut each tomato slice in half. Divide spinach between 2 plates. Top each serving evenly with bacon, tomatoes and provolone slices. Drizzle dressing mixture evenly over salads. Garnish with reserved bacon.

Boil the cheese tortellini in a large saucepan of boiling water until tender. Drain well. Add the squash puree and milk into the pan of cooked pasta. Stir in the butter until the sauce is smooth and creamy. Add the fresh parsley, salt and pepper to taste. Divide evenly into bowls then top with freshly grated Parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel potatoes and cut into wedges. Toss with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic powder and pepper. Spray a baking sheet and spread the potatoes in a single layer. Bake for 15 minutes, or until the wedges are tender. Remove from oven and spoon a generous amount of the Alfredo sauce on each wedge. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake for an additional 5 to 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Sprinkle with additional pepper and top with thyme before serving.

Heat olive oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, and cook until browned, stirring occasionally. Add yellow onion and oreganocook 5 minutes more. Add olivesstir in chicken broth. Cook 3 minutes more. Add fresh green beanscook over medium-high heat until crisp-tender, about 4 minutes. Serve hot.

Sweet tart crust: Blend together flour and cinnamon in a bowl. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add egg whitemix well until mixture holds together when pressed. Place in a 10 inch fluted tart pan and press into bottom and sides of pan. Bake for about 10 minutes in a pre-heated 400 degree oven until lightly golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before adding filling. Filling: Slice pears in half lengthwise and remove cores with a paring knife. Slice pears thinly and place in bowl. Toss with brown sugar and mix well. Place in tart shell and top with the second pastry shell and press edges together to seal. Brush top with a beaten egg white and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar for a decorative touch. Bake in pre-heated oven at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbling. Cool for about an hour before serving. Cut into wedges and serve with whipped cream
Wash berries and put in a cooking pan. Add water and bring to a boil. Add potato flour and cook until thickened. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Rinse halibut fillets under cold running waterpat dry with paper towels. In a small bowl, combine lemon juice with 2 tablespoons olive oilset aside. In another small bowl, combine rosemary and parsley with remaining olive oilset aside. Arrange potatoes in a single layer in a large shallow baking pandrizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oilseason with salt and pepper. Roast potatoes in oven until tender and beginning to brown, about 30 minutesset aside. Lay halibut fillets skin-side down in pandrizzle with lemon juice mixtureroast in oven until fish is opaque throughout, about 10 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer halibut to a warm serving platteradd potatoes to platter. Toss parsley mixture with remaining olive oildrizzle over fish and potatoessprinkle with rosemary leaves.

Wash potatoes well and boil for 10 minutes or until done. Drain potatoes well, then peel them and cut them into bite-size pieces. Combine the remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Add the potatoes, celery, parsley, salt and pepper, and toss to blend well. Add the frozen peas and toss lightly. Add the hard boiled eggs and toss again. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve cold with dressing poured over the top.
Mix all ingredients together and refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Shape into desired shapes and bake.

Place roast in 9x13 glass or metal pan. Pour cream of chicken soup over the roast. Bake uncovered for 3 hours at 250 degrees F. Remove roast from pan and place in slow cooker. Add remaining ingrediants to the roast and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Serve with hamburger buns.

Place chopped chocolate and butter in a large bowl. Microwave at medium power until smooth and melted. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in jam and liqueur. Spoon into raspberry shells. Sprinkle with cocoa. Let stand at room temperature until set. Store tightly covered.
Mix stuffing according to directions. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Stir in broccoli. Pour salad dressing over mixture. Bake for 10 minutes longer. Sprinkle with cheese.

Cook the potatoes in water till tender. Cool, mash them in a large bowl. Heat the oil in a frying pan and add the onion. When it turns golden, add the mashed potatoes. Cook over low heat till the mixture becomes firm. Add the egg beaten with the salt and pepper and cook till it sets. Spread the parsley leaves and serve hot.
Brown chicken in butter. Add vegetables and bouillon cube. Add rice and remaining ingredients. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the fingerling potatoes. Cook until tender, about 6 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside in the same bowl. Meanwhile heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Once the oil is hot, add the scallion slices and cook until crisp-tender, about 1 minute per side. Remove from the heat and set aside. Once the potatoes have cooled slightly, place them in a serving bowl or platter. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Once the butter is melted, add the parsley, season with pepper and stir until well blended. Pour the parsley-butter mixture over the fingerlings and toss to combine. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and top with the scallions.

Grill asparagus on a preheated grill or grill pan over medium heat until crisp-tender, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer to a bowl with balsamic vinegar and toss to combine. Sprinkle with lemon juice and soy sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Process the celery, green bell pepper, and garlic clove in a blender or food processor until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients, except for the crackers. Mix well. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve with crackers.

Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the bread cubes and milk. Let the bread soak for 30 minutes. In a separate bowl, combine the brown sugar, pecan halves and cinnamon. Preheat the oven to 350f degrees. Drain the soaked bread and add the raisins. Mix well. Pour the mixture into the baking dish. Sprinkle with the brown sugar and pecan mixture. Bake the pudding for 45 minutes. Remove the pudding from the oven and spread the apple pie filling over the top. Return the pudding to the oven for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove the pudding from the oven and allow it to cool slightly before serving.

In a large mixing bowl combine the cheeses. Add the butter, milk, and steak sauce and mix well. Divide into two balls and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Take out and roll in the nuts, if desired. Serve with your favourite crackers.

Scoop the flesh of the avocados from their skins with a knife. Cube the avocado into small chunks and place in a medium mixing bowl. Add the tomato, onions, garlic, and lime juice. Mash the ingredients with the back of a fork until a chunky spread forms. Salt to taste. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving time. Serves 2.

Cook potatoes in boiling salted water to cover until they can be easily pierced with a fork. Drain, cover and put aside to keep warm while you make the sauce. Combine margarine, garlic, basil in a small bowl. Stir until blended. Spread over potatoes.

In a small bowl combine pesto sauce and milk until well blended. Roll out dough to form a rectangle about 10 inches by 6 inches. Spread with cheese mixture to within 1/2 inch of edges. Sprinkle with paprika. Cut dough into 1 inch stripsroll up each strip with filling inside. Press edges together to seal. Place dough on a baking sheetbrush with egg beaten with water (to make wash). Bake 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightlysprinkle with pine nuts. Serve warm. Makes about 3 dozen.

Preheat the oven to 450. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Slice the sweet potatoes about 1/2 inch thick and toss with the olive oil. Season with seasoning salt, rosemary, italian seasoning. Bake for about 45 minutes turning once.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Sprinkle pork chops with chili powder. Place chips in a single layer on the bottom of a baking pan. Place chops on chips. Sprinkle with chips. Pour yogurt over chops and bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

Place the peanut butter in a large pot over low heat. Stir until the peanut butter melts and becomes liquid. Add the stock and stir well. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and add the milk. Stir in the curry powder, nutmeg, and black pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve the peanut soup with crackers or toast points.
Combine all in a saucepan. Bring to boil. Simmer 5 minutes. Pour into sterilised jars. Cover. Cool. Makes about 2 liters.

Preheat your grill. Mix the meats, add the egg and form into a loaf. In a small bowl mix the mushrooms with the garlic and seasoning. Spread the mushrooms over the loaf. Grill the loaf for 35 minutes.

In a small saucepan over low heat, combine whiskey, brown sugar, olive oil, garlic powder, soy sauce, salt and pepper. Stir well. Remove from heat. Cool to room temperature. Pour over steak or chicken, or chop fine and use as marinade for meatballs.

In 13x9 inch baking dish, combine soups, water and soy saucemix well. In 13x9 inch baking dish, place chopscover with cream mixture. Bake in 375 degree F. oven for 1 hour or until chops are tender. Remove chops from baking dishkeep warm. In small bowl, combine tomato sauce and dry onion mixspoon over chops. Place noodles in same dishspoon tomato mixture over noodles. Bake for 5 minutes or until heated through. Yield: 6 servings.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Brown the stew meat in the oil. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer for about two hours. Serves 6 to 8.

Place pork in a large bowl and toss with cornstarch and 3 tablespoons sugar. Place white wine in a small bowl, stir in soy sauce, then add the pork mixture. Let sit for 10 minutes to marinate. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until very hot. Add garlic cloves and gingerstir-fry 30 seconds. Add pork mixture and cook until pork is browned, stirring constantly. Add remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, carrot and bok choy. Stir-fry 1 minute or until bok choy is tender-crisp. Add 1/4 cup waterstir-fry until liquid is almost evaporated. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and remaining 2 tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 1 tablespoon water until sauce is thickened. Serve over hot cooked rice.

In a large stock pot, place all vegetables and chicken in 1 1/2 gallons of water. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 1/2 hours or until vegetables are tender and chicken is done. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Serve in a deep soup bowl. Garnish with cilantro if desired.

Combine breadcrumbs, parmesan and seasoning in a shallow dish. In another shallow dish combine milk and dressing. Dip each piece of chicken into milk mixture and then into the bread crumb mixture. Place on a baking sheet. Spray both sides of chicken with nonstick cooking spray and bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and turn oven to broil. Broil on high for 3 minutes or until brown.

Combine first four ingredients. Beat in egg white. Combine dry ingredients. Stir in egg white mixture, then zucchini. Grease three 9 x 5 inch loaf pans. Divide batter among pans. Bake at 350F for 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutesremove from pans. Cool on racks.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Saute the onions for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they begin to brown. Add the garlic and the tomatoes and cook for a couple more minutes. Stir in the water and the noodles, season with the salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter and dust 9 or 10 inch springform pan. Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each. Stir in dry ingredients. Add lemon rind and beat well. Fold in apples. Pour into pan. Bake 45-50 min.

Brush the chicken with olive oil. Sprinkle with tarragon, parsley and mustard. Grill over direct heat until cooked through. Baste chicken occasionally. Serve with vinegar dressing. Serves 2 to 4 people.

Heat oven to 450 degrees. Place buns cut side up in a baking pan. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Arrange slices of turkey spam over top of each bun. Sprinkle with cheese. Place back in oven and bake until cheese is melted, about 5 more minutes. Remove from oven. Top with pickle slices. Serve with mustard.

Sear roast in cooking oil until brown on all sides. Add water and bouillon cubes, cover and bring to a boil. Add all remaining ingredients except cornstarch and reduce to a simmer. Cook for 30-40 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. Whisk cornstarch and cold water together, adding to liquid in pan and cooking until thickened. Serve over white rice.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrot, celery, garlic, wild rice, water or broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for about 35 minutes or until the wild rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Mix the wild rice with the long-grain white rice and add the parsley. Cook an additional minute or so. Serve immediately or at room temperature.

Combine 1/3 cup of warm water with the dried yeast in the mixing bowl of your stand mixer with the whisk attachment. Let that sit for 10 minutes, or until bubbles begin to form. Add the remaining 2/3 of the warm water, along with 1 1/2 cups of bread flour and the caster sugar. Knead on low speed for 10 minutes until the dough is smooth. Add the remaining 2 cups of bread flour until the dough comes together nicely. Cover with a light towel and let rise for 1 hour or until doubled. Lightly grease two baking sheets and roll the dough into 8 balls. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise for 20 minutes. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Top with your favorite pizza toppings and bake for 10 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and crispy.
Combine all ingredients. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Serve with crackers.

Place blackberries into a food processor or blenderpuree until desired texture is reached. Combine blackberries and sugarset aside to let the blackberries macerate for at least 20 minutes and up to one hour. To serve, spoon blackberries on top of the vanilla ice creamdrizzle with the lemon juice mixture. Garnish with lemon zest or mint leaves and serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the leeks and cook for 10 minutes or until softened. Add the chopped tomatoes and stock. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium low. Simmer for 25 minutes or until the liquid has reduced to a thick sauce. Add the salt and pepper. Taste and add more seasoning if desired. Add the black olives and cook for 2-3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Stir through the lemon juice. Serve hot as a side dish.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream sugar and margarine together until light and fluffy. Beat in banana, then egg and buttermilk. Sift together flour, soda and saltstir into creamed mixture just until moistened. Fold in walnuts. Spoon into greased 12-cup muffin pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center of muffin comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack.

Drain tofu. Mix together cornmeal, cornstarch and poultry seasoning. Add yogurt and pepper. Mix well. Cut tofu into bite sized pieces. Toss pieces in yogurt mixture and place on a cookie sheet. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add garlic and carrot. Cook about 2 minutes, then add spinach and cook until almost dry. Add peas and the rice. Stir in the sesame oil and mix thoroughly. Add soy sauce and season with salt and pepper.
Mix all ingredients well in a bowl. Spoon into greased baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees f for 45 minutes or until golden brown.

Peel jicama and slice it thinly on a vegetable cutter. Remove seeds and pith from oranges and slice them in half. Combine jicama and oranges in a large bowl. Sprinkle with salt. Toss well. Add chili powder and stir well. Divide mixture onto four plates. Top with unsalted peanuts. Garnish with red pepper flakes. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

In heavy skillet over medium heat cook sausage, red pepper flakes, onion and garlic until onion is tender and sausage is browned, 10 minutes. Add tomatoes, cream and salt. Simmer until slightly thickened, about 15 minutes. Toss with cooked pasta. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 4.

In a large heavy skillet over medium heat, brown the meat. Add the onions and cook until the meat is cooked through. Transfer the meat to the crockpot. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or high for 4 to 5 hours. Serve with warm tortillas.

Cut lamb into 1-inch cubes. Add to a 6-quart slow cooker. Add oil and stir to coat. Add tomatoes and onion. Add green beans and stir to coat. Add garlic and stir. Add allspice and stir to coat. Add hot water. Cover and cook for 5 to 6 hours or until lamb is tender. Stir occasionally. Serve with rice.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add bell pepper and onion, and cook until tender. Stir in celery, paprika, thyme leaves and parsley. Cook for 30 seconds. Add broth and simmer for 5 minutes or until the mixture is reduced by half. Add the potato and cook for 3 minutes, or until the liquid is almost absorbed. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Serve immediately.

Wash potatoes and cook them in boiling water until tender, drain and put in a skillet over medium heat. Slice the rosemary into slivers. Stir in olive oil, rosemary, mustard, pepper and potatoes. Cook over medium heat until potatoes are golden brown. Cut the cheese into small pieces and stir in the cheese and serve immediately.

Sprinkle paprika, cayenne, garlic powder, oregano, salt and pepper over the top of the roast. Cover the pan. Cook the roast for 6-8 hours on low heat. Turn the roast over after about 4 hours. Add the vegetables, chicken broth and water to the crock pot. Cook until the meat is tender to your taste. Carve the meat into thin slices. Serve the meat over the vegetables with hot bread.

Heat oil in skillet on medium high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add olive oil, garlic and oregano to skillet. Brown chicken on both sides. Add broth, cover and simmer 10 minutes. Remove chicken to platter. Add remaining broth to skillet with oregano. Heat until broth is reduced by half. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve sauce with chicken. Serves 4.

In a saucepan combine the mustard and milk to make a thin paste. Cook the potatoes in a lightly salted boiling water until tender. Remove the pan from the heat and add the mustard mixture. Toss to coat well. Allow the mixture to cool slightly. Serve at room temperature or chilled.
Brown ground beef and hot dogs in large skillet. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Serve on buns.

Heat oil in dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and celery. Cook 10 minutes or until tender. Add carrots and cook 3-4 minutes or until tender. Add flour and cook 1 minute. Slowly stir in milk. Stir in creamed corn and whole kernel corn. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper. Heat through.

In a bowl combine the shrimp with the sugar, kosher salt, and spices. Heat the avocado oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the shrimp and cook until the shrimp are pink and firm and cooked through. Serve warm with lime wedges for squeezing.

Moisten rims of 2 glasses with lime wedge. Dip rims in coarse salt to coat. Place 1 cup ice cubes into each of 2 highball glasses or margarita glasses. Pour 2 ounces tequila into each glass and fill each glass with lemonade to top. Serve immediately.

Cream eggs with oil. Add pumpkin and beat well. Add flour, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, baking soda. Stir well. Spread in 9x13 pan. Bake at 375 for 25-30 min or until done. Cool slightly before frosting with cream cheese frosting.

Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlicsaute 2 minutes. Add kielbasa and saute 2 minutes. Stir in chicken broth, dried italian seasoning and black pepper. Heat through. Add great northern beans and cook until heated through. Stir in spinach leaves.

Place pork chops in an oven-proof dish and sprinkle with black pepper. Heat olive oil in large frying pan over medium high heat. Saute onions and garlic until tender. Pour over chops. Bake 15 minutes per inch thickness.

Boil potatoes in water until tender and drain. Peel and chop bacon and saute until crisp. Remove bacon from pan with slotted spoon and set aside to cool. Whisk together dressing ingredients. Add bacon to mixture and stir gently. Add celery, red onion, parsley to dressing mixture and stir gently to combine. Add diced hard-boiled eggs to dressing mixture and toss gently to combine. Add cooled cooked potatoes to mixture. Add more seasonings to taste and toss gently to combine. Serve chilled or room temperature.

Heat oil in saucepan and add flour, stirring with whisk constantly. Add water and stir constantly until smooth. Add rest of ingredients except chocolate chips and stir until smooth. Add chips and stir well. Microwave in microwave safe mug for 1 minute. Let sit for 5 minutes.

In a bowl combine the flour, sugar, salt and butter. Blend in orange juice. Stir in the cornstarch and water. Stir in the frozen berries. Pat the dough out on a lightly floured surface. Using a floured rolling pin, roll the dough out to a 14 inch square. Cut into 2 1/2 inch strips. Place 3/4 inch apart on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Brush with the orange glaze. Top with a mini chip. Bake at 375 for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 1 minute on the cookie sheet and then remove to a wire rack to cool. Makes 40.

In large skillet over medium heat, saute onion until tender. Add ground beef. Cook until no longer pink. Add jalapeno pepper and garlic powder. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in green chilies. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in enchilada sauce and corn. Cook for 2 minutes. Spoon mixture evenly into 8 cornbread squares. Top each with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool for 1 minute. Cut each square on the diagonal into 4 triangles. Serve warm.

Halve eggs lengthwise. Scoop out yolks and place in bowl. Mash yolks with a fork to blend well. Stir in remaining ingredients and blend until smooth. Fill the center of the white halves of the eggs with the filling and garnish with fresh dill sprig.

In a small bowl, combine the fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar. Set aside. Slice the fruit into 1/4-inch rounds. In a medium bowl, combine the fish sauce mixture with the fruit. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Garnish with the coconut flakes and the peanuts.

Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger powder, and dried onion flakes. Add chicken and marinade for 2 hours. Combine white wine and bourbon in a small bowl. Remove chicken from marinade and place in a resealable bag. Add bourbon mixture to bag. Seal and refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 425. Remove marinated chicken from bag. Place in a single layer in a foil-lined pan. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until done.
Melt butter over low heat. Stir in Worcestershire and hot pepper sauces. Add pecans and cashews. Stir and remove from heat. Pour into shallow dish. Chill. Serve at room temperature.

Chop up all of the vegetables and herbs and put them in a large pot with the malt vinegar and sugar, and stir over low heat until the vegetables are nice and caramelised. Add the cinnamon stick and the spices and continue to stir over low heat for 10 minutes. Then add the tomatoes and the cider vinegar and continue to cook for 30 minutes or so. Then add the garlic and the stock and cook for a further 30 minutes or so. Season to taste with the salt and serve with meat or vegetables.

Cook macaroni according to package instructions. In a skillet, saute the onion in the butter. Stir in the soup. Add the chicken, the milk and the cheese. Heat through. Add the macaroni. Sprinkle with the crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees F until browned. Serve immediately.

In a mixing bowl combine the yellow cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a small mixing bowl combine the coffee creamer and sugar and mix until smooth. In a medium mixing bowl combine the eggs, butter and non-dairy creamer. Stir in the flour mixture until smooth. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 10 x 13 inch pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 35-45 minutes. Cool slightly and cut into squares.

Prepare millet according to package directions. Heat butter in a sauté pan over medium heat. Sauté onion in butter until tender. Add squash and carrot. Sauté until soft. Add cabbage. Sauté until cabbage is bright green and slightly softened. Stir in millet. Season with salt. Stir in parsley. Serve warm.

Bake pastry shell. Let cool. Stir together flour and cinnamon. Add sugar and butter. Spread on bottom and sides of shell. Arrange berries in shell. Spoon sugar mixture over berries. Bake 45 minutes. Cool. Serve warm.

Mix together milk and egg. Cut French bread into cubes and dip in milk mixture. Cook in frying pan with butter until golden brown. Place in dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Add mushrooms to top before serving.

In a heavy saucepan saute onions in oil until softened. Add curry powder, carrots, chopped tomatoes and chicken broth. Cook over medium heat until vegetables are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Add basil and puree in blender or food processor. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut out 6 graham crackers from each side of the package to get 12 rectangles of crackers. Separate the rectangles and cut each into 4 squares for 48 pieces of crackers total. Cream together margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and continue to cream. Beat in pecans and pour over the crackers. Press down until covered. Bake for 10 minutes, or until topping is bubbly and lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Cut into squares and serve.

Bring 3 cups water to boil in medium saucepan. Stir in tapioca. Reduce heat to medium-lowsimmer 10-12 minutes or until tapioca is translucent but still has a slight bite to it. Meanwhile, in small bowl, combine cardamom pods and clovescrush with back of spoon or in mortar to release flavors. In medium saucepan over medium heat, bring 1 1/4 cups water to boil. Reduce heat to medium-lowadd cardamom-clove mixture. Stir constantly until water is reduced to 1/2 cup (about 45 minutes). Remove from heatlet stand 15 minutes. Strain into small bowldiscard cardamom pods and cloves. Add honeystir until blended. Stir in tapioca and lemon juice. Let stand until cool (about 30 minutes). Divide among 4 serving glassescover and chill until ready to serve. Pour about 1/4 cup orange juice concentrate into each glassstir until combined. Divide 1 t

Cook the carrots in boiling water until they are tender, about 3 minutes. Drain, rinse under cool water, then drain again. Combine the butter, olive oil, scallions, brown sugar and orange juice in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally until it is hot and bubbly. Toss the carrots with the warm sauce and season with pepper to taste.

Combine spices in a bowl and store in an airtight container or a spice grinder until ready to use. When ready to use, sprinkle a generous amount of the spice mixture over the meat and gently pat into the meat on both sides. Allow to sit for 15 minutes to 1 hour prior to cooking on a grill or in the oven.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet. Drain off fat. Add the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer over low heat for 20 minutes or until the meat is fully cooked. Serve hot on buns.

Cut the chicken into 4 pieces and dip in egg whites, then in flour. In a large skillet, heat 2 tbsp of the oil over medium heat. Saute the chicken until lightly browned on all sides, about 10 minutes total. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. Add the remaining oil to the pan and saute the onion until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the pepper, tomatoes, salt, cayenne, and water. Simmer until the sauce is thickened slightly, about 5 minutes. Add the chicken and the shrimp and cook for 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

Spread a layer of Mexican blend cheese on the bottom of an 8X8 inch casserole dish. Layer on the chicken and black beans. Spread sour cream on top and sprinkle with guacamole. Bake at 425 degrees F for about 20 minutes or until melted and bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips.
Toss together the shrimp, carrots and tomatoes. Add mint, lemon zest and soy sauce. Fold into flour tortillas. Top with chopped peanuts.

Saut onion in butter until tender. Add yellow squash and saute until tender. Add carrot and stir until tender. Add sour cream and soup and cook for 5 minutes. Spoon into greased casserole. Stir stuffing mix in melted butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over top of yellow squash mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

In a saucepan combine gelatin and sugar in water. Cook and stir for 2 mins or until gelatin is dissolved. Cool completely in the refrigerator. Add orange juice and lemon juicemix well. Spoon mixture evenly over bottoms of 2 1/2 cup freezer containers. Freeze for 6 hours or until set. Mash with potato masher just before serving. Spoon into serving glasses and top with ginger ale. Garnish with orange slices or orange wedges if desired.

Place the sugar and water in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar has completely dissolved and the mixture is warm to the touch. Remove from the heat and add the mint leaves and the rum. Stir to combine. Let cool completely. Meanwhile, combine the lime juice and the sparkling water. Cut the tops off the limes and squeeze the limes into the sparkling water mixture. Fill a highball glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum mixture and the sparkling water mixture into the glass. Top off with the champagne. Garnish each glass with a mint sprig and a slice of lime.

Peel & slice onions. Saute onions & garlic in butter until tender. Sprinkle with pepper. Combine flour & milk in shallow dish. Dip chops in mixture. Brown in hot skillet. In medium saucepan, combine remaining ingredients. Simmer until thickened. Spoon over pork. Yum!

Wash potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 50 - 60 minutes or until tender. Cut potatoes lengthwise in half. Scoop out pulp into a medium bowl. Place potato halves in a lightly greased 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Mash potato pulp with a potato masher until smooth. Add yogurt, mustard and dill weed. Stir well. Place potato halves in baking dish. Spoon potato mixture into potato halves. Combine oil, garlic and spices. Toss with mushrooms. Place around potatoes in baking dish. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Stir. Continue to bake for 10 minutes or until heated through. Makes 8 servings. High altitude no changes.

Place bacon in a large skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook until bacon is browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon to drain on paper towels. Add the onion to the skillet with the bacon drippings, and cook until translucent. Add the apples, cabbage, vinegar, brown sugar, allspice, salt, and pepper. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the apples are tender. Remove from heat and stir in the cooked bacon. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Place bulgar wheat and thyme leaves into a large saucepan. Pour over broth and water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until grains are tender about 20 minutes. Drain any excess liquid from the bulgar. Meanwhile, heat oil over med-high heat. Saute snap peas, bell peppers, onion, salt, and pepper until tender. Pour vegetables over bulgar, toss well, and serve immediately.

Place chicken breasts in a large glass baking dish. Mix ranch dressing and teriyaki sauce. Pour half of the mixture over the top of the chicken breasts. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator and pour the remaining mixture over the top of the chicken. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Sprinkle with green onions and bacon bits. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Serves 4.
Pour the brewed coffee and creamer into a blender and blend until smooth. Add ice cubes and blend again until smooth. Top with whipped cream, if desired.

Beat together the eggs and milk. Add the salt and the vanilla. Soak the slices of white bread in the mixture for a minute or two. Melt some butter in a pan and turn the heat on medium. Put the soaked bread into the pan. Cook until each side is golden brown. Dust with the mixture of white sugar and cinnamon. Serve warm with syrup or butter.

Cook the sausage on medium heat in a large frying pan until done and no longer pink inside. Remove the sausage from the pan and allow to cool slightly. Reserve the drippings from the sausage cooking process, adding the remaining drippings with the butter into the same frying pan. Stir the flour into the pan mixture to form the roux. Gradually stir the milk into the pan mixture to form the sauce. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat while continuously stirring the sauce to avoid lumps. Once the sauce has come to a boil reduce the heat to low and add the sausage back to the pan mixture. Stir the sausage into the sauce and cook the mixture over low heat, stirring constantly while allowing the mixture to thicken into a nice sauce. Once the sauce is thickened add the seasonings of your choice, such as black pepper and salt. Stir the seasonings into the sauce to blend the flavors together. Serve the sauce over the hot buttered biscuits and enjoy!

Soak the prawns in cold water for 10 minutes. Squeeze out the water, leave the prawns whole or chop them into bite-sized pieces. Mix the sour cream with the mayonnaise and lemon juice. Add the dill, black pepper and a squeeze of lemon juice. Mash the prawns into the cream mixture with a fork. Put the mixture onto the slices of rye bread, top with chives and red caviar.

Combine all ingredients in a blender. Process till smooth. Heat a frypan to moderately high. Grease lightly. Drop dessertspoons of batter into pan. Allow room for spreading and turning. Cook till bubbles appear on top. Turn and cook other side till golden brown. Serve warm with butter.

Steam the asparagus until crisp tender. Remove and set aside. In the same pan saute the mushrooms and the onion until soft and golden brown. In another pot, combine the melted butter and the flour. Cook over low heat until the mixture turns golden brown. Remove from heat and stir in the milk slowly. Cook until the mixture thickens. Stir in the cheese and mix well. Fold the asparagus and mushrooms into the sauce and pour over the noodles. Top with shredded cheddar cheese and sprinkle with black pepper and paprika. Bake in a 350 degree oven until the cheese is bubbly and brown on top. Serve hot.

Boil the potatoes. Peel and mash them. Saut the onions and celery in butter. Add the meat. Fry until browned. Add the stock. Let it boil. Add the mashed potatoes. Salt and pepper to taste. Add the egg. Beat it with a whisk. Stir the egg in the mixture. Pour the mixture into a large bowl. Cool it for 10 minutes. Then beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Add the milk. Beat until smooth. Refrigerate for several hours. Serve in bowls. Add chopped parsley.

Combine dry ingredients. Mix in oil. Add eggs. Add milk. Beat to blend. Stir in vanilla. Stir in sugar. Add cinnamon. Stir well. Grease waffle iron. Pour batter into iron. Cook until waffle is golden brown. Serve warm.

Mix instant mashed potatoes and milk. Add egg white and beat well. Add butter and continue to beat. Add biscuits and combine well. Place in a greased casserole dish. Melt unsalted butter and drizzle over the top of the biscuits. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake at 350 degrees f for 35 minutes or until golden brown.

Peel and cut the onion into eighths. Put into a freezer bag with the oil, mustard, dried sage, a good grinding of pepper and worcestershire sauce. Squeeze lemon juice into bag and then cut the halves into eighths and add them. Squidge everything around to mix and then add the chicken pieces. Leave to marinade in the refrigerator overnight, or for up to 2 days. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Allow the chicken to come to room temperature in its marinade. Arrange the chicken pieces in a roasting tin skin side up with the marinade, including all the bits and pieces. Tuck the sausages around them. Sprinkle the fresh sage leaves over the chicken and sausages. Put the tin into the oven to cook for 1 1/4 hours. Turn the sausages over half way through to color them evenly. Arrange the chicken and sausages on a large platter.
