In a small bowl, combine ground round, parmesan cheese, egg yolks, salt and pepper together in a small bowl. Add butter and onion to skillet on medium heat and saute until the onion is translucent. Increase heat to high and add the ground round mixture to the pan. Cook 2 minutes. Form into 4 patties. In a small bowl combine the cream, balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon of olive oil and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over patties and serve immediately.

Peel potatoes and dice. Cook in salted water for 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. In skillet heat oil. Add gingerroot, mushrooms, green onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add potatoes. Add 1 tablespoon of oyster sauce and 1 tablespoon of soy sauce. Add sugar and cook for 1 minute. Serve.
Combine all except salmon in a bowl. Mound on rounds. Arrange salmon on top and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve with a glass of white wine.

In a large stockpot with a tight fitting lid, heat olive oil, cumin seeds, cinnamon sticks and cardamom pods over low heat for 10 seconds. Stir in basmati rice. Add the stock. Cover the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 20 minutes. Uncover the pot and stir in the corn. Cover the pot and cook for 10 minutes longer or until all the liquid is absorbed. Remove from the heat. Stir in the lemon juice. Cover the pot and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork. Serve.
In a double boiler over medium heat, combine the chocolate, 1/3 cup water, heavy cream, vanilla, and kahlua. Stir frequently until mixture is smooth.

Preheat oven to 160 degrees celsius. Grease a baking tray and line with paper. Mix together the first 6 ingredients. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in the golden syrup. Remove from heat and add the boiling water. Stir in the bicarb. Pour into dry ingredients and stir to combine. Stir through the chocolate. Spoon onto the lined tray, pressing with the back of a spoon to form a flat round shape. Bake for about 10 minutes or until firm. Allow to cool on the tray for a couple of minutes before transferring to a rack to cool completely. Can be stored in an airtight container for up to a week.

Wash potatoes and boil until fork tender, about 10 minutes. Peel potatoes and cut into wedges or cubes. Place in a mixing bowl with the cumin, paprika and salt to taste. Toss until well coated. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spread potatoes in a single layer in a baking pan. Bake until browned, about 25 minutes. Turn once during baking. Serves 4.

Dice and mince chiles and garlic. Puree 1/2 of the chiles and garlic with sugar and tomatoes in a blender or food processor. Add fish sauce, lime juice, and 1/4 of the shrimp paste. Set aside. Slice papaya and put in a bowl. Add shrimp paste and rest of dressing. Toss and serve.

Cut pork loin into thin strips. Cut bamboo shoots into 2 inch pieces. Heat wok. Add sesame oil and stir-fry bamboo shoots for 20 seconds. Add pork and rice wine. Stir-fry until pork is tender. Set aside to cool. Mix cornstarch with egg white. In a large bowl mix together meat mixture and cornstarch mixture. Add the salt, sugar and white pepper. Stir in 2 tablespoons water. Place 1 teaspoon mixture in center of each wonton skin. Dampen edges with water. Fold over to seal and press edges to seal. Bring water to boil in a large kettle. Add wontons. Cook for 2 minutes or until wontons rise to the surface. Remove from water and drain well.

Saute onion in butter until tender. Add potatoes to onion and butter and mix well until potatoes are brown. Add remaining ingredients, except sour cream, to potato mixture. Remove from heat and pour into casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Pour sour cream on top of potatoes right before serving.

Zest and juice the lime. Cut the chicken breasts into strips. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken. Stir in the garlic. Cook until no longer pink. Add the lime juice. Toss to coat. Serve the chicken over the hash browns. Garnish with the parsley. Sprinkle with the black pepper. Serve immediately.
Slice eggs in half lengthwise and remove yolks. In blender combine eggs yolks, vinegar, sugar and juice. Process until smooth. Fill egg whites with yolk mixture. Top with sprinkled paprika.
Brown ground beef in a skillet with onions. Add baked beans and salt. Add Velveeta cheese and stir to melt. Spoon mixture onto the bun. Serve.

Combine poundcake crumbs and 1/4 cup of melted butter in medium bowl. Press firmly onto bottom of 9 inch springform pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Beat remaining butter in large bowl. Add milk, eggs and vanillabeat well. Stir in 2 cups white sugar, orange juice, and cinnamon until well blended. Spoon 1/2 of the cake batter over crumbs in pan. Spread 1-1/2 cups peach halves in syrup over batter. Spoon remaining batter over peaches. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until cake is golden brown and toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool cake in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove side of pan. Serve cake warm or cold. Garnish, if desired.

Combine all the marinade ingredients in a ziplock plastic bag. Place the meat in the bag and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven broiler. Drain the meat and discard the marinade. Broil 4 inches from heat for 8-10 minutes or until the pork is golden brown and done. Remove from the heat and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease 9-inch spring-form pan. Combine cream cheese and preserves in large bowl. Beat until smooth. Add poundcake mix, sour cream, half-and-half cream, eggs and almond extract. Beat until smooth. Pour half mixture into prepared pan. Combine remaining cream cheese mixture with dried apricots. Spread over batter in pan. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from spring-form pan. Cut in wedges. Sprinkle with almonds. Serve with Vanilla icing.

Beat margarine and sugar in a bowl until light and creamy. Add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Sift together the flour and cocoa powder in a separate bowl and add to the creamed mixture alternately with milk. Beat until smooth and well blended. Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 13-inch baking pan and bake at 350F for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Melt chocolate in top of double boiler over hot water. Remove from heat & stir in butter & sugar until smooth. Let cool to room temperature. Beat eggs & add to mixture. Fold in pecans. Pour into unbaked pie shells & bake in a 375f oven for 30-40 minutes until set. Cool to room temperature & chill overnight before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a cookie sheet with butter. In a large bowl, beat egg white until stiff peaks form. Beat in the splenda and the cinnamon. Spread the pecans out on the cookie sheet and toss with the egg white mixture to coat the pecans evenly. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, and stir once while baking. Spread the pecans out again and bake for 10 minutes longer or until lightly toasted. Repeat with the walnuts and the almonds, baking until toasted.

Mix together butter and peanut butter. Add powdered sugar, mixing as you add. You may need to add more sugar if mixture is too sticky. Roll into walnut-sized balls. Place in fridge. When hard, melt chocolate in microwave. Dip egg in chocolate. Return to fridge. Serve at room temperature.

Cook and drain onion. Mix with cheese, onion, mayonnaise and soups. Fold in broccoli. Spread into well greased 13 x 9 dish. Combine cracker crumbs and butter. Sprinkle over casserole. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until golden.

Combine rum, cognac, sweet cream, and whole milk in a heavy saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring frequently to prevent sticking. Reduce the heat to lowcook until the mixture is heated through but not boiling, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heatstir in the eggs, 1 at a time, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until the mixture is thickened slightly and a thin film forms on the surface when you run your finger over it. Remove the pan from the heatstir in the powdered sugar until well blended. Spoon into bowlsgarnish with nutmeg.
Toss lettuce with carrot, sun-dried tomatoes and walnut halves. Sprinkle with cheese and drizzle with dressing. Sprinkle with balsamic vinegar and sesame seeds. Salt and pepper to taste.
Combine all in a bowl. Serves 2.

Thaw sprouts. Cook in 1 tablespoon butter in saucepan until tender-crisp. Add rest of butter. Add vinegar, sugar, seasonings, and mushrooms. Cook for 1 minute. Add pimiento. Serve over hot rice or toast.

In a bowl cream together peanut butter, cream cheese, shortening and vanilla extract until smooth. In a separate bowl mix together the powdered sugar and nestle semi-sweet chocolate chips until all chips are coated. Take 1-teaspoon portions of the peanut butter mixture and roll into egg shapes (or any shape you like) on the palm of your hand then roll into the chocolate mixture. Place on a sheet of wax paper until completely hardened in the fridge or freezer (if you like the eggs softer place on a plate in the fridge). For a thicker shell just use less powdered sugar in the mix or roll in some crushed peanuts. Store in the refrigerator or freezer.
Boil the cabbage and water until tender. Drain. Mix the remaining ingredients. Combine the dressing with the cabbage and refrigerate. Add the apples and nuts just before serving.

Bring 3 quarts of water to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Peel carrots, then cut into 1/2-inch slices and add to boiling water along with cinnamon sticks and spices. Reduce heat to mediumsimmer until very tender, about 25 minutes. Drain wellset aside. Meanwhile, combine honey and lemon juice in a small bowl and stir until blended. Pour honey mixture over carrotstoss to coat well. Let cool slightly before serving. Makes 8 servings (2 cups)

In a large bowl, combine the dry pudding mix with the milk and the can of evaporated milk. Beat until well blended. Add the coconut extract and the coconut. Stir well. Chill for one hour or until ready to use. Gently fold the chilled Cool Whip into the chilled cream mixture. Spoon the mixture into the prepared unbaked pie shell. Cover and chill for at least three hours or until ready to serve. Garnish with additional shredded coconut, if desired. Store in the refrigerator.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the wild rice with enough water to cover by about 2 inches. Bring to a boilreduce heat to low, cover, and cook for about 30 minutes. Add the butter and onion, and cook until tender, about 1 minute more. Stir in the cranberries and brothcover and cook for another 15 to 20 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent stickingadd more water by 1/4 cupfuls if necessary to prevent sticking. Season with salt and freshly ground white pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh parsley, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Grease and flour 9 x 13 inch pan. In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and butter. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Add sour cream and beat. Combine the flour, baking soda, and saltstir into mixture. Fold in bananas. Bake in preheated oven for 45-50 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool. Spread with frosting. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serves 12.
Combine water and tea bags in teapotlet steep for 5 minutes. Strain into large bowllet cool slightly. Stir in apple cider, honey, and orange slice. Serve over ice cubes or chilled.

Beat eggs and milk together, add vanilla and beat again. Mix powdered sugar with cream cheese and spread onto bread slices. Add preserves to the mixture and spread on top of the cream cheese. Cook on each side in a buttered skillet or griddle over low heat. Turn once and serve with strawberry syrup.

In a large Ziploc bag combine honey and mustard. Add fish and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to broil. Place fish on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for about 20 minutes or until the fish begins to flake when tested with a fork. Spoon some sauce over the fish. Serve with additional sauce. Makes 4 servings.

Heat 1 tbsp. olive oil in a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat. Add couscous and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned and all liquid has been absorbed, about 6 minutes. Add chicken broth, parsley, tarragon, rosemary and lemon juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover tightly and cook 5 minutes or until liquid has been absorbed, stirring once or twice. Remove from heatlet stand 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a plattertop with remaining tbsp. olive oil. Makes 4 servings.
In a food processor combine all ingredients except parsley. Process until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Sprinkle with parsley.

In a large skillet cook chicken over medium high heat 5-6 minutes per side or until a meat thermometer reads 165 degrees. Set aside. In a small bowl stir together mustard, honey, garlic, and pepper. Slice chicken into thin strips. In a large skillet heat oil over medium high heat. Cook chicken strips 1 minute on each side or until crisp. Sprinkle evenly with remaining mustard mixture. Arrange carrots evenly on a baking sheet. Bake at 425 degrees F for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Toss carrots with the brown sugar. Serve chicken with the glazed carrots. Serves 4.

Brown the meat in butter. Then add the asparagus and saute for 2 minutes. Now add the sugar, the white wine and the stock. Simmer for another 2 minutes. Serve with the white asparagus tips. Slice the eggs and serve them with the asparagus. Add the creme fraiche and the pickle. Garnish with the chervil.

Brown meat and onions in large skillet. Add seasonings. Stir in egg noodles and water. Cook for 10 minutes. Add bread crumbs and mix. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in sour cream and heat through. Serves 4-6.

Cook beef and onion over med. heat until meat is browned. Add spices and cook for about 3 minutes. Add taco sauce and tomato sauce. Cook for 3 minutes more. Add beans and simmer for about 30 minutes. Serve over tortilla chips and top with shredded cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream shortening and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat until thoroughly combined. Add vanilla and milk and mix well. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking soda and saltstir well. Add to creamed mixture and stir just until blended. Stir in cereal and nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large skillet heat the margarine on medium heat until melted. Dip the chicken in the mixture then place the coated chicken on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes or until done. Serve over a bed of tortilla chips. This recipe can also be served over rice.

Combine strawberries, raspberries and blueberries in a blender. Cover and process until smooth. In a large bowl combine sugar, flour and baking mix. Cut in butter with a pastry blender until the mixture is crumbly. Stir in cereal and nuts. Spread evenly in an ungreased 15-in. X 10-in. X 1-in. Baking pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Combine the yogurt and the juice in a large bowlstir until smooth. Spread over crispsprinkle with extra nuts if desired. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving. Store leftovers in refrigerator.

Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/gas 4 and line 2 or 3 small baking trays with baking parchment. Mix the butter and sugar until pale and creamy. Add the flour and water, then bring together to form a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly dusted work surface and knead gently until smooth and elastic. Roll out to a thickness of 5mm/¼inch and use to line the trays. Prick the base with a fork and chill for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, grease and line a 23cm/9in deep pie dish with the pastry. Drain the juice from the tinned fruit and place it in the pastry-lined pie dish. Roll out the pastry remaining from the tarts to fit the top of the pie dish and lay over the fruit. Crimp the edges together and chill for 30 minutes or until needed. Bake for 30-35 minutes until the pastry is golden and the filling is bubbling up through the holes. Cool on a wire rack and serve at

Slice up cheese crackers, set aside. In a medium bowl mix together the shredded cheese, onion, green peppers, and chili sauce. Stir in the milk and eggs until well blended. In a separate bowl mix together the salt and pepper with the ground beef. Slowly add the beef mixture to the cheese mixture until well combined. Roll the mixture into 8 loaves, place in a greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Pour the remaining 1/2 cup of chili sauce over the top of the loaves. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the top with the cheese cracker crumbles. Bake for an additional 20 minutes. Serve with the remaining sauce.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Lay the bacon strips on a baking sheet. Bake until crisp. Remove the bacon strips from the baking sheet. Drain the bacon fat from the sheet into a skillet. Add the salt and pepper to the skillet and stir until combined. Place the bacon strips on paper towels to drain. When the bacon is cool, slice into thin strips. Place the oysters on the baking sheet and pour the bacon grease over the top. Sprinkle the salt and pepper over the top of each oyster. Sprinkle the slices of bacon over the top of the oysters. Sprinkle the chopped parsley over the top of the oysters. Place the baking sheet in the oven and bake for 3 minutes. Remove the baking sheet from the oven. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan, boil 1/2 cup water. Add the seasoning. Stir in the crawfish tails. Cook uncovered 4 to 6 minutes. Drain and rinse in cold water. In a large bowl combine the rice mix, tomatoes and soup. Spray a 2-quart casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray. Combine the rice mixture with the crawfish tails in the prepared dish. Bake uncovered 20 to 30 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with the cheese. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/gas 4. Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in the baked beans, red kidney beans and sweetcorn. Mash up the bread and stir into the mixture. Season with pepper. Spoon the mixture into a greased 1-litre (2-pint) dish. Cover with grated cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with salad.
Cut baguette into 1 inch slices. Toast in the oven until light brown. Spread the brie cheese on each slice of bread. Drizzle the honey over the cheese. Sprinkle on the walnuts. Serve.

In a large bowl combine the oats, flour and cinnamon. Stir in margarine until crumbly. Press into the bottom and up the sides of a pie pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Combine apples, lemon juice and sugar. Spoon into the partially baked shell. Sprinkle with the cloves. Bake until apples are tender and filling is bubbly. Let cool. Makes a delicious dessert.

In a large pot over medium heat add olive oil and saute the garlic and onion until tender. Add carrots and potatoes and saute until tender. Add the broth and simmer until tender. Blend or process in a food processor until smooth. Add the cumin and salt and pepper to taste. Heat through and serve.

Heat olive oil in skillet. Add onion and garlic and cook until onions are tender. Add the seasonings and cook 3 minutes. Add the beef and cook until browned. Stir in the tomato sauce and water. Heat until boiling. Stir in the beans. Simmer for 5 minutes. Spoon mixture onto heated flour tortillas. Top each taco with shredded lettuce. Serve with fat free cheese and taco toppings.

Saute onions in oil until soft. Add tomato paste and cook until thickened. Add tomatoes, garlic and spices. Bring to a boil, reduce heat. Cover and simmer until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in chicken, heat through. Serve over rice. Sprinkle with parsley if desired.

Spray 2 slices of bread with cooking spray and place in 2 frying pans. Top 1 slice with sliced tomato and cheese. Break an egg over the top and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook on medium heat until done. Top with another slice of bread and flip over. Repeat with remaining slices of bread and egg. Serve with skim milk.
Combine all ingredients except ice cubes in the blender. Blend until smooth. Add ice cubes to the blender and process until smooth. Pour into tall glasses and serve.

Grease muffin tin or line with paper baking cups. In large bowl combine quick bread mix, cocoa, and coffee granules. Add toffee pieces and chocolate chips. Stir until well blended. In small bowl combine buttermilk, oil, and eggs. Add to mixture and stir until moistened. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool. Store in an airtight container.

Cook onion in butter until tender. Drain vegetables and add to onion. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour into greased casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Makes 6-8 servings.

Season salmon with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until lightly browned. Remove to paper towel-lined platter to cool. Slice into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. In a small bowl combine onion, mustard and honey. Toss with fettuccine and enough lemon juice to moisten. Serve with salmon and chives.

Heat oil in a medium-size skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and onion. Cook until tender. Add sherry. Increase heat to medium-high. Add flour. Stir until mixture forms a paste. Slowly add milk and chicken broth. Stirring constantly. Bring to boil. Cook and stir until mixture is slightly thickened. Add frozen potato pierogies. Cook and stir until heated through. Stir in sour cream. Serve over pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan with butter or spray with nonstick cooking spray. Combine dry mix, eggs and milk in a large bowlstir just until moistened. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Pour into prepared pan and spread evenlydo not over-bake or the edges will be dry and the center will be soupy. Bake for 25-35 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for a few minutescut into squares and serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 8-12

Beat together cream and cream cheese until creamy. Add eggs and beat until just smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Butter 4 individual baking dishes and divide mixture evenly between dishes. Place dishes in refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Bake until puffed and golden brown on top, 40 to 50 minutes. Sprinkle with chives and serve immediately.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, cumin, oregano. Cook until garlic is golden. Add rice and stir to coat. Add stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Stir in pine nuts. Serve.

Place 1/2 cup of cheese in center of each breast. Fold over. Push down to form a tight seal. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight. Remove from refrigerator about 20 minutes before cooking. Heat oil in a skillet. Fry breast 4 minutes on each side. Baste with lemon juice during cooking. Salt and pepper to taste.

Steam the green beans for 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mustard, salt and pepper. Stir constantly until the mixture is smooth. Add the green beans, tossing well to coat the green beans thoroughly. Serve immediately.

Combine first 3 ingredients in medium saucepan. Boil 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add baking soda. Stir until mixture foams. Quickly stir in cereal. Spread onto wax paper. Cool 20 minutes. Store in covered container.

Put orange juice in small sauce pan. Heat on medium heat until juice is almost boiling. Turn off heat. Put in gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Add pineapple and nuts. Cool to room temperature. Add the fresh berries. Chill until firm. Serves 12.

Bring a small saucepan of water to boil. Add the brussels sprouts and cook for 2 minutes or until bright green and slightly tender. Drain and run under cold water. Drain and pat dry. In a large bowl combine the sprouts, pecans, butter, and oil. Add the lemon juice and mustard and toss. Add the salt and pepper to taste.

Place gelatin in a bowl. Add 1/2 cup boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add the sour cream and continue stirring until the mixture is smooth. Fold in the salmon. Pour into a 10-inch pie plate. Refrigerate until set. Mix the lemon juice, salt, and dill in a small bowl. Spoon the mixture into a pastry bag. Pipe the mixture in the center of each cracker. Serve with the salmon mousse. Serves 6.

Melt the butter in a medium saucepan. Slowly stir in the sour cream. When smooth, add the egg and stir well. Stir in the corn. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes, stirring frequently to blend all the ingredients together. Remove from the heat and stir in the corn muffin mix until it is well blended and moistened. Spread the mixture into a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Mix the rum with the peach and shake well to combine. Add the 7-up and mix well again. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Top with the champagne or sparkling wine and the sangria and stir gently. Garnish with the orange slice and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a medium bowl, stir together the milk, green onion, egg substitute, mustard, pepper and bread cubes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in the ham, and pour into a greased 10 inch square baking dish. Sprinkle with the Gruyere cheese and top with the bacon. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool 5 minutes before cutting into 9 squares. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a small heavy-bottomed pot over medium-low heat, stir together the milk, peanut butter, water, vanilla extract, salt, and cornstarch until well-combinedcook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the mixture thickens slightlyremove from the heat and stir in the vanilla extractpour into an 8x8-inch pan lined with parchment paper or wax paperlet cool, then cut into squaresmelt the candy coating according to the package instructionsin a small bowl, toss the peanuts with the melted coating until evenly coatedlet set for 30 minutesbreak the coated peanuts into pieces of any desired sizeplace 1 piece of candy coated peanuts in the center of each square of peanut butter mixtureserve.

Soak tart apples in water for two hours. Drain the liquid and drain the apples. Add sugar and spices to the apples and let sit over night. The next day add the oil, eggs and vanilla and mix well. Add the dry ingredients and mix well. Pour into an ungreased tube pan. Bake at 350 for one hour and ten minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for ten minutes and turn out on a cooling rack.

Boil water in large pot. Add bouillon cube. When bouillon cube is dissolved, add the potatoes and boil for about twenty minutes or until tender. Add cumin. Drain water from potatoes and add milk. Mash with hand. Add pepper and salt to taste. Add arrowroot and milk. Cook until thick. Cool. Serve with sour cream and sprinkle with chervil.

Pour white vinegar into a pot and bring to a boil. Add sugar, bay leaves and whole cloves. Remove from heat. Slice pickles into thin slices and add to pot along with a handful of dill seed. Return to the pot to the heat and bring to a boil again. Turn off heat and let cool overnight. Drain and rinse pickles then return to the pot. Add more sugar and cook until the pickles are glazed. Remove from heat and let cool overnight again. Rinse and dry the jars before filling with the candied dills. Seal the jars and store in a cool place for up to one year.

Mix together mayonnaise and horseradish. Mix well and set aside. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook onions until tender and golden brown. Stir in prepared horseradish mixture. Blend well and heat through. Arrange broccoli florets over horseradish mixture. Sprinkle with dry mustard and crushed red pepper flakes. Serve warm.

Place cashews in a medium saucepan with water to cover by about 2 inches and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for about 30 minutes. Remove from heat and drain cashews in a colander for about 20 minutes. Place cashews in a food processor and add brown sugar, cumin and salt and blend until smooth. Add butter and process again until smooth. Serve as a snack or as a topping for salads or sandwiches.

Sort through the beans and remove any small stones or debris. Cover with fresh cold water and soak overnight. Drain and rinse. Place the beans and the water into a large stock pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 to 2 1/2 hours or until beans are tender. Drain the beans and reserve the cooking liquid. Mash the cooked beans with a potato masher. Heat the olive oil in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until the onions are soft, 3 to 5 minutes. Add to the mashed beans and stir in the reserved cooking liquid to desired consistency. Add the salt and cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).Wash the potato skins thoroughly.Prick potato skins with a fork.Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the potatoes can be easily pierced with a fork.Mash the potato skins with a fork, or process in a food processor until smooth.Add the olive oil, garlic salt and pepper to the mashed potatoes.Stir to mix.Mound the potato mixture into a small bowl or serving dish.Serve warm.

In a large heavy-bottomed saute pan over medium-low heat, cook the onions and garlic until soft but not brown, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the Brussels sprouts and cook for 1 minute. Add the sugar and cook for 3 minutes. Add the bacon, season to taste with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9x13-inch pan. Mix potatoes and bacon together in a large bowl. Beat together milk, onion, garlic powder and paprika in a medium bowl. Add to potato mixture and stir to combine. Pour into prepared pan and dot with butter. Bake uncovered for 40-50 minutes, or until top is golden. Let stand 5 minutes. Makes 10-12 servings.

Mix oil, buttermilk, vanilla, and egg together. Blend in dry ingredients. Beat until smooth, fold in pecans and raisins. Pour into a greased 9 by 13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes in center of oven.

In a 12-inch nonstick skillet cook beef over medium high heat 5 minutes or until done. Remove meat from skillet. Add broth and soy sauce to skillet. Cook and stir until mixture comes to a boil. Add cornstarch mixture and green pepper strips. Cook and stir until thickened. Return meat to skillet. Serve over cooked rice. Garnish with green onion if desired.

In a small bowl combine the water and cornstarch and mix well. Combine the olive oil, vinegar, and seasonings in a medium bowl and stir well. Add the cornstarch mixture to the olive oil mixture and stir well. Add the plain low-fat yogurt and mix well. Serve with your favorite sandwiches or chips.

Brown bacon in frying pan. Remove bacon from pan and set aside. Brown steak in bacon drippings. Drain fat from pan. Add butter to pan. Stir in bacon and steak. Add seasoning to taste. Cook for 10-15 minutes. Add water to desired consistency. Serve hot.

Bring 8 cups water to boil in large pot. Add gnocchi and cook until floating to the surface, about 3 minutes. Drainset aside. Heat oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add crushed tomatoes and waterbring to boil. Add clamscook 3 minutes. Stir in basil. Serve with gnocchi.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Rub olive oil onto chicken breasts. Season with cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, allspice, paprika, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 30 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Serve with lemon wedges.

Shred the cabbage into a large bowl. Add the scallions, carrot, chili-garlic sauce, rice wine vinegar, and salttoss to combine. Cover the bowl tightly with plastic wraplet stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Store refrigerated for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 1 month.

Cook macaroni according to directionsdrain and set aside. Beat together skim milk, cream cheese, 1/2 cup of part-skim mozzarella, and non fat cheeses until smooth. Add cooked pasta and stir well to combine. Add parmesan cheese. Transfer to 3-quart casserole dishtop with remaining part-skim mozzarella. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes.
Mix together the ketchup and Italian dressing. Add the remaining ingredients. Marinate in refrigerator for 2 hours. Serve with crackers.
Combine sugar and melted butter. Blend in eggs. Add dry ingredients. Roll out and cut into squares. Bake at 350 for 10 to 15 minutes. Makes about 4 dozen.

Put the shredded cabbage in a bowl and toss in the lemon juice and a good pinch of salt and pepper. Chop the parsley and fennel very finely and mix into the slaw. Toss the capers through too and serve immediately.
In a bowl, combine dressing ingredients. Toss with romaine lettuce. Add croutons and top with parmesan cheese and blue cheese crumbles.
Sprinkle pot roast with mustard and brown sugar. Rub in oil. Add water and vinegar and cook covered on low heat for 3 hours. Add onions and flour. Cook covered 15 minutes more.

Brown sausage in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in soup and milk. Cook on low heat, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Stir in eggs. Cook over low heat until mixture is firm. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings.

In a bowl mix broth, salsa, onion and garlic. Pour half of mixture into crockpot. Add whole chickens. Pour remaining mixture over chickens. Cook on low for 8 hours. Shred chicken and add sour cream. Top with cheese and red beans. Serve with warm tortillas.

Beat together the cream, eggs, and brown sugar. Beat in the melted butter and the vanilla and the salt. Dip the bread slices in the mixture. Cook in a large skillet. Melt 1/2 tablespoon of butter in a large skillet. Dip the bread in the mixture. Cook in a large skillet over medium heat. Turn the bread after 2 minutes and cook until golden brown. Dust with powdered sugar and serve with syrup and butter.

Place the fish on a plate and pour the spices over both sides of it. Coat the fish evenly with it and leave it for a few minutes to marinate. Grill in a pan or on a grill until the fish is cooked through. Serve hot with baked potatoes or rice and salad for a delicious meal.

In a large bowl, combine the grapeseed oil and agave nectar together and stir to combine. Melt the chocolate in a double boiler (or over the stove in a metal bowl) with a tablespoon of agave nectar. Pour the melted chocolate into the bowl with the oil mixture and stir together with a wooden spoon or spatula (you may have to reheat the chocolate a bit to make it liquid again). Add the vanilla extract and stir again. Frost your cake or cupcakes and sprinkle with sea salt!

Drain excess fat from chicken and place in shallow pan. Dust with flour and salt and pepper to taste. Heat shortening in skillet and fry chicken in it. Turn and brown other side. Drain and place in shallow pan and cover with foil. Bake in a 325-degree oven for 1/2 hour or until done. Makes 4 servings.

Boil chayotes for 5-10 minutes. Cool in cold water. Cut chayotes in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Rinse with water. Chop coarsely. Mix chopped chayotes with garlic and onion. Add salt, black pepper, parsley, and olive oil. Add vinegar. Mix well. Serve as a salad.
Toast bread. Spread with peanut butter. Cut banana into thin slices. Lay slices of banana on top of the bread. Place a piece of bacon on top of banana slices. Drizzle with honey. Serve warm or cold.
Place ice cubes into a blender. Add gelato and raspberries and blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve immediately. Garnish each glass with a strip of orange zest.

Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Add powdered sugar 1 cup at a time, beating after each addition. Mix in almond paste and vanilla and stir until well combined. Spoon into teaspoon sized mounds on baking sheets lined with wax paper or parchment paper. Bake at 275 for 1 hour. Store in an air tight container.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan or skillet. Add the garlic and fry for a few minutes until golden. Add the chicken thighs and fry for 5 minutes. Turn over the thighs. Pour in the white wine. Cook for a few minutes until the alcohol has evaporated. Add the butter, lemon juice and parsley. Season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve the chicken with the sauce.

Spread bagel tops evenly with cream cheese. Spread bottoms evenly with pizza sauce. Top with mild green chilies, salsa and mozzarella cheese. Bake at 400 degrees f for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately. Makes 4 bagels.

Prepare cake batter according to instructions. Spoon into paper baking cups. Bake. Cool completely. Combine frosting with food coloring. Pipe frosting around edge of cake cup. Press in wafer. Add a chocolate egg to center of cup. Garnish with sugar crystals.

Heat the oil and butter together in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and celery and saute until the onion is translucent. Add the carrots and saute for 5 minutes. Add the chicken bones and cover with cold water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil over high heat and then reduce the heat to simmer for 2 1/2 hours. Remove the bones and strain the broth. Discard the bones. Season the broth with salt and pepper. Stir in the bay leaves and peppercorn. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat and strain the broth again. Discard the bay leaves and peppercorn. Return the broth to the heat and bring to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the parsley and thyme and remove from the heat. Strain again and allow to cool slightly. Strain once more through a fine sieve into a large bowl. Divide the stock into 2 equal portions. Chill one portion. For the remaining
Blend frozen raspberries in blender with raspberry sherbet. Add concentrate and gingerale. Blend well. Serve in cups with straws. Add dry ice for extra fizz.
Saute garlic in margarine until golden. Add green beans and saute until tender-crisp. Stir in lemon juice and coarse grain mustard. Simmer until thickened. Season to taste.

In a medium bowl, mix together cornmeal, sugar and salt. In another bowl mix together egg, milk, peppers and onion. Make a well in the center of the dry mixture. Add the wet mixture to the dry. Stir just until mixed. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 20 minutes or until golden.

In a saucepan saute the butter and onion until tender. Add carrots, celery, tomatoes. Cook until tender. Add the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Add the fresh pumpkin and cook until done. Add cooked rice and black pepper to taste. Serves 2.
Wash fish and place in a baking dish. Combine breadcrumbs with tomato sauce and herbs. Pour over fish. Bake at 375F for 15-20 minutes. Serve with boiled potatoes.

Beat together butter, sugar and vanilla essence. Add eggs one at a time and beat until light and fluffy. Sift flour and custard powder together and fold into butter mixture alternately with the yoghurt. Pour batter into greased and lined loaf tin. Bake for 40-50 mins or until golden brown on top and well risen. Leave to cool completely in tin before turning out onto wire rack. Dust with icing sugar.

In a saucepan bring stock to a boil. Add the barley and cook on medium heat 40 minutes. Drain and rinse until cool. In a large bowl place the remaining ingredients. Mix in the barley. Add more olive oil and seasoning to taste. Serve at room temperature or cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 days. Add more olive oil to taste before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Spray 12-cup shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Cook broccoli in large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp-tender. Drain. Stir in cottage cheese and cheddar cheese. Spoon mixture into prepared dish. Cut potato in half lengthwise. Scoop out pulp. Set shells aside. Combine cottage cheese mixture and potato pulp. Spoon into potato shells. Bake 30 minutes. Serves 4.

Cream butter, honey and brown sugar until well blended. Add egg and blend well. Stir in remaining ingredients except flour. Blend well. Stir in enough flour to make a dough that will hold its shape. Chill dough for 1 hour. Roll dough to 1/4 inch thickness on a lightly floured board and cut into desired shapes. Bake at 325 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 24 2 inch cutouts or 36 11/2 inch cutouts.

In a saucepan combine the sugar and the heavy cream. Heat to a boil and stir until the mixture is smooth and thickened. Remove from heat and beat in the salt and the vanilla. Pour into a buttered dish and cool until firm. Cut into squares.
Cream together the pudding and the cream cheese. Fold in the milk and the cool whip. Fill the ho ho cakes with the mixture. Sprinkle with the berries. Chill overnight.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until golden brown. Stir in garlic, chili powder, and cumin. Saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add water and beans and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes or until beans are tender. Stir in cilantro and lime juice. Serve hot.

Mix cream cheese with marmalade. Add curry powder, salt, and pepper to taste. Stir in cooked chicken, celery, green onions, and macadamia nuts. Shape into balls, coating hands with marmalade or lemon juice to prevent sticking. Roll in toasted coconut. Makes about 30.

In large bowl combine pears and fat free cream cheese. Cool. Beat with electric mixer. Gradually add jell-o gelatin and 1/2 cup milk. Beat until smooth and creamy. Add remaining milk. Beat until smooth. Fold in the cool whip. Chill. Top with maraschino cherries. Makes 8 servings.
Mix first 5 ingredients. Cut chicken into pieces. Dip in mixture and brown in olive oil. Cook in broth with rice for 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

Mix together corn flakes, coarse salt and ground pepper. Set aside. Beat egg in shallow dish. Dip chicken in egg. Dip into corn flake mixture. Place in single layer on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with cayenne. Bake at 400f for 30 minutes. Turn and bake another 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Spray crock pot with olive oil flavored cooking spray. Sprinkle seasoning salt over chicken and place in crock pot. In saucepan, saute the onions and garlic in the butter until tender. Pour over chicken in crockpot. Cover and bake for 4 hours on low or 2 hours on high. Serve on hot buns for sandwiches or with mashed potatoes.

In large saucepan cook pasta in boiling water until tender. Drain and return pasta to pan with the cheese and milk. Stir in cornstarch mixture and stir over medium heat until thickened. Stir in spices and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl combine salmon, milk, oats, parsley, chives, worcestershire sauce, salt and peppermix well. Divide into 4 portionsform each into a 1/2 inch thick pattyplace patties in a greased 15x10x1 inch baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Makes 4 servings.
Brown beef and drain fat. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer uncovered for at least one hour. Serve over cooked spaghetti.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss potatoes with oil and roast for 25 minutes or until tender, tossing halfway through roasting. Meanwhile cook broccolini in boiling water for 2-3 minutes. Remove potatoes and broccolini from oven and set aside to cool. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat and add lemon rind and potato flesh with the potato skins to make a paste. Cook for a couple of minutes until the potato flesh turns golden and the skins are crisp. Stir in salmon and cook until fish is just cooked through. Stir in broccolini and season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon potatoes mixture into potato skins and serve at once.

Heat oven to 250. Combine mustard with butter. Rub mustard mixture over top of roast. Heat oil in skillet. Saut onion and garlic until tender. Add sugar and garlic powder. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Add worcestershire sauce and bisto. Spoon over top of roast. Place in 250 degree oven for 6 hours.

In a large skillet, saute onions and celery in butter until tender. Sprinkle with flour, salt and pepper. Add water and stewed tomatoes, stirring to combine. Add bouillon cube. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Cook for about ten minutes or until thickened. Stir in bacon.

Preheat your oven to 325 degrees. In a bowl use your hands to mix together the meat, onion, and seasonings until just blended. Mold the mixture into a loaf and place in a pan or on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil. Place your loaf in the oven and bake for 45 minutes or until the top becomes a burgundy color and fat has gathered on the bottom of the pan. Serve with mashed potates and veggies for a yummy winter meal. Bon appetite.

In a large bowl, stir together butter, brown sugar, and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg and vanilla until smooth. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and saltstir into butter mixture until just blended. Stir in pecans. Press mixture into a 9x9-inch square pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Break into pieces. Makes about 2 dozen.
Place the chuck roast in a crockpot. Add the garlic and onion powders and the salt and pepper. Pour in the barbecue sauce. Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Serve over cooked white rice. Recipe.
Heat the oil in a large pot. Add the onion and cook until the onion is translucent. Add the diced tomatoes. Stir in the broth. Season with fresh basil, red pepper flakes, and whipping cream. Serve.
Place all the ingredients into a blender. Process until smooth. Pour into glasses. Garnish each glass with a cherry. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook the hashbrowns until lightly browned in a small amount of butter and oil. Add the sausage and cook until the sausage is no longer pink. Stir in the cream of celery soup. Add the eggs and half-and-half and stir until well blended. Add the shredded cheeses and stir until the cheeses have melted. Pour mixture into a greased 13x9 pan and sprinkle with paprika. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Makes 10 servings.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the tequila, triple sec and orange juice and shake vigorously until well chilled. Strain into martini glasses and garnish with cherries and a lime wedge.

Mix sugar and cornstarch together and stir into juice. Cook over low heat for 1 minute or till mixture thickens and clears. Cool and chill. Place beets on serving platter and pour sauce over top. Garnish with orange zest.

Heat olive oil in 9" skillet over medium-low heat. Add broccoli, onion and cook until soft. Beat 4 eggs in large bowl. Add broccoli mixture to bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Heat skillet over medium-low heat until hot. Pour egg mixture into skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes or until lightly browned on bottom. Slide omelet onto plate. Slice into wedges. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl mix together eggs, cornstarch, fish sauce, and 1 tablespoon water. In a large skillet or wok heat 2 tbs vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add eggs and stir-fry until set. Add shrimp and stir-fry until just cooked through, about 30 seconds. Add onion and cook until heated through. Remove from heat and add 2 tablespoons of water to thin if necessary. Serve over steamed rice.

Heat the oil in a large skillet. Saute the chorizo, onion, garlic and chiles until tender. Add the tomato sauce and water and cook until thick. Add the beans and bananas. Season to taste with salt, pepper and cumin. Serve with chips.

Mix eggs and sugar until well blended. Add flour and baking powder and blend well. Stir in milk and melted butter. Spread into unbaked pie crust. Sprinkle with coconut and bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Cool 30 minutes before serving.

Cream butter with peanut butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla until blended. Sift together flour, baking soda and saltadd to mixture and mix well. Chill until firm, then shape into 1 1/2-in.-round balls. Roll balls in milk chocolate kisses to coatplace on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375° for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool 5 minutes before removing to cool completely on wire racks. Yield: about 5 dozen.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss together potato, carrots, olive oil, rosemary and salt and pepper in a roasting pan. Set aside to marinate. Rinse the chicken inside and out. Rub inside and out with olive oil and rosemary. Stuff with lemon and garlic halves. Add to the roasting pan. Baste with mustard mixture. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until chicken is done. If desired, serve with additional lemon slices.

Mix together graham crackers, melted butter and sugar. Press mixture into a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake 5 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack. In a small saucepan, combine the topping, water and corn syrupheat until hot and bubbly. Spread over baked crust. Sprinkle on toffee piecespress down lightly. Refrigerate 3 hours or until set. Beat cream cheese, milk and sugar with electric mixer until well blendedspoon onto top of chilled toffee layer. Spread evenly with butterscotch pudding. Refrigerate 2 hours or until set. Spread top with whipped toppingsprinkle with toffee pieces. Store in the freezer.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat olive oil in large skillet over med-hi heat. Cook cauliflower, broccoli, carrot and red pepper until tender. Add summer squash and zucchinicook until tender. Add sauce and basil. Cook until heated through. Toss with pasta. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

In saucepan brown hamburger with pepper, garlic powder and dry mustard. Drain grease. Add onion soup mix and water. Stir to combine. Cover and simmer until blended. Spoon mixture into a 9 inch square baking dish. Cover with cheddar and swiss cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Top with fries for the last 10 minutes of cooking.

Combine the flakes, nuts and raisins in a large bowladd the vinegar, water and saltstir until all dry ingredients are moistenedspread mixture on an ungreased cookie sheetlet stand while you prepare toppingcombine toppingspread over flake mixturerefrigerate at least 3 hours or until firmcut into squaresstore in an airtight container.

Fry onions and mushrooms in the butter. Cook the meat and add the onion mixture. Add the sour cream. Salt and pepper to taste. Add the sugar and dry mustard to taste. Add the egg noodles and heat through.

In a pot, combine all the ingredients together and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 25 minutes or until all the liquid has evaporated, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking to the bottom of the pot. When it has thickened to your desired consistency, remove from heat and cool completely. Serve chilled with yogurt or ice cream or at room temperature as a dessert.

In a food processor combine the first seven ingredients until smooth. Add parsley flakes and blend. Add lemon juice and blend again. Add salt. Blend and then add vinegar. Pour over meat. Allow to sit for at least 2 hours. Grill until done.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Brush a 1-2 quart baking dish with oil. Arrange cauliflower in a single layer in the dish. Toss with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Bake until tender, about 15 minutes. Cool slightly. In a small bowl, melt butter in microwave. Stir in garlic and caper juice. Pour over cauliflower. Toss to combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm.
Place olive oil and baby spinach in skillet. Cook until spinach is wilted. Add cherry tomatoes and season to taste.

Bring beer to simmer in large Dutch oven or heavy saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer 40 minutes. Stir in sugar, salt, garlic powder, black pepper, and paprikasimmer, uncovered, 40 minutes longer or until meat is tender. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with steins of beer.

In a medium saucepan melt margarine, add onion and garlic and saute until soft. Add curry powder and basmati rice. Stir until rice starts to turn translucent. Add chicken stock and water and bring to a boil. Add zucchini. Cook until tender. Add chicken and simmer until heated through.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Combine the foie gras, salt and pepper. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until the butter just begins to brown. Add the pears and sugar. Cook until the sugar is dissolved. Add the balsamic vinegar and the cider. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the pears are tender and the sauce has thickened slightly. Transfer the pears to a roasting pan. Top with the rosemary and bake for 15 minutes. Serve the pears with the foie gras.

Peel and seed eggplant, and slice into thin rounds. Heat oil in saucepan over low heat. Add eggplant and cook for about 15 minutes, or until softened, stirring often. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Puree eggplant with remaining ingredients until smooth. Serve on crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cut the french bread into 2 inch pieces. Place bread in a single layer on baking sheet. Brush each piece of bread with olive oil. Sprinkle each piece with a few basil leaves. Bake for 5 minutes. Turn the pieces over. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Return to oven. Bake for 3 more minutes. Top each piece of toast with a few olives. Serve immediately.

Place egg yolks and water in the top of a double boiler and beat well with a wire whip or fork. Put all but 2 tbs of the butter in a small saucepan over moderately low heat until just melted. Add 1 tbs of the cold butter to the egg and water mixture and place over hot, not boiling water. Whip constantly until egg yolks thicken slightly. Remove from heat and whip in the second tbs of cold butter. Gradually pour the melted butter into the egg mixture, beating constantly. Place over hot, not boiling, water cook until thickened, whipping constantly. Thickened hollandaise should hold the imprint when a fork or whip is drawn across the surface. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice, salt, fresh chives and serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add pancetta and onioncook for 4 minutes or until browned. Add crushed tomatoes. Season with dried red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add spaghetti. Cook for 10 minutes or until spaghetti is done. Stir in Parmesan cheese. Toss to combine. Serves 2.

Cook sausage in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Remove from skillet. Add 1 tablespoon garlic powder and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Stir in broth and remaining garlic powder and pepper. Bring to boilingreduce heat. Add spinach. Cover and cook 2 minutes. Add sausagecover and cook 2-3 minutes longer or until sausage is thoroughly heated. Stir in heavy cream. Cook, stirring constantly, 2-3 minutes longer or until heated through. Stir in hot sauce and parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings. Nutritional Information Per Serving: 286 calories (56% from fat), 14 g fat (6 g saturated), 50 mg cholesterol, 31 g protein, 7 g carbohydrate (1 g dietary fiber), 610 mg sodium. Exchanges: 1/2 carbohydrate, 5 1/2 lean meat.

In a small bowl stir together vinegar, honey and mustard. Whisk in oil. Set aside. In a large bowl toss together chives, tomatoes and cucumbers. Add dressing and toss. Sprinkle with feta and pepper. Serve.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the artichokes, wine, and garlic. Reduce heat to low, cover the pan and cook until artichokes are tender, about 30 minutes. Discard the garlic and set the artichokes aside in a bowl. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the breadcrumbs and cook until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes. Stir in the Parmesan cheese and lemon juice, and season with lemon zest, lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the breadcrumb mixture into a shallow casserole dish. Arrange the artichokes on top of the breadcrumb mixture and bake until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle the parsley over the top just before serving. Serve warm.

Beat together cream cheese and chunky peanut butter until well blended. Beat in sour cream, vanilla and salt. Fold in 2 cups of the peanuts. Divide mixture into 12 tart shells and freeze for 30 minutes. Beat together the remaining 3 tablespoons of sour cream and the whipped topping until smooth. Spread over the peanut mixture. Sprinkle remaining peanuts on top. Return to freezer for at least 2 hours or until set. Makes 12 servings.

Combine 2/3 cup sugar, 1/3 cup cocoa, 1/4 cup cornstarch, and 1/4 tsp salt in medium bowlstir in 2 cups milk until smooth. Microwave on High 4 minutesstirmicrowave 2 more minutes or until thickened. Cool slightlystir in 3 Tbsp butter and 1 tsp vanilla. Pour into 6 custard cups or 4-oz ramekinsrefrigerate 1 hour or until set.

Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a saute pan. When the oil is hot, add the chicken and saute for 2-3 minutes on each side. Remove from heat. Slice the chicken into thin strips. Toss the chicken with the thyme and balsamic vinegar. Assemble the panini. Spread one side of each bun with mayo. Top with chicken slices, red onion slices and arugula. Spread the other side of the bun with mayo. Close the sandwich and grill in a panini press or in a skillet. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream butter and sugar. Add mashed bananas. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Sift dry ingredients together with soda. Add dry mixture to creamed mixture. Pour into two greased loaf pans and bake for 1 hour.
In a large bowl or cereal bowl, combine quinoa flakes and milk. Stir in honey, cinnamon and vanilla extract until well combined. Top with sliced peaches. Serve immediately.

Cream butter and sugars together. Mix in eggs and vanilla. In another bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir into butter mixture. Add the pecans. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 1 minute before removing from cookie sheet.
Combine dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Add the wet ingredients. Stir. Add ginger and lemon. Fill muffin trays 3/4 full. Bake at 375 for 18 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

Soak unflavored gelatin in hot water for 5 minutes. Beat egg yolks and sugar until thick. Beat in gelatin. Beat egg whites until foamy. Beat in 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold in 1/2 of beaten egg whites into cream cheese mixture. Fold in remaining egg whites. Fold in heavy cream and lemon juice. Pour into a baking dish. Bake at 375F for 10 minutes. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Melt apricot preserves in a small pan. Spread over top of cheesecake. Sprinkle with coconut. Cut into squares.

In large bowl, combine rice crispy cereal and artificial sweetener. In small saucepan, combine brown rice syrup, cashew butter and hazelnut butter over medium low heat until melted. Stir in vanilla extract until smooth. Remove from heat and pour into bowl with rice crispy mixture. Stir until well blended. Pour into parchment paper lined 9x13x2 inch pan. Cool completely. Melt chocolate chips and shortening in microwave until smooth (about 30 seconds). Spread over top of rice crispy bars and refrigerate until set. Decorate with chopped pecans if desired. Store covered in refrigerator.

Cut chicken breasts into bite-size pieces. In a saute pan, heat butter over medium heat. Add chicken and mushroom. Saute until browned. Stir in sun-dried tomato. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add cream. Heat until just boiling. Add penne pasta. Cook according to package directions. Serve with Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper.

In large soup pot, saute the garlic and onion in olive oil until translucent. Add the fresh sage. Add the seasonings. Add the fat-free chicken broth. Add the butternut squash. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the parmesan cheese and blend with an immersion blender. Serve with a slice of garlic bread.
Spread cream cheese on bagel. Layer lox on bagel. Top with eggs and hollandaise sauce. Garnish with fresh dill.

Slice mangoes and papayas into bite sized pieces. Combine mangoes, papayas, mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt, almonds, and coconut in a large bowl. Toss to combine. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve over greens if desired.

Mix the milk with the cream cheese. Add the parmesan cheese and basil leaves. Add the chicken flavor stuffing mix to the milk and cream cheese mixture. Add the cooked carrots and sugar snap peas. Bake in a casserole dish at 350 degrees F. for 15 minutes. Add the asparagus and red pepper. Bake for another 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375F. Mix dry ingredients and wet ingredients separately then combine and mix well. Shape into balls and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until done. Let cool and sprinkle with confectioners sugar.

Place butterkase and fontina cheese in heavy-bottomed saucepan. Gradually add 1/2 cup each of the sherry and dry white wine. Add remaining 3 tablespoons of sherry and dry white wine and stir until well mixed. Slowly whisk in the flour until smooth. Stir in shallots. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 4 to 6 minutes or until thickened. Add the blue cheese and stir until melted and smooth. Season to taste with freshly ground pepper. Serve with toasted bread cubes and scallions.

In skillet heat oil. Add onion and saute till lightly brown. Add garlic. Add cumin and saute till fragrant. Add tomatoes. Let cook a few minutes. Add frozen edamame. Add salt and pepper. Add cilantro. Serve over rice.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Mix together wild rice, soup, water, broccoli, and cheese. Spread in a 13 x 9 x 2 baking dish. Bake for 35 minutes. Serve with a salad.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and garlic and saute until onion is tender. Add flour to skillet. Stir until flour turns a light brown color. Add milk and whisk until mixture thickens. Add butter and whisk until butter is melted and sauce is smooth. Add chicken to skillet. Cook until chicken is no longer pink. Add green onion. Serve over tortellini. Top with swiss.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Grease a 9 inch pie pan. Layer ham, cheese, green onions in pan. Beat together the remaining ingredients in a blender or food processor until smoothpour into the pan over the other ingredients. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center of the pie comes out clean. Let cool for at least 5 minutes before slicing. Serve warm with salsa or your favorite topping.

In a skillet over medium heat cook beef until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in refried beans and taco seasoning mix until mixed together well. In a large bowl stir together beef mixture, avocado, sour cream, salsa and onion until well mixed. Spread mixture into a 9x13-inch dish. Sprinkle with cheese and top with black olives. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 15 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cut the fennel bulb into thin strips. Place the fennel in a medium sized bowl and toss with the zest of half a lemon and half an orange. Add a small handful of pine nuts and 2 tbsp of olive oil. Season with fleur de sel and ground black pepper. Toss well and serve.
Place corn, poblano peppers and onion in blender. Puree until smooth. Stir in jalapenos and cilantro. Add lime juice and salt and pepper. Stir gently to combine. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle both sides of the chicken breasts with the parsley. Season with the shallots and thyme. Heat the vegetable oil in a nonstick pan. Add the seasoned breasts and fry on both sides until they are well browned. Lift the breasts from the pan and set aside. In a bowl, whip the egg whites until they are stiff and glossy. Season with the pepper. Spread the egg mixture on to a sheet of plastic wrap. Place the chicken breasts on the mixture and roll them up. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Peel and cube sweet potatoes. Add to boiling water until they are half done. Drain and add to a bowl of cold water until they are cold. In a small bowl mix together the cornstarch and orange juice. Add to the sweet potatoes and mix until smooth. Add the spices and stir until well mixed. Add the cooked white rice and mix well. Pour mixture into a baking dish and bake for one hour. Serve with sour cream and green onions.
Cook eggs with the rice, scallions and peas. Then pour in the broth and let it cook until the liquid is absorbed by the rice. Stir to combine. Serve hot.
Mix flours, wheat germ, oat bran and baking powder together in a mixing bowl. Stir in nonfat dry milk powder. Add salt. Add oil and mix until smooth.

Preheat the oven to 375 f. Cut each of the biscuits in half and place in a 9 inch square pan. In a small bowl combine the butter, italian seasoning and garlic. Brush the butter mixture over the biscuits. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

In a small saute pan over medium low heat melt butter with rosemary & garlic. Add shrimp and cook 30 seconds on each side. Add lemon juice and cook for 1 more minute. Remove from heat and add Worcestershire sauce and hot sauce. Serve with bread.

Grease a 13 inch x 9 inch pan. In a medium bowl combine crumbs, butter and sugar. Press mixture into prepared pan. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 10 minutes. Combine remaining ingredients and spread over crust. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Cool and cut into bars.

Combine eggs, pumpkin puree, vegetable oil, and brown sugarmix well.Combine flour, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, and saltstir into pumpkin mixture just until dry ingredients are moistenedfold in cranberries.Spread batter into greased loaf pansbake at 350 degrees for about 50 minutes or until done.Cool in pans for 10 minutesremove from pans to wire rackscool completely.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Beat until light and fluffy. Add chickpeas and chocolate. Mix well. Gradually add flour, oats and salt. Beat well. Roll into balls and place on greased cookie sheet. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 9 to 11 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 5 dozen.
In skillet, saute carrots and onion in butter until tender. Add flour, salt& pepper. Add milk gradually stirring until smooth. Stir in carrots, paprika, peas, heat through.

To make the crust: mix graham crackers, butter and sugar in a mixing bowl. Press into the bottom of a pie plate. Bake for 10 minutes at 375 degrees F. Let cool. To make the filling: combine the egg yolks, sweetened condensed milk and lime juice in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Remove from heat. Stir in the butter and lime rind. Pour into the cooled crust. Refrigerate for at least one hour. To serve, spoon some of the whipping cream over the top of the pie.

Heat oil in a large fry pan over a medium heat. Cook onions for 10 minutes. Stir in cumin and coriander until aromatic. Cook for a further 2 minutes. Add kumara, carrot, potato, red lentil, water and stock cubes. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 25 minutes. Add yoghurt, soy sauce. Stir well. Serve hot. Serves 4.
Add water to bread machine pan. Add oil and the other ingredients to the pan in the order given. Select basic or white cycle. Press start and go.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring the chicken stock to a boil. In a bowl, beat the eggs with the parmesan cheese. Add the eggs to the soup. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add the parsley and season with the salt and pepper. Serve in bowls. Garnish each serving with a sprinkling of parmesan cheese.

In a medium saucepan, heat the water over high heat. Add the pasta and stir well to separate the strands of pasta. Cook for 4 minutes or until tender. Drain in a colander over a bowl and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking. Add the egg to the saucepan and whisk over medium heat until scrambled. Stir in the mustard, then pour in the hot water to make a cream sauce. Add 3 cups of the pasta to the saucepan along with the cheddar, salt and pepper. Stir to combine, then add the remaining pasta. Transfer to an 8x8 inch baking dish and sprinkle with croutons. Bake for 20 minutes, or until lightly browned on top.

Toast 3 slices of the French bread to desired crispness. Rub tops of toasted bread with cut cloves of garlic. Spread each toasted slice with 1 tablespoon of the Mayonnaise. Top each slice with 1/3 of the chopped crabmeat. Top each slice with 1/2 cup of the chopped spinach, and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of the seafood seasoning. Spread each slice with 2 tablespoons of the egg mixture. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup of the scallions and top with 1/2 cup of the mozzarella cheese. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven until the tops of the sandwiches are lightly browned and the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 10 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into wedges to serve.
Combine butter and marshmallows. Press into a ball. Roll in honey bunches of oats. Dip into dipping chocolate. Let set. Store in refrigerator.
Butter an 8 or 9 inch square pan. Mix all ingredients except cottage cheese. Pour into pan. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until well puffed. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Garnish with bacon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray two 9-inch round cake pans with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Divide batter between the two pans. Bake 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool completely. In a large bowl, beat together the powdered sugar and the softened cream cheese until smooth. Add the butter and beat until light and fluffy. Spread 1 layer of cake with about 1/4 of the frostingtop with second layer of cake. Spread top and sides of cake with the remaining frosting. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
In large skillet brown meat with salt, pepper and broth. Drain excess fat. Add garlic powder and onion. Heat thoroughly. Serve on buns with pickle slices and mustard, if desired.

In a small bowl, mix together the mustard, lime juice, cilantro and 1 tsp of the sea salt. Rub mixture over both sides of the chicken. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the chili powder and cook for 30 seconds. Add the chicken and cook for 2 minutes. Add the water, cover the pan and reduce heat to medium. Cook for 10 minutes or until the juices run clear. Sprinkle the remaining sea salt over the cooked chicken. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Peel and dice sweet potatoes and toss with butter, honey, whisky, brown sugar, salt and pepper to taste. Spread onto a greased baking pan. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until tender. Sprinkle with toasted walnuts and serve immediately.

Core apples and cut into quarters. Remove seeds if desired. Combine sugar and spices into a small pot. Add water and bring to a boil. Add apples and cook for 15 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Transfer apples to a jar or plastic container (for freezing) and pour the hot spice mixture over them. Store in the refrigerator. Can also freeze or dry.

Combine cherries and plums with lemon juice. Add 1 part wine to 2 parts sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until fruit is soft but not mushy, about 20 minutes. Add spices, salt and rose water. Cool completely before jarring. Makes 3 half-pint jars.

Melt margarine in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the onions and cook for 10 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in the puree and broth and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook for 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Stir in the peanut butter and milk. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place a slice of french bread butter side down on a baking sheet. Spread feta cheese evenly over top. Sprinkle olives and oregano over cheese. Place another slice of french bread butter side down over feta. Bake until crisp and golden brown. Serve with additional feta if desired.

In saucepan combine margarine, sugar, and corn syrup. Boil over medium heat for 5 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Stir in soda. Pour over popcorn and stir to coat evenly. Spread on jelly roll pan. Bake at 250 degrees for 1 hour or until lightly browned and crisp. Let cool. Store in airtight container.
Add all ingredients in the blender and blend until smooth. Pour the drink in a glass with ice cubes and garnish with a slice of fresh pineapple and an orange wedge on the side of the glass.

In a large mixing bowl combine the cheeses and the peppers. In a separate bowl combine the eggs and the cayenne pepper and beat well. Add the eggs to the cheese mixture and stir to combine well. Pour into an 8x8 baking dish and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until center is firm. Let cool and cut into squares.

Cook onions in 1 tbsp. Butter until transparent. Add rice and cook stirring for 2 minutes. Add 1/2 cup water and simmer 15 minutes or until water is absorbed. Add 1/2 cup milk and 1/3 cup swiss cheese stirring until melted. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Serves 4 as a side dish or 2 as a main dish.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the orange zest and juice and the asparagus and cook until tender, about 5-6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Put sugar in saucepan and add karo. Put on top of stove at med-high heat. Let boil without stirring. Brush sides of pan with wet pastry brush. Take off heat when it gets soft ball stage. Add white karo slowly and stir constantly until it cools. Add peanut butter, then add 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract. Stir and then add egg whites. Beat egg whites with blender or mixer. Spread on a sheet of greased wax paper. Put on cookie sheet and let cool. Peel off of paper and cut into strips.
Mix all ingredients in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Cool and use on any of your favorite bbq items. Store in the refrigerator up to 3 weeks.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat butter until it melts. Add in onion and minced garlic cloves. Saute until onions begin to turn golden brown. Add in basmati rice. Saute for 2 minutes. Add in bay leaf and thyme. Add in turmeric. Add in broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover saucepan and simmer until rice is tender. Serve.

Bring the rotel to a boil in a sauce pan and reduce to medium low heat. While it is boiling add the corn chips until they are all broken up into the tomatoes. Once the tomatoes are mixed in add the sausage, cheese, cilantro, jalapenos, onion powder and garlic powder. Let it cook for another 10 minutes or until the mixture thickens up a bit. Pour into a serving dish. Scramble the eggs in a skillet with the butter. Once the eggs are fully cooked add them to the serving dish with the tomato mixture. Serve with toast or tortillas.

In a large non stick skillet, cook and stir hash browns and bacon until crisp. Remove from skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, saute the green peppers. Pour egg mixture over top. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Broil about 3 inches from heat until lightly browned. Cut into wedges to serve.

Peel and cube the eggplants. Rinse with cold water and squeeze dry. Add to 1 cup of flour, salt and 1 beaten egg. Mix well. Add 1 cup of powdered sugar and mix well. Heat oil in a large frying pan. Drop the mixture by the spoonful into the hot oil and fry until golden brown. Drain and sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving.

Combine all the marinade ingredients except for the prawns in a bowl. Add the prawns and marinate for about 30 minutes or until firm to touch. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan or wok and add onions. Cook until softened. Add the tomatoes, garlic and sweet peas. Cook until the mixture is quite thick. Add the prawns and cook until they are pink. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over boiled rice.
Brown meat and set aside. In a skillet over medium heat, cook green pepper and onion in oil for about 3 minutes. Add to meat. Stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer uncovered for 2 hours. Serve hot.

Heat together the cocoa, sugar and salt in a medium heavy-bottomed saucepan. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens and forms a thin paste. Stir in the milk and heat until it boils. Pour into a large pitcher. Stir in the light cream and vanilla. Add the orange zest. Serve warm topped with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 9x13-inch baking dish, place brisket flat side down. In a medium bowl, combine ketchup, grape jelly and soup mix. Spoon mixture over brisket. Cover and bake for 2 hours. Turn brisket overbake for 2 more hours. Top with onions. Bake until done.

Place fish fillet on baking sheet. Brush with half of soy sauce. Sprinkle with half of gingerroot and sesame seeds. Broil 6 inches from heat for 3 minutes. Turn fish over and brush with remaining soy sauce. Sprinkle with remaining gingerroot and sesame seeds. Broil for another 3 to 4 minutes. Serve with cooked rice.
Beat together cream cheese and 1/4 c. of the cheddar cheese. Fold in remaining cheeses and seasonings. Cover and refrigerate until firm. Roll in chopped nuts. Serve with crackers.

In a food processor combine the garlic cloves and honey. Process until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and process until well blended. Place the chicken in a bowl. Pour the garlic mixture over the chicken and mix well to coat. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight. When ready to cook, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place the chicken in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes.

In large nonstick skillet over medium heat, warm 1 tablespoon oil. Add onioncook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add garliccook 30 seconds longer. Add broccoli coleslaw mix and 3/4 teaspoon saltcook 3 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Stir in brothcook 2 minutes or until broccoli is crisp-tender. Stir in hoisin sauce, honey and ground ginger. Remove from heatkeep warm. In small bowl, combine cornstarch and remaining 1/4 teaspoon saltstir into broccoli mixture. Remove from heatkeep warm. In same skillet over medium-high heat, warm remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add chickencook for 5 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in center. Stir in remaining 2 tablespoons brothcook for 1 minute or until heated through. Remove from heatkeep warm. Serve chicken mixture on tortillas with broccoli mixture and coleslaw. Sprinkle with chopped green onions.

In a heavy saucepan, heat the heavy cream and the white karo over medium heat until it boils. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract and butter.
