Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. Add cream of mushroom soup and salsa. Combine. Stir in tuna. Blend well. Combine milk and chicken broth. Add to skillet. Stirring constantly. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer 1 minute or until heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Let stand 2 minutes. Serve.

Mix together the coffee, cocoa powder and water in a jug until smooth and frothy. Add the olive oil and the margarine and mix until smooth. In a large bowl mix the flour and the sugar together and then add the coffee mixture. Beat until smooth and well combined. Stir in the chocolate chips. Turn the mix into the tin and bake for 40 minutes until set in the middle and the surface is glossy. Let the brownies cool in the tin before removing them and dusting with icing sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl stir together the flour, salt and baking soda. In a large mixing bowl beat the butter for about 2 minutes until creamy. Add the brown sugar and beat until smooth. Beat in the egg and the vanilla. Gradually add the flour mixture until smooth. Stir in the walnuts and the white chocolate chips. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool for 1 minute then move the pan to a wire rack to cool completely. Cut into 1-inch bars.

Place the frozen chopped broccoli into a 9x13 glass baking dish. Top with the cooked chicken. Mix the sour cream and the soup together and pour over the chicken and broccoli. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Mix the crackers and margarine together and sprinkle on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until the top is lightly brown. Serve warm.

Place popped popcorn in large bowl. Combine sugar, butter, light corn syrup and baking soda in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until boiling. Stir in vanilla extract. Pour over popcorn and toss to coat evenly. Store in an airtight container. Makes 10 cups.

Pound veal to 1/4 inch thick. Combine lemon juice, butter, white wine, chicken stock, egg yolk, ground mace, and seasoned flour to form a smooth paste. Spread mixture over escalopesroll up, secure with a toothpick. Dredge in seasoned flour. Brown in hot skillet. Add enough water to cover the escalopes. Cook covered 15 minutes or until tender. Remove toothpicks. Remove toothpicks before serving. Makes 4 servings.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, add olive oil. Add garlic, onion, celery and cook until tender. Add chicken stock, cauliflower and butter beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover. Simmer until all vegetables are tender. Using an immersion blender, puree all ingredients to desired smoothness. Return to pot. Stir in cream. Heat through. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and line 2 round 9 inch pans with parchment paper. In a bowl combine buttermilk, polenta, flour, baking soda and baking powder. In another bowl combine the butter and sugar and beat until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla and beat until blended. With a wooden spoon stir the wet ingredient into the dry ingredient. Divide the batter between the two pans and bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until the cakes are golden brown and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let the cakes cool in the pan for 15 minutes. Remove from the pan and allow to cool completely on wire rack before decorating with glaze. For the glaze combine the confectioners sugar and water in a bowl and whisk until smooth. Drizzle the glaze over the cakes and sprinkle with chopped rosemary leaves before serving.

Heat oil and add onion. Saute until soft. Cut chicken thighs into small pieces and add to skillet and brown. In a small bowl mix together the brown sugar and mustard. Pour into skillet and add the orange juice and garlic powder. Bring to a boil. Cook 10 to 15 min or until chicken is cooked through. Serve on a bed of rice.

Prepare raspberry jelly according to package directions. Add lemon juice and Grand Marnier. Chill until set. Cut into squares. Combine strawberries with sugar and let stand for 30 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and Grand Marnier. Spread a layer of the raspberry jelly on a plate. Top with a layer of the strawberries. Repeat until all the raspberry jelly and all the strawberries are used. Chill until ready to serve.

Put 1 cup flour in large bowl. Add 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon granulated sugar and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Cut 4 tablespoons very cold butter into flour mixture with 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse meal. Gradually add 4 to 5 tablespoons cold watertoss with fork until dough comes together. Divide dough into 2 equal partspat each into 4-inch disc. Wrap each in plasticrefrigerate at least 1 hour or up to 2 days.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease bottom only of 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pan. In large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, sugar, onion salt, oregano and dry mustard. In medium bowl, combine egg, milk and butterstir into flour mixture just until moistened (batter will be lumpy). Fold in cheese. Spoon batter into pan. Bake 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan to cooling rack. Yield: 1 loaf (18 servings).

Combine whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, brown sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Add baking powder and baking soda. Stir to blend well. Stir in eggs until well blended. Add melted buttermilk and cooking oil. Mix thoroughly until dough forms. Cover bowl tightly and refrigerate dough overnight or until ready to use. To cook, heat a large flat nonstick skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Grease pan lightly if necessary to prevent sticking. Place about 1/4 cup batter in center of pan for each injera. Cook until bubbles form on top and bottom are golden brown. Remove from pan and keep warm in a covered container in a warm oven. Repeat procedure for remaining batter. Makes about 18 injera

Brown hash browns in oil in dutch oven. When browned, sprinkle with garlic powder and seasonings. Stir to blend. Add chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Cook for 20 minutes or until hash browns are tender. Add gravy mix. Serve.

In a large bowl, combine the chutney with the honey and the lime juice. Add the mustard and ginger and mix well. Add the thighs and turn to coat thoroughly. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator at least 3 hours or overnight. In a small bowl combine the powder with the cornstarch and cayenne. Preheat the oven to 400. Drain the thighs, reserving the marinade. Dredge the thighs in the cornstarch mixture. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the thighs in a single layer. Cook until crisp and brown and flip the thighs over. Cook until the meat is no longer pink. Remove from the skillet and keep warm. Pour the marinade into a small saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Boil until thickened and syrupy. Serve over the thighs and garnish with parsley and sesame seeds.

Peel the boiled eggs and put the yolks in a mixing bowl. Mash the yolks and then add all the remaining ingredients to the yolks and mix well. Spoon the mixture into the empty egg shells and sprinkle with paprika. Refrigerate for several hours before serving.

Beat eggs, add milk and mix well. Combine dry ingredients. Add wet and mix well. Heat greased frying pan on medium heat. Drop batter with a small spoon on hot frying pan. Cook until tops are brown. Flip over with a spatula. Cook other side.
Place cabbage, apples, onions, garlic, white sugar, vinegar, bacon fat, and boiling water in a non-stick pan with lid and cook until tender-crisp. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.
Combine Roma tomatoes, Bermuda onion and tomatoes in medium bowl. Add cilantro and jalapenos. Mix well. Stir in lime and seasoning salt. Mix well. Add garlic. Stir well.

Preheat oven to 400. Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Place potatoes in a bowl, add seasoning mix and toss to coat well. Coat a 9x13 baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Arrange potato slices in a single layer in prepared pan. Spray with vegetable oil to coat. Bake 15-20 minutes or until tender turning after 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese and bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes about 4 servings.

In a bowl combine egg whites, sugar substitute, vanilla yogurt and cinnamon until well blended. Pour into an 8-inch pie plate. Bake in preheated 350 degree Fahrenheit oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until set. Cut fruit into 1/2-inch slices. Place on top of egg white mixture. Drizzle with maple syrup. Makes 1 serving.

Preheat grill pan on high. Spread tortillas with fajita seasoning. Top with cheese and spread with sour cream. Grill until tortillas are crispy and cheese is melted. Cut in half and serve with salsa and/or guacamole.

Mix together biscuit mix, margarine, milk & eggs. Add cheese & mix well. Divide into 24 balls. Roll in sesame seeds. Place in buttered baking dish. Bake in 375 degree oven for 20 minutes. Serve with honey mustard dressing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the acorn squash halves on a foil-lined baking sheet cut side up. Bake for 45 minutes or until soft enough to scoop out the seeds and fibers. Combine the cranberries, apple, orange rind, orange juice and sugar in a large bowl. Add the squash and toss to coat evenly. Return the mixture to the baking sheet (you may have to use two baking sheets) and bake for 15 minutes longer until the mixture is bubbling hot. Serve immediately.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until the onions are translucent and browned. Add the garlic cloves and cook for one minute. Add the fresh thyme and cook for one minute longer. Add the mushrooms, salt and pepper, and cook until the mushrooms are tender. Remove from the heat. In the same skillet, melt the whipping cream over medium heat until it is hot and bubbly. Add the eggs slowly, one at a time, stirring after each egg is added to blend the eggs into the cream. Stir until the mixture is thickened and smooth. Remove from the heat. Fold the onion mixture into the cream mixture. Stir in the asiago cheese. Spoon the mixture evenly into the tart shells. Bake for 15-18 minutes until the edges are set and the centers are still a bit wobbly.
Toss together all the salad ingredients in a large bowl. Combine the dressing ingredients in a separate bowl and pour over the salad. Toss again and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.

In a small bowl, mix together the olives, capers, celery, pepperoncini and oil. Spread evenly on 12 small rolls. Arrange 3 slices of ham on top of the olive spread on each roll. Top with 1 slice of genoa salami, 3 slices of provolone cheese and 3 slices of Swiss cheese on top of each ham sandwich. Wrap each in plastic wrap and place on a baking sheet. Refrigerate for up to 4 hours or overnight. Remove from the refrigerator 1 hour before serving. Arrange the muffulettas on a serving platter or tray. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees F or until the cheese is melted. Cut each muffuletta into four equal pieces to serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease a baking sheet and set aside. Beat egg white with fork or whisk until foamy. Stir in 2 cups of unsalted nuts until coated. Stir in brown sugar and spices. Toss with nuts until coated. Put on prepared baking sheet. Spread out well. Bake, stirring often until golden--about 20-25 minutes. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Place the olive oil in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Saute the onion, jalapeno, and garlic until the onion is translucent. Sprinkle the cumin over the onion mixture. Stir to combine the cumin and onions. Add the bay leaf, water, and the dry beans. Bring to a boil, lower the heat to a simmer, cover and cook for about 2 hours or until the beans are tender. Discard the bay leaf. Mash the bean mixture and season to taste with salt and jalapeno sauce. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350F. Mix breadcrumbs, parsley, onion powder and milk to form a paste-like consistency. Coat each chicken thigh with the mixture. In a small bowl combine cornstarch and water. Heat butter in a pan over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and saute until they are tender. Add the cream of mushroom soup and stir until it is bubbly. Add the cornstarch mixture and stir until thickened. Pour over the breaded chicken thighs and bake for about 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbling.

In blender or food processor, combine all ingredients except vegetables and pita chips. Process until smooth. Transfer to a medium bowl and stir in vegetables. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours. To serve, spoon into serving bowl and garnish with pita chips. Serve with pita bread.
Mix butter, sugar and dates until creamy. Add vanilla and nuts. Stir in krispies. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper to cool. Sprinkle with coconut. Makes about 40.

In a large pot combine the broth, bok choy, green onions and ginger. Bring to a boil. Add the noodles and cook 3 minutes. Add the soy sauce and cook 2 minutes longer. Stir in ham. Ladle into bowls. Top with sliced eggs, garnish with green onions. Drizzle with sesame oil.

Brown ground beef in skillet. Add tomato soup and 1 can water and cook until thickened. Stir in sugar and worcestershire sauce. Remove from heat and add 1/2 the beef mixture to the bottom of a 2 1/2 quart casserole dish. Spread 2 cups cooked noodles over beef mixture and pour 1 cup remaining beef mixture over noodles. Sprinkle 2 cups mozzarella cheese over this layer. Repeat layers 2 times and end with mozzarella cheese. Melt 1 stick margarine and 1/2 cup cream cheese together and pour over top layer of mozzarella cheese. Bake at 375F for 35 minutes or until bubbly and top is browned. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Place roast in a slow cooker. In a medium bowl stir together the consomme, soy sauce, brown sugar, and cornstarch. Pour over the roast. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. When ready to serve add the garlic and broccoli. Cook uncovered 1 hour more or until the broth is thickened. Serve over cooked rice.

Core apples and slice into paper thin slices. Combine sugar, lemon juice, brown sugar and water in small saucepan. Cook over low heat until mixture thickens. Stir in nuts. Remove from heat and let cool. Fill each apple slice with filling. Roll up like a jelly roll and place seam side down in glass dish or plate. Combine icing sugar with water to make a glaze and brush over each roll. Dust with caster sugar if desired. Makes 16 rolls.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Mix all the ingredients together until a dough forms. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Place on a parchment covered cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until slightly golden. Cool on a wire rack. Store in an air tight container.

Place baking potatoes on stove top to boil. When potatoes are tender, drain them well and place them back into the empty pot or another large bowl. Add the garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and the 1 tbsp of butter while the potatoes are still hot to help them blend. Add the cream and the remaining 2 tbsp of butter while the potatoes are still hot to help them blend. Serve while hot.

250 gm self rising flour1/2 teaspoon salt150 ml cream1/2 cup milkMix the flour & salt together then mix in the cream & milk. Knead lightly & roll out 1/2 cm thick on a well floured surface & cut into rounds. Place on a greased baking tray & bake at 200 degrees celsius for 15 minutes or until well risen & golden brown.

Slice the potatoes. Bring the water to a boil. Add the potatoes. Add the evaporated milk. Cook for about 10 minutes. Dice the cooked ham. Add the diced ham. Add the corn. Add the mushrooms. Add the black pepper. Add the salt. Add the paprika. Serve.

In a saucepan, saute onion and garlic in butter until onions are soft. Add rice, broth, jalapeno, bay leaf, thyme and salt to taste. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer about 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Add fresh ground pepper to taste.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add half to skillet and cook 3-4 minutes until browned on one side. Turn and repeat on other side. Transfer to a plate. Add butter to skillet with the cream and whisk to combine. Add dijon and tarragonwhisk to incorporate. Cook until sauce thickens. Add chives. Spoon sauce over chicken. Garnish with chives. Serve immediately.

Split cauliflower into florets. Cook florets until tender. Drain and set aside. Melt half and half and half and add to cauliflower. Add chicken soup and mayonnaise. Stir together and add cheese. Add curry powder to taste. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs.

Melt white chocolate squares in microwave at 30 second intervals. Stir between each interval until smooth. Dip each wafer halfway in white chocolate and place on wax paper. Chill for 2 hours or overnight. Melt semi-sweet chocolate in microwave at 30 second intervals. Stir between each interval until smooth. Dip each wafer halfway in chocolate. Place on wax paper. Use a toothpick to make eyeballs on the vanilla wafers. Use red food coloring paste to make the pupils in the eyeballs.

Form burger into 4 patties. Heat skillet over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon of oil and place patties in the skillet. Cook for 3 minutes per side or until cooked to desired doneness. Divide the ham into 4 slices. Spread mayonnaise and mustard on the bottom of the roll. Layer with ham slice. Top with swiss cheese. Add the burger and top with the pickle slice. Add the top of the roll. Serve warm.

Mash avocado in a small bowl with lime juice. Season with black pepper and sea salt to taste. Rub filet mignon with extra virgin olive oil and sea salt. Place on a broiling pan and broil for 2-4 minutes on each side until desired doneness is reached. Serve with mashed avocado on top of the steak. Top with fresh cilantro.

Combine soy sauce, chili-garlic sauce and sweet chili sauce in a small bowl. Set aside. Heat oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, add the ginger and saute for 1 minute. Add the chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Turn and cook for another 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the chicken from the pan. Turn down the heat to medium-low. Add the glaze mixture and cook for 3-5 minutes or until the glaze thickens and turns syrupy. Remove the glaze from the pan. Toss the glaze with the chicken and serve.

In a bowl combine the flour, baking powder and salt. Cut the cold unsalted butter into the dry ingredients with a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the white chocolate chips and the blueberries. Stir in the buttermilk to form a soft dough. On a lightly floured surface, knead the dough briefly until just combined. Divide the dough into 2 equal portions. Shape each portion into a 7 inch round and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Bake for 20 to 22 minutes or until golden. Serve warm with butter and jam or drizzled with a glaze.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the fish and cook until opaque throughout. Remove fish from pan and keep warm. Add lemon juice to skillet along with oregano and cook over low heat 1 minute stirring constantly to blend flavours. Add butter and cook until butter melts. Stir in parsley and return fish to skillet. Cook just until fish is heated through. Serves 4-5.

Bring cream to boiling in small saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in coconut milk. Pour through sieve into bowl. Stir in Irish cream and liqueur. Chill thoroughly. Pour into glasses. Top with espresso and sprinkle with cocoa powder.
Peel and slice the cucumbers. Put in a bowl with the garlic. Mix the other ingredients together well. Pour over the sliced cucumbers and toss to coat. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

Bring water and sugar to a boil on a medium flame. Stir well. Add vodka and stir well. Add kahlua. Stir well. Strain into a glass jar or bottle with a lid. Store in a cool place for two weeks. Serve cold or warm in a glass with ice. Makes about a cup.
Mix all together and form into log shape or ball and cover with the pecans. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with crackers and fresh vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease 12-cup muffin pan. Make fudge brownies according to box directions. Cool 5 minutes. Fill each cup with 2 tablespoons of peanut butter chips. Bake 10 minutes or until melted. Cool completely. Serve in cups. Makes 12 cupcakes.

Cook the cabbage and onions until tender. Add the garlic cloves and ham and cook until the ham is heated through. Add the broth and potatoes and cook until tender. Add the paprika and flour and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the butter and heat through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Wash and grate potatoes. Set aside. Combine salmon, eggs, potatoes and onion in a mixing bowl. Season to taste with baking powder and hot sauce. Form mixture into 6 oval patties. Roll in fine bread crumbs and place in a shallow pan. Bake in a preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until firm and brown. Serve with buns.
Mix all ingredients in large bowl except for chicken. Place chicken into bowl. Coat well and place into crockpot. Cook on low for 6 hours. Serve.

Bring 6 quarts water to a rolling boil over high heat. Add salt and pastastir. Cook until al dente. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a large bowl, whisk together lemon juice and zest, parsley, and 1/2 cup of the pesto. Toss the pasta, tomatoes, scallions, and ricotta salata into the lemon mixture. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of the pesto. Toss to combine. Sprinkle the top of the salad with the black pepper.

Pour water and sugar into a saucepan. Add dates and boil gently for about 20 minutes. Add dates one more time to get more juice, then remove from the heat. Let cool completely. Add lemon juice, then place the mixture into the blender, add nuts and blend until smooth. Transfer to sterile jars and seal.

Heat beer in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until reduced by half, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Add thyme and garlic and saute until garlic is golden and fragrant, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in honey and mustard. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Add asparagus to beer mixture and stir until well coated. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan combine first 5 ingredients, stirring until well blended and spices are dissolved. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Stir in milk and water until well blended. Remove from heat and let cool. Serve over ice cubes in tall glasses.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Combine honey and mustard in a small bowlstir well. Arrange the cashew halves in a single layer on the prepared cookie sheet. Brush with the honey mixture. Bake for 5 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and toss to coat the cashews evenly with the honey mixture. Bake for 5 more minutes. Remove from the oven, allow to cool for 5 minutes, then break apart the clusters into individual nuts. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine the crust ingredients. Divide dough in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll each half into a 10-in. x 6-in. rectangle. Spread each rectangle with butter. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the sugar-cinnamon mixture. Roll each rectangle up, jelly-roll style, starting at a long side. Cut each roll into 5 slices. Place cut-side down in an ungreased 15- x 10- x 1-in. pan. Bake 15-18 minutes or until lightly browned. Combine cornstarch with remaining 1 Tbsp. waterstir until smooth. Add remaining 1 Tbsp. sugarstir until smooth. Drizzle over rolls. Cool 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400. Separate biscuits into 12 small pieces. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Beat together mayonnaise and mustard until smoothspread evenly onto biscuit pieces. Bake for 10 minutes or until the biscuits are firm and golden brown on top. Cut biscuits into 1/2-inch slices and arrange on a serving platter. Sprinkle ham and cheese evenly over the top. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crispdrain on paper towels. In a medium bowl, toss corn flake crumbs with butterpress into a 10-inch springform pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Whisk the cheddar cheese in a medium bowl with the mayonnaise, chives, salt and pepperspread over the crumbs. Beat the eggbrush over the crust. Bake an additional 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the crust is golden brown. Let cool 30 minutes before removing from the pan. Slice into wedgesserve with the bacon.

In large saucepan combine the soy sauce, preserves, garlic, and mustard. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Add chicken. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 hour. Stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in the hot sauce. Serve over noodles or rice. Sprinkle with the green onions.

Melt margarine and add marshmallows. Stir until completely melted and well blended. Add chocolate sandwich cookies and stir until completely coated. Add rice krispie cereal and stir until well coated. Press into an ungreased baking pan. Cool and cut into squares.

In a large bowl, whisk crouton crumbs with cornstarch. Stir in soy sauce. Add chicken and toss until completely coated. Cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook, covered for 10 - 15 minutes or until nice and crispy and cooked through. Turn about 4 or 5 times to avoid burning. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with rice or noodles.

Blanch the haricots vert for 1 minute in boiling salted water. Drain well. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heatadd the ginger, lemon juice and zest. Cook until the ginger is fragrant. Add the beanscook, stirring until the beans are hot. Season with salt and serve.

In a large skillet heat oil. Add onions and bell peppers with garlic and cook over low heat until tender. Add tomatoes. Add saffron and season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Place fish fillets in skillet. Cook for 3 minutes each side. Add wine. Cook for 1-2 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle with parsley.
Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium high heat for 20 minutes or until mixture thickens. Add to a serving bowl. Refrigerate.

Cook sausage in pan until browned and crumbly. Drain fat. Add in bell peppers, onion and garlic. Saute until vegetables are tender. Add spaghetti sauce, cream cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, and seasoning mix. Heat until cheese is melted. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta well. Toss pasta with sauce mixture. Sprinkle with balsamic vinegar to taste. Serves 6.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sugar and stir until the sugar melts. Add the water and lemon juice. Bring to a boil and add the sprouts and carrots. Boil until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the butter and stir until melted. Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon zest and salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with chives and toasted almonds.

In saucepan melt milk and sugar over low heat stirring constantly. Bring to boil and stir constantly for one minute. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Let stand for several hours or overnight. Before serving add yogurt and blend with milk mixture. Garnish with sliced bananas.

In a large skillet saute onion and black olives in olive oil until tender. Beat eggs together with milk. Add to skillet and stir gently. Sprinkle feta cheese over top. Cook until the bottom is golden brown. Fold into thirds. Cut into wedges and sprinkle on top with red peppers. Serve hot.

Mix cumin and seasonings in a small bowl. In a large bowl combine the ground beef, salt and pepper. Stir in cumin mixture. Divide into four equal portions. Shape each portion into a flat patty. Cook patties in a large skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat until no longer pink in the center. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of the cheese over each patty. Top each patty with 1/4 cup of the green chilies and remaining 1/2 cup of the cheese. Spoon 1/4 cup of the salsa onto each patty. Top each patty with a flour tortilla. Let stand 1 minute or until the cheese melts. To serve, top each burger with a lettuce leaf and a dollop of the sour cream. Serves 4.

Prepare the soup base by sautéing the diced onions, celery and garlic in the butter until softened. Add the clams and their juice and simmer 2 or 3 minutes. Remove from heat and puree with the potato and cream. Season with a little lemon or lime juice and add a little more cream if the soup is too thick. Garnish with chopped parsley or chives.

Spoon 1/4 cup of the artichoke hearts onto the bottom half of the english muffin. Top with 1/4 cup of the mayonnaise and 1/4 cup of the parmesan cheese. Add 2 ounces of the fresh crabmeat and top with 1/4 cup of the sharp cheddar cheese. Place the other half of the english muffin on top and press together to seal. Cut into 4 wedges and serve immediately.
Put mustard & sauce in bottom of slow cooker, stir well. Add water & broth, stir well again. Top meat with sliced potatoes and cover with lid. Cook on high 4-5 hours. Serve over rice or noodles.

Cut the angel food cake into small pieces. Prepare the sweetened condensed milk according to the package directions. Chill. Fold in the whipped topping. Add the lime zest. Spoon the mixture over the cake. Sprinkle with the coconut. Garnish with kiwi fruit and strawberry halves. Chill before serving.

In a large bowl combine apple, pineapple tidbits, celery and carrots. In a small bowl combine sour cream and lemon juice. Pour over the apple mixture. Stir in grapes and sugar. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
Cook noodles until tender. Add the hamburger, onion and brown sugar. Cook until done. Pour the soups in and cook until bubbly. Add the milk. Serve with cheese slices.

Mix eggs, salad oil, flour and baking powder and put to one side. Drain carrot, mash to a pulp with a fork and mix into egg mixture. Knead lightly until you have a soft dough. Grease a cake tin or muffin dish and bake for 20-25 minutes at 190c/375 f until golden brown. Cool on wire rack.

Heat butter over medium heat. Add onion. Cook for about 5 minutes until soft and translucent. Add rice and cook for about 3 minutes. Add broth. Season with salt, pepper and spices. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Stir in orzo. Continue cooking for about 15 minutes until broth is absorbed. Stirring occasionally. Add Parmesan cheese. Cook for another minute. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line 2 large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Combine the salami, scallions, butter, cream cheese and cream in a food processor and pulse until smooth. Add the flour, baking powder and kosher salt and pulse until the dough comes together into a soft ball. Divide the dough in half, press each half into a 1-inch-thick disc, wrap tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. Remove the discs from the fridge and roll each half on a lightly floured surface into a 3-inch-thick oval. Brush each with the melted butter and sprinkle with a little more kosher salt. Using a 2 1/2-inch round cookie cutter or the rim of a glass, cut out the rounds from the dough. Place the biscuits on the prepared baking sheet and bake until the tops are golden brown, about 20 minutes. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Cut roast into 1/2-inch thick strips. Toss strips in brown sugar. Add italian dressing and italian seasoning. Stir to coat. Spread strips in bottom of crock pot. Sprinkle with bell pepper and onion. Cover. Cook on low 7-8 hours. Serve on buns. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 400f. Wash carrots well and slice lengthwise. Combine sugar, oil, rosemary, pepper and salt to taste. Place carrot slices into a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast for 30 minutes or until crisp on the edges.

Using a blender or food processor combine the extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice and garlic cloves. Process until smooth. Add sea salt and black pepper to taste. Serve at room temperature. Great on any salad.

Preheat oven to 325. Spread dressing over the bottom half of the slices. Arrange half the corned beef and half the kraut over dressing. Cover sandwiches with the remaining slices. Spray a baking sheet lightly with cooking spray. Place sandwiches on the sheet. Bake sandwiches until the cheese has melted, 8 to 10 minutes.

Heat 2 tablespoons oil in skillet over medium heat. Add chops and brown well on both sides. Add lemon juice and sugar to pan. Cook until chops are nearly done. Add remaining ingredients except cornstarch and ginger. Bring to boil. Add cornstarch and ginger. Boil until thickened. Remove chops. Serve over hot rice.

In a 4 or 5 qt. Crockpot mix together the sauce ingredients. Add the frozen meatballs and stir. In a small bowl combine the bell peppers and pineapple chunks. Add the bell peppers and pineapple chunks to the crockpot and mix. Cover and cook for 5 to 6 hours. Stir in bell peppers and pineapple chunks during the last hour of cooking. Serve over cooked rice.

Cut off and discard the stem and seeds from the red sweet peppers. Cut in half lengthwise. Cut into 1/4-inch slices. Cut off and discard the root ends of the spring onion. Cut into 1/4-inch slices. Cut water chestnuts into 1/4-inch slices. Combine water and dashi in a large pot. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add red sweet peppers, spring onions, and water chestnuts. Reduce heat to low. Add bay leaf and simmer for 15 minutes. Add chicken broth and light soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Add lemon juice and white pepper. Serve hot.

Melt the chocolate bars in a heatproof bowl over a pan of boiling water. Add the milk & honey & stir well. Then add the fresh cream & stir again until well mixed & smooth. If the mixture is too thin, add a little more milk until it is the consistency you want. Chill & serve in dishes. Can also serve as a dessert sauce & spoon over ice cream or cake.

Peel off the skin from the garlic clove. Smash it with the back of a spoon. Melt the butter in a pan. Dip the chicken into the butter then into the breadcrumb mixture. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes in a preheated oven at 350 degrees. Dust with the garlic powder, italian seasoning and the black pepper. Garnish with the freshly chopped parsley. Serve hot.

Dissolve yeast in warm water in large bowl. Let stand until bubbles form. Add oil, sugar, egg, salt and 2 cups of flour, Beat until smooth. Add remaining 4 cups of flour gradually until mixture is stiff enough to knead. Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Put dough back into bowl, cover bowl with plastic wrap or towel and let rise until doubled in bulk, about 1 1/2 hours. Punch down dough, divide it into 8 equal portions and shape each portion into round ball. Place balls in greased bowl, cover with plastic wrap or towel and let rise until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Punch down dough to deflate. Roll out each ball to 1/4-inch thick circle. Cut circles into wedges with pizza wheel or sharp knife. Place about 3 tablespoons of filling on each piece of dough leaving 1/2-inch border around edges of each piece of dough. Fold over edges of each piece of dough to form a package

Preheat oven to 170 degrees. Grease a baking tray. Dissolve the yeast in the wine and leave to stand for five minutes. In a bowl, mix the oil with the yeast mixture and add the eggs. Add the salt and the baking powder and mix to a soft dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes or until smooth. Put on the greased tray and flatten to about a half-inch thick. Bake for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly. Cut into pieces. Dust with icing sugar.

In a large pot over medium heat, cook sausage in onions until the sausage is cooked through. Add the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve with cheese.

Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Cut asparagus into 3-inch pieces. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, vinegar, lemon juice, olive oil and garlic and stir until combined. Toss with asparagusseason with salt and pepper to taste. Grill asparagus until tender and lightly browned (3-5 minutes). Serve.

In a bowl combine brown sugar, shortening and peanut butter. Beat until well blended. Add egg yolk, blend well. Add all-purpose flour, soda and salt. Blend well. Add more peanut butter until mixture is crumbly. Place in a greased pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. When done remove from oven and spoon 1/4 cup syrup over the top. Let cool and sprinkle with more peanut butter. Cut into bars and serve.

Heat olive oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add green pepper and mushrooms and saute until soft. Add garlic and saute until golden. Add diced tomatoes and tomato sauce. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Add white wine and oregano. Simmer until reduced to 1 cup. Add chops and simmer 15 minutes. Remove chops and keep warm. Add water to sauce and bring to boil. Cook 1 minute. Spoon over chops.

Combine brown sugar and flour in bowl. Add baking powder and salt. Mix well. Add egg and butter. Blend well. Add toasted sesame seeds. Mix well. Drop by spoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 for 6 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with vanilla.

In a large pot of boiling salted water cook pasta 1 minute less than the package directionsdrain. Toss pasta with garlic, olive oil, tomatoes, and wine until well coated. Serve with pesto and cheesetoss well before serving.

Cut the block of tofu in half lengthwise and then each half into 3 pieces. In a medium bowl, combine the lime juice, oil, honey and garlic. Place the tofu on a baking sheet and pour the marinade over it. Turn the pieces to coat each side. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat a grill pan over medium high heat. Remove the tofu from the marinade and place the pieces on the grill. Cook until browned and crisp on the outside and cooked through on the inside. Transfer to a plate and sprinkle with the cilantro and cumin. Add the chili flakes. Serve immediately.

Pat fish dry and brush with butter. Combine remaining ingredients in small bowl and stir until mixed. Coat fish with 1/4 of the mixture. Place in shallow baking dish and cover with remaining mixture. Cover with foil and bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Broil for 5 minutes and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Combine all in a food processor. Process until smooth. Taste for seasoning. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with minced tarragon. Serve with bread.
Place chops in ziplock bag. Combine remaining ingrdiants and pour over chops. Let marinate in refrigerator at least 8 hours. Grill until done.

Set up 3 bowls. In one bowl put the eggs beaten with a little water to make a wash. In another bowl put the panko crumbs. In the third bowl put the salt. Take the mushrooms and dip them in the wash, then in the crumbs, then in the salt. Heat vegetable oil in pan over medium heat until hot. Place the crusted mushrooms in the pan fry until golden brown on both sides.

Preheat oven to 375. Cream butter and sugar. Beat in eggs. Add vanilla and 1/2 cup flour. Beat until smooth. Add rice flour and beat until blended. Stir in remaining flour and nuts. Add chocolates. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks. Cool completely and store in airtight container.
Brown fryer. Combine all the soups in a pan. Stir in sherry wine and cheese. Heat until cheese melts. Serve over biscuits.

Bring amaretto to simmer in saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Simmer 1 minute more. Stir in sliced strawberries and cook until mixture is thick and syrupy. Cool to room temperature. In small bowl, beat cream cheese and powdered sugar until well combined and smooth. Beat in sour cream and vanilla. Fold in whipped cream until well combined. Set aside in refrigerator to chill while you make trifle cups. Slice angel food cake into 3/4-inch slices. Arrange slices in bottom of individual serving dishes or one large dish. Spoon half of the amaretto mixture over the cake slices in the dishes or in the large dish. Spoon half of the cream cheese mixture over the amaretto mixture and top with cake slices or remaining amaretto mixture if using only one dish. Repeat with remaining layers and refrigerate until needed. Serve immediately or chill overnight. Garnish with whipped cream and a few whole strawberries or sliced

Peal potatoes and cut in chunks. Boil for about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a large mixing bowl combine potatoes, bread dressing, cod fish fillet, onion, salt and pepper. Mix well. Pour in a greased casserole dish. Cover with aluminium foil. Bake at 350F for about an hour. Remove foil for the last 10 minutes or until top is golden brown. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, brown sugar, and garlic. In a large skillet over high heat, add olive oil. Once hot add ginger and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the soy mixture to the skillet and stir. Add chicken and stir-fry for 2 minutes on each side. Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 10 minutes or until cooked through.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 hour. Makes 1 1/2 cups. Serves 4 to 6.
Mix crab meat and cilantro. Dice vegetables. Combine with crab mixture. Add lime juice. Mix well. Add ketchup. Serve with lime wedges. Chill.

Cut up the cooked chicken into small pieces, then saute with the onions in the olive oil until lightly browned. Stir in the cream of chicken soup and the milk. Simmer about 2 minutes or until thickened. Spread 1/2 of the mixture in the bottom of a 13 x 9 baking dish. Top with the flour tortillas (cut in half). Top with the remaining sauce, then sprinkle the mexican blend cheese on top. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes until bubbly and browned on top. Serve with the stewed tomatoes on top.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. While pasta is cooking melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until tender. Add the flour and stir until combined. Pour in the milk and stir until smooth. Add the macaroni and mozzarella and mix until thoroughly combined. Pour into a 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with basil and bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees f.

Mix the day-old bread with the caster sugar, milk and sherry. Stir and let stand for 10 minutes. Mix the egg yolks and white wine together in a bowl. Add the sherry mixture and beat until smooth. In a medium frying pan heat the butter over medium-low heat. Pour in the sherry mixture and cook until the mixture has thickened and the bottom has become brown. Remove from heat and sprinkle with the ground cinnamon. Place one slice of bread on each of 4 plates. Spread with strawberry jam. Pour the sherry mixture over the slices. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

In a large pot heat the oil. Add the cilantro, onion and mixed spices. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the water, chickpeas and stewed tomatoes. Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes or until the chickpeas are soft. Add the cayenne and salt. Serve garnished with cilantro. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Pierce potatoes with a knife and bake until tender. Split open and scrape out flesh into a bowl.Melt butter over medium heat in a saucepanadd chopped onion. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in flour until well blendedstir in milk, sour cream, mayonnaise, cheese whiz and seasoningscook until thickened.Add potato to mixturestir well to combine. Spoon into potato shellstop with cheddar cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.

Brown the turkey in a large skillet. Add the stuffing mix and stir well. Add the cranberry sauce and stir well. Add the butter and stir well. Add the egg and stir well. Roll into 24 balls. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes.

In a 10-inch skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Drain off any excess fat. Stir in soup and heat until thoroughly combined and hot. Stir in hash browns. Top with shredded cheese. Bake until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat grill. In small bowl, combine all dressing ingredients. Place salmon on lightly oiled grill rack. Brush both sides of fish with dressing. Cook 3-5 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily when tested. Cut off any skin and serve with grapes.

Sift flour, baking powder and salt together. Mix with butter and milk to make a dough that is not too sticky. Roll out into strips about 1 inch wide. Cut into squares 1 1/2 inches. Place in stew just before serving.

Melt butter in heavy medium skillet over medium heat. Add chiles and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add heavy cream and cook until reduced by half and thickened slightly. Add potatoes and cook until softened and tender. Add salt and white pepper and stir to combine. Transfer to lightly greased 2-quart gratin dish. Bake until golden and bubbly, about 25 minutes.

Place beans, water, ham bone & parsley into large cooking pot. Bring to boil. Simmer covered 1 hour. Remove ham bone & parsley. Cut ham into bite size pieces. Heat oil in large saucepan. Cook onion & garlic until soft. Add ham pieces. Add celery & tops. Add navy beans. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Add salt & pepper.

Combine the lime juice, water, triple sec, tequila, superfine sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Boil until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from the heat. Pour half of the mixture into each mold. Stir in the strawberry pieces. Place the molds in the freezer for 1 hour. Add the remaining mixture into each mold. Replace the molds in the freezer for another hour. Remove the molds from the freezer and serve.

Bring soup mix and water to a boil in a saucepan. Boil 2 minutes and stir in the roast beef. Cook 10 minutes or until the meat is heated through. Split the hoagie rolls. Spread one side of each half with the sauce. Cover the sauce with the meat and top with the remaining half of the hoagie rolls.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl combine the cooked rice with the peppers and corn. Add the parsley, onion and salt. Mix thoroughly. Pour into a 9x13 inch baking pan. Mix the melted butter with the flour. Pour over the rice mixture. Bake for 20 minutes. Serves 6.

Melt butter in a large pan and add green onions and minced parsley. Cook on medium heat until softened. Add crawfish and andouille sausage. Stir and cook until crawfish is pink and the andouille is cooked through. Add flour and cook for one minute. Add cream and stir. Add red peppers and cook until mixture thickens. Add cooked fettuccine and toss until well combined. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Place tenderloin in 13x9 baking dish. Combine remaining ingrediants. Pour over tenderloin. Cover with foil. Bake 1 1/2 hours. Uncover and continue baking until tenderloin is done. Serve with green onions.
Mix all together. Form into balls about 1" round. Fry until brown.

Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a standard-size muffin pan with paper liners or grease the pan. In a large bowl whisk together the flour, oats, granulated sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In a medium bowl beat the egg with an electric mixer until slightly thickened. Add the butter and beat until blended. Add the vanilla and beat until blended. With the mixer on low speed add the dry ingredients and beat until blended. Add the milk and beat until blended. Stir in the bananas. Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups, filling each cup 3/4 full. Sprinkle each with cranberries. Bake until the cranberries are plump and a wooden pick inserted in the center of the muffins comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Cool the muffin pan on a rack for about 5 minutes. Remove the muffins from the pan and cool on the rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 8-inch round cake pans, or one 9-inch square pan.In a bowl combine the flour, 1/4 cup of the sugar, the baking soda, the baking powder and the saltset aside.In a large bowl cream the butter until smooth. Beat in the egg until well combined. Beat in the avocado until smooth, scraping the bowl often. Beat in the buttermilk until just combined. Beat in the vanilla extract. Add the flour mixture alternately with the buttermilk, beginning and ending with the flour mixturebeat just until combined. Fold in the nuts.Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pan(s). Bake for 20 minutescheck for doneness after 20 minutes with a toothpick or skewer inserted into the middle of the cakeif the toothpick or skewer comes out clean, the cake is done.Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to cool completely on a

In large bowl, toss together first 3 ingredients. Add next 5 ingredients. In serving glasses, layer half of each fruit mixture and half of each topping mixture. Repeat layers. Serve immediately. Yield: 16 servings.

Beat oil, eggs, and vanilla with mixer until blended. Combine flour, baking powder, and saltadd to oil mixture. Stir in chocolate pieces. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool 1 minuteremove from pan to cooling rack. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Sprinkle the yeast over the warm water and let stand for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the remaining dry ingredients. Combine yeast water with dry ingredients and stir to form a dough. Knead and form into loaves and place in greased pans to rise for 2 hours. Bake in a hot oven (400 degrees F) for 10 minutes. Brush with melted butter while hot.
Combine cream cheese, salsa and cheddar cheese. Mix well. Spread into 13x9" baking pan. Top with black olives. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips or veggies.
In a large skillet, brown ground turkey and drain. Stir in remaining ingredients and simmer 5 minutes. Serve in taco shells.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Brush the mixture over the chicken breasts and bake for about 30 minutes. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Place cream cheese in the bottom of a 9-inch pie dish. Mix together salsa and taco seasoning. Add the black bean mixture. Top with remaining ingredients. Chill until serving time. Serve with tortilla chips. You can also make the dip the day before you need it.
Soak dried apricot in hot water for 20 minutes. Drain water. Cut apricot in pieces. Blend apricot, lemon juice and cream until smooth. Add water and blend. Serve in cold glass.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Divide dough into 4 squares. On a lightly floured surface, roll out each square to a 9-inch circle. Place 1 square on a baking sheet and sprinkle with 1/4 cup mustard and 1/4 cup ham. Top with another square and press edges together with your fingers to seal. Repeat with remaining dough and filling. Beat egg with 1 tablespoon water and brush the edges of the pastry with egg wash. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm or room temperature with a salad.

Slice figs in half. In a saucepan combine the sugar and brandy. Bring to a boil and allow to thicken. Remove the fruit from the syrup and place on a wire rack to cool. Preheat oven to 375f. On a lightly floured surface roll out the puff pastry to a 13-inch square. Cut the pastry into three 4-inch strips. Place a fig half in the middle of each strip. Fold the pastry over the fruit, and press the edges together to seal. With a pastry brush, paint the top of each bundle with melted butter. Bake for 20 minutes or until the pastry is golden. Dust the pastry bundles with powdered sugar.

In a large mixing bowl, mix all dry ingredients. Set aside. In a small bowl, mix together milk, egg and molasses. Make a well in the middle of the dry ingredients. Pour in the milk mixture. Stir until mixed. Add the raisins. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Let stand 5 minutes before removing from pan. Makes one loaf.

In a 2-1/2 qt. casserole dish combine chicken pieces with soups. Cover and bake in 350 f oven for 1 hour. Stir occasionally. After an hour pour half-and-half over the chicken. Cover and return to oven. Bake for another 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center. Remove from oven and top with parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with chives and seasoning salt and paprika. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serves 4-6.

Pour the almonds into a microwave-safe bowl or container. Pour the sugar over the nuts, then add the water. Microwave at 70 percent power for 3 minutes 30 seconds. Mix the almonds well, then microwave for another 3 minutes 30 seconds. Mix again, then microwave for 1 minute more. Mix once more and allow the nuts to cool before removing them from the bowl or container.

Spray a large saucepan with cooking spraysaute onion 3 minutes. Stir in spices. Add carrotssaute 3 minutes. Add 3 cups waterbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 10 minutes. Add remaining 1 cup water. Stir in milk. Return to a boilreduce heat. Cook 1 minute. Stir in lime juiceseason to taste. Garnish with cilantro.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add mushroom soup mixes. Stir well. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. Stir in instant rice. Add boiling water. Mix well. Pour into greased 9 x 9 baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Combine water and bulgur wheat in slow cooker. Cover and cook overnight for 8 hours on low. Drain and rinse in colander. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cover and cook 1 hour overnight on low or 1 1/2 hours on high. Serve warm, sprinkling with additional ground cinnamon if desired. Makes 10-12 servings.

In a large stockpot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the sausage to the pan in a single layer. Cook for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally to break up the meat. Add the onion, carrot, garlic, and rosemary. Cook for 8-10 minutes. Add the lentils and cook for 2 more minutes. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Cover the pan and reduce the heat to low. Cook for 25-30 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Add the escarole and cook for an additional 4-5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. In a large bowl combine the first 4 ingredients until creamy. Beat in the eggs. In a separate bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Gradually add to the creamed mixture and stir until combined. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from cookie sheets to wire racks to cool completely.

Melt the butter in a saute pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until golden. Add the carrots, salt, and lemon pepper. Stir until the carrots are tender. Add the remaining vegetables. Cover the saute pan, reduce the heat to low, and cook until the vegetables are tender. Garnish the dish with the basil.

Peel onions, trim ends, and core. Cut off tops about 1/4-inch from tops. Stand up tops in small bowl and mix with rice. Add cheese, olive oil, white wine, salt& pepper. Mix well. Fill tops with rice mixture. Place in baking dish. Add enough water to come 1/2 way up sides of onions. Bake in preheated 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven until tops are golden brown, about 45 minutes.

Saute onion and celery in butter until tender. Stir in flour until smooth and bubbly. Add tomato juice to make smooth paste. Stir in baking soda to eliminate lumps. Stir in milk and bring to a boil. Simmer for 30 minutes stirring often. Stir in sugar and salt to taste. Correct seasonings. Garnish with roquefort cheese.

Grease large cookie sheet. Cream together margarine, sugar, and egg. Stir in flours. Add in vanilla extract and chopped dark chocolate. Drop by rounded teaspoonful onto cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven for about 8-10 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool on cookie sheet.

Melt the butter in a saucepan and add the chopped chocolate. Add the condensed milk and stir well. Cook for about 1 minute and then add the biscuits and nuts and mix well. Spoon into a greased tin and refrigerate for a few hours before cutting into squares.

In a large shallow dish combine the paprika, salt, lemon pepper, garlic powder, and ground pepper. Add the dried basil and the onion powder and stir well. Add the fillets and turn to coat both sides. In a large nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat heat the butter. Add the fillets and cook for 4 minutes. Turn and cook until the fish just separates when pressed with a fork, about 4 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Dress hardboiled egg by peeling it and then slicing it in half lengthwise. Remove yolk. Slice it in half lengthwise. Arrange the egg slices, carrot and shallot on plate. Arrange green beans around the plate. Place the gruyere in the center. Add the salad greens around the cheese. Pour the dressing over the salad and sprinkle the coarse sea salt over it.

Whisk eggs and milk in a bowl. Heat oil in a non stick skillet. Add eggs and cook. When cooked, layer on flour tortillas. Add cheese and bacon. Top with avocado and green onions. Roll up and place in a greased baking dish. Sprinkle with salsa and bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Serve with salsa.

Cut green peppers and onions into small pieces and chop garlic cloves. Combine with cooked bacon bits. Boil a large pot of water and add the green beans. Boil 1-3 minutes and drain. Toss with the chopped vegetables and bacon bits. Add soy sauce and accent seasoning. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Brown chicken breast halves on both sides in butter over medium-high heat. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. Add mushrooms to the pan drippings and saute until tender. Combine flour and milkstir into the mushrooms until well blended. Stir in the chicken stock and artichoke heartsbring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes. Place the chicken back into the casserole dish and pour the sauce over the topcover the dish and bake for 30 minutes.

Melt the butter in a large sauce pan. Saut the onions until they are soft. Add the flour and blend well. Cook for 1 minute. Gradually add the chicken broth and dry sherry. Blend well. Add the egg yolks and whisk until thick and well combined. Add the heavy cream and the shrimp. Cook until the shrimp is pink. Serve immediately. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Scramble eggs in a small skillet. Add milk if you like. Heat until eggs are firm but not browned. Toast english muffins and spread each half with egg mixture. Top each half with a slice of avocado and salsa. Sprinkle with diced red chili and monterey jack cheese.

In large bowl combine 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup coarse salt, 1/4 teaspoon white pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon dill. Set aside. Rub salt mixture over salmon. Cover and chill for 24 hours. In bowl combine 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup cognac and 1/4 cup white wine. Pour over fish and refrigerate for 24 hours. Remove fish from marinade and discard marinade. Place fish in 1 gallon ziplock bag. Add 1/2 cup cognac and 1/4 cup white wine to bag and seal. Place in refrigerator for 48 hours or more. Remove fish from bag and rinse well. Drain and cover with cold water and refrigerate for 8 hours or more. Rinse fish again and drain thoroughly.

In food processor bowl with metal blade, process figs until coarsely chopped. Add the cream cheese, walnuts and kosher salt. Process until smooth. Add the chopped green onion tops. Process until combined. Serve with crackers.

Combine soup, dry ranch, butter and pork chops in crockpot. Cook on low for 4-6 hours. Potato preparation: Wash and peel the potatoes. Slice them into quarters and then in half again (6ths). Add into crockpot with the pork chops. Cover and cook another hour or so. Drain off all but about an inch of broth from the crockpot. Mash potatoes and add some of the broth and butter (save the rest for the gravy). Stir in the parmesan cheese and cracked pepper. Keep covered while you make the gravy. Gravy Preparation: Melt butter over medium heat and add the garlic and onion powder. Slowly whisk in the flour and cook for about 1 minute. Slowly pour in the chicken broth and whisk until smooth and combined. Bring the mixture to a slow simmer and let cook for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Salt and pepper to taste and pour over the potatoes and pork chops. Serve and enjoy!
Whisk together tahini, water, and lemon juice until smooth and thick. Whisk in the tamari and red onion. Stir in the remaining ingredients and refrigerate until ready to use. Serve with vegetables.

Spread half of the cream cheese onto each tortilla. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Arrange roast beef, honey roasted ham and smoked turkey in that order across the cream cheese. Sprinkle with the remaining cream cheese. Roll up and cut in half. Top with the remaining cream cheese and roll up. Cut in half and serve with a mixture of romaine and iceberg lettuces, sliced tomatoes and mayonnaise.

Peel carrots and onion and cut into thin strips. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in carrots and onion and cook for 10 minutes or until they are soft, stirring often. Stir in apples and cook for about 5 minutes or until they are tender, stirring often. Stir in water and nutmeg. Cook for 10 minutes or until mixture is thickened slightly. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Crumble sausage into skilletcook over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain and set aside. Beat eggs in medium bowl until well mixed. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat until hotpour egg mixture into skillet. Cook and stir until almost setstir in sausage and green onion. Spoon onto baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake uncovered for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve over tortilla chips topped with salsa.
Mix together butter, cocoa powder and milk until smooth. Add marshmallow creme and mix until smooth. Add powdered sugar and mix until smooth. Chill for 30 minutes to 1 hour before using as frosting.
Place pork tenderloin in a slow cooker. Pour wine and soy sauce over it. Sprinkle with seasoning packets. Cover and cook 4 hours. Serve with cooking liquid as au jus.

Saut onion and celery in butter until crisp-tender. Stir in frozen peasheat through. Stir in marjoramheat thoroughly. Sprinkle with water to moistenstir and heat through. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve over rice or hot pasta.

In a medium bowl whisk the sifted flour, sugar and salt. In a separate bowl beat the eggs. Stir the egg mixture into the dry ingredients just until moistened. Beat the mixture again until smooth. Heat a lightly oiled frying pan or griddle. Grease with 1/2 tsp. butter and pour about 1/3 cup batter onto the pan. Cook until the bottom side is brown and bubbles form on the top. Flip the pancake over and cook until the other side is golden brown. Serve immediately with lingonberry preserves.

Melt olive oil in a heavy 3-quart pot. Add the celery, carrot and onion and saute over low heat for 20 minutes. Add the butternut squash and saute another 5 minutes. Add the potato and saute 5 minutes more. Add the hot water and simmer until the potatoes are tender. Puree the mixture in a blender or food processor. Heat the soup over low heat. Add the salt. Stir. Serve in deep bowls. Garnish with parsley sprigs.

Place the cucumbers in a bowl and cover with the red wine vinegar. Stir in the sugar and the crushed red pepper flakeslet stand at room temperature for 30 minutesstirring occasionally. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Serves 8 to 10.

Beat together the egg, water, caster sugar and cinnamon with an electric whisk. Put enough butter into a heavy-based pan over a low heat to melt it. Soak each slice of bread in the egg mixture on both sides for about 1 minute. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until lightly golden on both sides. Serve immediately with more cinnamon and/or sugar if wished.

Mix together dry ingredients in bowl. Add butter, vanilla and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. Roll into balls and roll balls in powdered sugar. Store in airtight container. Makes about 2 dozen balls.

In medium bowl with wire whisk or electric mixer on medium speed, combine 1 can (8 ounce) crushed pineapple in juice and 2 cups milk. Beat 2 to 3 minutes or until smooth. Add 1 package (3.4 ounce) instant pistachio pudding mix. Beat 2 minutes or until well blended. Fold in 2 cups COOL WHIP. Pour into 9-inch springform pan. Refrigerate 1 hour or until set. Top with miniature marshmallows. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into 6 wedges. Yield : 6 servings (serving size : 1/2 of a 6-slice dessert)

Cook milk, sugar, butter, and cocoa over medium heat until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Remove from heat. Mix in vanilla, then add quick-cooking rolled oats. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper or foil. Cool thoroughly before removing from paper.

Cut the cucumber in 1/4 inch slices. Cover with salt, toss well. Place in a bowl for 30 minutes. Rinse the salt from the cucumbers, pat dry with a paper towel. In a medium bowl whisk together the rice vinegar, sugar, mirin (or sweet rice wine), and saki (or rice wine). Place the cucumbers in a large non-reactive bowl. Pour the dressing over them and toss.

In a large saucepan, combine the sugar, water and almonds. Cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until mixture reaches a soft ball stage on a candy thermometer. Add the butter. When the mixture is melted, pour into a foil-lined cookie sheet and spread evenly to about 1/4 thickness. Let cool for about an hour before breaking into pieces.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Blend dry ingredients. Cut in butter. Beat egg. Add milk. Add dry ingredients. Mix well. Fold in raspberries. Place in greased or paper-lined muffin tins. Bake 20 to 25 minutes.

Slice and core the apples and place them in a large bowl. Toss with the sugar and butter until the apples are coated. Place the apples in a pastry shell and bake for 40 minutes at 350 degrees until golden brown on top. Let cool and top with apricot jam.

Whisk the eggs and heavy cream in a shallow bowl. Season with salt. Soak the bread slices on both sides for 30 seconds each. Melt the butter in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Place the slices of bread into the skillet. Cook until light brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Spread each slice of bread with mustard. Top with ham and cheese. Serve immediately.

Wash and dry apples. Remove the top of the stem. Peel apples. Cut each apple into 4 slices. Combine spices in a small bowl. Put sugar in a bowl. Dip each apple slice into the spice mixture. Dip each apple slice into the sugar. Place on a rack. Bake in a 200 degree oven for 1 hour. Turn slices. Bake for another hour. Cool. Store in a plastic bag or container.

In a large skillet brown meat and onion. Drain off fat. Stir in enchilada sauce, garlic powder, salt and chili powder. Heat until bubbly. Spread half of meat mixture in the bottom of a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Spread cornbread mixture over meat mixture. Top with remaining meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting. Serves 6 to 8.

In small bowl beat eggs well. In another bowl beat cottage cheese till smooth with buttermilk, eggs, butter, honey, white sugar, flour, orange flower water, water. Drop by tablespoonfuls into boiling water. Boil 2 minutes or till set. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Cool. Roll in powdered sugar.

Dip the chicken breasts in the egg whites and then roll them in the dry stuffing mix. Brown the chicken in the vegetable oil in a nonstick skillet. Lay a slice or two of cheese on top of each piece of chicken. Cover liberally with spaghetti sauce. Sprinkle with cheeses. Cover skillet and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Serves 4.

Cook raccoon in water with salt. Drain and cut into small pieces. Add lard to a skillet and fry until brown. Add onions and continue to brown. Add raccoon pieces. Add red pepper flakes to taste. Serve with white rice.

In a large skillet saute sausage until browned. Add potato slices and cook until tender. Combine sausage mixture with sauteed onions and pour over the top of slices. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

In a small saucepan, combine the water with all other ingredients except the tea leaves. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to a simmercover and cook for 10 minutes. Add the tea leaves. Cover and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Strain the mixture into a teapotdiscard the spices. Serve warm.

Butter outside of bread. On inside of one slice place cheddar cheese. On the other slice lay thinly sliced vidalia onion on top of the cheese. Put the two slices together, cheese-side down, in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook until the cheese melts and the bread is crisp and golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Peel onions, cut in half lengthwise. Remove center core. Slice into thin strips. Heat olive oil in skillet. Add onions. Stir until soft. Add tomato juice. Cook until liquid is reduced. Add tomato sauce. Cook until tomatoes are tender. Add potatoes. Toss. Turn into baking dish. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with basil.

Cream together the butter and oil. Cream in the sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Blend in the flour, baking soda and baking powder. Stir in the nuts and the coconut. Divide into two sections. Chill and roll out thin on wax paper. Cut out with cookie cutters. Bake at 350f for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Makes about 3 dozen

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until tender. Add the grouper fillets and cook until done. Season with the spicy brown mustard, lemon juice and salt and pepper.

Mix together pudding mix and milk. Add white cake mix. Add eggs, cream cheese and vanilla. Spread into 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes. Cool. Spread with cream cheese frosting. Sprinkle with nuts.

Crumble bacon and cook in a skillet until crisp. Drain the bacon and set aside. Slice cabbage into 1/2 inch strips. In a large bowl toss together the cabbage and bacon pieces with the coleslaw dressing and set aside. In another bowl combine the blue cheese crumbles with the tomatoes and set aside. On a serving plate layer the cabbage mixture and then top with the blue cheese and tomato mixture.

Preheat oven to 350F. Halve and core each pear. Arrange in a greased 9x13 baking dish, cut sides up. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 c apple cider and 2 tbsp maple syrupbrush over each pear half. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from ovenspoon 1/4 c cranberries and 1 tbsp walnuts onto each half. Return to oven and bake an additional 20 to 25 minutes or until tender when pierced with a sharp knife. Serve warm with goat cheese, if desired.

Mix together oil, garlic, and onion. Set aside for 10 minutes. In large bowl combine red, yellow, green, and plum tomatoes. Add dressing. Season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan with oil or cooking spray and set aside. In a large bowl, combine cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, club soda and butter. Beat on high for one minute and pour batter in to prepared pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cake. Let the cake sit in the pan for five minutes, then remove and let it cool completely on a wire rack. In a medium bowl combine powdered sugar, milk and vanilla extract with a whisk until smooth. Pour glaze over the top of the cooled cake. Refrigerate for at least one hour before cutting.

Place the carrot, celery ribs, onion, garlic powder, celery seed and bay leaves in a large pot. Add the broth and bullion cube. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken breasts and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in the crushed red pepper flakes and simmer another 5 minutes. Serve the chicken on a bed of rice.
Cut up vegetables into small pieces. Combine with cream cheese. Add mayonnaise. Mix well. Refrigerate. Serve with vegetables or chips.

Mix all the ingredients together. The mixture should be of a very thin consistency. Cook on a hot skillet with a little bit of vegetable oil. Do not make the mixture too thick, if you do so it will be difficult to cook it properly.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. In a large bowl, beat together the oil and eggs. Beat in the buttermilk and vanilla until smooth. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, cornmeal, sugar and salt. Stir into the liquid mixture just until combined. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups. Bake in the preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack.

Mix mushroom soup and onion soup mix. Pour half of mixture over bottom of crock pot. Place chuck roast on top and pour remaining mixture over the top. Cook on low for 8 hours. Add red potato and carrot in last 1 hour of cooking.

Wash button mushrooms, cut off stems and slice into pieces. Lightly dust the turkey fillets in flour. Heat butter, garlic clove and oil in a pan. Add the mushroom pieces and sauté for a few minutes until the mushrooms are softened a bit. Add the chicken bouillon powder and warm water and let the mixture boil for about 2 minutes. Add the sliced turkey fillets and simmer until the meat is cooked through. Remove the pan from the heat, stir in the parsley and season to taste with salt. Serve with freshly cooked pasta or bread.

Place fruit in a medium size bowl. Cover fruit with water. Let stand 10 minutes. Add vinegar, brown sugar and dry mustard to fruit and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook 5 minutes or until thickened. Cool and serve.

Cut filet of beef into thin slices. In a small bowl whisk together rice wine, soy sauce, cilantro, scallions, cumin, chili pepper flakes and pepper. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add beefcook until browned, stirring constantly for 4 minutes. Add soy sauce mixturecook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with sea salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Sauté the zucchini, pepper and onion with the kielbasa for about 10 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes and the vegetable seasoning. Add the tomato paste and mix. Simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with paprika.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash the potatoes and cut in half lengthwise. Bake for 40 minutes. Cut the salami into thin slices and brown them in the pan with the bacon. In the meantime, pour the baked beans in a bowl. Cut the chives into rings and mix with the salami and the baked beans. Mix well. Put the mixture in the baked potatoes and bake in the oven for another 5 minutes. Enjoy.

Brown ground beef and drain fat. Combine beef with enchilada sauce and soup and simmer for 20 minutes on low heat. Sprinkle with taco seasoning and sour cream. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Top with sharp cheddar and crushed doritos.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine cake mix with pudding mix. Add eggs and stir until smooth. Drop dough by tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Remove from baking sheetcool on wire racks. Melt 1/2 cup butter. Pour melted butter over cookiessprinkle with pecans and almond brickle chips.

Heat oil in skillet. Brown chops in hot oil for five minutes a side. Remove from skillet. In small bowl whisk together flour and water until smooth. Add to skillet. Heat until thickened. Remove from heat. Add parsley. Spoon over chops.

Preheat broiler. Cut off the stem end of the plum tomato and slice the other end into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Place the rounds on a baking sheet. Drizzle the rounds with the oil and sprinkle with the kosher salt and black pepper. Broil until the rounds are browned, about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Top the rounds with the fresh herbs and the Parmesan cheese before serving.

Cook gnocchi according to package directions. In large saucepan, heat heavy cream. Whisk in flour. Cook over low heat 1 minute or until thickened. Add salt, pepper and nutmeg. Cook 30 seconds. Stir in baby spinach. In large bowl, combine ricotta and mozzarella. Stir in spinach mixture. Add gnocchi. Gently toss to coat. Spoon into 2-quart baking dish. Top with parsley. Cover and bake 40 minutes. Uncover and bake 5 minutes or until browned and bubbly.

Prepare the couscous according to the instructions on the package. Add vegetable stock powder to boiling water. Add garlic to boiling water. Cook shrimp in boiling water for about 2 minutes until opaque. Drain shrimp. Add shrimp, peas and couscous to vegetable stock and stir well. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, brown ground beef and onion. Drain fat. Add remaining ingredients and heat through. Spoon about 1/3 cup meat mixture onto tortillas. Sprinkle with cheese. Fold over ends and roll up. Serve with salsa and sour cream for dipping.

Mix cottage cheese, caster sugar, double cream and egg whites together and season with lemon juice. Divide into 4 ramekins or souffl dishes and place in bain-marie over simmering water and cook for 10 minutes or until set. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before removing from ramekins. Decorate with raspberries and strawberries and serve with single cream.

Boil the potatoes until tender and drain. Rinse in cold water and drain again. Cut into small bite size pieces. In a large bowl, combine the lemon juice and red pepper. Add the potatoes and green onions and toss to coat. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. When ready to serve, stir in the bacon bits. In another bowl combine the mayonnaise and sour cream. Add the hot pepper sauce and blue cheese. Mix until blended. Add the mixture to the potatoes. Toss to coat and refrigerate for 2 hours. Sprinkle with bacon bits and serve.

In a saucepan heat the water with the bouillon cubes until boiling. In a large bowl combine the creme fraiche and mustard and blend until smooth and creamy. Add the bouillon mixture and the spring onion and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the cornstarch and cook for a few minutes until thickened. Serve with the cheese and spring onion.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add yellow pepper and onion. Saute 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in garlic. Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute. Stir in pasta sauce and cook 5 minutes. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes. Stir in basil. Spoon sauce over noodles. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and crushed pepper flakes. Cook for 1 minute. Add broccoli. Stir constantly until tender-crisp. Add eggs. Cook until eggs are set. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Serves 2.
