In a bowl, combine the first 3 ingredients until smooth. Divide the mixture among 4 bowls and refrigerate 10 minutes or until set. Top each serving with a slice of fruit and serve immediately.

Drain tuna and place in large bowl. Add 2 teaspoons garlic salt. Mix in dill relish, celery and onions. Spread mayonnaise evenly over tops of hot dog buns. Divide mixture between halves of buns. Sprinkle with remaining garlic salt. Roll up into sandwiches. Wrap in foil. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Mix the coffee with the water in a small bowl and set aside. Grease a 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) baking pan with melted butter and set aside. Put the biscuits into a food processor and blend until finely ground. Transfer to a bowl and add the coffee mixture and mix well. Transfer to the prepared pan and press down evenly. Set aside.In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the brown sugar, cocoa powder and evaporated milk and stir until the mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Remove from the heat and add the chocolate and mix well until melted and smooth. Pour over the biscuit base and spread evenly. Sprinkle with the nuts and fruit and press down gently. Chill for several hours until set.Cut into squares.

Place the fish in a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle the nuts over the top of the fillets. In a small bowl combine the oil with the herbs and lemon zest and juice. Brush the mixture over the top of the nuts. Bake for about 15 minutes in the preheated oven or until the nuts are lightly toasted and the fish is just opaque. Serve warm.

Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the onions and saute until softened. Add the fava beans and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and spices. Mix well. Cook for about 1 minute. Serve with pita bread.
In a small bowl combine mayonnaise and chili sauces. Add cornstarchstir until well blended. Add shrimpstir to coat. Place in refrigerator until ready to serve. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Lightly brush each mushroom cap with oil. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, saute the onion and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the pepper sauce and the gorgonzola and heat through. Remove from heat, add the parsley and the breadcrumbs and mix well. Divide the gorgonzola mixture between the caps. Bake for 15 minutes or until the mushroom caps are tender.

Slice each egg lengthwise in half and remove the yolks. In a small mixing bowl mash the yolks with the mayonnaise. Fold in the green onions and curry powder. Spoon the mixture back into the egg whites and serve chilled.

Beat egg until light and frothy. Add buttermilk and melted butter and beat well. Add the cornmeal, salt and baking soda. Mix well and pour into greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes to 45 minutes or until done in the middle with a toothpick coming out clean.

In a shallow dish whisk together the buttermilk and the egg. In another shallow dish mix together the panko breadcrumbs, coconut, salt & pepper. Coat the chicken with the egg wash & then dredge in the panko breadcrumbs. Place on a parchment lined baking sheet & bake for 15 minutes. Flip & bake for another 15 minutes.

Combine cake mix, butter, and egg in large bowl. Stir until dough forms. Press into greased 13x9 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 min. Cool. In medium saucepan, combine corn syrup and marshmallows. Cook over low heat until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Pour mixture over cooled crust. Sprinkle with chips and nuts. Chill until firm. Cut into squares. Makes 36-40 bars.
Brown meat and celery. Drain. Mix with remaining ingredients. Shape into patties. Cook as desired. Serve on bun.

Bring the water to a boil with the vinegar, salt, alum, and garlic. Add the cucumber slices. Boil for 1 minute. Drain. Pack into sterilized jars. Add the fresh dill and onion slices to each jar. Seal the jars immediately and store in the fridge.
Toss all except feta cheese in a large bowl. Toss in feta cheese. Drizzle dressing over and toss to mix. Sprinkle hazelnuts on top and serve.

In large skillet over medium-low heat, melt butter. Add green onion. Add crayfish. Cook until crayfish are hot. Remove from skillet. Beat eggs in bowl. Add crayfish and onion. Stir in cheese. Add to skillet. Cook until egg is set. Serve immediately.

Melt 2 tbsp of butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Whisk together 1 cup of milk and 4 eggs until smooth, then stir in 1/2 tsp white pepper. Pour into the pan, stirring constantly until just set. Add 1/4 cup finely chopped green onion, 1/4 cup flaked smoked salmon and 1/4 cup sour cream. Sprinkle with fresh coriander.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into uniform pieces (1 inch). Add them to a pot of boiling water and cook until tender. In a saucepan combine the cream cheese and butter and bring the mixture to a simmer over low heat and stir until the mixture is smooth and creamy (about 5 minutes). Remove the mixture from the heat and let cool completely. In a large mixing bowl add the cooled mixture and the milk, and beat with an electric mixer until smooth and fluffy (about 1 minute). Add the green onions and the parsley and beat again for 1 minute. Add the potatoes and the marjoram and beat again for about 30 seconds. In a shallow bowl combine the breadcrumbs and the melted butter and mix thoroughly. Add the breadcrumb mixture to the potato mixture and stir well. Transfer the mixture to a 2 quart casserole dish and bake for 30 minutes.

In a food processor, combine the tomatoes, onion, garlic, salt, pepper flakes, olive oil and basil. Process until smooth. Pour into a slow cooker. Cook on high 5 hours. Remove the leaves of the basil. With a slotted spoon, transfer the tomato mixture to a bowl. Add the basil leaves. Toss to coat. Serve immediately. Makes about 6 cups.

Preheat over to 350. Cream together the sugars and banana. Add the mashed banana. Add the flour mixture. Stir in the olive oil. Fold in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonful onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Remove from oven and let set for 10 minutes before eating.

In a Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot, heat oil over medium high heat. Add garlic and saute until golden, about 2 minutes. Add wine and continue cooking until liquid is almost completely evaporated, about 3 minutes. Add clams and cover pot. Cook until all of the clams open up, about 5 minutes. Uncover pot and stir in capellini and parsley until heated through, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Puree the garlic in a food processor. Add the sea salt, lemon juice and the extra virgin olive oil. Process until the dressing is smooth. Add the Parmesan cheese and process again until smooth. Add the lemon zest. Transfer to a jar. Store in the refrigerator.

Combine almonds with quinoa in a medium saucepan. Add 3 cups water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer covered 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the raisins. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Stir in the oatmeal, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally until oatmeal is tender. Serve in bowls with vanilla yogurt.

Mix brown sugar and spices together and spread on bottom of a 9x13 pan. Layer on the apples and pour the water over the top. Combine the flour and the oats. Cut the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse meal and sprinkle on top of the apples. Bake at 375 for about an hour or until the top is brown and crusty and the apples are tender.

Cook the swede and potato until done (boiling or baking), mash together with butter, chives and a little milk or cream, season to taste with sea salt and black pepper (and a pinch of cayenne if desired). Serve with freshly ground black pepper and chives on top as well as a little lashings of butter.
In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise and the Dungeness crab. Stir in the chopped artichoke hearts, the parmesan cheese and parsley. Chill. Serve with crackers.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and green onions and cook for 3 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool for 5 minutes. Beat the eggs lightly in a large bowl and stir in the mushrooms, onions and cottage cheese. Add the flour and baking powder and stir to combine. Add the remaining tablespoon of oil to the skillet and heat over medium heat. Using a large ice cream scoop or 2 spoons, drop the mixture by the spoonful into the hot oil and fry for 1 minute on each side or until golden brown. Drain on paper towel. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 9 x 5 inch loaf panset aside. In a large bowl, cream together the oil and brown sugar until light and fluffyadd the egg whites, one at a time, beating well after each addition. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and saltstir into the creamed mixture until just blended. Fold in the mashed bananas and vanilla extract. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack to cool completely.

Peel and core the pears. Slice into eighths. Slice the celery and hazelnuts into thin strips. In a large bowl, combine the pears, cherries, celery, yogurt and sour cream. Add the salt and the lemon juice to taste. Toss well, then cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 15 minutes. Serve on a bed of romaine or other greens.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Bake the potatoes at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 50 minutes. Slice potatoes into 1/4-inch thick slices and set aside.In a medium skillet over medium heat, saute the onion and ham together with the salt and pepper until the onion is tender and the ham is heated through.Remove from the heat and stir in the cream and Dijon. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs with the parsley until blended well. Combine the egg mixture with the onion mixture until well blended. Pour the mixture into the pie crust shells and sprinkle with Swiss cheese. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter into the heavy cream. In a separate bowl, mix the potato slices with the half-and-half, cheese, salt, and pepper. Layer the sliced potatoes into the

Preheat oven to 375. Cream together margarine and sugar. Beat in eggs. Add dry ingredients. Combine bananas with Tang and mix into batter. Stir in chocolate chips. Bake in muffin pan 18-22 minutes. Makes 12.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat until hot. Cook the mushrooms for 2-3 minutes or until they begin to soften. Add the onions and cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in the wild rice and cook for 3 minutes or until lightly toasted. Stir in the beer and cook until the liquid evaporates. Stir in the mushrooms and cook for 3-4 minutes or until they begin to brown. Add the Italian sausage to the pan and cook for 2 minutes or until the sausage is browned. Stir in the black pepper and remove from the heat.

In a small bowl combine all of the ingredients except the pork. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the meat and mix well. Marinate for at least 2 hours, turning occasionally. Cook on an outdoor grill over medium heat until done.

In a 12-inch oven-proof skillet, heat the butter over medium-high heat until the foaming subsides (about 5 minutes). Add the onion and cook until tender (about 5 minutes). Add the garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Sprinkle the flour over the mixture and stir well. Add the soup and stir until smooth. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly until smooth and thickened (about 10 minutes). Stir in the tomatoes and the fish and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook 10 minutes or until the fish is opaque and tender when tested with a knife. Sprinkle the cheese over the top and bake 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the sauce is bubbly. Serve over the cooked pasta and sprinkle with parsley and red pepper flakes if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees and grease the bottom and sides of an 8-inch cast iron skillet with butter. In a medium bowl, combine the cornmeal, all-purpose flour, salt and sugar and mix well. In another medium bowl, combine the milk, eggs and oil and mix well. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the wet mixture and mix well by hand or with a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Turn the batter into the prepared pan and place in the oven. Bake for about 40 to 45 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and has begun to pull away from the sides of the pan. Remove the pan from the oven and turn it upside down on a wire cooling rack or on the counter. Allow the bread to cool for 10 minutes and then use a thin metal spatula to loosen the bread from the pan and turn it out onto the wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a saucepan over low heat, warm heavy cream with cinnamon stick. Add strawberries to cream and cook over low heat for 30 minutes or until tender. Remove cinnamon stick. Remove strawberry tops. Add sugar to taste and calvados to taste. Chill before serving. Garnish with mint leaves.

Place octopus in a large saucepan of boiling water. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 40 to 45 minutes. Drain the octopus, reserving 1/4 cup cooking liquid. Cut the octopus into 1-inch pieces and place in a bowl. Add the oregano, lemon juice, olive oil and garlic. Toss. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with more oregano and lemon.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. In a large bowl add shrimp and tomatoes. In a large skillet over medium heat add olive oil and onions. Cook onions for 5 minutes. Add seasoning and cook for 1 more minute. Add cooked spaghetti and goat cheese. Mix well. Serves 4.

Grease and line the base of two 20cm sandwich tins. Mash the bananas and then mix with the sugar. Add the bicarbonate of soda and mix well. Add the eggs one at a time and then the melted butter. Stir in the flour and milk. Divide the mixture between the two tins. Bake in a preheated oven at 170C for about 25 minutes or until the cakes are cooked in the middle. Allow to cool in the tin. When cold cut each cake in half and spread the top with buttercream. Sandwich the two halves together and decorate.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a medium bowl whisk flour, baking soda and salt. In a large bowl beat the butter and granulated sugar with a mixer until smooth. Beat in brown sugar and vanilla. Add the egg and beat until fluffy. Reduce the mixer speed to low and beat in the flour mixture until well blended. Stir in the peanut butter and chocolate chips. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Drop the dough by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 2 dozen cookies.

Brown ground beef and onion together. Drain off excess fat. Add tomato sauce, water, worcestershire sauce and salt and pepper. Cook until mixture comes to a boil. Add cooked macaroni, heat through and serve.
In a large sauce pan combine thai peppers, garlic and vinegar. Simmer over low heat for 1 hour or until reduced by half. Strain, cool and bottle.

Heat the oil in a skillet. Cook the sausage patties for 3-4 minutes or until they are browned and crisp on the edges. Beat the eggs with the milk and margarine until the mixture is smooth and creamy and pour over the sausage patties. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until the edges of the egg are set and the centers are still soft but not runny. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese and serve on the English muffins.
Brown ground pork and add seasonings. Pour in milk and cook for 1 hour. Pour into molds and chill for 2 days. Melt butter and sprinkle with dry breadcrumbs and bake until golden brown.

Mix first 5 ingredients together. Cool to lukewarm. Add margarine and 2 cups of the flour. Beat well. Add remaining 3 cups of the flour and beat until smooth. Add egg. Beat 30 seconds or until well mixed. Turn onto lightly greased surface. Knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes. Shape into a braid. Place in a greased 8 x 4 inch loaf pan. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk about 30 minutes. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until done. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack. Makes 1 loaf.

Combine 1/2 cup water and 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar in a small bowl. Season with salt and thyme. Set aside. Cut 1 lemon into thin rounds and set aside. Cut remaining 2 lemons into quarters. Place chicken thighs in a non-reactive container and pour over vinegar mixture. Cover and marinate in the fridge for 2 hours. Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken thighs in a single layer and brown on both sides. Remove thighs from pan. Add figs and 1/2 cup water to pan and saute 1 minute. Add remaining 1/2 cup water and 2 tablespoons brown sugar and bring to a boil. Add thyme and simmer 10 minutes. Return thighs to pan and simmer 5 minutes. Place one or two slices of lemon on each thigh and serve. Garnish with cilantro and lemon rounds.

Cut the pineapple into slices about 1/2 inch thick. In a small saucepan combine butter, sugar, spices, and salt. Bring mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until mixture becomes thick and syrupy. Spread mixture over the cut sides of the pineapple slices. Grill over medium heat about 3 minutes per side until pineapple is heated through. Serve with vanilla ice cream. Makes 2 servings.
Cream together cream cheese and mayonnaise in a small bowl. Add sugar, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to taste. Stir in the chopped eggs. Serve on whole wheat bread or lettuce leaves.

Prepare pasta according to package directions. Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the sage and cook until the sage is crisp and fragrant, about 20 seconds. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter and the pasta and toss until coated. Sprinkle with cheese and serve immediately.

Cream shortening and sugar. Add eggs and mix well. Stir in vanilla. Combine flour, baking soda and saltgradually add to creamed mixture and mix well. Stir in milk and cinnamon. Drop by rounded tablespoons 2 inches apart onto greased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove from pans to wire racks to cool.
Mix all ingredients together. Let it sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to an hour. Served with tortilla chips.

Melt margarine in skillet. Add onion to skillet. Saut till tender. Add flour. Stir constantly over medium heat. Add broth. Stir constantly until thick. Add veggies and potato. Cook until tender. Add parsley. Remove from heat. Add milk and seasonings. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Top with second pastry. Cut slits in top. Bake at 400 for 40 minutes. Let cool 20 minutes. Cut and serve.

Mix together instant flakes, parmesan cheese, parsley flakes, garlic salt and margarine in shallow bowl or dish. Place the chicken in this mixture to coat. Place in greased pan in 350f oven. Bake for 1 hour.

Heat oven to 400f. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions, garlic and cumin. Cook for 2 minutes or until onions are soft. Add veal. Cook 1 minute. Add wine and cook 2 minutes. Stir in thyme and parsley. Stir in stock. Simmer 8 to 10 minutes or until veal is tender. Transfer to a bowl. Add noodles and porcini. Toss to coat. Transfer to a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with parmesan. Bake 15 minutes or until bubbly.

Whip cream to soft peaks in a large bowl. Add powdered sugar and beat to stiff peaks. Add vanilla bean paste and mix to blend well. Place mixture in a bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Remove cream from refrigerator and mix well. Add espresso and cinnamon. Serve immediately.

In a mixing bowl combine milk and pudding mix. Beat on low speed for 2 minutes. Beat in honey until smooth. Add peanut butter and cereal. Spoon into desert dishes. Chill for 2 hours. Garnish with more cereal if desired.

Brown crumbles in a large skillet. Stir in mushrooms and onion. Cook 5 min., stirring occasionally. Stir in soup and 1/3 cup water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add pastacook 10 min., stirring often. Stir in spinach and cheese until melted.

Slice up 1 medium size potato into wedges. Chop up 1 onion. Slice up 4 Kielbasas. Slice up 4-5 baby carrots. Place potatoes in bottom of crock pot. Add potatoes, onions, Kielbasas and carrots. Mix together well. Add 2 cans of water. Mix together. Put 1/2 cup of BBQ Sauce in the bottom of the crock pot. Pour the rest over the meat and veggies. Cook for 4 hours on high. Stir mixture well before serving. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes.

Heat oil and cashews in pan. Add onion and cook till soft. Add garlic and ginger. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add water and simmer till reduced. Add tofu and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in red pepper and frozen peas. Add more water if needed. Simmer for 3-4 minutes. Serve with rice and lime wedges.

Cream butter and sugar together. Blend in almond extract and baking soda. Gradually add sifted dry ingredients to creamed mixture, beating after each addition until well blended. Shape into small balls, then roll in powdered sugar. Bake 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets at 375 degrees F for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 1 1/2 dozen.

Peel the cabbage leaves off the stem carefully and cut them up in small pieces, and put them in a bowl with the water (2 or 3 Tbsp.) salt (1 tsp.) and let it stand for about 10 minutes. When the water has drained out of the cabbage and it is dry, place it in a heavy saucepan with the Crisco. Brown it over a low heat. Add the vinegar (2 Tbsp.) , the sugar (1 tbsp.) , the ground cloves (1/4 tsp.) , the ground allspice (1/4 tsp.) and the ground ginger (1/4 tsp.) , the onions (1/2 cup) , the salt (1/2 tsp.) , the gingersnaps (1 tsp.) , the cinnamon (1/4 tsp.) and the bay leaves (2 or 3). Bring this mixture to a boil over a low heat, then cover and let simmer for 10 minutes or so. Uncover and boil for a few minutes more until the sauce has thickened a bit. Serve hot over noodles or

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Butter one side of 4 slices italian bread. On 2 slices, layer 1/2 cup shredded swiss and 1/2 cup shredded muenster cheesestop with remaining 2 slices. Butter the other sides. Place the sandwiches into the skillet, buttered sides down. Cook until golden brown and cheeses are melted, about 5 minutes per side. Meanwhile, prepare the spread: In a small bowl combine the american, parmesan and part-skim mozzarella cheeses, the mustard, garlic salt with parsley and the remaining 1 tablespoon buttermix well. Spread evenly on the remaining 4 slices of italian bread. Serve with the sandwiches.
Spread honey mustard on one slice of bread and mayonnaise on the other. Layer with potato, onion and tomatoes. Top with avocado and alfalfa sprout. Serve.
Mix soup with sour cream and pour over potatoes. Bake at 375 until bubbly. Add toppings of bacon bits and shredded cheddar cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Grease a 13x9x2 inch pan. Peel bananas and cut lengthwise in half. Arrange half of the banana slices in a single layer. Sprinkle with half of each of the remaining ingredients. Repeat with the remaining banana slices and remaining ingredients. Bake 45 minutes. Cool 5 minutes. Cut into 2 inch squares and serve warm.

Heat oil in non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add shallot and saute for 1 minute. Add apple juice concentrate and water. Stir to combine. Add remaining ingredients and cook until thickened. Brush salmon pieces with glaze and broil until cooked through. Serve hot.

Wash carrots. Cut off tops. Standing up on their ends. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Melt butter over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar. Hot sauce, orange juice concentrate, lemon juice and cumin. Add garlic. Continue stirring until thickened. Stir in carrots. Sprinkle with chili powder. Salt to taste. Let cool. Chill before serving.

Heat a large saucepan over medium high heat. Melt the butter in the saucepan. Add the onion and garlic cloves. Cook until onions are golden brown. Add the mushrooms and continue to cook until mushrooms are done. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice. Add the cream. Add the cooked pasta. Add the lemon and season to taste with the parmesan cheese. Add the salt & ground pepper. Toss well. Serve hot.
Heat 1/2 of the barbecue sauce in a pan. Slice chicken into thin strips. Add to sauce. Cook until heated through. Spoon onto rolls. Top with pickles. Serve hot.

In a food processor or high-powered blender, process all the ingredients together until you have a thick, creamy texture. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with fresh fruit, nuts or graham crackers.

Combine dill weed and paprika in a shallow dish. Dip fish in egg and milk mixture and then roll in dill/paprika mixture. Melt olive oil in a large skillet and add fish. Cook until browned on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and serve with lemon wedges.

Mix flour, garlic salt and cayenne in a shallow bowl. Dip each shrimp in flour mixture. Dip in egg. Roll in flaked coconut. Place 3 shrimp on each skewer. Deep fry at 350 degrees for 2-3 minutes. Drain. Salt and pepper to taste.

Melt butter and shallots together. Add the rice and cook over low heat until lightly toasted. Add the broth and wine. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer uncovered for 15-18 minutes or until the liquid is almost evaporated. Add the parsely and season with salt and pepper. Remove from the heat. Stir in the parmesan cheese and serve.

Rinse lentils. Add butter to a medium pot over medium-high heat. Add lentils and water to the pot. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Cover and cook for 45 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Add beef bouillon cubes and stir. Remove from heat. Add cooked peppers and onion. Season to taste. Serve.

In a 9"x13" pan combine 2 packages of Ritz cracker crumbs and margarine. Press into pan. Bake at 350 degrees 7-8 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool. In a small bowl combine soup and margarine. Spread on top of the cracker layer. Cut the fish into small pieces and spread evenly on top. Return to oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Serve with rice and a vegetable.

Mix pumpkin and egg well. Combine with rest of ingredients except lemon slice and cinnamon. Drop from spoon into hot oil. Fry until golden. Drain on paper towels. Cool completely. Sprinkle with cinnamon and lemon slice.

Place apples in an 8-in baking panset aside. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heatstir in the sugar until the mixture is blended and smooth. Combine the flour and salt in a small bowlstir into the saucepan until the mixture is thickened and smooth. Spread the mixture evenly over the applessprinkle with the walnuts. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until the mixture is bubbly. Remove from the ovenstir in the maple syrup. Serve warm with the maple & brown sugar instant oatmeal.
Cook the bacon and drain well. In a food processor or blender, combine the cheese, mayonnaise, pimentos, sugar, salt, pepper and the cooked bacon until smooth. Serve with favorite crackers or breads.

In the bread machine pan place the warm water and the honey and stir in the butter until it is dissolved. Add the white and the whole wheat flours, the milk powder and the salt. Add the yeast and stir. Add the sunflower seeds and raisins and then pour in the water and stir. Select the basic dough cycle and begin. Bake according to the manufacturers directions.

Beat egg with milk. Stir in flour, soda and paprika. Heat butter in skillet until melted. Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture then in paprika and sesame mixture. Brown in melted butter. Turn and brown other side.

Cut hard rolls into 1/2 lengthwise. Fry bacon to crisp then remove from pan reserving drippings. Sauté onion with bacon drippings until tender. Combine milk with parsley flakes. In a bowl, beat together the eggs and milk mixture until frothy. Spread with half of bacon on half of rolls. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Top with remaining bacon. Top with remaining half of hard rolls, pressing down to form a sandwich. In same pan fry sandwiches until lightly browned on each side.
Bring first 5 ingredients to a boil. Cook for one minute. Remove from heat. Add remaining ingredients. Mix thoroughly. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Allow to cool.

In a 5-6 quart slow cooker (or dutch oven), place the corned beef, cooking onion, bay leaf, whole cloves and black peppercorns. Add enough cold water to cover the brisket by at least 1 inch. Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours, until the corned beef is fork tender. Remove the brisket and place it in a shallow dish. Pour off the cooking liquid into a medium saucepanremove and discard the bay leaf and whole cloves and then skim off and discard the fat. Pour the cooking liquid into a small bowl and stir in the yellow mustard and light brown sugar until the mixture is smooth. Pour the mixture over the corned beef and serve with sliced raw onions.

Brown chops in bacon grease. Cut potatoes and onions into 1 inch cubes and put into the bottom of a casserole dish. Layer the chops over the top. Pour the chop grease over all. Add just enough water to cover the top. Bake for 1 1/2 hours. Serves 4

Preheat oven to 375f. Mix peaches with sugar, cornstarch, water and cinnamon. Put in baking dish. Mix dry ingredients. Add margarine. Add soymilk. Drop by spoonfuls on top of peaches. Bake for 30 minutes or until top is golden brown.

In a large bowl, beat eggs and honey until well blended. Stir in milk and flourstir in coconut. Melt butter in 9-inch pie plate in 375 degree oven for 5 minutesstir in coconut mixture. Bake 25 minutes or until center is set. Cool slightlyrefrigerate until chilled.

Cook the peas in water to cover. Drain the peas but reserve the cooking liquid. In a bowl combine the pimentos, onion, vinegar, sugar and oil. Season the dressing with the red-pepper flakes, salt and some of the cooking liquid. Combine the dressing with the peas and chill. Serve cold or at room temperature. Garnish with the pimiento-and-onion mixture. Makes 4 servings.

Peel and slice the zucchini and saute in the butter until tender. Season with the salt and the pepper. Remove from the heat and stir in the bread cubes. Add the egg and the cheddar cheese. Put in an unbaked pie crust. Bake for 20 minutes.

Mix soy sauce, butter, curry powder, ground ginger, ground cinnamon and garlic in a small bowl. Set aside. Sprinkle the broiler chicken with the tabasco sauce. Lay the chicken in the baking dish. Sprinkle the chicken with the soy sauce mixture. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes or until done.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Cut in the cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Mix together half-and-half and sour creamstir into the flour mixture. Knead dough until it comes together, adding more flour if necessary to make a soft dough. Roll dough out on a floured surface to 1/2 inch thickness. Sprinkle orange zest on top of dough, then add huckleberries. Cut into 3-inch roundsplace 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 12-15 minutes until golden brown on top and bottom.

Preheat oven to 400F. Dust scallops with seasoned breadcrumbs. In small bowl, combine butter with pepper, paprika and parsley. Place scallops in baking pan and spoon mixture on top of each. Bake 4 minutes. Spoon lemon juice over the top. Broil 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain well. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat. Add ginger and red pepper flakes and cook for about 30 seconds or until ginger is fragrant. Add turmeric and cook for another 30 seconds. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add spinach leaves in batches. Sprinkle each batch of spinach with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt to the skillet. Cook until spinach is wilted and has cooked down. Remove from heat. Stir in cilantro. Mash potatoes with a fork or a potato masher until creamy. Add in yogurt and remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste.

Place the whole chicken in the bottom of a large pot and add the onion and carrots. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for approximately one hour. Take the chicken out of the broth and pull the meat from the bones. Discard the bones and set the meat aside. Skim the fat from the top of the broth and then bring it back up to a simmer. Cook the egg noodles in the broth for approximately ten minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve the hot broth with the cooked chicken and the egg noodles.

In a large mixing bowl whisk the half-and-half with the egg, sugar, vanilla extract and spices. Set aside. Slice the bread into 1/2 inch slices. Heat 1 tablespoon of butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Dip the bread slices into the egg mixture and place in the hot skillet. Cook 3 minutes on one side and 2 minutes on the other or until the egg is set and the bread is golden brown. Serve with syrup.

Cook potatoes in a medium saucepan of boiling water over high heat until tender. Drainlet cool. Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook sausage until lightly browned. Add potatoestoss to combine. Remove from heat. Whisk together egg and mustard. Pour egg mixture over potatoes. Cook over medium-low heat until egg is set. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add apples and saute until tender-crisp and lightly brown. Add orange rind and seasonings. Mix well. Add remaining ingredients and heat through. Serve warm.
In a large skillet add broccoli florets, sugar, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame seeds. Cook over high heat until the liquid evaporates. Add the olive oil to the hot pan. Stir-fry until tender.
In a large bowl, toss together the fruit with the honey, vanilla bean seeds, cinnamon, mint, and orange flower water.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs and beat thoroughly. Blend in the flour, baking powder and almond flavoring. Fold in rhubarb. Turn into a well-greased 8 inch square pan. Bake at 350 for 35 to 40 minutes or until done. Cool and cut into squares. Makes 8 to 10 squares.

Grease a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. In a large bowl combine the brown sugar, vanilla, oats and peanut butter. Cream the butter and brown sugar until light. Add the vanilla. Add the dry ingredients and stir until thoroughly blended. Press into the baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Spread the chocolate-covered raisins over the top of the crust. Bake for 10 minutes longer or until the crust is crisp and the raisins are melted. Cool before cutting into bars.

Cream butter until creamy and add brown sugar and salt. Beat until light. Add light corn syrup, sweetened condensed milk, vanilla and beat until light. Bake in greased pan at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on rack. Cut into squares.
Place cucumber in a colander to drain. Chop cucumber and add to mayonnaise and sour cream. Add white pepper and fresh dill. Chill for 2 hours. Serve with crackers.

Place brisket in crockpot with water. Add pickling spices and peppercorns. Cook on low for 10 hours. Add more water if necessary. After 10 hours, remove brisket from crockpot. Set aside. Place cabbage in crockpot. Add water to cover. Cook on high for 20 minutes or until tender. Slice brisket and serve with cooked cabbage.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook gnocchi according to package directions. Drain. Heat butter in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and cook 1 minute. Add zucchini and cook 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes. Season to taste with nutmeg, salt and pepper. Divide gnocchi among plates. Top with sauce, cheese and basil.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 12-cup bundt pan or two regular loaf pans with cooking spray. Combine brown sugar and pecans in a small bowl. Heat maple syrup in a small saucepan over low heat until it boils. Cut each biscuit into quarters and arrange in the prepared pan. Drizzle with the syrup and sprinkle with the pecan mixture. Bake for 30 minutes in the bundt or about 40 minutes in the loaf pans or until golden brown and the syrup is bubbly and syrup is bubbly and the topping is lightly browned. Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pans to cool completely on wire racks.

In large bowl combine first 5 ingredients. Beat until moistened. Beat 2 minutes on medium speed. Pour into greased and floured 10-inch tube pan. Bake 325 degrees f for 40-45 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan to wire rack. Cool completely,. Invert onto wire rack over wax paper. Remove wax papercool completely. Cut into squares to serve.

Place a large skillet over medium heat. Add oil and chicken. Cook until browned. Add curry paste and cook for 1 minute. Stir in carrot, onion and sweet chili. Cook for 1 minute more. Remove from heat and stir in cream cheese until well combined. Spoon chicken mixture into a pastry bag with a 1/2 inch tip. Cut puff pastry sheets into 6-inch squares. Place a square of pastry on a baking sheet and pipe 1/3 cup chicken mixture in the center. Fold 2 opposite sides over filling and seal. Repeat with remaining puff pastry and filling. Brush tops with egg and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake until golden brown, approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine skim milk, wheat flour, all-purpose flour, eggs, honey & salt in large bowl, whisking to blend well. Add oil & whisk until smooth. Heat a lightly oiled 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Pour about 1/3 cup batter into skillet & swirl to evenly coat bottom of skillet. Cook for 1 minute or until top of crepe is set & bottom is lightly browned. Turn crepe over with spatula & cook for 30 seconds to 1 minute or until top is lightly browned & both sides are golden brown. Remove from skillet & repeat procedure with remaining batter to make 3 more crepes, wiping skillet between each crepe with a paper towel dipped in vegetable oil as needed to prevent sticking. Serve crepes warm or at room temperature with desired toppings.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add corn and cook for 3 minutes. Drain and cool. Add to vegetables. Add butter. Toss in corn and mix well. Season to taste. Serve warm or cold. I like to sprinkle cheddar cheese over the top. This is a great side dish.

In a large bowl, combine the first six ingredients. Add flour, baking powder and saltmix well. Stir in the crunchy peanut butter. Pour batter into a greased 9-in. x 5-in. loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack to cool completely. Spread the jam on the bread while it is still warm. Crumble the remaining peanut butter over the top of the jam. Press the salted peanuts on top of the jam/peanut butter mixture. Cool completely. Cut into 12 slices.

In a bowl combine the first 3 ingredients. Dip each piece of chicken into the mixture on both sides. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 25-30 minutes or until done as you like. Sprinkle with cheese and oregano.

In skillet cook meat and drain. Add onion and garlic. Add cooked pasta and mix well. Stir in sauce and 1 1/2 cups water. Add spinach and cook for 5 minutes more. Pour mixture into 13x9 baking pan. Layer with provolone and parmesan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until browned and bubbly. Serve with salad or garlic bread.

In a pan brown the bell pepper and onion in the butter. Add the cooked sweet potato. Stir in curry powder. Remove from heat. Mash the filling. Wrap with wonton skins. Heat a small amount of canola oil in a pan. Cook wontons until golden brown. Serve with sour cream and mango chutney.

Heat olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute until golden. Remove garlic from skillet and set aside. Add sour orange juice to the skillet along with the remaining spices. Heat through. Add pork butt to the skillet. Cook for 2 to 4 hours or until pork is very tender. Remove pork butt from skillet. Add garlic back to the sauce and cook until thickened. Serve on top of pork. Garnish with sour orange slices.

Cut french bread in half and spread with butter. Spread one side with cream cheese. Top with ham and monterey jack cheese. Beat together eggs and milk. Add wine and green onions to liquid mixture. Pour over bread and ham. Sprinkle with parmesan. Bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes. Let set for 5 minutes before serving. Serves 6-8.

Put in bread machine water, buttermilk, oil, honey. Then put in old fashioned oats, white flour, wheat flour, and salt. Add yeast, baking soda on top. Set to bread machine settings 10 minutes rise 20 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10 minutes rise 10 minutes cook 10

Preheat oven to 375 f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with the butter until evenly coated. Spread the potatoes on the baking sheet in a single layer. Roast the potatoes for 40 to 45 minutes until golden brown. In a small bowl, whisk the maple syrup and the salt until evenly incorporated. Drizzle the maple syrup over the hot potatoes. Serve the potatoes hot.

Place chicken in a ziplock bag. Add the other two ingredients and seal the bag. Make sure the bag is sealed well as this is what keeps the liquid from leaking out. Marinate overnight. In a skillet heat up a little bit of vegetable oil and brown the chicken. Take the chicken out of the pan and pour out the liquid from the bag. Sprinkle the cornflakes on the bottom of the pan and put the chicken back into the pan. Let cook until the chicken is done. Serve over rice or pasta with the leftover sauce.

Place tomato sauce in bottom of prepared pan. Cover with diced tomatoes and mozzarella cheese. Arrange slices of marinated artichokes over cheese. Scatter chestnut mushrooms and sliced black olives over top. Bake for 15-20 minutes.

In a 10-inch skillet coated with cooking spray, cook ham over medium heat until no longer pinkstir in bell peppers and onioncook 2 minutes. Beat together the eggs and milkstir into vegetable mixture. Sprinkle with cheesecover and cook for 10 minutes or until set. Cut into wedges to serve.

Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain well, and transfer to a large bowl. Meanwhile, trim the broccoli stems and chop the flowers into small florets. Heat the 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook, stirring frequently, for 1 minute. Add the broccoli and cook, stirring frequently for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the broccoli is bright green and crisp-tender. Transfer the broccoli mixture to the bowl with the pasta and add the chili flakes and lemon juicetoss well. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil in the skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pesto and cook for 1 minute, or until the pesto is warm and fragrant. Add to the pasta mixture and toss well. Sprinkle with the parmesan and serve immediately.

Peel and slice eggplants about 1/4 inch thick. Combine eggs and water in a shallow dish. Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat until hot, about 375 degrees f. Combine flour and bread crumbs in a shallow dish. Dip the eggplants in the eggs and then in the flour and bread crumb mixture, pressing the mixture firmly into the eggplants. Place in skillet and fry until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and set aside. Saute tomatoes and garlic in the oil in the skillet until tender. Add mozzarella and sprinkle with parsley. Serve the eggplants on the top of the sauce.

Let the butter soften to room temperature. Beat in other ingredients. Pack butter into molds or crocks or form balls with a melon baller. Chill for at least 3 hours before serving. Can be stored for upto 1 month in the refrigerator or 3 months in the freezer.

Melt butter in sauce pan. Stir in corn syrup and brown sugar. Stir over medium heat until mixture boils. Boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add vanilla and baking soda. Pour over popcorn. Stir to coat well. Spread on waxed paper. Let stand overnight to dry. Store in airtight container.

Brown sausage. Add onions and bell peppers and cook 5-10 minutes till onions are tender. Add tiny new potatoes and cook uncovered for 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender crisp and the liquid is evaporated. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Cut schnitzels into long thin strips. Alternate strips of bacon and schnitzels on skewers and secure them with cocktail sticks. Grill over a barbecue or under the grill for about 3 minutes on each side until the bacon is crisp and the schnitzels are browned. Serve with slices of lemon or lime to squeeze over the meat.

Cut the scallops in half horizontally if they are large. Dip the scallops in flour and shake off the excess. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat until foamy. Add the scallops to the skillet and saute until lightly browned about 1 minute per side. Add the chicken broth, thyme, and crackers and bring to a simmer. Cover the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes or until the scallops are tender.

Heat oil in a large pot. Add the onions and saut for 5 minutes. Add the ground meat and garlic. Cook over medium heat until the meat is browned and no longer pink. Add the paprika, cumin and crushed tomatoes. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the red kidney beans and simmer for 10 minutes more. Serve hot with sour cream and parsley.

Place bread flour, whole wheat flour and semolina flour into large bowl of electric mixer. Dissolve yeast into warm water. Stir in 2 tablespoons of butter and honey until dissolved and creamy. With dough hook attached to mixer, gradually add liquid mixture to flour mixture. Beat at low speed 1 minute. Beat at medium speed 4 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. Turn dough onto lightly oiled surface and knead until smooth and elastic about 6 minutes. Place dough in lightly oiled bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise 1 hour or until doubled. Punch down dough and shape into loaves. Place loaves into lightly oiled bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise 30 minutes or until doubled. Preheat oven to 375 F. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely before slicing. Makes 4 loaves.

In a large bowl combine the cocoa and stevia. Stir in the cornstarch. Add the salt. Add the milk and vanilla. Stir until thick and smooth. Spoon into pie shell. Chill until serving. Top with whipped cream.
Chop the veggies. Combine the veggies in a bowl. Drizzle with oil and vinegar. Add olives. Season to taste with salt & pepper. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease muffin cups or line with paper liners. Sift together dry ingredients in a large bowl. In another bowl, combine milk, egg, and vanilla. Add to dry ingredients and stir until just moistened. Fold in cereal. Spoon into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pans for 5 minutes. Turn out onto wire racks to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.
Cream oleo and sugar. Add flour, vinegar, and soda. Roll into balls and flatten with fork. Bake 10 mins at 350 degrees.

In a small bowl combine all sauce ingredients and set aside. Combine honey and lime juice and set aside. Drizzle fish with a bit of oil and season with a pinch of sea salt. Grill or broil for 5 minutes on each side or until opaque and flaky. To serve place 3 slices of fish in center of plate and top with a few spoons of sauce. Add a dollop of rice and a wedge of lemon.

To make the rub, combine the first 7 ingredients and sprinkle over the ribs and refrigerate overnight or at least 4 hours. Soak wood chips in water for at least 2 hours or until soft and pliable. When ready to smoke the ribs, drain the wood chips and arrange in a wood chip tray in the smoker. Preheat the smoker to 275f. Wrap the ribs in heavy duty aluminum foil and cook until the ribs are tender and the meat pulls easily from the bone, about 3 hours. Remove the ribs from the smoker and remove the aluminum foil wrap. Brush the ribs with the barbecue sauce and return to the smoker for another 30 minutes for glazing. Serve the ribs warm with the barbecue sauce on the side for dipping. Makes 4 servings.
Whisk together the vinegar, honey, oil, salt and pepper. Add the radicchio and endive. Toss to coat. Allow to stand for at least 30 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan melt the butter with the light corn syrup and the vanilla extract over medium heat. Add the krispies and mix well. Press into an ungreased 15x10x1 inch baking pan. Cool to room temperature. Cut into squares and store in an airtight container.

Cut 1/2-inch-long stick from each stick. Cut sticks into 4-inch lengths. Insert sticks into apple centers. Place in a saucepan of water. Cook 10 minutes. Drain. Heat caramels in a medium saucepan over low heat, stirring frequently, until smooth. Dip caramel-coated apples in white chocolate. Press Oreos on top. Refrigerate.

In a bowl, combine first six ingredients. Form into balls. Roll in granola or coconut. Place on wax paper. Store in refrigerator. May sub almond milk for milk for dairy-free version. May sub agave nectar for honey for vegan version. May sub sunflower seed butter or almond butter for peanut butter.

Place eggs in a large pot and cover with water. Add a small amount of salt and bring to the boil over high heat. Once boiling, lower the heat to medium and continue to boil for 10 minutes. Drain the eggs and run cold water over them. Then rub them with the black tea leaves. Bring the remaining liquid to the boil and add the black soy sauce, sugar and tangerine zest. Then add the eggs to the liquid and bring to the boil again. Once boiling turn off the heat and let the eggs steep for 15 minutes. Strain the liquid from the eggs and place the eggs into the liquid to cool. Store in the fridge.

Preheat oven to 170°C/325°F/gas mark 3. Lightly grease 12 muffin holes. Sift dry ingredients together. Add golden syrup. Beat egg slightly. Add melted butter. Stir in dates. Fold in dry ingredients. Spoon mixture into holes. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until firm. Turn out and cool on rack.

Break vermicelli into 1 inch pieces. Melt butter in medium saucepan. Add vermicelli and stir until lightly browned. Add rice and chicken stock and stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook over low heat 20 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Enjoy.
Beat whites with vanilla and cream of tartar. Add brown sugar and beat until stiff. Sift together the dry ingredients. Fold dry ingredients into the whites in three batches. Bake as directed.
Brown the ground beef and drain. Mix the flour and seasonings. Gradually add the milk and water while stirring. Add the dried beef. Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes.

Cook potatoes in boiling water for about 20 minutes or until done. Drain in colander and place in greased casserole dish. Cook the onion in butter for about 3 minutes in medium skillet. Stir in the fresh mushrooms and continue to cook for about 5 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Stir in the sour cream, season to taste with salt and pepper. Spread the mushroom mixture over the potatoes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for about 15 minutes or until the cheese is lightly browned and the dish is heated through. Serves 6.

Prepare cake batter as directed on box but add 1 cup of eggnog and 1/4 cup of rum. Beat well and add almonds and spice. Bake in a greased bundt pan at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes or until done. Cool 10 minutes then turn out and cool completely before glazing. Beat 1/4 cup of eggnog and 1/2 cup of powdered sugar for a smooth glaze and spread over top of cake. Sprinkle with nuts if desired.

Cut the velveeta into slices about 1/4 inch thick. Spread a very thin layer of mayonnaise on each slice. Sprinkle with horseradish and hot sauce to taste. Roll up in slices of cooked bacon and secure with a toothpick. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 3 hours.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Toss carrots with olive oil in a large bowl. Sprinkle with smoked paprika, kosher salt, brown sugar, cumin, and molasses. Place on a baking sheet, cut side down. Roast 35 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven, turning once, until carrots are crisp-tender and lightly browned. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with vinegar and additional ground cumin and black pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve hot or warm.

Beat together cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add extract and continue beating until fluffy. Add heavy cream and beat until smooth and fluffy. Add a few drops of red food coloring until desired color is achieved. Fold in sliced berries. Spoon into tart shells and place in refrigerator until set. Serve and enjoy!
Saut butter, onion, and celery together. Add water and cook until potatoes are tender. Mash until smooth. Add flour and blend. Add salt and spinach. Blend. Add milk and cheese. Heat and serve.

In a large bowl, combine the flours, salt, baking soda and powder. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine the eggs and buttermilk and beat until well blended. In a small bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until smooth and creamy and then beat into the egg mixture until well-combined and lighter in color. Stir the wet into the dry until just combined. Heat a waffle iron until very hot and spray with non-stick spray. Place 1/4 cup of batter in the center of the hot iron and close the lid and let cook for about 3 minutes or until the waffle is golden brown and crisp on the outside and cooked through on the inside. Makes about 3 4-inch squares or 3 3-inch squares.

Boil water in a large saucepan for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vegetables and cook 2 more minutes or until tender-crisp. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles according to the package directions. Drain the noodles and stir them into the vegetable mixture. Add eggs and stir well. Serve hot.
Mix all the ingredients except fresh cream and serve in a tall glass with ice. Top with fresh cream and a dash of cinnamon.

Pour cold water into a medium bowladd cornstarch and mix with a wire whisk until smooth. Add the balsamic vinegar and mix thoroughly. Stir in the salt, sugar, egg, prepared mustard, and unsalted butter until smooth. This is your famous sauce. Serve immediately or refrigerate for later use. Serves 4-6.
Put cocoa and sugar into a blender. Add warm water and blend until smooth. Add milk and blend until smooth. Add chocolate and blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.

Cut livers into slices and cut each slice into two strips. Sprinkle both sides with flour. Heat olive oil over medium heat, add sliced onion and saute until lightly browned. Add strips of liver and cook until brown. Add mushrooms and cook until tender, then add the dry red wine and the spices. Stir to dissolve spices and reduce the liquid by half. Add the livers and cook until heated through. Serve over rice or noodles.

In large bowl combine poundcake mix, eggnog, nutmeg & cinnamon. Beat until smooth. Divide batter among 2 greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pans. Bake at 350 for 40 to 45 minutes. Cool 5 minutes. Remove from pans to cooling rack. Drizzle with rum. Makes 2 loaves.

Combine blueberries, strawberries, sugar, butter and water. Mix well. Combine dry ingredients. Spread half of fruit mixture into a 13x9 pan. Sprinkle dry mixture on top. Spread remaining fruit mixture on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until fruit juices bubble. Serve with a dollop of light whipped topping.
Cook pasta to al dente in boiling water. Drain. In a large frying pan or pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add pasta, tomatoes and water. Toss. Serve immediately. Add salt to your liking.
In a large bowl, combine the carrots, pineapple, orange and apple. Toss gently. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over the fruit and toss again. Serve chilled.

Mix mayonnaise, cheese, diced pimiento, and bacon in small bowl until blended. Spread mixture on bread. Cook in skillet over medium-high heat 3 minutes or until hot and melty. Flip and cook 3 minutes more or until bread is browned and cheese is melted. Makes 2 servings (2 sandwiches).

Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add bananas and egg beating well after each addition. Add vanilla and yoghurt and stir well to combine. Combine dry ingredients, sifting into the bowl. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9x5 loaf tin. Bake 60 to 70 minutes at 350 degrees until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes then remove from pan to cool completely on a wire rack.

Bring water to boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in tea and mint until thoroughly blended. Refrigerate at least one hour or overnight. Serve over ice in tall glasses. Stir in lemon juice to taste. Garnish each glass with a mint sprig.

Cook ground turkey until brown. Drain excess fat and return to pot. In a separate bowl, combine soup mixes and add to ground turkey mixture. Heat through. Spread tater tots evenly on bottom of casserole dish. Pour ground turkey mixture over tater tots. Sprinkle cheese on top of ground turkey mixture. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until cheese is melted.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and let cool slightly. Mash potatoes and combine with remaining ingredients. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Slice and core apples. Combine filling ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Spoon into crust. Dot with margarine drops. Bake at 350 for 50-60 minutes or until apples are tender. Cool for 20 minutes before serving.
Combine soymilk, egg white, honey, vanilla and spices in a blender or food processor. Process until smooth and frothy. Pour into glasses or mugs. Garnish with nutmeg if desired.

Heat oil in wok or large skillet over high heat. Add chicken and stir fry 2 minutes. Add pineapple and cook until heated through. Add lime juice and crushed red pepper flakes. Toss well. Add green onions and ginger. Toss. Serve at once.

Prepare 1 box of chocolate instant pudding mix as directed on the box. Cool completely. Beat 1 box of dream whip as directed on box. Fold in 1 container of COOL WHIP. Place pudding filling into prepared graham cracker pie crust and spread evenly over the bottom of the pie shell. Top the pudding layer with the COOL WHIP mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/gas mark 4. Peel and finely slice the onions. Wash the Savoy cabbage and cut the stalk out so that it lies flat. Dice the Savoy cabbage and toss with the finely sliced red onions and 2 tsp of water. Place the Savoy cabbage in an ovenproof dish and cover with foil. Bake for 5 minutes or until tender, stirring half way through cooking time. Heat the butter and oil in a wok until hot. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds, stirring frequently. Add the pork and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until cooked through. Stir in the Chinese five spice powder and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add the Savoy cabbage and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until piping hot and lightly coated with the sauce. Serve immediately sprinkled with spring onions and the remaining 2 tsp of water.

Rinse an old-fashioned glass with herbsaint (an anise-flavored liqueur) to coat the glass. Discard excess liquid. In a cocktail shaker, muddle the rye whiskey, sugar and bitters until dissolved. Add ice. Cover and shake until chilled. Strain into glass and garnish with a lemon peel.

Combine wild rice, onion, celery and mushrooms in saucepan. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer covered for 40 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add sausage. Heat through. In saucepan over low heat, combine milk and flour. Cook and stir until thick and bubbly. Stir in buttered bread crumbs. Spoon over rice and sausage. Garnish with worcestershire sauce.

Preheat oven to 350. Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, saute the vegetables in butter until tender. Stir in the soup, milk and seasonings. Add the tuna and mushrooms. Stir in the pasta and sprinkle with the pimento. Transfer to a greased 2-qt. Baking dish. Bake 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

Shell prawns and set aside. Cut red, yellow and green bell peppers into strips. Place bell peppers in a glass dish. In a bowl, combine lemon juice, olive oil, basil, rosemary, peppercorns and salt. Pour mixture over bell peppers. Place bell peppers on grill to heat through. Add prawns to the bowl of lemon juice mixture, cover and marinate for 15 minutes. Thread prawns onto skewers. Grill prawns for about 5-7 minutes or until firm and pink. Serve with grilled bell peppers.

Cook noodles according to package directions and drain well. In a saucepan over medium heat add butter and pot cheese. Stir until melted and smooth. Add the drained noodles and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper if desired. Serve warm or chilled.
Place water, rice and salt in saucepan. Bring to boil and cook for 15 minutes. Add butter and sugar.

In large frying pan over medium heat cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside. Cook onion and green pepper in bacon fat until tender, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle sugar over onion and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in remaining ingredients except bacon and tomatoes. Simmer covered for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and bacon. Simmer covered for 10 minutes more or until tomatoes are tender. Serve over hot cooked rice, garnished with green onion springs and bacon strips.

Drain hash browns and place in 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Mix sour cream and soup together in large bowl. Stir in cheese and butter until well blended. Spread over hash browns and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until thoroughly heated through and bubbly. Sprinkle with chopped parsley before serving.

Beat eggs and water with a mixer until frothy. Stir in cake mix. Press into 10-inch round pans sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until done. Cool. Melt 1 cup butter and peanut butter together. Drizzle over cooled cakes. Top with toffee pieces and chocolate chips. Melt 1/2 cup butter for frosting. Spread over cooled cakes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Soak the garbanzos overnight. In a large pot, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and the onions. Saute for 2-3 minutes. Add the rosemary and the bay leaf. Add the chorizo. Brown the garbanzos for 3 minutes. Add the tomato sauce, the chorizo liquid from the canned chorizo, the garbanzos, the water, the salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 45-50 minutes. Add the spinach. Cook for 3 minutes. Serve in bowls.

Slice zucchini into 1/8 inch slices and saute with onion and garlic until golden. Add fresh tomatoes and 1 tsp. of tomato paste. Add herbs and seasoning. Add water and simmer until sauce is thick. Cook pasta according to package. Add zucchini mixture to pasta and toss to blend. Serve immediately.

Bring 2 quarts water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook chicken in skillet over medium heat 10 min. or until browned. Drain and return to skillet. Add soup, milk and 1/4 tsp. pepper. Bring to a boil. Stir in broccoli and pasta. Toss until heated through. Serves 4.

Slice chicken breasts into 1/2 inch medallions. Melt butter in a skillet and saute onions in butter until tender. Combine seasoned breadcrumbs with cheese and dried bay leaves. Place onion and breadcrumb mixture in a large plastic bag. Add medallions and toss to coat. Remove chicken from bag and arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until done. Serve with pasta.

Slice and cook onions in 2 Tbsp. olive oil until soft. Lay slices on bottom of crock. Add 2 Tbsp. olive oil. Mix sour cream with soup and pour over onions. Add 1 1/4 cups water and baking potatoes. Place chops on top. Cover and bake 4 to 6 hours on low. Stir and let stand 10 minutes.

Combine sugar, milk, butter & 1/4 cup hot water. Add remaining 2 cups cold water. Boil for 5 minutes. Cut off kernels from each ear of corn & add to syrup mixture. Return to boiling point & cook until thickened slightly. Spoon into 9" x 13" greased baking dish & spread evenly. Sprinkle with almonds. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until hot & bubbly. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan, saute the onion, garlic, red bell peppers, zucchini, summer squash and lima beans in the butter over moderate heat, stirring occasionally for 4 to 5 minutes. Add lima beans. Cook for 1 minute. Add the corn kernels. Cook for 1 minute. Add the sage. Stir to combine. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
Boil red potatoes until tender. Mash them with butter, garlic, dried chives, salt and pepper.
Place all in crock pot except the rice. Cook for 6 hours on low, serve over the rice.

In a large skillet, saute onion in the oil until tender. Add the marjoram, rosemary, turmeric and a little salt. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the rice and the orzo. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the water. Bring to a boil. Cover the skillet and cook over low heat until the rice is tender.

Cut chicken into small pieces. Combine chicken with dressing, prosciutto, pepper, spring greens and parmesan cheese in a bowl. Spread pesto sauce on each roll. Top with chicken mixture and sprinkle with more parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Add the sugar, cocoa, and flour to the mug. Stir well. Add the milk and the egg. Add the oil. Stir well and microwave for about 90 seconds. The cake may rise above the rim of the mug. The cake is done when a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

Cream together the butter, sugar and eggs until light and fluffy. In a seperate bowl combine the flour with the baking soda. Stir the flour mixture into the creamed mixture. Shape into small balls and roll in chopped walnuts. Place on a greased cookie sheet, press a thumb print into the center and fill with strawberry jam. Bake at 350F for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

Cook rice as directed on package. Cool. Add tuna, pimento, onion and pepper to rice mixture. Stir well. Spoon into a lightly greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Blend soup and mayonnaise. Pour over top. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Combine breadcrumbs in a bowl. Add milk and stir until the mixture is soft but not soupy. In a large bowl combine the remaining ingredients except the mozzarella cheese. Gently knead the mixture until smooth. Shape into 3/4-inch balls. Press a small piece of mozzarella cheese into the center of each. Cover, refrigerate until ready to cook. In a large skillet heat 2 inches of oil to 375 degrees F. Add the meatballs in batches and fry for about 3 to 4 minutes until golden brown. Drain and serve hot.

Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside. Prepare the skewers by soaking them in water for 30 minutes. Preheat grill to 350 degrees. Drain the skewers and thread each with the meat mixture. Place the skewers on the grill and turn often until browned and the meat is no longer pink in the center. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl, cream the margarine and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla and egg and beat until light and fluffy. Combine the flour, cocoa and baking powder in a small bowl and sift together. Add the sifted mixture and mix well. Stir in the salt and chocolate chips. Spread the mixture evenly in a deep-dish pie plate or a 10 inch round pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack for 1 hour. Serve with vanilla ice cream if desired.

Heat peaches with sugar, cinnamon and water to boilingstirring constantly until thickened. Chill until cool enough to serve over vanilla ice cream. To serve, spoon peaches over a dish of ice cream and add a few drops of rum or a splash of lemon juice to each serving.

Place water in a small bowl. Heat in the microwave for 1 minute. Add tea bags and let steep for 1 minute. Add apple cider and let cool to room temperature. Add orange juice and cranberry juice. Stir in sugar and orange slices. Cut out the center of the oranges to make room for the cloves and cinnamon sticks. Thread the cloves and cinnamon sticks onto the sliced oranges. Place the red-hot candies on top. Serve in chilled glasses.

Heat water to boiling in large saucepan. Stir in rice mixture. Coverreduce heat. Cook 20-22 minutes or until rice is tender. Meanwhile, in small saucepan, heat butter until melted. Stir in marmaladeheat through. Remove from heat. Drain snow peascut crosswise into thin slices. Drain water chestnutscut into thin slices. Combine rice mixture with snow peas, water chestnuts, marmalade mixture and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Melt cottage cheese in skillet with italian seasoning. Add zucchini and cook until tender-crisp, about 7 minutes. Stir in tomato. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Serve pasta on top of zucchini mixture.

Cut the potatoes in cubes and place in the bottom of the crockpot. Cut the celery, carrots and onions and place in the bottom of the crockpot. Cut the garlic and place in the bottom of the crockpot. Season the ground beef with the garlic salt and salt and pepper. Brown the beef and drain off any fat and place the browned beef in the bottom of the crockpot. Add the can of soup and 1 can of water to the beef. Add the carrots, celery and onions to the top of the beef and water mixture. Add the frozen peas to the top of the carrots and celery and onions and place the lid on the crockpot and put on high for 5 hours or until the meat is tender. Serve the hamburger mixture over the mashed potatoes and enjoy!

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cut the lemons in half. Place a 1/2 cup of water in a 2-quart baking dishplace the fish in the baking dish in the middle of the dish. Place a lemon half on each side of the fish. Squeeze the lemons over the fish. Season with butter, pepper and salt. Bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork (10 to 12 minutes). Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray 9×13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Place tater tots in pan and bake for 12 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven- let cool. Crumble tots. Combine ground beef, taco seasoning and water in large skillet over medium heat. Cook until done- stirring occasionally. Drain off excess grease. Add tater tots- stir well. To serve- place crumbled tots in individual serving bowls- top with meat mixture then add desired toppings of your choice.

Cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, brown beef in a skillet. In a bowl, mix the egg and milk together. Add beef to egg mixture. Add tomato sauce to the skillet. Add the onion and green pepper to the skillet. Stir in the mushrooms. In a separate bowl mix together the pasta and beef mixture. Add the pasta and beef mixture to a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Cover with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Melt dark chocolate with syrup and butter in a heatproof bowl set over a pot of simmering water (make sure the bottom of the bowl doesn t touch the water). Stir until combined, then stir in puffed rice cereal. Drop by teaspoonsful onto parchment paper to set. Makes about 36 crackles

Boil eggs for 10-12 minutes. Remove from boiling water immediately, run under cold water and crack shells on both ends to ease removal of shell. Remove shells and rinse well under cold water. Cut eggs in half and remove yolks. Place yolks in a medium bowl and mash with a fork until creamy. Add the remaining ingredients except eggs, mix well and refrigerate until ready to use. Place each half egg on a toothpick. Fill egg whites with red beet yolk mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Cook the pasta in plenty of boiling water for about ten minutes. Drain well and add the olive oil. Stir through the cooked pasta. Cut the avocados into chunks. Squeeze the lemon juice over the avocados. Season with salt and pepper. Add the cream to the pasta mixture. Divide the mixture among four serving dishes, then top with a little shredded parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saut until fragrant (about 1 minute). Add water, crushed tomatoes, bouillon cubes, sage, shells and frozen chopped spinach. Stir to combine. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the pasta is tender and the flavors have combined. Add the beans to the pot and continue to cook for 10 minutes more or until heated through. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and serve with warm bread.

Prepare a broiling pan by putting it on a rack on a cookie sheet. Dip the chicken in the lemon-rosemary marinade. Spread the marinade on the broiling pan and place the chicken on the marinade. Broil the chicken for 10 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Serve with the vegetables.

Heat oil in skillet. Add onion and saute until transparent. Add pepper. Stir in garlic and cook until tender. Add salt and herbs. Place mixture into 2 1/2 quart baking dish. Layer eggplant over vegetables. Top with sour cream. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes.

Combine the first five ingredients. Add the vanilla and egg mixture. Sift together the dry ingredients and add to the liquid mixture. Add the apples and mix well. Bake in a 9 by 13 inch pan at 350 for one hour or until done.

Sift together the all-purpose flour, whole-wheat flour, salt, and baking powder. In a large mixing bowl cream together the butter and sugar until light. Beat in the eggs one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract. Beat in the mashed bananas. Sift the dry ingredients over the mixture and stir just until they are incorporated. Fold in the chocolate chips. Grease a loaf pan with cooking spray or butter. Spread the batter evenly in the pan and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 60 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing the bread from the pan.

Heat oil in pan. Add ground beef and cook until browned. Add onion and garlic. Drain fat. Stir in soup, milk, ketchup, salt and pepper. Pour into 1-quart casserole. Top with refrigerated biscuits. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until biscuits are lightly browned.

Mix together cream cheese, sugar and vanilla. Add beaten egg yolk. Unroll the crescent roll dough and separate into four rectangles. Spread the filling down the centre of each rectangle. Roll up and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

Combine water and sugar in blender containerprocess 1 minute or until sugar is dissolved. Add frozen lemonade, frozen peaches, vodka, lime juice and carbonated lemon-lime beverage. Blend well until smoothpour into two glassesserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 13x9-inch pan with cooking spray. Combine butter and sugars. Beat in egg and vanilla. Stir in bananas. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowlstir into butter mixture. Spread mixture into pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Stir together chips and nuts. Spread over top of bars.

Mix together the frozen corn with the cream and evaporated milk in a saucepan. Add salt and sugar to taste. Heat slowly until warm and thicken with flour and butter mixed together. Add pepper to taste. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Combine all the ingredients except the oil and mix well. Marinate the chicken for several hours or overnight. After the chicken has been marinated, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place the chicken pieces on the skillet and brown on all sides. Remove the pieces from the skillet and pour the marinade into the skillet. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and return the chicken to the skillet. Cook for about 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve.

Defrost spinach and squeeze out excess liquid. Add all remaining ingredients in a food processor and blend until smooth. Divide mixture evenly between 4 ramekins and sprinkle with a little grated cheese if desired. Bake for about 20 minutes or until set in the middle.

Prepare pasta according to package directions. Cook chicken in italian dressing until no longer pink. Remove from sauce. Add potatoes to sauce. Cook until tender. Pour over pasta. Top with chicken and sprinkle with parmesan. Serves 4.

Bring all the sauce ingredients to a boil in a large pot over medium heat. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the wings to the sauce and simmer for another 10 minutes or until the wings are cooked through and the sauce is thick and gooey.

Combine the tomatoes with the feta cheese and olives. Spread the tzatziki on both sides of the naan bread. Place the chicken on one slice. Top with the tomato mixture. Add the other slice on top. Place under the broiler and cook until the bread is toasted. Serve with a side of lettuce and tomato.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Mix mustard, honey-roasted ham, cheese and egg in small bowl. Divide mixture into 12 pieces. Place each piece on a small piece of foil. Brush foil with oil. Fold foil over meat mixture. Bake for 10 minutes or until done. Cool slightly. Unwrap meat mixture. Cut each piece in half. Place on toothpicks. Serve with toothpicks.
Cream together cream cheese, honey, and butter. Beat well. Add lemon rind. Mix to combine. Spread over hot cross buns. Decorate with 2 maraschino cherries. Serve with tea.

Preheat the broiler with the rack 4 inches from heat. Peel and devein 1 pound of jumbo shrimp, reserving the tails. Cut each tail in half lengthwise and set aside. Brush the inside of 2 12-inch-long pieces of aluminum foil with 1 tablespoon of the canola oil and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of the minced fresh cilantro leaves. Divide the reserved tails between 2 pieces of foil. Divide the reserved tails between 2 pieces of foil. Spread 1 teaspoon of the preserves on each piece of foil, then divide the shrimp evenly on top of the preserves. Drizzle each piece of foil with 1/2 teaspoon of the canola oil, then fold over to enclose tightly, sealing the edges with a toothpick or string. Broil until cooked through, about 5 minutes. Squeeze 1/2 of each lime over the foil-wrapped packages, then sprinkle with 2 teaspo

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
