Hard boil eggs and let cool. Peel shells off of eggs and remove yolk from egg whites. Mash yolk with egg whites. Add in the miracle whip and spices until fully mixed. Scoop the filling into egg whites with a spoon or if you are fancy, use a pastry bag. Sprinkle the top with paprika if desired. Chill for at least an hour before serving.

Combine the first 3 ingredients in a bowl, stirring well. Place breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl or plate. Combine 1/2 cup of the soup mixture and the breadcrumbsmix well. Combine the remaining soup mixture and 1/2 cup water in another shallow bowl or platestir well. Dip each chicken breast in the liquid mixture, then in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing to coat. Place in an 11x7-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Uncoverbake 10 to 15 minutes longer or until no longer pink at bone. Sprinkle with cheese if desired. Serve with vegetables if desired.

Cream butter and sugar. Add egg yolks. Sift in flour and baking powder. Add the golden syrup and the ground ginger. Blend well. Drop 30g heaped spoons of the mixture onto greased trays. Bake for about 10 minutes. Cool on trays.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).In a small bowl, mix together the butter and sweet onion.Place pizza crust in a 10 inch cast iron skillet.In a small bowl, mix together the Parmesan and mozzarella cheeses. Spread the butter and onion mixture evenly over the crust. Sprinkle with the cheese blend. Bake in the preheated oven until the edges of the crust are golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Cut tomatoes into wedges. Heat butter and shallot over medium heat until butter melts. Add leeks and tomatoes. Stir occasionally until tomatoes begin to soften. Add asparagus and cook 4 minutes or until crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with pistachios and lemon juice. Add parsley and toss to blend well. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375F. Slice pineapple into 1/4-inch slicesplace on baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes. In small bowl, combine tequila, orange marmalade, brown sugar, butter, vanilla and cinnamon until well blended. Brush pineapple slices with glaze and bake for another 5 minutes or until caramelized. Sprinkle with fresh mint. Serves 4.

Boil tomatoes until tender. Drain & cool slightly. Saute onion in olive oil until soft. Mash tomatoes, add onion & seasonings. Bake in 1 quart casserole in 350 oven for 1/2 hour until bubbly & lightly browned. Sprinkle with cheese & bake 5 more minutes until melted. Bake 10 minutes more until lightly browned. Sprinkle with bread crumbs & bake 2 more minutes until lightly browned. Sprinkle with bacon & serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Spray baking dish with cooking spray. Combine cracker crumbs and cheese. Divide evenly and stuff each vegetable with mixture. In small bowl combine egg and milk. Brush with egg mixture. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from baking dish. Top with dried parsley and freshly ground black pepper.

Mix dry ingredients. Add shortening and rub with your hands until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in milk just until moistened. Turn out onto a floured board, and knead lightly 5 to 10 times. Roll dough 1/2-in thick. Cut with a 2-in round cutter. Place about 1/4-in apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm.

Cut 2 large tomatoes in half lengthwise, add 2 small chopped garlic cloves and a little salt and fresh pepper to each halfplace in a baking dishput the tomatoes in the oven for 20-30 minutes or until the tomatoes begin to softenremove from oven, set aside and allow to coolmeanwhile prepare the fishbrush the salmon with olive oilplace the fish in the oven for 15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a forkremove fish from the oventop each fish with 2 tablespoons of the tomato mixturesprinkle with chopped fresh parsley and 1/2 cup breadcrumbsreturn the fish to the ovenbake for an additional 10 minutesserve over cooked pasta with a glass of white wine and a green vegetable.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugars. Add the egg and vanilla and beat well. Combine the flour, baking soda, cornflakes and chocolate chipsstir into the creamed mixture until well blended. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, add olive oil. When hot, add ground beef. Cook until no longer pink. Add onions and bell pepper. Stir until softened. Add cabbage and garlic powder. Stir until cabbage is tender. Add brown rice and broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer until brown rice is tender. Add Rotel, salt and fresh ground black pepper. Stir.

Cook chow mein noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a 1-1/2 qt. casserole combine soup and noodles. Top with celery, onion, tuna and frozen peas. Sprinkle with cashews. Bake in 350 degree F oven 20 to 25 minutes.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until just shy of al dente. Drain well. Return the pasta to the pot. Add cream. Cook over low heat until the liquid is absorbed and the sauce is thick. Add butter, lemon zest, lemon juice & cheese. Stir until melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, combine nuts and coconut. In a saucepan, combine butter, bananas, and lemon juicecook on low heat until melted. Mix with nut mixture until well blended. Spoon onto waxed paperlet cool. Cut into bite size pieces and place into airtight container. Yield 24 servings

Put crunchy peanut butter and honey in a microwavable bowl. Microwave on high for 1 minute. Stir in chocolate whey protein powder and old-fashioned oatmeal. Press into a 8x8 inch baking dish. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until hard. Cut into 16 squares.

Preheat oven to 350 f. In large bowl mix stuffing and milk until soft dough forms. Add soup, butter and seasonings. Blend well. Spread mixture in 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Lay chicken over stuffing. Bake for 45 minutes. Add green beans and bake 20 minutes longer or until chicken is no longer pink and vegetables are tender.

Beat eggs with water until well blended. Add salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Heat margarine in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add eggs and cook, stirring constantly until eggs are almost set. Reduce heat to low and stir in cheese. Cook for another minute. Add mushrooms and stir until heated through. Remove from heat. Stir in dill and onions. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Combine first 5 ingredients in heavy large pot. Bring to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered 30 minutes. Stir in flour. Cook 2 minutes. Add 1 can tomato soup. Stir to blend. Simmer 25 minutes. Stir in 2 cans tomato soup. Simmer 10 minutes.
In a medium bowl combine the first four ingredients. In a small bowl combine the mint and honey. Pour over fruit. Toss to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until ready to serve.

Mix all the ingredients except the baking soda and vinegar. Add those and beat for 1 minute. Chill the dough for 1 hour. Divide into 1/2 inch balls. Roll in sugar and place 2 inches apart on baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes or until browned. Cool and store in an airtight container.

In a skillet brown the onion and garlic in the oil for about 3 minutes. Add the fish and sprinkle with the spices. Add the tomatoes and their liquid and the water. Cover and simmer for 5-7 minutes. Spoon into a 11/2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle the topping over the top. Bake for 30 minutes.

Combine vermouth and heavy cream in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer until mixture is reduced by about half, about 20 minutes. Whisk in lemon juice and butter and season with salt and pepper. Arrange 4 of the breasts on a serving plate and spoon some of the sauce over them. Repeat with remaining breasts and sauce. Serve immediately. Garnish with lemon wedges.

Mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Spread half of mixture evenly in bottom of pan. Add layer of peanut butter. Spread 2nd half of mixture over peanut butter layer. Place in fridge overnight and cut into 8 individual squares.

Melt butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned. Add brussels sprouts and saute 3 to 4 minutes. Add wine and cook until liquid evaporates. Add broth and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in ginger. Add parmesan cheese and cook until melted.

In a pitcher combine the sugar with the water. Add the rose water. Stir. Pour into tall glasses filled with ice. Add a splash of club soda. Garnish with mint leaves and limes. Sprinkle with red food coloring. Rose petal is optional.

In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder, sugar and saltstir with a whisk. In a small bowl combine egg with melted shorteningstir until well mixed. Add to flour mixturestir until just combined. Stir in buttermilk and waterstir just until blended. Heat a lightly greased griddle or heavy skillet over medium heat until hot. Using 1/4 cup batter for each pancakepour batter onto hot griddle. Turn after bubbles form on top of pancakescook until golden brown on both sides. Serve with warm maple syrup. Makes 5-6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with melted butter. In a large skillet or saucepan, combine apples and dark brown sugar and corn syrup over medium heat. Cook and stir until apples are tender. Remove from heat. Beat eggs and milk in large bowl. Dip slices of bread into egg mixture. Layer half of the bread in bottom of prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with half of apples and half of cinnamon. Continue layering until all of the apples are used up. Top with remaining bread slices. Pour remaining egg mixture over all. Bake in preheated oven 40 minutes.
Mix gin and tonic together in glass. Garnish with a lime wedge. Serve with straws.

In a large skillet over medium heat, add the garlic, basil, crushed red pepper flakes to the hot oil. Stir well. Add the chopped tomatoes. Stir well. Cover. Simmer for 5 minutes. Cook spaghetti in boiling water until al dente. Drain. Add the spaghetti to the tomato mixture. Toss well. Remove from heat. Add the Parmesan cheese. Stir well. Sprinkle the Romano cheese on top. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

Bring the cream cheese to room temperature. Season the fish with salt and pepper. Coat both sides with the cream cheese mixture. Place the fish in a shallow dish and bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees F. Remove from the oven, squeeze the lemon over the fish and sprinkle with parsley and lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season sole with salt and pepper. Mix together black bean garlic sauce and chopped green onions. Spread sole with half of the sauce. Top with the other half of the sauce and the fresh coriander. Place in a shallow baking pan and bake for 15 minutes. Serve with white rice.
Boil potatoes till done in salted water. Mash them well and add the rest of the ingredients. Beat with mixer. Add parsley just before serving. Serve hot.
Combine all marinade ingredients in a large ziploc bag. Add chicken and marinate for at least 1 hour. Grill chicken until no longer pink in the center and serve.

In a large bowl, combine all dressing ingredients. Set aside. In another large bowl combine cabbage and romaine lettuce. Add green onion. Mix well. Pour dressing over lettuce mixture and toss to coat. Sprinkle with pecans. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Cook raspberries in water with sugar until thickened. Strain and add cornstarch to thicken further if necessary. Refrigerate overnight to allow flavors to develop. May be made 2 weeks ahead.

Wash and cut the tomatoes into pieces. Slice the shallot and garlic into thin rounds. Add all to food processor and mix well. Add all remaining ingredients and mix well. Refrigerate and serve with chips or as a condiment.

In a shallow pan, combine brown sugar with 1/4 cup of water and 2 tablespoons of soy sauce. Add 1/2 teaspoon pepper and 2 minced garlic cloves. Heat in microwave until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Remove 1/4 cup of mixture. Add 1 tablespoon of soy sauce and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Pat chicken breasts dry. Dip each chicken breast in remaining mixture. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium heat until hot. Add 2 chicken breasts and brown, turning once. Cook 5 minutes per side. Remove from heat and brush with remaining mixture. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
In a bowl, mix beans, tomatoes, oil, salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Cook cranberries, cinnamon, and allspice in 1/4 cup water in a medium skillet over medium heat until the fruit is soft and the liquid has evaporated, 15 to 20 minutes. Press mixture through a fine sieve to remove seeds and skin. Combine jam and cranberry puree in a medium bowl and stir until smooth. Let cool slightly and stir in lemon rind. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/gas mark 4. Melt butter in saucepan and stir in milk and flour. Bring to boil and stir until mixture thickens. Stir in cheese and seasoning. Let cool. Grease 2 loaf pans. Press mixture into bottom of pans. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes until browned. Melt butter in saucepan. Stir in milk. Bring to boil. Stir in flour. Cook for 1 minute. Add poppy seeds. Pour into mould. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with butter.

In a large bowl, sift together the almond flour, splenda, and baking powder. Cream the butter and then add the splenda mixture. Beat until well mixed. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Form into balls and place on a waxed paper covered cookie sheet. Bake at 350F for 15 minutes or until set.

Saut the leeks and celery in butter in a small saucepan until tender. Drain liquid. Combine the vegetables and bread in a bowl. Add the seasonings. Add the chicken broth and toss well. Let mixture sit for 10 minutes. Heat stuffing in the microwave 30 seconds before serving.

Saute onions and garlic in olive oil. Add meat and brown well. Drain excess fat. Stir in the tomatoes, salt and pepper. Cover and simmer until meat is tender. Serve over cooked pasta and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Prepare double pie crust. In a large bowl, beat the sour cream and egg until well blended. Add sugar and mix well. Add flour and salt and mix well. Fold in berries and nuts. Pour into pastry shell. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool and serve with whipped topping.

Combine evaporated milk, sugar and pineapple juice. Cook over medium heat until mixture reaches soft ball stage. Remove from heat and add the lemon juice. Cool for a few minutes, then add the butter. Stir until mixture thickens and loses its gloss. Add the candied fruit. Pour into a 9 x 13 pan and let cool. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray pie pan with cooking spray. In medium bowl, mix hash browns and cottage cheese. In large bowl, combine eggs, salt and pepper. Add hash brown mixture and hot sauce and blend well. Stir in green onion and paprika. Pour into sprayed pan. Bake 45 minutes or until done. Cool slightly. Garnish with bacon. Serve warm.

Place dates in food processorprocess to make a fine paste. Add the water, lemon juice & sugarprocess to make a smooth paste. Transfer the mixture to a bowl, add the butter & mix to blend. In a separate bowl combine the oats with the baking soda & saltadd to the date mixture & mix well. Spoon into a 9x13-inch greased pan & press down to form an even surface. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with almonds if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a small saucepan combine soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger and garlic powder. Heat and stir until sugar dissolves. Add cayenne. Spread the almonds on a baking sheet and pour the soy sauce mixture over them. Stir to coat and bake for 10 minutes. Cool. Store in an airtight container. Makes 1 cup.

Cut peppers into 1/4-inch strips. Cut onion into 1/4-inch slices. In a large nonstick pan or on a stove-top grill, heat cooking spray over medium heat. Cook beef until browned on all sides. Remove from heat and add peppers and onions. Heat through, stirring often. Stir in lime juice. Serve in tortillas topped with your favorite toppings.

Peel and slice banana and star fruit into 1/2 -inch cubes. Peel and slice mango and kiwi into thin slices. Make sure to remove all seeds. Combine lemon juice and honey in medium bowl. Dip fruit pieces into lemon mixture. Place fruit on wooden skewers. Place on large tray and freeze overnight. Scoop coconut ice cream into bowl and sprinkle with flaked coconut. Serve with fruit kabobs.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add bacon and ham to skillet and cook until crisp. Remove bacon and ham with slotted spoon. Add onion to skillet and cook until softened and lightly browned. Add tomato and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes or until beans are tender. Stir in ham and bacon. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl combine the first 5 ingredients. Add chicken legs and toss well to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a jelly roll pan with cooking spray. Arrange chicken legs on the prepared baking pan and bake for 30 minutes or until the juices run clear when the chicken is pierced with a knife. Serve hot.

Combine condensed milk and peanut butter. Add Bisquick to milk mixturestir just until blended. Stir in chips. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 9-11 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 1 1/2 dozen.

Combine tuna, peanuts and mustard. Mix together cream cheese and mayonnaise. Combine the two mixtures and chill. Slice biscuits horizontally. Brush tops of biscuits with melted butter. Spread tuna mixture over bottom layer. Top with second biscuit layer. Sprinkle with flour. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut each tart into 4 wedges.

Combine flour and seasonings and dredge cutlets. In a large skillet over medium heat, add butter and dredge pork cutlets. Saute in butter until golden brown. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan, add white mushrooms and garlic. Saute until tender. Add chicken stock and soy sauce. Bring to a simmer and cook 1 minute. Add the cutlets and cover. Cook over medium heat for 4 minutes. Add light sour cream and heat until hot. Serve with fresh parsley.

Combine milk and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add rice and cook over low heat for 20 minutes or until tender. In a separate saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and add the pumpkin, parsley and seasonings and cook for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir the cooked rice into the pumpkin mixture and serve with cheese.

Rinse shrimp, peel & devein, pat dry & sprinkle with salt & pepper. Marinate 2 hours, or overnight, stirring occasionally. In a large skillet, heat oil over med heat. Add shrimp, olives, onion & vinegar. Cook 3-4 minutes or until pink. Serve warm.

Drain canned tuna (if you use drained it will be easier to mix). Mix all ingredients together (except butter). Cut bread in half and spread butter on each half. Place a slice of tomato on each half and layer with lettuce leaf, onion slice, slice of tuna mixture, lemon juice on the tomato slice and a little salt and pepper to taste. Replace top slice of bread. Makes 2 sandwiches.

In small saucepan over low heat combine powdered sugar & margarine. Stir until blended. Add milkheat & stir until smooth & creamy. Remove from heatstir in peanut butter & vanilla until smooth. Coolpour into 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan. Refrigerate 1 hour or until firm. Spread with melted semisweet chocolate. Let stand until chocolate is setcut into 1 inch squares.
Blend cinnamon, sugar and cream cheese. Stir in raisins.
Boil potatoes and drain. Add 1/2 of the dressing. Mash to desired texture. Add remaining 1/2 of the dressing and miracle whip. Stir in egg and green onions. Chill.

Spoon the refried beans evenly on top of the chips. Evenly spread the cream on the beans. Sprinkle the cheese evenly on the cream. Sprinkle the salsa evenly on the cheese. Microwave for 30 seconds on high power until the cheese is melted. Serves 4. Prep time is about 5 minutes.

In a large bowl combine chopped vegetables, basil, vinegar, oil, salt and pepper. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Tear bread into 1-inch pieces and add to vegetables. Mix gently. Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes. Serves 6.

Place chicken breasts into large zip-top bag. Pour in soy sauce and bourbon whiskey and shake well to coat chicken breasts with the marinade mixture. Refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place chicken breasts into baking dish and bake 20 minutes per side, or until chicken is golden and cooked through. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl, combine pudding mix and light corn syrup. Stir for 2 minutes. Stir in peanut butter and stir until well blended. Spoon into 8-inch square pan. Sprinkle with cheerios and press down. Chill. Cut into 1-inch squares.

Place bacon in skillet and cook until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove bacon from skilletdrain off drippings leaving about 1 Tablespoon. Add green beans, bell pepper, chicken broth, bacon drippings and salt. Cover and cook 10 minutes over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally. Remove cover and continue cooking about 10 more minutes or until the liquid is evaporated. Serve with bacon or not, as desired.

Spread cream cheese onto each slice of whole wheat bread. Arrange cucumbers, alfalfa sprouts and olive oil over cream cheese. Place tomatoes in center of bread slices. Top tomatoes with lettuce, peppers and avocado. Drizzle red wine vinegar over each sandwich. Cut sandwiches in half. Serve immediately or chill until serving time. Serves 4-6.

Heat the oil over medium heat and add the onion, carrot and celery, stirring occasionally until they are softened but not browned, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute. Add the stock and tomato puree and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the remaining vegetables and cook until they are tender, about 5 minutes more. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Place tamales in microwaveable bowl. Add enough water to cover. Cover bowl. Microwave for 5 minutes. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Microwave for 30 seconds. Stir in sauce mixture. Serve with tamales.

Combine garlic and lemon juice in a bowl. Let sit for 10 minutes. Marinate the chicken in it for at least an hour. Drain off the marinade. Place the chicken on a rack on a broiler pan. Broil about 4 inches from the heat for 15-20 minutes until done. Turn once while broiling.
In a large pot over medium heat, combine the broth, water, chicken, beans, corn and cumin. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heatadd salsa, pepper, and onion. Serve with tortilla chips, if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Mix the quinoa flour, whole wheat flour and baking powder. Add the oil and water and mix well. Roll the dough into balls and place them on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Store in an airtight container.

Combine mustard, worchestershire sauce and lemon juice. Add garlic powder and oregano. Dip fish in mustard mixture and then into rice flour. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 12-15 minutes until fish is done and golden. Garnish with parmesan cheese.

Bring 1/4 cup water and cornstarch to a boil in medium saucepan. Boil 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heatstir in drink mix and crushed pineapple until blended. Cool 5 minutes. In a shallow dish, combine reserved 1/4 cup water and cornstarch until smooth. Stir in sweetened flaked coconut until blended and smooth. Working with 1 apple slice at a time, dip each apple slice in the cornstarch mixture and then in the drink mix mixture. Repeat procedure until all apple slices have been dipped and completely coated. Let stand 30 minutesdrain well on paper towels. Sprinkle apple slices with powdered sugarset aside. Repeat procedure until all apple slices have been dipped and completely coated. Let stand 30 minutesdrain well on paper towels. Sprinkle apple slices with powdered sugarset aside.

Slice cheese into small cubes. In a small bowl combine cheese, shallot, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Let stand until ready to use. In another small bowl toss together pear slices and walnuts. Spread butter on each slice of bread. Place two slices on a plate. Top each with a pear slice. Spread cheese mixture on one slice. Top with other slice. Trim crusts. Serve sandwiches with salad.

Pre-heat oven to 450f. Coat the fish with flour and season with salt and pepper. In a large fry pan heat the butter and garlic until golden brown. Add mushrooms and cook until they are soft. Add the white wine and simmer until the liquid evaporates. Add the cream and cook over low heat for 2-3 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Put the fish in a baking dish and pour the sauce over. Bake the fish for about 10 minutes.

Cut dough into 12 even pieces. Roll each piece into a 6-in. circle and place on baking sheets coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400° for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. In small bowl combine 1/2 cup melted butter and egg until smoothspread over top of each ring to within 1/2 inch of edges. Sprinkle each ring with 1 teaspoon garlic powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bake at 350° for 12-14 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon chopped parsley and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese.

Spray a large frying pan with cooking spray then cook the chicken until no longer pink. Mix in the salsa & paprika until well blended. In a separate bowl beat the cheese sauce ingredients together. In a third bowl beat together the sour cream & adobo seasoning. Spray a 9x13 baking pan then layer the tortillas. Top each tortilla with a spoonful of the chicken mixture then a spoonful of the cheese sauce. Sprinkle the top with the shredded cheese. Cover & bake for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven & sprinkle the top with the sour cream mixture. Bake uncovered for 5 more minutes.

Beat eggs and powdered sugar together. Stir in cornstarch. Cook on low heat until thick. Add soymilk. Cook until mixture coats the back of a spoon. Cool to room temperature. Add vanilla. Chill. Fold in 1 quart of whipped cream. Chill. Add to ice cream machine.

Preheat oven to 350F. Spray a 9×13″ baking dish with nonstick spray and set aside. Melt the chocolate in the microwave until smooth. Set aside and let cool slightly. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes). Beat in the melted chocolate and vanilla extract until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour and baking soda and add it to the mixture in two parts, alternating with the sour cream. Stir in the chocolate chips with a spoon until just incorporated. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread it out evenly with a spatula. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the top is slightly puffy and the edges are just set. Let cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.
Heat oil in large skillet. Add beans and stir-fry 1-2 minutes. Add ginger, garlic, soy sauce, chili-garlic sauce, vinegar. Stir-fry 2-3 minutes. Serve immediately.

Prepare and bake cake mix as directed. Cool and crumble. In a bowl combine butter, brown sugar and caramel topping. Add crumbled cake mix. Add egg. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 pan. Sprinkle nuts and ground cinnamon on top. Bake at 350F for 20 minutes. Makes 12 bars.

In a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat, warm 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil. Season the beef cubes generously with salt and freshly ground pepper. Cook the beef in the heated skillet until browned. Remove the beef to a plate and set aside. Add the pancetta to the skillet and cook until crisp. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil to the pancetta fat in the skillet. Add the onion to the skillet and cook over medium-high heat until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the beef cubes back to the skillet along with the balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, and beef broth. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the skillet and simmer until the beef is very tender, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Check the skillet occasionally and add more broth if it dries out. Remove the beef to a plate. Pour the sauce into a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Return the sauce to the sk

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in honey and mustard. Add in orange zest. Add in orange juice. Cook until sauce thickens. Add in broccoli florets. Cook for a couple of minutes. Add in water. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat. Garnish with hazelnuts. Serve.

In a heavy bottomed pot or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium high heat. Add sliced mushrooms and stir fry until golden brown. Add the carrots and cook 2-3 minutes more. Add the wild rice blend and stir fry another 2-3 minutes. Add the beef broth, bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer. Add the sirloin strips and cook until tender. Season with freshly ground black pepper. Serve hot.

Toss steaks in flour. Beat eggs with 1 Tbsp water. Dip steaks in eggs then coat with breadcrumbs. Heat butter and oil in skillet. Fry steaks for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until browned. Serve with lemon wedges.
Brown meat. Drain fat. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer until cheese melts. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Cut the tomatoes into 1/2 inch chunks. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar and oregano. In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes and the olives. Add the dressing and toss to blend. Serve the salad at once or cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days. Just before serving, sprinkle with the feta and serve.
Scoop out avocado flesh. Place in bowl. Add lemon juice, sea salt, chili powder, cumin. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Heat 1 teaspoon of oil in skillet and saute carrot and zucchini. Add the rest of the oil and the Rotel. Stir and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil. Cook until the rice is tender.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a large resealable bag. Add the beef and turn to coat. Refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Drain the liquid from the bag. Place the beef in a 9x13-inch baking pan. Bake for 4-5 hours or until meat is fork tender. Increase the heat to 400 degrees and turn the oven off. Let stand for 1 hour. Remove the meat to a platter. Strain the juices through a fine sieve and pour the juices over the meat. Serve with the reserved onions. Serves 10 to 12.

Pre-heat oven to 450 degrees. Dry-dredge the chicken in the flour and set aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat melt the butter and olive oil. Brown the chicken on both sides. Add the hoisin sauce to the skillet and cook until the sauce has reduced by half. Add the juice of 1/2 an orange. Stir in the oranges and red pepper flakes. Remove from heat and sprinkle with green onions and chopped nuts. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Combine yeast in warm water with a little sugar. let sit until creamy. Add butter, salt and the rest of the sugar. Add the egg and beat until smooth. Add the flour slowly until dough forms a ball. Roll out the dough to the thickness of the bottom of a glass. Brush with egg yolk wash and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 350 for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large skillet over medium heat, add the ground turkey and warm water until the turkey is just browned. Drain the water and stir in the seasonings until well mixed. Add the lemon peel and stir again until well mixed. Cook for a few minutes until the seasonings are well mixed with the turkey. Serve hot.

Select basic or quick bread cycle. Add all ingredients except beer. Add beer and oil with 1 minutes remaining of mixing. Remove dough from machine and divide into 8 pieces. Shape into rolls and place into greased 8x8 pan. Cover and let rise 10 minutes. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes.

Preheat the broiler. Rub the grapefruit halves inside and out with the honey. Season the inside of the halves with the cardamom. Sprinkle the sugar over the grapefruit. Broil until the sugar has caramelized, about 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Put the milk into a saucepan with the baking chocolate. Over low heat, stir until the baking chocolate is dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly. Remove from heat and add the sugar and cornstarch, stirring until smooth. Serve hot.

Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Gradually whisk in the milk and continue to stir for about 5 minutes until it becomes creamy. Add the onion and the garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the grits and stir well. Add the olive oil and salt. Cook, stirring constantly over medium heat for about 25 minutes. Add the cheddar cheese and stir until the cheese has completely melted. Stir in the thyme. Remove from the heat and stir in the scallions. Serve immediately.

Dissolve jello in boiling water. Add crushed pineapple. Cool to room temperature. Fold in whipped topping. Spread into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Chill for 2 hours or until firm. Garnish with carrots.

Follow package directions to prepare macaroni shells and cheese. Add corn and black beans to the macaroni mixture. Spread in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Top with green olives, sliced green chilies and chopped tomatoes. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Add 1/4 cup water and 1/2 cup sugar to a small saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to medium and boil for 2 minutes. Add lemon zest and 4 cups water. Strain through a fine strainer. Refrigerate until chilled. Add vodka to 3 cups of the lemon syrup and stir well. Refrigerate until chilled. Serve in chilled glasses. Garnish each glass with a slice of lemon.

Combine sour cream and mayonnaise in a bowl. Stir in basil and oregano. Add salt and pepper to taste. Fill pita pockets with a spoonful of the sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and bake in a preheated 375 degree F oven for 5 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Wash and trim the cauliflower. Cut out the core of the cauliflower and break up the florets. Arrange the florets in an ungreased shallow baking dish. Combine the sour cream, salt and pepper, and sprinkle over the cauliflower. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top of the sour cream. Bake at 375 degrees F for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

Peel the tomatoes. Bring the water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the peeled tomatoes and the remaining ingredients. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 45 minutes to 1 hour. Strain the mixture through a colander or through a cheesecloth. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown chops in butter in a skillet. Add apples. Stir together butter, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Spoon over apples. Dot with butter. Bake uncovered 20 minutes or until apples are tender.

Dissolve yeast and honey in warm water. Let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in salt, oil and herbs. Beat in flour until dough is too stiff to stir. Turn out on lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Place in greased bowl, turning once to grease surface. Coverlet rise in warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Punch down. Divide dough into 2 pieces and shape into 12"-14" ovals on lightly floured board. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic and herbs. Let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk, about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a 400 degree F oven for 20-25 minutes until golden brown and loaves sound hollow when tapped. Serve hot.
Preheat oven to 350. In skillet, brown chops in hot oil. Add applesauce, brown sugar, and mustard. Cover and bake for 1 hour or until tender.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cut the sausages in half lengthwise. Thread the sausages and vegetables alternately on four double thicknesses of foil. Drizzle with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with rosemary. Fold foil to enclose. Grill for 20 minutes. Open foil and turn sausage halves and vegetables over. Grill an additional 20 minutes.

Peel the cucumbers and slice them into 1/4 inch rounds. Sprinkle them with the butter and season with the salt & pepper. Place the bread slices in the sandwich maker and spread the butter mixture over them. Top with the slices of cucumber. Cook for 3 minutes until the bread is crisp. Makes 4 servings.

Place the vanilla bean in a small sauce pan and cover with hot water. Let steep for 10 minutes. Remove the vanilla bean pods from the hot water. Save the pods for garnish. Combine the champagne vinegar, olive oil, honey and tarragon in a blender or food processor and blend until well emulsified. Season to taste with salt and fresh ground pepper. Pour the dressing into a small bowl for serving or into a jar with a lid for refrigerator storage. Garnish with a vanilla bean pod or with fresh tarragon sprigs. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Slice the french bread into 1-inch pieces. Place on a baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with garlic and bake another 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Top each piece of bread with a slice of zucchini. Sprinkle with ricotta cheese and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake another 2-3 minutes. Remove from oven.

Place apple slices in a bowl. Add cinnamon to taste. Melt marzipan in microwave until soft. Drizzle melted marzipan over apple slices. Place on one slice of buttered bread. Top with second slice of buttered bread.

Cream together butter flavor crisco and sugar. Beat in egg, orange extract, and zest. Stir together flour and saltgradually add to creamed mixture and mix well. Form dough into 1-inch balls. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 8 minutes. Cool 1 minute before removing from cookie sheet to wire racks.

Preheat oven to 350. Crumble cracker with hands. Spread on plate or paper towel. Dip each breast in melted butter, then roll in crumbs. Place in shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Bake uncovered 30 minutes or until done.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and add raspberries. Let cool. Serve over ice. Top with soda.

Place yogurt and lime juice in large bowl. Stir to combine. Add brown sugar and stir to combine. Place half of the mixture in a large flat container and fold in half of the banana slices and half of the blueberries. Repeat with remaining yogurt mixture and fruit. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze until firm. Serve immediately or store up to two weeks in freezer.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a small bowl, combine the first three ingredients. Press into the bottom of an ungreased 13x9 inch baking pan. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Pour evenly over the crumb mixture. Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Cut into bars. Store covered.

Remove stems from caps and chop stems. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in stems. Add garlic and cayenne and cook 1 minute. Add mushroom caps and cook 5 minutes. Stir in creamed spinach and cook 3 to 5 minutes. Serve on bun with cheese.

In a large bowl combine orange juice and green onions. Cut the green onions in half lengthwise and add to the orange juice mixture. Then add the fish fillets and the teriyaki sauce. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for about an hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Dip the fish fillets in the cornflour until they are covered and then place in the baking dish. Pour the marinade over the fish. Bake uncovered for about 15 minutes or until the fish is cooked through. Sprinkle with fresh ginger before serving. Serve with rice.

Place the balsamic vinegar, olive oil and shallot into a shallow dish and stir to combine. Add the fresh rosemary and stir to combine. Add the steaks and turn to coat both sides with the marinade. Cover and chill in the refrigerator overnight. Grill over medium heat about 4 inches from the coals or heat on the stovetop, using a grill pan. Grill 4 minutes per side and serve immediately.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and saute until soft but not brown, about 6 minutes. Stir in tomato paste, chile in adobo, cumin, oregano and adobo sauce. Cook 1 minute more. Add beans and watersimmer 10 minutes. Stir in salsa and serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheet or line with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and saltset aside. In a large bowl, combine the butter and sugars until creamy. Beat in the eggs until fully blended. Gradually stir in the flour mixture until just blended. Fold in the chocolate chips and nuts. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheetflatten slightly with the back of a spoon. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until slightly golden around the edges. Allow to cool for 2 minutes before removing from the cookie sheet to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes about 4 dozen.

Place all ingredients into a 4-quart slow cooker. Cook 8-10 hours on low heat setting or 4-5 hours on high heat setting. Remove pork from cooker. Shred meat. Toss meat with 1/4 cup of barbecue sauce, 1 tablespoon of teriyaki sauce. Cover to keep warm. Serve meat with remaining barbecue sauce on the side. Makes 8 servings.

Peel and halve the eggs lengthwise. Remove the yolks and place them in a small mixing bowl with the other ingredients and mash well with a fork or whisk until creamy and smooth. Stir in the sour cream. Fill the egg halves with the mixture and sprinkle with the paprika. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving. Serves 12.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Heat the vegetable oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the chicken and brown well. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the soy sauce and stir well. Add the white vinegar and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Add the paprika and mix. Pour into a roasting pan or casserole dish. Roast for about 40 minutes.

Melt the butter and mix it with the sugar and egg until creamy and smooth. Sift the flour and mix it into the mixture. Add the milk and mix again until the dough is soft and sticky and then roll it into balls of 2cm thickness and place on an oven tray lined with greaseproof paper. Gently press each ball down on the tray so that they are about 2cm thick and place one sultana on each ball and then bake for about 10 minutes until the top is golden brown. Serve hot or cold and with jam or cream.
Blend banana and ice cubes in blender until smooth. Add dark creme de cacao. Pour into four tall glasses and chill. Add a few pieces of dark chocolate.

Preheat oven to 400. In a shallow dish, combine oil, mustard, parsley. Add the chicken pieces and turn to coat. Place in a single layer in a baking dish. Season with paprika. Bake for 30-45 minutes. Check doneness by inserting a knife into the thickest portion of the meat. The juices should run clear when the meat is fully cooked. Serve immediately.

Combine dry ingredients and add milk and egg. Add melted fat. Pour into a greased and floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour and fifteen minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in center of bread comes out clean.

Boil sprouts for 5-10 minutes. Drain well. In a small bowl mix the low sodium soy sauce, fresh ginger, minced garlic cloves, splenda granular. Toss the sprouts with the marinade. Heat the marinated sprouts in a large saute pan over medium high heat. Saute for 3 minutes or until the sprouts are heated through. Sprinkle the red pepper flakes on top. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add apples. Cook until lightly browned. Add water. Bring to a boil. Cook until tender. Remove from heat. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine brown sugar, cinnamon, and heavy cream. Bring to a boil. Cook until thick. Drizzle over apples. Serve immediately.

Spread mayo on one slice of white bread. Add roast beef, american cheese slice, tomato, smoked ham. Fold the sandwich in half. Insert a toothpick in the sandwich to hold it together. Repeat with the other slice of white bread to make a sandwich.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until tender but still firm to the bite. Drain and rinse with cold water. Combine the bacon, Miracle Whip, sugar, garlic salt and mustard. In a large bowl add the cooked pasta and mix well. Fold in the other ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

Mix all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 tsp. baking powder and 1/4 tsp. salt in a large bowl. In a medium bowl, combine 1/2 cup of buttermilk, 1 large egg and 1/4 cup oil and beat with a wire whisk until well blended. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the buttermilk mixture. Stir just until a smooth batter forms. Heat a waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions and spray with cooking spray. Pour 1/2 cup batter into the center of the iron and cook until golden brown and crisp, about 4 minutes. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve immediately.

Cream together margarine and sugar. Sift together flour and baking soda. Add vanilla, nuts and flour mixture to creamed butter and mix well. Shape into walnut sized balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Press down slightly with a fork. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on cookie sheet 1-2 minutes. Roll in powdered sugar to coat. Store in airtight container for up to 3 weeks or in freezer for 1 month.

Pour the juice from the watermelon into a pan, add the sugar and cook until it is almost syrupy. Mix the cornstarch with the milk and add to the juice. Cook until thickened and then add the vanilla extract. Pour into individual cups or bowls and chill until serving time. Serve with the crushed pistachios sprinkled on top with chocolate shavings and candied citron peel on the side.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Heat butter over medium heat in a large saucepan. Add the onions. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Add the beef broth and water. Bring to a boil. Add worcestershire sauce and reduce heat. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Spoon into bowls. Top with parmesan and swiss cheese. Place under the broiler until cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Cook bacon in large saucepan over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon, leaving 2 tablespoons drippings in pan. Add onioncook until tender. Stir in okra and garlic powder. Add stewed tomatoes and their liquid. Cook until okra is tender. Season with salt, pepper, and cayenne. Serve with bacon.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix together all ingredients except the rice crispies and bake for 15 minutes or until slightly brown around the edges. Stir in rice crispies and bake for 5 more minutes or until rice crispies are golden brown. Cool on wax paper.
Thinly slice beef. Combine in a medium bowl with lemon juice and soy sauce. Stir in green onion and onion. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes, if desired.

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add the frozen green beans and cook until they are bright green and tender. Drain the beans and cool them under cold running water. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil and sesame oil in a skillet. Add the mushrooms and cook until golden and browned. Add the tamari and mix thoroughly. Add the green beans and cook until heated through. Sprinkle with toasted almonds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a medium skillet. Sauti garlic and lemon peel in the skillet until golden brownset aside. Place the shrimp in an ungreased 1-quart baking dishsprinkle with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Bake in the preheated oven until pink and cooked through, 8 to 10 minutes. Sprinkle with green onion and drizzle with the lemon juice and Tabasco sauce to taste. Serve hot.

Combine sugar and butter in saucepan. Bring to boil. Remove from heat and beat in egg whites. Add flour and baking powder. Blend well. Add hot water. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9 by 13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven when top of the cake springs back when lightly touched. Cool on rack before removing. This cake never fails.

Preheat oven to 375 F. Lightly spray a gratin dish with cooking oil spray or brush with oil. Arrange tomatoes on bottom of dish. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with olive oil. Place bread slices on top of tomatoes. Cover with a thin layer of prosciutto slices. Whisk together eggs, heavy cream and red wine vinegar. Pour over bread. Bake 20-30 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Sprinkle with chives before serving. Serve with crusty bread or crackers for dipping.

In a medium bowl combine the granola, brown sugar and cinnamon. Beat eggs with milk and melted butter until smooth. Place crescent rolls on ungreased cookie sheets. Brush the tops of each roll with the egg mixture and sprinkle with the granola mixture. Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 12 servings. Serve warm.

In a medium bowl, beat eggs with milk and salt. Add bisquick and mix until smooth. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook ham in skillet until crisp. Remove ham from skillet and set aside. Add green bell peppers and dried onion flakes to the skillet. Cook and stir until the green peppers are just tender. In a 13x9 inch baking dish layer the ham, then the hash browns. Top with the green pepper mixture. Spread the egg mixture evenly over top. Bake, uncovered, for 30 to 35 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting into squares.

Make potato mixture. Combine potatoes, cheese, spices and chicken broth. Cook shells according to package directions. Drain and place in serving dish. Spoon potato mixture over top. Bake at 375F for 15 minutes or until potatoes are heated through and cheese is melted. Garnish with green onions.
Brown ground beef and onions in skillet. Add garlic powder, flour and seasonings. Add mushrooms and cream of chicken soup. Simmer until hot. Serve over noodles or rice.

Combine flour, baking powder, salt, shortening or lard in large bowl or food processor until well mixed. Beat in milk until dough is soft enough to roll. Divide dough into four balls. On lightly floured surface roll out dough to about 1/4-inch thickness. With sharp knife or pizza cutter, cut dough into 3-inch squares. With fingers or fork, gently squeeze square to make well in center of dough. Place well in center of each square. Spoon about 1/2 teaspoon of light maple syrup into each well. Fold dough over filling to cover completely. Seal edges of dough together with finger or fork. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes until dumplings are golden brown. Makes 12 dumplings.

In a large stock pot combine apple juice and apple cider. Bring to a boil. Whisk in brown sugar and sugar. Reduce heat to medium and add 2 cinnamon sticks. Continue to boil for 1 hour. Pour in everclear grain alcohol 190 proof. Stir and mix well. Using a ladle or measuring cup with spout, pour moonshine mixture into mason jars. Seal and refrigerate for 5-6 days. Shake well before drinking. Keep refrigerated and drink responsibly.

Cook minute rice in boiling water according to package directions. Rinse with cold water. Drain. Place in large bowl. Add tomatoes. Add fish fillets to minute rice mixture. Drain on paper towel. Add italian dressing. Toss gently. Sprinkle with cheese.

Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Cut tortillas into wedges. Divide mixture evenly and place on tortillas. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Wrap tightly and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper or wax paper. Beat together butter, almond extract and vanilla in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment on medium speed until creamy. Beat in egg white until fully incorporated. Add the powdered sugar one cup at a time until mixture comes together. Beat on high speed for 5 minutes until light and fluffy. Sprinkle in blanched almonds until incorporated. Spread onto baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until the mixture is crisp and lightly golden in color. Let cool completely before using or storing in an air tight container.

Marinate the wings for 3 hours or overnight in the refrigerator in the marinade. Place in a greased roasting pan. Bake uncovered at 400°F for 40 to 45 minutes until browned and cooked through. Remove from the oven and mix 1/3 cup of the marinade with 2 Tbsp of water. Pour over the chicken wings and return to the oven for 5 more minutes or until bubbly and glazed. Serve hot.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, add the butter, leeks and parsley. Cook until the leeks are tender. Add the tomatoes and cook until the sauce has thickened. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool. Place the dough on a floured surface and roll into an 11 inch circle. Spread half of the leek and tomato mixture on the dough. Sprinkle the remaining half of the leek and tomato mixture on top of the dough. Sprinkle the montrachet and parsley on top. Bake in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.

Prepare the dip mix according to the package directions. Spread the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate with the mayonnaise. Sprinkle the chicken breasts with the seasoning mix. Place each chicken breast on top of the dip mix in the pie plate. Top with the onion dip mix and the panko breadcrumbs.

Beat first 3 ingredients at medium speed with a mixer until well blendedStir in chips and toffee piecesSpread into a pie pan or shallow dishSpread topping over cream cheese mixtureCover and refrigerate until ready to serveJust before serving, core and cut apples into wedgesArrange around edge of pan or dishServe with apple wedges.

Combine gelatin and hot water in a large bowl and stir well. Add frozen strawberries and stir well. Add dry pudding and stir well. Place a layer of angel food cake in the bottom of a 9x13 pan and spread half of the jello mixture on top. Add a layer of the miniature marshmallows and repeat the process. Top with a layer of the cool whip and repeat the process one last time. Sprinkle fresh strawberries on the top of the dessert before serving.

Season the rump roast with salt and pepper. Place the roast in a 5 or 6 quart crockpot. Add the potatoes, carrots, onions and celery. Pour the cider over the vegetables. Place the bay leaf and the marjoram in the crockpot. Cook the roast slowly for 6 to 8 hours. Serve with gravy.

Bring 2 cups of chicken broth to a boil. Add the uncooked rice and cook until the rice is done, about 20 minutes. Cool the mixture slightly, then pour into a blender or food processor. Blend or process until smooth. Beat in the egg yolks and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice until well combined. Return the mixture to the saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon. Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining lemon juice. Season with the oregano, parsley, pepper, and Tabasco to taste. Serve warm.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Stir in the syrup, brown sugar and porridge oats. Heat and stir over low heat until the mixture is the consistency of thick batter. Remove from heat. Put in a greased 8 inch square pan. Cut into squares.

Prepare pie crust according to package directions. Crumble beef into bowl. Add hot dogs. Stir in beans. Spoon into pie crust. Bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Bake 10 minutes longer or until crust is browned. Spread with mustard. Top with cheese. Cut into wedges.

In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat the oil over medium high heat until hot and shimmering. Add the cloves, cardamom and bay leaves and saute until the spices are aromatic and the bay leaves are crisp and fragrant. Add the rice, stir well and add the cinnamon stick. Saute the rice for 3 minutes and then add the cumin and stir to combine. Add the water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pan with a tight fitting lid. Simmer until the liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand covered 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with coriander and serve hot.
Combine pudding mix with milk as per instructions on pudding box. Mix pudding well until smooth. Fold in chocolate chips. Spread over prebaked pie crust. Refrigerate.

Mix cornmeal and flour in bowl. Add eggs and mix well. Add sugar and mix until well combined. Add vinegar and mix well. Add margarine and mix until well blended. Add milk and stir until well combined. Pour into unbaked pie shell and bake in 350 degree oven until golden brown. Cool completely and serve.

In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal and milk. In a separate small saucepan, combine the sugar and waterbring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and the baking powder. Add the hot liquid to the cornmeal mixture and beat until smooth. Add the eggs and the butter and beat until combined. Pour into a greased and lightly floured 9 inch square pan or 8 inch round cake pan and bake for 45-50 minutes or until the bread is firm in the center. Cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash new potatoes and slice into 1/2 inch slices. In a large bowl combine potatoes, olive oil and salt/pepper. Spread evenly onto a baking sheet. Roast for 20-30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with italian cheese blend and fresh basil. Return to oven for 5 more minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Garnish with green onions. Serves 4-6.

Cut stomach into pieces. Place in a pot with enough water to cover the stomach pieces. Add sausage, potato, cabbage and onion. Bring to a boil and simmer for 3 hours. When done add more salt to taste and black pepper.

In saucepan combine first 4 ingredients, stirring with whisk until smoothcook over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Cool completelystir in lemon juice and juice. Spoon sauce over slices of ice creamtop with peaches.

Cream sugar and butter in large mixer bowl. Beat in egg and vanilla. Stir in flour and oats. Press mixture evenly onto ungreased 12 x 15-inch baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. Spread caramels over hot crust. Bake 2-1/2 to 3 minutes longer or until caramels are melted. Spread over hot crust with a knife or spatula. Cool completely. Break into pieces. In microwave, melt chocolate chips, half-and-half, and cashew pieces in small microwave-safe bowl on high for 45 seconds or until smoothstir until smooth. Drizzle over broken pieces of crust. Cool. Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator.

Dip each chicken breast in a mixture of half flour and half seasonings. Brown in hot butter in skillet. Add chicken broth and continue cooking until chicken is done. Stir in lemon juice. Serve over hot rice.
Cook pasta to package directions. Drain pasta and add to serving bowl. Add olive oil and basil and toss. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees Fahrenheit. In a small bowl, mix together the brown sugar with the garlic powder and onion powder. Coat a baking dish with cooking spray and place the smokies in the baking dish in a single layer. Wrap each smokie with 2 strips of the bacon, folding the ends to secure the wrap. Brush the wrapped smokies with the brown sugar mixture. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the bacon is browned and the smokies are heated through. Serve hot.

Prepare french loaf by slicing off top and removing crust. Slice into 2 inch thick slices. Butter both sides of slices. Combine mozzarella cheese with blue cheese dressing. Spread between slices. Top with diced tomato. Broil for about a minute or until cheese is melted. Serves 4.
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl. Shape into balls. Brown in a skillet. Serve with your favorite pasta sauce.

Line the bottom of a 6 inch round glass dish with vanilla wafers. Pour 1/3 cup hot water over the wafers to soften them. Add a layer of 1/2 the prepared pudding. Spread half the prepared whipped topping over the pudding. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup cocoa powder. Repeat the layers with the remaining wafer, hot water, pudding, and topping. Refrigerate for several hours. Garnish with a dollop of whipped topping and sprinkle with remaining cocoa powder. Serves 2.

Place 1/2 cup yogurt in a small bowlstir in 1/2 cup raspberry jam until blended. Set aside. Prepare 2 cups cooked vanilla pudding according to package directions using skim milk as directed on the package. Cool slightly. Slice angel food cake into 1-inch slices. Layer half of the cake in the bottom of a 10-cup trifle dishtop with half the yogurt mixture, half the pudding, half the peaches in syrup, half the sherry, and half the mint sprig. Repeat layers. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or until ready to serve.
Combine all of the ingredients. Pour into an ice chest and freeze. Take out and serve.

In medium saucepan combine 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup sugarstir over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Add cranberries and stir. Cook for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain mixture well. In large bowl, combine cranberries with remaining water and sugar. Add orange juice. Stir until mixture is well mixed. Add dried cherries and nuts. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until mixture is cold. Stir in Grand Marnier. Serve with turkey.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 8 or 9 inch square baking dish. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar. Beat in the egg. Stir in the milk. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and saltadd to the creamed mixture alternately with the milk. Spread batter evenly into prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

Mix together 1/4 cup butter and 2 eggs. Spread over half of a flour tortilla. Layer cooked ham, onions and cheese. Fold other half of the tortilla over and seal the edges with egg mixture. Roll up and cut into 1 inch slices. Melt butter in small skillet and brown each slice of the rolled tortilla. Serve with sour cream.

Place the soaked beans in a large saucepan with the bay leaves and enough water to cover by 1 inch. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer until the beans are tender (about 2 hours). Drain the beans. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute. Add the chorizo and sauté until the fat is rendered (about 8 minutes). Add the sage leaves and cook until they wilt (about 1 minute). Stir the cooked beans into the skillet. Season with the salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve with cheese.

Combine goat cheese, cream cheese and parmesan in a small bowl until smooth. Divide mixture into 4 portions, and shape each into a 1-inch-thick log. Wrap each log in 3 pieces of plastic wrap, then wrap in foil. Place on grill rack coated with cooking spraygrill 12 minutes or until heated through. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine tomato juice, juice from 1 lime, and next 5 ingredientsstir well. Serve dip with peppers.

In a shallow bowl combine the melted butter and lemon juice. Dip fish into butter mixture, then press into the spice mixture. Place in a shallow casserole sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Bake at 450 degrees for about 15 minutes, or until fish flakes when pressed.
Cut the sausage into 1 inch pieces and brown. Drain grease. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Serve with rice.

Salt & pepper the pork chops. Brown both sides of the pork chops in butter. Add onions & saute until tender. Add the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat & simmer for 1 hour. Serve over rice.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Place chicken breasts in shallow dish and sprinkle with seasoned salt and pepper. Heat real butter in heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Turn and cook an additional 5 minutes. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add garlic to skillet and cook 1 minute. Add broccoli and cook 2 minutes. Add wine and cook 2 minutes. Add heavy cream and cook 5 minutes or until cream is thickened and chicken is cooked through. Spoon half the chicken, broccoli and sauce on top of ziti. Cover with remaining sauce and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

In a large skillet over medium heat, add olive oil. Add ginger and garlic cloves and cook until softened and fragrant. Add flounder filets and season well with fresh cracked pepper. Add white wine and cook until liquid evaporates and fish is cooked through. In a small bowl mix together soy sauce and hoisin sauce. Remove fish from skillet and place on a plate. Pour sauce over fish and top with scallion slices and sesame seeds. Serve over rice and enjoy.

Season fish with lemon juice and white pepper to taste. Dill can be used with or without the lemon juice. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Serve on toasted bread with mayonnaise and lemon slices on the side.
Combine all ingredients except shrimp in a small bowl until blended. Gently fold in shrimp. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 4 servings.

Cook ground beef until brown in skillet. Add carrot, Chinese bellflower, and bean sprouts. Cook until wilted. Add rice and mix well. Add dried mushrooms and boiling water. Cook until hot. Add lettuce and stir gently. Cook until lettuce is wilted but still bright green. Add egg and stir gently. Add red pepper paste to taste and stir gently. Serve hot.

Combine first 6 ingredients in medium bowlpour over chicken. Marinate in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Grill as directed. Meanwhile, combine remaining 3 ingredients in medium bowl. Serve with chicken. Yield: 12 servings.

Place the rice vinegar, sugar, salt and sake in a nonreactive pot. Add the kombu and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until the sugar is dissolved. Cool and store up to 2 weeks covered in the refrigerator.

Beat together the first 7 ingredients. Add the other 6 and beat until smooth. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle with dry cake mix. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve with ice cream or cool whip.

In a large saucepan saute garlic and butter. Add the onion and saute until soft and translucent. Add the broth, clams and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 10 minutes or until the clams open. Add cream of mushroom soup and stir until melted. Add the pepper and half-and-half. Heat until hot. Do not boil after adding the cream of mushroom soup or it will curdle. Serves 4 to 6.

In a heavy based pan, heat half of the olive oil. Add half of the plum tomatoes and half of the white onion. Stir well. Add 1/2 tsp of the garlic cloves, 2 of the thyme sprigs and 1 tsp of the sugar. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until the tomatoes soften. In another pan, heat the remaining olive oil. Add the remaining plum tomatoes, white onion, 1 garlic clove, remaining thyme sprig and remaining sugar. Cook until soft. Add the vegetable stock and simmer for 2 minutes. Add the basil. Season with salt and pepper. Add the tomato mixture to the pan of the roasted tomatoes. Bring to the boil then season again with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with butter. In a large bowl, mix together butter, brown sugar, egg, buttermilk, cranberries, cornmeal, all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir in the optional walnuts, if desired. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool slightly before serving.

Cut cucumber into spears. Cut onions in half and slice into 1/2 inch thick slices. Combine all other ingredients into a large pot and bring to a boil. Add cucumber and onions. Cook for 1 minute and then remove from heat. Pour mixture into sterilized jars and seal. Let cool and then store in refrigerator. Makes 2 pints.

Combine all the dressing ingredients in a small bowl and set aside. Cook the tortellini according to the package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a large bowl combine the tortellini with the lettuce and the remaining salad ingredients. Toss to combine. Add the vinaigrette and toss again. Serve in lettuce cups or on a platter.

In a wok or large skillet heat 1 Tbsp. oil. Add broccoli florets, mushrooms and carrotsstir-fry 2 min. Add watercover. Heat to boilingreduce heat to medium-lowcook 6-7 min. or until veggies are tender. Add noodlescook 1-2 min. or until noodles are heated throughdrain excess liquid. Stir in the beef. Combine stir-fry sauce and cornstarch until smoothstir into mixtureheat throughserve with rice.

Heat oil in saute pan over medium heat. Saute garlic until just starting to brown. Add hot red pepper flakes and saute 2 minutes more. Add broccoflower and saute 3-4 minutes more. Add water and balsamic vinegar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 10 minutes more. Add butter and fresh basil leaves and simmer 2 minutes more. Transfer to a bowl and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese to taste.

Cook pork mixture over medium heat till browned. Remove from heat. Add mushrooms to pork. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir. Stuff into pork burgers. Grill 15 minutes or till done. Serve with your favorite burger toppings.

Heat a frying pan or griddle, add a little olive oil if you like, sprinkle with a little paprika, then lay the fish in the pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork or until it is cooked to taste. Serve with the sauce of your choice or with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice sprinkled with parsley and a slice of lemon.

In a large bowl mix frozen hashbrowns with the soup. Spread into a shallow baking pan. Mix together cheese and sour cream, spread over the top of the hashbrowns. In a small bowl mix cornflakes with melted butter and sprinkle over the top. Bake at 400F for 20-25 minutes. Serves 6-8.
Sprinkle fish with seasonings and lemon juice to taste. Bake in a preheated oven at 400f for 10 to 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Brown sausage in large skillet. Cook and stir over medium-high heat until evenly browned. Remove sausage from skillet and set aside. In the same skillet add brown rice and stir in milk and cream of mushroom soup. Cook over medium heat until heated through, stirring occasionally. Stir in mushrooms and melted cheese. Place in a casserole. Top with sausage and bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until bubbly and browned on top.

Slice and roast red peppers. Slice chicken into thin strips. Dredge in flour seasoned with salt and pepper. Dip in beaten egg. Crush nuts in food processor with bread crumbs until finely chopped, but not mushy. Dredge chicken in nut mixture. Fry in hot oil until browned on both sides. Add cognac and butter to pan drippings and boil for a minute. Pour over chicken. Serve with sour cream and feta cheese.

Bring to boil 6 cups of water with 1 teaspoon of salt. Add 4 ounces of medium noodles and cook until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Combine 3 tablespoons of butter with 1 cup of half and half. Melt the butter in small saucepan. Add the half and half and 1 tablespoon of flour. Cook and stir until smooth and thickened. Add 1/2 cup of milk and cook and stir until smooth. Season with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon of black pepper. Stir in 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese. Add the cooked noodles and stir until combined. Stir in 1 can of salmon.

Peel bananas. Cut them in half lengthwise. Add them in a blender with 2 cups of ice cubes and the honey, cover and process until smooth. Pour into 2 tall glasses. Top each glass with 1/2 cup of the ice cubes and 1/2 of the pineapple chunk. Pour the slushie over the ice cubes and stir gently. Serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

Sift together the dry ingredients in a bowl. Rub in the butter. Add the egg and the milk alternately and make a smooth dough. Turn the dough out on a floured surface and roll out about 3/4 inch thick. Cut into desired shapes. Place on a greased or lined baking sheet and sprinkle with fruit of choice. Bake at 450 degrees f for about 8 to 12 minutes.

Peel and chop 2 tomatoes. Slice 3 small sweet red or green bell peppers into strips. Cut 1 red onion into small pieces. Combine the tomatoes, bell peppers and onion in a bowl. Toss gently. Add 2 tablespoons of red wine vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Add 1 cup of fresh parsley. Arrange 4 cups of sliced cucumbers over the mixture. Garnish with 1 cup of crumbled feta cheese. Drizzle with 1 teaspoon of olive oil. Chill for 1 hour before serving. Yield : 4 servings.

First cream together the shortening, sugar, eggs, and sour milk until light and fluffy. Then add the vanilla and the salt to the mixture and beat well. Sift together the flour and the baking soda, and then add to the creamed mixture. Then gently stir in the chopped walnuts. Chill dough for 1 hour or more. Roll into 1-inch balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheets about 2 inches apart. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven immediately. Cool on the cookie sheets for 2 minutes. Then transfer to wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 weeks. Yields about 5 dozen cookies.

In a large skillet, bring 1/2 cup water to boil. Add onioncook and stir 2-3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Stir in sugar snap peascook 1-2 minutes or until crisp-tender. In a small bowl, combine the remaining 1/2 cup water, cornstarch, and pepper. Add to skilletcook 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in vinegar. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan melt the butter and saut the onion until transparent. Add the carrots and potato and saut for 3 minutes stirring occasionally. Pour the broth and rosemary into the saucepan. Bring to a boil and simmer until the vegetables are tender about 20 minutes. Puree the vegetables in a food processor or blender until smooth. Return the puree to the saucepan and stir in the evaporated milk and ginger powder. Bring to a boil and reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes stirring occasionally. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley and serve hot.
Cook sausage and green pepper and onion until tender. Stir in tomato and seasonings. Add beans and heat through. Serve over rice. Sprinkle with cheese.

Heat oil in fryer to 350 degrees F. Coat chicken with flour. Dip in egg whites then in seasoned bread crumbs. Fry chicken until golden brown. Remove from oil. Place in 10 inch pie plate. Sprinkle with onion dip. Arrange potato chips over top of dip. Serve.

Cook sausage in a skillet until browned. Drain, reserving 1 tablespoon fat. Add corn and sausage to the boiling water. Cook 3 to 4 minutes. Drain, reserving 1/4 cup water. Stir in the sausage, corn, and sauce. Cook 1 to 2 minutes. Serve in a bowl. Garnish with cilantro and cheese.

In a large skillet, brown beef and drain. Add onion and saute until tender. Add diced tomato and saute until tender. Add remaining ingredients and stir. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes. Serve with pasta. Serves 5 to 6.

Dip chicken in egg. Then dip in cracker crumbs. Melt 1 stick of butter in skillet. Brown chicken on both sides. Pour off fat. Add 2 tbsp water, 1/4 cup lemon juice, 2 tbsp mango chutney and 2 tsp curry powder to skillet. Simmer over medium heat until sauce thickens. Pour sauce over chicken. Garnish with parsley if desired.

Heat oil in medium-size saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft and beginning to color. Add rice and cook and stir 2-3 minutes, just to toast the grains of rice. Add stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, until rice is soft and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Add lemon rind and cook, uncovered, for 5 minutes longer. Stir in lemon juice and parsley just before serving. Season to taste with pepper.

Cut thick slices of apple-smoked bacon and place in a shallow dish. Sprinkle with brown sugar and a small amount of kosher salt (about 1/4 teaspoon) and dried chilies (a good starting point would be 10 medium to large chilies). Cover with a plastic lid and place in the refrigerator to marinate for 2 hours. Remove bacon from the refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking. Arrange bacon slices in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Place under broiler until cooked through, about 5-6 minutes. Serve with a spoonful of sour cream or salsa.
Preheat oven to 350. Slice french bread in half lengthwise. Spread 1 tablespoon of the tofu mixture on each half. Bake until heated through. Makes 2 servings.
In a 4-quart crock pot combine the first seven ingredients. Stir in broccoli carrots cauliflower mix. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 3-4 hours. Serve over rice with lime wedges.

Prepare fritters in an electric fryer. Wash the zucchinis and grate the coarse. Transfer the grated vegetables in a colander and toss with a little coarse salt. Let drain. Combine egg and flour. Heat the oil in the electric fryer and drop by spoonfuls into the hot oil. Cook until golden brown. Remove from the oil and place in a serving dish. Top with sour cream. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, beat the eggs. Stir in the cheese, buttermilk, butter and salt. Add the cooked macaroni and mix well. Pour into a greased 13 inches x 9 inch x 2 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered, at 350 degrees, for 45-50 minutes or until a thermoneter reads 160 degrees.
Pour hot water over the cherry jello powder and stir until dissolved. Refrigerate for about an hour. Add the dream whip and stir. Pour into a dish and top with cherry pie filling. Chill.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place squash in a baking pan and sprinkle with olive oil. Bake for 35 minutes or until tender. Scoop out and set aside. In saute pan, melt the butter. Saute the onion and carrot until tender. Add the apples and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the squash and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the chicken broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Season with the thyme and pepper. Puree until smooth. Pour into bowls and serve with crusty bread.

Cut bread into 8 pieces. Place a piece of bread in a small bowl. Sprinkle with a small amount of blue cheese. Top with a piece of cream cheese. Top with a second piece of bread. Repeat. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Melt butter in the skillet. Place sandwiches in the skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until lightly browned. Flip and brown the other side.
