Remove from heat and keep warm. Cook the asparagus in boiling water for 1-2 minutes or until tender. Drain. Melt butter in a small saucepan. Add eggs and stir. Add asparagus. Cook until eggs are set. Place a piece of toast on each plate. Top with eggs and asparagus. Serve immediately.

Brown ground beef. Stir in rice. Add soup and water. Bring to a boil. Stir in tomatoes, corn, tortilla chips and cheese. Mix well. Pour into 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with extra cheese. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes. Serve with lettuce and sour cream.

In a large bowl combine Splenda and skim milk. Stir until Splenda is dissolved and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and continue to stir until mixture boils for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in remaining ingredients. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper to cool. Store at room temperature or refrigerate for up to 3 days.
Peel and cut eggs in half. Remove yolks and place in small bowl. Add remaining ingredients. Beat until well-blended. Spoon back into egg whites. Garnish with green onions.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare stuffing mix according to directions on box but use water instead of chicken broth. Saute mushrooms and onions in butter until tender. Add stuffing mix. Stir until thoroughly heated. Add spinach and parmesan cheese. Mix until combined. Spoon into a greased baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes or until browned. Cool slightly. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Wash, peel and chop apples. Combine apples, oranges juice and zest of lemon and juice and zest of 1 orange in a large bowl. Toss gently but thoroughly. Spread mixture evenly in a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in brown sugar and cook until dissolved into a liquid syrup (do not let syrup brown). Pour syrup over the apples. Stir gently until blended. Bake for 1 hour. Invert dish onto a serving plate or cutting board. Carefully remove dish. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Boneless skinless chicken breasts marinated in a mixture of olive oil, lemon juice, garlic and oregano and then cooked. Sliced and combined with romaine lettuce and vegetables. Topped with feta cheese and kalamata olives. Served with whole wheat pita bread.

Preheat oven to 250. In large bowl combine cereals and pretzels. Set aside. In a small bowl combine oil and next 4 ingredients. Add to cereal mixture. Stir to coat evenly. Spread onto baking sheet. Bake 1 hour. Cool completely. Store in airtight container.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the zucchini and cook until crisp-tender, about 4 minutes. Drain. In the same pot of boiling water, cook the pasta until al dente. Drain. Meanwhile, in a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil over medium-low heat. Add the garlic and cook until it is golden, about 2 minutes. Add the zucchini and cook until heated through. Add the tomatoes and cook until heated through. Add the parsley and toss. Toss the zucchini mixture with the pasta and serve.

Cut the chicken breasts in half and then slice them into strips. Then dip the strips into the pesto sauce and breadcrumbs and fry in olive oil till golden brown. Serve with your favorite pasta or salad.

Peel carrots. Trim daikon radishes and cut into 1-inch cubes or strips. Peel and slice cucumber. Combine all vegetables in medium bowl. In small bowl combine remaining ingredients. Mix well. Serve immediately or chill overnight.

In a medium saucepan, combine milk and rosemary. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Slowly add yellow cornmeal and cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture is thick and creamy. Remove from heat and stir in the grated cheeses. Stir in the minced rosemary leaves. Serve hot as a side dish. Makes 4 servings.
Cook the hamburger helper according to package directions. Add in the rest of the ingredients except salsa con queso. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve with salsa con queso.

Heat canola oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion and garlic and saute until softened. Add the bay leaf and saute until fragrant. Add the rice and saute for 2 minutes. Add the boiling water and bring to a boil. Add the tomatoes and cook until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is done. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Combine oats, pecans, bran, sugar, fruit, and salt. Add enough hot water to moisten. Allow to set up.

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat oil in skillet over med-high heat. Add pork chops to skillet. Cook until browned. Remove from skillet. In a small bowl combine brown sugar, soy sauce, water, cornstarch and margarine. Bring mixture to a boil. Return pork chops to skillet. Add mixture. Cover. Bake 1 hour.

Put the cannellini beans in a saucepan with the water. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 40 minutes until the beans are tender. Season with the garlic, thyme, black pepper and some of the cooking liquor. Stir in the olive oil. Makes 4 servings.

In a large saut pan with 2 tablespoons of butter or oil saut the garlic and onion until soft. Add the tomatoes and crumble the breadcrumbs over the top. Add basil and season with salt & pepper. Dot with pine nuts and dot with butter. Bake until crumb topping is golden brown. Serve hot or cold.

Put one green tea bag and spearmint leaves into an eight-cup teapot and add water to cover. Cover the pot and set aside for five minutes to steep. Add one heaping tablespoon of sugar and stir until the sugar dissolves completely. Remove the pot from the heat and add the mint sprigs. Pour the tea through a strainer into six glasses and serve.
Blend in blender until smooth. Serve immediately.

Combine 2 cups sugar and butter and beat until light and fluffy. Add one egg at a time and beat well after each addition. Blend in lemon juice and zest. Pour into unbaked pie crust and bake at 350 degrees f for 45 minutes. Cool and serve.

Shred lettuce by hand or in food processor and place in large bowl. Chop scallions and add to lettuce. Cut eggs in quarters or eighths, place in bowl with lettuce mixture. In a skillet over medium heat fry bacon until crisp. Add chopped scallions, cook for 1 minute. Add heavy cream and simmer 2 minutes. Add vinegar, sugar, salt and black pepper to taste. Cook over low heat until thickened about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and pour over salad. Mix gently and serve warm or cold.

Season the chicken breast with the onion, garlic, oregano, basil, parsley, chili powder, salt and pepper to taste. Dip the chicken breast in the egg, then coat in the flour mixture. Fry in oil until done. Add the tomato juice to the pan after you remove the chicken breast from the pan. Cook for 5 minutes over medium heat, then remove from heat. In a medium size bowl combine the sour cream, mozzarella, salsa, garlic powder and the chicken broth until well mixed. Lay out the flour tortillas on a flat surface and add your favorite toppings to each one. Roll up the tortillas and place in the casserole dish. Pour the sour cream mixture over the rolled up tortillas in the casserole dish. Cover the casserole dish in foil and place in oven until the top layer is melted and bubbly, about 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl combine butter, brown sugar and egg with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and creamy. Reduce speed to lowmix in vanilla and then add the flour, 1 cup at a time until mixture is stiff dough. Mix in nuts. Shape dough into 1 inch ballsplace 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes or until goldencool on wire rack. Melt chocolate in top of double boilerstir until smooth. Dip each cookie into chocolateallow excess chocolate to drip offplace on wax paper. Let stand until set.

In a frying pan fry garlic in olive oil over low heat for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Add mushrooms and saute for another 2 minutes. Add white wine, reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Add salt & pepper to taste. Serve hot sprinkled with parsley.

Cut egg in half lengthwise, remove yolk and set aside. Finely chop whitesplace in bowl. Add all remaining ingredients except paprika. Stir to combine. Spoon yolks into whitestop with paprika. Serve with crackers or toast points.
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Mix together the first 5 ingredients well. Place onto bread and bake in oven for about 10-15 minutes until bread is lightly toasted and cheese is melted.

Mash 2 cups of berries. Add 1/3 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon of gelatin dissolved in 1 tablespoon of boiling water to the berries. Blend thoroughly and strain through a sieve or colander lined with a piece of cheesecloth or a clean dish towel. Add 2 cups of whipping cream and chill thoroughly before using.

Rub the inside and outside of the hen with the butter and sprinkle with garlic salt. Add to the crockpot all but the parsley. Cover and cook 6 to 8 hours on low or 4 hours on high. Serve garnished with parsley.

Brown bacon in a skillet. Drain fat. Add onion and cook until tender. Cut potatoes into cubes and add to skillet. Add milk and seasonings. Heat thoroughly. Add cheddar cheese. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Serve hot with crusty bread or crackers.

Mix the first 5 ingredients well and beat until smooth. Combine the last 3 and add to first mixture. Pour into greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Cool cake completely. Drain the fruit cocktail and save the juice. Make frosting by mixing the juice with the brown sugar and nuts. Spread on top of the cake. Cut in squares.

In a medium saute pan heat olive oil. Add red onion and saute over medium heat until softened. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add mushrooms and oregano. Cook until mushrooms are tender. Add tomatoes and red peppers. Heat through. Spread mixture over 2 tortillas and top with the other 2. Spray griddle or skillet with non-fat cooking spray and brown tortillas on both sides. Use pizza cutter to cut into wedges. Serve with guac or sour cream.

Melt 4 tablespoons of butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in dill, fresh lemon juice, salt and pepper. Cook 2 minutes or until dill is wilted. Remove from heat. Toss baby carrots with melted mixture. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin. In a large bowl, combine cornmeal, seven grain cereal, all-purpose flour, salt and baking powder. In a small bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and oil. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the liquids. Mix just until moistened. Spoon the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack. Makes 12.

Cut the fennel bulb into very thin strips. Saute fennel with onion and bacon in a large skillet until the bacon is crispy. Season with salt and pepper. Add the cilantro. Place the fish in the skillet and cover with a lid. Cook until fish is done. Serve with lemon wedge and enjoy.

Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add the canola oil. Once the pan is hot add the onions. Cook the onions until they are soft. Add the ground ginger, ground cumin and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the dried lentils to the pan and cook for about 4 minutes. Add the water and the salt. Bring to a boil. Cook for about 20 minutes. The lentils should be tender. Remove from heat. Add the cilantro and lemon juice. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine syrup and chocolate chips. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Cool completely before storing in an airtight container.
In crock pot place potatoes and onions. Top with hens. In small bowl combine seasoning. Sprinkle over hens. Cook on low for 8 hours.

Cut meat into bite size pieces. Brown meat and onion in butter. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add sauerkraut. Mix together flour, baking powder and salt. Add milk to make a thick batter. Drop batter by spoonfuls onto top of meat mixture and cover. Cook over low heat for about 15 minutes or until done.

Mix wine, soy sauce and curry powder with breadcrumbs. In a shallow dish mix curry and breadcrumb mixture with mackerel. Broil for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until fish flakes easily. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Bring 2 cups of water to boil in a small saucepan. Add the tea bag. Allow the tea bag to steep for 2 minutes. Remove the tea bag. Add the rice. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 25 minutes. In a large bowl, mix together the peas, carrots, and green onions. In a small bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil and sesame oil. Add the rice vinegar, soy sauce, and fresh ginger. Whisk until smooth. Pour over the vegetable mixture. Serve warm.

Peel, core and slice apples thinly. Toss the apple slices with the butter in a large heavy pan. Add the water, lemon juice and sugar to the pan and stir until all the sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 15 minutes or until the apples are tender but not mushy. Remove from the heat and cool. Serve warm or cold. Store in an air-tight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks or in the freezer for up to 3 months.

Mix together meat, flour, onion and spices in a large bowl. Add the eggs and mix thoroughly. Form mixture into patties about 2 inches thick and 3 inches in diameter. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute meatballs until golden brown on all sides. Pour tomato sauce over meatballs in skillet and add water and mozzarella cheese to skillet. Stir gently and simmer over low heat until sauce is thickened and cheese is melted. Sprinkle with grated parmesan and bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve over spaghetti and top with additional parmesan and crushed red pepper if desired.

Wash and cut off ends of green beans. Cut beans into 1-inch pieces. In a large skillet saute onion and bacon grease until tender. Add green beans and cook until tender but not limp. Sprinkle with pepper to taste.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a medium pot. Bring to boiling over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed and quinoa is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining ingredients. Top with cheese. Sprinkle with basil and cilantro. Cover and let stand 10 minutes. Uncover and serve.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute onion in butter until tender but not brown. Add flour and stir until mixture is smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Add water. Stir until smooth. Stir in the soup. Add the cheese, spinach, and salt and nutmeg to taste. Heat through but do not boil. Serve with oyster crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare brownie mix as directed on box, except pour into a greased 9x13 baking pan and bake for 1 hour or until set. Cool for 10 minutes. While brownie is baking prepare the cheesecake filling by creaming cream cheese and sugar until light and creamy. Add the egg and vanilla and mix well. Spread on top of brownie and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until cheesecake is firm. Cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.

Heat oil in a heavy 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and brown on all sides, about 10 minutes total. Add broth and vinegarcover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until the chicken is cooked through but still tender, about 10 minutes more. Stir in cherries and cornstarch mixturecook and stir until thickened and the sauce coats the chicken and cherries, about 2 minutes more. Arrange chicken on platestop with pears and drizzle with sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Place the beef in a roasting pan and sprinkle with the garlic powder and kitchen bouquet.. Bake for 2 hours in the preheated oven.After 2 hours of cooking, turn the oven up to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C). Continue cooking the meat for another hour or so, or until the internal temperature is 130 degrees F (54 degrees C).Remove from oven and let rest for 5 minutes before cutting.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Add potatoes and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain the potatoes and return to the pot. Add the broth, butter, lemon zest, basil, pepper and lemon juice. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher until smooth. Taste for seasoning. Serve warm.

In a large wok or frying pan, heat 3 tbs. Oil and stir-fry the bean pods until crisp-tender. Remove the bean pods and set aside. In the same wok or frying pan, heat 2 tbs. Oil over medium-high heat and stir-fry the ginger for a few seconds. Add the remaining 1 tbs. Oil and stir-fry the red pepper until it turns bright red and is very soft. Add the bean pods and stir-fry until heated through. Add the sugar and stir-fry until the sugar is dissolved. Stir in the Shaoxing wine. Add the salt and stir-fry until the liquid is nearly evaporated and the dish is glossy. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 180c/350f/gas 4. Line a 20cm/8in loose-bottom tart tin with pastry and blind bake for 15 mins. Cool completely in tin. Beat butter and icing sugar together in a large bowl until pale and creamy. Beat in almond extract and sliced almonds. Add egg yolks one at a time, beating well between each addition. Add caster sugar and beat until thick and creamy. Add double cream and beat until smooth and thick. Fold in ground almonds. Spoon into pastry case and bake for 45 mins. Cool completely then spread with lemon curd and decorate with almonds and sliced lemons. Leave to set then serve chilled with whipped cream if desired.

In large bowl stir together eggs and waterset aside. In another bowl combine flour and cayenne. Heat oil for frying. Dip each pepper halfway into egg mixture then coat with flour. Fry in hot oil until lightly browned. Drain.

In a large bowl combine the olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, olives and cucumber. Let sit at room temperature for at least one hour. Place the romaine on a plate. Top with the tomatoes, olives and cucumber. Slice the pitas in half and place on the plate. Top with the feta cheese. Serve at once.
In a skillet, combine mustard, maple syrup, and wine. Cook until thickened. Add pork chops, cover. Cook over low heat until tender. Stir in apple and onions. Simmer for 10 minutes.

Crush the biscuits in a food processor until you have a fine texture. Melt the butter and allow it to cool. Cream the biscuits and the melted butter together until you get a fine texture. Beat the cream cheese with the quark. Add the cooled melted butter and the dark chocolate and continue beating until you get a smooth texture. Whisk the double cream until you get a thick consistency. Fold the cream into the cream cheese mixture. Line a pie tin with cling film and put the filling into it. Cover with the cling film and put it in the refrigerator for 24 hours. Remove the cling film and decorate with dark chocolate curls.

Cut tenderloin into 4 strips about 6 inches long and 1/2-inch thick. Season meat with lemon-pepper seasoning on both sides. In a shallow bowl or plate, mix together the flour and the eggs to make a batter. Dip the tenderloin into the batter on both sides to coat it well. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the cooking oil and fry the tenderloin until golden brown on both sides. Serve with lemon wedges.
Spread each tortilla with a little cream cheese. Layer with lettuce, turkey, red pepper and cheese. Roll up tortilla like a burrito.

In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese, mayonnaise, basil, oregano, dill weed, garlic powder and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Spread onto each tortilla. Top with turkey, lettuce and onions. Roll up tightly. Makes 4 servings.
Mix all together. Spread into pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Let cool before serving. Top with whipping cream & almonds.

Cut avocado in half lengthwise. Remove pit and scoop avocado meat out of skins and place in large bowl. Add white onion and tomato. Mash with potato masher or fork until chunky consistency. Add cilantro and mash with fork. Add salt and peppers to taste. Squeeze in lime juice and gently toss together. Serve with tortilla chips.

Wash and hull strawberries. Place in a large bowl or punch bowl. Slice or chop strawberries into pieces and stir well with lemon and condensed milk. Pour in enough soda to make it fizzy and stir. Serve over ice cubes.

In a skillet brown the chicken with the butter. Add the dressing mix. Cook and stir until the mix thickens. Stir in the soup. Heat through. Spoon over hot rice. Top with the cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Serves 4.

In a large saucepan, bring water to boil over high heat. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Remove from heat. Cool completely. Add lime juice and stir to combine. Stir in mint and refrigerate for 30 minutes or until chilled. Place in punch bowl or large container and garnish with lime slices and mint sprigs. Serve over ice.

Prepare tea according to package directions. Allow to steep until cool. Remove from teapot and pour into a large punch bowl or pitcher filled with ice cubes. Stir in mint and lemon wedges. Serve over ice cubes in tall glasses and garnish each glass with a lemon wedge and sprig of mint if desired.

Place cinnamon sticks in a small saucepan with 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat and let cool. Peel cinnamon sticks. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the cinnamon sticks and water mixture. Add the egg yolks one at a time. Stir until smooth. Add the sweetened condensed milk, coconut milk, evaporated milk and rum. Whisk until smooth. Remove from heat and serve warm or chilled. Garnish with coconut flakes.

Cut bread in half lengthwise. Slightly toast bread, then rub with cut side of garlic. Spread with olive oil. Arrange onion on bottom of bread. Top with olives and red peppers. Sprinkle with capers. Top with green onions and tomatoes. Top with parmesan cheese. Drizzle with oil. Serve.

Layer of soda crackers on aluminum foil. It is very important that you do this step. I lay the crackers 5x5 on the foil. Turn the edges up on the foil to keep the toffee in when it is poured over the crackers. Heat on high until about the hard boil stage. Pour over the soda crackers. Immediately place a layer of milk chocolate chips over this and spread. Sprinkle with nuts if desired. Cool in refrigerator until hardened and break apart into bite size pieces.

Mix together all the ingredients and chill for several hours. Just before serving, stir in the basil. Season to taste with additional garlic powder, basil and fresh ground black pepper. Serve with fresh bread.

Combine all ingredients in large pot with 8 cups water. Stir over high heat until smooth, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and let cool. Cut into cubes. Makes 14 cups. To serve, brown in olive oil in skillet or ovenproof dish, then top with pasta sauce and sprinkle with cheese.

Mix first 3 ingredients in large bowl with electric mixer at medium speed until smooth. Shape into 1 ball, then roll in walnuts. Place on waxed paperchill at least 1 hour or overnight. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut a slit in each of the top of each tomato. Place on a baking sheet. Splash some olive oil on each tomato and sprinkle with some grey poupon dijon mustard and a pinch of sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the tops of each tomato are slightly charred and blistered. Serve each tomato on a plate with some sour cream and a sprinkle of scallions and garlic clove.

Add 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1/2 cup water in a sauce pan and stir over medium heat until dissolved. Add the Jello and stir constantly until dissolved and boiling (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat and let stand for 1 minute. Stir in 1/2 cup of popped popcorn. Spread out onto a wax paper-lined baking sheet and cool for 15 minutes. Roll into balls and refrigerate for 1 hour. Makes 2 dozen balls.

In a saucepan or stockpot, heat 3 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook 3-4 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, basil, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. In a small saucepan, heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat. Add butter and cook until melted. Stir in half-and-half and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in vodka. Stir in cooked pasta and serve, garnishing each serving with a tablespoon of Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

Bake potatoes as directed on package. When cooked, cut into halves lengthwisescoop out potato pulp into medium bowlmash to desired consistency with milk, bacon, sour cream, cheeses, seasonings and green onions. Spoon into baking dishtop with remaining potato halvesbake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through.

Spread the rice on the tortilla. Top with the beans. Sprinkle with cheese. Add the guacamole, tomatoes and scallion. Fold over the sides of the tortilla. Place the other tortilla over the filling. Grill in a skillet for 2 minutes per side. Serve with salsa, sour cream or guacamole.

Wrap 1 chestnut in each piece of bacon. Secure with wooden picks or toothpicks. Place chestnuts in a large baking dish. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree F oven for 20-30 minutes or until bacon is crisp and chestnuts are heated through. Meanwhile combine ketchup, peach baby food, and sugar in a bowl until smooth. Drizzle over chestnuts. Bake 5 minutes longer or until chestnuts are glazed.

Heat the sesame oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until soft. Add the red bell pepper. Continue to cook for about 2 minutes. Add the water, soy sauce and rosemary. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 15 minutes. When the liquid is absorbed, add the peas and walnuts. Fluff with a fork and serve.
Boil water. Blanch broccoli. Drain. Add sesame seeds. Put in a serving bowl. Prepare a mixture of sesame oil, rice vinegar, and sesame seeds. Toss the broccoli in the mixture. Serve.

Sift together the first five ingredientsset aside. Beat eggs lightlyadd oil, then milkset aside. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and saltstir into egg mixture just until moistened. Fold in oatscook on hot greased griddle. Serve with butter and syrup.
Beat first 4 ingredients by hand or in blender until smooth. Pour into pie crust, bake 30 minutes until set. Remove and refrigerate overnight. Spread yogurt on top, serve.

Heat the oil in a soup pot and cook the ham until browned. Add the bread and paprika and stir until crumbly. Add the garlic and stir to blend. Pour in the water and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the eggs and salt and stir vigorously until the eggs are just set. Serve hot.
Peel and cube sweet potatoes. In large skillet, melt butter. Add sweet potatoes and honey. Cook until soft and slightly brown. Sprinkle with cinnamon.

Grease a 13x9 inch baking panin a large bowl stir together muffin mix, sour cream and eggs just until blended. Pour half of the batter into panspread with half of the corn. Top with remaining batterspread with remaining corn. Bake, uncovered, in a 375 degree oven for 40 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut into 2 inch squaresserve warm.

Place flour in a large bowl. Add 1/4 cup of the warm water and stir well to mix. Sprinkle yeast over water mixture and let stand for 5 minutes or until foamy. Add 1/2 cup of the malt drink and stir well. Combine remaining 2 cups water and 1/4 cup malt drink in a saucepan and heat over medium-high heat until boilingadd 1/2 cup sugar and cook without stirring 1 minute or until sugar dissolves (syrup will be about 220 degrees f). Remove syrup from heatcool slightly. Add syrup and 1/2 cup of the sugar to yeast mixturestir well. Add 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour and 1 1/2 teaspoons saltstir until dough begins to pull away from sides of bowl (dough will be very soft). Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surfaceknead until smooth and elastic (about 5 minutes). Place in an oiled bowlturn to coat top. Cover and let rise in a warm place (85 degrees f

Spread rye bread with mayonnaise. Sprinkle yoghurt on top. Sprinkle with horseradish and mixed herbs. Season with salt and pepper. Top with rye bread and butter. Grill over medium heat until browned. Spread lettuce on top. Top with slices of roast beef. Makes 1 open sandwich.

Combine the mustard and lemon juice to make the creamy sauce. Toss the marjoram and paprika together. Spread the sauce evenly over the fish. Sprinkle the topping over the sauce. Bake uncovered at 425 degrees f for 15 to 20 minutes or until the topping is puffed and golden and the fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve hot with your choice of potato and vegetable.
Melt butterscotch in a double boiler. Add peanut butter. Stir in peanuts and raisins. Pour onto wax paper. Let stand until cool. Break into bite-size pieces.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Peel potatoes and boil until tender. Drain and mash. Add onions and flour and mix well. Add eggs and mix again. Add enough oil to form stiff dough. Knead lightly on a floured board until dough is smooth. Divide dough into 6 balls, flatten each ball into a thin round 5 inches in diameter. Brush each round lightly with oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Meanwhile, in small bowl combine sour cream, chives and paprika. Spread each baked round with sour cream mixture. Top each round with 1/4 of the salmon. Bake for 10 minutes more or until fish is hot through. Serve hot.

Prepare the egg and breadcrumbs. Mix the breadcrumbs with the salt and the freshly ground black pepper. Sift the flour into the bowl with the breadcrumb mixture and toss to combine. Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan until very hot. Dip the florets into the beaten egg and then into the breadcrumb mixture to coat. Add the florets to the hot oil and fry until golden and cooked through. Sprinkle with the freshly chopped parsley and serve immediately.

Brown meat in large skillet. Drain. Add seasoning, beans and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer covered 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Spoon meat mixture on tortilla. Top with cheese, sour cream, onions.

Prepare the egg yolks as described in recipe for hollandaise sauce. Add the lemon juice and water to the yolks and whisk until smooth. Add the Dijon mustard and parsley and whisk to blend. Bring the butter to room temperature and whisk into the yolk mixture slowly and carefully until emulsified. Season the sauce to taste with cayenne and salt. Serve the sauce immediately or keep warm over very low heat, stirring often to prevent the sauce from breaking.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Pound the chicken between 2 sheets of wax paper until thin. Cut into strips about 1/2 inch wide. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and pepper. Cook 1 minute or until crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in sauce, bouillon, and basil. Cook 2 minutes or until hot. Remove from heat. Spray a 13 x 9 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Place a thin layer of sauce mixture on bottom of baking dish. Place chicken on top. Top with remaining sauce mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until done.

Place ingredients in bread machine pan in order given and set on rapid or dough cycle. Check consistency of dough and add additional water or flour, if necessary. At end of cycle, remove, shape, and let rise until approximately doubled. Bake in preheated 350 deg. Oven for app. 30 to 40 minute.

Prepare 1 cup of lentils with 2 cups of water. Bring to boil and simmer for 20 minutes. Heat oil in a pan and add onions. Sauté until golden. Add garlic and ginger powder. Sauté until golden. Add lentil mixture. Add turmeric and ginger powder. Sauté for 3 minutes. Add garam masala. Add fresh parsley. Simmer for 2 minutes. Serve with rice.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and chipotle powder and saute until the garlic is lightly browned. Add the shrimp and cook until pink. Stir in the butter and tequila. Cook until the mixture is thickened. Stir in the lime juice and the cilantro. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with rice.

Dust the chicken with flour and sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and brown on both sides. Add the marmalade and nutmeg. Stir in the orange juice and simmer for a few minutes. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl, combine 1 box of jell-o with water and stir well. Set aside. In a large saucepan combine milk and lemon juice and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add sugar and 1/2 of the can of crushed pineapple with juice. Stir well and let cool slightly. Pour the milk mixture into the bowl of jell-o and stir well. Fold in the remaining can of crushed pineapple. Pour the mixture into the pie crust and chill until ready to serve.
In crock pot, combine soup, sour cream, onion, and cheddar cheese. Mix well. Arrange potato wedges in a single layer on top of soup mixture. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or until tender.

In a medium bowl mix together the egg, milk, butter, and vanilla extract until smooth. Sift in the sugar and baking powder. Add the whole wheat pastry flour and salt, stirring until well mixed. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat until hot. Place 1/4 cup batter on the hot griddle or skillet for each pancake. Reduce the heat to medium low to medium and cook until the bottoms are browned, about 2 to 3 minutes. Turn over the pancake and cook until browned on the other side, another 2 to 3 minutes. Serve hot with your favorite toppings. Serves 3 to 4 people.

Cook ground turkey breast. In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked ground turkey breast, bell pepper and scallions. In another bowl combine the breadcrumbs, egg white and soy sauce. Mix with the cooked turkey. Form into 1 inch meatballs. In a saucepan heat the sauce and cook the meatballs in the sauce until the sauce is thickened. Serve with rice.

Slice cucumbers lengthwise and remove seeds. Slice again lengthwise, but thinner. Put in a jar with 1/4 cup of water. Add sugar, salt, and chilies. Cover and let sit for 3 days before serving. This keeps for several weeks in the fridge.

Mix the flour, bicarbonate of soda and salt together in a bowl. Cream the butter. Beat in the brown sugar. Blend in the flour mixture. Stir in the vanilla extract. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls on wax paper. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool for a few minutes on a wire rack. Makes about 15 cookies.

Combine oatmeal and skim milk in a microwave safe bowl. Stir. Add apple pie filling and sprinkle with spices. Mix well. Cover and cook in microwave for 2 minutes. Stir. Cook an additional minute. Serve immediately.

Pickle beets and apples and cut into quarters or eighths and slice red onion into quarters. Mix pickled beet, apple and red onion and mix well. Blend creme fraiche and beet juice together and add to meatball mixture and mix well. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Toast bread and put a layer of butter on each slice of bread. Spread a layer of mixed salad greens on toast and top with pickled beet and apple mixture and finish off with a layer of meatballs. Serve.

Heat margarine in skillet. Add onion and green pepper and cook until crisp-tender. In small bowl combine biscuits, milk and eggmix well and pour over vegetables and bacon. Cover and bake at 400 for 15-20 minutes until golden brown. Serve immediately.

Wash rice and pigeon peas well and soak for at least 3 hours or up to 24 hours. Drain and set aside. In a 6-quart pot bring 15 cups of water to a boil with bouillon granules and tomato paste. Add rice and pigeon peas and cook until tender, about 30 minutes. When the water is absorbed and the mixture has thickened, add the remaining 2 cups water and cook another 10 minutes. Add sazon and recaito and cook another 5 minutes. Serve with adobo seasoning if desired.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown meat. Add celery and onion and saute until tender, about 10 minutes. Add tomatoes with liquid and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in soup and basil. Cover and cook until meat is done, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in pasta and cook until tender, 2 to 4 minutes more. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a 10 inch cast iron skillet or 9 x 13 inch baking dish layer potatoes, carrots, asparagus, and mushrooms. Season with garlic cloves, basil, salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil and bake until vegetables are tender, 30 to 40 minutes. Serve hot.

To make spread, combine mayonnaise, mustard and basil in a medium bowl. Spread 2 slices of bread with spread. Layer with turkey and spinach. Top with cherries and goat cheese slices. Close sandwiches and serve.

In a shallow bowl place wheat germ and salt and pepper to taste. In another bowl mix egg. Coat chicken cubes with egg and then wheat germ mixture. Place on greased cookie sheet and bake at 400f for 10-15 minutes.

In a heavy saucepan combine sugar and cornstarch. Stir in water and cook over medium heat until thick. Stir in the remaining ingredients except the nuts. Pour into the pie shell. Chill and garnish with nuts.

In a heavy non-aluminum pot or pan, combine all ingredients and bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered for 1 hour or until thickened. Remove from heat. Ladle into hot jars and seal immediately. Process pints in boiling water bath for 15 minutes. Makes 8 cups of jam.

Mix together brown sugar and butter in saucepan over medium heat. Stir until melted and bubbly. Stir in milk and vanilla extract. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Mix in maple flavoring. Blend in powdered sugar, one cup at a time, until smooth and creamy. Spread between layers of cake.

Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Cook pasta for 8 minutes or according to directions on the package. While pasta is cooking, in a large frying pan or saute pan saute the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from the pan and set aside on paper towels to drain. Turn the heat to high. Add the garlic to the pan with the bacon fat. Let the garlic sizzle for about 30 seconds until it becomes fragrant then add the red onion. Cook the onion for about 3 minutes or until it just starts to soften then add the spinach and cayenne pepper. Cook the spinach until it is just wilted then add the coconut milk. Bring to a simmer then reduce the heat to low and let simmer for about 1 minute then taste and season with the sea salt and black pepper to taste. Serve the pasta topped with the bacon and spinach mixture.

Cook beans and onion in large pan until done. Cool. Add eggs and milk. Beat until fluffy. Add remaining ingredients and stir until well blended. Pour into greased 9x13 baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Cool. Cut into squares.

Toast the breadcrumbs in a dry skillet over low heat for about 5 minutes or until crisp. Cook the ravioli according to the package directions. Drain. Place the toasted breadcrumbs in a bowl. Add the marinara sauce. Add the drained pasta. Toss to coat. Serve with additional marinara sauce.

In a large skillet saute onions in olive oil until translucent. Add zucchini, squash, and seasonings to taste. Sauté until vegetables are tender. Add spaghetti sauce, stir, and simmer for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, in a second skillet heat oil over medium heat and brown pork loin chops on each side. Add vegetables to each side of pork to cover. Spoon spaghetti sauce over chops. Cover and simmer for an additional 15 minutes or until chops are cooked through. Serve over pasta.

Melt butter in skillet and brown walnuts & ramen noodles. Cool on paper towels. Combine browned noodles and walnuts with broccoli, lettuce, and onions in large serving bowl. Whisk remaining four ingredients together in mixing bowl. Dress salad when ready to serve.

Saute ground meat with oil, dried italian herb seasoning, and garlic salt until brown. Drain grease. Add tomato paste, pasta sauce, and enough water to cover the meat. Bring to a boil and then simmer until sauce thickens. In the meantime, prepare the bread by cutting each slice into 4 squares. Spread 1/2 of the sauce mixture on each square of bread. Top with 1/4 of the meat mixture. Top with a slice of cheese. Broil until the cheese is melted. Serve with sliced tomatoes.

Cut the sausages into bite-sized pieces. Place in a large bowl. Drain the beans into a colander and add them to the bowl, along with the tomatoes. Mash the mixture together using a potato masher or fork. Combine the breadcrumbs and sunflower seeds together in a small bowl. Add the seasoning, mix well, and then sprinkle over the sausage mixture. Mix gently, cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Beat eggs in small bowl. In 9"x13" pan, arrange half of shells in a single layer. Spread half of ricotta on each shell. Sprinkle half of mozzarella on ricotta. Sprinkle half of Parmesan on mozzarella. Bake 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Repeat layers with remaining shells. Spoon tomato sauce over shells. Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan. Bake 20 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 8.

Brown turkey in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain off fat. Add the remaining ingredients. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve on rolls. Serve with shredded lettuce and sour cream. Recipe.

Cook bacon with a little water in a large pan until almost crisp. Slice the white cabbage and chop the onions finely. Melt the butter with the oil in a large pan. Saut the onions and garlic briefly. Add the cabbage and bacon and continue sautting until the cabbage is soft and golden brown. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Mix the egg and milk and add them to the cabbage mixture with the soft breadcrumbs. Stir until well mixed. Pour into a greased baking dish and bake in a preheated oven at 375f for 45 minutes. Serve hot.

In a medium bowl, beat the heavy cream until it just holds its shape. Add the pumpkin puree and beat until well incorporated. Add the vanilla, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and saltbeat until just incorporated. Chill the mixture for at least 1 hour. In a medium bowl, beat the marshmallow cream until very soft. Fold the marshmallow cream into the pumpkin mixture. Chill for another hour. Gently fold in the gingersnaps. Serve in a large glass bowl or trifle dish. Top with dark rum or brandy and serve immediately.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Cook pasta until al dente. Drain well and set aside in a large bowl. In a large skillet over medium high heat cook chicken in olive oil until browned on all sides. Remove chicken from pan. Add tomato sauce and tomatoes to skilletcook over medium heat 5 minutes. Remove skillet from heat. Stir in whipping creamheat over medium heat until just warmed through. Stir in chickenheat through. Pour over pasta in bowltoss well to combine. Sprinkle with sweet peas just before serving.

Melt butter and sugar together in saucepan over low heat. Stir occasionally until caramel is thick and golden brown. Add vanilla and cinnamon. Peel and slice bananas. Add to saucepan and stir gently to coat. Spoon over ice cream and top with bananas and pecans.
Combine first four ingredients in large bowltoss to coat. Add nutstoss to coat. Drizzle with dressingtoss. Serve immediately.
Saute eggplant in oil until tender. Drain and set aside. In a heavy skillet, combine tomatoes and hot water. Add sugar, salt and pepper. Cook until thick. Stir in eggplant and heat through.

Cream together butter and sugars. Add in egg and vanilla. Combine dry ingredients and then add to wet mixture and mix well. Stir in choc chips. Drop by spoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes. Cool and store in air tight container.
Combine first four ingredients. Let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in whipping cream. Add bananas. Pour into prepared crust. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Garnish with whipped cream before serving.

Cook macaroni until tender but firm. Combine beef, tomato soup, mushroom soup, green pepper, pimiento, and 1/3 cup of the cheese in large bowl. Blend thoroughly. Pour into ungreased 3-qt casserole. Sprinkle with remaining 1/3 cup cheese. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees F. for 15 min. or until bubbly. Sprinkle with french-fried onionscut into squares. Serves 12.

Saute onion and potato in butter. Add sorrel, chicken stock and bring to boiling. Cook until vegetable are tender. In a small bowl combine egg yolk with lemon juice, add slowly to the soup stirring constantly. Heat to boiling point. Remove from heat, stir in whipping cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve with hard boiled eggs.

Heat 1 cup of the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the almonds and cook until they begin to brown, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until the almonds are golden brown and the garlic is brown but not burned. Add the tomatoes and chili and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Add the vinegar and cook until the mixture is smooth. Season with salt. Makes 2 cups.

Remove the flowers from the stalks and soak in the vodka for at least 5 days. Strain the flowers out of the vodka and discard them. Place the sugar and water in a saucepan and heat over medium heat until the water starts to boil. Stir to dissolve the sugar and let cool to room temperature. Stir in the lemon verbena leaves and pour into an airtight container. Store the liqueur for at least one month before use.

Prepare waffle mix according to package directions. Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease 2 baking sheets or 2-10 inch pie pans. Beat 1 egg white until frothy. Add 2 teaspoons waterstir until mixture is smooth and shiny. Pour into greased baking pans. Bake at 375 degrees F for 6 minutes. Remove from oven. Spread with 2 teaspoons sugar mixturesprinkle with 1 teaspoon chopped nutsreturn to oven for 2 minutes. Remove from ovencool on wire racks for 10 minutes or until completely cooled. Yield: 2 servingsMakes 2 pancakes or 24 crepes.
Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add chipotles and cook 1 minute more. Add all other ingredients and whisk until smooth. Simmer for 10 minutes. Makes about 2 1/2 cups.

Melt the caramels in a double boiler. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter. Pour into a greased pan. Cool slightly. Combine the popcorn and peanuts. Drizzle with the caramel mixture. Cool. Store in an airtight container. Makes 10 cups.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, combine lemon juice, lemon zest, zucchini and butter. Cook, stirring constantly, until liquid is evaporated. Stir in pasta. Cook 1 to 2 minutes more. Stir in parsley. Serve immediately.

Cook and drain fettuccine as directed on package. Melt butter in a skillet. Saute the onion and garlic until golden brown. Stir in mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the olive oil and the onion mixture. Cook until the onions are translucent. Add the sour cream and the milk. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir until the mixture thickens. Add the tuna and the cooked pasta. Stir until thoroughly combined. Sprinkle the pasta mixture with the parmesan. Serve immediately.

Broil chicken on high until lightly browned. Combine remaining ingredients in saucepan and cook for 2 minutes or until thickened. Pour half of the sauce into a shallow bowl and set aside. Remove meat from bones and cut into 1 inch slices. Add to reserved sauce and toss well. Heat through and spoon into a shallow bowl. Top with remaining sauce. Serve with rice and garnish with chives. Serves 6.
Beat the butter until creamy. Beat in the sugar until fluffy. Beat in the eggs. Beat in the lemon juice and zest. Beat in the honey. Spread on toast.
Peel and cube the potatoes. Cook in boiling water just until tender. Drain and add the remaining ingredients. Chill for several hours before serving.

Boil a medium-sized sweet potato until tender. Mash the potato with a fork until it has a fine texture. Stir in the pineapple. Add brown sugar, salt, cream of tartar. Heat to boiling. Stir continuously until mixture turns a medium brown. Pour into a 9-inch square pan. Cool and cut into squares. Roll each square in a light coating of almonds.

In a large stock pot, saute the onions and bell peppers in the olive oil. Add the broth, diced tomatoes and meatloaf. Cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes. Add the condensed tomato soup and worcestershire sauce. Add the water. Bring to a boil. Turn the heat down to simmer. Cover the pot and cook for about 20 minutes. Add the cheese. Stir until melted. Serve with crackers or bread.

In a 9x13-in. baking dish combine olives, dressing and pepper. Stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Drain off excess liquid. In a large bowl combine olives, cream cheese, garlic, and parsleymix well. Spread into a greased 15x10-in. jelly-roll pan. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm or cool. Makes 1-1/2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a baking sheet with a silpat or wax paper. Place 1 wonton wrapper on silpatbrush with mustard. Sprinkle with cheesestop with cayenne. Repeat until all wrappers are used. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of artichoke heart mixture onto each wonton wrapper and sprinkle each one with a pinch of pepper. Bake until filling is golden brown, about 15 minutes. Cool slightly before serving. Makes 24 tarts.

In a small bowl, combine flour, Cajun seasoning and paprika. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Brown the chicken breasts in the hot oil. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add the lemon juice, capers and parsley. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Serve over rice.

Put sugar, water, vinegar & salt in pot & cook until 260f on candy thermometer. Add karo & stir until dissolved. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form & fold into syrup mixture. Add nuts & vanilla. Pour into greased 8 x 8 pan & cut into squares when cool.

Cook the bacon till crispy. Remove bacon to a paper towel. Drain grease from pan. Brown the beef in the bacon grease. Sprinkle with the onion powder and season with salt and pepper. Divide into 6 patties. Place 1 piece of bacon and a slice of cheese on each patty. Place the patties in the pan, cover and cook over medium high heat for 4 to 5 minutes per side. When the burgers are done remove from the pan. Place one doughnut on each burger. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine the eggs, mayo, and soup. Stir in broccoli and cheese. Pour into a 9×13 glass pan. Combine the crushed crackers and melted butter. Sprinkle over the top of the broccoli mixture. Bake for 45 minutes.

Cut potatoes into thin matchstick shapes and place in a bowl. In a small bowl, mix together the peanut oil and the sea salt. Pour the oil mixture over the potatoes and toss to coat. Transfer the potatoes to a baking sheet or platter and sprinkle with the fresh flat-leaf parsley to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a deep-dish pie plate with vegetable oil. In a large bowl, mix together the vegetables and American Cheeseset aside. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs until well blended. Stir in the vegetable mixture and season with salt and pepper. Spread the egg mixture into the prepared pie plate, and bake for about 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Check the egg mixture after about 30 minutes of bakingif the top is browning too quickly, cover the top loosely with foil. Let stand for at least 10 minutes before cutting.

In a heavy medium sized sauce pan, combine the milk, heavy cream and the egg yolks. Bring the mixture to a simmer until it is thick and coats the back of the spoon, whisking constantly. Add the Parmesan and Romano cheeses and the pepper and salt. Remove from heat and let cool slightly before serving. Add a drizzle of olive oil before serving.

Bring chicken broth to a boil. Add bulgur wheat and reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Combine bulgur wheat, cucumber, tomatoes, carrot and green onions in a large bowl. Combine lime juice, chili powder, salt, garlic powder, black pepper in a bowl. Add to bulgur wheat mixture and toss well to combine. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Clean celery and cut into fine pieces. Sift together flour and sage. Cut butter into flour and sage mixture until mixture is crumbly. Add celery. Mix well and divide into 24 equal parts. Roll each part into ball and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned. Cool. When cool, cut bun in half and place one ball of dressing in each bun half. Makes 24 dressing balls.

Butter one side of the bread, then place the bread in a skillet with the butter side down on the pan. Sprinkle the sauerkraut over the bread. Add the turkey and the swiss cheese. Toast in a preheated oven for 5 minutes at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spread the dressing on the other side of the bread, then spread the dressing over the top. Cut in half and serve.
Mix all ingredients together in a greased casserole. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve hot.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook for 1 minute. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Stir in the orzo. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the half-and-half and bring back to a boil. Cook for a few minutes, until the half-and-half has reduced a bit. Stir in the peas. Season the mixture to taste with the salt. Garnish each serving with a few shavings of the cheese. Makes about 8 servings.
Preheat oven to 350. Cut apples into thin slices. Combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Cool. Makes 3 to 4 cups.

Pour first 4 ingredients in blenderprocess until smooth. Set aside. Combine beef with next 4 ingredients in zip lock bagmarinate for 1 hour in refrigerator. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heatadd steakcook until done to desired doneness. Slice steak in stripsarrange over lettucetop with tomato, onion and cheese. Drizzle with dressing just before serving.

Pre-heat oven to 375. In a bowl, mix butter, oats, brown sugar and flour until mixture is crumbly. Place half of the mixture in the bottom of a greased 13x9 baking pan. Arrange the sliced apples on top of the crumbs. Sprinkle remaining crumb mixture over apples and bake for one hour or until apples are tender. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Combine cream cheese, sour cream and ranch dressing. Stir until smooth. Fold in spinach and artichokes. Spoon into 9x13-inch pan. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and dried dill. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-35 minutes or until warm and bubbly. Serve with pita chips or crackers.

Squeeze water from thawed frozen spinach into a colander. Chop finely. Combine with cooked rice and parmesan cheese. Add an egg white for each cup of rice mixture. Stir until well blended. Shape into 1 inch patties. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees or until brown and crispy on the outside.

Chop the fruit and put into the food processor with the lemon juice and the juice of the oranges. Blend to a purée. Mix in the coconut milk and the milk and honey. Chop the coconut and add to the mixture. Blend again. Serve in chilled glasses and sprinkle with extra coconut if desired.

Cook shrimp in 1/2 cup of oil with the garlic in a medium skillet. Drain. In a 12-inch skillet or Dutch oven cook the rice in the remaining 1/2 cup oil over medium heat, stirring constantly, until lightly browned. Stir in cornstarch and brothbring to a boil. Stir in the diced tomatoes and pepperoni. Cover and simmer until the rice is tender. Stir in the peas and pepper. Serve with the shrimp and Tabasco.
Slice liver into small pieces. In a skillet heat butter. Add garlic powder. Saute liver until brown. Add oregano. Pour in water. Add tomato soup. Boil. Stir in rice. Serve over rice.

Mix merlot, garlic, brown sugar, and Worcestershire sauce in a small bowl. Cut filet into four equal pieces. Place each piece of filet in a small bowl. Pour merlot mixture over filet. Marinate in refrigerator for 1 to 1/2 hours. Grill filet 5 to 6 minutes each side or until desired doneness is reached. Remove from grill. Slice and serve.

Cut beef into strips of equal size and soak in cold water overnight. Drain and boil in fresh water until meat is soft. Drain and grind in meat grinder or food processor. Mix spices and seasonings thoroughly. Add garlic and water and mix until smooth. Stuff into large sausage casings and hang to dry for 2 to 3 days. Slice thinly and serve on pita bread or crackers.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine potatoes, onion, butter and vinegar in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a foil-lined 15x10x1-inch jelly-roll pan. Arrange vegetables in a single layer. Bake 30 to 45 minutes until vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with lemon thyme.
Mix cake mix, water, eggs and oil. Add brown sugar and choc chips. Spread into greased 8 x 8 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Cut into squares and serve.

Mix potatoes with onions and seasonings. Shape into patties. Dip patties first into egg and then into breadcrumbs, then back into egg and back into the crumbs. Fry in hot oil over medium heat. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan and gently cook the carrots and onion with the cumin seeds and chili for 8 minutes. Add the lentils and stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add milk and salt and pepper to taste. Puree the mixture in a food processor or blender. Serve hot.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the first four ingredients. Bring to a simmer and cook for one minute, stirring constantly until thick. Cool completely. Stir in the light corn syrup just before serving.
Bring beef broth to a boil. Add pasta. Cook until tender. Remove from heat. Stir in roasted red peppers. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve in bowls. Sprinkle each serving with Parmesan cheese.

Fill a cocktail shaker half full of cracked ice. Pour in the rum, tequila and grand marnier. Add the tea bag, grenadine and powdered sugar. Shake well for 15 seconds. Pour the mixture over ice cubes in a tall glass. Garnish with cherries.

Heat 1 tbsp. of the EVOO in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Season the fish with salt and pepper on both sides. Place the fish in the skillet and cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Remove from heat. Squeeze the lemon over the fish. Garnish with a lemon slice.

Bring large pot of water to boil. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. In the meantime, in a large skillet heat oil. Add mushrooms and garlic and saute until mushrooms are tender. Add sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add ricotta cheese. Stir to combine. In the same skillet saute chicken breasts over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from pan. In a medium bowl combine the tomato sauce and the cream. Season the sauce with seasoning salt. Add to the skillet with the mushroom mixture. Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Cook the spaghetti. Drain the spaghetti. Toss the spaghetti into the mushroom mixture and coat well. Sprinkle the spaghetti with romano cheese and serve. Serve each serving topped with the chicken and green onions.

Place the crackers in an ungreased 9-inch springform pan. Melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir in the sugar until dissolved. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly until it forms a light caramel color. Immediately pour over crackersspread evenly. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 10 minutes. Cool completely. Spread with Cool Whip, then top with frozen orange juice concentrate. Arrange mandarin oranges around the edge of the pan. Chill until ready to serve. Spread whipped cream over top of frozen juice concentrate. Garnish with more mandarin oranges. Store in refrigerator until serving time. Serve cold.

Place all the ingredients in a large serving dish or container. Cover and chill for at least one hour before serving. Taste for seasonings before serving. Add additional sour cream or mayo if needed for consistency. Serve with chips or crackers.
Mix all of the ingredients in a large serving bowl. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine the fish sauce, rice wine vinegar, cayenne, sugar and water in a small bowl. Season the fish with salt. Place the fish in a shallow baking pan. Place the shiitakes around the fish. Pour the fish sauce mixture over the fish. Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil. Bake the fish for about 15 minutes. Remove the fish from the pan. Keep the fish warm. Add the cilantro, green onions and sesame oil to the pan. Cook and stir until the sauce thickens. Pour the sauce over the fish. Garnish the fish with cilantro leaves. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees f (150 degrees c). beat egg whites in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high speed for about 5 minutes or until stiff and glossy peaks form. stir in 3/4 cup of the granulated sugar and the lemon juicebeat on low speed just until combined. fold in the remaining 1 1/4 cups of granulated sugar and the chocolate chipsfold just until combined. spoon the mixture onto 2 ungreased baking sheets. bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes or until the meringues are firm and crisp. sprinkle the meringues with powdered sugar immediately after removing from the oven if desired.

In a saucepan saute the mushrooms in butter until tender. Add the beef bouillon cubes to the hot water. Slowly add the flour stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Slowly add the cream and stir until smooth. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Add the saut ed mushrooms and heat through. Sprinkle with the bread crumbs and the parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until bubbly and the top is golden brown. Serve immediately.

Place a layer of blueberries into the bottom of a pie shell. Combine the flour, salt and sugar in a large bowl. Add the egg and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in sour cream and melted butter. Spread the filling over the berries. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes, or until the filling is puffy and the center is set. Cool. Serve with whipped cream.

Pour the gin, light rum, and tequila into an ice filled cocktail shaker. Shake vigorously. Pour into a large ice filled glass. Top with the coke. Add the sweet and sour mix. Stir. Top with the raspberry liquor. Garnish with the lemon.

In a medium bowl combine the first 5 ingredients. Beat with a mixer until well blended. Pour into an unbaked 9" pastry shell. Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. In a small bowl, combine the powdered sugar and the remaining 1 tablespoon water. Beat with a mixer until smooth. Spread over the top of the cooled pie. Garnish with a mint sprig.

Peel cucumbers and slice into 1/4-inch slices. In a medium bowl, combine the pickling spice, salt and pepper to taste. In a small bowl combine the sugar and the vinegar, stir until dissolved. Add the pickling spice mixture to the sugar solution, mix well. Add the cucumbers, stir to coat well. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.

In a large pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the tomato sauce and the chile and cook until the chile breaks down. Season with salt. Remove from the heat and stir in the parsley.
Prepare puddings as directed on box and allow to cool. Fold in mandarin oranges and top with whipped topping. Chill for at least 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat oil in small skillet over medium-high heat until it starts smoking. Remove oil from heatadd vinegar and cook until thickened and reduced by half, about 3 minutes. In shallow pan toss butter with vinegar mixture until smooth and shiny. Place fish in a single layer in pan. Spread butter mixture over fillets and sprinkle with salt. Bake in oven for 15 minutes until fillets flake easily when tested with fork. Serve warm.

Spread mayonnaise evenly on two pieces of the bread. Place one slice of ham on the bread. Add the onion slices and then the apples. Place the other slice of bread on top. Cook in a sandwich maker until the cheese is melted and the bread is crisp and golden brown. Enjoy.

Combine blue cheese, onion, oil, lemon juice, vinegar, garlic, dry mustard, pepper in bowl of electric mixer. Beat till smooth. Add parsley. Spread in shallow dish. Top with parsley. Serve with water crackers or celery sticks.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss tomatoes, zucchini and garlic in a bowl. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Season vegetables with salt and pepper. Spread in a single layer on baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes. Meanwhile, boil the pasta. Drain well and toss vegetables in a bowl. Add the tomato paste and pesto and mix. Serve over the hot pasta. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Garnish with the basil.

Prepare the boxed cornbread according to directions and let cool. In the meantime combine the can of creamed corn, eggs and oil in a bowl and heat in a microwave until eggs are cooked. Add the diced green chilies and onions and stir. Cut the cooled cornbread into squares and place in a shallow dish. Pour the egg mixture over the squares and let marinade a few minutes or until ready to serve. This recipe is great to take along when you need a quick lunch.

In a bowl, combine the cream cheese and ranch dressing mix. Stir in the colby cheese until well blended. Fold in bacon bits. Roll into a ball or shape into a log and refrigerate until serving time. Roll the cheeseball in chopped nuts before serving. Serve with crackers or fresh veggie dippers.
Melt butter in small pan. Add lemon and orange juice. Add rind. Salt to taste. Cook to boil. Add ginger and paprika. Add tails. Cover pan. Simmer 1 minute. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter and sugars together. Beat in eggs and vanilla until well blended. Stir in dry ingredients just until blended. Stir in morsels. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes until set. Cool completely on cookie sheet for 5 minutes. Remove to wire rack to cool completely. Store in airtight container or freeze. Makes 4 dozen.

Combine beans, onions, and ginger in a saucepan of boiling water. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain well and return to saucepan. Add remaining ingredients. Serve over rice.

Bake crust according to directions on box. While crust is baking, combine brown sugar, butter, corn syrup, vanilla and eggs. Cook and stir until boiling. Remove from heat and add cashews. Spread into baked and cooled crust. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Preheat the oven to 350. Lightly butter a 10-12 inch round baking pan. Set aside. Beat the eggs, milk, salt & pepper together in a large bowl. Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the sugar & stir until dissolved. Add the golden delicious apple & cook for about 15 minutes or until tender. Stir in the amaretto liqueur & cook for 2 more minutes. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking pan. Spread the cream cheese evenly over the top & bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes or until golden brown & bubbly. Cool slightly & serve warm.

Bake russet potatoes in oven until soft. Mash well with butter. Add milk to desired consistency and season with season salt to taste. Bake in the same dish at 400f for 30 minutes or until browned on top. Serve immediately.

Cream butter. Add sugar slowly. Add flour. Mix well. Add egg yolks. Add vanilla. Add salt. Add melted chocolate. Press into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 375F for 30 minutes. Cool. Whip together 1 cup heavy whipping cream and 2 tablespoons powdered sugar. Spread on cooled filling. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Combine chuck, dried breadcrumbs, eggs, milk and seasonings in a large bowl. Shape into 2 1/2 inch balls and place in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Bake in a preheated oven for 25 minutes. Drain off fat and place in a large saucepan. Add onions and garlic and saute in hot oil for 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce, basil and romano cheese and stir over low heat for a minute or two. Serve over the meatballs.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add vegetablessauté 5 minutes. Stir in pimiento, soup, water. Bring to a boil. Add tomato juice. Cook 5 minutes. Reduce heat. Stir in chicken. Serve with cooked rice.

Remove the stem from the broccoli florets. Wash well. Add to a large bowl. Crumble bacon into small pieces and add to large bowl. Add cashews, Splenda and cream to a small saucepan. Whisk over medium-high heat until dissolved. Pour over vegetables. Mix well. Add raisins. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Serve cold.
Place dough seamsides together. Spread with cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nuts. Bake.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix together ground beef, sliced mushrooms and onion in a large mixing bowl. Mix in garlic powder. Add egg and mix. Add tomato sauce and catsup. Add bread crumbs and mix. Form into loaf and bake in a greased 9x5 pan for one hour. Makes one loaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet. Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg until fully incorporated into the mixture. Sift together the flour, ginger, and cinnamon. Stir into the creamed mixture until fully combined. Refrigerate dough for 1 hour. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Roll balls in granulated sugar. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Spray non-stick 8" ovenproof fry pan with cooking spray. Fry onion until soft. Add asparagus. Cook until tender. Beat eggs, egg whites and cottage cheese together. Add to pan with asparagus mixture. Cook without stirring until just set. Fold in rocket. Season with lemon juice. Top with capers.

Slice the leeks in half lengthwise. Cut into 1/2 inch slices. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the oil, then the leeks. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until very tender but not brown. Add the onions, and cook for 5 minutes more. Add the tomatoes, salt, pepper and 1/2 cup broth. Reduce heat to low, and cook for 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and vegetables are tender. Stir in dill. Serve sprinkled with paprika.

Prepare the spaghetti sauce according to the recipe instructions on the package. Boil the lasagna noodle for 2 minutes less than the package directions call for. Combine the cottage cheese and eggs in a bowl until smooth. Combine the spaghetti sauce with the cottage cheese mixture in a bowl. Spread 2 cups of the mixture in the bottom of a 9 by 13 inch baking pan. Top with 3 layers of the lasagna noodles and 2 cups of the mixture. Repeat twice more with the lasagna noodles and the mixture. Sprinkle the top with the mozzarella cheese and parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered in a 375 degree f oven for 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425-degree F. In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, lime juice, and onion powder and pepperset aside. In a small bowl, combine remaining 1/4 cup breadcrumbs and butterset aside. Spray a 13-inch-by-9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Place grouper in the dish. Sprinkle the lime juice mixture over the fish. Top with the breadcrumb mixture. Bake for 15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle with parsley.

Place fillets in pan with 2 tablespoons butter. Add lemon juice and sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Cover with heavy cream and add parsley. Place mushrooms around fillets. Add 2 tablespoons butter to pan and place over medium heat until butter begins to brown. Pour wine over fillets and brown butter. Serve hot with mashed potatoes and green salad.

Bring 6 cups of boiling water to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan. Stir in 1 cup milk. Add 1/2 cup chopped onion and 1 can (10.5 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup. Stir in 3 cups long grain rice and 1/3 cup sliced mushrooms. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Add 1 cup chopped onion and 1 cup diced green pepper. In a large skillet saute 1/2 cup chopped onion in 2 tablespoons butter for 5 minutes. Add 1 cup milk and 1 teaspoon dried thyme. Stir in 1 1/2 cups cooked, cubed chicken. Cook for 5 minutes. Spoon half of chicken mixture over cooked rice mixture. Sprinkle with 1 cup chopped parsley. Spread remaining chicken mixture over parsley. Sprinkle with remaining parsley and 1 cup diced
Combine all ingredients and pour into a deep dish glass or bowl. Garnish with a cherry and serve.
Combine mustard and tabasco in small bowl. Stir in cream cheese and mayonnaise. Serve with crackers. Makes 1 cup.

In a small saucepan, combine brown sugar with the pecans and brandy. Simmer until the liquid is syrupy and the nuts are plumped and coated with the glaze, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the heatstir in the brie cheese. Spoon the mixture onto a serving platter or plate. Serve with crackers.
Cook bacon until crisp and drain well on paper towel. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, sugar, and cheddar cheese. Add bacon bits and mix well. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Blend curd and broth with ginger and next 4 ingredients. Stir in flour and cornstarch. Cut chicken into 16 strips. Dip each strip in mixture. Place strips in shallow dish coated with cooking spray. Bake for 15 minutes. Meanwhile mix together yogurt and next 2 ingredients. Serve with chicken.

Mix together cheddar cheese, cayenne and 1 1/2 cups milk until well blended. Add in extra sharp cheddar and mix until smooth. Add in the cooked macaroni. Transfer to a 9-inch square baking dish. Cut cold butter into small pieces. Mix together with remaining 1/2 cup of milk until crumbly. Sprinkle over the top of the casserole. Bake for 30 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown on top.

Heat peanut oil to a boiling temperature (it will smoke slightly). Break the eggs into a bowl (one for each person) and stir with a fork to break up the yolks slightly. When the oil is hot, quickly add the eggs to the oil (they should immediately start to set) and turn the eggs over after a few seconds with a spatula or ladle. When the eggs are half done (the whites will be solid but not hard), pour the eggs into the bowl of cooked rice (and green onions) and mix with the fork to distribute the eggs evenly through the rice. Season with sesame oil (optional) and a little salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Mix molasses, oil, vinegar and thyme in a bowl and set aside. Peel potatoes and place in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Roast in oven for about 10 minutes or until tender. Toss with the molasses mixture. Sprinkle with chives and walnuts and serve.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Add zucchini, toss to coat with oil. Cook until golden brown. Add parsley and toss to combine. Season with salt. Serve immediately.
In a large bowl, combine all fruits. In a small bowl combine sugar, lemon juice, orange juice and lime juice. Toss fruit with this dressing. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour.

Cut chicken in half and place in shallow dish. Combine flour with bouillon cube and sprinkle over both sides of chicken. In skillet melt butter and saute onion until tender. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Pour milk in and bring to a boil. Stir in flour mixture and cook until thickened. Stir in ham and cheese and remove from heat. Spoon mixture over chicken and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Carefully remove seeds and ribs from each anaheim pepper (don’t use a knife or you’ll cut into them). Fill each pepper with 1 teaspoon of cheese and a pinch of salt. Beat together egg yolks, heavy cream and salt in a small bowl. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks formfold into egg mixture. Spoon a third of egg mixture into a large ovenproof skillet (about 12-inches)spread to form a thin layer over bottom of skillet. Lay peppers on top of egg mixturecover with remaining egg mixture. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until topping is golden browntop with remaining shredded cheese before serving. Makes 4-6 servings.

Place 1-1/2 cups strawberries in the bottom of a baking dish. Drain mangoes and reserve liquid. Coarsely chop strawberries with a knifecut mangoes into bite-size chunks. Spread berries in bottom of dish. Sprinkle with coconut. Combine flour, sugars, ginger, oats, and lemon juice in a large bowl. Drizzle with strawberry-mango liquid and stir until moistened. Fold in buttersprinkle mixture over the berries. Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat broiler or grill. Combine soy sauce, sherry wine, garlic clove, ginger, honey and water in a small bowl. Heat through in a saucepan until boiling. Coat the halibut with the sauce. Place on a broiler pan or grill rack about 4 inches from the heat source. Broil or grill for 4 minutes on each side or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.
In a pitcher combine the rums and brandy. Add the triple sec and OJ. Pour into tall glasses and garnish each glass with a lime.

Clean out the mushrooms and set aside. In a large saut pan heat olive oil and butter until the butter melts. Add the breadcrumbs and toast them until they turn golden brown. Add the minced garlic, the parmesan cheese and the oregano and mix well. Add the Italian parsley and mix well again. Fill the mushrooms with the stuffing. Place the stuffed mushrooms in a baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes until the topping is lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Cut the tomatoes in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and pulp. Arrange the halves cut side up in a shallow baking pan and sprinkle with the sugar and seasonings. Drizzle the oil over the tomatoes and roast for 2 hours in a 250 degree F. oven until the tomatoes have dried and are wrinkled.
Slice zucchini and squash thin. Saut in a skillet with onions and garlic until tender. Stir in sauce. Cook until heated through. Serve over hot pasta. Garnish with cheese and basil.

Combine evaporated milk, sugar & salt in medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until it reaches the soft ball stage. Remove from heat and stir in marshmallows and white chocolate chips until melted. Stir in lime rind and juice and pour into buttered 8x8 pan. Let cool for 2 hours and cut into squares.

Stir dry ingredients together. Add liquid, mix well. Divide dough into four parts. Roll each part out into a circle about 6 inches wide. Cut each circle into four triangles. Put on cookie sheet with the tips of the triangles pointing up. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until lightly browned on top.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a large bowladd basil and chili powdertoss gently to coat. Preheat oven to 375 F. Place potato mixture in a 2-qt. baking dishsprinkle with flourtoss gently to coat. Bake 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with olives.
