Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine rice and water in a saucepanbring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer 30 minutes or until rice is tender. Coolfluff rice with a fork. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chili sauce, shrimp, and almondssaute 3 minutes or until shrimp are pink. Remove shrimp mixture from skillet. Stir coconut milk and rice into skillet. Cook and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with green onion.

Boil potatoes until fork tender. Drain and set aside to cool slightly. In mixing bowl add cream of celery soup, mayonnaise, white vinegar and black pepper. Mix until combined. Add celery ribs, green peppers, green onions, hard-boiled egg and cooled potatoes. Stir gently to combine. Chill overnight.
Mix all ingredients and bake at 350f. for 25 minutes.
Rub mixture of soy sauce, ginger, garlic and worcestershire sauce onto chicken. Heat oil in frying pan. Add chicken and saute until done. Serve over rice.
Mix first 3 ingredients. Heat oil over med-high heat in a grill pan. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add to pan. Cook 4 to 5 min per side. Drizzle with vinegar mixture. Cook 3 more min.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, bring chicken broth and light italian dressing just to a boil. Add chicken breasts and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Add carrots and continue cooking until chicken and carrots are tender and cooked through. Add stewed tomatoes and pasta and cook until pasta is tender and carrots are almost tender. Season with italian seasoning and garlic powder. Serve in bowls garnished with parmesan cheese. Makes 2 servings.

Trim the excess fat from the steak and cut into small pieces. In a heavy-based pot over medium heat fry the steak with the shallots and garlic for about 5 minutes. Add the fish sauce and the chicken broth. Bring to a boil and add the sugar and the black pepper. Lower heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add the spinach and the lemon juice. Season with salt and red pepper. Serve with rice.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine flour, baking powder, salt, and 1/2 cup butter in bowlcut with pastry blender until crumbly. Add sour creamstir with fork until moist dough forms. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over doughpress into dough with fork until mixed. Turn onto lightly floured surfaceknead gently 4 times. Roll dough 1/2 inch thick. Cut with 3-inch round cutterplace 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Brush with watersprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Bake 12 to 14 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Yield: 8 servings (serving size: 1 scone)

Prepare marinade by combining oil, soy sauce, green onions, garlic, lime juice and red pepper flakes in a small bowl. Set aside. Cut meat into 1/4-inch strips and place in a large plastic zip-lock bag. Add prepared marinade and stir to blend well. Refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours. Remove meat from bag and add to grill pan. Cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side until desired doneness is reached. Serve with rice and sour cream or guacamole.

Soak 1 pound dried garbanzo beans in 2 cups cold water overnight. Drain and rinse. Place garbanzo beans in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until tender, 2 to 2-1/2 hours. Drain and cool. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine garbanzo beans and remaining ingredients in a food processor. Process until smooth. Heat 1/2 inch of oil in a deep fryer or heavy-bottomed skillet to 375 degrees F. Form beans into 1/2-inch balls and drop into hot oil. Fry until golden brown and crisp, about 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Serve in pita bread with lettuce, tomato and tahini sauce.

Spread cream cheese on top of french bread. Sprinkle with shredded parmesan and chopped fresh basil. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes. Slice the tomatoes and place on top. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar.

Pound the tenderloins to 1/4 inch thickness. Season all sides with salt & pepper. Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Saute the tenderloins until browned on the outside and cooked through. Remove to a plate, add tomatoes and artichoke hearts. Cook until tomatoes are slightly wilted and softened. Return the tenderloins to the skillet and drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and oregano. Toss and serve.

In a large skillet over medium heat, combine the olive oil, garlic cloves and jalapeno pepper. Saute until garlic is golden brown. Add the red pepper flakes and cook another minute or two. Toss in the greens and continue to saute until tender but still brightly coloured, about 5-6 minutes. Add the sherry wine vinegar and salt to taste. Toss well and serve immediately.

In saucepan combine all ingredients except the butter. Bring mixture to a boil. Remove from heat. Add the butter. Stir well. Pour over the popped popcorn. Shape into balls with buttered hands. Allow to cool.
Melt the butter in a pan. Saute the halibut fillets on both sides for about 3 minutes per side or until just done. Add the lemon juice and the lemon pepper and sprinkle with salt.

Heat oven to 400f. Beat egg lightly in medium bowl. Add chili sauce and beat well. Add onion and parsley and beat until blended. Add round and mix thoroughly. Press mixture into 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake uncovered for 1 hour or until cooked through. Meanwhile, prepare glaze. Stir together glaze ingredients in small bowl. Serve glaze over meatloaf. Yield 8 to 10 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9x13 pan. In bowl combine oil, water, eggs and cake mix until blended. Pour into pan. Bake 25-30 minutes or until done in middle. While cake is baking prepare cherries. In microwave safe container combine cherry pie filling and miniature marshmallows. Microwave on high 2-3 minutes or until mixture is hot and marshmallows are melted. Stir until smooth. Cool slightly, pour over warm cake. Cool completely before slicing into 30 squares.

Spread crepe with butter. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Place ham and mozzarella cheese on one half of crepe. Roll up. Place in foil. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes. In the meantime, saute chicken in butter with seasoning salt. Slice chicken and place on top of saltimbocca crepe. Serve with plum tomatoes.

Layer cream cheese, sour cream, oregano, garlic powder, crushed red pepper flakes in a 9"x13" baking dish. Spread pizza sauce over cream cheese layer. Top with pepperoni, onion, and pepper. Spread mozzarella over all. Bake at 350F for 20 minutes until bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

In a large zip-top bag or crock-pot, combine the chicken, water, oil, paprika and salt. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours or up to overnight. Place the chicken in the slow cooker. Cook for 6-8 hours or until the chicken is falling apart. Serve over rice.

Combine first three ingredients in a sauce pan. Stir over medium heat until boiling. Boil for one minute. Remove from heat. Add all other ingredients except for the peanut butter. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Spread with a knife and then sprinkle with chopped peanuts. Allow to cool.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute bacon bits and sweet onion until bacon is crisp and onion is tender. Stir in thyme. Add broth and beans, bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes or until beans are tender. Add coleslaw mix and simmer 30 seconds longer. Serve with italian cheese blend and cracked black pepper to taste.
Prepare jello. Add drained pineapple. Stir until dissolved. Pour into 13x9x2 pan and refrigerate until set. Combine cream cheese and whipped toppingspread over jello. Refrigerate until serving time.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Beat together cabbage, milk, and eggs. Combine flour and rest of dry ingredients. Add the cabbage mixture and mix thoroughly. Fold in onion flakes. Spoon into greased 12 cup muffin pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes.

Prepare cake mix according to instructions on box. Grease a bundt pan or tube pan. Bake cake according to instructions on box. While cake is baking, combine gelatin with boiling water in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until gelatin is completely dissolved. Remove from heat and let stand for about three minutes or until mixture thickens to a light paste-like consistency (do not let it harden). Add strawberry gelatin to mixture, stirring until evenly blended. Add milk and beat with a whisk until mixture is smooth. Remove cake from oven when done, and immediately poke holes in cake with the tip of a wooden skewer. Pour cooled gelatin mixture over hot cake in pan. Let stand for five minutes. Invert onto a plate. Drizzle with frosting and sprinkle with coconut.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a skillet, cook and drain ground beef. Add onions and cook until tender. Add mushroom stems and pieces and cook until tender. Add diced tomatoes, water and chili seasoning mix. Bring to a boil and cook until heated through. Stir in spaghetti and heat through. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

In slow cooker, arrange chops in single layer. Add mushrooms, soup, beer, onion soup mix, water. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours or high for 2 1/2 hours. Serve over cooked noodles or mashed potatoes. You can also add or remove garlic per preference.

Wash all greens well, drain, and set aside to dry. In a frying pan over low heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon with slotted spoon to a paper towel to drain. In the same pan over low heat add the garlic clove. Cook for 1 minute. Add the greens and cook for 2 minutes, or until just wilted. Add the vinegar, sugar, and cook for 30 seconds more. Toss the greens in the pan to coat evenly. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve with the bacon and the boiled egg cut into quarters.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Melt butter in skillet. Add the chilies. Cook 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the cheese to melt. Add the chicken. Heat through. Sprinkle with the cilantro. Spread 1/4 cup salsa onto a tortilla. Top with 1/2 cup of the cheese mixture. Add another tortilla. Repeat with remaining tortilla. Cut each into 6 wedges.

Heat olive oil in skillet. Add mushrooms. Saute until lightly browned. Pour in wine and broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until liquid has reduced by half. Blend flour with water until smooth. Stir into pan. Cook over low heat until thickened. Stir in parsley flakes. Season to taste. Serve over steak, chicken or other meat.

Bring to a boil 4 cups of water with 2 tablespoons of light brown sugar, 2 tablespoons of dark brown sugar. Stir well. Add 2 squeezed limes. Cool. Pour into a pitcher. Add 1/4 cup salt. Add 2 whole cloves& 2 cinnamon sticks. Serve over ice. Garnish with orange slices.

Mix together the turkey breast, boiled ham and cheddar cheese in a small bowl. Cut the carrots and celery ribs into bite-sized pieces. Divide the salad mixture evenly between two bread slices. Serve with salsa and ranch dressing. Cut the angel food cake into cubes. Divide the cubes evenly between two bread slices. Serve with strawberries.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring the cream to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in chocolate chips and rum extract until blended. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until firm enough to form into balls. Roll mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll into walnut halves. Refrigerate until firm. Melt white chocolate. Dip truffles into white chocolate. Sprinkle with chopped nuts. Let stand until set.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line muffin cups. In large bowl combine all dry ingredients. In smaller bowl combine applesauce, egg white, vanilla. Add to dry ingredients. Fold in apples. Fill muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake 18-20 minutes or until lightly browned.

Combine flour, baking powder and seasoningscut in margarine till the mixture resembles coarse meal. Beat together the eggs, milk, and cheesestir into the flour mixture until dough is smooth. Chill 15 minutes. Divide dough in halfshape each half into a rectangle about 3/4 inch thick. Cut into strips about 1/2 inch widetwist into 4 inch ropes. Place ropes about 1/2 inch apart on greased baking sheetbake at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes until light brown. Makes about 2 dozen.
Mix first 4 ingredients well. Roll into ball and place on cookie sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes at 350 degrees. Dip in powdered sugar while warm.

Cook leek in butter over low heat until tender. Add cream and milk and stir until thickened. Add mayonnaise and cook 2 minutes more. Stir in artichokes and pimentos. Pour mixture into a greased 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. Combine panko and Parmesan and sprinkle over top of casserole. Bake at 400f for 30 minutes or until browned and bubbly.

In skillet brown turkey, crumble. Combine broccoli florets with water until tender, drain. In saucepan combine all other ingredients. Cook over low heat until cheese is melted and thoroughly blended. Place 1/2 cup mixture over each serving of rice. Top with 1/2 cup turkey mixture and 1/4 cup broccoli mixture. Sprinkle with cheese mixture. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oil in medium nonstick skillet over medium heat until hot. Add onion and garliccook 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add bell pepper and cook 2 minutes longer. Stir in tomatoescook 2 minutes longer. Stir in beanscook 2 minutes longer. Season with pepper. Serve on toasted baguette slices.

In a saucepan combine all the above ingredients and boil until thick and clear. Put the drumsticks in a glass bowl and pour the sauce over them. Leave the drumsticks in the sauce in the fridge overnight. The next day remove the drumsticks from the sauce and heat rice in the oven as per directions on package. Serve the drumsticks with the rice and enjoy.

Combine the first five ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook to soft ball stage. Remove from heat and add pecans and the last two ingredients. Beat until the mixture loses its gloss and spread into a lightly greased and floured 10x15x1 inch baking pan. Chill until firm and then cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 8x8 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, combine salt, walnut oil, matzo meal, lemon juice and eggs until smooth. Stir in apples, sugar and cinnamon. Spread in baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool slightly. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a blenderprocess until smooth. Pour into an 8-cup glass serving bowl. Stir in the half and half, banana schnapps and the honeystir until blended. Sprinkle with the coconut. Chill until ready to serve.

Melt butter in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, mustard and onion. Cook, stirring constantly 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in ketchup and vinegar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 minute. Stir in chili powder and lemon juice. Serve as a basting sauce for barbecue, or combine with chopped or shredded beef, chicken or pork. Simmer until heated through and flavor is well blended.

Prepare coffee and let cool to room temperature. Place coffee in 2-quart saucepan and add cinnamon stick. Heat to boiling and remove from heat. Peel and slice pears. Pour coffee into large bowl and add sliced pears. Let soak overnight. Heat coffee mixture to boiling in saucepan. Add brown sugar and stir until dissolved. Pour into 6 ramekins. Cover. Bake at 350°F 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Drizzle each serving with 1 teaspoon dark rum and serve. Serves 6.

Chop the mushroom fine and saute with the onion until brown. Add the lemon juice, butter, and salt. Chop the parsley fine. Whip the eggs until light and frothy. Add the parsley, the mushroom mixture, and the salt. Cook like an omelet. Serve with the parsley.

In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add the egg and the egg yolk and mix until well blended. Add the flour mixture and the lime juice and mix until well blended. Stir in the lime zest and the white chocolate chips. Drop dough by the teaspoonful onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes or until just set. Remove from cookie sheet and cool on wire racks. Makes about 5 dozen

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Remove 4 breadsticks from can. In a small bowl, combine the cooked bacon, egg and fresh parsley. Stir until blended. Cut breadsticks in half crosswise. Press the cut sides into the center of each half of breadstick. Spoon bacon mixture into centers of breadsticks. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly before serving.

Melt caramels in heavy pan over low heat. Stir constantly. Add butter and oil and mix well. Remove from heat. Add marshmallows and stir until melted. Stir in puffed corn. Pour into buttered 9x13-inch pan. Let cool. Cut into squares.

In a large saucepan bring water to a boil. Stir in carrotsreduce heat to medium-low. Coversimmer for 10 to 12 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain carrotsreturn to saucepan. Stir in cinnamon and brown sugarheat through.

In a large saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup, water, and margarine over medium heat. When mixture comes to a boil, insert a candy thermometer and cook for 10 minutes. Stirring constantly, bring mixture to a boil again, then remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and nuts. Pour onto buttered waxed paper. Cool 5 minutes or until firm enough to handle. Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper and let cool completely. Makes 60 pieces.

In a large teapot combine lemongrass, sugar, ginger, and mint leaves. Add hot water and steep for about 5 minutes. Pour through mesh strainer into a 2-quart pitcher filled with ice cubes. Add green tea to the pitcher and stir until well blended. Serve immediately over ice in tall glasses. Garnish each glass with a sprig of mint.

To make the sorbet. Place mangoes and 1/2 cup water in a food processor or blender and puree. Strain through a sieve to remove seeds and pulp. Return the puree to the processor and add the remaining water and the sugar. Process until smooth and freeze according to manufacturer’s directions. To make the sauce. Combine the first four ingredients in a bowl and refrigerate for at least two hours before serving. Serve the sorbet in chilled bowls and drizzle the sauce over the top.

Mix ground beef, saltines, onion and eggs together in a bowl. Form into patties. Brown in a frying pan with a little bit of oil. Pour on your favorite brown gravy mix and simmer until heated through. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans or any other side you wish.

Heat oil in a 4-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Add okra and onion. Cook and stir until okra is soft and lightly browned, about 6 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until okra is tender. Stir in garlic and basil. Cook and stir 1 minute longer. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Soak gelatin in cold water, let stand 10 minutes. In blender container place oranges, apricots, sweetener and gelatin. Process until smooth. Add yogurt, egg whites, and rind. Blend 30 seconds more. Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving. Garnish with orange slices.

Place the iceberg lettuce in a large bowl. Mix together the dressing ingredients in a small bowl. Pour the dressing over the iceberg lettuce and toss to coat. Add the carrot to the salad. Serve with toasted sesame seeds.

Cook spaghetti according to directions. In a large skillet, saute the onions and green pepper in butter until tender. Add the chicken. Cook until done. In a small saucepan combine the soup, milk and colby cheese. Add the seasonings and cook over low heat until the cheese has melted and the mixture is well blended. Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet with the vegetables and chicken. Add the cheese sauce and stir until heated through. Serve immediately. Serves 6-8.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, warm the oil. Add the flour and whisk to combine. Cook the flour for 1 to 2 minutes. Slowly whisk in the stock until smooth. Add the tomato sauce, dried oregano and ground cumin and whisk to combine. Add the salt and whisk to combine. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes. Serve with enchiladas.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place pearl onions in a bowl with the olive oil and cover with water. Bake for 30 minutes until tender. Place the onions on a clean towel and rub the oil off the skin. In a small bowl, mix together the balsamic vinegar, water, sugar and salt. Pour the mixture over the pearl onions and allow to set for 30 minutes. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 2 days.
Remove seeds and pits from avocado. Mash with a fork or potato masher. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.

Brew the tea according to package directions. Add the chocolate syrup and the splenda. Add the creamer until desired sweetness is reached. Serve over ice, topped with whipped cream. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan combine milk, sugar and salt over medium heat. Cook until mixture thickens to the consistency of heavy whipping cream, stirring frequently and scraping bottom of pan with rubber spatula. Stir in half and half and extract and chill mixture to room temperature. In a large mixing bowl whip heavy cream with electric mixer on high speed until it is almost to soft peaks stagedo not over beat. In another bowl beat egg yolks with an electric mixer until they are pale yellow and thick. With mixer on low speed gradually add about one cup of the hot milk mixture to egg yolks, stirring constantly to temper yolks and avoid curdling. Then add egg mixture to hot milk mixture and stir until smooth. Pour mixture through a strainer into a bowl and stir to remove any lumps. Cover surface of custard with plastic wrap and chill at least four hours or overnight. Once custard is chilled process custard base in an ice cream machine according to manufacturers instructions. When almost frozen add raspberries and blackberries and continue processing until mixture is thick and creamy and resemb

Combine 2 cups of water and 2 tablespoons of instant coffee in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and let the mixture cool completely. Add sugar and stir to dissolve. Serve over ice with milk if desired.

Cut eggplant into 1/2 inch rounds. Place in bowl with olive oil. Toss to coat. Place on baking sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut melon into 1/2 inch cubes. Place 1/4 of eggplant on a tortilla. Top with 1/4 of melon. Sprinkle with soy sauce. Top with 1/2 teaspoon brown sugar. Add a pinch of smoked paprika. Drizzle with a little bit of vinegar. Top with a pinch of cumin. Add 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Roll up tortilla. Secure with toothpicks. Repeat with remaining tortillas.

In a large pot, saute the onions in 2 tablespoons of the butter until soft. Add the carrots and cook until slightly soft. Add the potatoes and cook for 30 minutes. Add the stock and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to low. Cook for 1 hour. Cool slightly. In a blender, puree until smooth. Stir in the cilantro. In a large bowl, combine all remaining ingredients. Garnish each serving with a dollop of sour cream.

Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add garlic and cook until it is brown. Add escarole and cook until soft. Add broth and beans and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Season with red pepper flakes and parmesan cheese. Serve with bread.
Brown meat in large pot and drain. Add all remaining ingredients and stir until well mixed. Cook over low heat until bubbly. Serve topped with cheese and sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350. Brown chicken and ham in butter. In a bowl, mix soup and sour cream. Add breadcrumbs and monterey jack. Spread over top of chicken mixture. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

Bring the water to a boil in a medium saucepot. Add the steel-cut oats and salt. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot and cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally until the oatmeal is creamy and the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the pumpkin puree and cinnamon stickheat through. Serve in a bowl topped with fresh blueberries, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Soak cheese in ouzo. Dredge cheese with flour. Heat oil until almost smoking. Saut cheese, brown for 1 minute on each side. Flame with more ouzo. Transfer to serving platter. Squeeze lemon slice over top. Sprinkle with oregano. Garnish with olives. Serve with tomato, pita bread and kalamata olives.
Place all in a large bowl. Drizzle with lemon juice. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Chill for at least 30 minutes.
In 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, add butter and diced tomatoes. Stir and cook 1 minute. Add evaporated milk and salt and pepper to taste. Cook until heated through. Makes 2 cups
Combine all spices in small bowl. Sprinkle both sides of chops with spice mixture. Let rest for 30 minutes. Brown chops in hot oil for 3 minutes per side.

Hard boil eggs in water for 10 minutes then leave them to cool. Meanwhile take sausage meat and put into a bowl and add egg and fat to it and season with salt & pepper. Roll into golf ball sized balls and flatten to a round shape about 3 inches in diameter. Wrap the sausage meat around each egg. Then roll in breadcrumbs and fry in hot oil until cooked through and brown in color. Serve hot with a salad of your choice.

In a small skillet, saute the bacon until lightly browned. Drain wellset aside. In a small bowl, combine the shallots, garlic, brown sugar, orange juice, balsamic vinegar, grainy mustard, olive oil, salt to taste and reserved baconmix well. Drizzle over salad greens or other fresh vegetables. Serves 4 to 6.
Mix together well. Serve with crackers.

In a large bowl combine the flour and the baking powder. Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the sour cream until moistened. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Divide the dough into 3 pieces and form each piece into a 6-inch rope. Twist the 3 ropes together and place the dough on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes. Cut with a sharp knife into 1-inch pieces and place on a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for 3 days or freeze up to 1 month. Makes about 4 dozen muffins.
In a mixing bowl beat together cream cheese & picante sauce until well blended. Fold in shrimp, mix well. Serve with crackers.

Heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic, onion & jalapeno. Saute until softened about 2 minutes. Add tomatoes & cook until reduced to a thick sauce. Add collards & bay leaves. Cook for 10 minutes. Add thyme & season with salt & pepper. Stir to combine. Cover & cook until tender. Uncover & stir. Cook for 5 minutes or until desired thickness. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375. Heat a cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Coat skillet with oil. Pat steaks dry and rub with 1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper. Add steaks and cook until golden, 4-5 min. per side. Remove skillet from heat and transfer to oven. Roast until steaks are medium rare, 8-10 min. Let rest 5 min. and cut into 1/4-inch slices. In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar and butter. Toss with greens and sprinkle with oregano. Slice steaks and serve with greens.
Preheat oven to 350. Spray 13 x 9 baking dish. Layer in bottom of dish. Layer in next 3 ingredients. Top with remaining 2. Bake for 40 minutes.

Sprinkle steaks with salt and pepper. In frying pan brown steaks on both sides. Add onions. Sauté until tender. Add sauerkraut and wine. Stir. Add paprika and garlic cloves and stir until hot. Add steaks and heat through.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine potatoes, onion and 1/4 cup salsa. Spread mixture in a 13-inch by 9-inch baking dish. Beat eggs and salsa in a small bowl until blended. Stir in sausage, 2 cups cheese and salt and pepper. Pour over potatoes. Bake 30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until set.

Place a large skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil and heat until shimmering. Add spinach leaves. Cook and stir until just wilted. Drain excess liquid. Add garlic, shallot, tomatoes, balsamic vinegar. Cook 2 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve warm or chill.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Heat 1/2 tablespoon oil and brown the beef. Add the onion and saute until translucent. Stir the garlic into the meat. Add the bay leaf and cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in the wine and scrape the bottom of the pan to loosen the browned bits. Stir in the salt and pepper and cook for 2 minutes more. Pour the remaining 1/2 tablespoon oil over the beef and mix well. Transfer the beef mixture to a 2-quart ovenproof dish. Stir the puree into the wine mixture and pour over the beef. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until the meat is tender and the sauce is thickened. Sprinkle with the vinegar and serve hot.

Brown the ground turkey in a saute pan and add the salt and black pepper and the white onion and cook until the onions are translucent. Add the garlic powder and the white mushrooms and cook until the mushrooms are soft. Add the pasta to the sauce and mix well. Add the creamy portabella mushroom soup and the tofutti better-than-cream-cheese and mix well. Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve over your favorite pasta.

Place the halvah in a bowl, cover with wine and set aside for a few minutes. Peel and core the apples. Fill with halvah mixture and place in baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for about an hour or until tender. Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving with a dollop of whipped cream.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to boil. Add broccoli, zucchini, beans, snow peas and asparagus. Cook for about 4 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain. Toss with olive oil. Add almonds. Sprinkle with vinegar. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Place potatoes and brussels sprouts in a microwave safe bowl with chicken broth. Cook for 4-5 minutes stirring every two minutes until potatoes are tender. Add fresh ground pepper and fresh chives and parsley. Serve immediately.

Place the chicken pieces and the remaining ingredients in a shallow glass baking pan. Turn to coat. Cover and bake for 1 hour. Uncover the pan and continue baking until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear when a knife is inserted, about 1 hour more. Serve immediately.

Cube the tofu into 1 cm cubes. Coat a fry pan with a little oil. Add the tofu cubes, sprinkling the cubes with a little sea salt. Cook over medium heat until the cubes are golden brown and crisp on the outside (about 15 minutes). Make the sauce by mixing the peanuts, water, vinegar, soy sauce, chilli, garlic, sesame oil, sugar and cornflour together in a bowl until smooth. Drizzle over the cubes and serve with the salad.
Cut the tomato into wedges. Pour on the dressing. Sprinkle with oregano and parmesan cheese if desired.

Combine the sugar, soy sauce, water and wine in a small bowl. Add the garlic. Set aside. Pound the chicken thighs with a rolling pin or heavy skillet to flatten them. Heat the butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken thighs to the pan and cook until browned on one side. Flip them over and add the wine. Reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan with a lid and cook for 15 minutes. Stir in the sugar mixture and cook for 5 minutes or until the sauce is thick. Serve hot.
Combine all the ingredients in a plastic bag. Add the beef and marinade for 2-3 hours. Skewer and cook on medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side. Serve with baked potatoes or rice.

Cut cabbage into wedges and slice onion thinly. Place in a large pot with carrot and chilies. Pour boiling water over it and stir. Cover and let stand for about 20 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Drain off water and discard chilies. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over cabbage. Let cool and place in glass jar in refrigerator. Serve over beans and rice or as a side dish with meal.
Boil potatoes with water and bouillon cubes. Add chopped ramps, milk, pepper, and salt. Puree with a blender.

Place all ingredients in pan of machine and make as directed. After mixing is done, put in greased pans and let rise for 30 minutes. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. I m a beginner and this is my first attempt at making my own bread. It tasted like a delicious dinner roll. I m not sure what I did wrong. I ve since learned to use an instant read thermometer and this dough was only at 185 degrees. I was shocked that it even rose. Maybe I just need more practice. It was tasty but I ve since made white bread and it is much better. I love this recipe. The first time I made it I had to add a cup more of flour and I didn t use instant yeast. I made it again and used instant and it was perfect. It is my new favorite bread recipe.

In a medium saucepan combine coconut milk and milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and add sugar and egg. Cook for 1 minute until thick. Remove from heat. Add tapioca and stir until combined. Return to heat and bring mixture slowly to a boil. Continue stirring until mixture begins to thicken. Remove from heat and add vanilla and coconut extract. Cool slightly. Fold in coconut. Pour into dishes and chill until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Mix mayonnaise, salt and pepper in a bowl. Butter 2 slices of bread and spread with mayonnaise. Arrange fish on bread. Top with remaining bread and press to sandwich. Heat butter in a small saute pan over medium heat. Add fish sandwich and cook until fish flakes with a fork. Place on a baking sheet. Top with dill and bake 2 to 3 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine gooseberries and water in a heavy 3 quart saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil for 30 seconds. Stir in the sugar and return to a boil. Boil over high heat for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice. Skim off the foam that forms on top. Ladle into jars and seal with hot lids. Process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes.

Wash, halve and pit peaches. Remove skins and chop fine. Combine with sugar in saucepan. Stir in pectin and lemon juice. Bring to boil. Boil hard for 1 minute. Remove from heat and skim off foam with spoon. Ladle hot mixture into hot sterilized jars. Seal with 2 piece lids. Process in boiling water bath 10 minutes.

In a stock pot add water to cover chicken and all the remaining ingredients, except the parsnips. Bring to a boil and skim the scum. Lower the heat to a simmer for 30 minutes. Remove the chicken and let it cool before removing the meat from the bones. Discard bones and skin and cut meat into bite-size pieces. Return the meat to the pot and add the parsnips. Simmer another 20 minutes and season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serve warm or cold with noodles and buttered matzo balls or dumplings.

In a medium bowl combine 2 cups milk and cornstarch. Whisk until smooth. Place in a saucepan and heat to boiling on medium heat. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add in 2 1/2 cups raspberries and vanilla. Stir well. Cool to room temperature. Pour into pie crust. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup raspberries and 1/3 cup sugar. Let stand for 1 hour. Spoon over top of pie. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with whipped cream.
Boil potatoes until tender. Peel and mash with a mixer or ricer. Add sour cream and cream cheese, horseradish and onion powder to taste. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a large bowl. Set aside. Beat together shortening, sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, and mashed bananas in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Gradually stir in the dry mixture just until blended. Stir in raspberries by hand with a spoon. Spoon the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, saute onion in olive oil for 5 minutes or until tender. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add squash. Cook until tender. Season with seasoning salt and fresh ground black pepper. Serve topped with Parmesan cheese.

Put popcorn in large mixing bowl. In large saucepan, combine syrup, brown sugar, granola and peanut butter. Cook over medium high heat, stirring constantly to boiling. Boil for 1 minute. Stir in butter and peanuts. Pour over popcorn mixture. Stir lightly until evenly distributed. Shape into balls using slightly greased hands. Roll in coconut.

Brown ground beef. Drain. Add onion through garlic and cook until soft. Stir in sauce. Season. Add mostaccioli. Cover. Simmer until mostaccioli is tender. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 13x9x2-inch baking pan with shortening. In a large bowl combine cake mix, marshmallows, cereal, chocolate chips, and buttermix well. Spread in prepared panbake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from ovencool 10 minutes. In a small saucepan combine sweetened condensed milk and chocolate chipsheat and stir over low heat until melted and smooth. Spread over cooled bar. Cool completely before cutting into bars. Store covered at room temperature.

In saucepan combine butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg. Cook over medium heat until melted and bubbly. Stir in rum. Cook 1 minute longer. Add peach schnapps, stir well. Arrange peach slices in serving dishes. Pour sauce over top. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large pot of boiling water, add potatoes and cook for 15 minutes or until fork tender. Drain potatoes and mash with a potato masher. Add 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and half-and-half. Stir to combine. Season with pepper and set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon minced garlic and 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh sage. Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add 2 tablespoons finely chopped shallot and 1/4 cup sour cream. Stir to combine. Remove from heat and add 1/4 cup finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese. Season with kosher salt and pepper. Add potatoes and stir to combine. Transfer to a baking dish. Top with remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup of finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano. Bake for

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Arrange florets on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Toss to coat evenly. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast in the preheated oven until golden brown and tender when pierced with a fork, about 30 minutes. Serve warm as a vegetable side dish.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Unroll doughseparate into 16 squares. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Brown hot dogs until doneslice and place on squares. Sprinkle each with about 1 tsp. Parmesan cheese and fold dough around hot dogs. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly. Cut each into 4 pieces for 4-inch twists or in half for 2-inch twists. Makes 80 pieces.

Add the carrots to a pot of boiling water and simmer for about 15 minutes or until they are tender. Meanwhile, add the Guinness and butter to a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a gentle simmer, then add the sugar and reduce the mixture by half until thickened. Drain the carrots and place them back into the pot. Stir in the sauce and season to taste with salt and pepper.

Preheat the oven to 375. Rinse the chicken inside and out with cold water and pat dry. In a small bowl mix the rosemary, the lemon zest, the salt and the black pepper. Rub the mixture all over the inside and outside of the chicken. Place the chicken in a roasting pan. Drizzle with the olive oil. Roast for 1 hour 20 minutes. Remove from the heat. Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before cutting. Serve with crusty bread.
Mix all ingredients together well. Serve on crackers, or bagels.

Mix together cream cheese, mayo and 2 cans of artichoke hearts in a bowl. Stir in 2 cans of frozen spinach, undrained. Spoon into a small casserole dish and top with 1 can of sliced mozzarella. Bake at 350 until bubbly and lightly browned. Serve with tortilla chips or your favorite crackers.

Cook cabbage and onion in butter. Combine with soup, milk and mayonnaise. Add cabbage mixture to a greased 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Combine corn flakes and butter. Spread over cabbage mixture. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes.

Coat a large skillet or wok with spray. Cook and stir chicken in spray 10 minutes or until done. Stir ginger into chicken mixture. Cook 3 minutes or until fragrant. Meanwhile, bring 2 cups water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add ramen noodlescook 2 minutes or until almost tender, stirring occasionally. Drain noodlesstir in vegetables. Stir in stir-fry sauceheat through. Stir chicken mixture into pasta mixturetoss well to combine.

In a large skillet, cook chicken in italian dressing until no longer pink in center. Drain. In a large skillet cook pasta according to package directions in boiling water untill tender but firm. Drain. In a large bowl combine chicken, pasta, alfredo sauce, 1 1/2 cup of the cheese, and tomatoes. Stir in basil and garlic. Spread in a 3 quart baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake uncovered at 375 F for 15 minutes or until heated through.

In a medium sauce pan melt butter over low heat. Add garlic salt and garlic to taste. Cook until fragrant and garlic is cooked. Add milk and stir until just hot. Add cream cheese and mozzarella cheese and stir until melted. Add pepper to taste and serve over hot cooked noodles.

Place 12 to 15 fresh mint leaves, about 1/2 cup packed, into a clean, dry glass jar. Add 1 cup (250 ml) of vodka or brandy to the jar. Cap the jar and allow to infuse for 1 to 2 weeks. Remove the herbs from the jar. Strain the liquid through a fine cloth or paper coffee filter. Add 1/2 cup (125 ml) of sugar and 1/2 cup (125 ml) water to the remaining liquid and mix well. Serve over ice.

Heat oven to 375 F. Place potatoes in a saucepancover with water to 1-inch above the tops of the potatoes. Bring to a boil over high heatreduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 20 to 25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. Let cool slightlypeel the potato skins. In a large bowl, combine the potato skins with the light sour cream, leek, onion and skim milkmash until smooth. Spoon into a greased 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with the cheesebake, uncovered, 10 minutes or until the cheese is lightly browned. Serve with a tossed salad.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Beat together flour, baking powder and salt. Beat together sugar and orange juice. Beat together eggs, yogurt and vanilla. Add dry ingredients alternately to the wet, stirring just until combined. Fold in blueberries. Spoon into greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Bake 12-15 minutes or until tops are golden. Makes 12 muffins.

Saute the rice in oil over medium high heat until golden. Add the water and coca-cola, bring to a boil and cover. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 15 minutes or until the rice is tender. Stir in the raisins and almonds and serve immediately.

Dissolve yeast in the water. Let stand for 5 minutes. In a bowl, combine the yeast mixture with the remaining ingredients except the flour and wheat germ. Beat the mixture for 2 minutes at medium speed with an electric mixer. Stir in the flour and wheat germ. Cover the bowl and let rise for 1 hour in a warm place. Knead the dough on a lightly floured board for 5 minutes with lightly oiled hands until smooth and elastic. Divide the dough into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball with floured hands, and place the balls in a well-greased bowl. Cover the bowl and let rise in a warm place for 40 minutes. Punch down the dough and roll each portion into a 6-inch circle on a lightly floured board. Place the circles on a greased baking sheet and let rise for 30 minutes in a warm place. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 20 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

Form hamburger into small patties, mix in onion and seasonings to taste. Grill until done. Spread bottom of rolls with ketchup and place burger in the bun. Serve with a dollop of heinz 57 steak sauce on the burger and hot sauce for those who want it hotter.

Beat cream cheese until softened. Add all other ingredients except pickle and cherries and mix well. Roll mixture into a ball and wrap with plastic wrap. Chill overnight. Unwrap the ball and add cherries and dill pickle. Roll in the remaining chopped pecans. Serve with crackers.

Brown beef in a large skillet. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer 2 minutes. Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium-high heat. Spray the surface lightly with nonstick cooking spray. Place one tortilla on the surface and spread about 1/3 of the meat mixture in the center. Spread about 2 tablespoons feta and about 1/3 of the jack and cheddar mixture over the top. Top with another tortilla. Brown for about 2 minutes on each side. Cut into wedges. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Preheat grill to high heat. In a small bowl, mix together coriander and caraway seeds. In another small bowl, mix together the crushed red pepper flakes and garlic powder. Sprinkle both spices on both sides of the chicken. Sprinkle the kosher salt on both sides as well. Grill over high heat for about 3 minutes per side. Remove from heat and let cool. Serve alone or with your favorite side dish.

Spray a 2-quart casserole dish with Pam. Cook the onion, green bell pepper, and garlic in the dish until the onion is tenderabout 5 minutes. Stir in the rice, chili powder, and jalapenoscook, stirring frequently for 1 minute. Stir in the diced tomatoescook 2 minutes more or until heated through. Stir in the fresh coarse ground black peppertop with shredded cheese. Bake 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted.
Combine all in a bowl. Cover and marinate for 30 minutes. Serve in a pita with fresh greens and a sprinkle of cilantro or parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl combine the potato wedges, olive oil, minced garlic, oregano, parsley, salt and pepper and crushed red pepper flakes. Toss well to combine. Arrange wedges in a single layer in a 15x10x1-in. baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake for 35-45 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips and sweetened condensed milk. Stir in walnuts. Pat into an ungreased 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake 20 minutes. Cool 15 minutes. Sprinkle with coconut. Cool completely. Cut into 12 bars. Makes 12 servings.

Roll dough into a rectangle on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes. Combine caramel ice cream topping with miniature marshmallows and spread over bottom of cookie crust. Sprinkle with salted peanuts. Melt chocolate chips in the microwave. Spread over top of cookie crust. Allow to harden before cutting into 16 wedges.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Season salmon with Old Bay Seasoning. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned salmon. Cook until golden brown. Flip and cook until golden brown on the other side. Remove from heat. Let cool slightly. Prepare the dressing. Combine mayonnaise and sour cream. Add Old Bay Seasoning to taste. Add more mayo to reach your desired consistency. Toast the bread. Spread dressing on 2 pieces of toast. Place the salmon fillets on the dressing. Top the salmon with the bacon. Top the bacon with the tomatoes. Top the tomatoes with the lettuce. Place the 2 remaining slices of bread on top. Slice each sandwich in half.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Grease 10-inch tart pan with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Set aside. Cook the pumpkin in boiling water for 4 minutes. Drain and cool. Puree in food processor. Transfer to bowl. Add basil, flour, and 1/8 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon of pepper. Combine well. Spread mixture in prepared pan. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sprinkle with cheese and garlic. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool slightly and cut into wedges.

Preheat oven to 400°F. In a large bowl, combine oil and ginger. Add the carrots, tossing well. Transfer carrot mixture to a baking dish or jelly-roll pan and bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over low heat, combine marmalade and water and heat until marmalade is melted. Pour mixture over baked carrot mixture and bake an additional 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat flour, butter, sugar, eggs & milk in kitchen aid mixer on low to medium speed for 30 seconds. Increase speed to medium-high & mix for 3 minutes. Decrease speed to low & add vanilla. Mix for 2 minutes or until batter is smooth. Pour into greased & floured 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. Bake 50 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes. Remove from pan & cool completely on a wire rack.

Wash the figs well under cold water. Do not wipe them dry. Combine the baking soda with the water (the water should be a bit hotter than room temperature). Toss the figs into the waterthey should rise to the surface immediately. Let them sit in this water for 10 minutes. Drain the figs, squeeze out the water with your hands, then set them aside to drain further for 15-30 minutes. In a large pot, combine the figs with the vinegar, cinnamon sticks, cloves, lemon slices, water and sugar. Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer for 45-60 minutes until the figs are tender. Stir occasionally while cooking. Remove the cinnamon sticks and cloves before serving. The figs will keep for several months if stored in the refrigerator.

Sprinkle pork with salt and pepper. Spread 1 tbsp of the pizza sauce on each side of the roll. Layer pork slices on the sauce on both sides of the roll. Sprinkle with 1 tbsp of the dressing. Layer with remaining dressing. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup of the cheese. Microwave on high until cheese is melted. Top with remaining 1/2 cup cheese.

Preheat oven 350 degrees. Wash and trim carrots. Mix the maple syrup and orange rind in a 2-quart casserole dish. Add carrots. Cover and bake for 15 minutes or until carrots are almost done. Meanwhile combine mace and orange juice in a saucepan and heat til syrupy. Stir into the casserole. Cover and bake for another 10 minutes or until the carrots are cooked through and the glaze is thick.

Brown pork chops in butter. Add onions and green peppers and saute until tender. Drain. Stir in hominy and soup. Add milk. Pour into 13 x 9 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Stir occasionally. Serve over rice or noodles.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a saucepancook over low heat until half-and-half is hot and coffee is dissolved. Stir in chips. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in cream and rum. Beat egg yolks in a small bowladd to coffee mixture 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly. Bring to a boilcook and stir 1 minute. Remove from heatstir in salt. Cool 1 hour or until mixture thickens slightly. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Beat cream with remaining 1/4 cup of coffee mixturespread over pie. Chill overnight. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate curls before serving.

Place potatoes and carrots in 4-quart pot. Add water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add mushroom soup and oregano. Cook 4 minutes. Add chicken. Cover. Reduce heat to medium. Cook 10 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika. Serves 4.
Dissolve jello in hot water. Add the pie filling. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Chill until set. Fold in the topping.

Use 2 or 3 waffles depending on how big you want your sandwich to be and spread it with honey mustard. Fill with ham and swiss cheese. Top with smoked turkey. Finish with another waffle and top with more mustard and cranberry sauce. Cut into 4 triangles and serve.

Cook rice per package directions using 3 cups broth. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and snow peas and cook 5 minutes. Remove vegetables from pan and set aside. Bring broth to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat. Remove from heat and stir in vinegar and soy sauce. Pour broth over cooked rice and toss to mix well. Top with vegetables and serve.

Cut the bread into 1-inch cubes. Combine the egg, milk and maple syrup in a large bowl. Add the cream cheese and cinnamonmix well. Stir in the bread cubes. Pour the mixture into a 2-quart baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate with butter and water stirring until smooth. Remove from heat and let cool. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beat in vanilla and sugar until thick and glossy. Fold in chocolate mixture, then fold in coconut. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool on cookie sheets for 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cook rice in the water with the butter and salt until tender. Stir in the prepared mustard, worcestershire sauce, and chili seasoning mix. Spread rice into a greased 2 quart shallow baking dish. Pour tomato sauce over the rice. Sprinkle the top with the chipotle chile in adobo, the adobo sauce, and the water. Cover tightly with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer. Serves 6.

In a 5-quart slow cooker combine 1 can of cream of chicken soup, 1 can of cream of celery soup, 1 can of chicken broth, 1/2 cup diced onion, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add the chicken. In a small bowl combine 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon onion powder, 1/4 teaspoon white pepper, 1/8 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/4 teaspoon paprika, and 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper. Sprinkle over the top of the chicken. Cook on low for 6-7 hours. Serve on buns or over rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place shrimp in a single layer in a large baking dishdrizzle with coconut milk and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake in the preheated oven until shrimp turn pink and firm, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine lime juice, pineapple juice, and rum in a small saucepan over medium-high heatbring to a boil and cook until slightly reduced, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro and garliclet cool slightly. Serve shrimp with rice topped with the sauce and garnish with cilantro sprigs.

Heat olive oil and butter over medium heat in a pan. Add garlic, saute for one minute. Add bread slices to pan, cook for 2-3 minutes per side until lightly browned. Remove bread from pan. Spread one slice of bread with provolone cheese. Top with mozzarella cheese, parmigiana reggiano cheese and asiago cheese. Top with remaining bread slice. Cook until melted and golden brown. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Cut the top off each pineapplereserve each top. Cut the bottom off the pineapplereserve for the base. Cut the sides of the fruit offreserve for the sides of the pineapples. Cut each fruit in half lengthwisereserve for serving. Place the fruit shells on a cookie sheet. In a small bowl, combine the maple syrup, rum, butter, cinnamon, ginger and nutmegpour over the fruit shells. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the fruit is tender. Remove from the ovenlet cool slightly. Serve with the reserved pineapple top, bottom, sides and fruit on the side. Top with the whipped cream, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl combine mustard, mayo and spices. Divide into 2 equal parts. Dip each breast in one mixture then in breadcrumbs, pressing lightly to adhere. Place on a foil lined pan sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until no pink shows at center and juices run clear. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cook the chicken in water seasoned with salt and pepper. While the chicken is cooking, saute the onions and mushrooms in extra virgin olive oil in a large saucepan. Add the broccoli, the Rotel and the salt and pepper. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Meanwhile the chicken is ready. Cube it up and add it to the saucepan along with the spaghetti. Cover and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Stir in the velveeta and heat until it is melted. Serve hot.
Peel and core pear and cut into pieces. Place in a blender. Add ice cubes, apple juice and milk. Blend until smooth. Makes 3 servings.
Cube the tofu. In a large bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients. Add the tofu and toss well. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a 13x9x2 inch pan with foil. Arrange the chicken in a single layer in the pan. In a small bowl combine the corn and beans. In a separate bowl combine the tomatoes, sour cream, and seasoning. Spoon 1/2 of the sauce over the chicken. Sprinkle with 1/4 of the beans and corn. Add the remaining sauce. Sprinkle with the remaining beans and corn. Bake for 40 minutes. Uncover and bake 5-10 minutes longer or until the juices run clear. Serve warm with the tortillas.

Preheat the oven to 170C/fan 150C/gas mark 3. Butter 6 ramekins or custard cups and dust with 1 teaspoon of the caster sugar. Melt the dark chocolate with the butter and allow to cool slightly. Beat together the egg yolks and the rest of the caster sugar until light and fluffy then beat in the dark chocolate mixture. In a separate bowl beat the egg whites until stiff then fold into the chocolate mixture. Divide the mixture between the ramekins. Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes or until just set. Serve with creme fraiche or ice-cream.
Combine milk and yogurt in a blender. Blend until smooth. Add instant breakfast drink mix. Blend until well mixed. Add ice cube. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

Prepare grill. In a small bowl, combine the mustard, oregano and chili flakes. Place the pork ribs on a rack set in a shallow baking pan. Spread with the mustard mixture. Bake in a 300 oven for 2 hours or until tender. Remove the pork from the oven and set aside. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the wine and potatoes. Cook until the potatoes are tender. Pour the cooked potatoes and liquid into a blender and process until smooth. Return the potatoes and liquid to the saucepan over low heat. Stir in the chili, roasted garlic and hot paprika. Brush the pork with the sauce and sprinkle with the sherry. Return the pork to the oven and bake for 10 minutes longer or until the sauce is bubbling.

Combine lentil and water in a large saucepan or stockpot over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until tender, about 20-30 minutes. Add carrot, orange juice concentrate, wasabi powder and gingerroot. Continue to cook for 1-2 more minutes. Mix in soymilk and rice vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or cool and refrigerate up to 1 day. To reheat, heat in microwave until hot

In heavy 3-quart pan combine first 6 ingredients. Cook over medium heat to 240f. Add butterscotch chips and marshmallow creme. Beat until chips are melted. Pour into buttered 8-inch square pan. Sprinkle with nuts. Cool. Cut into 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Wash the beets. Wrap in foil. Bake until tender. (about 1 hour) Remove from oven and let cool. Peel when cool enough to handle. Cut into wedges. In a bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Toss to combine. Add the beets. Toss to coat. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In an iron skillet or 9x13 glass dish, combine dry ingredients. Add liquid and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Pour into skillet or dish and bake for 40 minutes or until done. Cut into 1 inch squares and serve. Makes 8-10 servings.

Spread each bread slice with honey mustard. Arrange tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, and sprouts on 6 bread slices. Arrange the remaining bread slices over the top. Cut the sandwiches in half. Drizzle with lemon juice. Makes 6 sandwiches.
Place all ingredients in large bowl. Mix well. Serve with nacho chips. Serves 4.

Wash and drain the berries. Combine the berries and the brown sugar in a large saucepan and cook over medium heat. Stir constantly until the berries begin to break down and release their juices. Add the cinnamon and continue cooking over medium heat until the mixture is thickened. Remove from the heat and cool. Slice the lemons thinly and reserve both the juice and the slices. Place the reserved blueberry mixture in the prepared crust. Blend the lemon juice and cornstarch in a small bowl and add a few drops of the hot blueberry mixture to blend. Pour the mixture over the berries and spread evenly. Arrange the reserved lemon slices in a decorative pattern on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Cool before serving.

In a bowl, combine cream cheese and milk until smooth. Add egg and water and mix well. Add shrimp and Parmesan and mix lightly. Unroll dough and separate at perforations. Place 2 teaspoons cream cheese mixture at the wide end of each triangle. Gently fold the point of each triangle over cream cheese mixture to form a triangle with a point. Gently press ends together and pinch to seal. Place points down on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Combine cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, and key lime juice. Beat well with mixer on medium speed until smooth. Stir in key lime zest. Pour into graham cracker pie shell. Chill at least 1 hour before topping with frozen whipped topping. Serve cold.

In a large pot of boiling water, add the salt and the jumbo shrimp and boil until they turn pink (about 2 minutes). Remove the pot from the heat and drain the shrimp, reserving 1 cup of the boiling liquid. In a large frying pan over high heat, add the olive oil and the hot chili peppers and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the Spanish onion and the fennel bulb and cook for 5 minutes more. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add the tomatoes, the wine, the reserved boiling liquid and the salt and pepper to taste and simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes. Serve the shrimp on top of the sauce. Serve with steamed rice.

In a small pot over medium heat bring the water to a boil. Add the lemon, sugar and salt. Turn heat to medium low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool. Put the brine in a gallon size bag. Add the chicken breasts and put in a zip lock bag. Push out all the air and seal. Let brine over night or as long as 8 hours. Remove from brine. Grill or saute. Can also put the brined chicken in a crock pot with the brine. Cook 5 to 8 hours on low. I serve with a spicy cream sauce.
Mix together first 5 ingrediants. Put tenderloin in bag and marinate in refrigerator overnight. Skewer tenderloin and grill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in Dijon mustard and white wine vinegar. Add honeymix well. Pour over baconcook over low heat for 5 minutes or until bacon is crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels. Place baby spinach leaves on a large platedrizzle with olive oil, and toss to coat. Arrange spinach leaves in a circle on platetop with crouton. Arrange 2 eggs on top of spinachtop each with a strip of bacon. Drizzle Dijon-honey mixture over eggssprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Place the potato, carrot, and onion in a small bowl and fill with enough water to cover. Microwave for 10 minutes. Drain. Place the potato mixture and beef in a large bowl. Add the egg and mix until thoroughly combined. Stuff the mixture into the cabbage leaves and roll them up. Place them in a baking dish with the tomato sauce and bake for 1 hour. In a medium bowl combine the brown sugar and lemon juice and mix well. Pour the mixture over the cabbage rolls and bake for an additional 15 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.
Mix all ingredients together. Refrigerate. Spread on top of cooked vegetable salads. Spread on top of vegetable pizza.

In a large bowl combine cereal and powdered sugar. Set aside. In a large saucepan, melt chocolate over low heat until smooth and shiny. Stir in the peanut butter until combined well. Pour chocolate mixture over cereal mixture and stir until well-combined and slightly dry to the touch. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a large bowl stir together cake mix, eggs and water until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Spread in prepared dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Meanwhile combine powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons of water. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over warm cake. Cool. Spread with cherry pie filling. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9x13-inch pan. In medium bowl combine cherry pie filling and 1 cup miniature marshmallows. Set aside. In large bowl combine white cake mix, 1 cup water, vegetable oil, 2 eggs and 1 teaspoon vanillamix well. Spoon half of cake batter into 9x13-inch pan. Top with cherry-marshmallow mixturespread evenly. Add remaining white cake batter over cherry mixturespread evenly. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 10 minutesremove from pan. Serve warm or cool.

Preheat oven to 325F. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Blend in egg yolks and almond extract. Sift together remaining dry ingredients and add to mixture until dough is formed. Refrigerate dough for 20 minutes. Roll into small balls and place 1 inch apart onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes until lightly browned. Cool 2 minutes on baking sheet then remove to wire rack to cool completely. Combine confectioners’ sugar, half-and-half and almond extract and blend to form icing. Dip cooled cookies in icing and set aside to dry slightly before serving. Store tightly covered at room temperature.

In a medium saucepan combine the first five ingredients and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until the mixture thickens slightly and begins to bubble. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter and vanilla. Pour into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the nuts and refrigerate for several hours or until firm. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).In a large bowl, stir together the rice, carrots, green bell peppers, garlic and turmeric. Stir in water and vegetable broth until rice is tender and mixture is moistened. Spoon rice mixture into each acorn squash half. Top each half with 2 tablespoons sour cream and 1/4 cup chopped parsley. Place acorn squash halves in a baking dish and pour 1 cup water into bottom of pan. Bake in the preheated oven until tops of squash are tender and beginning to brown, about 35 minutes.

Cream peanut butter, white sugar, egg, and baking soda until smooth. Add salt. Drop by spoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Let cool on sheets for 1 minute. Transfer cookies to wire racks. Makes 1 dozen large or 2 dozen small cookies.
Brown ground beef in skillet with taco seasoning mix. Heat tortilla chips in microwave. Scoop some meat into bag. Add salsa and a few chips. Top with cheese. Serve immediately.

Sift all dry ingredients into large bowl. Mix well with hands. Add egg yolks. Beat well with electric mixer. Add apricot jam. Beat well with electric mixer. Add milk slowly while beating with electric mixer until well blended. Pour into well buttered 1 1/2-quart baking dish. Bake at 350F for 45 minutes or until set but soft in center. Serve hot with cream or custard. Makes 4 servings.

Combine dry cake mix, water, vegetable oil, and eggs in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer and beat for 2 minutes at medium speed. Stir in mashed banana. Spread into greased and floured 10 inch tube pan or 12 cup bundt pan and bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutesremove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

Prepare a sandwich as above for each person. For two people use 4 slices of bacon, 4 slices of cheese, 2 slices of onion. Cut each onion in half. Place onion slices on 1 slice each of cheese. Top each onion slice with 2 slices bacon. Place other slice cheese on top. Place other slice onion on top of that. Place another slice bacon on top. Top with other slice cheese. Place butter on outside of bread. Place on a cookie sheet in oven. Broil on low 5 min. Remove from oven. Top each slice with 1 teaspoon mayonnaise. Cut in half and serve.

In a large pot or Dutch oven, add water. Bring to a boil. Add spam and onion. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Add rice. Cover and simmer until tender and all liquid has been absorbed. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer 5 minutes more. Stir well. Remove bay leaf. Serve over hot cooked rice. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix cake according to box directions. Pour into greased and floured 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool. In the meantime prepare the sundae toppings. In a medium bowl, combine ice cream, bananas and pineapple topping. Spread over the cake. Add the cherries and the hot fudge. Refrigerate until serving.
Whisk together soy sauce, fresh lemon juice and mirin in a small bowl. Stir in cold water until well combined. Store refrigerated in an airtight container for 2 days. Makes 1 cup.

Bring water to a boil, add potatoes. Cook for 12-15 minutes or until tender. Drain the potatoes and place in a large mixing bowl. Mash the potatoes with the butter, onion, sour cream, eggs and cream until smooth. Season with the salt and pepper. Stir in the fresh herbs to taste. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 450. Spread cauliflower and broccoli in a single layer on a baking sheet. In a large bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons oil, kosher salt and the spices. Pour over vegetables. Toss to coat. Arrange in a single layer. Roast for 10 minutes. Sprinkle vegetables with 2 tablespoons Parmesan. Roast for 10 more minutes. Serve.

Using a sieve or a wire strainer, squeeze juice from limes into a medium bowl. Discard seeds and pulp. Slowly add 3 cups of cold water to the juice, stirring with a whisk until sugar is dissolved. Stir in 2 cups of sprite, honey to taste and salt to taste. Serve immediately over ice in tall glasses.

Mix together the milk and sugar in a pan over a medium heat. Add the cinnamon stick. Stir until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is smooth. Bring the mixture to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer gently for 30 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and leave to cool for 10 minutes. Remove the cinnamon stick. Beat the egg yolks in a bowl. Add the cooled milk mixture and the vanilla. Strain into a jug. Cover the jug with cling film. Leave until it has cooled. Chill for 2 hours or overnight before serving.

Trim woody ends of asparagus spears. Heat oil in skillet over medium-low heat. Add shallots and garlic and cook 1 minute or until shallots are tender. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add asparagus. Reduce heat and simmer 3 minutes or until spears are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with lemon juice and sugar. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook rotini in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, melt butter. Add flour and stir constantly until smooth. Cook for 1 minute. Add milk and bring to a simmer. Cook for 1 minute. Add cheeses, 1 cup at a time and stir constantly until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in broccoli and cauliflower. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Sift together the flour and baking powder into a large bowl. Add the sugar and cardamom and mix well. Add the oil and mix well again. Knead the mixture into a smooth dough. Divide the dough into 2 parts and keep the remaining part covered with a wet cloth. Roll one part into small balls (diameter about 1cm or less). Roll each ball into a smooth shape between your palms and place it on the baking sheet. Repeat with the second part. Bake the cookies at 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for about 25-30 minutes or till they turn light brown. Cool on wire racks. Sprinkle the pistachios on the top and enjoy these crispy cardamom spiced cookies.

Remove the stems from the mushrooms and chop coarsely. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sausage and onion and cook until browned, stirring often. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Add the cream cheese and stir until it is completely melted. Stuff the mixture into the caps of the mushrooms. Sprinkle the caps with the bread crumb mixture and bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the caps are browned.
Place all the sauce ingredients except for the chops into the slow cooker. Stir to combine well. Add the chops, cover the pot, and cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 6 hours. Serve over rice.

Prepare beef according to package directions. Heat oil in a large wok over high heat. Add beef and stir-fry 1 minute. Add hoisin and five-spice powder. Stir-fry until meat is no longer pink and liquid is almost evaporated. Add honey and stir until blended. Add soy and sherry and stir. Add garlic and stir-fry 15 seconds. Add cornflour mixture, stir until thickened. Serve over rice.

Let dough rise for 30 minutes. Roll out the dough to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Spread pizza sauce over dough. Add mozzarella and parsley. Layer with pepperoni slices. Roll up the dough. Crimp the sides of the dough together. Bake for 30 minutes or until brown.

Cut pears into 1/2-inch dice. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add green onions and saute until softened. Add molasses, mustard, ginger and vinegar. Cook until thickened. Add chicken. Cook until no longer pink. Add pears. Serve over rice or noodles.

In a medium bowl combine the first four ingredients and set aside. In a small bowl combine the dry cracker crumbs with the soy sauce. Stir in the wine and set aside. Clean mushrooms and cut off stems. Fill the cavity with the cheese mixture. Dip mushrooms into the cracker crumb mixture and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes until cheese is bubbling. Serve hot with crackers or toothpicks.

Roll out the sugar cookie dough and cut into 4-inch circles. Bake according to the directions on the package. Cool completely. Spread each circle with 1-1/2 teaspoons of cream cheese. Place 1-1/2 teaspoons of frozen limeade concentrate in the middle of each circle. Garnish with fresh fruit. Serve immediately.
Combine all the ingredients. Shape into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Roll in chopped pecans and serve with crackers. Makes about 1 cup.

Saute onion and garlic powder in oil. Add caraway seed. Add ground beef. Brown ground beef. Add cabbage and water. Simmer 2 hours or until cabbage is tender. Add velveeta cheese. Heat until melted. Serve on your favorite roll with ketchup.

In a large bowl combine the crepes, bacon, swiss cheese& flour. Add the egg and milk. Beat well. Pour into a greased 8 inch square baking pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 350. Cool slightly before cutting.

Combine cream-style corn and butterstir well. Combine prepared onion dip and eggsbeat well. Combine corn mixture and onion mixturestir well. Stir in celery salt and black pepper. Pour into a greased 1-quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes.

Bring 6 cups of water to a boil in a large pot. Add pasta and cook for 12 to 14 minutes. Heat 2 tablespoons of butter and 1 tablespoon of all-purpose flour together in a skillet over medium heat until the mixture begins to brown. Add the milk and saffron threads and stir until the mixture thickens. Remove from the heat and add the prawns and snow peas. Season with salt and pepper and set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons of butter and the remaining 1 tablespoon of all-purpose flour together in a skillet over medium-high heat until the mixture begins to brown. Add the prawn mixture and the cooked pasta. Toss to combine and serve.

Preheat oven to 350. Heat oven to 425 degrees f. Cut dough into 48 equal pieces. Place 8 pieces on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 3-4 minutes and flip. Remove from oven and brush with melted butter and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and paprika. Bake for 3 more minutes and repeat with remaining pieces.

Melt chocolate with milk in a small saucepan over low heat until smooth. Stir in cream cheese until smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Pour into crust. Cover and refrigerate until set. Decorate top of pie with whipped topping and chocolate shavings if desired.

Slice the leeks thinly. Melt the butter in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Add the leeks, stirring continuously for 5 minutes. Add the sage. Add the beefsteak tomatoes. Cover and cook over a low heat for 10 minutes. Add the garlic and season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook for a further 2 minutes. Serve.

Boil corn until tender (about 20 minutes). Combine with sugar and water and cook until thickened (about 2 more minutes). Season with salt and serve warm or let cool and freeze in ziplock bags. Serve with your favorite meat or vegetable dish.

Combine cream cheese and butter in the bowl of an electric mixer. Beat until well blended. Add the flour and salt and mix until incorporated. Onto a floured surface roll the dough into a 12-inch by 8-inch rectangle. Spread with jam and roll up jelly roll style. Cut into 1-inch slices and arrange on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Allow the cookies to cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pans and cool completely on wire racks. Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit and lightly grease a baking sheet with olive oil. Grate the potatoes into a large bowl and add the flour and egg. Add the parsley and mix well. Shape the potato mixture into patties and place them on the baking sheet. Spray the top of each patty with olive oil and bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle the tops of the patties with parsley and then sprinkle on the salt and pepper. Flip the patties over and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Serve while warm.

Cut head of cauliflower into florets, then pulse in food processor until florets are chopped into 1/4" pieces. Toss florets in a large bowl with 2/3 cup of lime juice and 2/3 cup of vinegar (you can use rice vinegar or apple cider vinegar). Let stand at room temperature for about 2 hours (or overnight), stirring every 30 minutes or so. After 2 hours or so (or overnight), stir in garlic and red chili pepper flakes to taste and add salt to taste. Let sit at room temperature for another hour or so. Remove from bowl and place in colander to strain off liquid (you can reserve the liquid to use later in marinades or other recipes). Place florets in a serving bowl. Toss with remaining lime juice to taste. Top with cilantro leaves and serve immediately.

Heat oil in saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir honey and seasonings into hot oil until honey dissolves and mixture is bubbling. Stir in almonds and coconut until coated and fragrant.
