In a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisk the sweetened condensed milk until it is smooth, then slowly whisk in the flour mixture until well combined. Remove from heat, stir in the brown sugar and oats. Spread evenly in the prepared pan, and bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. Cool before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13-inch pan. Mash yams with a potato masher. Stir in vanilla. Cream together the butter, sugar and eggs. Stir into yam mixture. Blend in flour and baking powder. Mix in pecans and vanilla extract. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for about one hour or until set. Sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving.

Cook potatoes in boiling lightly salted water until tender. In a skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the sour cream until thickened and smooth. Blend in sugar, salt and pepper until smooth and creamy. Remove from heat and stir in dill and spinach. Pour mixture into a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Combine topping ingredientssprinkle over potatoes. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes until bubbly.

In a large saucepan combine maraschino cherries, orange marmalade, fresh lemon juice and walnuts. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens into a syrup consistency and the walnuts are lightly browned. Stir in golden raisins. Pour into hot jars to within 1/4-inch of the top of the jar. Seal with 2-piece lids. Process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes to seal the jars. Makes 4 half-pint jars or 8 small jars.

1. In a medium bowl, beat the eggs and milk.2. Sift the flour and salt into the mixture and blend well.3. Add the melted butter and mix thoroughly.4. Heat a lightly oiled skillet over medium-high heat.5. For each pancake, pour about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet. Cook until the pancake is golden brown on the bottom. Turn and cook the other side.6. Makes 10-12 pancakes.

Preheat oven to 425. Arrange fish in oven dish and coat with oil. Bake for 10 minutes then turn over and bake for another 10 minutes until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove from oven. Mix shallot with wine to make dressing. Pour over fish and sprinkle with dill and herbs. Garnish with chives. Serves 2.

Combine cream cheese, butter, sugar and vanilla in a bowl or electric mixer. Sift in flour and combine to make a soft dough. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or longer to allow dough to harden. Roll dough to 1/4 inch thickness on wax paper or a floured board. Cut with a 2 inch round cookie cutter or other shaped cutters. Place on wax paper or a cookie sheet lined with wax paper or parchment paper. Refrigerate until ready to bake. Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Bake until light brown around edges. Cool on wire racks. These cookies are crisp and good with tea.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Toss until well mixed. Add more water if needed to moisten the mixture. Cover and refrigerate.

Roll out dough on lightly floured surface to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut into circles to fit 9-inch pie plate. Place in plate. Bake at 400 degrees F for 10 minutes. Cool. Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually blend in sugar and vanilla. Spread on bottom of cooled crust. Top with sliced berries and glaze. Chill.

Cream butter, sugar and lemon rind until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Blend in flour, salt, baking soda, cream of tartar and lemon juice. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes. Cool slightly before removing from pan to wire rack to cool completely. Dip tops in confectioner s sugar.

Heat oil in large stock pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring, until softened. Add salt and pepper. Stir in curry powder and cook 1 minute more. Add diced tomatoes and juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in chicken broth and hot water. Stir in peanut butter and cook until melted. Stir in cilantro. Serve with fresh cilantro.
Brown meat in skillet. Add potatoes, onions, garlic powder, seasoning. Drain. Combine with soup mix and water. Cook in crock pot for 4-6 hours on low. Serve over white rice.

In a slow cooker, combine chicken with half of each can of beans and peppers and half of each can of tomatoes. Mix in onion and season with pepper and salt. Cover and cook on low 5 to 6 hours. Serve with hot cooked rice.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, black olives, chilies, vinegar and tomato saucestir until hot, about 3 minutes. Divide mixture into two equal portions. Spoon about 1 tablespoon mixture onto one half of each of four french rollstop each with 1 1/2 tablespoons shredded cheddar cheese. Close sandwiches. In a large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, black olives, chilies, vinegar and tomato saucestir until hot, about 3 minutes. Divide mixture into two equal portions. Spoon about 1 tablespoon mixture onto one half of each of four french rollstop each with 1 1/2 tablespoons shredded cheddar cheese. Close sandwiches. Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat. Add sandwiches and cook until golden brown and heated through, 2 to 4 minutes per side. Makes 4 servings.

Heat butter in a skillet. Sweat onions and garlic in butter for 10-15 minutes or until tender. Add farmer and feta cheeses. Season with nutmeg, salt and pepper. Add eggs and mix well. Cook until mixture is thick. Add parsley and stir. Remove from heat. Let cool. Stir in spinach. Stuff into cannelloni and serve.

Heat the oven to 200 degrees celsius or 400 degrees fahrenheit. Drizzle the olive oil over the tomato halves and place them cut side down in a baking tray. Cook for 10 minutes until softened. Drizzle the tomatoes with the red wine vinegar. Sprinkle over the chili flakes, garlic, oregano and sea salt. Remove the mozzarella from the water, squeeze out the excess moisture, then tear into shards. Arrange over the top of the tomatoes. Cook for a further 10 minutes or until the mozzarella is just melting. Remove from the oven. Drizzle with a little more extra virgin olive oil if desired. Tear over the fresh basil leaves.

Mix together honey, soy sauce and garlic in a bowl until well combined. Place chops in a shallow dish or ziploc bag and pour the marinade over them. Turn the chops in the marinade to coat both sides. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, turning occasionally. Heat the grill or broiler to medium heat. Brush the grill or broiler rack with oil and place the chops on the grill, 3-4 inches from the heat, and cook for 5 to 6 minutes per side. Serves 4-5.

In a large bowl, combine the first 7 ingredients. In a small bowl, combine the milk and eggstir well with a whisk. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients just until moistened (batter will be lumpy). Fold in the cherries and walnuts.Spoon into 12 greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Bake at 400 F for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Sprinkle both sides of the salmon fillets with salt and pepper. In a medium saucepan combine the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the sauce has thickened. Transfer the sauce to a small bowl and set aside. Arrange the fillets in a shallow baking dish and pour the sauce over the top of the fillets. Bake for 12-15 minutes until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve immediately with the reserved sauce spooned on top of each portion of fish.

Combine chocolate and butter in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over low heat. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Beat egg. Add to chocolate mixture. Combine powdered sugar and nuts in a separate bowl. Spread mixture on a greased baking sheet and refrigerate. When chilled roll into a log. Dust with coconut. Cut into pieces. Wrap in foil.

Combine and brown butter and dry noodles until the noodles are crispy. Set aside. In a separate bowl combine evaporated milk and vegetable oil. Heat over low heat until it comes to a boil. Stir in sugar, white vinegar, and noodle flavor packets. Pour over crispy noodles and allow the flavors to blend. Add salad greens and almonds. Refrigerate.

Place all spices in a small bowl. Use a whisk to blend well. Heat the olive oil in a medium skillet. Add the spices and cook for about 1 minute. Add the chicken and cook over medium-high heat until browned and cooked through. Season with pepper and serve.

Combine sugar, evaporated milk and butter in heavy 3-qt pan. Cook over low heat until soft ball stage, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Stir in corn syrup and vanilla. Beat until mixture is smooth. Add pecan pieces. Pour into greased 8-in square pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.

In a small bowl, combine curry powder and margarine. Rub mixture over both sides of the chops. In a skillet over medium heat, saute the onions until tender. Add apples and saute for a few minutes. Add the juice. Stir in the ground cinnamon. Cover the skillet and simmer for 10 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a serving dish. Arrange the chops on the mixture. Cover the skillet and simmer until the chops are done. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve over rice.
Prepare vegetables as per instructions. Boil in enough water to cover. Steam until done. Remove from heat. Drain and add butter. Add basil. Salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, combine the sugar, butter, heavy cream, salt & freshly ground black pepper. Add the potato cubes to the mixture. Toss to coat. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes. Take out and stir with a wooden spoon. Return to the oven for another 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion& garlic& cook until tender& fragrant. Stir in the mushrooms& continue to cook until soft & slightly brown. Remove from the heat & stir in the flour& cook for 1-2 minutes stirring constantly. Pour in the marsala wine& the beef stock& stir to combine. Add the seasonings& simmer for 5 minutes & serve over the chicken.

Boil pasta shells in water until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Combine all other ingredients together in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until cheese is melted. Stir in cooked pasta shells. Pour into 1 1/2 qt. casserole. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Combine mayonnaise and lemon juicemix well. Add chickenmix well. Add remaining ingredientsmix well. Refrigerate.

Blend together powdered sugar, butter and orange blossom water in a bowl until smooth. Sift together flour and cinnamon in a separate bowl. Add to the powdered mixture and mix well. Chill dough for 1 hour. Form into 1 inch balls and roll in the walnuts. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet and bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 3 dozen cookies.

Boil eggs and remove shells. Cut eggs in half and remove yolks to a mixing bowl. Mash yolks with a fork and stir in the rest of the ingredients to blend well. Fill each of the halves with the yolk mixture and sprinkle each with some paprika. Chill until ready to serve.

Mix chicken broth and sour cream and set aside. Prepare stuffing as directed on box. Remove the chicken breasts from the bones and cut into bite-sized pieces. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and celery and cook until tender. Add the chicken and cook until thoroughly heated. Add the chicken broth mixture and stuffing mix to the skillet and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add the sour cream and mushrooms. Pour into a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until browned. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 8.

Combine first 5 ingredients. Beat butter and orange juice until creamy. Gradually add dry mixture, beating until well blended. Beat until smooth. Combine apples and pecansstir into batter. Spread batter into 10-inch tube pan sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 50-55 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Cool completely on rack. Dust with confectioners' sugar just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Toss apricots in oil, place in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes. Combine apricots, dates, and 1/2 cup water in a saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until fruit is tender and liquid is syrupy. Add remaining 2 cups water. Stir in quinoa. Cook uncovered until all liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with nuts. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Butter one side of each slice of bread. Layer each with 1/2 of the ham, 2 tablespoons of the cheddar cheese, 1 tablespoon of the monterey jack cheese, 1 tablespoon of the mayonnaise and 1 teaspoon of the prepared mustard. Garnish with green onions. Top each with the remaining slice of bread, buttered side up. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.

In a small bowl, combine ground cumin, chili powder, and salt. Mist a large bowl with nonstick cooking spray. Pour popcorn into bowl. Sprinkle with spice mixture and toss well. Store in a zippered plastic bag or airtight container for up to 1 week.

In a large saucepan heat vinegar and water over medium heat until the vinegar has dissolved. Add pineapples, ginger, cornstarch and sugar. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook for 3 minutes, or until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in the beets, onion and butter. Cover and refrigerate. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Clean shrimps, peel and devein them. Combine horseradish mustard, horseradish, horseradish sauce, black pepper, paprika, garlic salt, bay leaves & salt in a large bowl. Add beer & mix well. Add shrimps & stir to coat well. Cover & refrigerate overnight. Drain & rinse shrimps & dry. Add vinegar & heat to boiling. Add shrimps & simmer 1-2 minutes. Drain on paper towel-lined platter. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a small bowl combine rosemary, salt, black pepper and olive oilset aside. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown pork in oil on each side about 3 to 4 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove from heat and set aside. Add onions to skilletcook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add garliccook for 2 minutes longer or until fragrant. Add broth, oranges, rosemary mixture, cooked rice and cooked pork to skilletstir gently to combine. Spoon into a greased casserole dishcover with foil. Bake for 30 minutes or until heated through. Uncovercook for an additional 10 minutes or until bubbly.

Slice up your favorite vegetables such as broccoli and mushrooms and saute them in a little olive oil until they are soft and tender. Add in the egg whites and scramble them with the veggies. Serve with a little bit of grated Parmigiano Reggiano cheese.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute or until tender. Add lemon juice. Cook over medium-high heat until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Drain pasta and add to the skillet. Add 1/4 cup pasta water. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the cake mix and oil. Beat with an electric mixer until thoroughly blended. Add milk and beat until smooth. Stir in oats, then add raisins and walnuts. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove to wire rack to cool.
Mix dry ingredients. Add chicken broth and butter. Stir well. Spread on wax paper. Bake at 200 degrees F for 1 hour. This is a great side for the holidays and is good on any type of bird.

Combine first five ingredients. Beat in shortening until blended. Stir in sugar and beat until blended. Add eggs, one at a time. Stir in white chocolate chips. Spread batter in a greased 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 35 minutes or until done. Cool in pan on wire rack. Cut into bars.

Combine quinoa, slivered almonds, vinegar and oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook until liquid is absorbed. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. Toss quinoa mixture with the chicken pieces. Top with grapes. Serve.

In 9x13 pan, pour vegetable oil. Covering bottom and sides. Add cake mix, eggs and water. Mix with fork. Moistening all dry ingredients. Pour in pie filling. Swirl into mixture. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes, or until toothpick comes out clean.

Place a 3-inch piece of butter in a large baking dish. Add pork. Lay garlic and onion slices over the top of the pork. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Drizzle with soy sauce. Bake, uncovered at 425 degrees for about 15 minutes, or until a meat thermometer reads 155 degrees. Brush with the butter mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 15 minutes longer or until a thermometer reads 160 degrees. Serve with hot cooking juices. Garnish with parsley.
Mix cheeses and olives in bowl. Spoon into bread basket and top with onion and walnuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Top with rosemary and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 F. Grease an 8x8 inch baking dish with butter or margarine. Peel the potatoes and slice them into thin rounds. Toss the potato rounds with the salt, black pepper, and fresh rosemary. Spread the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle the shredded blue cheese evenly over the top. Pour the sour cream evenly over the potatoes. Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese evenly over the top. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until the potato mixture is bubbling and the Parmesan cheese is golden brown. Makes 4 servings.

Remove seeds from garlic cloves. Peel away papery skin from ginger root. Chop garlic, ginger root and green onions finely. Cook pork in salad oil over high heat until browned all over. Pour out oil from pan, leaving just 1 teaspoon of oil in pan. Add garlic mixture to pan. Stir until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add water, kim chee juice and kim chee. Cook for 1 minute longer. Add tofustir until warmed through. Add green onionsstir to combine. Serve hot with scallions sprinkled over each portion of soup.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Lightly spray a baking dish with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine cheeses. Stir in basil, rosemary and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add eggmix well. In another bowl, combine bread crumbs and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Mix well. Using your thumb and index finger to form a loose pocket, place a small portion of the cheese mixture in the center of each shrimpshape to form a loose pocket. Coat each shrimp lightly with flour. Dip in eggthen coat in bread crumbs. Place in prepared baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

Place lentils in a pot of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes or until lentils are tender. Drain lentils. Combine lentils with remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Serve at room temperature. Serves 6 to 8.

Saut fennel and garlic in olive oil until softened. Add carrots and saut until tender. Stir in the vegetable broth and simmer for 20 minutes or until carrots are soft. Purée mixture until smooth. Season with black pepper and orange juice to taste. Garnish with fresh cream and serve hot.

Pound turkey until 1/8 inch thick and cut into 1-inch pieces. In a large resealable plastic bag or shallow glass dish combine sake, soy sauce, sugar and garlic. Add turkey and turn to coat. Marinate in refrigerator 30 minutes to 1 hour. Heat a grill or grill pan over high heat. Remove turkey from marinadereserve marinade. Discard garlic cloves from marinade. Grill turkey 4 minutes per side or until cooked through, turning once. Grill mushrooms during last 2 minutes of turkey cooking time. Combine reserved marinade and cornstarch in a small bowlstir until smooth. Add 1 tablespoon of water and stir until smooth. Place turkey on a serving platter and top with mushrooms and green onions. Serve with reserved marinade.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Scrub potatoes, and prick with a fork several times. Bake for 1 hour. After 1 hour, remove potatoes from oven, and let cool for 15 minutes. Cut potato in half horizontally. Remove the insides, leaving about 1/4 inch (1/2 cm) of the potato around the edge. Add butter, garlic salt, and parsley flakes to inside of potato halves. Place back in the oven for 5 to 10 minutes, or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Combine the lime juice, salt and black pepper in a large bowl. Add snapper fillets and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Meanwhile, combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Remove fish from the marinadediscard the marinade. Coat fish with spice mixture. Grill fish over medium high heat for 6 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serves 4.
Mix first four ingredients together in a medium bowl. Add just enough milk to make dough stick together. Gather into a ball. Chill for one hour. Roll out and bake.

Cut frying chickens into 8 pieces each. Cover with cold water by about 2 inches. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer and cook until tender. Remove chickens and strain liquid into a large bowl. Cut carrot and celery into small pieces. Add to the broth along with the barley and bouillon cube. Simmer 15 minutes or until barley is tender. Remove bay leaf and stir in leeks. Serve the soup with the chickens cut into bite size pieces and add to each portion of soup. Serve with buttered bread or toast.

Brown hamburger in skillet. Add taco seasonings. Dice kidney beans in a bowl. Dice onions and mix in a bowl with beans. Slice lettuce to desired size, then add to the bowl with the onions and beans. Drain the fat off of the hamburger meat and add to the bowl with onions, beans and lettuce. Add coleslaw dressing and mix well. Add chopped tomato and shredded cheese on top of the meat mixture. Serve with chips or corn chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line muffin cups with paper liners. In a medium bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, light brown sugar, and vanilla until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Beat in the flour mixture alternately with the milk, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Stir in the miniature semisweet chocolate chips. Fill each muffin cup 3/4 full with the batter, using an ice cream scoop or a large spoon. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack.

Preheat the over to 350 degrees F. Sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, mix together the butter and bananasthen add the beaten egg and vanilla. Add the banana mixture and the milk alternately to the dry ingredients, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients and beating just until moistened. Stir in the nuts and mix just until blended. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups half full. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near the center comes out clean.

Combine flour, milk and cheddar cheese in a small mixing bowl. Mix well with spoon or fork until dough forms. Turn dough out on floured surfaceknead briefly until smooth. Pat dough out to about 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into 1-1/2-inch squares with a sharp knife or cut out with cookie cutters. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 450 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Melt the butter in a saucepanstir in the garlic powder. Brush the topping over the hot biscuits.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add tomato paste. Stir frequently to prevent burning. Add water. Bring to a boil. Add pasta and cook according to package directions. Add sausage and olives. Stir in spinach. Cook for 30 seconds more. Add sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Add mozzarella. Cook 1 minute more. Serve immediately.
Slice mushrooms and saute in butter. Add garlic. Add wine. Add beef tenderloin. Saute. Add lemon juice. Add worcestershire sauce. Add parsley.

Peel and core apples. Chop apples and mix with chopped bananas and lemon juice and sugar. Cook on medium heat for about 20 minutes or until mixture thickens and begins to boil. Skim off foam and ladle into hot sterilized jars. Process pints in water bath for 10 minutes.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add tuna and garlic powdersaute until browned and cooked through. Combine eggs, process american cheese, flax seeds and saltmix well. Spread mixture over top of tunasprinkle with cheddar. Broil for 3 minutes or until cheese is golden brown.

In a small saucepan, melt chocolate over low heat with butter. Remove from heat and stir in sweetened coconut. Spread on pastry sheets. Sprinkle with blanched almonds. Roll up and slice into triangles. Serve with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce.
Drain the tuna and mix with the remaining ingredients except the bread. Spread the mixture onto the bread slices. Top with the lettuce leaves, tomato slices and dill pickles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel and thinly slice onion. In a medium bowl toss onions with 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast for 40-45 minutes, stirring once. In a small bowl combine mayo and remaining tablespoon olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Spoon about 1/4 cup mixture on each of 4 toast halves. Top with onions and serve.

Combine soy sauce, ketchup, marmalade and garlic in a small bowl. Rub mixture into the sides of pork ribs. Place ribs in the crockpot and pour in enough water to cover the ribs. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 9 hours. Remove pork ribs from crockpot. Combine the cornstarch and water until smooth. Pour into the crockpot and cook, uncovered, until the mixture thickens. Return the pork ribs to the crockpot, turning to coat with the sauce. Serve with baked potatoes.

Sift flour once with salt. Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the flour in alternating additions with the milk. Beat in the sour cream and lemon rind. Beat until the batter is smooth. Pour into a greased and floured 10 loaf pan and bake at 325 for about an hour. Test with a wooden skewer. The skewer should come out clean. Let the cake cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before turning out. Wrap in plastic and let it sit overnight before serving.
Bring water to boil. Add bouillon. Stir to dissolve. Add soy sauce, garlic powder and salt & pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve.

Mix dry ingredients in large bowl. Melt butter in small saucepan over low heat. Add applesauce and honey and mix well. Add dry ingredients and stir well. Spread evenly in large jelly roll pan (11x17). Sprinkle with craisins and chocolate chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown and set. Cool and cut into bars. Wrap individually in plastic wrap and place in freezer. Can be frozen up to one month.

In a small frying pan fry the bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Cut each water chestnut in half lengthwise. Combine the soy sauce & brown sugar in a small bowl. Cut each water chestnut in half lengthwise. Cut each water chestnut in half lengthwise. Combine the soy sauce & brown sugar in a small bowl. Combine the soy sauce & brown sugar in a small bowl. Place 1 slice of bacon in each water chestnut half. Place the water chestnut halves in the bowl of soy sauce & brown sugar. Refrigerate for at least an hour. Serve on small lettuce leafs or toothpicks.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 1 1/2-quart baking dish. In a medium bowl, mix pears, cherries, peaches, and pineapple together. In a small bowl, combine butter and brown sugar and blend well. Stir in curry powder. Spread half the fruit mixture in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Cover with remaining fruit mixture and spoon brown sugar mixture over the top. Bake uncovered for 40 to 50 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm or cold. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare bread crumbs by combining all crumb ingredients in a food processor. Pulse until crumbs are combined. Season flour with salt and pepper. Dredge chicken in flour. Egg wash in egg, then dip in bread crumbs. In a large saute pan over medium heat, add 1/2 cup olive oil. Saute chicken until golden brown. Remove from pan. Place in a baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes. Combine butter and remaining olive oil in a small saute pan over medium high heat. Saute garlic for 30 seconds. Pour over baked chicken. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Mix corn flakes and pretzels together in a bowl. Add butter and mix well. Spread mixture evenly in the bottom of a 9x9 pan. Add nuts and mix well. In another bowl mix chili seasoning mix and water. Pour over nut mixture and bake at 300 for 30 minutes. Cut into squares and serve.

Preheat oven to 400f. Toss together all ingredients except cooking spray in 13 x 9 baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake uncovered for 35 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned. Makes 8 servings.

Peel and chop the papaya. Peel, pit and chop the mangoes. Combine all the fruit with the sugar and lime juice. Bring to a boil and simmer until the mixture thickens to the consistency of jam. Cool, transfer to sterilized jars, cover with lids, seal, and store refrigerated.

Combine the butter, flour and sugar in a large bowl. Mix with electric beaters until fluffy. Add the cocoa, egg yolks and milk and mix well. Add the vanilla essence and mix well. In another bowl beat the egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Fold the egg whites into the mixture until just combined. Pour into 6 individual souffle dishes. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. In the meantime mix the brown sugar with the boiling water. After 10 minutes, pour the brown sugar mixture over the top of the souffles and return the dishes to the oven for 5 minutes or until the mixture has thickened. Serve immediately.

In a skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add the corn and saute 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes and continue sauteing until heated through. Remove from heat and add lime juice and season to taste with salt and cumin. Garnish with cilantro.

Cut the tomatoes in half and place on a grill over high heat. Grill until the skin is blistered all over and the flesh is soft and juicy. Let cool slightly. Chop the garlic and finely crush the cilantro leaves with the flat of a knife. Peel the skin off the tomatoes and cut off the stems and seeds and place in a blender. Blend with the cilantro and garlic until smooth. Blend in the olive oil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Taste for balance of flavors and add more oil if necessary. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with a few cilantro leaves and serve with crusty bread.

Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Add scallops and saute 2 minutes per side. Remove from skillet. In a small bowl, combine heavy cream with 1 tablespoon pesto. Pour over the scallops. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Mix together beef, taco seasoning and kidney beans in a large bowl. Spoon half of the mixture into a 9 inch pie plate. Top with a layer of lettuce and another layer of the beef mixture. Sprinkle with half of the cheese and top with another layer of lettuce and the remaining beef mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake for 15 minutes in a 375 degree oven or until heated through. Garnish with tomato and serve with italian dressing and crushed doritos.

In a double boiler over low heat melt sugar, evaporated milk and margarinestir until blended. Add vanilla and marshmallow cremebeat until fluffy. Stir in coconut and vanilla chipspour into a wax paper lined 8x8 inch pan and chill in the fridge until hard. Cut into squares and store in an airtight container in the fridge.
In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the sausage and celery until the sausage is no longer pink. Drain the fat. Add the stuffing mix and butter. Fold in the sausage mixture.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a shallow bowl combine bread crumbs, egg and 1 teaspoon of ketchup. Mix well. In another bowl combine remaining ketchup, worcestershire sauce and salt and fresh ground pepper to taste. Pound out 8 pieces of round. Dip into egg mixture then roll in bread crumbs. Place in a 9x13 casserole dish. Spoon ketchup mixture over top and bake for 1 1/2 hours or until meat is tender. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 2 cookie sheets or line with parchment paper. In large bowl, beat together applesauce, peanut butter, sugar, eggs and flour until well combined. Beat in baking soda and salt. Stir in cocoa. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 8 minutes in preheated oven. Let cool on baking sheets for 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

In saucepan, add clams & their juice. Cook 3-5 minutes until they open up. In a medium bowl, add all other ingredients & mix until blended together. Stir in clams & their juice. Bake in casserole dish at 350f for 20 minutes. Serve with crackers or veggies.

In a large saucepan melt together the butter and marshmallows over medium heat until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in the Milky Way bars. With spoon place mixture into a large bowl of cocoa Krispies cereal and mix until the mixture is covered with cereal. Shape into 1 inch balls with slightly wet hands. Place in freezer until ready to serve.

Melt sugar, milk and butter together over medium heat. Bring to a boil and add cocoa and oatmeal. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper and cool.

In a saucepan combine soup mix with milk. Bring to boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Add flour, stir until smooth. Add butter and cook, stirring constantly until thickened. Add hard-boiled eggs and heat through. Serve over hot toast points.

Peel garlic and mince with the tip of a knife. Put the garlic in a small bowl. Add the balsamic vinegar and the oil. Whisk together. Cut the vegetables in a bowl. Add the dressing and the parmesan. Toss. Cook the pasta in salted water and drain. Add the vegetables. Toss and serve.

Preheat the oven to 175C (350F). Line a baking tray with baking paper. Combine the oil, honey and chili with the thyme and rosemary in a small saucepan over low heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly before pouring over the almonds. Toss well and place onto the prepared tray. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until crisp and lightly browned.

In a large heavy bottomed sauce pan, melt butter over medium high heat. Add the yellow onions and saute until softened and translucent about 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic and the red pepper flakes and saute for 30 seconds. Sprinkle the salt and pepper over the mixture and continue to saute until the garlic is golden about 1 minute longer. Stir in the cumin and continue to saute for 1 more minute. Stir the flour into the mixture and cook for 1 more minute stirring constantly. Remove the pot from the heat and gradually stir the stock into the mixture until smooth. Return the pot to the heat, add the cream, the heavy cream, and bring to a simmer. Add the shredded cheddar cheese a hand full at a time stirring until the mixture is smooth between additions. Simmer until the cheese is melted about 1 minute more. Taste for seasoning adding more salt or pepper if needed. Serve warm with a good loaf of crusty bread or crackers.

Preheat grill. Spray large grill rack or grill pan with nonstick cooking spray. Cut peel and white part of onion to within 1/4-inch of root end. Cut peeled and root end off onions. Slice 1/4-inch off bottom of onions. Spray cut side of each onion. Sprinkle with balsamic vinegar and oregano. Place cut side down on rack. Grill 15-20 minutes or until crisp tender. Sprinkle with brown sugar, salt & pepper. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Preheat a large nonstick oven-proof skillet over medium heat. Place potatoes in a single layer in the center of the hot skillet. Sprinkle with salt to taste. Cook until potatoes are crispy. Remove from heat. Add garlic, shallot, white onion and bacon bits. Return to heat. Cook over medium heat until potatoes are lightly browned. Turn potatoes out onto a plate. Add 2 tablespoons of fat to the hot skillet. Add potatoes to the fat. Toss to coat with the fat. Sprinkle with paprika. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f (165 degrees c).Grease a 2 quart shallow baking dish. Spread sausage and onion in dish. Top with bread. In a large bowl beat together eggs, milk, salt and dry mustardstir in worcestershire sauce. Pour evenly over bread. Sprinkle with cheese and bake in preheated oven until golden brown and eggs are set, about 40 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375F. Place 1/4 cup of the oil in a pan and heat until hot. Add the onions and stir to coat. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the sugar and balsamic and cook for another 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon into pastry shells. Top with cheese and bake until just melting.

In a large pitcher, combine the water, baking soda and tea bags. Stir until the soda dissolves. Cover the pitcher with plastic wrap and let it steep for 30 minutes. Stir in the sugar and ice cubes. Serve immediately.
Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in onion. Cover and cook until tender. Add water and cornmeal. Cook until thick. Stir in cheese and salt. Makes 4 servings.

Slice ripe olives. Cut raw cauliflower in small pieces. Peel green bell pepper, cut in strips. Cut onions in small pieces. Peel pimento. Slice. Combine olives, cauliflower, pimento, green pepper strips and onions. Sprinkle with salt. Put vinaigrette in small dish. Mix well. Put lettuce leaves on individual plates. Spoon cauliflower mixture on top. Serve.
Combine wine, garlic, oregano and rosemary in a large crockpot. Cut slits into roast and add to crockpot. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours. Remove roast, slice and serve with reserved red wine.

Preheat oven to 400. Mix mustard with lemon juice and cumin. Brush mixture onto both sides of chicken breasts. Place chicken breasts in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Combine pecans, bread crumbs and butter. Sprinkle evenly over chicken. Bake 20-25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Mix together oleo, coconut, nuts, sugar, salt and vanilla. Mix in eggs. Spread into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted comes out clean. Cool. Spread top with whip cream. Serves 6.

Heat a small amount of water in a steamer basket. Add eggs. Poach for about 5 minutes until firm but still soft in the center. Remove from steamer basket and set aside. Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a saucepan. Lower heat and add the tomatoes. Cook for 15 minutes or until the tomatoes are soft. Stir in the soy sauce, broth, onion, and garlic. Cook for another 2 minutes. Serve the tomatoes over the poached eggs. Sprinkle with the pepper and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

In a saucepan over medium-high heat, combine butter and flour. Stir until flour is well blended and mixture is smooth and bubbly. Add garlic powder and onion powder. Stir and cook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add dried cilantro and milk. Stir and simmer for 5 minutes or until thick. Stir in cream cheese and stir until smooth. Add cheese and stir until melted. Add diced green chilies. Stir and cook for 10 minutes or until mixture is smooth. Pour over cooked chicken breasts.
Combine all ingredients well in a large bowl. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Place the sugar, water, and cream in a pan over medium heat. Bring the mixture to a boilstir constantly until the mixture thickens enough to form into a ball when dropped from a spoon. Pour the mixture over the almondsstir until the almonds are coated with the syrup. Spread out on a greased baking tray and bake for 45 minutes. Cool before serving.

Spread pizza sauce evenly over crust. Top with salsa and sprinkle with jalapeno juice. Sprinkle with olives and onions. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350F degrees for 20 minutes or until done. Cut into wedges.

Rinse the rice and beans thoroughly, and drain them in a colander. Heat ghee in a saucepan or heavy pot. Add mustard and cumin seeds and turmeric. When the seeds pop and the spices darken slightly, add the drained beans and rice and stir for a minute or two, making sure the grains don't stick to the pan. Add the water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and let cook covered for 30-45 minutes or until the grains are tender and the liquid is almost absorbed. Add salt to taste and stir in the lemon juice and garam masala. Serve warm.

In a medium sized skillet over medium heat add olive oil, butter, and onion. Cook for 5 minutes or until softened and transparent. Add minced garlic cloves and cook another minute. Add cooked rice and cook 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in 2 cups of the tomato sauce and 1 cup water. Cook for 5 minutes or until well combined and heated through. Add coriander and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm. Serves 4-6 as a side dish or 2-3 as a main dish.
Heat oil in wok and saute garlic. Add beef and stir fry until just browned. Add all remaining ingredients and mix well. Stir fry until beef is tender. Serve over rice.

Rinse the mackerel and pat dry with paper towels. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Lay the mackerel fillets on a baking sheet and sprinkle with the lemon juice. Chill the fish for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the minced garlic with the olive oil. Remove the fish from the refrigerator and brush with the garlic oil. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F. oven for 8 minutes or until the fish is just opaque in the center. Serve immediately.

Bring 1 cup water to a boil in a small saucepanremove from heatadd tea bagsteep 3 minutesremove tea bag. Place 1/2 cup of the tea in a blenderadd the remaining 1/2 cup water and the remaining ingredientsprocess until smooth. Pour into 4 glasses. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a shallow baking pan with foil. In a small bowl, combine the sugar, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg. In a separate bowl, beat the egg white with a fork until frothy. Roll the pumpkin seeds in the egg white, then coat with the sugar mixture. Spread evenly in the prepared pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until the seeds are golden brown. Cool completely before storing.

Beat egg whites with equal till soft peaks form. Set aside. Beat together egg yolks with mascarpone cheese. In a large saucepan heat coffee with cognac. In a mixing bowl combine egg yolks with mascarpone cheese, 1 tsp of the coffee mixture, and vanilla extract. Beat well until mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Set aside. Dip each ladyfinger into coffee mixture then dip in egg yolk mixture. Place in a baking pan or on a cookie sheet. Top with a little bit of mascarpone cheese mixture to cover the ladyfingers. Drizzle with remaining coffee mixture. Refrigerate until firm. Garnish with cocoa or sprinkles if desired.

In a large pot or Dutch oven, place all of the above ingredients except pasta. Add water to cover. Cook on medium heat until carrots are tender, 20 minutes or so. Add pasta. Cook according to directions on package. Serve hot.
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and simmer for 10 minutes until the berries pop. Remove from heat and let cool. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. In a large bowl combine the tuna, soup, milk, cheese, broccoli. Mix well. Spread into a 2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

In a blender or food processor, combine water, granulated sugar and pineapple. Blend until pureed. Strain mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher. Stir in lime juice. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 48 hours. Makes 8 servings.

Melt oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Brown chicken in skillet for 10 to 15 minutes or until it is cooked through. Pour wine into skillet and scrape up any brown bits from the bottom of pan. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cover pan with a lid or piece of aluminum foil and bake in oven for one hour or until chicken is done. Turn off power. Transfer chicken to a serving plate. Stir in stock into skillet along with cornstarch mixed with water and stir until thickened. Pour over chicken and serve.
Mix all meat ingredients. Chill for 3 hours or overnight. Soak bamboo skewers in water. Thread meat and onions onto skewers. Cook on a hot, oiled grill for about 5 minutes per side.

In double boiler melt chocolate. Remove from heat and add condensed milk. Stir until smooth. Pour into 9x9 pan and refrigerate until firm. In a small bowl mix the walnuts and the miniature marshmallows together. Pour the mixture over the top of the chocolate layer. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until firm. Cut into squares.

1. In a plastic bag combine the dressing mix and pork chops. 2. Heat oil in frying pan. Place the pork and dressing mixture into the heated pan and brown. 3. Pour milk into pan and stir. 4. Add the soup and flour and stir until smooth. 5. Heat until bubbly.

Peel potatoes and cut into thin slices. Cook in boiling salted water until soft. Mash potatoes. Stir in butter, egg, caraway seeds and salt. Form mixture into 2 1/2 inch long fingers. Place on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, combine granulated sugar, brown sugar, fat-free evaporated milk, butter, light corn syrup, and salt. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 5 minutes or until thermometer inserted into mixture registers 240f. Remove from heat. Add peanut butter and vanilla and stir until combined. Spray an 8x8x2-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Pour mixture into pan. Sprinkle with mini semisweet chocolate chips. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into 2-inch squares.

Mix all the ingredients in a bowl except the spam. Dice the spam into bite size pieces. Mix the diced spam into the mixture in the bowl. Serve as a dip for crackers or bread or spread on sandwiches. Serves 4 to 6.

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add spears and cook 4-5 minutes until tender crisp, drain and plunge into ice water. Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute more. Add the stock, bring to a boil and simmer 5-7 minutes until the stock is reduced to 1 cup. Stir in the lemon juice and season with the pepper. Add the asparagus and cook for 2-3 minutes longer to heat through. Serve garnished with parsley sprigs.

Rinse and pat the shrimp dry. Combine the next six ingredients. Set aside for 30 minutes. Grill the shrimp over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until the shrimp are opaque. Serve with the lime and a few sprigs of oregano.

In saucepan on med heat, combine light corn syrup, sugar and coffee. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in amaretto. Stir in chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Let stand until set. Melt unsweetened chocolate in microwave. Drizzle over cookies. Chill. Makes about 4 dozen.

Slice and core the apples. Toss with the sugars, cinnamon, nutmeg, and pecans. Divide the filling evenly into the pie shells. Bake for 40-45 minutes until apples are soft and the tops are browned and bubbly. Let cool completely before slicing and serving.

Cream butter and sugars in a bowl until light and creamy. Beat in the egg. Sift together the dry ingredients and mix into the creamed mixture to form a soft dough. Press into the prepared baking tin and bake for about 35 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the tin while warm and cut into squares. Sprinkle with desiccated coconut if desired. Leave to cool completely before storing in an air-tight container.

Place chicken in crock pot then sprinkle with garlic salt. Add the rest of the ingredients and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours. Shred the chicken with two forks and stir. Serve in taco shells and top with your favorite toppings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a small bowl combine Dijon mustard with lemon juice and garlic. Brush over chicken breasts. Sprinkle with pepper. Bake uncovered for 15 - 20 minutes or until no longer pink in center.

In a medium saucepan bring 4 cups water to a boil, add fettuccini and cook until tender. Drain and toss with the butter and set aside. In the same medium saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in the half-and-half and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and cook for 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Remove from the heat and stir in the buttermilk. Add the nutmeg, pepper and cheeses and stir until well blended. Toss with the fettuccini and serve immediately with more parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.
Cut the vegetables into small cubes and combine in a bowl with the italian dressing. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.

Cut the rhubarb in chunks. Wash and then cook over medium heat until tender, about 5 minutes. Stirring occasionally, add the water and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Add the candy orange slices and lemon juice and bring back to boiling point. Pour over jelly molds and refrigerate until set.

Combine maple syrup and water in saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook 2 minutes or until mixture is reduced to 1 cup. Remove from heat and cool. Combine soy sauce and lemon juice in small bowl. Stir well. Place salmon fillets in shallow baking dish. Brush with soy sauce mixture. Top with dried cherries. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Broil 4 in. from heat for 3 minutes. Turn and broil 3 - 4 minutes longer or until salmon is opaque in center. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp and cook 1 minute per side or until opaque. To serve, drizzle salmon with maple glaze and arrange over bed of rice. Garnish with cinnamon and cherries. Serve with shrimp. Yield 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Mix the graham cracker crumbs and brown sugar together in the pan. Melt the butter in the microwave and pour over the crumb mixture. Press the coconut into the mixture until it is covered evenly. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top is lightly browned and crisp. Let cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 425f. Cut potatoes into wedges. In large bowl combine corn flake crumbs, parmesan cheese and seasoning. Add in chili powder and garlic salt. Toss to coat well. Add potatoes and toss to coat evenly. Spread onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake until golden brown. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a 9x13-inch baking dish, melt 2 tablespoons butter. Add whole chicken and spread butter over top and sides of chicken. Season chicken all over with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Place in oven and roast 40 minutes or until a thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh reads 160 degrees F. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, toss potatoes with 2 teaspoons olive oilseason with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Spread potatoes evenly onto a rimmed baking sheetroast 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork and beginning to brown. Remove chicken from ovenlet stand 15 minutes or until cool enough to handle. Cut into piecesdiscard bones. In a small bowl, stir together remaining 1 tablespoon butter, garlic, 1 teaspoon maple syrup, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pe

Wash cherries in cold water. Drain well. Place in bowl of bread machine. Add water, sugar, lemon juice. Set bread machine for dough cycle. At end of cycle turn out dough onto floured surface. Knead by hand adding flour 1/4 cup at a time if dough is too sticky. Roll out dough and cut into shapes. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 350 for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on rack. Makes about 48 cookies.
Saute onion and garlic in olive oil in large skillet. Add chicken and zucchini. Saute until chicken is done. Add mushrooms and mild salsa. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve over rice.

Crush oreos and combine with melted butter in a large mixing bowl. Stir in milk, vanilla and chocolate chips until well blended. Press into a lightly greased 9x13 baking pan. Sprinkle with nuts if desired. Let cool before cutting into bars.
In a large bowl combine cantaloupe, strawberries, banana, yogurt and mace. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Garnish with poppy seeds and serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan bring the water to a boil. Add sugar and cinnamon sticks. Add the frozen cranberries and cook until just thawed and starting to break up. Remove from heat and add jello gelatin stirring until dissolved. Cool slightly then stir in applesauce. Pour into an 8x8 baking dish and refrigerate until set.

Combine egg, 1/4 cup cold water and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a shallow bowl. Beat until smooth. Combine flour, pepper and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt in another shallow bowl. Dip fillets in egg mixture. Dip in flour mixture, tapping off excess. In a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Fry fillets until golden brown on each side. Serve with tartar sauce.

Brown the chops in the hot oil and remove. Add the carrots and onion and saute until soft. Add the mushrooms and saute until tender. Add the chops and the remaining ingredients and simmer until chops are tender. Serve with the potatoes.

Steam or boil carrots until just tender. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add carrots and cook, stirring frequently, until carrots are browned. Add dates. Cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in couscous, water and salt. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Stir in walnuts and butter. Serve immediately.
Melt chocolate in microwave. Add condensed milk and mix well. Stir in nuts and pour into a buttered 8 x 8 pan. Refrigerate for about an hour or until hardened. Cut into squares.
Cook pumpkin until soft, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool, remove seeds and skin. Cut into small pieces. Cook apples and peppers in broth until tender. Blend all together with cilantro. Garnish with cilantro.

Slice the chicken breasts thinly. Dip the chicken in the ranch dip. Wrap in bacon. Place in a ziploc bag. Freeze. Take out as many as you need. Thaw in refrigerator 24 hours. Cook in 350 oven for 30 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes. Skewer with toothpicks.
Combine all ingredients in slow cooker. Cook for 7 to 8 hours on low. Add additional broth if needed. Serve with chips, burritos or as tacos.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 9x13-inch pan. Beat butter and icing sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in flour and white sugar until well mixed. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Stir in almond extract and light corn syrup. Stir in almonds. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack. Cut into 12 bars.
Brown meat and drain. In large bowl combine meat and remaining ingredients. Simmer uncovered until meat is tender and mixture is hot. Serve on hamburger or hot dog buns. Recipe.

Heat the milk in a pan with the rind of one orange and the bean of one vanilla pod until it has just come to the boil. Meanwhile, put the arborio rice into a large bowl with the egg yolks, sugar and cream. Gradually pour the hot milk over the yolks while continuously beating until the mixture is thick and creamy (the zest of one lemon could also be added at this stage). Pour into a buttered dish and bake at 180C for 30 minutes or until set. Serve with rhubarb compote and light cream.

Wash plums. Halve each. In a bowl mix 1 cup (250 ml) of white sugar with cinnamon. In a separate bowl mix eggs with flour and baking powder. Add this to plums and mix well. Pour into a greased 22 cm (9 in) round pan. Bake at 180 C (350 F) for 1 hour. Remove from oven. While warm pour icing over.

In a bowl using an electric mixer, beat together the sugar and water until sugar dissolves. Beat until foamy and bubbly. Beat in egg whites until very smooth. Beat in marshmallow cream until combined. Beat in vanilla.

Heat oil in saucepan over med. Add garlic. Saute until golden. Add onion. Saute until transparent. Add carrot. Saute until tender-crisp. Add ham. Add stock. Simmer. Add ginger. Stir. Cook for 1 minute. Add pasta. Cook to al dente. Stir in parsley.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, brown the beef and onions. Drain off liquids. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Simmer for 20 minutes or until liquid has evaporated. Serve hot on your favorite buns or bread.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook fusilli until al dente. Drain and set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp and stir until just opaque. Add crushed red pepper flakes, salt, and wine. Cook for 1 minute. Add onion and stir until soft. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add tomatoes and their juices and simmer for 3 minutes. Add drained pasta and toss until well-coated. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 4.

Bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook potatoes until tenderdrain and set aside. Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Cook bacon until crisp. Using slotted spoon, transfer bacon to paper towels to drain. Reserve bacon drippings. Sauté onion and leek until tender. Stir in flourcook 1 minute. Add chicken brothbring to a boil. Stir in potatoes, bacon, and parsleysimmer 5 minutes or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cream together shortening and sugar until light and creamy. Stir in pumpkin puree, vanilla and cinnamon. Beat well. Gradually add flour and baking soda. Stir until dough begins to form. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 9 to 11 minutes or until lightly browned.

Prepare marinade by combining the lemongrass and lime leaves. Wrap the chicken thighs in the marinade and refrigerate overnight. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the noodles. Cook according to directions. Meanwhile prepare the chicken. Add the ginger, lime juice and soy to the chicken and bring to a boil. Lower heat and let simmer for 20 minutes. Remove the chicken to a plate. Strain the liquid and combine with the noodles and green onions. Garnish with cilantro and lime. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350. In a small bowl, combine the chipotle with the heavy cream until well blended. Set aside. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. In a medium bowl, toss the cubes with the nutmeg, salt and pepper. Place in a shallow baking dish with the chipotle sauce. Sprinkle the grated gruyere on top. Bake for 45 minutes or until the sweet potatoes are tender and the sauce is bubbly. Serve immediately.

Line a 10-cup muffin pan with 10 paper muffin cups. Crumble cookiesset aside. In a food processor combine ricotta cheese and cream cheeseprocess until smooth. Add egg and process until combined. Add 2 tablespoons sugar and process until combined. Add lime juice and pulp and process until combined. Divide the mixture among the muffin cups. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 20 minutes. Cool. Combine 2 tablespoons sugar and 1 tablespoon water. Brush the top of each cake with the glaze. Top with a passion fruit slice. Makes 10 servings.

Spread garlic and olive oil evenly over tortilla. Sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Add pepperoni. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Let it cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In large bowl, combine the cornbread mix, turkey broth and sage. Mix well and pat into a large, shallow baking dish. Melt 1/2 cup of the butter and pour over the top of the cornbread mixture. Sprinkle evenly with the garlic salt, poultry seasoning and pepper. Bake for about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the remaining butter and the eggs and beat well. Remove the baking dish from the oven and pour the egg mixture over the top of the hot cornbread. Bake for another 25 minutes or until light golden brown. Serve with your favorite vegetable. Makes about 8 servings.
Combine first 3 ingredients in small bowl. Chill 30 minutes. Stir in mint. Serve chilled. Makes about 4 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 8 x 8-inch baking dish. In a medium skillet over medium heat, saute the onion in the oil for 4 minutes or until tender. Stir in the beef and cook until browned. In a large bowl, combine the beef mixture, beans, tomatoes, chili powder and cayenne. Transfer to baking dish. In another bowl, combine the batter and milkstir just until moistened. Pour batter over filling. Bake for about 40 minutes or until cornbread is done.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a blender or food processor combine milk, eggs, Bisquick and 1 cup of chilies. Blend well and pour into a greased 9x13 baking pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup of the cheddar and 1/4 cup of the Jack pepper cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. While baking prepare the sauce by combining 2 cups of chilies, adobo sauce and pepper to taste. When casserole is done remove from oven. Spoon sauce over the top of the casserole. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of cheddar and 1/4 cup of Jack pepper cheese. Bake for 10 minutes more or until sauce is bubbly.
In a large bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients. Add pecanstoss well to coat. Spread pecans in a single layer on wax paperlet stand for 2 hours or until dry.

Combine the first six ingredients. Beat until smooth. Add eggs and beat until just combined. Combine dry ingredients. Stir into the ginger mixture. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake at 375 degrees F for 15 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 12 muffins.
Combine peaches and juices in a 3 quart crock pot. Mix together oats, flour, sugars, spices and butter. Drop in teaspoonfuls on top of the peaches and bake on low for 7 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel, core and slice apples. Add 1/4 cup water and 2 cloves to a 9x13 pan. Place apples on top of water and add 1/2 tsp. of cloves and 1/2 tsp. of water to each apple slice. In a medium bowl combine the self rising flour, 1 cup of brown sugar and 1/4 cup of butter until blended. Stir in the rolled oats and 1/4 cup of melted butter and mix until well blended. Sprinkle over the top of the apples. Bake uncovered for 1 hour or until done. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with vanilla ice cream if desired.
Bring water to boil. Add mixed vegetables. Add shrimp. Cook for 5 minutes. Add ramen noodles and ramen soup. Cook until ramen is tender. Stir in garnish. Serve hot.

Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add the shrimp and saute until pink. Add the ginger and the garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the broccolini and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowadd the hoisin sauce and the soy sauceadd the hot red pepper flakes. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil and butter over medium high heat. Add potatoes and carrot and saute for 5-7 minutes until lightly browned. Stir in shallot and saute for 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and stir in fresh parsley. Serve.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onions, cook until softened. Add celery to butter-onion mixture. Cook until celery is tender. Add soup. Cook until heated through. Place mixture in a blender or food processor and blend. Add cream cheese, mayonnaise, gelatin, crabmeat, salt and pepper. Beat until smooth. Pour into a lightly greased 1 qt. casserole. Chill overnight. To unmold, run a sharp knife around edge. Invert onto a serving plate. Garnish with hot sauce.

In a large bowl, combine the sugar, butter, and eggs. Beat at medium speed of an electric mixer for about 5 minutes or until light and creamy. Add the vanilla and mix well. In a medium bowl, combine the flour and salt. Gradually add to the creamed mixture, beating just until blended. Add the water 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 40 to 45 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for at least an hour. Serve at room temperature with ice cream or whipped cream. Store in the refrigerator.

Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Divide into four equal portions and form into patties. Broil or pan fry to desired doneness. Serve on hamburger buns with lettuce, mayo and tomatoes or as desired.

Place the potatoes at the bottom of the crock pot. Add the pot roast on top of the potatoes. Cover with water. In a medium bowl, combine the soy sauce, apple cider vinegar, bay leaves, peppercorns and onions. Place the bowl on top of the roast. Cover the crock pot with the lid and turn it to the high position. Cook on high for about 6 hours. Remove the roast from the pot. Set aside. Skim the fat from the broth. Stir the cornstarch into the broth. Cook on high for 10 minutes. Serve over the roast. Garnish with the scallions.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook the carrots until tender-crisp, about 10 minutes. Drain and refresh under cold running water, then drain again. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the carrots and cook until heated through and glazed with oil. Stir in the lemon juice and honey to taste and toss well to coat the carrots. Season with the salt if desired and serve.

Combine butter, cornstarch and 1/3 cup of powdered sugar in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until thickened and boil for one minute. Stir in remaining 2/3 cup of powdered sugar, the flour and the cream cheese. Cool completely. Stir in food coloring. Using a cookie scoop or teaspoon, drop onto a cookie sheet lined with wax paper about 2 inches apart. Place in fridge for 1 hour. Melt 1 cup of chocolate chips in the microwave for about 3 minutes stirring every 45 seconds or so. Dip each cookie half into chocolate. Return to wax paper lined cookie sheet to set up.
Mix all ingredients together and bake for 1 hour at 350. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Serve with green pepper slices.

Spread 2 tablespoons of cream cheese over 1 slice of bread. Place avocado over cream cheese. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. Spread 1 tablespoon of sour cream over avocado. Spread 1 tablespoon of salsa over cream cheese. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cheddar cheese over salsa. Sprinkle with green onion. Sprinkle with black olives. Spread 2 tablespoons of cream cheese over 1 slice of bread. Place avocado over cream cheese. Spread 1 tablespoon of sour cream over avocado. Spread 1 tablespoon of salsa over cream cheese. Spread 1 tablespoon of cheddar cheese over salsa. Sprinkle with green onion. Sprinkle with black olives. Place avocado over cream cheese. Spread 1 tablespoon of sour cream over avocado. Spread 1 tablespoon of salsa over cream cheese. Spread 1 tablespoon of ch

In small bowl stir together first 5 ingredients. Rub mixture over both sides of each chop. Grill over medium heat about 8-10 minutes per side for medium rare. Baste often with glaze during last 4 minutes of grilling. Serve warm.

In 8x12 inch pan, combine marshmallows, sugar and evaporated milk. Cook on low heat until mixture boils. Add cherries and cook until they are softened. Take off heat and add cherry chips. Stir until melted. Spread on bottom of pan. In another pan combine peanuts with semi-sweet chocolate chips and creamy peanut butter. Cook on low heat until melted. Spread over cherry layer and let stand until set. Cut into squares.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Shape into a loaf. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until meatloaf is cooked through. Slice and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Season chicken breast with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic cloves to oil. Stir and cook until garlic turns golden. Add chicken to oil and brown well. Remove from heat. Put chicken in casserole dish and pour over enchilada sauce. Sprinkle with herbes de provence. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until cooked through. Meanwhile, boil macaroni in salted water until done. Drain and add to casserole. Stir in chipotle and corn. Toss to combine. Serve hot.

Brown ground beef in a dutch oven. Add onion. Cook until onions are tender. Add bouillon, tomatoes, orzo, mix, and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered until orzo is tender. Stir occasionally. Add salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Place cookies in food processor. Process until fine crumbs. Set aside. Combine egg whites, sugar and salt in large bowl. Beat until stiff peaks. Fold in crumbs and vanilla. Spread into 9 inch pie plate. Chill for at least 4 hours or overnight. Beat heavy cream with nuts and unsweetened chocolate. Spread over pie. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place beans in a large bowl. Add the garlic and onions. Drizzle with the olive oil. Add salt and black pepper. Toss until evenly coated. Spread the mixture on two baking sheets. Bake for 25 minutes or until tender. Toss the balsamic vinegar over the beans. Serve immediately.

Clean chicken and cut into bite sized chunks. In slow cooker add the chicken, ginger, garlic and cilantro. In a bowl mix the soy sauce, broth, brown sugar and cornstarch. Pour over the chicken. Cover. Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. During the last hour add the bulgur. Cook for the final hour.

In each manicotti shell, place about 1/2 tablespoon string cheese and top with about 1 tablespoon marinara sauce. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Place in a single layer in a baking pan and bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 6.

Cook pasta until done. Drain. In a 1 1/2 quart casserole, combine the pasta, broth, cream, peas, salt, pepper, parmesan cheese, and paprika. Stir well. Cover. Bake 1 hour at 350 degrees F. Uncover. Bake 5 to 10 minutes longer or until sauce is bubbly. Makes 6 servings.

In a food processor or blender, puree mangoes and onions until smooth. Add mint and juice from one of the oranges and puree until smooth. Transfer salsa to a small bowl and stir in remaining orange juice and harissa. Season with salt and set aside until ready to serve. In a small bowl combine the oil and spices. Rub the oil mixture on the fish and place on a parchment lined baking sheet. Roast for 12-15 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with mango salsa.

Combine the water and the wine in a large saucepan. Stir in the soup. Simmer the mixture for 5 minutes. Cut the meat into 1 inch cubes. Add the meat to the saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat. Simmer for 30 minutes or until the meat is tender. Mix the rice blend and the meat. Remove the mixture from the heat. Stir in the butter and the parsley. Spoon the mixture into a 3 quart baking dish. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Cut 2-inch rounds from each slice of bread. Spread 1 side of each round with applesauce. Sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar. Put sandwich together and cut into triangles with a pizza cutter or large knife.

Preheat oven to 350f. Split biscuits and brush with melted butter. Layer with vegetables, cheese, and bacon. Place in baking dish and pour melted butter over top. Bake for 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

Rub the butter into the plain flour until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Mix the egg yolk and egg together with a fork and stir into the flour mixture with a knife until a dough is formed. Do not overwork the mixture as this will make the pastry tough. Roll out on a lightly floured board into a 25cm/10in circle. Cut into 4 (or more) equal pieces and transfer to a greased baking tray. Brush with the beaten egg and sprinkle with sugar. Bake in the oven for 10-15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack before serving.

Cook the bacon until crispy. Drain the fat. Cook the onions & green peppers in the fat until tender. Add the tomatoes. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the grits. Stir until combined. Add the milk. Cook until creamy. Add the parmesan cheese and the salt & pepper. Serve hot.

Boil, peel and dice potatoes. Boil or microwave eggs. Peel the egg whites and chop the yolks. Combine the egg yolks with the green bell pepper, onion and pimientos. Add the mayo, mustard and seasonings. Combine all of the above with the potatoes and serve.

Set oven to 400 degrees. Wash potatoes and cut in half lengthwise. Place potatoes in a large bowl and add the rest of the ingredients except the breadcrumbs and the seasoning salt. Stir until evenly coated and then place on a baking sheet and bake for 40-45 minutes until tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle with seasoning salt and serve.

In a large skillet, saute the onions in the butter for about 5 minutes or until translucent. Add the apples, cabbage, brown sugar and celery seeds. Cover with water and cook over medium heat for 30 minutes or until the vegetables are tender, adding more water if necessary. Add the wine and salt. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by half.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Fold in all fruit and 1 cup nuts. Put in fridge to congeal. When jello is totally set, spread sour cream over top. Sprinkle with rest of pecans. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Prep time doe not include refrigerator time.

Cut and peel potatoes into cubes. Cut onion and celery into small pieces. Sauté in oil until slightly browned. Add boiling water and bay leaf. Simmer until tender. Remove bay leaf. Add milk and salt to taste. Melt butter. Add parsley. Serve hot.

Mix together oats, nuts, brown sugar, coconut and saltset aside. Combine butter, marmalade and milkcook until mixture boils and thickens (3-5 minutes). Pour over cereal mixturestir until well blended. Spread in an 8x8-inch pan and chill until firm (30 minutes). Cut into 2x2-inch squares.

In a small bowl, mix together the cream cheese and pesto. Divide the mixture among 6 burrito-size tortillas. Top each with 1/2 cup of the shredded turkey and 1/2 cup of the lettuce and tomato. Roll up each tortilla, wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 4 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, and salt. Cut butter into flour mixture using two forks or a pastry cutter. Stir in vanilla. Add the eggs and milk. Blend well. Spread into a buttered 8x11-inch baking pan. Bake for about 40 minutes. Cool, refrigerate, then cut into bars.

Peel and devein the shrimp, leaving the tails on. Squeeze the lemon juice all over the shrimp to keep them from turning brown in the pan. In a large skillet, add the olive oil and the minced garlic. Saute the shrimp in the oil and the garlic until just cooked through. Remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside in a warm place. Reduce the heat to medium-low and add the white wine to the pan, deglazing the pan and scraping up any brown bits from the bottom of the pan. Stir in the Italian parsley and add the cooked shrimp back to the pan, tossing them gently in the wine-parsley mixture. Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon juice. Serve immediately with crusty bread, rice or pasta.

Saute diced onion in olive oil. Add garlic and saute for one minute more. Add zucchini, carrot, tomato and parsley. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add basil and black pepper. Stir well. Add water to desired consistency.

Heat the lite olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the chiles and cook for 20 seconds, until chiles are very fragrant. Add the minced garlic and saute for 30 seconds, until the garlic is golden. Remove from heat and add the butter and lime juice. Season with salt. Toss the shrimp in the hot mixture and cook for 1 minute. Serve at once with chopped green onion and the bread.
Combine green tea, mint extract and sugar in a teapot and add just-boiled water. Cover and steep for 10 minutes. Remove the mint sprig before serving.

Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. Beat eggs slightly and add to the flour mixture, along with the sugar, milk and peanut butter. Mix well and pour into a greased 9" x 5" loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Check for doneness by inserting a toothpick into the center of the loaf. It should come out clean. Remove from oven and let cool. Makes 1 loaf.

Prepare and bake cookies according to package instructions. Let cool completely. Combine powdered sugar and enough lime juice and lime zest to make a thick glaze. Drizzle glaze over cookies. Sprinkle with coconut.

Preheat oven to 425 deg. Prick the potato all over with a fork. Season with thyme, pepper, and salt to taste. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 45-50 minutes, turning once, until the potato is crisp on the outside and tender within. Sprinkle with cheese and bake until the cheese has melted.

Cut chicken into cubes. Brown in skillet with butter. Add garlic. Stir in broth. Add spaghetti. Cook until done. Drain. Return to pan. Add onion. Add chili powder. Stir. Add Rotel. Add Velveeta. Stir until Velveeta is melted. Serve.

Mix milk, flour and salt into a smooth batter. Pour 1/4 cup of batter into a hot pan with butter. When the bubbles appear on top of the pancake, turn and cook the other side for 1 minute until brown on each side. Repeat until all batter is used up. Serve the frittatensuppe with beef broth topped with strips of sliced pancake.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, add 1 tbsp olive oil. Add 1/2 of a crushed garlic clove and saute for 1 minute. Add the fennel and 1/2 cup water and cover and cook for 10 minutes. Uncover and cook until tender. Season to taste with kosher salt and fresh ground pepper. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Mix the first five ingredients until well blended. Press into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake for ten minutes. Beat cream cheese and one cup of sugar. Add one cup of whipped topping and stir until well blended. Spread over the pretzel crust. Dissolve jello in boiling water. Stir in thawed fruit and let set for ten minutes. Pour on top of cheese mixture and chill until firm.

Spread both sides of bread with butter. Place one slice of bread with ranch dressing and turkey. Top with one slice of bread with ranch dressing and ham. Top with one slice of bread with ranch dressing and cheese. Top with one slice of bread with ranch dressing and pickles. Heat in a pan with butter and grill sandwiches until golden brown. Serve.

Cut the bacon into 1/2 inch strips. Heat a small saute pan over medium high heat. Add the bacon and cook until crisp. Drain on a paper towel. Add the toasted sesame oil to the hot pan. Add the shrimps and scallops. Season with sea salt and black pepper. Add a few dashes of hot red pepper flakes. Cook about 1 minute or until the bottoms are browned. Flip them over and add a few drops of fresh squeezed lime. Skewer each with a toothpick. Garnish with a slice of smoked bacon and a few sliced scallions. Serve immediately.
