Preheat oven to 350. Mix together all dry ingredients in bowl. Mix yogurt in a bowl until smooth, then add eggs, oil, and vanilla. Mix in dry ingredients until just moistened. Spoon into two greased loaf pans. Bake 60-70 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center of loaf comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes in pans then remove from pans to cool completely on wire racks. Drizzle with icing or sprinkle with sliced almonds before serving.
Drain tuna. Add red onion and green olives. Mix well. Spread onto one side of Italian bread. Top with provolone cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until cheese is bubbly. Enjoy.

In a bowl, stir together the 1 1/2 cups of the flour, the sugar, the baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Stir in the butter with your fingertips until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in the egg and the 1/2 cup milk. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup flour and the nutmeg. Stir in the blueberries. Spoon the batter into an ungreased 8-in. square baking pan.In another bowl, combine the brown sugar, the cinnamon and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon saltsprinkle over the batter. Bake at 375 for 35 to 40 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 8 servings.

In olive oil, cook onions until soft. Add garlic clove and cook for 1 minute. Add spices and cook for 1 minute. Add roasting chickens. Add salt. Pour in broth and add carrots. Add tomato paste. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cover and let simmer. Serve over rice.
Fry the onions with a little oil and add the spices. Cook for 3 minutes and serve.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add asparagus and cook 1 minute. Add shrimp. Cook 3 to 4 minutes, or until pink and curled. Remove with a slotted spoon. In a small bowl, combine gingerroot and next 4 ingredients. Whisk. Add to the pan with the shrimp and heat through. Serve over rice. Garnish with parsley.
In a blender, combine ice cream, vodka, baileys and kahlua. Blend well. Pour into a glass. Add ice cream topping or whipped cream to the top of the glass. Garnish with chocolate sprinkles.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Butter 12 muffin cups or use paper liners. Add chives to the softened butter. Cream the garlic into the softened butter. Sift together the baking mix, cheddar cheese, parsley and salt. Stir into the garlic-chive mixture. Add the buttermilk and mix until smooth. Fill the prepared cups with the batter 3/4 full. Bake until golden brown. Cool before removing from cups. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 12 muffins.

Mix ground beef with mayonnaise, milk, cornstarch, mustard and garlic powder in a large bowlshape into a ball and place in center of pie shellsprinkle evenly with the cheese. In a small bowl, combine the sour cream, eggs and green pepperspread over top of beefsprinkle with mushrooms, green onions, olivesbake in a preheated 375 degree F. oven for 30-35 minutes or until set. Cut into wedgesserve warm.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring often until softened. Add the vegetable stock, frozen peas and season with salt and black pepper to taste. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 30 minutes until the peas are tender. Melt the remaining butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Add the skim milk and pine nuts. Cook until the nuts are golden and the sauce is thickened. Add the frozen spinach to the cooking liquid and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 10 minutes until the spinach is tender. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Ladle the soup into bowls and drizzle with the sauce. Serve with a sprinkling of pine nuts and a swirl of sour cream if desired.

Combine 1/2 cup of water and 1/4 cup of flour in crockpot and stir well. Add in the milk slowly stirring as you add each cup of milk. Stir in the 2 cups of shredded velveeta cheese and 1/2 cup of sharp cheddar cheese. Cook on high for 1 hour or until cheese is melted. Mix in the 1/2 cup of mild cheddar cheese. Serve with your favorite bread or croutons.

Cut each wing into 4 pieces. In a large bowl, toss together the wings, oil, paprika, cumin, turmeric, chili powder, curry powder, lime rind and garlic. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Preheat the oven to 200C. Remove the wings from the marinade. Arrange the wings in a single layer on a baking tray. Roast for 30 minutes. Turn the wings over and roast for a further 10 minutes, or until the wings are browned and cooked through. Serve with rice or noodles and a crisp green salad.

Dissolve gelatin in hot waterstir in yogurt until smooth. Chill until thickened. Fold in raspberries. Pour into a dessert dish. Chill until set. Garnish with additional raspberries if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease muffin cups or line with paper muffin cups. In a large bowl combine the oat bran, baking powder, and cinnamon. In a medium bowl, combine the egg whites and sugar. Add the oil and milk. Stir in the egg mixture and combine well. Fold in the raisins. Spoon into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Makes 18 muffins.

Peel and dice the potatoes into a large saucepan of cold salted water and cook over high heat until tender. While the potatoes are cooking, heat the milk and cream together in a small saucepan over medium heat with the garlic and butter, and bring to a simmer. Strain the cooking liquid from the potatoes and return them to the saucepan. Add the cream mixture and the cheeses and mash with a handheld mixer or a potato ricer. Season with scallions and salt and pepper to taste. Place the potato mixture into a casserole dish and sprinkle with the scallions and more cheese. Bake the gratin for approximately 30 minutes, or until golden brown and bubbly. Serve hot.

Whisk together wine, oil, vinegar and seasonings. Pour over roast. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or up to overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Roast uncovered for 2 hours. Remove from oven. Brush roast with vegetable oil. Continue roasting uncovered for 1 hour or until desired doneness. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Mix shortening, sugar, egg and syrup until well blended. Stir in flour and baking powder. Form into balls. Roll in coconut. Bake in a moderate (350 degree) over until lightly browned (about 10 to 12 minutes). Cool and serve.

In large bowl, cream together the butter and chocolate until smooth and shiny. Add the vanilla and eggs and blend well. In a medium bowl, sift together the flour and salt and stir into the chocolate mixture. Mix well and fold in the nuts. Drop by teaspoonful onto wax paper and refrigerate until firm. Makes 100 bites.
Pack apples in jars, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Combine first 5 ingredients. Add water and lemon juice. Process in water bath canner for 35 minutes.

Put all the dry ingredients in a mortar and pound with the pestle to a fine powder. Transfer to an airtight jar and store in a cool dry place. The nine-spice garam masala can be used in the same way as standard garam masala. It is the most versatile of all the curry pastes and can be used in the same way as standard garam masala. It is the most versatile of all the curry pastes and can be used in the same way as standard garam masala.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion in butter until soft and lightly browned. Stir in celery soup and milk. Bring to a simmer over low heat. Cook 10 minutes. Stir in swiss cheese and 2 cups sauerkraut. Bring back to simmer. Cook 2-3 minutes or until sauerkraut is heated through. Serve hot with turkey polish sausage and remaining sauerkraut sprinkled on top. Serves 8-10.

Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Saute garlic and scallops till just cooked through. Add remaining ingredients. Cook till heated through. Drain pasta and place in pan. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with Parmasean and serve.
Spread mayo on crust and sprinkle with garlic and parmesan cheese. Top with basil and cheese. Bake according to package instructions. Cool and cut into squares.

Mix all-purpose flour, baking powder,salt and sugar together in a bowl. Add eggs. Cut in shortening with pastry blender. Add milk and mix well. Stir in raisins and caraway seed if desired. Knead lightly on floured surface until smooth. Roll out 1/2-inch thick on floured surface. Cut into 2-inch rounds using biscuit cutter or glass. Place on greased baking sheet. Brush top of each round with melted shortening. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about 12-15 minutes. Makes 12 servings.

In a medium pot, combine 2 cups rice, 4 cups water and 2 teaspoon tabasco sauce. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Combine 3/4 cup water and 1 tablespoon turmeric in a small bowl. Stir well. In a large skillet, heat 2 teaspoons olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook 2 minutes. Add green peas and cook 2 minutes. Add green onion and cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes and cook 2 minutes. Add rice and water mixture. Stir in 1/2 cup of the rice mixture into turmeric mixture and stir well. Add remaining rice mixture and stir well. Cover and cook 3 minutes. Stir in shrimp and cook until pink. Remove from heat. Stir in olives. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In large bowl, mix 4 cups flour, 1 cup sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon baking powder. Cut in 1/2 cup shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. In small bowl, beat 1 egg with 1 1/2 cups milk. Add to flour mixture all at oncemix just until moistened. Turn into greased 12-cup muffin pan. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup sugar. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until golden brown. For blueberry muffins, stir 1 cup thawed frozen berries into battersprinkle with 2 tablespoons sugar.

In a small saucepan combine chocolates and butter and melt over low heat. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. In a large bowl combine the granulated sugar and eggs and beat with an electric mixer for 3 minutes or until thick and creamy. Add the melted chocolate mixture and mix until blended. Stir in the flour and baking powder and mix well. Spread the batter evenly into a lightly greased 9 x 9-inch baking pan. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until set. Cool for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.

Combine cheese and nuts in food processor. Pulse until well combined and somewhat finely ground. Scrape down sides of work bowl as needed. Add remaining ingredients and pulse until combined. Serve with crackers, pita or on sandwiches. Makes about 2 1/2 cups.

Mix together tomatoes with garlic and brown sugar in a bowl until smooth. Dip each of the chicken breasts in flour to coat. Heat butter in a skillet over medium-high heatcook until chicken is no longer pink (about 5 minutes per side). Add red onion to the pan. Stir in bloody mary mix. Add tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve over noodles.

Bring milk to boil in saucepan, add bay leaf and onions. Simmer 5 minutes. Cut haddock into chunks, add to milk mixture. Melt butter in skillet, stir in flour, cook 1 minute. Add milk mixture stirring until thickened. Cook for 1 minute more. Serve over potatoes or rice with grated cheddar cheese sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a loaf pan with shortening. In a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and saltset aside. In a medium bowl, mix the butter and sugar until creamy. Add the egg and beat until blended. Stir in the banana, milk, and vanilla extract. Add the flour mixture in 3 parts alternating with 2 parts of the berry mixture. Spread into the prepared loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from the pan to cool completely on the rack. Store tightly wrapped at room temperature.
Stuff green bell peppers with rice. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes. Dice green onion. In a bowl mix salsa, sour cream, cumin, salt and onion. Spoon over stuffed green peppers. Serve immediately.

In a small skillet melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and mix to form a paste. Add the salt and paprika. Stir for one minute. Add the garlic, shrimp and triple sec. Stir for another minute. Remove from heat. Add the parsley and crushed red pepper flakes. Serve over rice with a squeeze of lime.

In a large bowl, combine 1 cup of flour, yeast, salt, sugar, and water. Stir until well blended. Beat 2 eggs and stir into dough. Add butter. Knead well. Divide dough into 4 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a long rope. Tie each rope into a knot. Place knots on a greased baking sheet. Let rise 1 hour. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 17 minutes. Combine remaining 2 cups of flour and butter. Mix well. Spread mixture over hot loaf. Sprinkle with parmesan and provolone. Bake for 3 to 5 minutes longer, until golden. Makes 4 loaves.

Make roll mix according to package directions. Roll out on lightly floured surface. Cut dough with round cookie cutter. Put 1/2 tsp sugar in each center. Fold over dough to form a ball. Press edges together. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes. While still warm, drizzle with lemon glaze. Place raisins in center of each cookie. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boilcook 2 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly. Stir in blueberriescook 3 minutes or until heated through, stirring frequently. Serve over ice cream or cake.

Beat egg whites and milk with cinnamon and vanilla. Spray 10x15 inch jellyroll pan with cooking spray. Place 1 slice raisin bread in pan. Dip in batter and turn. Repeat with remaining raisin bread. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until golden. Turn once. Serve with maple syrup.

Cook the pasta in boiling water according to package directions. Drain. In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the rosemary, garlic and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the gorgonzola. Stir in the cooked penne. Mix in the walnuts. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese.
In a large bowl combine the first six ingredients. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Store in a covered container.

Cook potatoes in boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender. Peel and mash while still warm. Stir in parsley. Combine eggs with 1/2 cup milk and 1 tbsp plain flour and add to mashed potato mixture with remaining milk. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour into a greased baking dish. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes or until golden brown and firm to the touch. Sprinkle with parsley and serve hot.

Cut potatoes lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick rounds. Place rounds, butter side down, on a baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with seasoning salt and green onion. Broil 1 minute or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with bacon and cheddar cheese. Bake 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Brown sausage in skillet with seasoning. Drain fat. In a crockpot, add cream cheese and mix in ranch dressing mix with rotel tomatoes. Add sausage to mixture in crockpot. Cook on high for about 1 hour. Serve warm with tortilla chips or bake in cooked wonton wrappers till set.

Prepare the okra by cutting off the tops. Take each pod and run a knife through the stem end. This should cut out the seeds. You can then dice the okra. Cook the okra in bacon drippings with the chopped onions and tomatoes until tender. In a mixing bowl combine the okra, Ritz cracker crumbs, egg and cheese. Turn into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Mix all dry ingredients in large mixing bowl. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add milk gradually until dough forms. Turn onto lightly floured surface. Knead briefly until smooth. Divide into 12 pieces. Roll each piece into a 3-inch circle. Place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper or greased wax paper. Brush top of each round with a little water. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm.

Heat butter in pan over medium heat. Add eggs and salt and pepper to taste. When eggs start to set, add milk. Cook until eggs are done. Add jarlsberg and lox slices. Cook until heated through. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl whisk together mayonnaise, horseradish mustard and garlic. Add diced potatoes and toss to coat. Pour into a greased 9x13x2 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until heated through. sprinkle with parsley. Makes 6 servings. Serve with roasted chicken or steak.

Cut garlic into paper-thin slices. Add to food processor bowl with vegetable oil. Pulse until finely chopped. With motor running, slowly add mayo. Season with salt & pepper to taste. May be stored up to 1 month in refrigerator or 1 month in freezer. Reheat in microwave for about 30 seconds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown chicken in oil. Transfer to a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned. Add lemon juice and oregano. Pour over chicken. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with artichoke hearts. Bake for 5 minutes more. Serve with a slice of lemon.

Heat oil and fry the leeks and sweet potato for 10 minutes or until they start to soften. Add the carrots and cook for another 5 minutes. Pour over the stock and bring to the boil. Cut the pumpkin and potatoes into small pieces and add to the soup. Simmer for 30 minutes and then blend until smooth. Reheat the soup and add the red curry paste and lime juice.

Combine soup and cheese in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until hot. Remove from heat. Add corn, corn kernels and shrimp. Stir in milk, seasoning salt, and pepper. Simmer 5 minutes or until heated through. Garnish with green onions.

Place almond meal, whey powder, caster sugar and baking powder in a food processor. Grind until mixture is crumbly. Combine water, oil and eggs in a small bowl. Pour into the processor and process until mixture forms a ball. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before shaping into 24 balls with your hands and place on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350 F oven for about 15-18 minutes or until firm to the touch. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 2 dozen.

In a large skillet, fry potatoes in butter until browned. Add bacon and fry until crisp. Remove from skillet. In a small bowl, mix together milk, eggs, salt, ham, tomato and chives. Pour mixture into skillet with potatoes and bacon. Cook over medium-low heat until set. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f (230 degrees c). Toss mushrooms with oil in a large bowlseason with balsamic vinegar, garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, mexican oregano, salt and pepper. Spread evenly into a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Roast in oven until mushrooms are golden brown and tender, about 10 minutes. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Combine first 3 ingredients. Add next 4 ingredientsstir until well blended. Beat butter and sugars in large bowl with mixer until blended. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in chocolate chips and oats. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool.
Cook green pepper and onion in butter in a large skillet until pepper is tender. Stir in tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Cover and simmer 10 minutes or until heated through. Toss with noodles.

Brown the shallots in the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the broth, nectar, squash, quinoa, cumin, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt to the pan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the vegetables are very soft and the quinoa is tender, about 35 minutes. Add the chicken and continue to simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes more. Season the soup with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cook and drain zucchini in microwave oven as directed on package. Heat margarine in skillet. Add pepper and basilsaute until tender-crisp. Stir in tomatoes and cook until slightly thickened. Spoon over zucchini. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 15 minutes. Serve as a side dish or a vegetable. Makes 4 servings.

Cut avocado into small chunks and toss with lemon juice. Mash slightly. Cut onion into small dice. Wilt spinach in a skillet with a small amount of olive oil over medium heat. When spinach is wilted, toss with lemon juice and onion. Add avocado and cilantro. Toss again. Season with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature.
In a small saucepan combine sugar, corn syrup and butter. Heat to boiling. Pour onto wax paper. Sprinkle with salt and let cool. Combine cereal and nuts. Drizzle with topping.

To prepare crust, process gingersnaps until finely ground. Add melted margarinepulse until well blended. Press firmly into 6 2 1/2-inch tart pans sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 325 for 20 minutes. To prepare filling, beat cream cheese on medium-low speed until softened. Add ricotta cheesebeat until well blended. Add Splendabeat until blended. Add eggbeat until smooth. Beat in egg yolkbeat until blended. Stir in vanilla. Pour filling into crusts. Bake at 325 for 30 minutes. To prepare topping, beat cocoa and milk on medium-low speed until well blended. Stir in Splenda. Spread over warm cheesecakes. Chill until firm. Yield: 6 mini-cheesecakes.

Combine all the ingredients except the panko in a large bowl. Mix thoroughly. Divide the mixture in half. Form into 30 meatballs. Coat with the panko. Fry in hot oil until cooked through. Drain and set aside.

Heat oven to 450°F. Place flour in shallow bowl. Mix in salt and pepper. Dip both sides of each chicken breast into flour mixture. Heat butter in heavy skillet over medium high heat until sizzling. Add half the chicken. Cook until browned on both sides. Remove and put in 13X9 baking dish. Repeat with remaining chicken. Sprinkle with basil. Add wine vinegar to pan drippings. Heat until boiling. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with parmesan. Bake until no pink remains in thickest part of chicken. Remove from oven. Dissolve sugar in cream. Drizzle over chicken. Sprinkle with basil.

Combine flour, cinnamon, salt, baking powder, banana, milk, eggs and honey in a mixing bowl. Mix well. Stir in peanut butter until well blended. Divide batter into 12 muffin cups. Bake for 18 minutes. Cool in pans for 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Combine dates, baking soda, boiling water and egg in blender. Blend until smooth. Combine all other ingredients. Blend again. Bake in a lightly greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pan at 350 F for 1 hour. Cool. Makes 1 loaf.

Cook pasta according to package directions. In a large bowl, combine pasta, olive oil, vinegar, basil, and carrot. Toss well. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and green onion. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Mix all dressing ingredients together in a bowl until sugar is dissolved. Refrigerate. Place remaining ingredients in large bowl. Toss gently. Just before serving, add dressing and toss again.

Remove skin from chicken and discard. Place chicken in large roasting pan or casserole dish. Combine remaining ingredientspour over chicken. Cook at 375 degrees for 1 hour or until done, basting often. When done, let cool and remove meat from bone. Chop or shred meat and add back to pan with remaining liquid. Refrigerate until ready to use. Serve on a bed of romaine lettuce or any lettuce of your choice. I find this best when served cold.

In a large bowl, beat together the powdered sugar and cream cheese until smooth and fluffy. Add the cocoa and the butter and beat until blended. Add the vanilla and beat well. Spread the mixture in a greased 8 inch square pan. Chill for at least 4 hours or until firm. Drizzle with fudge icing and sprinkle with nuts before cutting into squares to serve.

Slice the top off the roll. Remove some of the bread. Fill the roll with a layer of the tomatoes. Next layer is mozzarella. Next layer is provolone. Sprinkle on the basil. Drizzle on the olive oil. Add the seasoning. Serve.

In a skillet over medium heat, saute onion and garlic until soft. Add ground beef to pan. Season with cinnamon. Continue to cook until no longer pink. Add tomatoes and mix well. Stir in cooked rice noodles. Serve.

Cut cabbage into 3/4 inch stripslayer in greased 9 inch pie plate. Mix milk with eggspour over cabbage. Lay sausage slices across top of casserole. Mix together cracker crumbs and melted buttersprinkle over top of casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serves 4-6.
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Cool before using. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

Cut spareribs into 3 pieces. Place in heavy plastic bag and pound with meat tenderizer until thin and flattened. Mix together all other ingredients and pour over ribs. Let stand for 2 hours. Cook in oven at 350 for 3 hours. Remove from oven and let stand for 1 hour.

Mix the cream cheese, sour cream, raisins and bacon in a large bowl. Add the green onion, curry powder, flaked coconut, fresh parsley and the chutney. Add the chopped bacon. Mix well. Refrigerate at least 3 hours. Roll into balls and cover with flaked coconut. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Brown ground beef. Drain. Add seasonings. Stir in potato and eggs. Pour into greased casserole dish. Bake at 325 degrees F for 30 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut 1 inch off the top of the brie wheel so that the wheel is flat on the bottom. Place the wheel of brie into the center of a cast iron skillet or baking dish. Sprinkle with rosemary and drizzle the oil over the cheese. Place the sliced apples around the outside of the cheese. Place in the oven and bake for about 15 minutes or until the cheese has begun to melt and become soft. Sprinkle the walnuts over the top and serve with assorted crackers and bread.

Bring 3 cups water to boil in medium saucepan. Stir in 2-1/2 cups brown rice. Coverreduce heat to medium-lowsimmer 50 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, in large nonstick skillet, cook sausage and onion over medium heat until sausage is no longer pinkdrain. Add tomatoes and green chiliescook and stir 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in corn mixture and black beans. Spoon over rice. Sprinkle with cheese.

In a large saucepan, heat sugar and water until boiling. Cook and stir for 2 mins. Cool. Pour into a large container. Add bananas. Cover and freeze. Remove from freezer 1-2 hours before serving. Add frozen concentrate and soda. Garnish with sliced bananas. Serves 20.

Combine flour, brown sugar, white sugar and oatmeal in a large mixing bowl. Cut in shortening until mixture is crumbly. Add apples and mix lightly. Press half the mixture into a greased 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 20 min. Cool. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Spread over the bottom layer. Top with remaining crumb mixture. Bake 20 min. Serve warm.

Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beat in remaining ingredients until well blended. Spread in a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Cool completely and cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350f. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add pears and cook for 15 minutes. Turn off heat and add thyme and prosciutto. Allow to cool. Place pie crust in a 9 inch tart pan. Cream together cream cheese and gorgonzola. Add salt and pepper. Spread over the bottom of the tart pan. Layer with pears and prosciutto. Bake for 25 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool slightly then serve.

Cook rice in large pot of boiling water as directed on package. Meanwhile, cook broccoli, green beans, onions and peppers in 2 to 3 tbsp cooking spray in large skillet on medium heat 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in rice and remaining ingredients. Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until thoroughly heated and cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine the first four ingredients. Spread in the bottom of a shallow 9-inch baking dish. Arrange apple slices over the cream mixture. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Cover with foil. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Uncoverbake 20-25 minutes longer or until bubbly. Serve warm.

For the topping, combine the butter and olive oil in a small bowl and mix well. To make the bread, cut the french bread into 1-inch thick slices. In a small bowl combine the melted garlic butter and the pepper and mix well. Brush the cut sides of the french bread with the melted garlic butter mixture, and sprinkle the black pepper on top. Sprinkle the top of the french bread with the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oregano and the fresh parsley. Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the bread is crisp and golden brown and the herbs and spices are fragrant. Serve warm.

Combine milk and pudding mix in a small saucepan. Stir constantly with a whisk over medium heat until thickened. Add whip topping and mix. Add the rest of the ingredients to the mixture and refrigerate overnight.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place sweet potatoes in a baking pan and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. In a large skillet, brown chicken tenders in steak seasoning. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine water and maple syrup. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced. Add the reduced syrup to the pan with the chicken. Add the green onion and butter to the pan. Stir well. Remove from heat and pour over the sweet potatoes.
Boil water and mix biscuit mix with water in a bowl. Add sausage and cheese and mix well. Fill a greased biscuit pan or greased mini-muffin pans half full. Bake for about 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9-inch round baking dish. Heat butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add plums and cook 1 minute or until lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Add sugar and cook until the juices start to bubble and the fruit is softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in vanilla and milkset aside. In a large bowl combine the flour, eggs and saltmix well. Stir in the plum mixture and pour into the baking dish. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a cake tester inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool slightly and dust with confectioners' sugar if desired.

Pour 6 to 8 cups of water in a French press or coffee pot. Put in ground coffee, and bring to a boil. Allow to steep for about five minutes, and strain into an 8-cup container. Slowly pour in milk, stirring frequently to prevent lumps. Stir in sugar until dissolved, then add caramel syrup and chocolate syrup. Stir in vanilla extract. Store in refrigerator for up to five days. When ready to serve, pour into a tall glass or mug over ice cubes. Sprinkle with a little salt.

Boil the baking potatoes in a large saucepan of boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain potatoesreturn to pan. Cover with paper towelspat dry. Cut the potatoes into quarters. In a bowl combine the Miracle Whip, paprika, garlic, salt, and pepper to tastestir in the potatoes, and toss to coat evenly. Place potato mixture onto a large piece of heavy-duty foiltop with the onion rings. Bring up the 3 sidesfold foil over the top of the onion rings to seal the package securely. Grill the foil-packed potatoes over medium-low heat, turning occasionally, for 35-40 minutes or until tender. Carefully open the foilsprinkle potatoes with parsley if desired.

Place peppers and spices in a pot and bring it up to a boil and cook for about 5 minutes. Turn off heat and add the remaining ingredients and let it cool down completely before pouring it over the hard cooked eggs and store for at least a week before eating.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken. Cook 5 minutes or until browned. Add salsa and cumincook 2 more minutes. Stir in 1 cup of the cheese and remaining ingredients. Heat to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook 5 more minutes or until heated through. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon of the remaining cheese. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onions and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the paprika and coriander and cook for another minute. Add the chilli flakes and cook for another minute. Add the tomatoes and the beans and cook for about 20 minutes. Add the balsamic vinegar and season to taste. Serve hot.

In a small saucepan saute onions over medium heat until soft and light brown. Add brown sugar and balsamic vinegar. Cook 1-2 minutes longer until liquid has reduced slightly. Remove from heat. Season with crushed red pepper and set aside to cool. On a pizza crust layer ricotta cheese. Sprinkle with prosciutto and onion mixture. Bake according to pizza crust directions. Serve warm or room temperature.

Cook onion in 1 tablespoon butter till tender. Stir in the seasoning salt, then add water. Bring to a boil. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the mushrooms and evaporated milk. Continue cooking until heated through and thickened slightly.

In a large bowl combine the tomatoes, onion and lime. Mash by hand with a potato masher or puree in a blender or food processor. Add the oil, garlic and chile. Mash by hand or pulse the blender for a few seconds. Taste and add more seasoning to suit your taste. Serve this as a dip for tortilla chips or a condiment for your favorite dishes.

Saute garlic and ginger in oil until the garlic turns golden brown. Add the rice and stir fry until the grains are translucent. Add the coconut milk and water and bring to a simmer. Simmer the rice with the lid covered until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is cooked through. Add the salt and stir. Garnish with the scallions and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Separate rolls along perforations. Place one crescent roll in each of 6 ungreased miniature muffin cups coated with cooking spray. Combine sugar and cinnamon in shallow dish. Dip each marshmallow in melted margarineroll in sugar mixture. Place one marshmallow in center of each roll. Brush edges with margarine. Bake 8-10 minutes or until marshmallows are puffy and golden brown. Cool in cups for 2 minutes. Serve warm or cool. Yield 6 servings (1 puff per serving).

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion and squash in melted butter about 6 minutes, or until squash is tender. Add garlic and cook about 1 minute more. Stir in broth. Simmer 10 minutes. Add pasta to broth. Cook 4 minutes. Add broccoli. Cook until pasta is tender. Stir in tomatoes. Top each serving of soup with bread and sprinkle with Parmesan.

In a skillet brown the short ribs on all sides. Add the consomme, water, and taco seasoning mix to the skillet and bring to a boil. Add the bell pepper and simmer for 30 minutes to one hour or until the meat is tender. Serve with rice or tortillas and a tossed salad.

Cook elbow macaroni according to package directionsdrain. Spray 13 inch pie pan with cooking spray. In small bowl, mix together eggs, broccoli, ham. Combine 1 cup of the pasta with 1 cup of the cheese blendmix well. Spread 1/2 of the pasta mixture in prepared pantop with 1/2 of the broccoli mixture. Repeat. Bake uncovered at 375 for 45 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting.

In large saucepot, heat water until boiling. Remove from heat and add jell-o mixes until dissolved. Stir in lemon juice. Add applesauce and stir until slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Fold in cream cheese and mayonnaise. Fold in pecans and celery. Pour into 2 quart mold and chill until firm.

In a large saucepan, combine the orzo and cold water. Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and simmer the orzo until it is just tender, about 8 minutes. Drain the orzo in a colander. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, combine the sun-dried tomatoes, olive oil, vinegar, pine nuts and garlic. Cook until the mixture is combined. Add the tomato mixture to the drained orzo. Add the radicchio, basil, and cheese. Serve immediately.
Saute garlic cloves in oil. Add chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Stir in orzo pasta. Cook according to package directions. Add cooked rice. Add more broth if desired.

Combine sour cream, mayonnaise, and ranch dressing mix. Spread half of the mixture over the bottoms of 2 shallow 1 1/2 quart baking dishes. Place fillets in dishes. Spoon remaining sour cream mixture over the fillets. Sprinkle with french fried onion rings. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve immediately.

Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray. Unroll wraps and place on baking sheet. Spread about 1/2 cup of the tomato sauce evenly over each wrap. Sprinkle each with 1/4 cup of the mexican blend cheese. Top with 1/8 teaspoon each of the oregano and sweet basil. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of the black pepper and 1/8 teaspoon of the crushed red pepper flakes. Sprinkle with 1/8 cup of the pepperoni. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the wraps are browned and the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350f. Grease and line an 8x8-inch pan with parchment paper. Combine all ingredients in the pan and bake for 25 to 35 minutes. Cool completely before removing the brownie from the pan and cutting into bars.

Combine all the above ingredients in a small bowl. Mix well. Stuff each mushroom with equal amounts of cheese mixture. Bake in a 350 oven for 15 minutes or until lightly brown on top. Makes 40 servings or 40 large mushrooms. Ive seen these in store for 4.00 for 40 pieces and they are worth every penny. They taste like they came right from the store but with more cheese. If you want less cheese you can use less cream cheese but it still tastes great as it is. The only thing i would change is to add more garlic to make it taste more like hy vee s. I have made these several times now and i love them every time.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a medium bowlstir with a whisk to blend. Gradually add milk to flour mixture. Beat at low speed with an electric mixer 1 minute or until a thin batter forms (batter will be thin). Add shortening, margarine, granulated sugar, and vanillabeat at low speed until well blended. Increase speed to highbeat 4 minutes or just until mixture is thickened and fluffy. Frosting will be thick enough to spread on cake or cupcake without breaking or spreading thinly over cake or cupcakemay be frosted immediately or stored in refrigerator for up to 5 days. To frost a 2-layer, 9-inch cake or 24 cupcakes, prepare as directed above, beating at high speed 5 to 6 minutes or just until frosting is thickened and fluffy. To frost a 3-layer, 8-inch cake or 36 cupcakes, prepare as directed abovebeat at high speed 5 to 6 minutes or just until frosting is thickened and
Mix tuna with olive oil, lemon juice, onion, olives and a splash of water. Taste for seasoning. Serve on toasted bread with lettuce and tomato.

Melt the white chocolate with the sweetened condensed milk in the top of a double boiler or in the microwave. Add the almonds, orange peel and dried cranberries to the melted white chocolate mixture and stir until well blended. Spread the mixture into a waxed paper lined pan and refrigerate until set. Cut into squares and sprinkle with the dried blueberries.

In a shallow bowl combine cumin, salt and pepper. Coat fish with mixture, coating well and shaking off excess. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add fish and cook 2 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Place fish on a platter and top with salsa and avocado. Makes 4 servings.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into even-sized pieces. Place in a large pot with enough cold water to cover them by about 2 inches. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook for about 15 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain the potatoes and return to the pot. Mash the potatoes with the butter and sherry and season with the salt. Serve hot.
In small saucepan, combine parsnips, butter, honey, rind and juice. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatcover and cook until parsnips are very tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Makes 4 servings.
Drain the vegetables and combine with the remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate for several hours. Serve with any meal.

In slow cooker place pork shoulder, onions, gingerroot, teriyaki sauce, and water. Cook covered 4 to 5 hours. Transfer to colander. Stir in vegetable mixture and rice. Cook uncovered 30 minutes. Serve hot with chopsticks if desired. Makes 6 main dish servings.
In a medium bowl, combine apple, pear, red grapes, peaches, walnuts, plain yogurt, unsweetened applesauce, salt, cardamom. Chill overnight. Serve the next morning with a sprinkle of cardamom on top.

In a heavy skillet, heat the butter over a medium heat. When the butter is sizzling hot, place the fish in the skillet. Cook the fish for 3 minutes on each side or until it is done. Remove the fish from the skillet and keep warm. In the same skillet, pour off the butter from the skillet, add the milk. Bring to a boil. Stir the plain flour with the milk and stir until thick and smooth. Remove the skillet from the heat. Stir in the lemon slices. Return the trout to the skillet and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes. Serve the fish topped with the sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine whole kernel corn, flour, sugar, eggs and milk in a large bowl. Beat with a hand mixer until well blended. Spread in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 1 hour or until center is set. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before cutting into squares for serving.

Lightly spray 8 or 9 inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In large bowl combine Bisquick mix, nonfat milk and fat-free liquid egg substitutestir with wire whisk until smooth. Stir in vegetables and parmesan cheese until well blendedpour into prepared pie plate. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake in 375 degree oven about 40 min or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 10 mincut into wedges. Yields 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat together all dry ingredients except peanut butter. Cream together shortening and sugars. Add beaten dry ingredients. Mix together egg and peanut butter. Add egg mixture to creamed mixture. Stir in vanilla. Chill for at least one hour. Roll dough into 1 inch balls and place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 5 dozen.

Sauté bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels and set aside. Cook onion and garlic in bacon fat. Add olives and continue to sauté. Add diced tomatoes and sauce. Season with chili flakes, anchovy paste and salt and pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add bacon and serve with pasta.
Combine all ingredients in blender. Blend until smooth. Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of fresh orange if desired.

In a large heavy saucepan cook bacon until crisp and remove and drain fat from pan. Add celery, carrots, and onion and cook until tender. Add flour and stir until lightly brown. Add chicken broth and simmer until thickened. Add potatoes and simmer until tender. Add tomatoes and baby clams and simmer until clams open. Add thyme and season to taste with salt and black pepper. Do not boil.

Prepare the gelatin as directed on the box. Let cool slightly. Add the orange juice and stir to combine well. Fill shot glasses, then refrigerate until completely set up, at least an hour and a half. Fill the shot glasses half full of the gelatin mixture and top off with the champagne. Serves 6.
Mix cornstarch with water until smooth. Add milk slowly while stirring. Boil the mixture until thickened. Add cinnamon and vanilla. Add sugar and coconut. Serve hot in cups.

In a large nonstick skillet or wok, heat peanut oil over medium heat. Add tangerine peel, gingerroot, and dried chiliesstir-fry 1 minute or until fragrant. Stir in chickenstir-fry 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir in soy sauce, vinegar, and sugarstir-fry 1 minute or until heated through. Serve over hot cooked white rice or pasta.

Peel, trim, and cut parsnips into slices 1/2" thick. Toss with salt & pepper. Heat the oil (or melt the butter) in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the parsnips in a single layer. Sauté for 4-5 minutes or until the parsnips are golden brown on the bottom side. Flip the slices over to brown the other side. Remove from heat and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with parsley and nutmeg.

Bring chicken stock to boil over high heat. Blend flour and seasonings in small bowl. Gradually add stock to flour mixture, stirring until smooth. Cook and stir over medium heat for 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in turkey and heat through. Serve over toast.

Prepare grill. In small bowl combine butter, lime zest, lime juice and jalapeño. In another bowl combine corn and olive oil. Place on grill and grill for 5 minutes. Turn and brush with lime butter. Cook additional 5 minutes or until tender. Serve warm.

Follow instructions on pudding mix. Add eggs. Pour into a greased bundt pan. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Cool on a wire rack. For glaze, melt together in double boiler the morsels and butter. Spread over cake. Sprinkle with nuts. Refrigerate.

Mix first 4 ingredients well with mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add vanillabeat well. Combine flour, baking powder, and baking sodastir into batter. Fold in mashed bananas. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing cupcakes from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Make frosting: In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and butter until smooth. Beat in confectioners' sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in peanut butter until well blended. Add vanillabeat until well blended. Spread frosting on cupcakes. Garnish with chopped peanuts. Store in refrigerator.

In a large pot, heat the oil and butter. Add the onion and saute for about 5 minutes until soft. Add the potatoes and courgettes, cover with the vegetable stock. Bring to the boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until vegetables are cooked through. Remove from the heat. Place a liquidiser bowl over a saucepan of hot water. Using a spoon, scoop up some of the vegetables from the pot. Liquidise until smooth. Return the puree to the pot. Stir in the parmesan. Heat through. Whisk the eggs with the lemon juice and seasoning. Ladle some of the soup into four bowls. Pour the egg mixture over. Sprinkle with basil. Garnish with a parmesan ridge. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Unfold one puff pastry sheet and lay on baking sheet. Prick with fork and bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned and just cooked through. Remove from oven and let cool completely. On half sheet of dough, spread 1 tablespoon orange marmalade. Lay sliced strawberries over jam and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of granulated sugar. Fold other half of dough over filling and pinch edges to seal. Beat egg and 1 tablespoon water in small bowl until frothy and brush over pastry edges. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown and pastry is just cooked through. Cool for 10 minutes before slicing into wedges to serve. Serve with whipped topping, if desired.

Cut the tops off the tomatoes and discard them. Remove the cores and seeds from the tomatoes. Slice the tomatoes as thin as you can. Put the slices in a bowl. Sprinkle with the salt and the hot sauce and mix gently to coat the slices. Drizzle with the oil and the vinegar and toss gently to coat the slices evenly. Put in a single layer in a shallow dish and refrigerate for several hours. Serve chilled with a few sprigs of fresh parsley and garlic cloves pressed into each slice.

Melt butter in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and saute until lightly browned. Add wine and cook for 3 minutes. Add stock and cook for 5 minutes. Add the cream and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat and stir in garlic and chives. Season with salt and pepper.

Cream the sugar, butter, lemon rind and juice until creamy. Gradually beat in the flour, seasonal with the spices. Add the milk gradually, beating well after each addition. Turn out on to a lightly floured board and knead briefly. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness and cut into desired shapes with a cookie cutter. Bake on an ungreased baking sheet in a preheated oven at 350f for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned.

Combine 1/2 cup flour and rosemary in small bowl. Coat each chicken piece with flour mixture. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat butter. Add half of chicken to skillet. Cook 4-6 minutes on each side until lightly browned. Remove from skillet. Repeat with remaining butter and chicken. Add mushrooms to skillet. Cook 4-5 minutes until tender. Add cooking wine to skillet. Boil until liquid is reduced by half. Add enough water to cover chicken. Reduce heat. Simmer 10 minutes. Add parsley. Transfer chicken to serving platter. Toss mushrooms with sauce. Arrange mushrooms around chicken and serve.
Combine all ingrediants in a food processor. Process until the mixture is very smooth. Stuff into casings, tying them off at regular intervals, then refrigerate for 2 weeks before serving.

In a large pot combine the rhubarb, the vanilla bean and cardamom pods. Add the white wine, lemon juice and zest. Bring to a boil and simmer until rhubarb is tender. Let cool to room temperature. Stir in the yogurt and blend until smooth. Add powdered sugar to taste. Pour into 4 serving glasses. Garnish with lime slices. Serve chilled.

Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. Combine buttermilk, molasses and egg in a small bowl. Add to the dry ingredients all at once. Stir until just moistened. Add raisins. Knead on a lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 8-10 minutes. Place dough in a greased bowl, turning to grease top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Punch down dough and turn onto a lightly floured surface. Divide dough into 2 equal portions. Roll each into a 14-inch rope and braid. Place on a greased baking sheet, cover and let rise until doubled in bulk, about 40 minutes. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes or until browned. Cool on a wire rack. Store in an air tight container.

Brown meat and onion and drain fat. Add taco seasoning and water and simmer 5 minutes. Add corn and stir in soup and put in 9 x 13 pan and top with tater tots. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Take out top with cheese put back in oven for 5 minutes or till cheese is melted. Add ketchup or taco sauce when served tastes very good enjoy.

Wet a paper towel and wipe any dirt from the mushrooms. Place the mushrooms in a large stockpot. Add the remaining ingredients to the pot. The liquid will not cover the mushrooms at first. Cook covered over very low heat for 4 hours. Stir occasionally so that all of the mushrooms are completely coated with the cooking liquid. Remove the cover and cook for an additional 4 hours. The mushrooms will shrimk by half and become saturated with cooking liquid. Remove with a slotted spoon and serve in a bowl.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Slice the salami into small rounds (about 1/4-inch thick) and saute until browned on all sides. Add the scallions and garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the tomato and cook for 2 minutes until softened. Beat the eggs with the salt and pepper, pour into the skillet and cook until scrambled. Top with the goat cheese. Makes 2 servings. Serve with bread or on toast for a heartier meal.
In a medium bowl combine the first five ingredients. Beat until smooth and of spreading consistency. Tint with food coloring, if desired. Use to frost or ice cookies or cakes.

In a large sauce pan heat the butter over medium high heat. Add the shallots and cook for 2 minutes. Add the frozen peas and 1 cup of chicken stock. Cook until the stock is absorbed. Add more stock if necessary. Cook until the peas are tender about 5 minutes. Stir in the whipping cream. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve hot topped with a crouton if desired.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 9x12 pan and line with parchment paper. Sift flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt into a medium bowl. Mix the remaining dry ingredients together. Add water and mix until the batter is smooth. Add oil and mix. Add vanilla and mix. Fold in nuts. Spread in prepared pan. Bake 350 for 35 minutes or until firm in the center and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack. Cut into squares. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Soak violets in milk for 2 hours, strain. Beat yolks with sugar until thick and pale. Gradually add warm milk, stirring constantly over hot water. Return to saucepan and cook over hot water for 10 minutes stirring constantly until mixture coats the back of the spoon. Cool and refrigerate. When cold, beat vigorously for 1 minute to aerate custard. Pour into molds. Garnish with violets and serve chilled.

Heat oil in a large skillet. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add chicken and saute until browned. Add remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Pour marinade over chicken and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is cooked through. Remove from heat and let cool. Skewer with wooden skewers and grill until cooked through. Remove from skewers and serve with rice.

In a large bowl, beat together cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth. Add swiss cheese, green onions, and baconmix well. Spread onto a large platesprinkle with cracker crumbs. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until melted. Serve with crackers or chips.
Brown the meat in a skillet. Add the remaining ingrediants to the crockpot. Cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 6 hours. Serve over rice.

In a food processor, blend the feta and kasseri cheeses together with the cream cheese until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the garlic cloves. Blend in the lemon juice and lemon zest. Add the parsley and mint. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours to blend the flavors. When ready to serve, remove the mixture from the refrigerator. Form the mixture into 24 small balls. Roll the balls in the chopped nuts to coat them. Cover the balls and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.

Heat olive oil and saute the onion and garlic until onion is translucent. Add the chicken and brown on both sides. Add the apples and apricots and saute for about 2 minutes. Add the white wine and let it come to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer until the chicken is done. Stir in the parsley and serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl, combine lemon juice and margarineblend well. Place flounder in a 13-in. X 9-in. X 2-in. Baking dish coated with cooking spray. Brush fish with lemon mixture. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees f. for 10 minutes. In a small bowl combine soup, wine, cheese, parsley and paprika. Spread over fish. Bake another 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Makes 4 servings.
Mix first 6 ingredients together until smooth. Spread over bottom of crust. Bake 25-30 minutes until set. Cool 1 hour. Top with chocolate pudding and whipped cream. Garnish with pecans.

Combine first 4 ingredients in saucepan. Cook over low heat until thickened. Stir in wheat germ. Cool slightly. Stir in flour & chocolate chips. Spread in greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes. Cool. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 375F. Combine the marinara sauce & cream cheese. Set aside. Cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain the pasta and place in the baking dish. Add the sauce mixture over the pasta. Sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve warm.
Combine first 5 ingredients in small bowl. Add ginger, garlic, zest and fishtoss to coat well. Refrigerate 30 minutes or up to 8 hours. Grill 4 minutes each side or until desired doneness.

In a large heavy skillet combine cashews, walnuts, sugar, cardamom and 2 tablespoons water. Cook over medium heat until mixture is golden brown and coated with sugar syrup. Set aside to cool completely. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 11 by 14 by 1 inch baking pan with phyllo sheets brushing each sheet with ghee. Pour cashew mixture into center of pan. Fold phyllo over filling as you would for strudel, ending with phyllo on top. Brush top of roll with ghee. Bake for 1 hour until phyllo is golden brown. Serves 12 to 14 people.

Mix sugar, brown sugar, syrup and water in a saucepan. Stir over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Bring the mixture to a boil. Simmer until the mixture reaches 238 degrees f on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat. Stir in the bicarbonate of soda. Stir until the mixture foams up. Stir in the nuts quickly. Pour mixture onto a buttered baking sheet. Spread mixture out to a depth of 1/4-inch. Let the mixture cool. Break into pieces.

Heat oven to 375. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil and set aside. In a small bowl stir together the oil, garlic, thyme and salt and pepper. In another small bowl whisk together the juice from both lemons and zest from one of the lemons. Place the chicken breasts in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet and pour half of the mixture over them. Turn the breasts over and repeat with remaining mixture and the other half of the lemon juice and zest. Roast for 25 minutes or until cooked through and browned. Sprinkle with additional salt and pepper if desired. Serve immediately.

Crush graham crackers into small pieces. Add melted butterstir to blend. Press crumbs into bottom and up sides of 2 quart baking dish (or individual serving dishes). Bake at 325f for 10 minutes or until golden. Set aside to cool. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, stir together condensed milk, egg yolks, and lime rindcook for 3 to 5 minutes or until mixture thickens. Stir in fresh lime juicepour into crust-lined dish(s). Bake at 325f for 15 to 20 minutes or until set. Let stand for 1 hourcover and chill for up to 1 day. Whisk together whipping cream and powdered sugarspoon over cooled pie(s). Garnish with fresh lime slices.

Cook noodles. In separate pot boil chopped broccoli. In a third pot, boil chicken. When done cut up into small bite size pieces. Add cream of chicken soup and 1/2 tsp. Texas pete to the boiled broccoli. Mix in the boiled chicken and cooked egg noodles. Add 1/2 cup shredded cheese. Pour into a 9x13 baking dish and sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup cheese on top. Bake at 350 until cheese is melted and the top is golden brown. Serve hot.

Slice kiwi fruit and strawberries. Top with sliced apples and whipped cream cheese. Drizzle with sugar and milk. Prepare cookie dough according to package directions. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet for 5 minutes. Cool completely on a rack. Top with grapes for serving.

Put a few pieces of cherries in the bottom of a casserole dish. Arrange the chicken pieces on top. Sprinkle with the remaining cherries. Combine the ketchup, brown sugar and mustardpour over the chicken. Bake uncovered at 350° for 45 minutes. Serve with noodles or white rice.
Combine first 3 ingredients. Add green onion. Spread about 1 teaspoon on wonton wrapper, fold over one edge over the filling and press to seal. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute 3 minutes or until tender. Add garlic, asparagus, mushrooms and artichoke hearts. Saute until vegetables are tender-crisp. Add tomatoes and cook 2 minutes more. In a small bowl combine breadcrumbs, parsley, cheese, oil, garlic and oreganomix well and sprinkle over vegetables. Transfer skillet to oven and bake 5 minutes or until heated through.

Cut tomatoes into 1/2-inch slices. Arrange in a single layer in a shallow serving bowl. Crumble the mozzarella over the top. Drizzle with the oil, then sprinkle with the basil. Season with the salt and the black pepper. Serve at once.

Cut the onions into 1/4 thick slices and soak for 15 minutes or so in ice water to remove the sharpness of the onion. Drain and dry well. Mix the panko with the jalapenos and cayenne until evenly distributed. Beat the eggs and flour together in a separate bowl. Drain the onions again and dip into the flour mixture then the panko mixture to coat well. Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment or wax paper and bake at 375 for about 15-20 minutes, turning once or twice during baking until the onions are golden brown and the coating crispy and crunchy. Serve with ranch dressing for dipping.

Marinade pork shoulder for at least 12 hours in olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, dried mint, salt, red pepper flakes. Grill meat over hot coals or in broiler until well-browned and tender. Serve in flatbread or rolls with tzatziki sauce and fresh cucumber slices.

In a large saucepan or dutch oven, combine fresh cranberries and granulated sugar. Add water and brown sugar. Bring to a boil, reduce heat. Simmer covered 10 minutes or until berries have popped. Transfer to a blender or food processor, puree. Combine puree with butter, and return to saucepan over low heat. Stir frequently until heated through. Serve with crackers or toast. Makes 1 1/3 cup.
Mix together the first 5 ingredients. Stir in the remaining 2 and chill for 2 hours.

Peel off the outer green leaves from the leeks and slice them into rounds. Chop the inner white stalks finely and set aside. Melt butter in a large heavy-based pan or pot and saute the leek rounds over a low heat for about 5 minutes. Add the onions and celery with a little water to stop them sticking to the pan. When they are softened, add a knob of butter and the stock. Bring to a boil then cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the finely chopped leeks, chopped parsley and season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Continue to simmer for 10-15 minutes until the liquid has been reduced to a thick sauce. Remove from the heat and stir in the whipping cream. Serve hot with a sprinkling of grated cheese over each bowl if desired.

Slice the sausages into bite size pieces. In a baking dish pour in the tomato juice, worcestershire sauce, dark brown sugar and the onion. Toss the meat around to coat. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees f for about an hour or until the meat is cooked through. Serve hot with potatoes or rice.
Combine first 4 ingredients in blender. Cover and blend until smooth. Pour into 2 glasses filled with ice cubes. Serve immediately. Garnish each serving with 1 lemon and 1 orange wedge.
Bring baked beans to room temperature. Butter bread slices and top with ham and cheese. Fill sandwiches with beans and serve warm.

Combine the first four ingredients in a bowl. Toss with apples. Put in unbaked shell and dot with butter. Bake at 375 for 50-60 minutes or until apples are tender. Cool and sprinkle with nuts and icing.

Preheat oven to 425. Pat dry with paper towels. Place in roasting pan and rub with oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place cloves of garlic and rosemary over the top of the turkey. Roast for 1 hour. Turn oven to 350 and cook for an additional 30 minutes.
Prepare crust. Beat together cream cheese & sugar. Beat in peanut butter & powder. Spoon into crust. Beat together cream & fudge topping. Spread over filling. Refrigerate until serving.

Place chops in 13 x 9 pan. Pour water into gravy mix. Mix well. Add to pan and bring to boil. Cover pan and bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees. Add potatoes and onion the last half hour. Serve on mashed potatoes or rice.

Heat oil in heavy skillet. Add onion and bell pepper. Cook 2 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with lemon juice and vinegar and stir to blend. Add fish and sprinkle with cayenne. Cook 4 minutes or until fish flakes easily.

Chill 2 martini glasses. Place pomegranate juice, vodka and liqueur in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Shake until well chilled. Pour 2/3 of the drink into the glasses. Top each glass with champagne. Garnish with pomegranate seeds.

Cream cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth, blending in the morsels until melted. Add the crumbs, preserves and almonds, mixing well. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours until firm enough to shape. Using a small amount of preserves, form into balls. Roll in crumbs or almonds, place in wax paper-lined pan or on wax paper. Chill until firm. Store in refrigerator. Makes about 2 dozen.

Combine olive oil and lime juice in small bowl. Cut parsley leaves off stems. Chop parsley leaves. Slice garlic clove thin. Combine parsley, garlic and hot sauce in small bowl. Rub mahi mahi steaks with parsley mixture. Grill 5 to 7 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Remove fish from grill. Spoon 1 tablespoon lime mixture over each serving. Serve with warm tortillas. Serves 4.
Brown chicken in skillet. Add water, soup, and broccoli. Simmer for 20 minutes. Cook rice according to package directions. Stir into soup mixture. Cover. Heat through. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl, combine the first 7 ingredients. In a large zip-type plastic bag, place the spareribs and pour the ketchup mixture over them. Seal the bag and turn the ribs to coat. Refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 350. Remove the ribs from the bag and place in a large shallow baking pan. Bake for 1 hour. Turn the ribs and bake 1 hour longer. Remove from the oven. Remove the ribs from the pan and drain the pan drippings. Pour the drippings into a small saucepan and add the brown sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil and stir until the mixture is thickened and glossy. Pour over ribs and serve. Makes 10 servings.

In a large saucepan combine water, soy sauce, sugar, ginger, garlic powder and cayenne. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Stir in couscouscover and remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes or until water is absorbed. Stir in scallions and serve immediately.

Lightly brush both sides of the mushroom caps with olive oil. Place on the grill and cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Remove from the grill and let cool. Spoon a small amount of reduced-fat cheddar cheese on each cap. Lay bacon slice on each cap. Top with tomatoes and chives.
Mix dry ingredients. Add applesauce, banana, eggs, water and vanilla. Mix until smooth. Fill muffin cups. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large bowl, toss vegetables with 1 tablespoon oil. Place vegetables in a single layer in a shallow roasting pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. In a small bowl, combine remaining 2 tablespoons oil, lemon juice, and lemon pepper. Toss vegetables with dressing. Sprinkle with snow peas. Serve warm.

Combine condensed milk, copha (vegetable shortening), brandy and food coloring in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir until well blended. Add glace cherries and stir gently. Remove from heat. Line a shallow tray with baking paper. Using a teaspoon, spoon a little of the mixture into your hand and roll into a ball. Roll the ball in the desiccated coconut. Place the ball on the prepared tray. Repeat until all the mixture has been used. Chill for 30 minutes or until set. Melt dark chocolate. Spoon a little chocolate over each ball. Chill until set. Store in the fridge.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium-high heat. In a large skillet over medium heat, add bacon and cook for 5 minutes, or until it begins to render its fat. Once the fat has rendered, add the pancetta and cook until lightly browned and crisp. Reduce the heat to medium-low and add the cinnamon and continue to cook until the pancetta is browned and the cinnamon has infused into the fat. Add the cream to the skillet. In a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, parmesan cheese and a pinch of salt and pepper. Whisking constantly, slowly pour the egg yolks into the cream mixture. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until the sauce is thickened. Drain the pasta and stir it into the sauce mixtureadd the cinnamon pancetta mixture and chives. Toss until the pasta is coated in the sauce, then sprinkle with the freshly ground black pepper. Serve with additional parmesan cheese, if desired.

Preheat broiler. In a small bowl, combine half-and-half and maple syrup. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until crisp. Remove bacon with slotted spoon to paper towels to drain. Add scallops to the skillet with buttercook 2-3 minutes per side or until browned. Remove to a serving platter. In the same skillet over medium heat, stir together mustard and half-and-half mixturesimmer until thickened, 3-4 minutes. Pour over scallops to serve.

Brown celery and tarragon in hot oil in a 2 qt. saucepan until tender. Add broth and juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Add the other ingredients and simmer 20 minutes. Remove celery and tarragon. Slice the chicken and add to soup. Simmer until heated through. Garnish with celery and tarragon.

In a small heavy saucepan, melt the butter and add the orzo pasta and cook over medium heat until toasted. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add the rice and cook for 20 minutes or until the stock is absorbed and the rice is tender. Add the roasted red peppers and mix well. Sprinkle with the chili powder and the sweet smoked paprika and stir.

Combine all ingredients except meat in medium bowl. Refrigerate. Remove steaks from marinade. Discard marinade. Grill over medium-high heat 10 minutes for medium rare. Top with herb mixture and serve.

Pre-heat the oven to 150 degrees Celsius and grease the oven proof baking dish with olive oil flavored cooking spray. Mix the flour and pepper in a dish and dredge the chicken thighs in the flour. Heat the olive oil in the frypan and fry the chicken thighs until the flour is golden and crispy. In the slow cooker combine the white wine with the chicken stock. Add the garlic and the red onion and cook the onion until soft. Add the thyme and the green olives and season with salt and pepper. Place the fried chicken thighs in the slow cooker and cover with the wine and the stock mixture. Cook on high for 2 hours. Turn the slow cooker to low and cook for 2 more hours. Remove the chicken thighs from the slow cooker and add the lemon. Serve the chicken thighs with the sauce and the green olives.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prick potatoes with fork in several places and bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes or until tender. Slice off top of each potato, being careful not to remove much of the potato underneath. Scoop potato meat into a medium bowlmash with a fork. Add sour cream, table cream, and beansmix well. Fill potatoes with bean mixture. Sprinkle potatoes with recaito. Bake potatoes in preheated oven until cheese melts, about 20 minutes. Top with picante sauce before serving.

Cream shortening and sugars. Beat in egg until mixed well. Add peanut butter and mix. Add flour, salt and soda. Mix well. Drop by spoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake in 350 degree oven until done about 10 minutes.

Slice cabbage into 1/4 inch strips. Saute in olive oil until crisp-tender. Remove from pan. Add chicken broth to pan. Simmer until reduced by 1/2. Stir in butter and sherry. Add cabbage back to pan. Season to taste. Cook an additional 1-2 minutes. Serve.

Take a slice of bread and spread it with spaghetti sauce. Top with cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese. Put a few slices of olive. Repeat until all bread slices are done. Heat in the microwave for 30 seconds. Serve.

Rinse rice and set aside. Heat oil in skillet over med-high heat. Saute onions and garlic till onions are soft. Add peppers and cook 5 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and add rice. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Stir in cilantro and salt. Fluff with a fork. Serve.

While egg is frying, put red onion and green bell pepper on the griddle. Add velveeta. When eggs are done, put them on the top and bottom of the tortilla. Then put the top on the griddle. Flip it after 3 minutes. Let the other side brown. Put on plate and cut into wedges. Serve with salsa.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease muffin cups.Sift together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and baking soda. In a large bowl, combine the granulated sugar and margarinebeat until creamy. Beat in the nonfat sour cream and egg substitute. Stir in the skim milk and the sifted dry ingredients just until moistened. Fill each cup three-fourths full. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes before removing to cool completely. Yield: Makes 12 servings. Serving Size: 1 Muffin

Cut Pastrami into strips about 1/2 inch thick and place over sauerkraut in a baking dish. Sprinkle with dressing. Cover with Shredded Hash Browns and top with cheese. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into squares and serve with mustard or a side salad.

In a large bowl beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add the sugar and beat until smooth. Add the peanut butter and beat until smooth. Fold in the cool whip. Pour into the pie crust. Top with chopped peanut butter cups. Refrigerate. Cut into wedges. Serve cold.

In a small bowl mix soy sauce, cumin, brown sugar and cayenne. Lay tuna on a plate and top with the mixture. Put the plate under the broiler until the tuna is cooked. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and scallion.

Prepare english peas according to directions on package. Chop onion. Drain pimiento. In large bowl, combine all ingredients except paprika. Mix well. Sprinkle with paprika. Chill. Serve over lettuce. Makes 6 servings.

Beat eggs in bowl until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla. Cook over medium-low heat until mixture thickens. Add milk and coco lopez. Cook until mixture thickens. Add cinnamon sticks and white rum. Beat until frothy. Transfer to bottles. Store in refrigerator.

Boil 3 cups of water in medium saucepan. Add salt to water and boil the cauliflower for 8 minutes. Drain and rinse the cauliflower in cold water. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter until foamy. Add the flour and cook for 2 minutes while stirring constantly with a wire whisk to make a roux. Stir in the milk and bring to a boil while stirring constantly. Add the sour cream and continue to stir for 1 minute until mixture is smooth and thickened. Stir in the cauliflower and black pepper to taste. Transfer to an 8-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle the top with the cheddar cheese and bake for 30 minutes until golden brown on top. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all filling ingredients in an 8x8 dish. Mix all topping ingredients in another bowl. Pour topping over fruit filling. Bake 45 minutes. Serves 6.

Heat olive oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and saute until softened, about 4 minutes. Add ginger and saute 1 minute more. Add zucchini and saute 2 to 3 minutes more until crisp-tender. Add chicken stock, orange juice, orange zest and orange juice concentrate, if using. Bring to boil, reduce heat. Simmer until vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in yogurtseason to taste with salt and white pepper. Refrigerate several hours or overnight before serving.

In a small saucepan over medium low heat, melt baking chips with condensed milk. Stir until smooth and remove from heat. Stir in peppermint. Drop in red food coloring and stir. Spread into a wax paper lined 8x8 pan and sprinkle with crushed candy canes. Chill.

Spread mustard on the bottom half of the bun. Layer greens and Fuji apple slices. Top with brie cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Top with the second half of the bun. Wrap in parchment paper and refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove from parchment paper. Cut into wedges and serve.

Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil and season with black pepper and sea salt. Wrap in aluminium foil and bake in the oven for 1 hour at 180 degrees celsius. Slice the chicken breasts into thin strips. Heat olive oil in a pan and fry the chicken strips until cooked through. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. Heat another pan with olive oil and saute the onion for a couple of minutes until soft. Add the chicken and fry for a minute or so. Add the garlic and dried rosemary and stir-fry for a few seconds. Add the sweet potatoes and stir-fry for a further 3 minutes. Add the lemon juice and season with black pepper and sea salt. Serve immediately.

Place cauliflower in a large saucepan. Add 3 cups water. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain cauliflower and transfer to a large bowl. Add 2 cups milk and 1/4 teaspoon saltmash until smooth. Stir in shallot, curry powder, heavy cream, ground pepper, and butter. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in skillet. Cook onions and pepper over low heat until softened, about 10 minutes. Add ground beefcook and stir until no longer pink. Drain fat. Add remaining ingredients except bunscook and stir 5 minutes. Top each bun half with 2/3 of the beef mixturetop with bun half. Makes 6 servings.
Mix together first 7 ingredients. Form into patties. Brown in skillet with oil. Drain. Pour tomato sauce over patties. Sprinkle with parmesan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Serve over toast.

Drain tuna and flake it. Add cereal and stir. Add egg substitute and green onions. Mix thoroughly. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Form into patties and place on a cookie sheet. Dip patties into dijonnaise and bake at 450 degrees for 15 minutes. Melt butter and lemon juice. Dip patties in butter and lemon juice mixture and bake for 5 minutes more. Serve immediately.

In a medium pot, cook onions and garlic for 2 minutes. Add rice. Stir for 1 minute. Add chicken broth and 1/4 teaspoon of salt and pepper. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir often. Remove from heat. Stir in corn and remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt and pepper. Allow to sit for 2 minutes.

Boil the potatoes in their skins until cooked - about 30 minutes. What you are aiming for in this recipe is starchy mashed potato. As soon as the potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel them and either mash them or put them through a potato ricer. Peel the garlic cloves and pound them in a pestle with the lemon juice or use a hand-blender for this step. Mix the potato, garlic and ground almonds together thoroughly in a bowl, and then beat in the olive oil gradually with a wooden spoon. Beat in the whole egg and season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut the ends off of the zucchini. With a small knife, hollow out the center and save for filling. Slice the zucchini into rounds 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick. Mix together the cottage cheese and the corn. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Divide the cottage cheese mixture evenly among the zucchini rounds. Roll up the zucchini rounds and place in a buttered casserole dish. Sprinkle the top with the chopped green onions. Bake 20 minutes until the tops are brown and bubbly. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large skillet fry potatoes in oil until almost tender. Sprinkle with salt. Spread potatoes in a single layer in a 9 x 13 inch pan. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake until potatoes are done, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with green onion tops and bacon bits. Return to oven until bacon is crisp. Serve with sour cream.
